Manager.description: Just gimmeh high prio ...
Manager.title: Fatal Issue!

Manager.description: Have a button in c:geo that put a cache or trackable to watch list.
Manager.title: "put a cache on watch list" with c:geo

Manager.description: If you select show cache on map - that map becomes live map.
Manager.title: Map becomes live map

Manager.description: If you select "Any Destination" and enter some coordinates it would be cool to have a history function. It's really annoying to re-enter calculated coordinates again and again.
Manager.title: History for manually added coordinates

Manager.description: All the spidering should be moved to a extra package with a generic interface (like the connectors from GeOrg). This would make it easier to maintain updates from Groundspeak and support import from multiple platforms.
Manager.title: Separate spidering from other code

Manager.description: Compared to other geocaching-apps c:geo has a really slow database. This should be improved.
Manager.title: Optimize database

Manager.description: If you're caching offline, it's difficult to publish your logs later with c:geo or other apps. c:geo should provide a field-note-export. (Basics are already implemented in the history.)
Manager.title: Field-note export

Manager.description: When "follow me" (blue button) is enabled a blue arrow is in center of map and map moves around. When "follow me" is disabled blue arrow should also move around, just map should be stationary.
Manager.title: Blue arrow not moving when "follow me" disabled

Manager.description: I didn't tested it, but logging of needs maintenance seems to be broken. I've heard that gc.com shows a confirmation dialog like should be archived.
Manager.title: Needs maintenance log doesn't work

Manager.description: I don't know, if it was possible a few weeks/months ago (or was it only half implemented?), but it would be a nice feature to select/deselect caches from list with sliding (like in Note Everything).
Manager.title: Select caches from list with sliding

Manager.description: With the change of developers we must update about-information: Although Carnero made the most of the code, he isn't the main developer anymore. In my oppinion we should remove the entry "author" and list him (at the top) and all other developers under "contributors". Also "powered_by" =" Carnero" should be replaced with a more generic term, such as "geocachers of the world" (I'm open to other suggestions. :D )
Manager.title: Update about/strings.xml

Manager.description: When somebody has more than i think 128 stored caches (maybe 256) and select show in Locus it freezes. Need to check this bug out and if it is a problem... Fix it.
Manager.title: Alot of stored caches freezes Locus

Manager.description: Hello, When I click on "Nearby" caches, none of the cache titles appear in the listings. Just the cache's serial numbers. Only when I click on the caches do they appear in the list.,
Manager.title: No Cache Titles

Manager.description: From Facebook: It looks like opensource c:geo does not work on Android 1.5. This issue and many others will be fixed in next few weeks. July 9 at 3:56am Any updates on this yet?? Those of us stuck with Android 1.5 phones due to the manufacturers not updating the version are patiently waiting! I have a Motorola i1, and that phone is only 3 months old and stuck forever on Android 1.5 so it can support the iDEN Direct Connect network. Carnero and the official app have always supported down to 1.5, so i hope the opensource version continues as you have stated you would.
Manager.title: c:geo on Android 1.5 still crashing, any updates?

Manager.description: With version 2.26, I have experienced this several times: with the live map, I switch to satellite view and zoom all the way in. On several occasion, I have received a FC error. This may not be a c:geo error, but I never had the problem with the pre-open-source version.
Manager.title: Force close in map view

Manager.description: By default, I have c:geo hide found caches. There is a recently introduced bug which causes this to work sporadically. In some cases, previously foudn caches are displayed. When zooming in/out, sometime previously foudn caches will appear/disappear. The problem is intermittent - sorry I cannot provide more concrete details.
Manager.title: My caches - inconsistent display behavior

Manager.description: When viewing the list of saved caches and clicking view map, the map view loads non-saved caches. To reproduce: Save a few caches. From the main menu click "Stored" Click the map icon on the upper edge. The map now contains caches that are not in the stored cache list.
Manager.title: Saved caches map becomes live map

Manager.description: In map view (both live map, map of stored caches and map of individual caches) all cache icons disappear if the zoom level is low enough. The caches appear at first, but disappear once the search indicator in the upper right hand corner disappears. This could make sense in live map, where one does not want to load every cache in the whole world if one zooms out to view the entire world, but this is not what's going on here, as it also affects the stored cache and individual cache maps, and caches that are already loaded also disappear.
Manager.title: Caches dissappear from map if zoomed out far enough.

Manager.description: When using the live map, caches that I own or have already found appear in the map, even though I have opted to hide them. Steps to reproduce: In the settings, select "Exclude own and found caches". From the main menu, select "Live map". Disable follow position (optional). Scroll to an area where you have found or own caches. What should happen: Caches you own or have found should not appear. What does happen: All caches, including caches you have found or own, appear. After loading is complete, the found and owned caches disappear. If the map is moved (triggering a new search) the caches temporarily re-appear.
Manager.title: Found and owned caches appear in live map.

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Mistery or multi when final defined should use final instead of set coordinates

Manager.description: GPS accuracy on some android devices can be improved a lot by dampening GPS coordinates. the free app "GPS status" by EclipSim allows four levels of filtering, none, weak, medium, strong. When switching from weak to medium on my Galaxy S I9000, the GPS accuracy improved considerably. The downside is that it takes longer to react. But when navigating only a few meters in search for a cache, I prefer accuracy over speed. Maybe it would even be possible to use GPS Status / Radar to navigate to caches in addition to the builtin compass?
Manager.title: adjust compass sensitivity / invoke GPS Status

Manager.description: I have many folders on my sd card. The time for searching the gpx files for import is greater then 10 minutes. Is it possible to specify a folder for the import. Or would it be possible to make ist selectable? Thanks for your work! Greeting luckyloser
Manager.title: GPX Import - specified or selectable folder instead of searching the whole sd card

Manager.description: Clicking the top map in the cache details view (above the cache attributes) should invoke the navigation menu. I will work on this issue.
Manager.title: top map in cache details should lead to navigation

Manager.description: I guess that should be "successor"?
Manager.title: "accessor" in project description

Manager.description: Depending on the OS defaults there are some funny encoding problems, e.g. we get ¬∞ instead of °. This problem occurs if someone is using a Mac along with the default encoding (MacRoman). Setting the project encoding to UTF-8 would be great!
Manager.title: Project encoding should be UTF-8

Manager.description: Logs can have images attached. Currently you can't view them with c:geo.
Manager.title: Images from logs

Manager.description: It would be nice, if it would be possible to start GCC in cache view. E.g. over the more menu.
Manager.title: Open GCC from Cachelisting

Manager.description: When the user deletes all caches of the "Stored" caches list, the caches are deleted from the database BUT they remain in the list view until the user exits the "Stored" caches list and the re-enters the "Stored caches" list afterwards. This is confusing most of the users (including myself). Steps to reproduce : import any gpx file via Stored / Import GPX (e.g. 93 caches are added in the "Stored" caches list) Select Manage/Drop All to remove all caches out of the list (deletion proceeds) .... after deletion: The list of caches (in my case 93) can still be seen in the "Stored" caches list [BUG] For my understandig the list of caches shall be empty after a "delete all caches" command. Robert
Manager.title: Deleting caches in "Stored Caches" need refresh

Manager.description: It's very cumbersome to change the api-key in values/strings.xml for every build and undo it (so nothing is changed in the repository). It should be possible with Ant, but I never worked with it before and I don't know if there's a way without copy/replace the complete file (because it's impossible to create a template for strings.xml, maybe with a patch-task in combination with copy/filterset?). Maybe one of you can help with this. Some links: http://www.androidengineer.com/2010/06/using-ant-to-automate-building-android.html http://blog.cuttleworks.com/2011/02/android-dev-prod-builds/ http://ant.apache.org/manual/Tasks/patch.html My idea: Use copy/filterset-task to generate a patch-file from template with new api-key from debug.properties / release.properties Use patch-task to apply the generated patch-file to values/strings.xml Is there an easier way or should we move the key to a separate configuration file (like in the second link, but this would result in changes in the code)?
Manager.title: Use Ant for build / make building easier (api-key)

Manager.description: I frequently missed the zoom function for spoiler images. Maybe this feature can be added to cgeo#40 (Log-Images) too.
Manager.title: Zoom for spoiler images

Manager.description: Sometimes we solve more than 1 cache at the same time. So we have to switch from GCx to GCy very often. Currently we have to keep the GC-numbers in mind. It would be nice to have a list of recent searched geocaches or the possibility to open cgeo twice. Or maybe use tabs / split the screen / ... ??
Manager.title: Open more than one cache at the same time

Manager.description: If a cache has a really long description it's not parsed correctly. The example is GC2WKX2
Manager.title: Long HTML text does not show

Manager.description: Spoiler Sync (http://www.anode.plus.com/spoilersync/) downloads spoiler-images for offline use. There's someone who would love to have support for Spoiler Sync in c:geo. http://www.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=897807#p897807
Manager.title: Support Spoiler Sync

Manager.description: You could add support for this open server, they have free API. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geocaching#Opencaching.com
Manager.title: Feature request: support for OpenCaching.com

Manager.description: Somebody please check if that is true :D I can't.
Manager.title: Signature... Do you know that [NUMBER] doesn't work if you are over 1000?

Manager.description: We should use a class for coordinates instead of an ArrayList of Doubles. There are a lot of free geo-classes supporting many reference-ellipsoids, many formats (parsing and output) and conversions, waypoint projection and much more.
Manager.title: Use class for coordinates

Manager.description: First and foremost: I don't want to introduce any unnecessary formalism. And I strongly believe in "Release early, release often". Nevertheless I wanted to ask if we are going to have some kind of planned (or expected) releases. For instance last week a new release was created on Friday, so that all cachers would be able to use the new version over the weekend. I'm mainly asking because I refactored all the code relating to calling external applications (navigation, maps, ...) which led to a lot of changes. And I just want to know when will be a good time to release large changes (which may introduce new bugs, even if you do a lot of testing beforehand). Currently I will hold back my changes until the weekend is nearly over, assuming that releasing on Sunday evening will have the smallest impact, if any bugs slipped through. BTW: Would something like this better be discussed in the wiki? I have never worked with GitHubs wiki before.
Manager.title: Release planning?

Manager.description: Hi, it happens quite offten to me that c:geo crashes when loading details of the cache. I use c:geo 2.25 on HTC Wildfire with Android 2.2.1. It doesn't matter if it is from map or searchlist or nearby list. After selecting/taping to the cache to display its details, sometimes it happens that it displays the splash screen "Loading the cache details" and then after some time the phone displays an errormessage and goes back to the map/list.
Manager.title: c:geo crashes when loading details of the cache

Manager.description: Hi, I use HTC Wildfire which is not a fast smartphone and when I tap on the map icon in main menu nothing happens for a while. It takes some 5 seconds for the c:geo to change the screen to something else than the main menu. It would be very helpful if the icon blinked or somehow reacted and the splash screen "Loading map" appeared. Otherwise it seems that it doesn't work and at the beginning it made me tap several times on the icon. The same would be fine also for the other icons. The reaction time with them is not so bad, but at least a blink would help too.
Manager.title: map icon reaction and splash screen

Manager.description: Hi, sometimes when in active map, caches don't load to the map. After killing the c:geo process in task list and re-running the c:geo, the caches on the map display correctly. I use c:geo 2.25 on HTC Wildfire with OS Android 2.2.1. and I have all types of caches enabled in configuration.
Manager.title: caches not displayed in active map

Manager.description: Listing of "Vzpominky stareho sklerotika" (http://coord.info/GC2PYCW) is not available in c:geo. The relevant section is missing in cache details.
Manager.title: Listing not available for GC2PYCW

Manager.description: Will Attend and Attended, I've forgotten it and will fix it.
Manager.title: Add event-logtypes to Field Notes export

Manager.description: At the moment c:geo is mainly designed for "live-caching", loading nearby caches over the internet. In the last days a lot of people asked me if we could improve the offline-functionality of c:geo. Better performance, up to 4000 and more caches in database (issue #11) Search in offline caches (name, GC-code, owner...) GPX-export
Manager.title: Improve Offline-Functionality

Manager.description: I am not sure, wether this is a bug or an improvement proposal, however I am pretty sure it was working up to 2.26RC2: When importing GPX-files the import data is always stored in the "Standardlist" although I selected another list to be shown before the import-operation.
Manager.title: Import GPX to different lists

Manager.description: Improvement Proposal: It should be possible to have an option for batch-moving caches (after selecting them) to another list. At the moment it is only possible one-by-one.
Manager.title: menu item for moving of stored caches

Manager.description: Opening a trackable c:geo only shows the "goal", "about" and the photo but not the last logs. In my opinion this feature would be helpful for the user (e.g. to look where the TB has already been in the past, etc.)
Manager.title: TB-logs not shown when date format is set other than GC-default

Manager.description: From facebook: George Markusic I would like to say that I am so happy that someone picked up the support of this application. The only issue I have since the change is my signature. Now when I try to log cache it automatically loads my signature first. I always enjoy putting in a story of my adventure first then add my signature to the bottom. Is it possible to add a feature in a future release where it is an option to have the signature automatically load or you can add it when you want like in the older version. I'll add this functionality.
Manager.title: Switch signature-auto-insertion on/off

Manager.description: gc.com allows you as a premium member to add notes to a cache. Show (and maybe edit?) of this notes should be supported. I'll add at least reading of cache-notes in the next days.
Manager.title: Show cache-notes from gc.com

Manager.description: "Restore database" does not block the UI, therefore it can be invoked multiple times concurrently.
Manager.title: restore database can be invoked concurrently

Manager.description: The direction of the blue arrow is wrong, if you hold your device in landscape mode. I know that c:geo does not support different layouts. What I mean is a different problem: If you are walking with your device held normally, the arrow will show the right direction. If you continue walking the same direction but start rotating the device, then the arrow on the map rotates, although the map doesn't rotate and you walk the same direction.
Manager.title: map direction wrong if device is held in portrait mode

Manager.description: The labels and values of the attributes in the cache details view are aligned at the top. They should be based aligned.
Manager.title: cache attributes have bad text alignment

Manager.description: Do we need Google Analytics? Has somebody access to the accound? And if yes, is it possible to publish the data? But my position is that we don't need it.
Manager.title: Google Analytics?

Manager.description: This is similar to issue #66 but I'm logging this separately as this is about visually disabling the nearby button as long as there is the GPSr either switched off or there is no fix. In fact, the button is currently already disabled, yet there is no visual clue to the user. As a possible visual clue I would like to suggest to cross out the button instead of grayingit as this should be more visible even in bad lighting conditions. For instance, it could be crossed out in red.
Manager.title: Visually disable nearby button in main screen without GPS fix

Manager.description: Currently, the menu option "export to field notes" is always enabled, even if there are no stored logs available. This is irritating as this always creates new empty field note files.
Manager.title: Menu option "export to field notes" enabled when no field notes are available

Manager.description: The activity screen shown while c:geo scans for potential map files currently says in its title that it isa looking for gpx files. This seems to be a reuse issue of the import activity.
Manager.title: Settings: search for map file screen has wrong title

Manager.description: Sometimes I can rate, sometimes not. c:geo does not tell me, why it sometimes does not provide the "rate" function to me. Of course I have entered my gcVote password.
Manager.title: Sometimes I can rate, sometimes not

Manager.description: IMO an import should add the caches to the current list, but seems, that they are always added to the default list "Stored" :-(
Manager.title: GPX files are not imported into the current list

Manager.description: We could use my project's code: http://code.google.com/p/android-change-log/
Manager.title: Change log / What's new popup on start

Manager.description: I'm one of the guys where the memory on the phone is constantly short. :) Therefore I'd like to set android:installLocation="preferExternal" according to http://developer.android.com/guide/appendix/install-location.html in the manifest instead of the current "auto". Does anybody see problems with that approach?
Manager.title: prefer installation on SD card

Manager.description: This issue applies to version 2.26RC3. The new (or old, depending on your point of view) cache information dialog provides quick access to the compass, but not to the help manual. In contrast, the cache info screen (activity) we had before provided access to the manual. Please add a "?" action button to the cache info dialog. The corresponding manual topic is "c:geo-cache-info".
Manager.title: Cache information dialog does not provide help manual access

Manager.description: Looking in market and see this too many times. java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at java.lang.String.(String.java:468) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.replaceWhitespace(cgBase.java:4566) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4527) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4279) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.requestLogged(cgBase.java:4259) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByGeocode(cgBase.java:3056) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail$loadCache.run(cgeodetail.java:1227)
Manager.title: Another OutOfMemmory

Manager.description: Like in dropping caches.
Manager.title: Use progress bar and abort-button for gpx-import

Manager.description: After gpx Import the waypoints are shown in log section and the waypoint section is empty.
Manager.title: waypoints not shown from gpx

Manager.description: On a completely new device I just had an exception caused by a null map file name. This name is then used by mapforge to verify it as a valid file name. I was able to work around that issue with commit bf92bf3. Nevertheless someone with more experience in the map code should verify that the default value null for the map file name doesn't cause other problems, as I don't really know the remaining map code. From the commit history it looks like a user "Rainer" added the mapsforge implementation, but I don't find an assignee with that username.
Manager.title: exception in map file name settings

Manager.description: I'm not sure if something can be easily done about this. It's not a big deal, but I figured I'd toss it out there. The new feature to make trackables visited in the setup is wonderful, however, when logging a Will attend, DNF, write note, etc, it still visits all the trackables. I'm sure most folk only visit their trackables on a found log. Is it possible to revert the trackables to do nothing when the log type is changed? If not, it's no big deal. Since 99% of my logs are found it, it's not anything major to have to manually change it on the few other logs. Thanks!
Manager.title: Visit all trackables oddity...

Manager.description: Especially for Mystery and Multicaches the listings sometimes contain waypoints without coordinates. When I find out the coordinates for the stages/finals I modify the waypoints in c:geo (I enter the coordinates and I add some variable values, ... to the waypoint description). But when I refresh the data in c:geo, my modifications are LOST !!! :-( IMO nothing entered by the user should ever get lost: Not by Refresh, not by GPX import not by anything else. IMO these modifications should even be stored independently of whether the cache itself ist stored for offline use or not.
Manager.title: Manual waypoint modifications are lost by Refresh

Manager.description: GCVote supports also half-point rating (like 4.5 points). Therefore also c:geo should do so.
Manager.title: Support half-point rating

Manager.description: When a user goes through the new field now export feature in cgeo in order to upload her or his logs there is an important difference to the existing online log function. In the latter case, cgeo automatically clears a saved log after it has been commuted to gc.com. In the case of export there is no automatic clearing. In consequence, cgeo will reexport old log entries with the next export. While gc.com will sort old entries based on date, the export files will grow as will the internal database. I would like to suggest that the user can clear saved logs from the history or the stored lists. But maybe someone other has a better idea?
Manager.title: Allow user to clear all saved logs (field note export related)

Manager.description: The GUID of newly stored caches is not parsed correctly. For me that led to the effect that "old" caches could be voted (GCvote.com) in the app, while new caches could not be voted. Maybe some other features are effected by the missing guids too.
Manager.title: cache guid not parsed correctly

Manager.description: If you enable/disable the circles around caches from the options menu of a map, then a refresh is missing. The change only gets visible on next interaction with the map.
Manager.title: refresh missing after circles setting has been changed

Manager.description: It is not at all reproducible, but it now happend the fourth time while logging a cache: After selecting "Besuch loggen" the signature is autoinserted correctly. While I am typing the log-text the app suddenly does not react for some seconds and without doing anything automatically inserts the signature again multiple times (as far as I remember always five times) into the text-field. In my signature I am using [NUMBER] [DATE] and [TIME] fields and my signature starts with a line feed (this is to have space to insert my own text in front of the signature). Maybe one of these is causing the problem. Device: Samsung Galaxy SII with Gingerbread 2.3.3.
Manager.title: Multiple signature insertion

Manager.description: When selecting "Besuch loggen" for GC14XNH the app reproducibly crashes. On all other caches logging is OK.
Manager.title: GC14XNH: Logging causes crash

Manager.description: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue with this, but in the latest build I am unable to use the turn by turn feature. In both Google Nav and TeleNav, it starts to load the app, then goes back to cLgeo.
Manager.title: Turn By Turn not working

Manager.description: I'm going to make the settings class a singleton. Currently the settings are created and accessed at so many places, although this could easily be more centralized.
Manager.title: make settings a singleton

Manager.description: Email request. I really like Your app. It has made me put my old etrex on the shelf. I have a suggestion to make. When I am outdoors and try to look at the logs of a cache to see if it was found reacently it is impossible to see the dates of the logs. The colour is light grey ( i think) and it does not work out in the sun. The rest of the log is in white. Could you please change all of the log to white (or make it configurable) ? Please comment but I don't see any problem why it should not be white?
Manager.title: Color of logdates

Manager.description: Try to align mapsforge zoom-controls with google zoom-controls or vice versa.
Manager.title: mapsforge zoom-controls placement

Manager.description: when switching the map view some problems may occur: class cast exceptions WRT GeoPoint IntentReceiver leak when switching from Google to OSM Caches on live map not loaded after switch
Manager.title: Problems in mapview switch

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Add mapsforge copyright notice to 'about'

Manager.description: I was looking into code and found strange usage of .trim() function. When cache is parsed from web is stored with all spaces and every single usage of almost every field then uses .trim() I believe it would be better user trim once at parsing and not when using fields. What do you think?
Manager.title: .trim() usage

Manager.description: The following sequence led to an empty live map: start c:geo start live map (caches are loaded) switch directly to home screen switch back to c:geo (showing live map with caches) close live map open live map again: no caches areloaded (and shown) workaround: pan/zoom map to trigger cache load
Manager.title: Caches on live map not always loaded

Manager.description: It should be possible to select and copy text from cache-description (and maybe from logs).
Manager.title: Copy text from cache-description

Manager.description: If the manual app is not installed, we fall back to an online version of the manual. Currently that is located at http://cgeo.carnero.cc/manual/. So please put it on cgeo.org and afterwards change the URL in ActivityMixin.goManual(...).
Manager.title: Manual still hosted at carnero

Manager.description: Please add option for creating an empty cache to the offline database. This way a not c:geo downloaded cache could be managed by c:geo - like waypoint navigation etc For me this use case occurs from time to time: No network access for mobile thus no offline download possible, but hotel lobby provides inet with printing - thus paper-caching ... Non-geocaching.com listed caches - either from opencaching or (like in Konstanz/Germany) tourism caches. The workaround is to edit any other cache and remember which one it was ;-) Bad Idea if I decided to clean the offlined caches before starting trip to new region.... Comments? Best regards - Henning
Manager.title: Option to "add" an empty geocache

Manager.description: (Add an option to) automatically store cache for offline use, if anything was changed by the user manually. From time to time I start with a cache just from the live map - and start editing/adding waypoints etc. hitting the back button once too often means to "loose" cache-details. Well actually my added information seems to be stored locally since after finding the cache again all manual added data is back within the description... For this scenario, if a user obviously is doing a cache since data is added: Please store all retrieved data locally - murphy defines that no network is available if cache description is left ;-) Comments? Best regards - Henning
Manager.title: store offline if cache has manual/edited info

Manager.description: Currently, when adding the TIME function to your log signature, it is posted in am/pm 12 hour format. Would be nice to also allow this in 24-hour format
Manager.title: allow TIME in signature to be in 24-hour format

Manager.description: I save my queries in a folder named "pocket_queries", which is in a folder named "downloads" on my SD, this way I just delete old files and replace them, keeping it all nice and tidy Is it possible when using the import GPX button that it goes to maybe the last folder used but with the possibiliy to change this rather than scanning the whole phone, making things a little quicker Using a Motorola Milestone 2 great program by the way :)
Manager.title: Importing queries into a list from a predetermined folder

Manager.description: I can't send a log for offline stored caches (from gpx/PQ) from the overview in maps-view. When I open the cache in detail-view it works.
Manager.title: Cannot upload log from overview in maps-view

Manager.description: I found some smaller resource leaks (file handles and db cursors). I'll provide some fixes and at the same time try to learn git - personally, I do prefer mercurial over git... Florian.
Manager.title: found some ressource leaks

Manager.description: I noticed when I am picking a list of stored caches, the name of the list is no longer displayed. Regardless of my current list, it only displays "c:geo"
Manager.title: List name no longer on top of screen

Manager.description: I noticed that it sometimes takes a while to finish when you click "Store" in the cache overview. Maybe the cache information is downloaded/processed again? Shouldn't it be more efficient to just use the available data from the view? But again, I maybe totally wrong here. PS: Bananeweizen seconded that there might be a possibnle issue: "Please create a separate issue, I think you are right in that the cache is parsed two times."
Manager.title: When storing for offline, the cache information is probably processed a second time

Manager.description: I just installed the nightly build 2011.08.10 and have seen the following: In contrast to the older versions the name of the currently opened list of saved caches, the name is no longer shown above the caches. So the user does not have a possibility to see which list is currently shown. It only shows "c:geo". I would appreciate to make it like before...the list-name to be shown on top.
Manager.title: List name not shown anymore at top

Manager.description: From FB: My problem is, when I search by address it doesn't work. Am I supposed to use city and zip code? Capitalize the letters?
Manager.title: search by address does not work

Manager.description: cgBase.java.storeCache around line 5000
Manager.title: marker images for offline maps still on carnero.cc

Manager.description: I'm adding an additional comparator to be able to sort event caches by the event date in the list. Sorting by GC code to get the age isn't enough in those cases.
Manager.title: sort by date in cache list

Manager.description: What can be done with send-to-c:geo that could not be done with chrome-to-phone (or fox-to-phone for Firefox users)? I ask because I'm a firm believer in "remove code as much as you can to get a maintainable application" and am under the impression that it duplicates the functionality in a less general way (chrome-to-phone uses push notifications). The only difference I see is that people do have to have a Google account to use chrome-to-phone, but I bet this is the case for 99,9% of our Android users.
Manager.title: send-to-c:geo vs. chrome-to-phone

Manager.description: As shown on the screenshot below, the strings are not vertically aligned with the labels. The labels are a bit above the data.
Manager.title: Alignment problem in cache details

Manager.description: Huh? I just tried C:geo extensively. I found 4 caches, and did not find 2. I logged through c:geo on site. In other words, right after the find (or not) I logged in C:geo, and sent the log. The logging order should be 1: @ 14:10 2: @ 14:45 3: @ 14:55 4: @ 15:25 5: @ 15:35 6: @ 15:45 yet in actuallity the logs are sorted like so: 1: @ 14:45 (found) 2: @ 15:25 (not found) 3: @ 15:35 (found) 4: @ 15:45 (not found) 5: @ 14:10 (found) 6: @ 14:55 (found) (going UP in recent logs). It is as if c:geo "held on" to my logs before sending them? Any clues how this could happen? It is frustrating like H*l when you do multiple searches / finds / not founds in a day.
Manager.title: logging wrong order?

Manager.description: In the logging activity, there should be an option menu entry to edit the default signature (i.e. to open the settings and scroll to the edit field for the signature).
Manager.title: Logging activity should have option to edit default signature

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: have button to insert log templates (in options)

Manager.description: A tag (such as v2.26-market) should be added to the commit corresponding to an official releases. That would ease the construction of the "What's new" and of the contributors list.
Manager.title: Tag releases

Manager.description: Since I'll be abroad, I stored around 2000 caches (coming from GPX files) in c:geo. Listing the stored caches causes a keyDispatchingTimedOut if I try to press anywhere during the first 10 seconds.
Manager.title: Timeout when listing too many stored caches

Manager.description: Hi, It would be nice if we could update the coordinates for enigme caches, and then have them display in a different color (say green) once we resolve them and input the real coordinate to look for the cache. Either we update the initial data or there is a new field use to enter the coordinates found. That sounds reasonable?
Manager.title: update coordinates

Manager.description: I just downloaded and installed c:geo on my Samsung Galaxy S (T-Mobile) and named my device and requested registration -it failed. I wonder if it is because the URL is incorrect - it says "before registration pleas read http://sendtocgeo.carnero.cc" which gives an error message. Should it be "sendto.cgeo.org" or "sendto.cgeo.carnero.cc"?
Manager.title: 'request registration' fails

Manager.description: in the details view the title should be strikes through if the cache is disabled or archived.
Manager.title: strikethrough title of archived Caches

Manager.description: currently the logging templates in the options and the options menu of the visit activity use different code and therefore even show different things which can be inserted. e.g. the numbers template is missing in the options menu.
Manager.title: unify code for logging templates and logging options menu

Manager.description: One of the last commits changed a cache attribute to be uppercase, so it matches a change on the website. This should be avoided by making all attributes always lower case in our code and matching them with any case (independent of uppercase/lowercase).
Manager.title: store attributes always lowercase

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Selecting Navigation-Radar crashes c:geo (with no Radar installed)

Manager.description: As suggested by Bananeweizen in cgeo#86 (comment)
Manager.title: Refactor map selection to 'single source'

Manager.description: If you use a filter from the options menu in the cache list activity and select one the caches for showing its details, and then return to the list, your filter is gone. I would expect that the filter stays active until I return to the home screen of c:geo (because the order stays the same until you completely leave the list view).
Manager.title: list filter lost on return to list

Manager.description: Okay, no one else came up with this so far: gc.com sends pocket queries as zip files. Some other woops, such as Locus and GeOrg already directly import zipped gpx files. They register appropriate intents, so importing pocket queries is just a matter of taping on the attachment in your mail client or tapping on the download link on the pocket queries page on gc.com. It would simplify usability quite a lot if c:geo would also support direct import of zip files with gpx data.
Manager.title: Import of zipped gpx files

Manager.description: When opening the details of the mentioned cache (GC2EAZW) it shows just empty lines (or black on black ?). I am using 2011.08.14 nightly, but I dont know wether this occured before. On the website the description is ok.
Manager.title: Change color of cache description to make it readable

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Show on map (stored list, nearby) becomes live map

Manager.description: While in cache-details, click on the list of contained TBs and select one of them. When selecting the "back-key" (on my Galaxy SII) I am going back to the cache-detail page but not to the TB-list. I would suggest as an improvement to go back from TB-detail view to TB-list instead. I often browse through all TBs of a cache and have to do many unnecessary clicks.
Manager.title: Back from TB-detail should go to TB-list

Manager.description: Not really a bug, more like an improvement. The localization PT is missing quite a few translations now, so I'm going to work on it. Some of the translations for the main menu will never be shown entirely there (as they're somewhat long strings) and can probably be switched to something else.
Manager.title: Localization PT update

Manager.description: Release 2.26 (15-08-2011). Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds. Then you get only the map, no caches. If you zoom in or out, the caches reappear for 3-4 seconds, then they are gone again. It used to work with the last c:geo (Radovan Paska aka carnero).
Manager.title: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds

Manager.description: Cache details activity does not show "found" attribute. Cache icon on map lacks smiley, cache does not get hidden if "hide found caches" is set. Cannnot be corrected by updating cache data from gc.com - icon will then be hidden from map but details view is not updated. Cache had been correctly stored in DB before update. Version: latest market version Language (c:geo and gc.com): german
Manager.title: "found" attribute not shown in cache details

Manager.description: Cache details activity does not show "own" attribute. Cache icon on map lacks star, cache does not get hidden if "hide own caches" is set. Cannnot be corrected by updating cache data from gc.com - icon will then be hidden from map but details view is not updated. Cache had been correctly stored in DB before update. Version: latest market version Language (c:geo and gc.com): german
Manager.title: "own" attribute not shown in cache details

Manager.description: While the map is not centered on your current location, show a cross hair in the center of the map. As soon as the x-hair is positioned over a cache icon, the cache name pops up and closes as soon as the x-hair is moved away. As reference, this feature is available in Locus and proves to be quiet useful to "detect" a specific cache, because its much quicker than to open the caches quick info. The cache name pop-up shouldn't be too intrusive (apply semi-transparency or something). EDIT: This should probably be an option.
Manager.title: Show cache name when hovering over cache icon on live map

Manager.description: The newest market version 15.08.2011 (or is that 08.15.2011 or is that 2011.08.15 or is that ...) shows on the history map not only the caches from the history but also other stored caches. However, this issue may be already present in older versions.
Manager.title: History map shows also all other stored geocaches

Manager.description: Currently there is a pause between storing 2 caches, if they were parsed quite fast. This is not needed if the cache was already stored locally and nothing was parsed. It only leads repeated pausing without anything done in between.
Manager.title: no pause on parsing if cache exists

Manager.description: As a first step, the "Personal Cache Note" should be shown. As a second step, it should be possible to edit it.
Manager.title: Support "Personal Cache Note"

Manager.description: in the rating menu we should also have the textual description, not only the number of stars
Manager.title: Show text in rating menu

Manager.description: open map with Google, the last zoom is used. change the zoom. switch to OSM. you no longer have the current zoom (but probably the one from the settings).
Manager.title: switching map type changes zoom

Manager.description: Using 2.26 RC3, Android 2.3.4 Motorola (Sprint) Photon. Caches are not displayed on the map for "Nearby" caches. Single caches ARE shown in "Live Map" and "Navigate To" map modes. Looks to be the same bug in issue #67 that was closed except force stop of c:geo doesn't fix it nor does panning/zooming.
Manager.title: Caches not displayed in "Nearby" Map

Manager.description: Hi, it happens quite offten to me that c:geo crashes when loading details of the cache. I reported this about c:geo 2.25, but it is the same with c:geo opensource 2.26 R3. I use HTC Wildfire with Android 2.2.1. It doesn't matter if I chose to display cache details from map or searchlist or nearby list. After selecting/taping to the cache to display its details, sometimes it happens that it displays the splash screen "Loading the cache details" and then after some time the phone displays an errormessage and goes back to the map/list. When I try to display the same cache details again afterwards, it loads with no problem. Lack of memory? Timeout? (HTC Wildfire is quite slow and low memory device and the signal was not so good.) In addition I have to report that c:geo crashes now more often also while moving through a map. (Actually, I must say that after last week of hard geocaching during my vacation I got very upset about restarting c:geo all the time because of crashing, not loading maps, not loading caches, not loading cache details, displaying all caches on wrong coordinates, etc.). :( I know you are mostly doing this for free and thank you for the job, and I will just pray that you manage to fix all this asap.)
Manager.title: c:geo crashes when loading details of the cache

Manager.description: Hi, during last week we experienced several times that cache target location was wrong by 20-30 metres (both showing by compass and displaying on live satelite map). After restarting c:geo, all cache icons on map "jumped" for some small distance and the location of the particular cache started pointing to the correct place. This is actually quite nasty - for the first time we had spent some desperate hour searching in deep forest on totally wrong place. Luckily c:geo crashed after some time and afterwards loaded the location correctly. But sometimes even restart didn't help, so we rather used both phones to check if one of them wasn't in this bug (and sometimes they were - both phones showing the same caches but on different places on a map). It was happening to me and my husband with c:geo opensource 2.26 R3 on HTC Wildfire with Android 2.2.1 and Samsung Galaxy S2 with Android 2.3 Gingerbread.
Manager.title: cache location wrong by 20-30 m

Manager.description: Hi, on a longer walk I often put the phone to standby (to save battery and to prevent from unwanted tap) with the active map displayed in c:geo. After wakeup c:geo jumps with my current location on map for some 1,5 km. It usually displays only the blue pointer on a blank map and then after some 10 seconds it jumps back to the correct location. Is this necessary? It happens all the time and gets quite annoying. :( (I am sure you already know that I use c:geo opensource 2.26 R3 on HTC Wildfire with Android 2.2.1)
Manager.title: wrong location after wakeup from standby

Manager.description: Similar to the Navigate : Map labels, when you pull up a stored list and choose "More," it too reads c:geo instead of Maps.
Manager.title: Menu displaying c:geo instead of Map

Manager.description: On facebook they report a problem that c:geo says that log is posted succesfuly but it does not show on GC.com Another problem is that c:geo reports log not sent, but log is actually sent (multiple) times. Please someone check this. (Maybe even before other issues) See also #139, #216.
Manager.title: Log visit problem(s)

Manager.description: When you change from GM to OSM it takes a long time. Could you implement a simple "please wait spinning dialog" in between?
Manager.title: Change from GM to OSM takes a long time. There should be a wait notification

Manager.description: I have reproducibly the following issue on version 15.08.2011: When I use OSM:mapnik in "Live Map" and drive around I see that the trail (Spur) gets disaligned. Example: I drive along a windy road and the trail follows the road at first but after the next turn the trail from some minutes ago seems to drift away from the road. It looks like the trail is averaging to become a straight line from trail start to current position as longer as I use it. However it is not fixed to the position I was some minutes ago. On GM it is OK, I do only see this with OSM.
Manager.title: Trail gets disaligned on OSM

Manager.description: On some messages, specially the long ones , the english is not completely correct. I notice this specially by the lack of determiners before some nouns. I think that the english translation should be reviewed, preferentially by a native english speaker. Is there any contributor under this condition, with the will to accomplish this task?
Manager.title: English text improvement

Manager.description: I was just doing some testing and I discovered that every time I attempt to log a cache that is stored in one of my lists, I receive a notice that says it appears my log failed to upload to geocaching.com. In truth, the log did go though. Upon dropping the cache from the list, the log publishes flawlessly. I tested this on several caches and got the same results.
Manager.title: Reporting False Failed Log Upload Notices

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: New Coordinate input is unusable (partly invisible) with light theme

Manager.description: I think it would be a good idea to include support for something like the Log Dumper and Emailer from Tomas Hubalek. I could for example emagine that c:geo offered a user to use that app and send a logfile to the c:geo team in case of exceptions.
Manager.title: Include support for LogDumper

Manager.description: http://dosensammler.info/2011/08/06/cgeo-datumsfehler-oder-geocachen-inklusive-zeitreise/ In the article the wrong date is "7. Dezember 2012". Seems to affect all caches
Manager.title: "date hidden" in cache detail is wrong

Manager.description: Is there a plan for a "Solved Mysteries" function ? It would be nice, if you could add a waypoint, and mark it as Final Location, and then when you use Live Map or Nearby caches, it would pop up using the final coordiantes instead of the original. I have coordinates for 100's of solved mysteries, because I never know when I am near them, as it is often that the distance between original coordinates and solved coordinates are to far.
Manager.title: Solved mysteries

Manager.description: Hi! When trying to see the compass, I'm always getting the message "This cache has no coordinates". I have an account on geocaching. Going on the site, I can see the coordinates for a given geocache, but on my phone, I keep seeing always the same message. The error occurs, for example, for the geocache code GC14VBX. cgeo version is 22605 I'm running android 2.1-update1 My Phone is a ZTE, kernel version 2.6.29 Phone region is Portugal Thanks, Joao Faneca
Manager.title: "This cache has no coordinates"

Manager.description: The crawler spends one third of its time during a "nearby" search on downloading direction images like this one http://www.geocaching.com/ImgGen/seek/CacheDir.ashx?k=CGQN%0a%01%08%5bQR%5c%5eRA. The seem to be meant to replace the direction arrow in the cache list in strange cases where the cache coordinates are not known. Has anyone ever seen such an arrow in his cache list? I don't think we need them and would therefore like to remove th ecode to download those images.
Manager.title: Direction images should not be downloaded - at least not in advance

Manager.description: It would be very helpful to have the option to set the livemap to change orientation to have the direction of travel at the top instead of just always north at the top.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Livemap direction of travel

Manager.description: Hi, Would it be possible to highlight caches which have never been found (no "found it" log)? We could add say a star on the map and on the list, or a different color? Thanks
Manager.title: Highlight never found caches

Manager.description: Large portions of code are duplicated (ctrl-c/ctrl-v). For example, cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.requestJSONgc(String, String, String) and cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(boolean, String, String, String, String, int, Boolean) share a lot of similarities. Duplicate code is (of course) hard to maintain so unwanted (harder to fix bugs and harder to optimize code, cause you have to implement changes twice - or more) Solution: move duplicate to separate methods (extra gain - makes code easier to read (if method names are chosen right))
Manager.title: remove/merge duplicate code

Manager.description: A little (large) problem in the handler for storing caches: FATAL EXCEPTION: main java.lang.ArithmeticException: divide by zero at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$3.handleMessage(cgeocaches.java:345) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4627) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:868) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:626) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) The same problem was fixed in c58671a for cgeomap. The big question: Why do we have the same code in two files?! I think we have to refactor a bit. And we must look, why detailProgress can be 0. It works in debugging with a breakpoint, maybe because I'm not as fast as the CPU with clicking on "Resume". ;)
Manager.title: Force Close (division by zero) in loadDetailsHandler

Manager.description: I suggest to have a prominent link to the last recent cache (that is the most recent from cgeopopup or cgeodetail) on the home screen. While caching or debugging, it happens very often to me that I close the application completely (not via home button, but using the back button) and on next start it takes some time to re-find the cache.
Manager.title: Most recent caches (viewed)

Manager.description: c:geo 15.08.2011 Steps to reproduce : Convert a waypoint from loc file to GPX file (i used GSAK) Import GPX Open waypoint from map or list click menu CRASH NullPointerException line 270 on isEventCache method from cgCache class. stacktrace show a canBeAddedToCalendar (line227) calling isEventCache (line270) Great job, team. Continue !
Manager.title: Imported waypoint from GPX causes crash on menu

Manager.description: A request from a user of geoclub.de: Please make the description zoomable (like in Locus).
Manager.title: Zoomable description

Manager.description: I don't know if this behavior is wanted or not, but only 35 logs are displayed (counted them at 5 caches). I couldn't find anything where this number is set.
Manager.title: Only 35 logs are displayed

Manager.description: The placeholder [NUMBER] for the log-signature is no longer working. It just returns empty when inserting signature to the log. Most likely it is the result of GC.com update yesterday ?!
Manager.title: [NUMBER] for signature not working

Manager.description: When c:geo is started and there is internet connection a NOTE DISPLAY has to be enabled. It will call some "low tech API" on our webpage (api.cgeo.org) and it would get a data back. Something like none to display no note or a note text (with possible date limit to reduce calls or to display note while offline). Example of usage: NOTE: Dates on log are missing due to GC.com change. We will fix it as soon as possible. Thank you. I answered about 50 emails in past 2 days why there are no dates on logs....
Manager.title: Display NOTE
enhance logging / use logger for all logs

Manager.description: There is a problem with several characters in the file strings.xml (at least in English): Plain DDD.DDDDD�� DDD��MM.MMM' DDD��MM'SS.SSS" Wich are the correct ones?
Manager.title: strings.xml

Manager.description: Sometimes it loads very long (user from facebook) and on my device: Galaxy S (Android 2.3.4) it's not loading. Just black display.
Manager.title: Nearby list is not working

Manager.description: In the setting menu, what is @ 2 1 3 1 2 3 1 5 0 7 ?
With a minor modification, those files can be imported. Later, this may need to be factored out to the connectors.
Manager.title: enable import of opencaching GPX files

Manager.description: Each time I try to load cache details from the "live map" it hangs just showing the spinner. I have waited for an hour for it to load to no avail. When I try to load "nearby" it takes about 20 minutes to list the caches then hangs if you try to select one. When I tried to view details while using 3g it seemed to be causing signal loss. I am using android 2.2.2 on the samsung galaxy prevail.
Manager.title: c:geo opensource hangs when loading cache details

Manager.description: After getting the app to load the local caches, I attempted to download all the caches to the local device because 3g down here leaves a lot to be desired. The time is currently 1:00 am EDT and the problem is not GS server load - I am able to quickly browse the site. On c:geo, I checked my login, was able to view live map, and was able to be nearby - all worked properly. The only thing that is not working is cache details. Please fix.

Finaly I look at the cache log and saw ten times my visit log!!! Is it possible to avoid creation of send/write Log Visit of founded cache repeatedly from one user (check if user has already sent a Log Visit?

Manager.description: To manage items in our custom lists, you need to open lists in listview mode. If you want to sort items / list through map or after a search, you cannot do it. Please add a row with the list name, if there, into the cache details and add a menu into this cache screen to move to other list (like it already exists on long press in listview). Thanks
Manager.title: Suggestion : Move to other list from cache screen

Manager.description: Way to reproduce: 1- Create a test list 2- Add some caches to it 3- Display this list 4- Hit "Drop All" 5- Caches are removed from list but still displayed in the list
Manager.title: List not refreshed after drop all

Manager.description: Dropping an empty list displays the message : Do you want to remove current list of caches? All caches remaining in the list will be moved te "Stored". The list being empty another message would be better.
Manager.title: Wrong message before dropping an empty list

Manager.description: To reproduce it: Store a cache for offline use Open default-list Menu -> Manage -> Drop all List is empty Open cache again (search, nearby list) You have two options in detail-view: refresh and delete What I expect: The cache is not only removed from list, but also from memory (at least as stored offline, can stay in cache until it is deleted from our garbage collector). There's another issue ralated to this: After dropping all caches the database-size isn't decreased. I explained it with that it is not possible to reduce pagesize in WAL-mode, but I had also no success after changed it to another logging-mode and run VACUUM. See issue #212.
Manager.title: Drop cache from list removes from list but not from memory

Manager.description: From emal: Using samsung nexus s Android version 2.3.4 Cgeo ver. 22.08.2011 When browsing the live map in landscape view, the rightmost third of the screen never shows any caches. Can anybody look into it?

Manager.description: Could it be possible to add a Streetview mode ? Thanks
Manager.title: Feature request : turns GoogleMaps into Streetview

Manager.description: Hi, The "import from web" feature worked nicely on my Nexus S just once. On the next start of c:geo-opensource, the "Import" button does not show up anymore (which previously opened up a menu where I could choose to import from web or from GPX). Instead of the "Import" button, only the "Import from GPX" button is there. I don't know what could have caused this... Thanks, Enze
Manager.title: Import from web

Manager.description: Caches being imported from gpx have no static maps. If you are traveling to somewhere without data roaming, the static maps would be quite helpful with imported caches. I just have that situation. :)
Manager.title: create static maps when importing gpx

Manager.description: The Cache Listing is very long on small screens. A Register would be helpfull. For Example: Listing Waypoints Spoilerphotos Logs
Manager.title: Register to group Cache Listing

Manager.description: Hi. When switching from old c:geo to c:geo opensource, I did a backup/restore of my data. For lots of those caches (Mystery Finals mainly) i stored POIs in Locus. As you may know, Locus provides an POI option to directly switch back to the c:geo cache details after a POI has been created from "c:geo->Show on Map->Locus". This is working for new stored caches, but not with the ones that have been imported. Locus even throws an exception. The last entry from the stack trace reads: "ActivityNotFoundException: Unable to find explicit activity class {carnero.cgeo/carnero.cgeo.cgeodetail}; have you declared this activity in your AndroidManifest.xml?" Any idea why this isn't working? Did Locus have some kind of old reference thats not working after re-import of the caches? Or isn't c:geo opensource accepting the "old" references at all? Incompatible? TIA, Rev
Manager.title: Link from "Locus" POI's to c:geo cache details not working with caches from restored DB

Manager.description: If cgeo can't open the static map, it should not only display this as a toast, but instead ask whether to create the static map now.
Manager.title: if static map can't be opened, ask for creating it

Manager.description: I was just using cgeo with logcat enabled, and noticed this warning: W/Database( 1101): Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache for database /data/data/cgeo.geocaching/databases/data; i.e., NO space for this sql statement in cache: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude_string, longitude_string, latitude, longitude, note FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = "GC1M3C8" LIMIT 100. Please change your sql statements to use '?' for bindargs, instead of using actual values Probably nothing serious, but I guess using parametrized queries is considered good practice wit databases. See paremeter selectionArgs in query() doc.
Manager.title: Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache

The user experience would be better (I regularly miss spoiler images), and for typical hints the additionally used space on the screen would be neglectable.

Manager.description: I am using the last nightly NB29.08.2011 but I am quite sure, that I have seen the problem before sporadically. However now I have a TB to reproduce it: If you open TB2EZMF with c:geo you will see a discover from 27.03.2011 but it is without text. If you look the same at gc.com you will see it actually has text : "Ein dickes Plek, bestimmt gut zum Bassspielen " If you look further down on the same TB-log you will see a "placed" log from 27.03.2011 on gc.com. This one is not shown at all in c:geo. More down there is a another discover on the same date by user "blueguy" on gc.com This one is also not shown in c:geo. More down there is a discover from from user "Thomas S" on gc.com On c:geo this discover is shown but for a wrong username (Blueguy). Maybe this has something to do with several logs on the same date ?? I hope you can reproduce this one.
Manager.title: TB-log sometimes mixed up

Manager.description: When I'm using my mobile phone in offline modus and I open c:geo with an other app by clicking on the URL to a cache, it tries to reload the cache, instead of using the stored one. I imported a PQ to c:geo and Locus, cause I only have offline maps for czech rep in Locus. When I click on a cache in Locus, there is a link to the Cache on Geocaching.com, which I can catch with c:geo. But then I get the message, that the download went wrong. So, when catching the gc.com-url, maybe check, if the cache is already stored. PS: Is there a way to see cache-description in locus?
Manager.title: Download of already stored caches on external call

Manager.description: Will be nice if it is possible to sort list by status (active, disables, archive) so it is easier to delete archived caches from list.
Manager.title: Sort by status

Manager.description: In the detailed cache description the trackables are not listed.
Manager.title: Trackables are not displayed

Manager.description: When the user drags the map, the position tracking remains on. This leads to confusion as the user drags the map, and then it jumps back to centre on the current position. This happens both with Google Maps and OpenStreetMaps. I think that c:geo's maps should follow the standard set by the Android Maps app, which is to disable tracking as soon as the user starts dragging the map. In a related note, I also feel that it would be nice if c:geo followed the Google Maps approach of putting the "tracking button" on the action bar instead of a floating button on the top corner of the map.
Manager.title: Disable map tracking when dragging

Manager.description: I want to keep my position while i change map's mode. Scenario : open main map (google) disactivate autolocation (blue dot) change to map to OSM offline (my case) move to another position move back to google -> blue dot is back and you move to current position. it occurs only between OSM and google. not between google maps / google satellite May be do you need only to store status of autolocation...? Thanks LudoO
Manager.title: Changing map don't keep position

Manager.description: in Issue #328 @cachapa suggested additionally to move the tracking toggle button to the action bar. This issue should allow to discuss this new feature seperately (it is in part discussed in #123 as well) Comments copied from #328: @cachapa: In a related note, I also feel that it would be nice if c:geo followed the Google Maps approach of putting the "tracking button" on the action bar instead of a floating button on the top corner of the map. @SammysHP: +1 for both. A more descriptive icon than the blue dot would be good, too. @koem: +1 for both! @Bananeweizen: Regarding the button placement: I'm not sure if the action bar is the best place. Currently this seems like a good solution. But I can imagine that we may have some additional controls in the near future (e.g 3 buttons instead of 1), then the action bar might get quite crowded. For instance, there are several applications for tracking your sports races which typically have multiple overlay controls directly on the map. @cachapa: In my view, if there's still space in the action bar, we should put it there. If at one point the action bar becomes crowded, this can be re-evaluated. The platform's UI guidelines should be followed whenever possible, which in this case means following the Google Maps app. In fact, I propose that the icon from Maps be adopted, as it will be the less confusing for new users.
Manager.title: Move tracking toggle button to actionbar

Manager.description: I've been working on small tweaks to the user interface as I get comfortable with c:geo's source code. Now I wanted to work a bit on the action bars. I realize that aesthetics vary from person to person, so I wanted to reach some agreement before I put in the work. Essentially, I wanted to retouch a few spots to bring the action bars closer to the Android standard, if you can call it that -- everyone seems to implement their action bars slightly differently, but there are a few common points. The tone is more or less set by the Google I/O app which is supposed to be the gold standard for Android UI patterns: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.google.android.apps.iosched I think that we should follow those patterns as well. Anyway, my proposals: Make the vertical separator cover the whole height of the action bar (so that the action buttons really look like buttons); Add a separator currently missing in the leftmost button in the right group, for example, in http://cgeo.org/content/images/screenshots/s2.png the map button should have a separator on the left; Remove the separator paddings to make the buttons look square instead of rectangular, with the benefit that we win a bit of horizontal space Remove the separator next to the c:geo icon in the main activity I can do this myself, and in fact already started, but as I said, I wanted to get your agreement before changing the action bars in every activity.
Manager.title: Tweaking the action bars

Manager.description: I just tested c:geo on the Android 1.5 emulator, and I noticed there is no reaction to clicking the buttons in action bar. This is because Android 1.5 doesn't recognize the "onClick" XML property in the buttons, so the method never gets called. This is of course fixable, but the question is if it's really worth it. I'll leave that decision to the people who have access to the market statistics and who get the user complaints :-) P.S.: another thing I noticed is that the title bar in 1.5 doesn't disappear like in later versions. I guess this is also easily fixable.
Manager.title: Small problems in Android 1.5

Manager.description: From what I remember, original cgeo were able to display only caches from a list. Now when you show map into list, all caches are displayed. Reading is then complex (I got a few hundred waypoints stored, because i use offline a lot). May be a new button "show all" / "show list only" could be valuable ( like enable/disable live ) ?
Manager.title: Show map from a list display all caches

Manager.description: I can help in french translations. But i see french guys are already involved. If needed, I will be happy to help on this project.
Manager.title: Translation - French

Manager.description: I have seen this problem today the first time, and it may be difficult to reproduce: I have a list with caches and some of them have TBs shown by the icon in the list. Today I grabbed a TB from a cache on my list and it was the only TB listed in this cache. Afterwards I refreshed the cache-list (by refreshing the whole list as well as by refreshing the single cache). The cache-detail does not show a TB anymore but in list-view the TB-icon is still visible also after closing and reopening the list/app. Version used: NB31.08.2011
Manager.title: TB-icon in list not updated

Manager.description: It will be great to add "Reverse Geocoding" capability on waypoint. On a waypoint you could get address to go then easily with car ! I saw the field cache_location but it seems to be parsed from html page. I thought about a real revgeocode function using coords. Then, there are several ways to manage offline, because coords could be updated in offline mode! see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/472313/android-reverse-geocoding-getfromlocation
Manager.title: Real Reverse Geocoding

Manager.description: in a case, shown menu is not the right one ! Scenario to reproduce the bug : Open a list Filter by type / traditional sort by name long tap on an item to move to another list open filter menu choose type here comes the menu of an item (may be the item under the menu), not the menufor cache's type.
Manager.title: Navigation bug with filter and list

Manager.description: My geocaching.com account is set up to use DD/MM/YYYY format which I believe is confusing c:geo hugely, giving me previous log dates like 1/1/2013 etc. If c:geo cannot detect what format is being used, there should be an option in the settings to manually specify.
Manager.title: Does not detect different date formats

Manager.description: The static maps can help when being offline. It would be nice to have the static map for the waypoints created by the user.
Manager.title: Cache static map for own waypoints

Manager.description: It would be nice to have a waypoint overview map of the cache details page like we have an overview of the stored caches from the stored list.
Manager.title: waypoints overview map

Manager.description: Some caches have waypoints defined without the correct coordinates. The user has to change them. It would be nice feature to ask the user if the local modified waypoints can be overwritten.
Manager.title: Affirm overwriting local modified waypoints

Manager.description: How about a list of your friends. The list could show you how many caches they have found and on selecting one of them you could see the caches they found. The data for this is present on the website so mirroring it to the phone is quite logical to me. Would be nice to get this for easier comparison. Optional being able to add friends from this would be nice to have as well.
Manager.title: list of your friends

Manager.description: Clicking settings or any object in main screen
Manager.title: FC nb02. 09.11

Manager.description: The details view is initialized twice with all data in most cases, because it loads the cache details in onResume() and from the loadCacheHandler.
Manager.title: details view is populated twice

Manager.description: When the compass is invoked, it slowly rotates to the right direction. That may be a nice animation, but I just want to know where to go. Therefore the initial direction should be correct instead of "animating" towards it.
Manager.title: compass should point to the direction initially

Manager.description: Currently the cache list shows the list name and number of caches in the title. If you select another list, it only shows the titles of the other lists in the selection, but we could also have the number of caches in brackets for each list.
Manager.title: have number of caches in list selection

Manager.description: In a running cgeo with a reasonable large number of caches the Strings from the cache description occupy a little bit more than half the overall memory that cgeo uses. Therefore cgeo should NOT load the cache description for displaying caches in a cache list only. The description String should only be loaded when displaying the cache in details view.
Manager.title: dont load cache description for cache list

Manager.description: When in other countries, the description mostly isn't in english or your mother language. Normally you cannot go caching then. c:geo should support a translation (e.g. by google translate) which will then be displayed instead of the original texts. After cache refreshing the original texts can be displayed again. Design like this: Choose to translate from menu - all texts will be translated, stored and shown. A progressbar is shown: "translating title, translating short description, translating long description, translating log entry 1/12, ..." Workaround could be #128 - copy text, go to google translate
Manager.title: google-translate cache title / description / logs

Manager.description: I just saved some caches and each of them took nearly a minute to do so. That looked like a bug to me. But it wasn't, they all were earth caches including an image within each log entry (and getting/saving those images took so long). To avoid users thinking the app crashed or is buggy, we should report some progress steps during saving a cache, e.g. Saving cache details log 1, 2, 3, 4, .... spoiler image 1, 2, 3, ... I don't want to report all internal details of the saving process. I just want some label of the progress dialog to change every some seconds, so the progress is visible.
Manager.title: saving cache should report more details

Manager.description: Static maps can be very valuable, when caching abroad (as data roaming is too expensive to be used). But the static maps are not very useful, as long as they do not show my own position. The Windows Mobile caching app "GCzII" has static maps, which show my position (of course allways updated, when I move). IMO c:geo should have this as well.
Manager.title: Show my position in static map

Manager.description: Bernd Schreck sent me a mail with this ft. request: Hello everyone, while driving in the car (I am using my smartphone in a fixture) in an area with stored caches, the stand-by mode of the device in list-view is quite annoying. This year I used a "holiday caches"-list for our holiday destination area in order to see caches "approaching" on my route. To keep the "holiday caches"-list displayed (meaning to prevent the stand-by mode) on the phone I had to fiddle all the time with my fingers on the display. Improvement proposal for the list-view: ---> Additional option in the list-view to prevent (i.e. enable) stand-by mode. Currently the list-view provides already a menue with "Options" that leads to "Map" and "List". The new proposed option "Stand-by mode ON" i.e. "Stand-by mode OFF" could be implemented (added) there. Hope you ll like my proposal and implement this characteristic. Regards, Bernd
Manager.title: turn off stand-by mode in list view

Manager.description: Stage10 is currently sorted before Stage1
Manager.title: stages are sorted wrongly

Manager.description: Hi trying to open the app it crashes down... greets Dani
Manager.title: FC nb05

Manager.description: I am running Gingerbread on HTC thunderbolt. When I click "nearby" I get a listing of the closest caches. If I then hit menu and "show on map" the map loads up but does not show any caches. This used to work, however the last few versions its been broken. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, logging in etc.
Manager.title: Caches don't show on map from nearby list

Manager.description: It would be a nice feature to support waypoint projection. It can be helpful to get the first waypoint from the cache origin and/or to calculate another waypoint from an existing.
Manager.title: Support waypoint projection

Manager.description: From the german geoclub forum: If the live map is opened the position is (perhaps depending on the map type) not the last known position but some arbitrary place defined by the map itself. It should be explicitly set by c:geo to the last known position.
Manager.title: Support last known location on all maps

Manager.description: From german geoclub forum: As the internal GPS consumes much power it is advisable to switch it off when not directly needed during longer caching tours. It would be convenient to be able to toggle its state in c:geo directly (something many location-related apps allow)
Manager.title: Allow to toggle phone gps state directly in c:geo

Manager.description: I've been looking at the code for the cache lists (in the "nearby" and "stored" activities) trying to enable visual feedback when an item is selected, clicked or long-pressed. There are a few problems in showing the list selectors, and most of them are related to the UI for selecting multiple caches. To be clear, I think that selecting multiple caches is a nice feature, but I don't really like the way it's currently implemented. Particularly, the fact that one can fling any cache to the right to go into a kind of hybrid single-and-multiple-select mode. My problems with this are as follows: It's not obvious that the functionality is there; Sometimes the user tries to tap an item, but flings it by mistake; When one item has been flung, the list internally goes into the select-mode. In that mode, tapping a cache doesn't work anymore, even though visually the other caches still look clickable (this is made worse is the mode was started by mistake); Due to the way the fling detection works, it's basically impossible to enable visual feedback for those list items; There's a lot of code that goes into supporting this functionality which could be greatly simplified. I've also identified a few bugs related to that code which would be taken care of. Also, scrolling the list in multiple-select mode would get a significant performance boost. My proposal is to do away with the hybrid selection mode, and keep the exclusive multiple selection mode which can be enabled from the menu. I've been studying the code and I can do this myself, but I'd like your opinions on this before starting.
Manager.title: Problems with quick selection in cache lists

Manager.description: OC Nodes http://opencaching.eu has own common API (it is not GarminCaching site !!!) Project home API is http://code.google.com/p/opencaching-api/ It will be nice use common API OC Nodes. At current API is installed on 3 sites but next will be add in short time http://www.opencaching.pl/okapi/ http://www.opencaching.us/okapi/ http://www.opencaching.org.uk/okapi/
Manager.title: OC Nodes API - feature request
