Manager.description: Version: build from 38afd18 Step by step: initially no caches stored open map click on a cache select "store" click on another cache select "store" do it as often as you want close map, open stored caches only the last stored cache is visible Also if you select "store" from detail-view or from "store all/selected". When you store 3 caches with "store all/selected" all 3 are stored. When you store another one only 2 are stored (1 from the 3 and the new one).
Manager.title: Storing cache overwrites all other stored caches

Manager.description: Today I filtered my search results for multi-caches. Since starting a new search I only get multi-cache results. None of the taditionals (or other types) is show anymore. Even my saved caches are filtered the same way! The "home screen" says 10 saved caches but when opening te saved ones I can only see four caches - all of them multi-caches. Cancelling/resetting the filter does not make any difference. If this is not a bug but wrong usage then please help me, otherwise please fix this issue. Thank you, fama-berlin
Manager.title: Search broken after filtering results

Manager.description: It is very nice, that c:geo shos the "Personal Cache Note". Additionally it should allow to edit it. And (even more important), it should be possible to copy text from it, e.g. copy coordinates and create a waypoint from them
Manager.title: Edit "Personal Cache Note" and copy from it

Manager.description: Hi. I just deleted about 30 caches from a list and noticed that its pretty slow. The list below the progress dialog is updating after every change (for each cache being removed). Maybe thats part of the problem. It would be better to "freeze" the the list and update it once after the operation finished. Rev
Manager.title: Deleting many caches from lists is slow / list "flickers" in background

Manager.description: The context field of cgSettings is used to call startActivity() in getLogin(). It works only because the context being saved is, indeed, an activity, and thus does not require to give FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK to start a new activity stack. Its type should be changed to Activity instead of Context, although storing the application context might make more sense in other cases. This needs to be thought of and redesigned. Edit: I think the home screen should check whether the settings activity should be launched to get missing or outdated information instead of starting the activity from getLogin(). This would solve this problem.
Manager.title: Context being used as an Activity

Manager.description: "Navigate" - "Show on external map" leads to "Locus" and to "Google Maps" and to "Radar and Navigation" but not to "Orux Maps" (although it is installed). It seems, that the used Intent "com.robert.maps.action.SHOW_POINTS" is a very specific one. Isn't there any generally supported Intent for this purpose?
Manager.title: Support also OruxMaps

Reproduce: open live map and save caches shown on the map verify the amount of stored caches in the saved list from homescreen open Nearby Caches, just scroll through the list and return back to homescreen open saved list and you will see that some or sometimes all of the saved caches are gone
Manager.title: List entries get lost frequently

Manager.description: This would be a major improvement in areas with many caches.
Manager.title: Show on map when viewing list should only display caches in that list.

Manager.description: Add menu item "store to list" when viewing, say, a set of search results. With a choice of existing lists or a new list
Manager.title: Select list for storing caches

Manager.description: I think it would be helpful if the GPS is only activated when needed e.g. when you navigate on map or search for caches nearby. Turning GPS off by default will save battery of the device. What do you think about this?
Manager.title: GPS only activated when needed

Manager.description: One is cosmetic and one real bug If you enter coordinates with leading zeros (N46 04.005) it's displayed like N46° 4.005 That 0 would be great If you enter the same coordinates in "Plain mode" you always get "000" at the end. And yesterday I misstyped for 1. Instead of 005 I wrote 905. Save it and try to fix it. The dialog has your coordinates not the coordinates written on buttons.
Manager.title: Another bug in coordinates enter dialog

Manager.description: In some menus c:geo reuses the same menu icons for different functions. For example, in the cache list the "Select mode" icon is the same as the one for "Log visit" in the details view. In other places, generic icons are used, presumably because better ones weren't available. For example, the "Open in browser" in details view, which has a generic "information" icon. I propose that we adopt some of the icons from the free icon set from androidicons.com: http://www.androidicons.com/freebies.php It would obviously be nice if we could link back to them in the about page, or similar. I find that ok since they're offering a wonderful gift to the community for free. If you guys agree, I'll go over all the menus and post the proposed changes here for voting before implementation.
Manager.title: Find better menu icons for some menu entries

Manager.description: At least in the compass view you have a negative bearing (e.g. -40° instead of 320°). I don't know if this is a wrong order of calling the bearingTo()-method or if it's the result of using the Android-method. Using build from current HEAD.
Manager.title: Negative bearing

Manager.description: inventoryItems is used in a cache to hold the number of trackables. It may be obtained as a result of a search, where we do not have the list of trackables, or from a cache details where we do have a list. It is an int, but the 0 value indicates either an empty inventory or the absence of information. We should distinguish between the cases.
Manager.title: Clarify inventoryItems
Missing indices in the database

Manager.title: Code format

Manager.description: got a mail yesterday, I asked him about the error messages... Fist may be #438? Hello Karsten, I am using a SG3 (GT-I5800). I upgrated c:geo from NB 03.09.2011 to the latest revision NB 13.09.2011. After having installed the latest NB, I wasn't able anymore a) to search for the nearest caches (second main menue option) the app was searching caches for about a minute b) to search via live-map (first main menue option) the map showed up, some caches were found and displayed on the map. In both cases the app finally displayed an error message. I tried both options serveral times always with the same result. As I hadn't deleted the NB 03.09.2011, I installed this version again and both (live-map and nearest caches list) worked as supposed to. Finally I re-installed the latest NB 13.09.2011 again and noticed the same problems as described above. I hope this report will help you to find and to fix the root-cause of this issue. Kind regards, Bernd
Manager.title: Errors in Nightly 13.9.11

Manager.description: Ok. I might get down to why so many users have login problems. Go to settings, click check login (Should say OK) Change your username (or password) that login must fail (e.g. Add 1 letter to user) Click Check login You get "Login OK" and wrong password stored in database. I don't have time to check.
Manager.title: Login OK even if password wrong

Manager.description: cache sizes are always displayed as "micro", "small" and so on in Cache lists and cache detail view. Only in the filter choice popup translated sizes are used.
Manager.title: Cache sizes are not translated in lists and details view

Manager.description: Android 1.5 is force-closing on the latest version from the repository. The crash happens on cgBase.java on line 3950 with the following exception: "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils". It takes a while from startup until the crash happens (around 20~30 seconds here), so that might be why it's been going unnoticed.
Manager.title: Crash on start on Android 1.5

Manager.description: There should be an option of including several types of caches in search and live maps and what have you. Currently it's either all types or just one type. This filter should be modifiable for a single search instance w/o affecting the "normal" choice.
Manager.title: Cache filter switch on main page should be inclusive tick boxes, not radio buttons

Manager.description: My signature was for long time: [NUMBER] but now the empty line is never working. also if I enter a blank. Only if I enter a letter/symbol the line appears again.
Manager.title: Newline in signature

Manager.description: E g i'd like Search to be able to find caches near Vitabergen, Stockholm, Sweden with trackables currently in place, but excluding any that have already been found by BengtB. This could be done by having radio buttons at each type of criteria for "exclude/include" and a single search query start link for all conditions specified, plus temp cache type selector for that single search.
Manager.title: I'd like to be able to search for caches fulfilling several criterias at once

Manager.description: In the main activity there's a filter button which can filter caches by type globally in the app. Currently, this changes the label below the button, but it's a very subtle change, particularly since that label is almost always cut for lack of space. My proposal is to make the setting more visible by also changing the filter button's image. I propose a simple horizontal flip of the image, and adding a green led on top of the white switch in the image.
Manager.title: Change the main filter button image when it is active

Manager.description: Invoking the map app selection sub menu from the navigation menu leads to the cache being logged (offline) and the menu going away.
Manager.title: cache gets logged when opening navigation menu

Manager.description: The action bar background bitmap (actionbar_background_tile.png) appears 4 times in the project, one for each DPI level and an extra default. Since the background is just a simple gradient, it can be replaced by an XML shape drawable. This change alone will immediately shave around 80KB off the apk. The only possible issue is that on close inspection the background bitmap has a subtle "roughness" to it which I can't tell if it's by design or result of image compression.
Manager.title: Replace actionbar background bitmap with XML

Manager.description: We should put the contents of readme and buildnotes together into one file readme.md. That file is then displayed with markup directly on the cgeo source page on github. For an example have a look at the contents of https://github.com/infinitest/infinitest (below the source list). Everything you see there is a simple text file at https://raw.github.com/infinitest/infinitest/master/README.md
Manager.title: move readme and buildnotes into readme.md

Manager.description: When I am not logged on to gc.com, the log button is disabled, but this is not visible for the user. After the implementation for #200 (toast on failed login) I now might have an idea why this button is no longer reacting...
Manager.title: Log button not visually disabled

Manager.description: The drawable-mdpi only contains files which are duplicate from the ones in drawable. This is because Android 1.5 uses mdpi resolution and isn't able to find the mdpi folder, so all of its images need to be in drawable. As it is, it makes no sense to keep the drawable-mdpi folder around. It's making the program file bigger with zero benefit.
Manager.title: Remove drawable-mdpi folder

Manager.description: Today all of a sudden I had mysterious problems interacting with gc.com using the release version - even before the update. Luckily after some tries I could reproduce and debug it on the emulator and found that gc.com in my case sent 'set-cookie' header instead of 'Set-Cookie' - which lead to successful login and 'not logged in' when requesting the cache page. Currently no idea why this happens.
Manager.title: Mysterious login problems - gc.com sends 'set-cookie' header

Manager.description: Example Open GC1F9GF log from onika2 I can't decrypt log
Manager.title: Can't decrypt some logs

Manager.description: The format for spoilers image seem to have changed during the GC.com upgrade. We do not currently load spoiler images for caches that are not in our database. See GC2QM0K for example (unless you're having Marseille caches in your database :-) If someone wants to tackle this, that would be great, and we would be able to do a new release on the market.
Manager.title: New HTML format for spoiler images

Manager.description: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds on a NookColor. Release 15-09-2011 for Market. Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds. Then you get only the map, no caches. If you zoom in or out, the caches reappear for 3-4 seconds, then they are gone again. It used to work with the last c:geo (Radovan Paska aka carnero). Hasn't worked since cgeo-opensource started. Video: http://www.rkkda.com/tmp/2011-09-15-182108.mp4
Manager.title: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds on a NookColor

Manager.description: When looking for a cache, I missed a character and searched for "GC1F9G" (instead of "GC1F9GF"). I got a FC without any log information or stack trace.
Manager.title: Crash when looking for non-existent cache by GC

Manager.description: Some caches description doesn't show up correct. Examples: GC217HR GC1QB2K
Manager.title: Description of some caches not readable

Manager.description: I propose that we close release branches now that the releases have been done and replace them with tags, since development should not happen on those branches anymore. We should create two tags market_20110826 and market_20110915 corresponding to the versions that were uploaded by @mucek4 onto the market, and remove the corresponding branches. Note that this does not prevent from restarting a branch from those tags if we want to do a minor correction in a new release. But that would be a new release branch, and then a new release tag when uploaded to market. No objection?
Manager.title: Close release branches

Manager.description: Following scenario: New installation try to enter coordinates the first time. Format selection is PLAIN, controls shown are degree,minutes,seconds switch input style to something else -> FC Essentially this is an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception in the coordinate parser when trying to parse an empty string. This is due to the plain text controls being empty, even if trying to workaround this situation by entering some coordinates. Only workaround is to pre-fill the dialog with own coordinates (if available) version: 1a961ab
Manager.title: FC in coordinate input

Manager.description: In some cases the parser produces incorrect results when parsing a coordinate string like "N 49° 56.031", something the formatter happily and correctly produces given the correct input 49 + 56.031*60 = 49.93385. I have created a test case for it, but as it has to do with regex I suppose somebody else will be able to fix it faster then me.
Manager.title: GeopointParser produces incorrect results

Manager.description: I tried to change a waypoint, now it ist GONE! All the comments are deleted and the name is overwitten by "waypoint 1". This was a Multicahce with 4 Waypoints and Point 3 is overwritten (I only tried to put in some coords...) I tried to create a new waypoint and tried to give it the coordinates: N49 11,929 E008 09,357 but it ALWAYS changes this to N49 11,933 E008 09,350 ? This is with the new version from 15.09.2011 I really would like to change back to the C:GEO Version from 26.08.2011 :( Edit: typos
Manager.title: Waypoint editing broken

Manager.description: As discussed on the developer forum, tests in another repository makes them quite unusable, as they quickly go out of sync with the code, gets unmergeable at the same time as the code, and developers tend not to write tests because it requires accessing another repository. As it seemed to have reached a consensus there, I plan to reintroduce the tests into the main repository (as a separate Eclipse project, just as they are now, by just copying the content of the repository into the tests directory) so that they can be kept in sync with the code.
Manager.title: Reintroduce tests into the repository

Manager.description: Currently there are several situations where the map title is something like "Map [10]". Instead it should be more descriptive like "GC12345" or "Caches around GC12345 [n]" or "Live Map [n]" or "Berlin [n]" (assuming that we just searched for "Berlin").
Manager.title: Map title should describe what is shown

Manager.description: Current Market version has no hints.
Manager.title: Hints are no longer shown

Manager.description: Import caches from oc and then delete them They stay on map.
Manager.title: opencaching.de delete problem: deleted caches always on livemap

Manager.description: Recently when storing a cache for offline us I had problems I select store, it then brings up a box 'saving cache for offline use....' and goes no further, I can back out of it, and can use the home button to do something else, but c:geo is stuck on that screen. Old way to restore c:geo is to power off the phone and back on again. Once up and running the stored cache is there and available for use.
Manager.title: Storing caches offline

Manager.description: With todays market version and nightly 1709 cgeo reports it can not login with my eeepad android 3.2. Also trying manual in settings only reports that gc.com is not reachable It was working with older versions, but howeverI have none to test it. Using my phone with Android 2.3 everything is OK, same network, same version, same time. Can someone please doublecheck with a tablet ? Regards, Lineflyer
Manager.title: Login does not work on Honeycomb tablet

Manager.description: On nighty 1709 the cache hint is already shown decoded when opening cache details. Sorry, could not test with market version right now.
Manager.title: Hint already decoded by default

Manager.description: Example is GCZHPZ And Mingo too (GC30) found 2x
Manager.title: Logcount in cache with 1000+ logs says 1

Manager.description: When you switch the map while the livemap is loading, the UI freezes and after a while a messages appears: "The process c:geo is not responding... Close... Wait". I had this also in a few other cases, e.g. closing map (while loading?).
Manager.title: Freeze when switchin map while loading caches

Manager.description: I cannot see the spoilers for GC20C99. Too bad, the hint is see spoiler (version 8c2357d).
Manager.title: GC20C99 not showing spoilers

Manager.description: I quite often store a cache for offline use after just looking at it, and every time c:geo seems to need to download the cache again! I wonder why that is, as it has just downloaded the same info and should still hold it (after all the cache is still displayed!). Sometimes that second download can take a while and is annoying.
Manager.title: storing just viewed cache: why the online wait again

Manager.description: There is a lot of duplicated code for access position / direction. We should refactor this code and move it to a single position.
Manager.title: Move duplicate code for position / direction to a single position

Manager.description: I didn't get any data how to get to this, but it looks like heavy scrolling trough maps (alot of http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx/MapAction?{"dto":{"data": requests before this) Uncaught handler: thread downloadThread exiting due to uncaught exception java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.AbstractList$SimpleListIterator.next(AbstractList.java:64) at cgeo.geocaching.cgWaypoint.mergeWayPoints(cgWaypoint.java:74) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache.gatherMissingFrom(cgCache.java:202) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.storeWithMerge(cgeoapplication.java:738) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.addSearch(cgeoapplication.java:697) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByViewport$6f6ee709(cgBase.java:2956) at cgeo.geocaching.mapcommon.cgeomap$DownloadThread.run(cgeomap.java:1223) This might be related or not. In the same log I see 09-17 17:49:09.472 E/cgeo (16892): cgeoBase.request: java.lang.NullPointerException 09-17 17:49:09.482 W/cgeo (16892): Failed to download data, retrying. Attempt #2
Manager.title: ConcurrentModificationException in mapsforge

Manager.description: Hi. After update 17 sep login doesn't work. I try install new update morning today (18 sep), but that update no fix my problem. c:geo just say: "Sorry can't login..." Best Regards Kazeasch (tested in Czech Republic. Sorry for my English)
Manager.title: Can't login on the Galaxy Tab (HC3.1)

Manager.description: We've just used c:geo in anger for the first time over the weekend. A brilliant app (Thank you!). There seems to be a strange issue with GPS accuracy. We have a premium account and were correctly loggged in. However, c:geo consitently gets the cache position wrong by 30-40 metres. This applies for both the compass and the maps (live map and locus). The system recognises where we are perfectly but messes up with the cache position. However, very strnagely, the downloaded static map gets the cache position perfectly (but we cannot navigate on these tiles!) For instance at GC2ZRG4 the cache is next to the main path (as seen on google maps and as found by us). The static map also shows it there. The live map shows our own position correctly but both the compass and c:geo map point us 30 metres off the path. This happened consistently with every cache we did so we ended up just having to use the Garmin...... We are running the most up to date version of c:geo on a HTC HD2 which is currently running Core Droid Desire HD Froyo v 1.7. Any solutions The Sweeney Toddlers
Manager.title: Position inaccuracy

Manager.description: These should maybe be added as separate issues, but I guess they are small and easy, so they can probably be tracked here. a) Logs should be auto-saved (but ofcourse not posted to gc.com) when pressing "back". One time too many I have written a long log, and accidentally pressed "back" and had to write it all over again. Maybe add a "clear"-button (with prompt) to clear the log field if anyone ever wants to delete everything they have written without having to long press -> select all -> delete. b) Signature should be placed below cursor position. Currently the cursor is placed at the bottom, below the signature, when i start logging which is usually not what at least I expect. c) Logs on cache page does not show all (unicode) characters. I guess this has to do with either the font used, or Android per se, so it might not be an easy fix. You can add a number of unicode-chars to your logs by using the html entities (IE ✐). They show up fine on the web (gc.com), but not on the phone, where they are simply displayed as squares. It would be great if the font used in the app was able to show more of these characters.
Manager.title: A few improvements to logging caches

Manager.description: Also the mapping app Androzic is very useful (especially when you have OziExplorer maps). It would be nice, if c:geo could support it.
Manager.title: Support also Androzic

Manager.description: I am running version 16.09.2011 on a Samsung Continuum running Froyo 2.2.2. Everything seems to work fine except, when I touch the Live Maps button (which is kinda the core of this program), the app force closes immediately. c:geo also FC's when clicking "show on map" from within a cache description. Let me know what information you might need from me. I can u/l a logcat file is you need that as well.
Manager.title: Force Close when touching Live Map button.

Manager.description: I have the latest (18.09.2011) c:geo and Locus Pro installed. The Live map is not using Locus? Is that intended? Also, when I select 'menu: Utility programs' it does not find Locus Pro, only Locus Free (offers it for download). Should it not tell me that I have Locus Pro installed and use that?
Manager.title: Locus issues: live map not Locus? Locus pro not found?

Manager.description: As discussed in 00a58e7, we need an additional cache type "unknown" including a set of icons for that type. Implementation of the code is easy, I need someone to create those icons.
Manager.title: cache type "unknown"

Manager.description: when I call up the history of caches in g:geo, it is isually sorted alphabetically. sorting by 'date' sorts by some obscure date I cannot make out. I would love to have it sort by the last time I viewed that specific cache in c:geo (sorted reverse, ie last cache first) It should not be too hard to store the last time a cache was viewed in memory and use that as sort date.
Manager.title: sort history by *my* viewing date

Manager.description: Downloading a PQ to a list, cgeo should place all PQ caches in new list, and not exclude already stored caches.
Manager.title: Downloading a PQ to a list, cgeo should place all PQ caches in new list

Manager.description: Currently, caches can only be in a single list. This seems unnecessarily restrictive. I understand this might require a redesign of the list implementation, but the current one seems sluggish. Lists should only have references to caches, not store the caches.
Manager.title: Allow caches to be in several lists at once

Manager.description: I have installed c:geo nightly 20.09. and the help-app from markt on my Asus Transformer. If I try to open the help (e.g. from main screen) it only shows "Please wait" and a failure message in the background. If I deinstall the help-app the help-button works correctly (going to online-help via Brwoser). On my phone the same versions are running well with offline-help. Screenshot follows
Manager.title: Help HTML not opening on Android versions 3 and 4

Manager.description: With "Don't show found or owned caches" set, in live map, found / owned caches flicker on and off, seemingly at random. Activate Live/Inactivate Live merely changes precisely which caches flicker or disappear or show up, and not in any rational way. Seemingly. There's probably a very predictable mechanism at work, but I cannot see what the misbehaviour depends on. "flicker" is triggered by Time, wait long enough and caches will disappear or reappear Moving, move the map so that a cache site gets inside the map area shown and you get flicker all over, If a found cache is shown, looking at the description shows no "Found" label.
Manager.title: Caches owned or found flicker on/off at random on live map

Manager.description: It would be great if c:geo was set as a handler for mime-type "application/gpx+xml", and would try to add these to stored caches automatically.
Manager.title: Default handler for mime type application/gpx+xml

Manager.description: In the logging dialog you have the possibility to attach e.g. date, time, cache number... => Would be nice if there is an option to attach (or take) (multiple) photos to a log entry.
Manager.title: Possibility to attach / take a photo when logging visit

Manager.description: Would be nice if you can add an "batch" submit option for the offline logs. When you save a offline log it doesn't save the gcvote rating.
Manager.title: Offline logging batch submit

Manager.description: Hello Please add support for the following Freemap.sk maps: hiking (T) cycling (C) transport (A) TMS description: http://wiki.freemap.sk/LayerAllInOne (please use Google Translate to read it in your language or ask me for help in case of problems). Thanks in advance.
Manager.title: Add support for Freemap.sk maps

Manager.description: A lot of compiler-warnings are suppressed - like warnings for: unused parameters of methods missing @override annotations Unnecessary cast from x to x redundant nullchecks Imho, correcting these problems result in better (more readable and easier to maintain) code, but I would like to hear your opinions: Do 'we' want these 'problems' corrected, or should I leave it like it is? (if 'we' want them corrected, I'm willing to go over them)
Manager.title: Your opinions on compiler warnings

Manager.description: I uploaded a PQ into c:geo with 500 caches and stored the caches. It was then possible to show the stored caches on the c:geo livemap but for some reason it wouldn't show them in Locus. Smaller cache lists work fine. Is there a limit to the number of caches that c:geo can open in Locus? I only ask because it's a limitation for offline caching (which we do a lot). The Sweeney Toddlers x
Manager.title: Limit to number of caches that can be shown in Locus?

Manager.description: Not that logparsing is simple and a request was made on FB. Can we have refresh log only. People have some caches stored in list and they would like to have only logs updates. This should be simple and fast operation.
Manager.title: Refresh only logs

Manager.description: GCVote is not shown directly in nearby-list. Only after opening a Cache it shows the color-code for the voting for this cache in the list after closing it again. Version: 24/09/2011
Manager.title: GCVote not shown

Manager.description: Can not find c:geo opensurce in phone market and can not get new updates. And its missing in myapps. can you fix it?
Manager.title: c:geo is not available on android 1.6

Manager.description: Today I went caching with the market version 24.09. and encountered that waypoint sometimes get lost. I found a way to reproduce: Search for caches (e.g. by adress) which are not in the database Select a cache with waypoints and store it (the waypoints are correctly shown up to now End c:geo Start c:geo again and do the same search as before (e.g. by adress) Select the previously saved cache from the results Select one of its waypoints and it shows "Unbekannte Koordinaten" with the red-dot symbol Refresh the cache-details Waypoints are OK again There may be other ways to have this error (e.g. when selecting the cache from saved list), but I found only this one reproducibly. Regards, Lineflyer
Manager.title: Waypoints sometimes replaced by "unknown"

Manager.description: One from support email. If you enter a coordinate in any destination and selext Menu>Navigate>Map the coordinate is not shown. Instead the Live Map is opened.
Manager.title: Any destination live map = live map

Manager.description: When I try to click on a go4cache icon (red dot) on the live-map while using OSM it is very difficult to get the info-window open. Doing the same while Google Maps is active is much easier (as it should be). It is like the accepted radius for tapping on the screen is much lower when OSM is displayed. Happens with OSM:Mapnik and OSM:Offline. Works OK with Google:Map. Others not tested. Regards, Lineflyer
Manager.title: Difficult to open go4cache info when using OSM

Manager.description: From email: Hello. If i try to refresh saved caches, phone goes to sleep after some time a d refreshing breakes and is cancelled. Please make it possible for refreshi.g of offline caches to owlvercome the sleep of phone.
Manager.title: Phone sleep breaks refreshing

Manager.description: Ive been using this app for a couple wks now and has been great up until today when i select live map it works but wont show any cache i travelled throught a coulpe towns today and nothing shown. ive tried unistalling and reloading still nothing is there anything you might be able to help me out with this thank you.
Manager.title: live map

Manager.description: Sometimes, found caches are still shown on the map (with exclude found caches option turned on - naturally). This seems to be somewhat related to the loading process not being complete. As if the filter is applied AFTER all caches in the view have been loaded. Not entirely sure, but i believe it also happened after the view was completely updated. The caches aren't even marked by smilies. This is particulary problematic when you are moving the map around much, exploring the area. I believe there was a bug some time ago that the found-filter sometimes stopped working at all. A workaround was to disable->goto map and re-enabled the option (also not entirely sure about that). Could be some problem with already "cached cashes" too?! Regards, Rev
Manager.title: Found caches not always properly hidden

Manager.description: Feature request: It would be nice the have a button that directly opens GPS status (could be hidden if app is not installed) next to the Compass-Button on the live maps cache popup window.
Manager.title: "Link" to GPS status from quick info popup

Manager.description: Ability for getting the gcvote rating should be part of the connector, so non GC caches are not send to gcvote.com. (I'm basically waiting for the network changes to be merged, afterwards this can be implemented easily).
Manager.title: disable base.getRating() for non GC caches

Manager.description: When selecting "Forward" (Weiterleiten) from cache-detail of an OC-cache it translates to http://coord.info/OCxxxx which of course is not working with non-gc caches. It should be changed e.g. to plain-text like "Cache OCxxxx on Opencaching". Or does OC have such kind of short-URL function ?
Manager.title: Forwarding OC-caches not possible

Manager.description: All the texts for sharing are currently hardcoded in the app. They are neither localized nor customizable. If they were customizable in the settings, the localization wouldn't be an issue at all. This is at least an issue for these different actions: twittering cache twittering trackable sharing cache
Manager.title: Twitter text not customizable

Manager.description: As discussed in #553, there should only be one photo icon and a concatenated label in a log entry of the cache details, if multiple images are available. With the changed handling, all images are opened anyway, so multiple links are no longer necessary.
Manager.title: Have only one link for (multiple) log images

Manager.description: It would be great, having a function "mark as found" - similar to "field notes" but without typing text on the road. Simply press menu -> mark as found... and when at home -> export all "marked" GC-Numbers e.g. to a txt or html file which contains links direct to the Listings (or to the Log-Page of the Listings)
Manager.title: Mark as Found

Manager.description: As discussed in #553 I'd like to add image support for images associated with a cache (spoilers and images from the image gallery) as sometimes this helps a lot :) I plan to add a new section in the details view similar to the trackables section. The image will be loaded and displayed when the user clicks on an image (similar to the trackables). Any suggestions how I can determine the image urls because there is no direct connection from the cache data to the images. The image gallery has to be parsed at first.... What about - for a first version - a new menu entry that opens the images in the browser if there are any images associated with the cache ?
Manager.title: Display images in the details views

Manager.description: The waypoint display threshold input box is smaller than other choices. Its style should be more unified.
Manager.title: Waypoint display threshold size

Manager.description: I tried on my phone and it does not work. This is report from Facebook: I tried searching for one and it said c:geo failed to load the cache details and just goes back to the search screen. Example: try searching for OU0340
Manager.title: Opencaching

Manager.description: Right now, some coordinates are printed depending on the current locale, and some are printed with a fixed format. Example: French/German localized: "N 48° 3,123" fixed format: "N 48° 3.123" (note the dot instead of the comma) This leads to inconsistencies in the user interface, and a recent reformatting to remove redundant information made a unit test fail in non-English locale. What format should we use? If we want to always use the same format (which I would favor), we should merge pull request #572 and close #571. If we want localized strings (which seem to be rare), we should merge pull request #571 and close #572. What do you think? As a side note, we should probably finish the GeoFormatter class afterwards and use it everywhere for consistency.
Manager.title: Format to use to display geocoordinates

Manager.description: Uncaught handler: thread main exiting due to uncaught exception java.lang.VerifyError: cgeo.geocaching.compatibility.Compatibility at cgeo.geocaching.cgDirection$cgeoSensorListener.onSensorChanged(cgDirection.java:68) at android.hardware.SensorManager$ListenerDelegate$1.handleMessage(SensorManager.java:415) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4203) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:791) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:549) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

Manager.description: Having the test in the same java package as the class under test allows to access package private and protected methods/fields in test coding. If the test is in a different package, I need to make method/fields of the productive code public only for testing. Examples in GPXParser: parse(final InputStream stream, Handler handlerIn) convertWaypointSym2Type(final String sym) {
Manager.title: Put tests into same java package as tested class

Manager.description: Some caches (but not all) seem to include an extra
Manager.title: Extra HTML in cache location

Manager.description: It should be possible to switch to a list view from the live map. That would make it handy to first select a map piece with certain caches, then show them as list and store only a selection of them. Now I have instead choosen a map area with 102 caches, but I only want to store about 30 of those. There is no way to do this currently. It only works by storing all and afterwards deleting.
Manager.title: show live map as list

Manager.description: There is currently no way to rename an existing list.
Manager.title: rename list

Manager.description: An entry for deleting a cache is already there, but not for storing it.
Manager.title: Store cache from context-menu in list-view

Manager.description: This will probably hurt our collective and individual prides, but I suggest that we move the "changelog" section of "About c:geo" above the "contributors" section. I am afraid the new changes interest the users more than the list of contributors. Any objection?
Manager.title: Put changelog before contributors in the "About c:geo" screen

Manager.description: If you input a keyword in the keyword search and press the return key, the focus jumps to the next input field (or the button, depending on the Android version, as it seems). And this is the same for mainly all other one line input fields, which have a button to invoke an action using the value of the input field. I suggest to instead directly invoke the button action when pressing the enter key in the input field. (And when doing this refactoring, the IME_ACTION_GO should also invoke the same action). Anybody with different opinions?
Manager.title: Use enter key to invoke action in one line input fields

Manager.description: If you open the log cache activity without holding a trackable in your GC account, an error is logged in the system log. This is because the parsing expects the table with the trackables to be there always. I would like to fix that, but for a good test driven change I first need test data, that is a logging web page with trackables. Can someone who currently has at least one TB in his account, please open a web page to post a log on an arbitrary cache (http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?ID=****) , save that web page and commit it into the repo or send via mail? I don't really want to hunt some caches now just to implement that fix. :) Alternatively you may also take the issue and fix it yourself...
Manager.title: wrongly logged error when logging with TB

Manager.description: It looks like the directory /sdcard/.cgeo contains lots of cache/trackable jpeg pictures that are never cleaned up. Shouldn't those be cleared when they get out of the database?
Manager.title: Ever increasing directory on sdcard

Manager.description: If you download a offline map from mapsforge.org and put it in /sdcard/.cgeo directroy it will not be found if you press the 3-dot-button under Settings->Map sources. Creating a new dir it works. Because of the dot in .cgeo?
Manager.title: OSM map file will not be found in .cgeo directory

Manager.description: I can not tell the specific error, but often the storage time in the cache-details ("Stored in device x days ago") can not be correct. I recognized sometimes that e.g. the las log shown was from 10 days ago and the storage time said 1 day ago. After refreshing I can see new logs older than 1 day. In general the days shown often are less than the real last save date. Mabe there is some operaation resetting the value although the cache details have not been updated. This might be in conjunction with updating the app (by instllaing nightly builds) but I am not sure. If I find a way to reproduce I will post it.
Manager.title: Incorrect storage time in cache details

Manager.description: Since yesterday I lost downloaded pictures in the spoiler and in the logs... When I refresh it works a few minutes and when I load new caches they dissapeared again.... It's the first time it happens since month I use C-GEO. Could you check and Help ?
Manager.title: Pictures disepear once loaded for external use

Manager.description: From email: Dear cgeo-developers, since some months we use cgeo with our HTC Desire HD - thanks at this point for you great work!!! Before (and still now) we use a HTC Touch Pro2 under WinMobile 6 and the software "gatecacher" (by Dennis Baremans). This software has one feature that works perfect when approaching a cache (especially by bike): at certain distances (every 50m from 950 to 150m, every 10m from 150m to 50m, every 5m from 50m to 10m and then every meter) they are given by playing these predefined sounds (wav-files) together with the current angle (also as sound). Sounds for distances larger than 950m are not available but from time to time the current angle is spoken. This wonderful feature unfortunately no Andoid-GC-Software consists of as far as I know It would be wonderful if in any future cgeo could get something like this. Yours Uwe
Manager.title: cgeo Accoustic navigation

Manager.description: Noted in the development version when GC.com changed its login variables: the login error was in the log, but success (without the avatar) was reported on the screen. Maybe a forgotten corner case of #602, will investigate.

Manager.title: send2cgeo script broken

Manager.description: Suddenly cgeo starts failing to log in on GC.com. The official gc app works fine. The login procedure reports Unknown error.... I don't know where else to report this. I tried reentering the login data, but nogo. Groundspeak's own app works fine, provably.
Manager.title: cgeo fails to log me in to GC.com. Official app works.

Manager.description: Hi, when I export a bunch (e.g. 500 Caches) from GSAK to a GPX File (v 1.0 or v 1.1) and import it to c:geo, no childwaypoints are imported. The rest of the information is fine. To narrow the error down: When I import a single cache (direct GPX from GC or exported via GSAK) the child waypoint is parsed correctly and also shows on the map. But it doesn't work with a GPX file that contains multiple caches. I can provide you with sample GPX files for testing. Thanks for your work John
Manager.title: GSAK GPX Import - No child waypoints parsed

Manager.description: It would be nice if you at the icons on the map to which a local log exists a symbol (like the smiley when logged only one other color) would appear. Sorry for the bad English, was translated with Google translator.
Manager.title: cache-icon with symbol on Maps for caches with local log

Since the last update (06.10.11) "everything" stays in the systems default language. Since i prefer english, it would be great if this gets fixed :) Regards, Rev PS: Enabling/disabling and restarting did not help.

Manager.description: It would be a nice feature to copy Waypoint's in one Cache. In many multi-caches you get at one station the coordinates for the next station. Can copy a waypoint with the ability to quickly create new waypoints

I finally got a log from a user. Is there anything we can do about this filtering? The Android Market (WEB) tells me "Diese App ist nicht mit Ihrem HOT HD2 MTK6516-Gerät kompatibel. Der Filter Ihres Geräts für Inhaltsbewertung ist nicht mit diesem Artikel kompatibel." ("App not compatible, content filtering prevents this App from installing") Filter is set to "All", (i tried "mature" instead: no change.)
about the phone: IMEI: 3541********* Model Number: HD9 Android Version: 2.2.1 Android Market: 2.2.11 Baseband-Version: MAUI.10A.W10.48MP.V5.F1,2011/01/27 16:48 Kernel Version: 2.6.21.9 Build-Number: 10HX2 V7MODby BM (26-06-2011)

Manager.description: In my personal settings I didn't enter a password for GCVote.com. I don't use it (anymore), i'm not interessed in the ratings - i am looking at the favorite points now. But during the parsing of a cache a http request is made to gcvote.com for the rating. I don't want that request. I want my cache parsed as fast as possible. I propose to link the request to the existance of the GCvote.com password. Do the request only if the extra password has been entered, don't make a request if there's no such password. What do you think about this ?
Manager.title: Use GCVote.com rating only if GCvote.com password has been entered

Manager.description: There are some unused strings, e.g. "init_languages_description". Should we remove them? If we need one of them later, we can take it from the repository-history. The other question: Is there an easy way to identify such unused strings?

Then I get a FC with no error in the log, except for D/AK8973 ( 441): Compass CLOSE D/AK8973 ( 441): Compass Start D/AndroidRuntime(32703): Shutting down VM W/dalvikvm(32703): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x4001d5a0) ... Manager.title: Cache note not removed after deleting at gc.com

Manager.description: The cache details activity has 6 (!!!) different progress dialogs as fields. I'd like to completely remove those and instead have one progress dialog wrapper class which internally manages one progress dialog, but takes away all the resource management. The only open question I have: Is it possible to have multiple progress dialogs shown concurrently in Android? And if so, does that make sense? Do we use something like that somewhere? I'm asking because I would like to write that wrapper in such a way, that there can be only one progress dialog at any time. Simplifies things a lot.
Manager.title: remove multiple progress dialogs

Manager.description: Watchlisting is not possible if a cache comes from GPX, because the internal ID is missing then. So it must be refreshed online before adding it to the watchlist.

Manager.description: I just opened a (non live) map for 10 caches around the world, showing the whole earth. Afterwards I opened live map, which used the same zoom level. That's absolutely not useful, so the zoom level for the live map should be limited in such a way, that you cannot "zoom out" further than that limit.
Manager.title: limit zoom level of live map

Manager.description: I currently need to have a waypoint created based on a distance and angle from the cache coordinates. I see no way to create this easily in c:geo. We can only create such waypoints based on manually entered coordinates or based on my current coordinates. Therefore I suggest an additional button "Cache coordinates" in the coordinate input dialog, which works similar to the "my coordinates" button.
Manager.title: create waypoint based on cache coordinate

Manager.description: We currently have 7 main menu items in the options menu of cache lists. As only 6 are shown at a time, we always have "Map" and "List" under the "more" button. This is even true for an empty list. There you see 3 disabled menu items, but you have to use the "more" button to get to the list management so you can delete the empty list. I suggest that for empty lists (and only for those) the disabled menu items are also hidden to avoid clicking through multiple menus.
Manager.title: hide some options menus for empty list

Manager.description: Open a live map click store (about 30-40 caches) move map clicl store again (about 10 caches) Progressbar at 100% all the time
Manager.title: Progres bar stalled at 100%

Manager.description: We have no type for locationless caches in our cache type enumeration. But we have icons for them (and put them in the icon lookup maps). We should either remove them completely or support them fully. Which way to go?
Manager.title: support locationless caches fully or not at all

Manager.description: 10-16 08:47:35.521 E/AndroidRuntime(5341): at cgeo.geocaching.cgCacheListAdapter.getView(cgCacheListAdapter.java:488) 10-16 08:47:35.525 W/ActivityManager(190): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeocaches
Manager.title: FC in getView

Manager.description: 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.activity.Progress.dismiss(Progress.java:15) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail.setView(cgeodetail.java:1085) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail.access$400(cgeodetail.java:74) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail$4.handleMessage(cgeodetail.java:188) 10-16 08:41:57.599 W/ActivityManager(190): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeodetail I think there are several things to fix in Progress: methods should be made synchronized because when using background tasks several things can happen simultaneously if the user goes back and reenters a cache details activity for example Progress.show should take a handler rather than a boolean cancelable to install the proper handler in this case (which will ultimately dismiss the dialog before letting another activity / background task use it) in Progress.dismiss, dialog should be set to null in any case A better fix would probably not to have a static Progress but to have a Progress instance as a field in cgeodetail.
Manager.title: FC in Progress.dismiss

Manager.title: performance of name sorting

Manager.description: parseSearch() still has the same problems that we already fixed in parseCache(), namely that it holds the complete webpage of every cache from the search results in memory. I'll apply a short term fix for this memory leak by adding a String constructor call, but we should really refactor that method to use the BaseUtil mechanisms.
Manager.title: refactor "parseSearch" to use BaseUtils matching routines

If it is possible to add button there It'll be useful. Thanks I'm not so good in javascript so I had tryed but I can't do that.
Manager.title: Send2cgeo load multiple caches on one click

Manager.description: I have found several caches and submitted my find online. When I look at a live map it does not give me the smiley face. If you click on the cache and open it - it will say found - and my log post is there. Why am I not getting the smiley face? I keep going to a bunch of caches thinking I have them to do - but in fact when I open the cache - then realize I have found it already. Am I doing something wrong? Also, since I am new to the geocaching thing - perhaps most of this is my fault? Why when I try and log a find online (using my Moto Droid) SOMETIMES - it says the cache is not available and it will only let me SAVE for offline use? Also - last question -- I just did my first "series". Is there a way to change the coordinates on my gps? Example -- had to find 7 caches - each had a clue to the GPS coordinates of the FINAL CACHE. Using C:Geo -- is there a way that I can enter those coordinates AFTER I found them all? Again using the Motorola Droid - the c:geo is my ONLY source of navigation/GPS. This app is AWESOME!!! I love it - just not sure if its me or is there something wrong?
Manager.title: Smiley not given to found cache :(

Manager.description: I'd like to refactor cgCache. First I'd like to change the direct access of the members into getters and setters method calls. Second, I'd like to introduce a class hierachy. An interface "ILogable" with basic operations for all kind of caches, trackables, challenges. Different implementations like GCCache, Trackable, OCCache, Challenge and so on. Your opinion on that ?
Manager.title: Refactor cgCache

Manager.description: From facebook: I have a feature suggestion. I like to solve Unknown/mistery caches but usually when solved I don't go there to log for long time (some times I even forget them forever). So I would love an option to filter the Stored caches to easily find the ones I solved, maybe by filtering the ones with custom placed waypoints as I usually store there the final coordinates. Maybe just having an option to custom mark them in the list, something like the orange bar placed beside the caches found but not yet logged or the green one for the solved. Maybe a Blue or Violet bar? I don't really know what's the best way but it will be a very usefull addition anyway :D
Manager.title: Add special color marker in list of stored caches for solved caches

Manager.description: When we currently store a cache, then we always load the (potentially) existing current cache with the same geocode from the database, merge the old cache into the new one and store the new one. This is generally fine and gives correct results (so we have the most recent fields and so on). But this approach takes a huge amount of time. For most of our search operations (like "near me"), the storeWithMerge() is responsible for half the runtime. So it would be good if we could implement the merge differently (e.g. by only writing the newer values into the database, avoiding loading the cache details at all). You should also think about it from this perspective: We typically get new cache information from a (online) search, but that contains only partial cache data (e.g. only the most important fields). We then load the old cache (with all the fields), copy all those fields into the new cache, and save all the fields of the new cache into the database. That way we copy the large information chunk into the small one. And afterwards we store all fields, although only some have changed.
Manager.title: storeWithMerge is bad strategy

Manager.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at java.util.regex.Matcher.reset(Matcher.java:181) at java.util.regex.Matcher.(Matcher.java:94) at java.util.regex.Pattern.matcher(Pattern.java:290) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.getViewstates(cgBase.java:358) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.login(cgBase.java:450) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeo$firstLogin.run(cgeo.java:727)

Manager.description: I often find concurrent requests (here the last three GET requests start before the previous one has returned), which probably explain the concurrent access causing data corruption and exceptions while browsing the live map as the results may be handled concurrently. Anyway, this is a real problem that must be fixed independently of whether it fixes all the map issues or not. D/cgeo (24758): GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): 200 (5162 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): 200 (3251 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): 200 (2961 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx D/cgeo (24758): 200 (2516 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx
Manager.title: Concurrent map access

Manager.description: Google issued an update to the Android development tools and the Eclipse plugin. Unfortunately, the ant scripts are not compatible with previous versions, so people having upgraded cannot use ant anymore unless the configuration is updated, and people that have not upgraded cannot use the new version. So we should all upgrade to the up-to-date version. I created a new branch new-development-tools. People having an up-to-date development environment can test it and report here. Note that using those development tools, I was able to confirm that c:geo still works in a Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0) emulator.
Manager.title: New Android development tools (revision 14)

Manager.description: I have noticed this change in the past few versions or so of c:geo. If I am using road maps (default) I cannot zoom in as far as before. If I use satellite view it will allow me to zoom in closer than road maps allow. I can tell this because of my distance from the cache. Did something get changed to limit the road map zoom level or is it actually something that Google changed? PS. Also satellite views last zoom level is always black.
Manager.title: Live Map Zoom Level Distance

Manager.description: When running unit tests, the log shows that loadLogsFromDetails() throws an error for some caches ("... status is error"). Could someone look into that who knows the log reading code?

Manager.description: Maybe I'm wrong, but when you started to show circles on map around caches, those for traditionals were red, filled and not dotted. Now they are all black, dotted and very slim, as they were for Multis and Mysteries, because their header-koords mostly are wrong. So they are hardly seen on Google-Satellite-Map. When switching from Google to OSM or otherwise... the Circle-option get lost, but no big problem

Manager.description: NB 2310 -ab0e4b1: If I am in compass mode and select "Show on map" c:geo crashes and goes back to cache-details. It is reproducible on my device. If it not reproducible on your side, I can provide a log later.
Manager.title: FC when selecting "Show on Map"

Manager.description: When a gpx file from a pocket query is imported that has a waypoints file attached, the progress bar shows correct progress for importing the cache file, wrong progress for the waypoints file and no progress for storing the caches in DB. Reason is that the progress bar is initialized once with the size of the cache file in cgeogpxes but not updated later for the import of the waypoints file or when storing the caches. Control is handed over to GPXParser that doesn't know about the progress bar. My proposal is to put control over file handling and storing of caches into cgeogpxes and remove it from GPXParser. GPXParser gets rid of all the static methods and provides only: Collection parse(InputStream, Handler) Simple API, nicely testable. Ok, LocParser would need some more rework. This refactoring would also make it easier to add support for importing pocket query zips directly. What do you think?
Manager.title: Progress bar shows wrong progress when importing gpx with waypoints

Manager.description: If the user cannot be located at all and uses "search / coordinates", the initial dialog presented to it ignores the mode of coordinates selection (plain, degrees, deg+min, deg+min+sec) and display the wrong fields. I'll fix this in the release branch.
Manager.title: Bad dialog entries when user cannot be located

Manager.description: Google Maps seems not to restrict itself to the range of longitude we deem acceptable. For example, look at a cache, zoom out until you see the whole earth, and you might get: E/cgeo (11001): cgMapView.draw: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$MalformedCoordinateException: malformed longitude: -335.1517 This can even go further as in: E/cgeo (11001): cgMapView.draw: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$MalformedCoordinateException: malformed longitude: -560.1517 where you see the whole Earth several times on your screen. We should fix this in two parts: Geopoint should take care of the modulo operation and accept any longitude as valid when it comes from microdegrees. We should not allow zoom levels allowing the representation of the whole earth as we are not ready to deal (in live map for example) with physical earth locations being present several times on the displayed map.
Manager.title: Zooming out too much may confuse c:geo

Manager.description: From email: I still offering feature "RESUME" The idea for Manage -> Refresh All. After every succsessfull cache downloading put its number (just number in cgeo, not the name) into some file at the disk. If in time of download cgeo is crashes, user could start cgeo againg, then choose Manage -> Resume Refresh All to start downloading not from the 1-st cache, but from last downloaded. As I see it will be a solution for this issue. Every can download GPX file, and Refresh it again and again :) This is something between bug, refactoring and future request. What do you think?
Manager.title: Resume refreshing after FC

Manager.title: Save for offline not possible on live map

Manager.description: If c:geo cannot load an online image, it will show drawable/image_not_loaded.png instead. I suggest to use a smaller image instead, because if I have a cache with several images which all cannot be loaded, there is no use in showing multiple large "empty" images instead. I just want to scroll over them, because they have no value for me. And the other thing is: Users may have gotten used to this image representing "could not load image", but the image itself absolutely does not reflect this status. Something like the good old browsers "red cross in empty image" may be suited better to transport the message, even if it is not as nice. Something like http://www.iconarchive.com/show/oxygen-icons-by-oxygen-icons.org/Status-image-missing-icon.html http://findicons.com/icon/185419/image_missing?id=362146 Comments? Other opinions? Suggestions for better images/icons?
Manager.title: replace image_not_loaded.png with smaller image

Manager.description: The button to load more caches after a search is currently labeled "load more caches...". Instead it should be something like "load more caches (123 currently)". Otherwise there is no easy way to see how much the list already contains, if the title label is long.
Manager.title: have number of caches after "load more caches"

Manager.description: I think I found an easy solution for the out of memory issue when downloading caches. That code creates bitmaps which are not used afterwards. Mainly I wanted to change something else in cgHtmlImg, so this was merely a side effect (but that's why my commit will include some other refactorings).
Manager.title: Out of memory in images when downloading
