Manager.description: Can't install the aplication, I'm using CM7 V1.1 with Android VS 2.3.7 and it says that my phone isn't compatible with C:Geo can you please check it out? Or is the version of C:Geo not compatible with 2.3.7? Thank you,
Manager.title: Problem installing from market

Manager.description: When using a (non live) map, it would be really comfortable to long tap on a point of the map, which would then trigger a menu for live map at that point or for caches around that point.
Manager.title: long tap on map for search around that point

Manager.description: Currently the trail display on maps is always active and can only be disabled via options menu for that session. We should have a normal option for the trail display to not force users to disable it again and again.
Manager.title: have explicit option for trail on map

Manager.description: Version b489b69 does not work for me, it crashes when querying nearby caches: E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-20 E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): java.lang.NullPointerException E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.saveCache(cgData.java:1215) E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.storeWithMerge(cgeoapplication.java:593) E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.addSearch(cgeoapplication.java:557) E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByAny(cgBase.java:2175) E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByCoords$5bd01a3a(cgBase.java:2182) E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$geocachesLoadByCoords.run(cgeocaches.java:1874) W/ActivityManager( 208): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeocaches @rsudev, did the merge you committed work perfectly for you? Edit: I confirm that it works fine for me with d464383 (the version before the merge).
Manager.title: NPE when looking at nearby caches

Manager.description: It seems that the behaviour of the live map has changed recentöy: It shows only the stored caches. It shows found caches although I selected "Exclude own and found caches".
Manager.title: Live map shows stored caches only

Manager.description: I like the additional info while loading a cache (so I know, that really something is giong on). But when I refresh a cache, no verbose info is shown (so I still don't know, whether anything is going on).
Manager.title: Verbose cache loading should also work for Refresh

Manager.description: When pressing the button labeled "No more caches" it tries loading the next page of search results.
Manager.title: "No more caches" still tries loading more

Manager.description: The image OOM fix in d464383 prevents non-saved images to be decoded, as they are first not saved, then loaded from the saved version (which does not exist). To test, check your GC login/password with an avatar image present, the avatar cannot be decoded although it is correctly downloaded.
Manager.title: Non-saved images are not loaded properly

Manager.description: it is really disconcerting to have c:geo search my whole Android every time I am trying to import a GPX file. Not only does that take much time, but it also finds GPX files from other applications. You should really add a preference/setting which directories it should look into for imports (and default that to one sane choice)
Manager.title: specify import directories

Manager.description: I don't know whether this is a bug or a feature request: Import opencaching GPX for a certain location Open nearby list while at this location Only the nearby GC caches will be listed It seems imported non-gc caches are only visible/listed on live map. From users perspective he would like to see any cache which is nearby independently if it is GC or non-GC.
Manager.title: Nearby List also for non-GC caches

Manager.description: If I find some spare time today during the conference, I will try to convert our settings to a PreferenceActivity. I know it is deprecated, but we still target 1.5 (no fragments there) it can easily be converted to fragments afterwards.
Manager.title: use PreferenceActivity

Manager.description: Using NB0311- b55a04f : Perform search (e.g. by adress) with results not already stored on the device The result list always shows the "Traditional" icon also if the cache is of another type Only after opening the cache-details once the icon will be also corret in the list
Manager.title: Search results always shows Traditional icon

Manager.description: When switching on circles in maps only traditionals have a red filled circle. Request: every Waypoint and Multi should have filled circles too. I use this function for finding places for new caches sometimes. Showing only traditionals accentuated doesn't make sense I think.
Manager.title: circles and colors

Manager.description: Good morning. At our last cache attack event 2011 in Nordhorn i'd liked to leave a peace of my inventory. but I had to search a lot of time, to find the action menu to leave it @ the event in c:geo. it would be nice, when the inventory action "button" becomes a real button. so it is easier to the that behind the text "no action" is a menu with more actions. thank you and nice work =)
Manager.title: Button for inventory actions

Manager.description: As far as I've seen, cache data for offline use is currently either spidered online from the gc website or imported from gpx-files. Have you already thought of importing cache data from the saved html-page of a cache detail site? You would save the cache detail site as html page, put it in the .cgeo folder on the sdcard and let cgeo import it from there without contacting the gc site at all. This way, the gc site would not be spidered with your login data and you do not have to create a pocket query. You just open the cache you like in your browser and use the "Save Page" - "Html only" feature of the browser. Of yourse, this is only practicable if you don't want to import dozens of caches. But for getting the details of a few caches this is a fast and secure method. (I got the cgeo source code and did a proof-of-concept implementation, which works great for me. I did not create a pull request because I possibly have overlooked something in the implementation and because I'm new to the git cvs and the whole project).
Manager.title: Parse cache data from html file

Manager.description: When using c:geo it sometimes forcecloses, it is more probable to happen when I have more caches saved. c:geo is usable with about 50 offline caches, but using more is really pain. I would be great to have about thousand caches saved (around all locations where I normally am). How can I help with debugging this ?
Manager.title: Sometimes forceclose (map, lists)

Manager.description: Hi there. Last weekend i was caching with someone who doesn't have a premium account. There was a lot confusion about where to go next, because she wasn't seeing the premium caches on the map at all and I wasn't able to take into consideration what caches we should/could skip because they all look the same. Regards, Rev
Manager.title: Make premium caches distinguishable from normal ones (live map and lists)

Manager.description: I have the latest c:geo (ver. 31.10.2011) running on Android 2.2. I posted some geocache found logs over the weekend using c:geo but when I checked the History list, not all of those geocaches are in the list. I think the History list is missing about half of the geocaches that I logged, even though those geocaches show up in Quick View on the geocaching website. What could be going wrong?
Manager.title: Not saved caches not shown in history

Manager.description: Gc.com has downtime almost weekly. When using cgeo it is very easy to not see gc.com notifications. I would like to see a feature where cgeo detects the yellow notification bar and show it as a dialog.
Manager.title: gc.com downtime notifications

Manager.description: Following the update of gc.com, trackable names are now displayed into a h2 section with a class information. I fixed the regex in both the release and master branch (6c1d069). Closing, it is just for further reference.
Manager.title: Trackable names display changes

Manager.description: Our GeopointFormatter class is great but not optimal: we do not need to generate arbitrary formatted coordinates. This would be different if it belonged to a library. Reducing it to the set of formats used internally in c:geo reduces the total code size by approximately 200 lines, and ensures maximum performance. Of course, the old one will still be recoverable from git if someone wants to use it in a library.
Manager.title: GeopointFormatter is too broad for our use

Manager.description: As we generalize the use of Geopoint, we get it by the fact that Google Location objects are not always in the expected bounds. In particular, our current adjustments are probably wrong when dealing with a viewport which encompasses the 180° meridian. Any latitude and longitude should be accepted. Since we use Android methods to compute distances and bearings, we do not have to deal ourselves with wrap around and such.
Manager.title: Do not check bounds when creating Geopoint

Manager.description: When trying to login and there is no network, a NPE occurs (loginResponse is null in cgBase,454)
Manager.title: NullPointerException on login without network

Manager.description: Just today a strange idea came into my mind and I want to ask you about your opinion and about the general feasibility: Since some weeks you implemented the import of QR-Codes via QR-Droid,etc to scan GC-Codes. When selecting this feature it also allows me to open Google Goggles. This made me think about the following: I tried Goggles to read a Travel Bug Dog Tag and it worked, that it delivered back the TB-code from the tag. Would it be possible to allow scanning of the code and opening the TB-page with it ? Just today I went again to a TB-Hotel with >10 Bugs and most of them without description of the goal. So I had to input each code manually into the c:geo search to look them up. I dont really know if scanning is faster, but if Goggles is working reliable it could save a lot of manual input (and its a really sophisticated feature :) )
Manager.title: Scanning of TB-codes with external app ?

Manager.description: If the database is empty at startup and there is a backup available, the app should ask the user if he wants to restore it.
Manager.title: ask for restore if database is empty

Manager.description: Refreshing the cache may completely change its properties. The menu currently stays as on first opening the cache.
Manager.title: cache details options menu does not adapt to changes

Manager.description: NB 1211-1ECC184 Trying to search with username for owned caches crashes c:geo reproducibly on my devices. Market version seems ok. If its not reproducible I can provide a log later.
Manager.title: "Hidden by" search crashes c:geo

Manager.description: (Using NB1311- 01a6ad6) After updating my phone (Samsung Galaxy SII) to Android 2.3.4 I have a strange problem: When using the coordinates input (e.g. by "Any destination") with the input helper (format: DDD MM.MMM) all the fields are preselected on access as usual. This means when I start typing the previous content is replaced by the numbers I enter. This is still working normal in all fields except for the MM input of longitude: After entering the DDD information the focus jumps to the MM field and the content is preselected normally, but if I input some digits they are just appended to the exisiting digits. The MMM field is again working normal. The strange thing is, that if I selected the android default keyboard instead of the Swype keyboard it is working normal again. Now you could say, that this is a pure Samsung-Swype problem, but I found out the following: If I use the latest market version (instead of the NB mentioned above) the behaviour changes a little bit. With this version the same problem also occurs in the MM field of the latitude (North/south) coordinates. This field was OK in the NB-version. This brings me to the conclusion that the problem is based by the Swype-keyboard but also somehow related to a programming issue. I hope you can follow my explanations...it is a little hard to describe the problem.
Manager.title: Coordinates input problematic with Swype keyboard

Manager.description: All Go4Cache UI strings are currently hardcoded.
Manager.title: Go4Cache UI hardcoded English

Manager.description: Is c:geo using groundspeak's public api or is it just scraping the webpage? Seemingly, the api avoids problems like the sudden login procedure changes.
Manager.title: C:geo using geocaching.com live api or scraping?

Manager.description: Is it possible to use a tile cache shared by other apps, like OsmAnd ? It is in slippy format: /zoom/x/y.png Would be great to avoid redundance, and allow easier hunting without connection.
Manager.title: Using slippy tiles cache (of OsmAnd f.eg.)

Manager.description: This is an UI improvement request. Having not tracked the development for some time I only noticed by chance that the stored caches icon now has a context menu that opens when the user long taps on the icon. This is unexpected as the user has no visual clue of this added functionality. For instance, Google apps add visual clues when there are additional functions associated with action bars and icons; usually a down-pointing triangle. I would suggest to add a small down-pointing arrow to the top-right hand edge of the icon, as this is the usual position, at least in left-to-right locales. For this to work, the number of stored caches needs to be shifted to the top-left hand edge of the symbol.
Manager.title: Visual indication of list menu for "Stored Caches" Icon

Manager.description: This seems to be a regression: if I rotate my Galaxy 7" Tab (Android 2.2) after I've opened one of the map views the bounding box for showing markers will be wrong. It doesn't seem to get updated, this the map will contain an area where it lacks markers albeit there should be markers shown. Note: only tested with OSM offline maps.
Manager.title: Rotating the Map views does not recalculate the bounding box for showing markers

Manager.description: This seems to be a problem with the OSM offline map view: if waypoints are shown on a map and a waypoint happen to be near the geocache it is associated with (such as a Parking waypoint), then tapping on the geocache marker brings up the waypoint instead, albeit it is layered below the geocache marker and thus not shown. Similar, if multiple waypoints and/or geocache markers are in close proximity the layering of the display is the inverse of the hit-test layering: the user taps on the topmost marker, but c:geo detects the lowestmost marker instead. Probably both issues are related, thus I filed them together in a single issue.
Manager.title: Enabling waypoints in Maps and tapping on Geocache marker brings up Waypoint instead

Manager.description: In NB 1411 the logview is always showing"Logging not possible". Only after switching from Found to other log type and back again its normal. I did not log a cache up to now but at least the prompt is wrong in log view. Is this a new feature ?
Manager.title: Logging not possible

Manager.description: It is obviously not possible to do an offline log if no login data is given (the whole log-menu is missing). That sounds strange to me. Is there a reason? The logic for adding (offline) log menu entries is in class "ActivityMixin" in function "addVisitMenu".
Manager.title: Login data required for offline log?

Manager.description: The UI of c:geo is slightly inconsistent for the menu item icon for "scan QR code" (main screen): it shows a barcode. However, for reasons of visual consistency, it should show a (simplified) QR code. This allows users not familiar with the term QR code to better understand what this function is for and to easily identify QR codes when they see them.
Manager.title: Menu item "Scan QR Code" should show a QR code instead of Barcode

Manager.description: When I browse a gc.com listing in my browser and selects a cache you get the option to open it in cgeo. After selecting cgeo loading starts but quickly fails with message from text label "err_dwld_details_failed". No error message in log. If you load the cache from cgeo live map once, then opening the same cache from browser is successful. I'm using latest nightly build.
Manager.title: Cache details cannot be loaded from gc.com webpage listing

Manager.description: This is a request for frontend improvement: the "navigate any location" activity has a history of past locations entered. However, its use is currently rathing limited. In particular: the user can only delete a history waypoint or navigate using the compass. the user cannot navigate any other method, such as maps, et cetera. A long tap on a waypoint brings up only the option to delete. the user cannot recall a history waypoint. My suggestion is to change the activity as follows: when the user taps on a history waypoint, its coordinates get transferred to the input field. No navigation is done yet. the user then may choose to edit the waypoint or navigate using the same methods as when entering a new waypoint. the existing "shortcut" of tapping on a history waypoint and navigating by compass should be removed as its use conflicts with easy recall, editing, and navigating by other means.
Manager.title: History of Navigate any Location does not allow navigation other than compass, no edit

Manager.description: Until a few weeks ago it was possible to refresh not stored caches by clicking on "refresh. Now this doesn't do anything.
Manager.title: Refresh not stored caches

Manager.description: The buttons in the log-view are missing.
Manager.title: Batch-actions for trackables not working

Manager.description: There are a lot of empty (?) geocache-directories (GC***/TB***) in /data/data/cgeo.geocaching/.cgeo.
Manager.title: Geocache-directories in internal memory

Manager.description: A small feature request for consistent user experience: if possible, the code scan activity should have an action bar like all other c:geo activities. In this case, the action bar should contain the home and help actions.
Manager.title: GC/QR code scan activity should have an action bar like all other activities

Manager.description: Normal caches show the size in the cache list. Event caches don't do that. But they could show the date instead. Currently it is not possible to get a clue of when an event cache happens, you must open the cache details for that.
Manager.title: show date for event caches in cache list

Manager.description: Last days the check for being online in log-view has been introduced. Since I am using the corresponding nightlies I recognized that the log-view shows "Logging not possible" for some time (depends on network speed: WLAN 1-2 seconds, 3G up to 10 seconds) unitl the network-status is known and only then changes to the normal "Log"). In order to avoid user complaints and misunderstandings I would suggest to show the normal "Log" at first and only change to "Logging not possible" after it has been detected that the network is not available.
Manager.title: Change behaviour of "Logging not possible" prompt

Manager.title: Crash (NullP) in LiveMap using offline OSM-maps

Manager.description: Before: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/443/beforep.png/ After: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/337/aftero.png/ I find the changed version much more readable. Any objections?
Manager.title: increase readability

Manager.description: Hello, after loaded a cache list from a GPX file, it should be useful to manually add some spoiler images inside the folder sdcard/.cgeo/cachename unfortunately, after this operation, cgeo doesn't seem to use/see the new images stored. please add some kind of feature/command that will allow cgeo to update caches spoiler/reference adding or updating them taking the files from inside the folders thanks
Manager.title: Ability to manually update spoiler images

Manager.description: current: E 009° 5.123 I think we should use the leading zeros in a consistend way: E 9° 5.123 or E 009° 05.123 What do you think about this?
Manager.title: Coordinates: leading zeros or not?

Manager.description: Testing and developing with Eclipse overwrites my Market version of c:geo - i can't use the automatic update anymore because the Market version is signed with a different key than my Eclipse version.... Normally i use my personal, latest build when i am on a cache tour to find bugs... In case of bugs this can be very annoying and i need a fallback to the Market version. I have to deinstall c:geo and download it again from the market.... A parallel installation of the Eclipse (developer) version of c:geo would solve this problem. While developing we could use a different AndroidManifest.xml than for the release build. Your opinions about this ? And: how does Android distinguish two different applications ? Name of the apk file ?
Manager.title: Parallel installation of Market and Eclipse version of c:geo

Manager.description: I have alot of caches in archive, and when I try to update them all its takes several hours and sometimes crashes after updating half of them, making me update them all again. How about a menu option to update caches older then a month, a week, etc.
Manager.title: Updating archived caches

Manager.description: When I was caching today, I played with the Android sound recorder on the way back home from the cache (to record a "voice log"). I suggest to make that an official integrated feature: Have a new menu item in the visit activity to record audio (which just invokes the native audio recorder). When the audio recorder closes, it returns a content URI for the recording. We would need to save that with the cache (and change the DB for that). Playback of the recording could be invoked from a second menu item in the visit activity or from the history. As the audio stuff is handled by the recorder, we don't need additional permissions. Example code: http://www.openintents.org/en/node/114
Manager.title: Audio recording from cache log activity

Manager.description: Hi, I found a problem related to event caches. Use case: Open an event cache in c:geo Menu -> Add to calendar Close cgeo Open your calendar application Find and open the event The "location" of the event has coordinates and is clickable on my Sony Ericsson phone. Click on the location. Google Maps will open but will not find anything because the coordinates mm/ddd are separated by "," where GoogleMaps requires "." (After editing the calendar item and replacing "," with "." then GoogleMaps will load location). Thus. Coordinates added to calendar should have "." instead of ",".
Manager.title: Bad format for event coordinates when added to calendar

Manager.description: After some change in the code the popup text is now not really correct: It e.g. shows "Heading to GCxxxx 24 Minutes" It should rather say " Heading to GCxxxx 24 Minutes ago" Same applies also for other languages, e.g. german "Auf dem Weg zu GCxxxx 24 Minuten" to "Auf dem Weg zu GCxxxx vor 24 Minuten".
Manager.title: Go4cache popup needs improvement

Manager.description: As discussed in #823, there is still an issue with the GPX import (activity being destroyed at a bad time). This could be solved by importing the GPX file directly in the main activity (or the cache list activity respectively). Would solve that activity leaking problem and also make the screen "a bit more colored" during the import operation. :)
Manager.title: import GPX without ImportActivity

Manager.description: Mucek4 told me at the event, that the compass uses cpu-time while the screen is off. Also the compass needs a lot of cpu during normal operation (constantly 90-100%). Compared to other navigation-apps this is too much(like Locus, 5-80%).
Manager.title: Compass cpu-usage (mainly while screen off)

Manager.description: If a new version is installed and the user restores the database directly from the settings activity, he will still get a "do you want to restore" dialog afterwards in the main activity. Probably the dialog should be shown only after the initial settings check with login data and stuff has been done.
Manager.title: restore dialog after manual restore

Manager.description: Is it possible to use a different layout when the device is in landscape mode? The dialog is a bit to high on my HTC Legend then (the "finished" button text gets cut somehow).
Manager.title: coordinate input dialog does not fit in landscape mode

Manager.description: Create a new custom waypoint. Its description in the cache details activity then starts with " . benutzerdefiniert", i.e. some check for an empty/blank string seems to be missing when constructing that string. (assigned to SammysHP because of his changes in that area)
Manager.title: minor fault in waypoint description

Manager.description: As of several weeks ago, it seems that we get logged out after approximately 20 minutes. This is evidenced by the positions of the caches being moved. After logging back in, it sometimes take a full minute for the caches to be moved back to their correct positions.
Manager.title: Keep getting logged out

Manager.description: Feature request: I would be good to have an option to see the list of TBs which are currently in the hands of the user and open the detail page from there. Use Case: Sometimes I want to look up the goals of the TB i currently have with me. The only possibilty is to use the search for each TB which means I first have to lookup the tracking code every time. Also in the log view the TBs are ony listed but not linked to the TB-details. On http://www.geocaching.com/my/default.aspx there is a list of the users inventory, which could be used to make a inventory list also in cgeo. This could be a new menuitem in search and there could also be a link from logview to open the listed TBs detail page.
Manager.title: View users TB-inventory

Manager.description: For some fields the spell checker (with the suggestions) should be disabled. I've now implemented this for the trackable code in the search and in the trackable logging action. Any further edit texts where this would be useful?
Manager.title: disable spell checker

Manager.description: Loop from the last page to the first one and vice versa. (See #829)
Manager.title: Use infinite scrolling for ViewPager

Manager.description: When I edit a waypoint (e.g. change its name) the view page in the details does not get updated. only after closing and re-opening the details the new waypoint name is shown.
Manager.title: Waypoints not updated

Manager.description: I would like to have an extended context menu for the waypoints in the new details: compass navigate (and sub items)
Manager.title: Extend waypoint context menu

Manager.description: While I like the new details page, I don't like the look of the page indicator at the bottom. I've now seen that this can be replaced easily using existing libraries like https://github.com/JakeWharton/Android-ViewPagerIndicator. Please install the app from https://market.android.com/details?id=com.viewpagerindicator.sample and play around with it. That's quite a difference to what we currently have. I'm not exactly sure how our indicator should look like, but I think, one of the samples of that app with the underline style might match our current theming and style quite well. Comments from your side?
Manager.title: use different viewpagerindicator

Manager.description: If nobody is working on it, I can manage the strings-it.xml if, OK for you, is there any text format convention I must use? ISO8859-1?
Manager.title: Italian translation: I can do it

Manager.description: I have seen a strange thing, which is hard to describe (NB 3011): If I have the live-map activated and click on a random cache it shows e.g. in the german version Typ Traditional-Cache (Unbekannter Typ) If I switch cgeo to english (incl. restart) I see in the same situation: Type Traditional-Cache (Unbekannter Typ) That leads to the following questions: Why is this prompt always in german ? Why is it "Unbekannter Typ" because that is the prompt for an unknown cache-type not the size, which is normally displayed there. I am quite sure, that in older versions the size information was available in live map. At the moment it is only available, if the cache details have already been loaded (and thus stored) before
Manager.title: CacheSize and CacheType: refactor null-checks
Application crashes after clicking to one of trackables

Manager.description: Currently we are using a lot of built-in icons from Android (e.g. android.R.drawable.ic_menu_agenda). The problem is, that they are sometimes very colorful and change from Android version to version. I'd suggest to import them from the Gingerbread-branch.
Manager.title: Import Android icons

Manager.description: When adding a waypoint to a cache there is a possibility to add current/my coordinates. I would like to have a button to copy original coordinates from the cache into the new waypoint.
Manager.title: Copy cache coords to waypoint

Manager.description: What's our strategy on updating libraries? commons-lang3 has a new released version since some days, to which we could update. My personal opinion is to always update to the latest version of any included library, because that typically has less bugs for the features which were already in the old version (and which we may therefore use).
Manager.title: library update strategy?

Manager.description: In Live-Map-mode I can use "show as list" and I can save the caches to the "default"-list. I can't directly save caches to an other list. I can't even move caches, that are already saved on the phone! I always have to go "saved" to move caches around. :( Even in detail-mode, there is no way to put the cache to a specific list. I alway have to go to the list and have to move it from there. With 500 caches in a list, it is REALLY hard to find the specific cache again, when you memory is as old as mine :) Please make it possible to move a (already saved) cache to specific list.
Manager.title: Moving caches to other lists

Manager.description: Currently only few TBs fit one one page on the new TB-page. I have seen that a quite big font is used and there is one free line before and after the TB-name. Would it be possible to use a little smaller font or remove the empty lines so that more TB fit one one screen without scrolling. Of course it should not get so small that users can not easily tap it, but right now its a really big section for each TB.
Manager.title: Reduce font-size for TB-view in new ViewPager

Manager.description: The logs view of the cache details view has a progress indicator. In the emulator, I can always see that indicator in the middle of the view. On my device, there is no progress indicator. If I'm fast enough when opening the cache, I always have just a black screen and suddenly the logs are there.
Manager.title: no progress indicator when loading logs

Manager.description: With NB0412 - db47d7d I have no text in the new bottom line after opening a cache from livemap or nearby list. Only after sliding the first time the text is shown. Opening a cache from saved list is normal.
Manager.title: No text in ViewPager after opening cache from LiveMap or Nearby list

I do not see my finds, and the coords are fuzzy by 20-30 metres. Every so often, when I do a login check, I see my AVATAR as well as the OK. Then the live map shows my finds, and the coords are OK. The login check is unreliable. My unit is an HTC Wildfire using Android 2.2.1

While driving around in my car I noticed, that the OC-caches disappear well before the iconr eached the edge of the map. I used the horizontal-mode not the landscape-mode, so it will not be most likely not linked to #279. After manually adjusting the map a little towards the OC-cache they appear again. The GC-caches display is OK all the time. Maybe someone could have a look if the boundaries on the map for the OC-caches are the same as for GC-caches.
Manager.title: OC-caches disappear from live-map to early

Manager.description: Since we have the new cache descriptions, you get a much better overview of the cache properties. Nevertheless, I sometimes find myself sliding to the waypoints view, just to see it's empty. In contrast to the friends log view we cannot just have it hidden for caches without waypoints because otherwise that button would have to be part of the (already full) options menu. That's why I suggest to have the number of waypoints in the page title of the waypoints page. That way one can immediately see whether or not sliding into that view makes any sense. So you would know that sliding is useful here: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/267/wp6.png/ but not here: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/88/wp0k.png/ Any objections? As you can see at the screenshots the code is already available and eager to be committed. :)
Manager.title: number of waypoints in waypoint indicator

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce Update final coordinates in gc.com website Open c:geo, go to the saved caches, go to the one you just modified Press update, and wait for it to finish Press Menu, Navigate, Static maps Expected result Static map of new coordinates Actual result Static map of old coordinates Notes I'm using nightly build from this morning. Also, I tired to delete the cache, and save it again, and then, when I tried to display static maps, I get a Toast message saying it can't find them. Then, I pressed the back button, to show the list of saved caches, and the cache I just downloaded wasn't there, so I guess there is also something broken.
Manager.title: Static maps not updated

Manager.title: Waypoint sorting

Manager.description: I am beginning to feel that this problem is unique to me... I launched c:geo today after not having used ti for several days. It appeared that we were still logged in. I was having some issues getting a 3G connection, so I rebooted my phone. after that, I launched c:geo and logged in. Everything worked just fine as we found our first cache of the day. We then drove, about 10 minutes, to a second cache. When we got there, I launched c:geo and we were logged out. I know this happened because a) the locations of the caches 'jumped' and b) a nearby cache we had found no longer showed the smiley. I again logged in, and after a minute or so, the smiley reappeared. What happened next, however, was truly strange. We found the cache using the map view/google satellite. The location of the cache appeared to be within 5 meters of our location as shown in the map. However, the cache information page indicated that the cache was 30+ meters away. I then used a separate program to grab the current GPS location. Using a distance calculator showed that the GPS location was within 8 meters of the cache location. So, why did the info page indicate the distance was 30+ meters even though the location was properly displayed on the map?
Manager.title: Logout / wrong position

Manager.description: When i click on the List-Button, the Software crashes. I have the Version from 17. December, there are no Problems with it. I dont have more Information, sorry!
Manager.title: Crash in Nightly (26.12.)

Manager.description: I am not sure, whether it is intended to work in that way: Today I did GC1Z71W. This cache has 10 waypoints (Stages of a Multi Cache). For all of them I added the coordinates in c:geo as I found them. Now I updated the cache-details and found, that all my modified waypoints are again replaced by the waypoints from gc.com (with empty coordinates). I think, this should not happen as the user might loose coordinates he needs for completing a multi-cache he already started, and I am quite sure that the behavior was different in older versions ?! I am using the RC-version downloaded 23.12.2011.
Manager.title: Edited WPs are overwritten by CacheUpdate

Manager.description: For GC288FW the cache-description is in blue color. Nevertheless the readability improvement (change of background color) is not working here. For my opinion descriptions with this color should also be improved for readability by c:geo.

After upgrading the c:geo version to the newest RC (30.12. RC1) the saved waypoint have somehow multiplied (and saved as "Personal Note x") with incorrect north-coordinates.Have a look at the screenshot: None of the personal notes was there before and it should only be something like 12 or 13 waypoints but not 30.

The new feature: "waypoints from personal notes" is great, but it made 10 new waypoints, that are all just wrong and I can't delete these... Manager.description: A small glitch which becomes visible with the light skin (white background, black text): if the inventory page is available, it initially shows all list items white-on-white, so nothing is readable and only the list item dividers are drawn. After the user wipes over the list items they get painted properly and become visible. This seems to be an initial display problem.
Manager.title: Inventory Page of Cache Details Initially Shows White-on-White for Light Skin

Manager.description: At least for me the "Anywhere" screen has been completely useless until now. I once had a look at it and didn't understand why I should use it, because my caching activities and waypoint management are much easier in the other activities. Only when I now merged a contribution, I investigated that activity a bit more in the code and then finally understood it has essentially nothing to do with geocaching at all. It is a pure navigation tool, which allows either direct coordinate input or a projection relative to the current point. Maybe I'm the only one who is stupid enough to not understand this activity on first glance, but I feel that it should be reworked to make it more easy to understand. The following ideas come to my mind, and I'd appreciate feedback: Remove the activity and rely on other compass applications which will implement that much better. Remove the activity and maybe pimp the waypoint editing features (the only thing missing there is creation of a waypoint from cache coordinates, as written in another issue). Rename the activity from "Anywhere" to "Navigate" (or some other label) to indicate the pure navigation aspect. (A counter argument might be that people may then confuse it with the navigation menu in the cache activities). If bearing and distance is given, the calculated coordinate should be visible below those fields (and change directly on inputting the numbers) instead of only calculating it when invoking the navigation tools. It is completely unclear which coordinates are used if I fill both the projection input fields and also give a coordinate using the top buttons. Can we somehow show that better? The workflow of the acitivity might be easier to understand if we have an explicit button below the input fields instead of starting everything from the options menu.
Manager.title: Rework "Anywhere" screen

Manager.description: Open search Search for a trackable with a tracking-code Post a log to grab it You must enter the code again I'm not sure how difficulty it is to implement this because I never looked into the trackable code, but this would be a helpful feature.
Manager.title: Autofill trackable code

Manager.description: The refactorings for the visit-activity are missing for the trackable-log-activity.
Manager.title: "Load Logpage"-progress for trackables

Manager.description: When you write a new log for a trackable, its initial type is "Found it".
Manager.title: Default trackable-log type

Manager.description: Also the short description can contain html (with images). It should be loaded with an AsyncTask like the long description.
Manager.title: Also load short description in an AsyncTask

Manager.description: This is related to issue #375: I used to disable GPS to save battery power on bigger trails and while its relatively easy to switch it back on, c:geo takes lots of time to notice that new coordinates can be queried. I wish there would be a "query now" or "update now" button in the compass or - which would be most preferred of course - enough intelligence that c:geo picks up new coordinates much faster than it does now. Most of the time its quicker to completely force quit the app, restart it and open the last cache than to wait for it to get new coordinates...
Manager.title: Smaller wait time for proper coordinates

Manager.description: When I'm on a quick caching tour somewhere I usually look on the live map, select a few caches (thanks to the new overlay mode that displays more info on the cache without that the details have to be opened!) and save them to the local list. What I'm now missing though is a small visual indicator that I already saved a particular cache, especially in regions with many caches, so I don't accidentially click on such a cache again and try to save it.
Manager.title: Display save state in map view

Manager.description: I use the map view quite a lot to get a grasp of all available caches in an area. Especially urban areas however have many, many hotspots with hundreds if not thousands of caches. Rendering all these caches with big symbols is quite cumbersome because the labels overlap each other and don't provide the wanted information (for the search example "I look for an area with many traditionals"). On GC.com's map they have three or four zoom levels with different symbol sizes and information and IIRC only the lower two sizes are actually clickable (which is a good thing), while the other serve more of an "overview" purpose. I understand that this might not be something for people who do lots of single caches in the outback where the containers are farer away from each other, so maybe this could be something that can be switched on / off by a preference option?
Manager.title: Smaller icons in zoomed-out map view

Manager.description: I made a new RC version and decided to try it. This was the resoult. The problem is (i guess) my personal note copy-pasted from autoresponse email on of one cache. Manager.description: I recently figured out that one can switch the default view to a map view when clicking on the navigate button in the overlay / details view. Thats fine and all, I usually use GMaps Terrain for a better overview where a cache is placed, but occasionally I still use the simple compass. Now when I set any map as default view, I apparently cannot switch back to the compass view, but I can reach any map view through the compass. It would be cool if the other way would work as well...
Manager.title: Switch between map and compass

Manager.description: I have seen this issue several times, but can not clearly say, under which condition it happens: I have a list containing my solved mysteries (where I have modified coordinates on gc.com). Initially they were all correctly stored (modified coordinates as cache-coordinates + additional waypoint with original coordinates). After some days I access the list again and find that the cache-coordinates are back to the original coordinates, and only after updating the caches from web again they are OK. My first assumption was, that if the caches are loaded on live-map (which might be the case), they are somehow overwritten by the original-coordinates. However I tried to reproduce this and I can see, that the cache-icon is shown on the wrong geolocation on live-map (the original coordinates) but after this the saved version was still OK. So two questions: Is it a limit of gc.com, that the coordinates on live-map are not my modified coordinates ? Might this cause the cache-coordinates to be reverted back to original in the saved-list ? Edit: Latest NB as well as new Market Release.
Manager.title: Modified coordinates revert back to original sometimes

Manager.description: Recently i figured out there seems to be no way to open a geocache from waypoint. The usecase is as follows: After finishing a cache we were looking for another cache near our position. On the live map i had a lot of final waypoints of mystery caches. I could open the waypoint but had no knowledge about the geocache it belongs to. It would be nice to be able to change to the geocache details view from the waypoint view.
Manager.title: Open cache from waypoint

Manager.description: If c:geo is forced to English the content of the "Navigate" menu from cache-details is still shown in system language. Some time ago there was also #625 dealing with a similar problem, but it was solved/closed.
Manager.title: Forced English not working in some menus

Manager.description: Nightly 1001- 0c8fcf0 Open cache via gc-code search, cache is not saved The newest friend-log is shown in the normal logbook as first entry independently of the log-date If you save the cche and update it, the problem disappears
Manager.title: Logbook chronology not ok

Manager.description: NB 1001 - 0c8fcf0 Clicking on a non-saved cache on the live map, the popup is empty beside the cache-name. No GC-vote, No detail button, No save-button.
Manager.title: Live map popup broken

Manager.description: Search for GC2RF5 Toast-message says: "Download der Cache-Details fehlgeschlagen, wegen UNPUBLISHED_CACHE". I do not find UNPUBLISHED_CACHE as a string or as text in the strings.xml
Manager.title: Wrong prompt or missing translation

Manager.description: Consider setting targetSdkVersion in AndroidManifest.xml to 14+ (15 is current) to allow Holo theme in ICS. http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2012/01/holo-everywhere.html I tried it with my app, and It did just that, nothing else broke. If you need to test it, just send me custom apk.
Manager.title: Holo theme

Manager.description: All currently existing non GC caches are shown as unreliable. This should be changed in the GPX import or the constructor of the caches.
Manager.title: mark non GC caches as reliable

Manager.description: As pull request #921 is closed I think its suitable to open an issue for remaining problems: Stored OC-caches are always marked as not reliable (orange ring) on live map. I guess it is because the live-map can -of course- not verify the coordinates from gc.com. OC-caches should be removed from checking reliability because they are imported from PQs and should therefore be reliable in any case.
Manager.title: Stored OC-caches marked as unreliable on live-map

Manager.description: As pull request #921 is closed I think its suitable to open an issue for remaining improvements: I would suggest to replace the marker for "personal note available" by a more meaningful icon. My personal favorite would be a "small pencil". I have no experience in creating icons...so probably I can not help myself to solve it. So I just want to start the discussion and remind, that this should be done if others agree to it. Maybe there are some opensource-icons available which can be used for that ?
Manager.title: Replace note-marker by more meaningful icon

Manager.description: in cache details and in special event list mode
Manager.title: Show day of week for events

Manager.description: Steps: Search for Trackable "TB123456" c:geo produces page with Name:Trackable Item Details and Type and Owner: Unknown Geocaching.com website produces message: The Travel Bug you requested does not exist in the system. Note: Geocaching.com produces various messages based on what you search for: TBASDF -> ElementNotFound Exception: Couldn't find base element in array: S TB12345678 -> Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow.
Manager.title: c:geo doesn't handle unknown trackables

Manager.description: Steps: From a list of caches, sort by some field other than distance Click on one of the caches to view its details Click back to return to the list Problem: Cache is now sorted by distance, but if you go back to the sort menu, it will still show as sorted by the field chosen earlier.
Manager.title: Lists revert back to distance sort after viewing a cache

Manager.description: although this is implemented since several days, I'm still not used to the term standard navigation. reading it in the menu, I always have to think about what is my standard navigation. Therefore I suggest to use the name of the tool again, e.g. compass.
Manager.title: replace term standard navigation

Manager.description: Sometimes people complain about long search times when scanning for GPX files. The progress dialog in that activity should therefore explicitly explain that there is a default directory and that it did not contain GPX files, so people learn about it while waiting for the scan activity.
Manager.title: mention standard GPX directory in progress dialog

Manager.description: When offline map is selected cgeo loads OSM from internet if the selected region is not in the .map file. I think it should be better if no map is loaded from internet, if selected offline ..
Manager.title: Offline Map

Manager.description: From our facebook group: I need a button in the overview of a pq for example to send the cache directly to the device. Like the two on the rigtht site for "send to gps" and "add to tour" from the GCTour-script. I had have already a look into the script but the search nearest page is to different to the other pages....
Manager.title: send to c:geo missing in search nearest

Manager.description: A photo in a log can be without title. In that case we show an empty string as the headline above the image, which doesn't look nice. Example: GCBHV1, log of 2011-10-16
Manager.title: empty log image title

Manager.description: I would like to add some filters for special attributes in my "saved list". For example if I search for a "night cache", "bicycles allowed" or maybe "without ticks".
Manager.title: Filter for attributes

Manager.description: There are some places where we have separate translation strings for singular and plural forms. We should rework them to use quantity strings instead, which will allow better localization of the plural forms: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals
Manager.title: Use plurals

Manager.description: There are two options I would like to see. The first one is to "drop found" so I only need to store the unfound caches and do not need to go through lists of found caches when I first go out in the morning. The other option is to allow this as a filter.
Manager.title: Drop found

Manager.description: Hello, fist of all I will thank you for the great program. When I go caching I miss always one thing: I still use the map for navigation. It would be easier to read the map to be connected with the compass so that the map is rotated to the direction I have to go. Greetings, Taneller
Manager.title: Map rotation

Manager.description: After update of the gc.com website 17.01.12 the log-activity is no longer working. A toast message comes up saying that the log-page could not be loaded.
Manager.title: TB logging not possible after gc-site update

Manager.description: I thought it is a mistake in #1008 that PATTERN_TRACKABLE_ID is now a regex for the GUID (e.g. 853acd4d-5a12-4c63-9afc-55afd2cbfe0e) and not the ID (e.g. 658003). But I looked at the mocked data, it was already before the latest changes. So our trackable-id is indeed a guid. Don't know if it can cause some problems.
Manager.title: PATTERN_TRACKABLE_ID is not the id

Manager.description: If I open the stored caches, the app tries to get the new location and resorts the listitems according to that. But this takes some seconds. If I have choosen an item before this is finished and choose "delete" for a cache it can end in a wrong deleted cache, because the order changed during this process. Although the Dialog shows the right cache title for what the operation should be done. It happened some times and i don't know what cache the app removed instead.
Manager.title: Deleting an offline stored cache during relocation

Manager.description: Steps: Store some caches offline Filter the stored list, such as to just show multi-caches. Note that the bottom says "No more caches". Click on one of the caches to view it Go back to the filtered list of stored caches. Note that the bottom now says "Load more caches: currently: XX" Click to load more caches Crash There are no more caches to load because I am looking at stored caches. The problem is in the calls to setMoreCaches in cgeocaches.java. It only compares the current list of caches against the search results. It doesn't account for any filters.
Manager.title: Crash when trying to load more caches with filter applied to stored cache list

Manager.description: The id of a (navigation-)app is based on it's name (see cgeo.geocaching.apps.AbstractApp.getId()). If the name changes (regular name change, fixing a typo or translation, changing the language) the id will change too. My first idea was to use the fqdn of the class, but then any refactoring would lead into the same issue. A solution might be a new enum, containing a value per app, and we always only add values to that enum, but never remove any.
Manager.title: ID may change

Manager.description: A minor bug: After restoring the database (following a clean install of the same version) on the first access of the lists the title shows "Gespeichert" instead of "Standardliste". Only after changing the shown list the title will be correct.
Manager.title: List name wrong after restore

Manager.description: As discussed in some issues, people are asking about the calendar permissions. I'm working on a very small app (200 lines of code), which basically contains just the code for creating the calendar entry and can be invoked from the main app. There is no shared data model or anything like that, but just an intent invocation with several strings. That way we can easily decouple that use case from the main app and remove the permissions there.
Manager.title: calendar addon

Manager.description: A few times I needed an high-res icon from c:geo. It would be good if somebody can provide one. We need at least two types: with text without text And of course the icon background must be transparent. ;) PS: High-res = at least 512x512 px, but larger would be better.
Manager.title: High-res c:geo icon

Manager.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.
Manager.title: Handle missing calendar provider

Manager.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.
Manager.title: Handle missing calendar add-on

Manager.description: As we now provide an add-on, we should list it in the useful-apps-menu.
Manager.title: Add add-on to useful apps

Manager.description: From blafoo: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException. CalendarActivity, line 155. GC3B473
Manager.title: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in calendar

Manager.description: If the finish() call is removed from the onCreate method, which it must be because onCreate will continue executing while the dialog is being shown, then it must be added for positive and negative outcomes of the dialog. Steps to reproduce (after removing finish() from onCreate): View an event cache Click menu and then Add to calendar Click Back arrow Click menu again. Nothing will happen because the add on is still running, just without any window showing. Hitting back a second time will return control to c:geo. I will submit a pull request to fix this.
Manager.title: Calendar add on does not properly exit

Manager.description: For me that test fails because it expects the full 20 caches, but my settings remove one disabled/archived cache.
Manager.title: Unit test testSearchByCoords does not work correctly

Manager.description: We still have this setting, but I think it's better to remove it, because c:geo should always identify as browser. Maybe it's not even used anymore.
Manager.title: Identify c:geo as an ordinary webbrowser

Manager.description: c:geo is supporting pictures in logs already for caches..maybe this could also be applied for TB-logs ?
Manager.title: Show log-images also for TBs

Manager.description: Opening the popup from within the map the compass app is started from the action bar. This should be replaced by the default navigation application as in the other activities too.
Manager.title: Default navigation not used in cgeopopup

Manager.description: If a stored cache is refreshed from the small popup window after clicking on it in map view, it moves to the default ("Stored") list. Steps: Store some caches offline in a list other than default ("Stored") list View the offline caches on the map Click one of the caches to bring up the small description window Click "Refresh" When refresh is done, hit back to close the window and then back again to close the map Cache list will update and cache you just refreshed is no longer there. It has moved to the default ("Stored") list This does not happen if you choose to Refresh in the full Details tab.
Manager.title: Refreshing stored cache can make it move to default list

Manager.description: I have seen the following issue today with NB2301 0e9faa4 but also with older NBs: Steps: Search for caches e.g. by adress (Example: Gotenstraße Hamburg) On the result list click the map-icon (upper right) to map the search-result On the map all the caches are shown as unreliable although they are online requested in the search. Only after opening the detail for a cache, returning to the search result and displaying the map again the specific cache is shown as reliable. Is there no possibility to check the reliability in the search or is the check just missing ?
Manager.title: Reliable check in search result

Manager.description: example: TB26KHF
Manager.title: links in TB log don't work

Manager.description: As mentioned in #1033 the not working links in TB-logs are also an issue for cache-logs: Example GC2Y6EQ , I attached a GCVote link to my log from 24.01.2012.
Manager.title: Links in cache-logs not working

Manager.description: From a friend: I tried to use the search function on the top of the homescreen to log TBs I have found. The help-app says, this should work. However it seems only to be working if you use the public identifier of the TB but not with the secret code printed on the TB. This makes this special function quite useless, as usually I don't have the public code when I find a TB and try to log. It would save some clicks if I could just use the secret-code in search from the homescreen.
Manager.title: TB-seach from homescreen not possible with secret code

Manager.description: I just tried out c:geo NB with a basic member account. If I have seen it correctly all the caches on live-map (except the caches stored on the device) will appear with non-reliable marker. I know, that the reliability can only be checked if the user is PM. Assuming that this functionality will go to the market, I guess that many basic-member users will not understand why the caches are marked as unreliable and will probably not like this feature or even don't trust the app anymore. The change to look-and-feel is to drastic. In fact in most cases the caches shown to basic-members will have reliable coordinates anyway, but we just cant detect that right now. I hope, that I understood the the working-mode of the reliable-check, if not please correct me and/or close this issue. After having seen the look-and-feel for basic-members I would like to suggest to think over the display of reliability in the following way: For premium members only mark unreliable by a orange-circle and reliable without marker (like currently implemented) For basic members only mark reliable by a green-circle and unreliable without marker Doing it in this way each type of user would only get notified by a marker in important cases on his user-perspective and not be overwhelmed by a lot of caches marked in some way. What do you think ?
Manager.title: Working mode of unreliable marker

Manager.description: While I started working on the preference activity, I found that we can avoid several issues there by first doing a refactoring of the existing settings, related to 2 points: We don't use the standard location to save the preferences, which makes it unnecessarily hard to get some things running at all (like the preference manager of the preferenceActivity). We sometimes use integer types for boolean preferences. As the preference activity expects boolean values for boolean preferences, this might lead to real problems. I have no clue whether it can deal with wrong data types or just looses the values when reading the preferences. Therefore I will first do a refactoring which cleans those 2 issues. Additionally it might be a good idea to externalize the preference key names into a String resource, because then we can access the names from code and from the preference activity XML declaration without duplication.
Manager.title: use standard preferences location, use right preference types, externalize preference keys

Manager.description: Imagine there are several similar caches located in a small area. All are saved in a list, but the names are long with a appending number. So they are hard to distinguish. On the map started from the list all look also the same because they are of the same type. Now during the cache tour every cache is logged offline as found (or DNF) and in the list they are marked. But on the map they look still similar. It would be an improvement to "mark" them also on the map. Maybe an overlay or a slightly changed color could do it.
Manager.title: Change icon in map for caches with offline log

Manager.description: It should be possible to give custom waypoints also a type attribute. For a cache with only custom waypoints for parking, stages and final they are all displayed just as waypoint. At the map the waypoint could then also have the icon for parking or final.
Manager.title: Define types for custom waypoints

Manager.description: Imagine "some" solved unknown caches that are displayed on the map together with it's final waypoints. Because the finals don't have to be close to the cache it's hard to know what final waypoint belongs to which cache. A connection in the map between cache and waypoint could be a good way to show they belong together. Making the connections visible / invisible from the menu would be helpful too.
Manager.title: Connector between cache and final waypoint in map

Manager.description: When the Navigate menu is selected, the compass is displayed without being chosen. (My Default Navigation is set to Map) Steps: Open a list of caches (can be Stored or Nearby) Long press a cache to open the menu Select Navigate About the same time the menu is displayed, the compass will show up. Hitting back takes you back to the Navigate menu where you can then select something other than Compass. I thought this might have been due to refactoring by Bananeweizen in 9b0459d, but the previous commit has the same problem.
Manager.title: Compass starts without being chosen

Manager.description: Steps: Select Nearby from the main screen Long press on one of the caches in the list (that you have not looked at recently) Select either your default navigation or Navigate There is a delay before anything happens If I'm looking at the list and I select to show on the map via button in the top right, it is instant. So, the coordinates are already known. There should not be a delay when choosing to navigate to the cache. I haven't looked at the code, but it seems that it is either retrieving more information from the website or doing some other slow operation.
Manager.title: Delay when navigating to a cache in Nearby

Manager.description: The inventory will Not full Display. Please look http://coord.info/GC2W3FD over 70 Tackables but Display 20. thank you.
Manager.title: inventory Not full display

Manager.description: Friends log is shown although no login data is given in settings. just testing in mediamarkt...
Manager.title: friends log without login

Manager.description: Although there is no gps and no network licalization avalable. status line still shows "lokalisierung".
Manager.title: near search icon enabled

Manager.description: In pull request #1035 there seems to be a minor bug: OC-caches stored in lists used to be shown on the live map. Now I can see that they just "flash" for a short time if I move the live map to an area with stored OC-caches and then disappear. Can someone confirm this ?
Manager.title: OC-caches no longer shown on live map

Manager.description: What about the following time schedule for our second release in 2012: developing of "new" features till 05.02.2012 (more than a week) My last new feature for this release would be the further optimisation of the database access (see Live Map) What about you @SammysHP @Bananeweizen ? testing a complete week untill 12.02.2012 In this week we should only commit bugfixes, translations etc. but no new pull requests. Remarks ?
Manager.title: Time schedule for Release 2/2012 ?!

Manager.description: I got an email to support saying something like. It it possible to just download images when caches are imported from GPX and not refresh all cache details. I made a PQs myself to test this thing out. If image is attached to a cache (like spoiler) there is no reference in GPX If image is displayed in cache there is a reference in GPX and we ca download it (with some yet unimplementef feature) What do you think?
Manager.title: Download images with PQ import

Manager.description: Since NB from 26.01. it appeared to me, that the logbook-page of stored cache are no longer available. Only after updating the cache, its available again but after a while (or restart of the app, or some other action) the logbook is again no longer shown in cache-details. Right now I can find a way to reproduce it but I am quite sure its a new issue in the nightly from yesterday (26.01.).
Manager.title: Logbook,WPs,Inventory not shown

Manager.description: With the developer version on my mobile I get crashes in the live map after some seconds.
