Manager.title: Crash in map

Manager.description: The orange markers indicating offline-logs are not visible in all lists.
Manager.title: Missing offline-markers in lists

Manager.description: The date and time of logs are missing in the history list. The second line for each cache is the same as in other lists.
Manager.title: Offline-Logs are not handled in list-refresh / general bug in list-refresh

Manager.description: At least in he history list the order stays the same.
Manager.title: Repeated offline logs don't refresh logdate

Manager.description: As discussed in #1044, having an alert builder for the sub menu items of the navigation menu encapsulates the logic of the navigation menu much better and isolates the menu code from the code of the activities where it is used. There might be only one drawback I can currently imagine: Menus of an alert builder might potentially be rendered differently than menus of a context menu. Has anyone ever experienced something like that or can even prove that all those different menu items are rendered the same (Android documentation or the like?)
Manager.title: use alert builder for navigation sub menu items

Manager.description: Found in NB2801 221e215 Search e.g. by location In the results click on map icon or select menu Show on map Result: Map is shown but with some other location (probably the last used location or current position) I guess, this is also related to the other issues starting with NB2601 ?!
Manager.title: Map location from search not working

Manager.description: When doing update of already saved offline cache, is it really necessary to download photos again? It's problem especially with caches which requires to post photo with the log, like earth caches. The result is downloading a lot of photos, which takes a lot of time. But the photos are already downloaded once, so why download all of them again and again?
Manager.title: Downloading photo gallery

Manager.description: Sometimes the search by address can give more results than expected, e.g. searching for "Steinbach" which exists multiple times in Germany. Several of those addresses are shown completely identical, e.g. "Steinbach, Germany". It would be nice to have some further differentiation between those addresses. As there are in fact no more additional details in the address returned by the geocoder, we can probably only add current distance and maybe geographic direction (e.g. "123 km SW").
Manager.title: more details on results when searching by address

Manager.description: When I set "Corrected Coordinates" for a cache on the geocaching.com-website, c:geo can import it and display the cache with the new coordinates on the map. But when I store the cache, c:geo drops these new coordinates after some time (I guess 1-2 days) and replace it by the original ones. As workaround I have to refresh the cache shortly beforce I want to look for it. These bug exists at least for the last 2 versions (including the version "2012-01-04") on Nexus S.
Manager.title: cgeo drops corrected coordinates

Manager.description: I nearly always log offline and then use the PC afterwards for logging. For that use case it would be quite comfortable if the second line of the history list entries would not only contain date and time, but also the geocode, so you can more easily search the logged caches online (without opening each of those caches).
Manager.title: show geocode in history

Manager.description: As found after implementation of pull request #1051: In older versions the location information had a "darkened" background like the main menu items. In the current versions the location-info line as well as the login-info do not have any background. As I am using a light background I can not see the information clearly anymore.
Manager.title: Background missing for location and visual login

Manager.description: As mentioned in pull request #1051: The find count on the homescreen seems to be always 0 after the feature has been implemented.
Manager.title: Visual login is not showing find-count

Manager.description: From the Live Map view, some caches are failing to be stored for offline, and fail to download when 'more details' button is clicked. (a specific example is GC36EMW). Other caches in the area which are not 'Premium Member Only' are fine. Sometimes no error is shown when the cache has failed to store, the most specific information a message has given is 'communication error'. These caches also seem to temporarily disappear sometimes as the map moves and zooms. Full details of these caches can be viewed on geocaching.com.
Manager.title: Live map - Premium Member Only cache details not available

Manager.description: Today I went caching with NB3101 7fba2c2 and have seen the following issue reproducibly: I started Live Map and the caches are shown normal after (very short :-) ) loading time. When driving around (with my car) the map starts to scroll and at some point of course an update is performed. At the start of this reload (indicated by the progress indicator in the upper right) all caches disappear some seconds (depending on the network speed) until the reload is completed. After that the caches are again shown normal.
Manager.title: Live map caches "flashing"

Manager.description: According to Lineflyers comments in issue #290 the navigation menu should only provide static maps button for stored caches. I will change this myself.
Manager.title: Static maps only for stored caches
Better models and ORM

Manager.description: In the latest NB after refreshing a cache the WPs created from Personal Notes are visible in the WP-Tab. After closing and Restart from cgeo the WPs are gone.
Manager.title: WPs created from Personal Notes not saved

Manager.description: On the Map there is a Marker for Caches with changed Coords (red flag). It would be nice to have also a marker in the listview of caches.
Manager.title: Marker for changed Coords in Cachelist

Manager.description: In the latest release notes you can find "fix: incorrect handling of GeoKrety trackables" - what does that mean ?
Manager.title: fix: incorrect handling of GeoKrety trackables

Manager.description: In nightly builds, since a few days, when you refresh caches, waypoints disappear. In fact, they are only hidden, because if you add an extra WP, all missing WP becomes visible again.
Manager.title: Refresh a cache hide waypoints

Manager.description: Just a minor thing: If you start c:geo after a fresh installation you will be directed to the user settings to enter your gc.com login. If you continue in the settings-menu and also restore an existing DB-backup while in this menu and go back to main menu, still the prompt appears telling you that the DB is empty and a backup is available.
Manager.title: Restore DB prompt although already restored

Manager.description: On yesterdays caching trip with NB0302 I had some problems with the offline-logging. I stored some offline logs (just typed a few words and pressed back). The toast message "Log saved" was shown. After that the following things appeared somehow randomly among the caches: The orange marker was not shown for all caches where I saved a log but for some it worked. If I deleted the offline log the orange-marker stays in the list for all caches where I have tried that After accessing the offline-log again (back in my warm car) and sending the log it gets marked green+orange in the list I assume its related to the latest changes, but I wanted to create a separate issue to test if it is fixed after the problems are solved.
Manager.title: Offline marker in lists not reliable

Manager.description: Hi, can you add hint to details window? Now it is located in Description window and it is not optimal... you have to move between windows and hint is located below the long text so you must scroll down long time... it is uncomfortable... You should add hint to details windows too... It would be great! Sorry for my bad english :) Thank you
Manager.title: HINT shown in details window

Manager.description: Show size of cache in compass windows would be nice feature... For example the sice indicator known from geocaching.com.
Manager.title: Show size of cache in compass windows

Manager.description: I encounter a strange behaviour with my self created cgeo with issue#285 label. When changing to details from list view the Cache seems not to be loaded fully including waypoints and logs. After I just added a waypoint (in offline mode) the cache seems to be loaded and all waypoints and log entries are there. So far I don't know if this is an issue, already fixed or appears according to CacheCache issue changes. Please check this.
Manager.title: Missing CacheDetails

Manager.description: This issue should collect all current refactoring requests for StaticMapsProvider. So far collected: [DONE] use thread pool of size=1, only one download thread [DONE] provide isStaticMapExisting(geocode) [DONE] provide isStaticMapExisting(geocode, waypointId) [DONE] only download if http response code shows success (200, others?) [DONE] show info dialog if download is blocked (code 403) after 1000 tries [DONE] create test class for StaticMapsProvider [DONE] move code to load images from StaticMapsActivity to StaticMapsProvider [DONE] extract guessDisplaySize to DisplayHelper class [DONE] don't download static maps in UI thread use IAbstractActivity instead of activity for better testing provide message handler extract GoogleStaticMapsProvider, keep StaticMapsProvider as the proxy create alternative StaticMapsProvider used according to settings only download new maps if coords change download maps ordered by priority preview first (1) then cache highest zoom level (2) then WP highest zoom level (3) cache next zoom level (4) a.s.o. add a download status page for static maps? Comments? Additional requests?
Manager.title: Refactoring StaticMapsProvider

Manager.description: With the NB0902 83b215a there is a change in the progress window: If you load cache-details (from live map or from search result) the progress window is always showing "Store for Offline" as last prompt before the details are opened. I guess it is because it is stored in the cache-cache. But as the cache is not really stored for offline-use I suggest to avoid showing this prompt.
Manager.title: Cache-Detail loading always showing "Save for Offline"

Manager.description: When creating a new waypoint the input field for the direction is already using the keyboard with numeric layout but the input field for distance is using the alphanumeric keyboard. The input method for the distance should also be the numeric keyboard for easy usage.
Manager.title: Numeric input method for distance in waypoint creation

Manager.description: Steps in NB0902 - 83b215a : Search for a cache not opened/stored before Open the details The preview-map is not available (red cross) Select "Store" Try opening the static maps The map window is showing five maps with red cross
Manager.title: Recognize StaticMaps-API limit for map download

Manager.description: While out caching with the latest build I noticed that no images will load. I get the red x for everything (images in description, spoiler images, images in logs). I just confirmed that Market version works fine. Anyone else have this problem?
Manager.title: All images load as red x

Manager.description: When on the search page and the menu button is hit a search own caches option appears. However, if the user has selected that they want to hide their own and found caches in the main options menu, this search returns nothing making it completely useless. To get this to work, the user has to disable that main option first before going to make this search.
Manager.title: Ignore settings when searching for own caches

Manager.description: Thousands are separated with . or , and currently clipped. Instead of 1,234 only 1 is displayed.
Manager.title: Find count cannot handle values over 999 again

Manager.description: Settings: Hide found caches Store a cache offline, that you've found (or log it as found) Open live map. Not found caches are displayed, included offline stored ones. Menu --> disable live. Now only offline stored caches are displayed, but found caches, too. This is absolutely ok, if you display a list of offline stored caches. They are displayed there, too (but with a refactoring of the filters it would be good, if they are also hidden there, but that's another issue). But the live-map should behave like in live-mode.
Manager.title: Offline stored found caches not hidden if live-mode disabled

Manager.description: On Android 3.0 and higher, the options menu is considered to always be open when menu items are presented in the action bar. When an event occurs and you want to perform a menu update, you must call invalidateOptionsMenu() to request that the system call onPrepareOptionsMenu(). There are some cases where we modify the menu (e.g. after updating a cache in the details-view).
Manager.title: onPrepareOptionsMenu() for Android 3+

Manager.description: Please add import from Geoget software database file (db3). (Import of 140 MB GPX file crashes and falls. Not finish. CGeo is unstable.)
Manager.title: Import from Geoget database

Manager.description: Can you add the shortcut to your own caches on the main page when you start cgeo? IT would be awesome, because I often check my caches over the mobile while I am on the holiday or away from home...
Manager.title: Shortcut to own caches on the main page

Manager.description: This issue is I think somehow related to #716. If I just continuously zoom out on live-map the behaviour is the following: At some zoom-level (I think depending on the number of caches or a limit from gc.com) no new caches will be shown but the caches from the last zoom-level stays on the map If you zoom out e.g. showing whole europe the icons start flickering and reloading is performed for a very long time (according to the progress indicator) With the "old map" AFAIR the caches just disappeared at some point when zooming out and no more loading was done. The current behavior looks somehow different and I don't know if this might cause high traffic to gc.com ?! A side-issue for this: If I zoom in again to a high zoom-level afterwards and scroll through the map, it won't load caches anymore. It behaves like offline (not trying to load from gc.com) Only If I switch off the update and on again, the caches are loaded.
Manager.title: New live map behavior when zooming out/in

Manager.description: It would be nice to import querys direct from Geochaching.com
Manager.title: Import querys direct from Geochaching.com

Manager.description: We have now two 'Spinners' (drop-down selectors) in c:geo (map source selection, waypoint type) and may get a third (units selection for projection). Currently these are in standard style. We should adapt them to our theme. I started this already for the waypoint type, but as this got quite involved I choose to make it a separate issue.
Manager.title: Better styled spinners

Manager.description: I found two problems when editing waypoints, but i believe they are related to each other. I found this in the emulator. Don't know if it's easy to reproduce on a real device. The location is set to Longitude 13,8 and Latitude 51,3. When creating a new waypoint from current location in format DDD° MM.MMM the initial displayed value (grey text) is "N 51 18.000" and "E 013 48.000" (without °). But when opening the popup to edit the coordinates the north value is displayed as "N 51° 17.1000" ! (18.000 == 17.1000?) Create a new waypoint. The proposed value (from current location is X) Then click to change the coordinates to another value Y, press "Done" but not Save. Change the value again and the popup to edit the coordinates is initialized with value X (and not Y as expected).
Manager.title: Problem on editing waypoint coordinates

Manager.description: The Greasemonkey script part of send2cgeo needs to be adapted to the new map and afterwards be put onto the server.
Manager.title: adapt send2cgeo script to new map

Manager.description: From other user: User modified coordinates are not updated on refresh with the current nightly. The coordinates are changed to the listing-coords and the modified-flag is removed.
Manager.title: Modified coordinates not recognized

Manager.description: every time i try to use live map now i get this message. it started occurring yesterday or early today. it occurs at any resolution and will only display caches if there are some stored and then only for a second and then they disappear. confirmed with a friend and my wife that they can reproduce
Manager.title: Live Map : Since c:geo is unable to download only partial data, coordinates of caches could be inaccurate

Manager.description: I'm running c:geo 04.01.2012 on Android 2.1 update 1 and the live map is not working as expected. When I load the live map, the throbber appears, then on cache icon with the [1] in the title but as soon as the loading finishes, they all disappear with the toast about partial data and inaccurate locations. Panning around the map will occasionally make another cache icon appear then disappear in the same way. This still occurs after an uninstall and reinstall from the market and re-entering my geocaching.com login details.
Manager.title: Caches disappear from the live map after loading

Manager.description: Does enyone have time to disable live map and put a small notice on Release branch?
Manager.title: Live map notice

Manager.description: First thanks for turning this nightly build out so quick after Groundspeaks mapping regression. The live map does grab and show up caches for the area now. However, it doesn't appear to know which caches a user has already found. About 1/2 of my smilies aren't showing up on caches that I've already found. Maybe it's now looking at the logs to determine this. When I click on them and look at the logs for ones that I've already found, the data is several months old. I've also tried setting it to 'exclude my own and found caches' it still shows those that I have found that didn't have a smiley as one would expect. Thanks and keep up the good work.
Manager.title: Nighly Build - 16.02.2012 - d53b445 - Live Map Issues

Manager.description: Hi, I open an active map and it says: "Since c:geo is able to download only partial data, coordiantes of caches could be innacurate." It started 2 days ago. I do not know what happen. Can you tell me how to solve it? Thank you very much. Linda Gabriela
Manager.title: Caches disappear and do not longer show up on map

Manager.description: HTML in the hint is not shown correctly. Example: GC28GDQ
Manager.title: Hint can contain HTML

Manager.description: I recently started geocaching, and have been using C:geo and really enjoy the program. However, I've ran into a problem. I used the app on my Droid X2 for about 2 weeks and recently it started giving me an error: "Since c:geo is able to download only partial data, coordinates of caches could be inaccurate". I've reinstalled it and that still didn't fix this. Worked fine for a few weeks..but just started giving me this error. It only shows the caches I have on my watch list for about 1 second..then they disappear and I can't pull up any caches on the Live map. Any answers would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Bryan
Manager.title: No data being sent to my device.

Manager.description: This one is from email... So i noticed a new issue on the app. The settings that I've set up is to have maps as the default map source to make it easy to navigate. When I am in a cache detail page and want to view the cache on the map I hit menu and default navigation to open google map to view the location on the map. All I get is a blank map with no cache location. Ok no problem I go back into the setting and change the default map back to radar and go back to a cache detail page. I then click menu and navigation then map to load google maps. I then am able to see the cache location. Kinda weird that it is viewable in one setting but not the other. Thanks for the great app.
Manager.title: Default navigation and map

Manager.description: Hi Using Dolphin browser V7.3.0 Android 1.1 on Viewsonic Viewpad7 Dolphin default browser, probably no other browser installed, I can't find any other browser. From Geocaching.com website, from a geocache site page exporting to gpx.( Premium member) (I did 3 sites) Then importing to c:geo Open Stored icon > Menu > Import GPX it searches everywhere, over 10,000 files it finds 3 .gpx files Selecting any file, ERROR BOX Import failed File format not OK Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX1.1: could not parse XML
Manager.title: Import failed GPX1.1: could not parse XML
Control statements as blocks

Manager.description: I experience this error when clicking on owner of a trackable OR current location of a trackable. 02-18 15:41:01.392 E/AndroidRuntime(17609): java.lang.ClassCastException: android.widget.TextView 02-18 15:41:01.392 E/AndroidRuntime(17609): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeotrackable.onCreateContextMenu(cgeotrackable.java:338) 02-18 15:41:01.392 E/AndroidRuntime(17609): at android.view.View.createContextMenu(View.java:4429)
Manager.title: ClassCastException for trackables

Manager.description: This is not always reproduceable. I think it depends on if cache is in CacheCache or DB, etc. Steps: View a cache that has trackables View one of the trackables Click on the "Spotted in" to search for the cache (in this case it will be the same cache we are already viewing) Sometimes you can get IllegalArgumentException (geocode must not be empty) from cgData.loadCache I was never able to reproduce this if I started off by searching for a trackable (vice starting off in a cache). I was able to cause it several times in a row with one cache and then it started working fine. 02-20 11:35:53.617: W/dalvikvm(2227): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception Manager.description: If you open a waypoint from LiveMap (NB2102) and then press remove, then you get the following exeption: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: geocode must not be empty at cgeo.geocaching.CacheCache.removeCacheFromCache(CacheCache.java:42) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.removeCaches(cgData.java:3027) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.removeCache(cgData.java:3009) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.removeCache(cgeoapplication.java:536) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeowaypoint$deleteWaypointListener.onClick(cgeowaypoint.java:316)
Manager.title: Exception when removing waypoint from LiveMap

Manager.description: As already mentioned in the initial disscussion of #868 most users not only have one preferred navigation tool. It's the same for me and i was looking for a solution that doesn't pollute the menus nor the action bar, but enables fast access to a second navigation tool. My proposal is to add a second preference for such a second tool. Just a short text explaining how to access it and a spinner to choose the tool like for the first one. Access to the tool is only available via long click at the action bar navigation icon wherever it exists. Currently this will be in the cache details, cache popup (from map) and the waypoint activity. I guess this will improve the navigation handling a lot. What do you think about it? The code is almost complete and i can provide it soon so you can have a look at it and maybe give it a try ...
Manager.title: Improve default navigation to support a second tool

Manager.description: If you click on a cache or waypoint on the map and change it (adding/removing/changing waypoints) the map is not updated when the cache/waypoint is closed. A manual refresh is also not available (?)
Manager.title: Map is not refreshed when coming back from Editing a waypoint or cache

Manager.description: The QR code scanner only works with strings that start with http://coord.info/. It does not work if you scan a QR code that is just a GC code or a TB code. The error presented if I scan just a geocode is "Didn't find any geocode in the scan result." At the very least, the error message should be changed to explain that only scanning http://coord.info/ links will work. I think the best behavior would be to show what was scanned along with the error message. I found a cache today that had a QR code so I scanned it (thinking it would load information about the cache). I just kept getting error messages from c:geo. I finally used my phone's barcode scanner and determined the QR code was just for http://www.geocaching.com I don't want to turn c:geo into a full QR code scanner, but it needs to be clearer what the program is doing and why it might not be working (after all, you usually have no idea what a QR code says when you are scanning it).
Manager.title: QR code scanner only excepts one input type

Manager.description: Over support email: Thanks for the great and very useful app. I was wondering whether you might consider adding the static maps as a screen next to the log screen. In other words, screen 1 is waypoints, screen 2 is the cache details, screen 3 is the screen description, screen 4 is the log screen, and screen 5 would be static maps if you downloaded them, or if you haven't, a button to download. cheers
Manager.title: Static maps "tab"

Manager.description: On offline map (stored, show on map) in popup, "more details" and "drop" are really close together. Drop should ask "are you sure"? Caching 4h of walk from nearest GSM signal and if you press "drop" in a long walk there.
Manager.title: Ask before drop

Manager.description: geocode usage in cgeowaypoint is inconsistent. On one hand is can be given as an extra, on the other hand it can be taken from the waypoint object.
Manager.title: Refactor cgeowaypoint, usage of geocode

Manager.description: The filter for cache size shows 8 entries, the last of them is named "unknown error". I think there should be only 7 choices for size, the eigth is obsolete.
Manager.title: Size filter shows an entry "Unknown error"

Manager.description: Load e.g. Mystery and save in c:geo Correct Coordinate on gc.com Refresh Cache in c:geo WP for old coordinate is created but coordinate in detail view are the old. Same if owner change coordinate for cache. On Galaxy Nexus with 4.0.2 with NB 22.02.2012
Manager.title: Cache Coordinate don't renew

Manager.description: As a cache owner it is possible to let a cache have another visible owner name than the real user name. Cgeo cannot currently open details for the cache owner in this case. Look at my cache GC15593 for an example. Clicking on the user name will open a menu, but it is not displaying the real user name. When I wrote this feature for about a year ago I introduced "ownerReal" in cgCache. This variable was given value from the link "other caches hidden" below the cache description.
Manager.title: Can't open owner details of cache when different name is used

Manager.description: Hi, this is my first issue, I hope it will help. In the Nightly build (a221f3a) if you try to open the live map but without internet connection the app crashes. Greats
Manager.title: live map + no internet crash

Manager.description: I do have an archived cache (GC389ZY) in my list. If I map that list, the archived cache can't be distinguished from active caches in the map.
Manager.title: Archived caches shown as active on map

Manager.description: I'm just thinkg about the use case for the captcha setting. is it useful for PMs ? Shouldn't it not be hidden for PMs ? shouldn't it not always be enabled for non-PMs ? Is there a scenario where it is senseful that the setting is disabled ?
Manager.title: Captcha setting

Manager.description: If a user has a 'last listid' that is no longer valid (e.g. after a database restore) c:geo crashes when accessing the stored caches. No chance to switch to an exising listid. Only cure is to remove and reinstall c:geo
Manager.title: Crash with invalid listid

Manager.description: Requesting the needed informations in the Live Map takes somes seconds. It is not clear/visible to the user when the requests are finished esp. in case of an error. If no caches are shown: are the requests still outgoing ? Or are there just no caches around ? With the start of searchByViewport() i'd like to start the indicator, with the return i'd stop it. My idea is to use an counter because there can be more than one call to searchByViewport() at the same time.
Manager.title: Progress indicator in Live Map

Manager.description: After playing around with the new live map in NB2402 - a221f3a I see some strange behaviour in the interaction with already stored or cached (opened before) caches. Right now I have no clear view but here are some occurences I have seen: Caches (with ?) on livemap are sometimes shown reliable (no orange marker) This may depend if the cache has been opened before but I could not clearly reproduce this Icons in my stored caches list are replaced by ? after having them viewed once on the live map. Only after opening the cache from the list the icon is shown again afterwards in the list. Found marker in lists gets lost after the certain cache has been viewed on the live map. Only after opening the cache from the list the found-marker is shown again afterwards in the list. Stored caches with personal note available, and final coordinates set are sometimes shown as ?-caches on the live map but with marker for note and final (and also on the final position).
Manager.title: Merging of stored/cached caches with Live Map

Manager.description: The popup after clicking on a cache in live-map is sometimes very small so that scrolling is needed to access all information. I guess this is caused by a combination of a short cache-name and the fact, that the section "Save for Offline" is missing.
Manager.title: Live map popup formatting

Manager.description: In Trackable view: Click on a cache name (either current location or one in the log) If the cache has already been viewed once then cgeo will crash. I have not got any useful log.
Manager.title: Re-opening cache from trackable will kill cgeo

Manager.description: Now that we have the possibility to translate several fields of a cache, it would also be nice to invoke arbitrary apps with those texts (maybe a different translation app, the mail app, ...). Therefore we should have another menu item in that context menu of text fields similar to the "Send to" menu of the cache itself (using "text/plain" as mime type in this case).
Manager.title: "Send to" for the text fields in cache details

Manager.description: Reported by a colleague and I can reproduce it with NB2602: In GC3BFQB the cache-description contains a single image only but nothing else. In cgeo it shows up empty and no link to the picture.
Manager.title: Picture in cache-description not shown

Manager.description: Hi, I guess I found a new bug, on the aplication. I will explcain who it ocures: I use cgeo on municipality A, with data and gps enabled; Turn off cgeo; I go on road trip to municipality B, (like 200kms betwin A and B); Once in B I turn on the GPS and start cgeo. Open live map, it shows me municipality A, I just think: "Yeah, GPS is not fix yet. Gonna wait a little bit." A few minutes later GPS fixes position (the status bar icon stops blinking) The live map jumps to a municipality C, I was like, wtf?!?! Wait a little but, nothing, the only thing who's work was the accelerometer. Turn cgeo, turn on again, in the first page it show me "municipality A" and the map still on A too. Turn data On, nothing changes. Close cgeo again, and now with data and GPS ON (but not fixed yet), the municipality and map go to B. (where I was) I guess my issue is a bit long and probably messy (like my english) please ask me if you don't understand something. Greats
Manager.title: Live map + gps position + data

Manager.description: Currently the address selection (when multiple addresses match a search term) is a view constructed from multiple buttons. This should be a standard Android list activity.
Manager.title: address selection as real ListActivity

Manager.description: The finalDefined flag is not persisted correctly. To reproduce: Store an unmodified cache (without GC edited coordinates) for offline use. Add a final waypoint. -> Cache is shown with flag in cache list, everything ok. Close and kill c:geo (a simple close is not enough to get rid of the process in memory). Restart and open the list containing the cache -> Flag is gone, finalDefined=false. Open cache details, go back -> Flag is there, finalDefined=true. To my understanding the reason is the following: The flag is set when a waypoint is added. Therefore it is correct after adding a final waypoint or after loading all waypoints from the database. But the flag (which was set on adding a waypoint) never gets stored, because the cache itself does not get stored after adding a waypoint. Therefore it is not correct after running a new c:geo instance, where only the cache details without waypoints have been loaded. A possible solution would be to store the cache after modifying waypoints but that may have other bad side effects (like data usage when caching in the wild).
Manager.title: finalDefined not correctly stored/initialized

Manager.description: Currently this new feature is only used for the action bar. For intuitive use it should also be available on long click in the cachedetail menu and maybe also represented by another icon in the background. I like this feature because I use radar and map equally but I almost never use the actionbar to start the activity but the menu.
Manager.title: Second navigation method also for long click in menu

Manager.description: Would be nice, if it would be possible to sort a list by the logging-state. For example good for offline-logs, to easy find the logged caches. Maybe two-step sorting: first by state, second by time? Thanks
Manager.title: Sort by logging-state

Manager.description: This feature would allow non premium users to generate "PQs" inside c:geo. GPX files could be used to import caches to other PDAs.
Manager.title: Export stored caches as GPX

Manager.description: If you run a search for caches, then all caches which are already stored on your device should have "Offline" in the line with the small cache attributes. This got lost somehow.
Manager.title: offline marker missing in online search cache list

Manager.description: Edit: Update title to match the remaining issue With NB2802 - b2d7a2b I had the following problem: Some caches (not all) I have already found where not marked with the smiley-icon on the live map. When clicking on the icon the popup shows it as "Found", so the information seems to be available but not used in the live-map. It is not reproducible, meaning if I open the live-map again the situation changes or even the problem disappears. The rate is approx. 1 out of 30 for me which is not marked.
Manager.title: Found caches not hidden for basic members

Manager.description: Steps: Go to History list Select some items (by entering select mode or sliding right) Go to Options / Manage / Remove from history A progress indicator will be displayed, but never updates When the progress indicator goes away, the list is the same as before Closing and reopening will show the updated list
Manager.title: History list item removal doesn't update progress or list

Manager.description: Since a while I have a phone with Android 2.3.6 which allows enabling/disabling GPS very easily from the status bar. I now have it disabled by default (so Facebook and other apps can not track my position), but always forget to activate it for c:geo and then wonder why the position is not updated. We really need to have a check in the tool whether or not GPS is enabled (at least when entering the map) and to notify the user or to activate it by ourselfes then. Not sure if there are duplicates for this, I didn't find one with the quick search.
Manager.title: check GPS enabled state

Manager.description: With end of February the server for the Osmarender (Tiles@Home) layer of OpenStreetMap was switched off. http://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tilesathome/2012-February/006707.html
Manager.title: Remove Osmarender Map Layer

Manager.description: As of today evening the live map parsing failed completely for me. The key format was changed from 'x_y' to (apparently) '(x,y)' Can someone verify this?
Manager.title: Live map - key format changed

Manager.description: I am providing a screenshot. The sort mode is set as "distance". I am using CyanogenMod 7.1 and latest c:geo. https://p.twimg.com/Am_BADKCAAAbSYM.png:large Thanks so much!
Manager.title: Nearby caches: mixed units and not sorted by distance

Manager.description: This evening I experienced another change in the live map grid data. The now the real gc-codes are present there...
Manager.title: Live map: Grid JSON now containes real GC codes

Manager.description: Issue #1122 brought up a fix for the send2cgeo button on the new map. But this updated script hasn't been published on the web page yet. I've noted that a discussion has been started how to automate the distribution of script updates in issue #1136 . But that discussions hasn't come to an end yet. Therefore I suggest that - for the time being - the script is uploaded to the web page and users are informed (manually, e.g. website, facebook, ...) that they should update the script. This should bring them the functionality back again.
Manager.title: Upload Send2cgeo 0.25 script to website

Manager.description: c:geo version 16.02.2012 device: Sony Xperia Play Android 2.3.4 When I try to log a found cache and add a signature date and time are added just fine. Only the number stays empty. My template looks like this: '# [NUMBER] added a starting quote only here to avoid some formatting [DATE] [TIME] Is there a setting / config file where I have to fill in the starting number ? because I already found 80+ caches before using c:geo I already tried: Add number manually, number stays empty Add date manually: works (for the date) Add signature automatically: everything except number was added Googled, found some older issues, no solution FAQ: nothing about [number] Changed profile settings at Geocache.com (changed language dutch / english) maybe because "gevonden" / "found it" which as I understand triggers the number + 1 : no result Log online / offline: number stays empty Tried a template without the "#" at the beginning (start remark in some scripts) update c:geo to version 16.02.2012
Manager.title: [number] in signature stays empty

Manager.description: Our detection of the member state does not handle the above string. I'm not sure whether this only occurs for people, where the membership is about to expire (like me) or also for those where it already expired.
Manager.title: "Renew Your Membership!" not handled

Manager.description: The action bar shows icons for caches and also for trackables. But those of the trackables are so small that they are hard to recognize. We should replace them with icons that have a similar size like the cache icons.
Manager.title: Bigger title bar icons for trackables

Manager.description: In NB0403 I can see the following: Open live-map and wait till loading is finished (progress indicator gone) Click on a cache, the popup appears Use "back"-key to close the popup You will see (at least acc. to the progress indicator) that a reload is done As the map has not been moved a refresh/reload is unnecessary.
Manager.title: After closing map-popup a reload is triggered

Manager.description: Hi! When I'm searching for my own caches by using Search->Menu->Find my caches and the option to hide my caches and found caches is on, the result is always empty. When explicitely searching for my caches I expect them to show up, even when the settings say otherwise. Regards, Oliver Hanappi
Manager.title: Searching for my caches results in empty list when option to hide my caches is turned on

Manager.description: With NB0503 - 12e87a9 I have seen the following twice up to now but not reproducible: A cache is loaded at the outer range of the live-map (with unknown cache-type at first) I move in to this location and the live-map is refreshed At the end I have two icons representing the same cache: The unknown icon stays, the correct icon on the reliable coordinates is still shown besides it. If I click on one of them, the exact same information is shown in the popup (including the correct cache-type) Please see this example where the unknown-icon and the mystery-icon actually are the same caches. As you see also after zooming in and refreshing by moving the map the problem stays. The problem disappeared after closing and reopening the app. I don't know if closing and reopening the map solves it (did not try).
Manager.title: Doubled caches on live-map

There is now an API for accessing the calendar. http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/calendar-provider.html Trying it in 4.0 gives following partial stack trace: 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): no such column: displayName: , while compiling: SELECT _id, displayName FROM Calendars WHERE (selected=1) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: displayName: , while compiling: SELECT _id, displayName FROM Calendars WHERE (selected=1) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.database.DatabaseUtils.readExceptionFromParcel(DatabaseUtils.java:179) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.database.DatabaseUtils.readExceptionFromParcel(DatabaseUtils.java:135) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.content.ContentProviderProxy.query(ContentProviderNative.java:358) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.content.ContentResolver.query(ContentResolver.java:311) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.app.Activity.managedQuery(Activity.java:1706) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at cgeo.calendar.CalendarActivity.selectCalendarForAdding(CalendarActivity.java:82) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at cgeo.calendar.CalendarActivity.onCreate(CalendarActivity.java:53)

Manager.description: While not logged in I tried to load (by entering geocode) an event cache which had been archived. I received this: I was not able to reproduce it, so I think it was a one-time error on gc.com.
Manager.title: Fail to handle error on gc.com

Manager.description: I know, there are bigger problems now, but is it possible to add Bing Maps' Bird View to the Live Map, cause Google Maps is very bad at my hometown.
Manager.title: Bing Maps in LIveMap

Manager.description: This test fails for me and I have no clue why. I get a search result with coordinates even though I am not logged in (sign in box and link in page). So the test fails as the coordinates are reliable. How is this working out for the others?
Manager.title: Test fails for me: cgeoApplicationTest.testSearchByViewportNotLoggedIn

Manager.description: On my Asus Transformer (Android 4.0.3) the MicroSD is mounted at /Removable/MicroSD/. Also Locus stores the vector maps at this location (Removable/MicroSD/Locus/mapsVector). If I scan for offline maps in c:geo settings it does not find *.map files located in this directory and I have to manually input the path.
Manager.title: Offline-map search does not scan all locations

Manager.description: Only a . and in log: D/cgeo(935): HtmlImage.getDrawable: Failed to obtain image
Manager.title: Inline-log-images not loading

Manager.description: In case the user deletes his modified coords on the website for a cache already stored on the device the coordinates are reverted correctly but the originally created WP "Original coordinates" is now useless (as it is the same the cache-coords now). It could be deleted in this case (e.g. if the coords of the WP are identical to the cache-coords).
Manager.title: WP "Original coordinates" not removed

Manager.description: Hello today I had the following problem If I add a Waypoint over the menu and save it the next time I edit it the point can't be save and he is automatic deleting from list. If the Waypoint is from Listing there is a duplicate for every edit. I hope your guys are understand what I mean. Timo aka BudBundi
Manager.title: Waypoints are defect

Manager.description: When clicking on a cache, it doesn't load the type and coordinates of it anymore. I think it was like that before.
Manager.title: Detailed by clicking on cache on LiveMap

Manager.description: Should we be aware of large data objects going over mobile connections e.g. 10 MB images? Refresh would download it again. Furthermore the user is not aware of it.
Manager.title: Special handling for large data transfer?

Manager.description: my c:geo version is 03.01 RC2, running on a Samsung Galaxy SII with Gingerbread 2.3.3 When I select "Import GPX" from the Import menu c:geo scans my complete SD card (actually both cards because the SII has internal storage which gets mounted as "sd" card and place for an second card as well). Scanning all that storage takes 5-10 minutes. I'd like to set the directory c:geo looks into for PQ's, usually I am pretty well aware where I (actually, the dropsync client) put my PQs on the SD card.
Manager.title: Configurable directory for "Import GPX"

Manager.description: The title of the strategy selection list is currently not localized ("Live Map strategy")
Manager.title: Localize strategy menu title

Manager.description: I'm confused by our database code. Sometimes it uses transactions, sometimes not. I cannot really see a pattern there and therefore don't understand it. I always thought that if we only issue one database command (and therefore have nothing else which might get into an inconsistent state), then it is not necessary to wrap this in a transaction. Therefore I would go and remove transaction support in methods like clearSearchedDestinations(), just as there is already no transaction in dropList(). Does someone else have more insights? The Android documentation is quite thin here...
Manager.title: When to use transactions?

Manager.description: After you tapped a cache on the new live map to see its name or other details, the tiles for the current viewport are reloaded completely, although the viewport did not change at all. If we release that, we cause to much traffic at the GC servers.
Manager.title: tiles are reloaded after every popup

Manager.description: We actually have two problems with changed (updated) caches in the Live Map: After getting "better" details from searchByViewport() caches are displayed twice in the Live Map (that's issue #1232) Caches are not updated with new data after going to the details page.
Manager.title: Update of caches in the Live Map

Manager.description: With NB1103 I have seen a lot of "jumping" cache-icons (marked as reliable all the time) on the live map. To that time I used the "speed dependent" strategy, which seemed to cause it. On the start I was not moving so the map was filled with the nearby search, then I started driving and the cache positions started "jumping". Trying to reproduce this, I found the following way: Use "detailed" strategy to populate the map You will get the reliable results from the nearby search (as PM) Change the strategy to "fast" and force update of the map (e.g. by moving a little) Result: Some of the reliable icons may change their position on the map (to a wrong position) Result of nearby search (coords verified with website): Result after update with fast-mode (the multi has moved to a wrong position) :
Manager.title: Merge between nearby search and map results faulty

Manager.description: With NB1103 I have seen some caches having a strange icon. Unfortunately again this is not reproducible. I don't know whether this is a problem with the icon overlay itself or maybe there is another cache-icon for the same cache below it. If this are two cache-icons it is just the problem mentioned in #1232. What do you think ? Please refer to the screenshot, with one multi and one mystery with a half-smile:
Manager.title: Icon overlay in live map not shown complete

Manager.description: A feedback of some friends who are using the nightly builds: I import a lot of gpx-files with quite high amount of caches (sometimes up to 500). The import is OK with the new version but it takes ages because it downloads static-maps which I use only rarely. I would like a setting to switch it off for gpx-import to save time. If I switch off the general setting for static-maps I can also not use them for all other caches and I am also not asked whether I want to download them on access. I think a lot of users will run into this "problem" and in addition the Map-API will give up after 1000 requests (which is easy to reach already with 200 caches also containing some waypoints). Therefore I would suggest to have a separate setting for static map loading while importing a gpx.
Manager.title: Setting for static map download on gpx-import

Manager.description: During live-map operation (fast strategy) I had some caches (all not stored and unreliable) where I got the message 'c:geo konnte den Cache nicht finden.' (or something similar) if I clicked them. This was reproducible for the specific caches as long as the map was open. After closing the map and reopening it was back to normal.
Manager.title: Click on cache in map results in 'Cache not found'

Manager.description: Version: 11.03.2012 I'm using the light skin. When scrolling the Logbook and Friends Logbook, the background turns black and I cannot see the text.
Manager.title: Light skin goes black when scrolling

Manager.description: From Bonemaro. Steps: Go to History view Long press on an entry and select Drop or Move to Other List NPE occurs when the code tries to refresh the list (after drop or move completed) Crash is from cgeocaches.switchListById because app.getList return a null list. I think the fix can just be check for null list and return if present. We don't actually need to reload the history list as dropping a cache or moving to another list doesn't affect the history list. (On a side note, it might be confusing because the user is not actually dropping from history list or moving from history list, but I like the functionality present there as it allows easily taking action on all caches you have found)
Manager.title: NPE crash in History view on Drop or Move

Manager.description: Hello, Is possible to implement some option for exporting caches (from Stored) to Locus? I know I can send them to Locus using Menu-Show on map-Locus. But it doesn't save them to Locus' database so it's not possible to use some features for them (such as downloading map around caches or displaying 161 m circles)... I found that if I cachange last parameter in DisplayData.sendData function (AbstractLocusApp.java, line 81) to true, Locus asks for saving caches - that's exactly what I need. So it'll be great if you'd add something like Menu-Show on map-Export to Locus. It wouldn't be that difficult, wouldn't it? Thank you! BTW I asked author of Locus about saving these temporary caches and he replied me it would be very complicated and easiest way is to ask you for implementing this straight to c:geo.
Manager.title: Exporting caches to Locus

Manager.description: This was working but has stopped again. Any ideas how to fix it? I like this option. Thanks
Manager.title: [NUMBER] not working in Signature

Manager.description: As mentioned in #1273 I still think that the query for the live-map is done for a much higher area than actually needed to fill the viewport. Maybe I understood something wrong, but if this can be limited somehow it would be Easier do to the PNG-parsing as the zoomlevel for map-requests could be higher Limit the loading time Here is my example: Starting the live-map with all default after clean install I get the following result: (Look at the title bar 32/403): If I zoom out you will see that the initial request covers a much too huge area:
Manager.title: Map request vs. viewport

Manager.description: I have noticed that added waypoints never seem to go away. Steps: Store a cache Add waypoints to it Drop the cache (it moves to list ID 0) Wait at least 3 days without accessing that cache (so that the it drops from the database) View the cache again The waypoints are still there While this could be considered a feature, it means the waypoints database just gets bigger and bigger (and probably logs, images, trackable, etc too). I think the problem is in clean function in cgData. It is the one the removes the caches after 3 days. It is using RemoveFlag.REMOVE_CACHE which looks to me that it only removes it from the cache cache and not the database. I believe it should be REMOVE_DB. Can anyone second check this?
Manager.title: Faulty DB Clean?

Manager.description: Using NB1703. We were driving on the freeway (~100km/h). This speed was reported correctly at the bottom of the main-screen. When entering LiveMap and selecting speed-dependent-strategy then (and maybe for other strategies as well) the speed is displayed in the title-bar. The speed displayed in title bar was ~25-30km/h. It feels like this is rather m/s, maybe a multiply by 3.6 is missing?
Manager.title: Speed in LiveMap title is incorrect

Manager.description: According to https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent.html#putExtra(java.lang.String,%20android.os.Parcelable[]), the extra key parameters must be prefixed by the package name. We should define and use constants such as public static final String EXTRA_WAYPOINT = "cgeo.geocaching.intent.extra.WAYPOINT"; (or even go through a constant factoring "cgeo.geocaching.intent.extra.") instead of using "waypoint" as in editIntent.putExtra("waypoint", waypoint.getId());
Manager.title: Use qualified names as extra keys

Manager.description: Steps: Load a cache (from search or stored) View cache on map (I am using Google maps, but should not matter) Note that [1] is shown in title bar Move the map around so that the cache gets near edge of screen As you keep moving map around, the count will keep increasing each time cache is reloaded I'm not sure that the cache should be continually reloaded from DB, but that is a different issue. The problem is from the introduction of LRUList in 771dc28 by @blafoo. Previously, a set was used so when CGeoMap line 1154 calls caches.addAll(search.getCachesFromSearchResult(LoadFlags.LOAD_WAYPOINTS)); it prevented duplicates from being added. But, LRUList is based on ArrayList which does not handle duplicates. I'm not sure if best method is to make LRUList based on set or clear caches before calling addAll (which might introduce other problems - I haven't looked).
Manager.title: Moving map continually increases cache count (not live map)

Manager.description: test case work offline enter the stored cache list hit "search" button on device then insert a cache name (just copy a word from a description in list) the search result is "no caches found" same test case with gcxxxx name it works
Manager.title: offline stored search doesn't look for descriptions

Manager.description: Version 0.3.0 is out! Changelog: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/wiki/Changelog Download: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/downloads/list At least all users must update their map files because the format has changed. This resulted already in some problems because user tried the new version and got errors.
Manager.title: Update mapsforge library

Manager.description: When the static maps creation is cancelled, the progress dialog vanishes and one can work again normally, but in the background the download of static maps continues, as can be seen in catlog. MIght be related to #1270 or #1287.
Manager.title: cancelling static maps creation does not work

Manager.description: When I try to open my own unpublished cache then the app crashes
Manager.title: Crash while opening an unpublished cache

Manager.description: Today with NB2003 - 7212666 I had this problem: I was driving on the autobahn with the live map open (speed dependent) and suddenly I got this picture. It stayed all the time and the progress indicator was loading endlessly. It might be, that I had some problem with the internet connection to that time. The app was still responsive and I was able to move around the map. Also my position and trail was updated normal but no new caches shown anymore. Maybe its some problem with the mapsforge map ? I happened to me only this single time and is not reproducible.
Manager.title: Map rendering stopped and graphics cut off

Manager.description: If I import any GPX-file I always get this kind of progess window. In this example the PQ contained 262 caches, so I don't understand the meaning of the numbers. I am quite sure, that I mentioned this somewhere already but I can not find it anymore so I open this issue.
Manager.title: Strange progress indicator on GPX-import

Manager.description: I found a bug, but I don't know exactly how to reproduce it. It happened often enough to discover a few symptoms. Here's what I did: I had a multi-type cache stored on c:geo (http://coord.info/GC2TDT1) I modified the cache coordinates on www.geocaching.com and sent it to send2cgeo On the phone I chose Import -> from web, the cache downloaded again Reference point with original coordinates were added - that was good Original coordinates stayed the same, modified coordinates WERE NOT stored. Only after refreshing the cache a few times, the modified coordinates finally showed up. Maybe it's somehow related when requests for static maps get blocked by google, after you make too many requests, but I don't think that's the case. Anyhow, sometimes it seems that the refresh or re-download operation fails, so modified coords are not recognized. I almost went for a walk in the totally wrong direction, but I suspected something was wrong. Any ideas?
Manager.title: Bug when refresing caches with modified coordinates

Manager.description: Hello! I just recently tried to download some offline maps as described in the faq. Meaning I followed the link to the mapsforge site, downloaded a pre-made *..map and placed it in a folder (named /Maps). Autosearch worked fine, and I clicked in the menu on "OSM:offline". However, when actually offline, no maps show up (everything works in online mode). No error message is printed. I checked the region of the map, the region of the cache I want to display and also downloaded other map files, but cannot figure out the source of the problem. Is there anything else I can report for tracking down this issue? Greetings, Puray
Manager.title: OpenStreetMap / Offline Maps do not show up.

Manager.description: If I load some cache and then I use "Store for Offline" from menu, cache already stored aren't refreshed. I can verify it entering in a cache details and reading how much time occurred from the last refresh. I've version 16.02.2012.
Manager.title: "Store for Offline" doesn't refresh cache already stored

Manager.description: I can't get the nightly build version running (tested 2303), I get a FC as soon as I click on any button, only "About" is working. I saw you have done a lot of good work, but I can't enjoy it :( Android 1.6 running on Archos 5 Internet Tablet Latest known c:geo version running is the current market version (04.01.2012).
Manager.title: Got FC with latest build version

Manager.description: If I e.g. use the http://coord.info/... link to open a cache in c:geo I sometimes but not always experience that c:geo is started and downloads the cache details (progress window shown) and instead of displaying the cache afterwards exits with "c:geo konnte diesen Cache nicht finden". Also from the app gcwatch (with AFAIK uses the GUID to address the cache) the same happens. If I try again with the same link the cache is displayed immediately (no loading) without problems. So it seems downloading is OK but it does not manage to open the detail-view. This behavior started somewhere mid of 03/2012 and is still there with NB2303/RC version. My example: http://coord.info/GC18BDH
Manager.title: Link to cache fails to open on first attempt

Manager.description: With PullRequst #1318 I added a call progress.cancel() on cancel StaticMaps download after GPXImport. That causes a second dialog showing the amount of caches imported. Will go for it on Sunday, today I have guest at home.
Manager.title: Two dialogs on GPXImporter when canceling StaticMaps

Manager.description: Issue can be reproduces by: opening a multi-cache that contains mutliple waypoint-entries with coordinates (e.g. http://coord.info/GC1TH7Y) selecting Navigate-Map from the waypoints screen change orientation of the device In the changed orientation, only the Icon of the main cache will be displayed, the other waypoints disappeared. Imho a minor issue, as selecting a specific waypoint and displaying on the map works as expected.
Manager.title: Waypoints on map disappear when moving map or switching orientation

Manager.description: I have seen several posts on FB stating that after installing the RC-version the hiding of found caches does not always work although the relevant setting-option is active. Here is an example: There's a switch Exclude found and own which I have checked. Not all caches that I have found but the most of the caches that I have found still show up with the smiley. I have gone into these caches and they were logged by me. When I first look at the screen they are not there but a few seconds later (about 10) they show up. I notice as i zoom in or out is when this happens. Hope this helps. I can not reproduce this by myself. Is it possible that this problem appears when upgrading from market-version to RC-version only for some reason ?
Manager.title: Hiding of found caches on live-map not always working

Manager.description: I noticed a very annoying bug on my HTC Desire S device. Every time c:geo loses focus, e.g. switched to another app or the phone lock due to manual lock or display timeout, I need to relaunch c:geo. This can be done either by "relaunching" the app or by holding the home button and select c:geo. In the latter c.geo display the last displayed activity. In the former c:geo goes back to its dashboard and I have to reopen the page displayed before. This is very annoying. I expect c:geo to display exactly the activity which has been active before screen lock or app switching. Seems to affect all versions, current markt, rc and nightly.
Manager.title: c:geo does not remember last activity on relaunch

Manager.description: For the case of the preview map being this large red cross, it would be really nice to have a context menu to just refresh that preview map.I know I can refresh the compete cache, but sometimes my data rate may be so bad that this is much easier and faster...
Manager.title: Context menu to refresh preview map

Manager.description: Today while collecting solved mysteries with the newest RC I have seen the following problem: I stored caches on my list containing modified coords from the website. The stored cache information is correct (WP for original coords, cache at modified coords). When I map the location or open the live map the cache is sometimes shown at the original coords instead of the modified coords. I suspect it is an issue with merging the data coming from the map with the offline data from the DB.
Manager.title: Cache not always shown at modified coords

Manager.description: One aspect that I still get a lot of static code analysis warnings for is our use of unbuffered IO. We often do not wrap streams or readers into their buffered version. On normal Java applications this should basically always be done to improve performance. Does anyone have more insight on how this relates to Android? I did not find any good article on that.
Manager.title: buffered io?

Manager.description: When using the "fast" strategy in Live Map, found caches show up even though displaying found caches is disabled in the options. To reproduce: Open live map. Select menu->strategy->fast Go to area where you have found caches. Desired outcome: Found caches do not show up. Actual outcome: Found caches are displayed. UPDATE: Observed on c:geo version: Market version 02.04.2012. Android version: 4.0.3 (ICSSGS RC4.2) Phone: Samsung Galaxy S GT-I9000.
Manager.title: Found caches show up in Live Map

Manager.description: After running the Live Map for a while, all caches show up as unknown (grey with two question marks) or Mystery (blue box with white question mark on).
Manager.title: Live map mixes up Traditional and Mystery caches.

Manager.description: Currently c:geo defaults to the DD/MM/YYYY date format when displaying cache info and logs. It would be better if it did one of the following (sorted by descending desirability): Use the geocaching.com date format. Use the system date format. Offer a configuration option for date format. C:geo already knows the user's geocaching.com selected date format (otherwise it would not be able to parse log dates), so it would be a trivial change to use the same date format for formatting date output as well.
Manager.title: Custom date formats

Manager.description: With the availability of NFC chips to new phones as well as the cheap cost of NFC tags, it would be cool to enable cache owners to add an NFC tag which can be scanned to log the find. Functionally this would work very similar to the QR code scanning currently supported - but more passive.
Manager.title: Support NFC tag-based logging

Manager.description: With the current market release more details when opening a cache popup are only requested if the cache type is unknown. From my point of view it would be an improvement also to request the data if the popup is opened for caches which already have a parsed cache type icon, because: It will deliver the D/T rating and cache size It will deliver the favorite points (but currently this is not used for the popup anyway) We would be able to confirm or correct the cache type (if parsing went wrong) Let's say you are using the live map to look for an appropriate cache to go for, then this information would be very useful and it will probably be faster than having to download every cache.
Manager.title: Also request more details in popup for known cache types

Manager.description: And a new time-schedule issue :-) What about the next releases... I suggest to close the old milestone (and thus remove the flag from the issues) and create two new milestones to sort the issues: Bugfix release Next normal release Bugfix would then be everything which can be fixed easily or high-prio issues with the goal to release it in 3-4 weeks. What do you think ? Edit: Have just seen that master and release have been synced now (so I removed one passage of my posting).
Manager.title: Time schedule

Manager.description: Under http://www.cgeo.org/cgeo.apk there is still the version from January 2012. It should be updated as some users don't have access or don't want to have access to the market.
Manager.title: Update download link on cgeo.org

Manager.description: Hi. Am i the only one unable to see the long descriptions with today's update? I've tried several caches, and only the short description appears in c:geo, rendering it unusable for most of them. I've tried to erase the caches, reload them, load new caches that were not in my stored list: unsuccessful. Running HC 3.1 on a rooted Acer Iconia Tab A500 if that matters.
Manager.title: Long descriptions not displayed?

Manager.title: Default Setting for StaticMaps should be OFF

Manager.description: Sometimes after updating the c:geo app, the live map "resets" its location to the same place in between Göttingen and Erfurt in Germany. I live in Denmark and have never been anywhere near this location - with or without my phone. I have never done any searches in the area or imported pocket queries within that area. It has also happened upon other occations. I have not noted exactly which events cause this. If this is essential to locating the bug, I will try to be more observant of when exactly this bug occurs.
Manager.title: Live map defaults to (same) location in Germany

Manager.description: (This is a fork of another issue into a feature request. See: cgeo#1368 for details.) As described in the abovementioned issue, the initialization of the live map behaves differently depending on whether you use Google Maps or OSM. Google Maps defaults to the last known (or viewed) position, whereas OSM defaults to some map-default location, somewhere in the middle of Germany. The map initialization should, in my opinion be (in order of relevance): If "center map on current location" is activated and the location service has a fix, fix the map there (if the preference is on, but there is no fix, proceed - the map will relocate once fix has been obtained) If the location service is off, the "center map on current location" is not selected or the location service has not yet obtained a fix on location, use the following, in the order selected by the user in a user settings: Last known position (persists from last time used - skip if live map has never used before) Home location (user setting - skip if none set) If all of the above fails, let library use its default value.
Manager.title: Live map initialization

Manager.description: I'll add an export package like the package for navigation apps. For implementations I'll rewrite the fieldnotes-export (also with upload capability) and add a (primitive) GPX exporter. This will fix/improve/affect following issues: #1206, #569, #583, maybe #529
Manager.title: Generic Export and Implementations

Manager.description: I remember the discussion about the cache list. Yesterday I tried to move a cache from one list to another. A tap opened the context menu, but in the background the list sort order changed because of my position. This results in the wrong item moved to a different list. We should do context menu actions just by the GC-Code. Is this possible?
Manager.title: Cachelist context menu action on wrong cache

Manager.description: I need a method to send multipart POST requests (to upload files) like Network.postRequest(). It's too bad that Android does not have a good http client library (and don't say that the Apache HTTP Client is a good library, also some parts are missing). I'll be very glad if somebody can help me and implement such a method in the Network-class.
Manager.title: HTTP Multipart POST implementation required

Manager.description: Is there a developer IRC channel available or are there plans that such a channel is established?
Manager.title: IRC channel availability

Manager.description: One thing, I always wanted to ask for, is this "heading line" on the map between the current position and the target position (cache, waypoint). I'd find that very helpful. In fact, this is one of the very few features of the official app, I'm missing in c:geo.
Manager.title: Heading line

Manager.description: Edit Lineflyer: Changed topic to match the issue Hi! I have downloaded a cache and on the live map it is shown with the organge ring. But after viewing the cache's details and navigate to the cache it is still orange. This makes absolutely no sense. I can't find an option to navigate to the exact coordinates! Thanks!
Manager.title: Updating stored caches from popup won't set them as reliable

Manager.description: Hi! I have downloaded the 0.2.4 version from the mapsforge archive. Everytime I enter the map (e.g. from a cache) c:geo crashes.
Manager.title: c:geo crashes after entering OSM: Offline map

Manager.description: From email: Hello, There were some functions working in the previous revisions, which are not working now (02.04.2012 revision). Issue: updating stored cache lists not working properly. Start program - Stored - (a stored list of caches opens) - Menu - Manage - Refresh All. It supposingly refreshes the stored list. If I logged my cache as "found" using my PC computer, this function used to add a green vertical line next to the cache name and add a "smiley". Now it does not do it. It does not update the cache status to "found", either. It refreshes the logs, but that's it. Start program - Stored - (a stored list of caches opens) - Menu - Select mode - (selecting a few caches) - Menu - Manage - Refresh selected. Same story as above. No green line, no "smiley", no "found" status on the cache main description page. However, after entering ("clicking on") the stored cache main page and hitting the "refresh" button, the cache status is updated to "found" and after leaving back to the stored list, the green line is back and the "smiley" (on the map) as well at this cache only. Please, fix.
Manager.title: Refresh does not show "green line"

Manager.description: Reading over the changes for the unpersonal speech in one of the last commits, I found that we sometimes refer to "mobile" in the UI texts. As c:geo can also be used on tablets and other Android devices, it might be nice to rework those strings to refer to "device" or a similar term instead. Any suggestions beside "device" (german: "Gerät")? And more precisely, better to use "this device" or "the device"?
Manager.title: use broader term than "mobile" in UI

Manager.description: If a Waypoint creat by use and some Text is sored in note (last field in editor) it is save correct ant show correct, but when edit this Waypoint again ne note lost formating e.g. save A=1/n B=2/n C=3 /n is new line then it is load in editor as A=1 B=2 C=2 This is bad if the layout is needed
Manager.title: Waypoint Note edit defect

Manager.description: its my opinion as I use cgeo to plan out my hides using red circles and feel that the circles around events should be dashed like waypoints instead of red as events are temporary and don't interfere with placement of permanent caches
Manager.title: Red Circles around Event Caches

Manager.description: Currently embedded images for logs are loaded via internet. This results in a short freeze/delay after switching to the description page. Smileys are the only possible images that are allowed in logs. We should look for a free smiley pack and replace online referenced images in logs with them.
Manager.title: Use offline images for smileys in logs

Manager.description: Some people already told me, that the icons overlays (pencil, disk, etc.) look blurred and/or are too large. On my SGS II with Android 2.3 everything looks fine, however today I had the chance to have a look on a Galaxy Nexus S running on ICS and there is a problem indeed. (Market version 02.04.12) This is how it looks like on the Galaxy Nexus S (bad quality pic because I took a photo of the screen): This is how it looks on my SGS II:

Manager.description: add the possibility to update cachelogs only of a stored cache, instead the whole cache. useful for premium caches, if the user isn't premium atm.

Manager.description: When not connected, a NPE occurs when opening the live map in the searchByViewport code. The bitmap is not checked for null before its size is checked.

Manager.description: IIRC this bug was fixed some months ago, but now it is back again. When you open a not stored cache and store it with the button from the detail activity, the data is downloaded again. It should use the already downloaded data.

Manager.description: If a map view is restarted after having been removed from memory and the map provider has changed, the location and zoom information are lost because they are not stored in the Bundle. Also, if a map restart is needed because the map provider changed, this information must be transmitted to the new map through the Intent starting it.
Manager.title: Map position is not always saved

Manager.description: Some weeks ago I installed an OSM map to save some traffic. I had the feeling that it does not work correctly, but did not check that. When I investigated today I realized that I was correct. I switched data network off on my phone and no maps were loaded.

Manager.description: I can no longer load the list of stored caches (I am running revision 7a00578): E/AndroidRuntime(18924): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: coords must not be null E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.loadBatchOfStoredGeocodes(cgData.java:2598) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.getBatchOfStoredCaches$4ebae73a(cgeoapplication.java:295) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByStored(cgBase.java:1344) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$LoadByOfflineThread.run(cgeocaches.java:1507) W/ActivityManager( 206): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeocaches W/ActivityManager( 206): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeo
