Manager.description: Hi, I don't know, if this was already here (I couldn't find it) but I would really appreciate, if you would to build in a function/button for refreshing all caches on the Live map: The Problem: I have stored a aprox. 1 year ago all caches few kilometers around the place I live. in this time, some of them didn't exist anymore, or the stored ones have and old logbook. now I need to Refresh them all, but I don't want to refresh them one-by-one. I have here aprox. 300 cashes around and it would be very time consuming. It would be great, if I have a button, and all the cashes on the Live map screen would be refreshed. I think this isn't a big deal to build in this function. What do you think ? Sorry for my english :)
Manager.title: Refresh all caches on live map

Manager.description: I currently have every cache within a 10 mile radius stored in my device but when I open live map they are acting like caches not store and also like first time info being pull they are displaying as grey ?? with orange circles http://www.flickr.com/photos/60422826@N02/6943505096 is this a database bug where the db (.cgeo) on sdcard needs to be wiped out and start fresh http://www.flickr.com/photos/60422826@N02/6943510692
Manager.title: Stored caches not acting as stored caches

Manager.description: This evening, CGParserTest has been failing me when ran as part of the full testsuite, but passes individually. For at least one of the caches, assertEquals(expected.isFound(), actual.isFound()); fails. I have not investigated further, and would be interested in other reports before doing so.
Manager.title: Non-deterministic test CGParserTest

Manager.description: While working on the mapsforge 0.3.0 switch and the integration of backwards-compatibility support for mapsforge 0.2.4 I asked myself if it is really worth the effort. One thing is, that due to the derivation-based API even more code needs to be duplicated to support 0.2.4 and 0.3.0 in parallel (and maintained in duplication). The other thing is, that I would assume that the most people have no problem with just downloading the up-to-date map from mapsforge, especially when they actively get notified that the mapfile is invalid for the current mapsforge version. I'd like to get your thoughts on this before proceeding with implementing support for both versions.
Manager.title: Feedback wanted: Do we need to continue support for mapsforge 0.2.4

Manager.description: Last week I got the chance to introduce c:geo to three new users. All of them tried at first to close the live map popup by clicking on the map in the background instead of pushing the back button. It seems that this is the most intuitive way on a touchscreen. Therefore it would be good if both operations could be supported to close the popup.
Manager.title: Allow close of popup by click on map

Manager.description: If you add a cache to your watchlist from the cache details activity, it will be put in your watchlist on the server and displayed as such on your device. However, if you go back to the cache list activity and reenter the cache details activity for the same cache, it will say that your cache is not in your watchlist while it is.
Manager.title: Watchlist state toggling not recorded

Manager.description: Sitting in the sun I just noticed that in selection mode the cache descriptions get darker compared to non selection mode.they are nearly unreadable in the sun.I suggest to have the font stay as is when entering selection mode.
Manager.title: Font color in selection mode

Manager.description: Since some weeks in the NBs the popup from live map is closed right after selecting "Save". (It seems the saving is now done in the background). Thats quite OK, because it does not block the app during the cache download. However the icon of the cache to be saved is not updated afterwards. It stays marked unreliable, does not "jump" to the precise coordinates and the disk-overlay is not shown. You have to close and reopen or reload the map to make the change visible. @rsudev: That's the issue I talked about on IRC some days ago.
Manager.title: Save from popup does not update icon

Manager.description: I made a PQ of 1000 caches and imported them. All of them are showing in the stored-list, but some are missing from the stored-map. The same situation with my wifes phone (SGS2).
Manager.title: Some of stored caches not showing in map

Manager.description: Currently when adding waypoint "name" if before "type". When you start typing a name "Sta" Autocomplete offers "stages of multi-cache", however type stays Reference point. My idea is to move "type" before "Name" and when user changes type and name is still empty the name be filled with default text. What do you think?
Manager.title: Change name of waypoint in relation to a type

Manager.description: A nice enhancement would be to get the name of the waypoint (if there) instead automatically naming them "Personal note X". wp1: N 49° 6.707 E 009° 13.829 final= N 50° 6.808 E 009° 13.829 Format could be Name:coords or Name=coords or Name coords. In cGCache.parseWaypointsFromNote, the regex could become something like this \b([^\s]\s[:=])?([nNsS]{1})\s*\d and name could be retrieved from group 1, coords from group 2. if no group1 then default name could be used.
Manager.title: Retrieve waypoint 's name from personal note

Manager.description: offline stored cache open details log offline --> select "log cache" in menu write text, log online toast says that everything is ok cache not labeled as "found" (details and list), no log in log page kill process doesn't help refresh cache from details --> labeled as "found" and log in log page Didn't try to reproduce yet.
Manager.title: Online logging not stored

Manager.description: 'Login failed because of unknown error' Have updated version as of 4/24/12 Android Version 2.3.5 GPS enabled WiFi enabled
Manager.title: Login Failed

Manager.description: I just downloaded latest (0424) nightly version and I noticed, that there was some menu reorganisation on cache lists. There is small problem with new/empty lists - it is not possible to import anything to them (at least I didn't find that option - only filter and list "buttons" are visible after pressing menu). there is no problem if there is at least one cache already on the list (additional buttons appear).

Manager.description: Since yesterday evening cgeo prompted me, that it can't login into geocaching,com Today morning it is the same. The only thing I can remember is that I inszalled WhatsApp. I will reinstall my last own build and check current master.
Manager.title: login fails

Manager.description: Commit f4d2aff introduces some code marked "for testing purpose" that seems to set the URL to a dummy value that will be checked by the tests. This probably should be removed.
Manager.title: Remove "for testing purpose" code from production

Manager.description: Obviously Gps averaging takes many Gps points and averages them to give an accurate fix. People use it to set accurate coordinates when hiding caches. There's an ap If you are a geocacher this should be familiar. You arrive at or near a cache location and your phones Gps is not accurate by as much as 10 to 20 meters. (Especially in trees or canyon effect.) Why not offer a switch on the c:geo compass which you use when near to a cache. Switch averaging on and don't move the phone. The user will get an accurate distance and bearing to the cache. The user could move to the location and re average to home in. In a nut shell you would make c:geo the most accurate search geocache application on the market. I think you should give this consideration. Please can you give me some feed back Regards chris
Manager.title: Support email: GPS averaging - feedback

Manager.description: The flagpost icon is showing for some of my stored caches (which should mean that they have updated coordinates, which they don't).
Manager.title: Flagpost icon showing incorrectly

Manager.description: It used to work before, but it seems that now it doesn't work anymore: I have a few caches stored for offline, then I log a visit online (found it/write note/whatever), and the log, after it was posted, was shown in the logbook of the stored cache. Or at least it was there if it was still in history. Now it's not there, unless I refresh the cache. This function was very handy for mass drop of found caches...
Manager.title: Logging a stored cache does not show log

Manager.description: When on the map you can open a waypoint and get it's details, but you can not navigate to it's "parent". I want to implement that and I'd like feedback. How about a bar above/below the waypoint info with the cache info? Just a plain button in line with "Edit" and "Delete"? I favour the bar above the waypoint type and name.
Manager.title: Navigation from Waypoint Detail

Manager.description: Downloading a list of, say, 100 caches over any internet connection (including WiFi) takes quite a long time (several minutes). I suspect that the bottleneck is the geocaching.com server. Therefore, I suggest to implement a multi-threaded approach to download several caches simultaneously
Manager.title: Multi-Threaded download for offline-usage

Manager.description: I have downloaded caches from various cities in Germany. When I want to view all the caches on a map, I always get the entire map zoomed out. It's kind of annoying to zoom in to my particular location first. It would be nice if I can apply a filter in the map screen that includes only offline caches within a specific distance, say 3-5km. This could be implemented as a new filter, because the filtering mechanism (for example by cache type) works pretty well already with offline-stored caches.
Manager.title: Offline-Mode: Filter "show nearby caches"

Manager.description: when logging a stored cache as found it doesn't update. status on details page doesn't update to found nor does my log appear on the logbook tab nor does it add a green bar on left side when viewing caches in a list. I discovered this when I opened a cache that appeared to be not found and pressed refresh to get new logs the status then changed to found
Manager.title: stored caches not updating after found

Manager.description: Yesterday on my way to solve issue #1364 i found out that: waypoint navigation menu is created on the fly cache navigation menu is created a static way both methods use 2 booleans to filter out 2 menu items cache always shows static maps item although there is no static map waypoint shows static map item only if one is existing So we should refactor this behaviour to: create waypoint and cache navigation both on the fly and kick one method change boolean parameters to a List filter only show StaticMaps entry if existing On my branch I changed the cache method to take a filter list. This seems to be better and more flexible. Any comments?
Manager.title: Refactoring navigation menu

Manager.description: Users will not find that feature if we use the same default. I suggest to change the long press default to map instead of compass.
Manager.title: both navigation settings have same default

Manager.description: I believe the headers should not be stored here, if the entity itself was not stored (i.e. if saved is false): https://github.com/cgeo/c-geo-opensource/blob/master/main/src/cgeo/geocaching/files/LocalStorage.java#L157 I currently experience "saved==false" quite often with my broken connection, just in case someone needs a debugging session on code in that area. :)
Manager.title: Saving HTTP headers on error

Manager.description: Version 19 of the SDK contains a new version of the support library.we should update, but last time I did that, somebody complained. :-\
Manager.title: Update support library

Manager.description: Unfortunately, the live map no longer works. Tested on two machines. Revision as of 24/07/12, Andorid 2.3.4
Manager.title: Live Map not starting

Manager.description: Alert dialog has no title
Manager.title: No title when asking for static caches

Manager.description: After asking for the download of static maps the activity was closed.I had to reopen it to see the downloaded maps.
Manager.title: Static maps activity closes unexpectedly

Manager.description: it always uses english I updated italian localization weeks ago, and the above string is present inside the it localization but the 27/4 update and the previous one, continue to use english for this string
Manager.title: live_map_notification is not localized

Manager.description: I was out caching this weekend using latest build with GPS turned off (using Network for position). I noticed that when I click a cache on the map, often the popup window would open with distance as "--" (the default) and stay that way for up to 30 seconds. I believe this was introduced in 5a10f40 (observer pattern). I think maybe the problem is that cgeopopup is registering for location updates, but no update is getting fired for some period of time (likely longer since I was using Network and not GPS). Sometimes if I wait till it shows a distance, then open other popups from the map, then they will have a distance right away, but sometimes they still don't. I have reproduced this with GPS turned on as well.
Manager.title: Popup from map slow to update distance to cache

Manager.description: There is a bug if you show stored caches on map, not all caches are visible. However if you click on live map with the "Disable Live" option, so that only stored caches are visible, all stored are shown: Comparison: Stored -> show map: http://shrani.si/f/6/E4/16T6ZdEa/screenshot-1335853925934.png Live map: http://shrani.si/f/q/I4/gBRkx1R/screenshot-1335853943596.png
Manager.title: Bug - live map and show stored caches on map

Manager.description: It's only a very minor thing, but I suggest to remove the "1 x published" output from the cache details, as this really has no value for the user. Every other counter gives a clue of how active the cache or the cache owner are, but this one seems very useless and just consumes screen space. What's your thoughts on that?
Manager.title: remove "published" from log count output

Manager.description: I created a new list in order to import caches from the web using send2cgeo. The 'import' option was not available. It appears the import option has moved under 'manage'. With a blank list, options available are filter and list. 'filter' has no purpose if the list contains no entries. As a work around, I moved a cache to the empty list, and was then able to import caches. I am using nightly build ver. 2504-faa78b
Manager.title: Empty list does not allow import of caches

Manager.description: After upgrading to NB0105 a toast is showing up when opening the live map, saying that I use 0.2.4 mapfile and should upgrade the map file. Unfortunately it closes after only a few seconds, which is not enough time to read it. You should consider to keep it open for a longer time or add a "OK" button (and maybe a "Don't show this again" selection).
Manager.title: Toast message for map upgrade should be displayed longer

Manager.description: Using lastest build. Steps: Open a list of caches (either stored or nearby) Note how caches are sorted (should be distance by default) Select one of the caches to view its details Go back to list. Caches are no longer sorted by distance (I think they are now by geocode). This happens also if you sort by anything, then view details of a cache and go back to the list. It will not be in the order it was in before.
Manager.title: Lists don't stay sorted

Manager.description: Hi, I'm using c:geo offline very often, so I send caches to c:geo via send2cgeo and then go geocaching in terrain. I'm using lists by location where I'm. But sometimes I go for caches in the same places. I've new and old caches in one list and it's not easily possible to show only new caches. So sometimes I try to hunt some caches which are some months only in my phone. I will be happy when I can click in list "Delete caches older than 30 days" for example.
Manager.title: option to delete old caches

Manager.description: When you enter the selection mode, the items will get a larger height than in normal mode.
Manager.title: Different item height (lists, selection mode)

Manager.description: Since a few days ago the context menu (long press) is gone in the lists.
Manager.title: No context menu in lists

Manager.description: Extract from support mail: Why is it I can't do the same with the .gpx that I download from waymarking.com Essentially, its the same data in the same format, but they will not load into c:geo. It asks if I want to import them then states that 0 (zero) caches were imported. If they could be identified with a little W symbol, I could load all my intended caches, waymarks and benchmarks for trip, and could then see them as they approach during my drives.
Manager.title: Support for waymarking.com GPX-imports

Manager.description: While testing the new mapsforge implementation I have seen the following problem: Select offline map v0.3.0 (did not test 0.2.4) for usage in c:geo Reboot device (so that c:geo for sure is not active) Disable all internet-access Start c:geo Select Live Map No map is shown only empty background. After enabling network access again the map is loaded and keeps loading although I disabled network again afterwards. This is NOT a problem of fallback to online map, because once the map is shown I can disable network again and can still pan around on the map through germany.
Manager.title: Offline map not shown if no network is available

Manager.description: NB 0205 - 5a36c17(did not test with older NBs): After using the live map in strategy "Fastest" (don't parse cache types) I returned to the lists and for some of the stored caches some cache-information was no longer shown (cache-type incl. icon, D/T, size). Refer to screenshot: After opening the specific caches from the list the information is available again (in details and again in lists when returning to the list).
Manager.title: Cache type gets lost in lists

Manager.description: Using latest build with mapsforge 0.3 maps. Steps: Open a map view of caches (via Live Map or Stored) using offline maps Zoom in as far as possible (using double click or zoom in button) Once you can't zoom in any further, click the zoom out button The map will zoom in more instead of zooming out The only way to zoom back out is by pinching the screen. Once the zoom in button is enabled, the zoom out button works correctly.
Manager.title: Zoom out zooms in on offline maps

Manager.description: If a nearby search is performed by a basic member he will get the distance graphics only (unless he enables the re-captcha) and only basic information of the caches. People are often complaining, that e.g. "sort by distance" is not working in this case because it is still selectable but has no effect although they see the distance on the screen. First of all I thought about disabling the sorting by distance in this case (if technically possible). Same would apply for other sorting options which are not available in this case (e.g. D/T, Size, etc.). But as the distance is one of the most important information in case of a nearby(!) search it would be even better to obtain the distance information somehow. Perhaps it would be feasible to drop the support of distance-graphics and instead implement a new approach ? I once learned, that there is a very small HTML on geocaching.com used for send2gps. If I remember right, it is very small and gives coordinate information for the cache requested.
Manager.title: Distance information in nearby search for BM

Manager.description: The graphic files shown to basic members in nearby search results are in km/mi depending on the setting on geocaching.com. Some users complain that miles are shown although they selected metric units in c:geo. Reason is most likely, that imperial units are the default on geocaching.com unless the user changes this setting. For PM the setting on the website is not relevant as c:geo calculates automatically according to the setting. I suggest to implement that c:geo changes the preference on the website according to the user setting (as it is already done e.g. for the language setting) to avoid a mismatch.
Manager.title: Switch metric/imperial units for BM

Manager.description: As discussed in #1308 (or in the related pull request) currently the app crashes if an invalid mapfile is selected. Unfortunately it also crashes if the offline map is activated while no file has been selected. This means, that every user with default settings (no map-file selected) will experience a crash if he e.g. accidentally selects OSM:Offline. Is it possible to disable this map selection as long as no file at all has been given in the settings to avoid this problem ?
Manager.title: Disable OSM:Offline if no file is selected

Manager.description: After the new lifemap was awailable (gerat!!!) the lifemap or complete c:geo crashes when the orientation changes on my Samsung Galaxy-Tab . I trryed to reboot the device, deleted all Application-Date of c:geo - the problem still exists. Regards stepbaer
Manager.title: Crash when switching between horizotal / vertical orientation

Manager.description: With NB 0205 I see the following issue (not sure if it was already in before): With OSM:Online as well as OSM:Offline the tile-loading is not OK once I changed the orientation of the device. Starting hoizontal everything is fine: After changing the orientation the tiles for the remaining/new map-space are not loaded:
Manager.title: Orientation switch not OK for OSM-maps

Manager.description: I will try to port cgeo to Bada because I have a friend with a Samsung Galaxy Wave II with this stupid OS Bada. No program I saw is as good as cgeo and the only good program for Bada crashes every some minutes. And because I have a Samsung Galaxy Mini, I will try to get all geocaches to the SD card. This is really the only think I hate at cgeo and now I'm waiting more than half a year and no one with the needed programming knowledge wants to solve the problem. Now I try to get the hang of Android and Bada programming. It may take more months than anybody here would need...
Manager.title: Caches are still written to internal space (that is really an issue) and only available for Android (there's nothing good for Bada)

Manager.description: Currently there is no possibility to manually download static maps for a certain cache in case the general setting "Download static maps for caches" is switched off in the settings. But switching it on in the settings will also load the static maps generally e.g. in case of GPX-imports. This has some side effects like long import time, google timing issue and restrictions. It should be possible to download static maps manually for a cache (like it is already implemented for the case that no static map is available). After this has been implemented I would further suggest to have the general setting for downloading static maps switched off in order to avoid problems on GPX-imports. My personal guess is, that only a minor percentage of users want to have a static map by default in this case. Another possibility would be to introduce a new setting for "Static map download for GPX-imports" to split up the usecases. This should be switched off by default.
Manager.title: Manual download of static maps should always be possible

Manager.description: Salve! The germany map of http://download.mapsforge.org/maps/europe/ doesn't work with c:geo (v0405). But the niedersachen.map and austria.map works correctly :-) Ciao, Cadfael
Manager.title: nightly (v0405): v3.0 germany map of mapsforge doesn't work?!

Manager.description: Steps: Go to a list of stored offline caches Click menu / Manage / Drop All Click OK c:geo crashes Error log: FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-33 android.view.ViewRoot$CalledFromWrongThreadException: Only the original thread that created a view hierarchy can touch its views. at android.view.ViewRoot.checkThread(ViewRoot.java:2802) at android.view.ViewRoot.invalidateChild(ViewRoot.java:607) at android.view.ViewRoot.invalidateChildInParent(ViewRoot.java:633) at android.view.ViewGroup.invalidateChild(ViewGroup.java:2505) at android.view.View.invalidate(View.java:5119) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CompassMiniView.updateDirection(CompassMiniView.java:123) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CompassMiniView.updateAzimuth(CompassMiniView.java:96) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CacheListAdapter.setActualHeading(CacheListAdapter.java:278) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.updateDirection(cgeocaches.java:1441) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.update(cgeocaches.java:1407) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.MemorySubject.addObserver(MemorySubject.java:24) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.addDirectionObserver(cgeoapplication.java:135) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.startGeoAndDir(cgeocaches.java:1250) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.access$18(cgeocaches.java:1247) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$DropDetailsThread.run(cgeocaches.java:1789) I have confirmed this when dropping more than one cache.
Manager.title: c:geo crashes when choosing Drop All from a stored list

Manager.description: The load more caches button is not shown in search results. Maybe it has to do with changes from @Bananeweizen.
Manager.title: Load more caches button missing

Manager.description: Using latest build. Steps: View the details of a cache Select Refresh or Store While the refresh or store is occurring, hit back to cancel it Select Refresh or Store again No progress dialog is shown, but the cache is refreshed or stored (as evidenced by the status changing when complete)
Manager.title: Refresh/Store cache progress doesn't show if previously cancelled

Manager.description: "Download Static Maps" from navigation causes and endless loop when google maos limit (1000) is reached.
Manager.title: Google Maps limit causes endless loop in "download static maps"

Manager.description: Refreshing a cache with original waypoints will create new waypoint ids for the original waypoints but leave old static map files for the waypoints. Old waypoint files should be deleted. This issue also takes place in refactoring issues. I would like to store coords information about static maps. This should prevent from download the same static maps again and could help removing old files on fresh.
Manager.title: Refreshing caches keeps old static maps

Manager.description: This should be a discussion if we should always provide the navigation menu entry to download static maps. If waypoints change coords user would like to download static maps again, also if something failed for maps. I would suggest always to offer this choice.
Manager.title: Always provide download static map?

Manager.description: Found with todays NB 0705 - 6d99922 (not tested before): Go to "Any destination" from main menu Enter coordinates Press menu and select Navigate Two issues: The navigate icon is a "circle" but should be the "world map" The menu for navigation has no entries
Manager.title: Navigate from "Any destination" not working

Manager.description: This morning my battery was at 100% and I haven't opened c:geo a single time. GPS has been disabled all day. After about 9 hours my battery is down to 56% and Android says that c:geo is responsible for 97% of that (battery usage screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/wMjhd.png, detailed battery graph: http://i.imgur.com/Nmb0c.png) The "Use details" for c:geo have Keep Awake at 1 second, which is clearly not right. You can see that my phone has not gone to sleep at all in this period. Phone is a T-Mobile G2 running CyanogenMod 7.2.0-RC0. It's the build that somebody made to fix the voicemail notification error, but I can test with a standard build or different ROM if necessary.
Manager.title: c:geo prevents phone from sleeping, causing excessive battery drain.

Manager.description: After implementation of the new popups for waypoints (which is a very nice thing) I have the following "problem": On some multi caches the owners created an additional WP for the first stage. As (according to GC-guidelines) the coords of the multi are also the coords of the first stage you will have cache and first WP on same coords. The map shows the cache icon correctly but clicking on it will bring up the WP popup as well as the cache popup (i.e. if you close the WP popup in front you will see the cache popup). I suggest to suppress the WP-popup in case the parent cache is at the same coords. Example: GC1PHGH
Manager.title: Two popups if cache and WP are on same coords

Manager.description: I don't know whether this is new or has been there ever since: If a TB-description contains smileys from gc.com c:geo only displays a image-placeholder (Red x). Example: TB3F651
Manager.title: Smileys on TB-page not loading

Manager.description: When using find counter in the signature, if you're not online, it doesn't add the number. I think that number should be stored (and updated when online) so that when logging offline it changes accordingly on new "Found it!" logs stored offline.
Manager.title: Feature request: store cache find counter in signature if logging offline

Manager.description: Obviously there was a site-update on geocaching.com today: Cache-Detail loading fails for market release as well as for current NB ! Log is probably this: 05-08 23:42:38.711 E/cgeo (30026): cgeoBase.parseCache: class "CacheInformationTable" not found on page
Manager.title: Download of cache-details fails

Manager.description: Refresh a stored Cache - Error Message: updating failed Store a new Cache - Error Message: Download Cache Details failed
Manager.title: Refreshing and store a Cache failed

Manager.description: From support mail and confirmed: The quick-navigation icon (on the right side of the screen) is not shown in waypoint view (inside cache details) if the app is running with white background.
Manager.title: Quick Navigate icon not visibile in white theme

Manager.description: If the app is running with white background the TB-names are "white on white".
Manager.title: TB list not visible in white theme

Manager.description: If I am not completely wrong my owned caches used to have a grey (instead black) background in the lists. This marking is gone after the latest design-changes to the lists. I am not suggesting to have it back (because it did not fit into the remaining frontend design anyway) but it is also not good to loose a "feature" Therefore I would like to suggest to use the owned icon (star) as overlay (like on the map) also in the list. That would match with the strategy to align icons between map and lists.
Manager.title: Marking of owned caches in list gone

Manager.description: When i try to open the cache GC3JXK8 by searching the cache number, c:geo displays a error message "cache details können nicht geladen werden". Also if i try to search caches nearby the coordinates, c:geo do not show the cache GC3JXK8. As far as i know, the problem occours only at this cache - strange.
Manager.title: C:geo do not show GC3JXK8

Manager.description: I agree that "original coordinates" could be useful, but most of time, map is flood with a lot of points. "Original coordinates" are then unnecessary to be displayed (in my opinion) . Adding an option to hide this kind of points could be relevant. Thanks!
Manager.title: Add an option to hide "original coordinates" in map

Manager.description: The Samsung Galaxy SII, amongst other devices, mounts part of its internal storage on /sdcard and the optional SD card on /sdcard/external_sd Allow to move the .cgeo directory (or cgeo, depends on how issue #706 is implemented) to be moved to the /sdcard/external_sd directory. If the getExternalFilesDir() call does only give directories on /sdcard, maybe allow for a softlink to be created to the real storage on /sdcard/external_sd
Manager.title: Add option to move storage to external_sd

Manager.description: While not strictly geocaches, precise points on confluence.org are visitable as well. Confluence.org has no good android App for itself, but the GPX files it produces are importable via "Import GPX" and shown on the map. Improve support so points can be fetched directly and converted to first-class database entries and "View logs" and other stuff works correctly.
Manager.title: Import points from confluence.org

Manager.description: I can find no way to fetch and cache images from the galleries. Having them cached is immensely useful whenever you have either no or very expensive data access. Being in abroad in holidays comes to mind :-)
Manager.title: Fetch and cache images from GC Galleries

Manager.description: Using the latest build with mapsforge 0.3 offline map. Steps: Display the offline map Zoom in until the scale is 60m (200ft) or less Change the map source to Mapnik OSM maps You will get blank map and no tiles will ever load. If you look at the log, you will eventually see TileDownloader: java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://tile.openstreetmap.org/19/465485/206885.png The problem is that c-geo is trying to download tiles at a higher zoom level than is available from the website. I believe this is caused by reusing the mapView and mapController when the map source is changed.
Manager.title: Zoom level isn't reset correctly when swapping from offline to mapnik OSM

Manager.description: In edit waypoint screen, save should be static at bottom so that will be always visible/"clickable" on the screen. I got a GalaxyS, I always have to scroll down to acces "save" button in edit waypoint screen.
Manager.title: Static save button in edit waypoint

Manager.description: Is it possible to add a default action a single tap on an item of the waypoints list ? In nightly version, user should long press item in the list to open menu and then select action. Single tap does nothing ! I suggest : single tap: edit long press: menu
Manager.title: Waypoints list default action

Manager.description: I use c:geo for working with two geocaching accounts - one with friends and another with the kids. It is obviously simple to log in to either account as and when I need to, but I have noticed that the status of the caches, e.g. 'found', are not specific to either account. So caches that I have found with either account are shown as found when logged in to either account.
Manager.title: Cache 'found' status not tied to specified account

Manager.description: Please make it possible to show caches from all lists on map, I think, that it's often usable. Many users (me too) have special list for solved mysteries.
Manager.title: Virtual list "ALL caches"

Manager.description: Today I wanted to see how far a waypoint of a multi-cache is to a traditional cache of my todays list. To see this I would like to optionally see the waypoints of the caches.
Manager.title: Show List Caches and Waypoints in one Map

Manager.description: I have a Dakota 20 now. Now I would like c:geo to export a cache list including original and own waypoints in the same format gc.com provides. That would improve my searches in the woods and below trees by far. The current GPX Export is only imported as waypoints, not as caches. Maybe someone has another solution?
Manager.title: Geocaching-like GPX Export

Manager.description: Both values are concatenated and exported in both fields, so after importing again, you see "BaWü, Germany, BaWü, Germany". We could either have 2 fields state and country in the database (instead of 1 field "location") or just leave the "state" field empty on exporting GPX.
Manager.title: Export: State and country fields both contain both values

Manager.description: I use to get my PQs via mail and save the GPX-attachments from there (so they are stored in /mnt/sdcard/downloads on my device). After that I can easily import them to c:geo as it scans the sdcard and will find them. Just a few days ago I used the GPX-export for the first time. It will put the GPX into /mnt/sdcard/gpx which is perfect as it is. Unfortunately now the import will no longer scan the sdcard as it finds gpx-files in the default directory and stops searching. This is no bug as I could just copy my import-files there manually but users which are not used to the directory structure and just want to have an easy way of importing will not understand what has happened. So I suggest to add a button or something similar (on the result window) to force continuation of scanning when if it was stopped after scanning /mnt/sdcard/gpx. To avoid questions: The import of GPX-files directly from mail is still not working on my SGS2, but thats another thing which was already discussed.
Manager.title: Always allow search in other locations for GPX-import

Manager.description: I just found that there is a really nice method for enums: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/Enum.html#name() Wouldn't it make sense to use that instead of always creating an additional "id" field like we do now?
Manager.title: enumerations with name() instead of id

Manager.title: FC when closing dialog "Import from web"

Manager.description: I want to do some refactorings due to smelling code in cgCache / cgeoapplication. This was found due to static maps issue #1512: cgCache.addWaypoint(waypoint, true) -- does add/insert or change/update not only add -- name should be changed to addOrChangeWaypoint cgCache.addWaypoint calls cgeoapplication.saveOwnWaypoint(waypointid, geocode, waypoint) -- call is done for all waypoints not only own ones -- should be renamed to _saveWaypoint EditWaypointActivit needs to update the cgCache attribute "finalDefined" not storing the whole cache and delete / insert original waypoints I would like to: rename cgCache.addWaypoint(...) to cgCache.addOrChangeWaypoint(...). rename cgeoapplication.saveOwnWaypoint(...) to cgeoapplication.saveWaypoint(...) add the possibility to update only the main cache table skipping other things Can I go for it?
Manager.title: Refactoring - saveCache/Waypoint

Manager.description: EditWaypointActivity does a call to cgCache.save to store "finalDefined" attribute. Unfortunately the cache update flag is not set and so not "detailed" caches skip an update (e.g. GC3FR70). Otherwise detailed caches delete/insert original waypoints invalidating origin waypoint static maps filename ... After the refactoring of issue #1557 adding a possibility to store only cache main table data, this should be used in EditWaypointActivity to store the attribute after setting cache update flag to true. So finalDefined can always be stored and original waypoint static maps filenames will never be invalid.
Manager.title: EditWaypointActivity - finalDefined not always stored

Manager.title: Exception deleting list content

Manager.description: With an active filter, the "delete all and list" action will move the non-visible (filtered) caches into the standard list.
Manager.title: "delete all and list" should not be enabled when filter is active

Manager.description: There is the same question on "drop selected" and "drop all and remove list". The message is "Do you want to remove selected caches from list?". This made me think I chose the correct item yesterday, removing a whole list. Furthermore the items appeared at the default list. It seems somehow strange to me, not sure if I can reproduce.
Manager.title: Wrong behaviour on "drop all and remove list"

Manager.description: On my phone (Samsung Galaxy S) the new button to give a favorite point is not visible, the label is visible. On my tablet (Transformer TF101) the button is visible. On both devices the same NB.(12-05-2012)
Manager.title: In NB the new Button "favorite"is not visible

Manager.description: Today I had the opportunity to test this new feature. Here is what I did: Logged 4 caches without data-connection (resulting in stored log only, orange marker) Enable data access again Go to lists Click Menu, Select Export/Field Notes, Check "Upload to geocaching.com", Click "Export" The progress window shows 100% (38/38) immediately (Please note: It should only be 4 caches to be uploaded, 38 is the sum of caches on my list) After the progress disappears, a toast message is shown "Saved field notes to ....." Checking the website I see no changes. The log is only showing: 05-13 22:53:52.395 D/cgeo (12649): GET http://www.geocaching.com/my/uploadfieldnotes.aspx 05-13 22:53:53.435 D/cgeo (12649): Decompressing response 05-13 22:53:53.470 D/cgeo (12649): 200 (1072 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/my/uploadfieldnotes.aspx 05-13 22:53:53.610 D/cgeo (12649): POST http://api.go4cache.com/ 05-13 22:53:53.740 D/cgeo (12649): POST http://www.geocaching.com/my/uploadfieldnotes.aspx 05-13 22:53:54.110 D/cgeo (12649): Decompressing response 05-13 22:53:54.110 D/cgeo (12649): 200 (503 ms) POST http://api.go4cache.com/ 05-13 22:53:55.120 D/cgeo (12649): Decompressing response 05-13 22:53:55.120 D/cgeo (12649): 200 (1383 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/my/uploadfieldnotes.aspx It keeps reproducible. I am not able to upload the fieldnotes. I checked the field-notes file which is stored as well. It contains the 4 caches in question and looks normal AFAIR.
Manager.title: Wrong progress information when uploading field notes

Manager.description: I personally discover a lot of trackable using the search button from the cgeo main screen and have to change touch type from grabbed or retrieved to discover on each one would like to see a check box in setting to set to discover by default Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: An option to Set trackables to discover

Manager.description: As discussed in 23ba555 I added the labels "Duplicate" and "NoChange" which can be used to flag issue which to the time they are closed: Duplicate: Issue already covered by another issue (I could be useful to give a reference to the other issue as a comment). NoChange: The issue can not be solved as it is e.g. a system limitation or a problem outside c:geo application. The reason for creating this labels is, that this seems more useful as having e.g. a milestone "No Change". Please use it once you close an issue with the reasons mentioned or provide a feedback here if you disagree with this proposal. If you think other label-colors are meaningful, feel free to change :-)
Manager.title: New Labels Duplicate + NoChange

Manager.description: Using latest build. Steps: I had imported some caches via GPX I went into the settings and set it to store static maps for caches and waypoints (I normally have it disabled) I connected via wifi (data on the phone was turned off, so wifi was only connection) I viewed one of the lists with OSM offline map (but with no offline map loaded, so it was just blank tiles) I clicked on each cache that was near me so the popup opened I then clicked Refresh in the popup so that static maps would be downloaded Once I was out caching (no more wifi), I scrolled down in the Details window and there were no static maps. I thought maybe I hadn't given it enough time to download before disconnecting the wifi (there is no indication of download start, progressing or completing) But, if I go Menu / Navigate / Static Maps, then the static maps are displayed This happend with all of the caches I refreshed via popup (which I think might be the problem). I think this could be reproduced more simply than all the steps I list above, but I don't have the wifi/data connection to test.
Manager.title: Static map previews not created for Details screen when refresh via Popup

Manager.description: Hi, With latest NB, I get FC after a couple of seconds after the launch of cgeo. Latest known working version was ver. 1205 Log here: http://pastebin.com/1mWkbj95
Manager.title: Got FC with latest build version

Manager.description: After #1556 fix, the location is no longer updated.
Manager.title: Location is no longer updated

Manager.description: http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5339/7204968690_04494a074e.jpg saw this today when I opened my munzee app notifying me of an update can something like this be implemented May solve a lot if issues with users complaining the app doesn't work when they haven't updated Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: A popup that notifies users if of update

Manager.description: The GPS arrows are repainted on every change, even if that is in the fractional degrees only. Therefore I changed that to only invalidate the view if a certain threshold in direction change is reached. Interestingly I still get lots of redraws on the compass views, which are somehow triggered from somewhere else. I'm currently wondering how that happens (somehow triggered by that one update, resort and notifyDataSetChanged per second maybe)... (but to tired now to find the solution)
Manager.title: to many updates in cache list

(It can also be done by modifying the path in settings view.) PID: 20855 SIG: 9 I/ActivityManager( 1767): Process cgeo.geocaching (pid 20855) has died. I/WindowManager( 1767): WIN DEATH: Window{40bb5fb8 cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.cgeo paused=false}

Manager.description: This one from support email: I just have one question. When I select navigate to geocache option, map is shown with a geocache marker and my current location (arrow). When I get close to the geocache, the arrow goes underneath the geocache marker. The geocache marker is big and it is totally obscuring the arrow. Is there a way to have the arrow go over the geocache marker? This would help me (and probably others) to navigate very close to the cache location before we start searching.
Manager.title: Blue arrow over cache markers

Manager.description: I've got an Archos 5IT with Android 1.6 (software version 2.0.45) and cgeo version 27.04.2012. My problems: reload of a cache > "c:geo can't refresh the cache" import via send to cgeo > caches are download but appears nowhere no new version avalaible from the market like before... CGEO is frozen on my latest version. I can update my data. Is my Archos too old for the new versions of cgeo ? (It works welll on my Motorola Defy and my Samsung Galaxy Ace) Edit: SORRY , I just download the apk directly from cgeo.org and installed it. IT WORKS ! with version 09.05.2012 The problems is that the market don't ask me for new avalaible version.
Manager.title: Problem with Archos5 IT

Manager.title: Release date for trackable

Manager.title: History list not sorted by date

Manager.description: What about supporting challenges like http://coord.info/CX19F4 ? the user would enable the challenge support in the settings if enabled, challenges are requested and displayed in the nearby search and in the live map a new activity ChallengeDetailActivity could be used to display challenges tapped in the live map Who's pro, who's against it ?!
Manager.title: Challenges

Manager.description: At the moment there are four overlays in the live map caches (online + stored + waypoints) other cachers (Go4Cache) position scale I'd like to add/splitt additional overlays resulting in overlays for online caches (limited to 500 (?) caches) stored caches (unlimited) waypoints (unlimited) challenges (see #1591) circles other cachers (Go4Cache) position scale The user could enable each overlay seperately the same way he chooses the kind of map.
Manager.title: New overlays for live map

Manager.description: By accident i noticed lately that tapping on a user (name) in the cache details a window popups with different options. To advert this feature i'd like to highlight the user, e.g. with underlining the name. Also i'd like to add a 4th option to contact the user by using the "Send E-Mail to a User" functionality on GC.com.
Manager.title: Highlight user / email user

Manager.description: There are a couple places in the code where the following is used to determine if an error has occurred search.getError() != null. The code assumes that if a non-null value is returned, then an error has occurred. The problem is that the error can be set to StatusCode.NO_ERROR which breaks the logic above. I only see one spot (in GCConnector.java) that actually sets it to NO_ERROR. Here are a couple of ways I see to fix this. Expand all checks to check != null and != NO_ERROR Remove all != null checks and only check != NO_ERROR (requires making sure NO_ERROR is always set) remove NO_ERROR and only use null checks Thoughts? (I realized this as there is a small bug dealing with being offline and viewing caches in history that have been dropped from a list)
Manager.title: Inconsistent use of SearchResult error code

Manager.description: Yesterday I did a cache series with my niece and nephew. It was one of those without numbers in the name, and you had some other caches (not from that series) spread over the same area. If this happens, it is really hard to just navigate the series with c:geo. You cannot use the list and sort by name (which works fine if you have a series with consecutive numbers in the name) and you cannot use the map easily, because you don't see which is the next one and you see the other non-series caches also on the map, if you didn't explicitly remove them from your stored list). I really wished that there would be some possibility to give an explicit order to a group of caches and then to have them shown as directed graph on the map (or with numbers besides the icons), so that it is more easy to navigate the series as a whole. Did anyone have similar issues with cache series? Or any good ideas what to do about it? Or ideas what to implement to make this easier?
Manager.title: show explicit order for cache series

Manager.description: I'm not sure about the actual common agreement about a debug setting/switch for c:geo. I'm pro a debug setting/switch for the personal builds. The code could be protected by if (Settings.isDebugBuild()) {...} To activate this setting it is required to add an extra line in a file like mapsapikey.xml. Such a file could be used for personalization tests, too. This is required for tests like SettingsTest.testSettings() BTW: what is the intention about the actual debug checkbox in the settings ?
Manager.title: Debug setting

Manager.description: It depends on caches livemap threshold in settings (before this option was present all wpts of multis were showed)
Manager.title: Waypoints of multicaches are not longer shown in cache detail->navigate->show on map

Manager.description: The compass seems to drain the battery faster than anything else in the app. Today I left the app running on compass with display switched off and an hour later my battery was nearly empty. It had not been completely full before. Looking at the power consumption graph on the device, I have never seen such a fast decrease of the battery power before.
Manager.title: High battery use with compass

Manager.description: If you view a list of stored caches and then apply a filter, the count of caches in the title bar does not update. I think it should update to show number of caches displayed, not remain showing total number of caches in the list.
Manager.title: Cache count in title bar doesn't update when filtering list

Manager.description: Mucek, please register the c:geo repository over on builHive: https://buildhive.cloudbees.com/. That way we get automatic builds for our commits and even for our pull requests (independent of our own Jenkins). I've also not yet used it, but it sounds like it brings some value. And it's free. Have a look at this pull request in another project to see how it automatically checks pull requests: jenkinsci/naginator-plugin#2
Manager.title: create build hive for c:geo

I’m a premium member and a have the same phone. I’ve been searching for this problem and I didn’t find any solution. Could anyone help me?

Manager.description: We should convert cgeo into an organization, that would let us manage permissions more easily. For example, I'd like an extra mapsforge repository to host our modified version of mapsforge, and we could easily give it the same rights as c-geo-opensource. See https://github.com/blog/674-introducing-organizations for more information about organizations. Assigning @mucek4 :)
Manager.title: Make cgeo an organization

Manager.description: To do that, I need a mapsforge repository, which will be easier if #1634 is done first. The change to commit on top of the upstream sources is shown in #1633.

Manager.description: When you made online log and you are on really bad connection c:geo is sometimes unable to send log. It's only notified as toast and it's almost the same text as found. I suggest when c:geo fails to send log a popup window should be displayed. Something like c:geo failed to post log because server is not responding. and options. Retry, save offline, go back to editing

Manager.description: Example: 1.) I store a cache which I have not yet found (no green indicator bar at left border in "Stored" caches overview, no cache status indicated on "Details" page) 2.) I find it and log it as "found" on the geocaching.com site using my desktop computer (I do not use c:geo!) 3.) Then I update the stored caches in c:geo on my smartphone using Menu --> "Manage" --> "Refresh all" (or I select multiple ones and use Menu --> "Manage" --> "Refresh selected ()") 4.) The cache which I have found is NOT being indicated as "found", neither with a "Status" line on its "Details" page nor in the overview with a green bar at the left border This problem occurs only if I refresh multiple or all stored caches. If I refresh a single cache using the "Refresh" button on its "Details" page, it works properly, i. e. the status is being updated to "Found" and the green bar appears on its left border.
Manager.title: "Found" status not being updated when refreshing stored caches

Manager.description: Show compass for a cache. Start slowly rotating around yourself so that the compass is always trying to get to the current cache direction. After some rotations (2 or 3?) the compass gets stuck and will not come to life again.
Manager.title: compass gets stuck after some rotations

Manager.description: Found with RC-version 2012.05.30-RC-dd31d83. Test with first RC-version will follow: We have the known limitation that owned caches are identified as multi caches by the PNG-parsing. This is no big deal, but it allows to track the following problem: Strategy: Speed dependent (in stationary environment -> Nearby search used) User: PM After loading has finished the owned caches are well identified (by nearby search): Zooming out a reload takes place and the owned caches change their type to multi and owned marker is gone: I guess this is not limited to owned caches, but due to the limitation in parsing mentioned above it most likely to happen with owned caches. It seems information from nearby result is merged wrong with map parsing results.
Manager.title: Nearby result overwritten by PNG-parsing

Manager.description: I use c:geo on my Huawei Mediapad and since I installed Android 4.0 the compass doesnt work anymore. With Android 3.2 it was all ok. The concrete version I use, is Android 4.0.3 and I have installed the actual c:geo app. I tried the compass with other apps like Google Maps or other geocaching apps and all works fine there, so I think its a problem with the actual c:geo app.
Manager.title: Compass doesnt work

Manager.description: The value returned by the sensor for the orientation falls into the [0, 360[ range. However, when the direction is adjusted for the phone orientation through Compatibility#getDirectionNow(), a value as large as 270 may be added. This might be the cause (or one of the causes) of the problems recently discovered with the compass.
Manager.title: Compass values are outside the [0, 360[ range

We can either display the warning once, and then remove it, or allow it to be displayed once per c:geo launch only.

Manager.description: Steps: In settings set to Log Offline Open cache details for a cache From menu, select Log Offline Nothing happens I think the refactoring by @Bananeweizen in b8b1121 is the source as a function in NavigationAppFactory that used to return true or false now always returns true which disrupts logic in CacheDetailActivity.onOptionsItemSelected
Manager.title: Offline logging does not work from cache details

Manager.description: Seen on Facebook, and reproduced here: if you refresh all the caches while in the "All caches" pseudo-list, then your lists will be emptied. This is an unfortunate side effect of the "All caches" implementation. This should be fixed in the release branch.
Manager.title: Refreshing from "All caches" list will lose the list id

Manager.description: When you scan a QR-Code of an Multi-Cache while Filter-Settings are set to Traditional you get an errormessage "Cache not found". Filter must be set to either Multi-Cache or All Caches for scan to work. (renamed from "QR scan does not work if filter set")
Manager.title: Filter applied to single cache request

Manager.description: A network request may be done from the UI thread when creating a cgeovisit (now renamed into VisitCacheActivity) if the template contains [NUMBER]: at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:465) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.doRequest(cgBase.java:2908) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2889) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2880) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2801) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider$5.getValue(LogTemplateProvider.java:88) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider$LogTemplate.apply(LogTemplateProvider.java:40) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider.applyTemplates(LogTemplateProvider.java:117) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeovisit.init(cgeovisit.java:462) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeovisit.onCreate(cgeovisit.java:244) This may lead to Application Not Responding errors. Edit 2014-08-12: this also leads to crashes with recent Android versions which do not allow this kind of operation to happen on the UI thread, see later comment.
Manager.title: Network operation on UI thread

Manager.description: If the List "All" is opened while importing caches with send2c:geo the imported caches will not show up in any list except in the new "All" list. It is quite inconvenient to manually move these caches into the standard list if you have quite a large number of caches. Perhaps should be moved automatically into another list, if you download them while beeing in the "All" list. Keep up the good work! Best regards, Kratergecko
Manager.title: send2c:geo problems with new "list all" feature

Manager.description: Using master (it would be great if someone could check with the release as well), I noticed this week-end that when I logged a cache, the existing logs disappeared and only mine stayed until I refreshed the cache (and found mine + previous logs back).
Manager.title: User log replaces existing logs

Manager.description: As the above describes, most of the found caches show up as a greyed out box with ?? on top of it, but some just show as unfound, and my own caches show up as a multi
Manager.title: Found caches still shown when exclude own and found caches

Manager.description: "New release available.\nClick to install." dialog must be foreground for landscape displays. screen capture uploaded to http://imgur.com/e05nJ
Manager.title: New version notification in landscape mode

Manager.description: I don't know whether this is OK or should be removed: Currently you can select "Save static maps" as default navigation tool.
Manager.title: "Save static maps" available for default navigation

Manager.description: I never used the home button and the help button I only use accidently. I suggest to remove them both - maybe configurable. Or by using something like themes.
Manager.title: more space in header - remove help and home buttons

Manager.description: On a quite low zoomlevel the map on geocaching.com will stop hiding owned/found caches although it is selected. As we adopt the same implementation (for PM) owned/found caches are suddenly shown (most probably as ??-caches only as the zoom is too low to parse the types). I am aware that this is a limitation from gc.com but we should somehow deal with it. One possibility would be to not use such low zoomlevels for our requests but do more requests with higher zoomlevel. The usability might be very low anyhow as in high-dense cache areas you will only see a lot of ??-caches on the map in this case.
Manager.title: Found/Owned caches shown on low zoomlevel and kept on higher zoom

Manager.description: From friends and also myself: My owned caches are stored on my device. In case I receive a mail telling me about problems or news for my cache I would like to be able to post logs like Disable listing (at least this is helpful) Enable listing Maintenance performed while out in the field. Using c:geo for this would be very helpful any way faster than using the mobile browser to access the website. It could just be possible in the log activity if I am the owner of the opened cache. I did not see another issue matching to this. If you find one, please map it/close this.
Manager.title: Adding special log types for owned caches

Manager.description: With the market release (as well as NBs) the functionality of the limit for waypoints showing on the live map is working almost good, but on some occasions it is not working. I can not clearly reproduce this but it is something like this scenario: Live map is running while driving around A saved cache with waypoints is coming in range The count of caches on live map is below my configured limit (in this case: 20) and the WPs are shown The live map keeps periodically loading Suddenly the WPs disappear although the count of caches is still below the limit Closing and reopening live map makes the WPs reappear in this case Set "Unverified" because the described steps are not always reproducible for me.
Manager.title: Waypoint limit for live map not always working

Manager.description: This one is from support email: I find myself constantly switching between hiding and displaying my found caches. Any way to have a switch somewhere other than the preferences? Like the map view or caches nearby views?
Manager.title: Hide own/found switch on live map

Manager.description: With the current releae the filter (e.g. traditional caches only) is not applied on the live map if the user is basic member only. Reported by user and reproducible for me.
Manager.title: Filer not applied to live map for BM

Manager.description: We got several of those in the 2012.06.06 and the 2012.06.01 releases. java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.apps.cache.navi.AbstractStaticMapsApp.invoke(AbstractStaticMapsApp.java:50) at cgeo.geocaching.apps.cache.navi.DownloadStaticMapsApp.invoke(DownloadStaticMapsApp.java:18) at cgeo.geocaching.apps.cache.navi.NavigationAppFactory$1.onClick(NavigationAppFactory.java:137) at com.android.internal.app.AlertController$AlertParams$3.onItemClick(AlertController.java:899) at android.widget.AdapterView.performItemClick(AdapterView.java:284) at android.widget.ListView.performItemClick(ListView.java:3569) at android.widget.AbsListView$PerformClick.run(AbsListView.java:1831) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:150) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4385) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:849) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:607) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
