Manager.description: In 2012.06.06, also in 2012.06.01 (at line 1220): java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$DisplayRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1221) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019)
Manager.title: NullPointerException in CGeoMap.DisplayRunnable#run

Manager.description: In 2012.06.01, and probably in the current source code as well: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fileName must not be null at org.mapsforge.android.mapsold.MapDatabase.openFile(MapDatabase.java:484) at org.mapsforge.android.mapsold.MapDatabase.isValidMapFile(MapDatabase.java:217) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.mapsforge.MapsforgeMapProvider.isSameActivity(MapsforgeMapProvider.java:89) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.MapProviderFactory.isSameActivity(MapProviderFactory.java:72) at cgeo.geocaching.Settings.setMapSource(Settings.java:812) at cgeo.geocaching.SettingsActivity$cgeoChangeMapSource.onItemSelected(SettingsActivity.java:821) at android.widget.AdapterView.fireOnSelected(AdapterView.java:870) at android.widget.AdapterView.access$200(AdapterView.java:41) at android.widget.AdapterView$SelectionNotifier.run(AdapterView.java:836) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:132) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4123) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:491) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:841) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:599) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: Mapsforge: do not try to open a `null` filename

Manager.description: Users report, that the "Save for offline" option is no longer available from search results with release 2012.06.06 Could not check up to now.
Manager.title: Save for offline no longer available in search results

Manager.description: There should be a "rot13" button in the "Hints" section, maybe also in the "Description" section. I'm willing to implement this if you accept external submissions.
Manager.title: rot13

Manager.description: The options menu even stays open after clicking it.
Manager.title: “enable live" does not do anything

Manager.description: With the GPX import and export we confuse the user id and the user name of the cache owner. EDIT: Just if someone wants to see the effect: Import a cache (from GPX) where the displayed user name is not the user id of the owner, like GC31DT7. It shows the user id then. Now update the cache online and it suddenly displays the display name as on the website.
Manager.title: user name wrongly parsed/written in GPX import/export

Manager.description: See image.
Manager.title: Long waypoint names overlap with navigate button in list

Manager.description: I sometime need to reverse the order in a list, like when I try to find a Cache with the beginning letter "Z". But I have no option to reverse the sort-order? I read the FAQ and searched the manual... Am I blind? If not, this is a feature request ;)
Manager.title: sort in reverse order

Manager.description: c:geo version: current play/market version (20120606) phone; motorola milestone android version: 2.1 If i switch to OSM Mapnik while viewing a google map for example, the app crashes with an OutOfMemoryException. See Stacktrace below. After that i have to switch back to Google Maps by using the settings menu. Hope this helps and i haven't forgotten anything. Stacktrace: I/ActivityManager( 1273): Displayed activity cgeo.geocaching/.maps.mapsforge.MapsforgeMapActivity: 2498 ms (total 2498 ms) D/dalvikvm( 9185): GC freed 42217 objects / 1747792 bytes in 131ms D/dalvikvm( 9185): GC freed 24545 objects / 1916768 bytes in 148ms E/dalvikvm-heap( 9185): 262144-byte external allocation too large for this process. E/ ( 9185): VM won't let us allocate 262144 bytes D/skia ( 9185): --- decoder->decode returned false W/dalvikvm( 9185): threadid=39: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x4001b170) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): Uncaught handler: thread pool-2-thread-1 exiting due to uncaught exception E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: bitmap size exceeds VM budget E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at android.graphics.BitmapFactory.nativeDecodeStream(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at android.graphics.BitmapFactory.decodeStream(BitmapFactory.java:459) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at android.graphics.BitmapFactory.decodeStream(BitmapFactory.java:515) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.Tile.requestMapTile(Tile.java:223) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCMap.searchByViewport(GCMap.java:243) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByViewport(GCConnector.java:115) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at cgeo.geocaching.connector.ConnectorFactory.searchByViewport(ConnectorFactory.java:74) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$DownloadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1151) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1068) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:561) E/AndroidRuntime( 9185): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1096) I/Process ( 1273): Sending signal. PID: 9185 SIG: 3
Manager.title: OutOfMemoryException using OSM Mapnik

Manager.description: It would be useful if c:geo would support "Ignore Listing". Some cachers use this features to hide out caches they are not able to do (e.g. T5) from search results. Currently the search already does not show caches which are on the ignore list, it should additionally be possible to add caches to the ignore list.
Manager.title: Support "Ignore Listing"

Manager.description: When user selects Show As List from the menu on Live Map, it shows a list created from lastSearchResult which doesn't necessarily match the caches shown on screen, just the last batch downloaded. I think this is leftover from the old live map where a single search populated the screen. The implementation should be more simliar to how the list for storing offline is gathered. I assign myself.
Manager.title: Live Map Show As List shows last search not caches shown on the map

Manager.description: Due to the same logic that causes #1757, often Store Offline in the Live Map is disabled when it should not be. The cause is the check app.hasUnsavedCaches(lastSearchResult) used when checking to disable or not. lastSearchResult could be empty with the new live map, but caches still shown on screen. The check should be made against caches in the viewport. I should be able to tackle this one as well.
Manager.title: Live Map Store Offline not available

Manager.description: Right now, the found-date of a logged cache can only be entered manually, using offline-logging. Importing the found-date from .gpx would give the posibility to sort by found-date and see a history for already found caches.
Manager.title: Store the found-date when importing .gpx

Manager.description: no downloading possible after cache search in specific area
Manager.title: no offline downloading possible after find/search caches

Manager.description: A user who contacted us regarding #1751 does also have this problem. I don't know whether there is any relation, so I open another issue for that. Please have a look below...in the screenshot attribute-icons are missing and cache-size whould be micro: For me the cache looks normal, so set to "unverified" by now.
Manager.title: Attributes missing and cache-size incorrect

Manager.description: From mucek4: mucek4, 09.06.2012 21:49:53: they send us GPS named "caches-full.gpx" mucek4, 21:50:05: c:geo didn't impport it as of wrong file name mucek4, 21:50:25: and would you like to import it anyway mucek4, 21:50:42: I had to change filename from caches-full.gps to 1234567.gpx mucek4, 21:50:47: and it was imported mucek4, 21:50:59: I used my developer build from masted 2 days ago
Manager.title: Message when importing non-gc.com-named GPX files

Manager.description: I used field notes for the first time now and I found that we store them in a separate directory below the root, instead of using our cgeo directory. I favor having all our files in one directory, so it is easier for the app and the user to clean up.
Manager.title: field notes are not stored in cgeo directory

Manager.description: To prepare for seeking abroad, I add stuff to a bookmark list on the gc.com web site. It would be good if I could import the caches from the list into c:geo. Import could have a checkmark "full fetch" that would make c:geo not only fetch the GC codes from the bookmarks and store them as saved caches, but would also fetch the full details (and perhaps even a map snippet).
Manager.title: Allow to import caches from Bookmark-list

Manager.description: htc desire, c:geo latest, android 2.3 nearby -> list -> menu button -> NO option to save for offline; same goes for any search-result list; i can however select a cache and save them one by one; mass-refresh from stored caches also works tried: remove db, move db, reinstall c:geo... nothing worked... how come? thx!
Manager.title: can't store caches for offline use

Manager.description: From support mail: After having imported a lot of PQs I have nearly 1000 caches in my different lists. Now there is a list already, but a useful addon to find a specific cache would be t have the possibility of performing a search for cache name.
Manager.title: Offline search for caches

Manager.description: @campbeb fixed #1757 and #1758. After confirmation that this works as expected, the fix1757and1758 branch from the c:geo repository must be merged into release then deleted.
Manager.title: Merge fix1757and1758 into the release branch

Manager.description: A user with a Galaxy Nexus reported and proofed with screenshot that the button "Load detailed description" (or however it is in english) is missing on the description tab of a cache. (Example: GC3GB5D) It must be something device specific, because it is working for me with the release build without problems. Just waiting for the confirmation that he is using the current release and that enabling "Automatically load detailed description" will "solve" his problem.
Manager.title: Button "Load detailed description" missing

Manager.description: It would be nice to have the possibility to filter for words in the lists for saved caches. I'm often searching for a specific cache but there are hundreds saved.
Manager.title: Provide a filter "Name" in the lists with saved caches.

Manager.description: When I use the context menu (is this the right term in Android?) in the list of saved caches I can choose to log the cache. Then the cache details are not shown and I directly get the log page. After saving or sending the log the cache details are shown. It would be nice to get back to the cache list when logging was invoked from the list.
Manager.title: Go back to cache list after logging when logging was started from the list.

Manager.description: Hi, I've code to upload coords to gc.com, but I don't know, what is the preferred way of working with coords in c:geo. There are two usable methods: never modifiing coordinates of cache, only creating waypoint and uploading to gc.com setting final waypoint as cache coords and uploading to gc.com Please, tell me how to do it and I'll implement it (I'have all needed code) and place a pull request with final version. Thanks for reaction.
Manager.title: Uploading modified coordinates to geocaching.com

Manager.description: If I search for caches hidden or found by me (CachingFoX) the result list is always empty. Search requests with other user names are still working fine. Effected functions Search > Found by user Search > Hidden by user Search > Menu > Search my caches c:geo version 2905-621ad7...
Manager.title: Search caches by user returns always an empty list

Manager.description: The existing help-app is not working with Android >=3. (#525) As more and more devices will get/have this OS version, the amount of user complaints is rising. The current behavior (freeze after clicking button) is not acceptable. We should think about doing something to avoid this from the c:geo side. This could be: Just remove the link/buttons to the help app from c:geo Take over the code (as it is reported to be opensource in #525) and transform into an add-on to replace the existing links Replace the link/button by a link to our own online help (to be created) On short term we could only contact the author to at least mark the app as incompatible with Android >=3 so the users can not install a non-working app (In this case users will be linked to the online version).
Manager.title: Remove help function or replace by something else

Manager.description: If you open GC2831E and click the link on the picture in the cache description it will say: "HTTP_REFERER.... Site was not opened using the right link". Can we do something about it or is it just an (unnecessary) restriction made by the owner ?
Manager.title: Referer problem

Manager.description: It's not possible to click on link for send2cgeo and mapsforge website (more info in #991).
Manager.title: 2 Links in settings are unclickable

Manager.description: Sometimes it could be very convenient, when caches could be displayed on hiking maps (here in czech and slovakia we have realy precies maps provided by army ... today sold by shocart company). Theese maps are easy to obtain by mobile atlas creator (and there are many sources of raster maps available all over the world). Is it possible to implement using new offline map type ? I'had searched for android project that could display this type of maps ... and they are mostly closed-source freeware, but format of maps is documented.
Manager.title: Can we support trekbuddy tarred atlas offline map format ?

Manager.description: Last days it happend to me quite often that pictures in cache description are replaced by the placeholder (Pic-icon with red x on lower right) with the current market release (NB not tested yet). Reproducible with these caches, website shows it. Example: GC2XD3P
Manager.title: Picture in description not shown

Manager.description: There have been additions to the code which use self made dialogs just for very small input (using a text view or checkboxes and so on). Those dialogs don't fit the remaining visual appearance and are not the recommended way of implementing this in Android. Instead we should use an alert builder with a custom view: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/AlertDialog.html#setView(android.view.View, int, int, int, int) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9763643/how-to-add-a-check-box-to-an-alert-dialog
Manager.title: remove self made input dialogs

Manager.description: Hello! I recognized that spoilerimages are not listed in listing of my own caches. Same thing is reproducable on my friends app. Can anyone tell something about it? Thanks!
Manager.title: Missing own spoilerimages

Manager.description: The logbook page on geocaching.com has a tab for logbook, my logs and friend logs. In case I e.g. want to help someone finding a cache it would be good to have instant access to my own log for this cache. Its not worth an own tab but maybe you coud append it to the friend-log tab.
Manager.title: Also show my logs in friend-logs tab

Manager.description: From support mail. I have not enough understanding of GPX to decide whether they are justified: Thanks for GPX exporting functionality. Here are some ideas for further development in that area: possibility to configure the folder where the GPX files are exported Include following data to GPX file: Link to cache webpage Cache terrain/difficulty ratings Cache size Cache hint
Manager.title: GPX-export improvements

Manager.description: I suggest to include an ohloh widget on the cgeo home page. I always find that a good way of attracting potential new contributors to a project, if I see it on a web page of another project. It also allows outside people to "judge" the project a little bit (e.g. we currently list 49 contributors which is huge!) I suggest to use the last one on this page: https://www.ohloh.net/p/cgeo2/widgets Any comments?
Manager.title: include ohloh widget on web page

Manager.description:
Tested by @Lineflyer, contains the following changes since the last Market release: % git shortlog --no-merges market_20120606..release
Lars (3): Change log update for release branch Translation change #1784 also for release branch Change log update release branch
Samuel Tardieu (6): Fix #1722: do not use BigDecimal in computations Fix #1738: enable "store selected" operation on search results Fix #1736: some caches can be null Fix #1735: safely uppercase string even if it is null Fix #1751: set language to English Fix #1790: use correct freshness information for pictures
Manager.title: Put a new release on Google Play from the release branch

Manager.description: Some support mails are asking, whether it is possible or we want to support google maps offline-use (which google just announced some days ago). I don't know the technical background so I open this as feedback issue. Does anyone have an idea about that ?
Manager.title: Support of Google Oflline Maps

Manager.description: I only have access to the settings after reinstalling c:geo. When I try to return to the settings page after the first time I don't access to the checkboxes options. Device: Samsung Galaxy S (GT-i9000) ROM: ICS - Anarkia
Manager.title: Settings problems

Manager.description: I remember at one time in any list owned caches used to be grey for easy identification, now they just appear as an unfound cache http://www.imgur.com/M8lBX.jpg I would like to ser this brought back Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: Owned caches in lists

Manager.description: due to the apple patent infringement lawsuit against HTC New devices coming into the USA lost the ability to chose to open cache links in cgeo. now when you click a cache link it will open in browser this appears to be on androids with ics and sense 4.0 they want you to set a default with app associations in settings http://www.imgur.com/IqIEz.jpg http://www.imgur.com/p38os.jpg and unfortunately cgeo isn't a choice http://www.imgur.com/YOhuk.jpg the sense 4.0 automatically sets a default association with the stock browser and if you clear the default it will automatically default to the other available choice and in my case chrome , now I think if cgeo appeared as a browser it would then appear as a choice to open web URLs except the next issue I foresee it all web URLs trying to open with cgeo then getting an error or forceclose is there something that can be done to fix this from searching on the net its an app that strictly runs in the background called htclinkifydispatcher that is blocking the "open link with" popup that would appear prior to apple suing everyone Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: make cgeo an available app association

Manager.description: From support email: Is there a chance to implement the number of people having a cache on their watchlist? This is interesting, especially for the owner.
Manager.title: Number of people on watchlist

Manager.description: Hi Would it be possible to display somewhere in the detail view of a cache the name of the list it is saved in (if this cache is stores of course)? Would it be possible to add in some menu the possibility to move the cache to another list? Thanks
Manager.title: feature request: list info/move from detail view

Manager.description: The field notes export has changed the "Found it" to "found it". It appears that this was done sometime between 6/3 and 6/6. This is causing issues with trying to use the field notes with other applications like GSAK.
Manager.title: field notes export

Manager.description: Recently more cache information was added to the compass like D/T and cache size as well as the waypoint type, Maybe it would be possible to show the text for the waypoint (the note added to the waypoint) additionally. If you look e.g. at GC3FJ5F the wapoints note includes the question to answer. While caching you navigate to that waypoint and the compass shows "Question to answer" but to see the question I have to go back to the waypoint view to see it. It could be implemented in the line used for the type of waypoint (e.g. "Question to answer:......) or even below the compass as an additional text line above the current coordinates. From my point of view it will be very helpful to know what to do, without the need to go back from compass to other views.
Manager.title: Show more waypoint info in compass

Manager.description: When I modify the coordinates of a mystery cache on GC.com and then use "Sent to c:geo" and "Import from web", I get the origional coordinates instead of the modified ones. By "Refresh" I then get the modified coordiates.
Manager.title: "Import from web" does not get modified coordinates

Manager.description: I love c:geo and I used to love its map view, but I really start to hate it, because the map view crashes more and more often. I the past crashes used to happen for offline maps but now they do even for online maps (especially "OSM: Mapnik"). PLEASE try to solve this problem (even by using another library if the currently used one is too buggy).
Manager.title: More and more map crashes

Manager.description: Normally I use c:geo in German, but when I prepare for writing an issue here, I switch to English. Most of the menues are then English, but there are still some German parts ("Kompass", "Karte" "Statische Karten", "Auf ext. Karte zeigen", "Google: Karte", "Google Satellit", "OSM: Radfahrerkarte")
Manager.title: English German mix

Manager.description: I guess we want to be present in the Amazon app store also, right? If so, European developers should now be able to register at https://developer.amazon.com/welcome.html (but the store is still not available to European users). Should Mucek do that or is this a stupid idea?
Manager.title: Register in Amazon store

Manager.description: Seems that waypoints are not shown in / sent to Locus with "cache details -> menu -> navigate -> Locus".
Manager.title: Waypoints not shown in Locus

Manager.description: I think since the fix for #1725 was implemented I am missing the option "static maps" as selection for the default navigation tool. In the fix the selection "Save static maps" was removed, but it seems it removed "Static maps" as an option as well.
Manager.title: "Static maps" not selectable as default navigation

Manager.description: Currently I see some of the Premium Membership caches in some zoom levels. I would like to have only the content visible I could actually use. If you don't want to hide it by default, you may provide an option similar to hide found caches / hide own caches.
Manager.title: Hide Premium Membership Content for Basic Users

Manager.description: When planning the next vacation cache tour it would be great to customize the home coordinate. So if there is no GPS signal it would not default to the approximate WiFi location, but use the customized home coordinate instead. This also could solve some issues I had with having no location signal at all. (resulted in home coordinates 6000 km from my location [Germany]) It would be even better to have a favorite home coordinate list, but one customizable home coordinate should be pretty sufficient.
Manager.title: add possibility to change home coordinates

Manager.description: The user is reporting that c:geo crashed each time he tries to open the live map. Manager.description: With the current market release (as well as with nightly builds) the coordinate conversion in cache details is not working correct. Open a cache Tap on coordinates The DMS fomat is displaying more digits than expected and provides wrong numbers Labeled high as this is a regression issue present in current release.
Manager.title: Coords conversion to DMS not working correct

Manager.description: In reference to Issue #1827 among others. I'm in favour of dropping the geocode as primary key. It would minimise the effects of broken geocodes. I don't like the way the Database is queried anyway. To populate a list for instance we do these three SELECTS. Retrieving the geocodes using the criteria SELECT COUNT using the criteria SELECT IN using the geocodes There are cases where memory is an issue, but not always. See Issue #1777 where the three SELECTS are called directly one after the other. Any views on this?
Manager.title: Feedback Database Queries

Manager.description: The recent gc.com update seems to have introduced some small glitches. Type and size seems to be no longer parsed correctly.
Manager.title: Errors after gc.com update 26.06.2012

Manager.description: I have a cache stored with a 'Need Maintenance'-flag. In the meantime the owner did an Owner Maintenenance. If I refresh the cache data, the log for the maintenance is correctly visible, but the maintenance-icon on the details-page does not vanish.
Manager.title: Needs Maintenance for saved caches

Manager.description: I am running the nightly builds, and for the last two days, new caches imported into c:geo are being displayed as the unknown grey ?? icon. I have not changed any settings. I use c:geo in offline mode, and refresh does not change the icon either.
Manager.title: Caches icons showing as grey ??

Manager.description: With nightly 20120627 I experienced that a running GPX-import is also cancelled if I touch the screen at any position (not only "Cancel" button). I think this i not desireabl, in my case I touched the screen to keep it alive.
Manager.title: Import GPX is cancelled by any touch

Manager.description: Today I installed an exif viewer from Google Play and tried to use it in combination with c:geo. The temp.jpg stored by c:geo is missing the EXIF information present in the original picture. Install e.g. "EXIFViewer" Open cache GC3P43W Open hint picture to have long press access to the picture of the cache description Long press on "St2" picture Select to open it in EXIF viewer The EXIF viewer does not show any EXIF data If you try the same from web page it shows the full information Can we so anything to enable this ?
Manager.title: EXIF information on cache pictures missing

Manager.description: my evo 4g lte just prompted me to update the apps and you can now store maps for offline can that be implemented into cgeo if one saves the map maybe make cgeo call for maps from where the google maps app stores them instead of refreshing maps every move ? Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: google maps save for offline

Manager.description: In issue #1833 a user wants to export a list of caches to import into another c:geo client. So far I only know that the backup file can be imported into another device. What about a feature to export a list of caches with our own format to transfer almost every data we have? This issue just to ask if we need this. So far we only export in a restricted GC.com GPX format. It fits the requirements on GPS devices but not for import into c:geo.
Manager.title: Feature: Export caches in c:geo format?

Manager.description: Is it just us or have satellite maps disappeared as an option from live maps and other cgeo maps? Has this happened in one of the updates over the last week? We're pretty sure satellite view was there when we were caching at the weekend but no longer...... How do we set things up so live map has satellite as an option? It's one of the best features of the software. We are PM's so have satellite maps when using the groundspeak site (if that's relevant). Thanks in advance.......... The Sweeney Toddlers PS if this is a permanent change could you tell us how we can get old of the old versions of cgeo so we can reinstall please
Manager.title: What happened to Satellite Maps?

Manager.description: If you open a cache of size medium/regular, cgeo shows the size as Unknown.
Manager.title: Regular/Medium cache size not recognized

Manager.description: If I do a search using a place name, it brings up a list of the caches. If I then map that location I can see where they are. From that screen, if I choose Store for Offline, nothing happens. If I return to the list view and do it from there, no problem. Still a great app. Thanks.
Manager.title: Store for offline not working from Map view

Manager.description: For event caches I see the log summary starting with a comma.
Manager.title: log summary starts with comma

Manager.description: With version 2012.06.29-NB-fd3eda7 I found this (but it is probably present longer time): Don't hide found caches Open live map (Strategy: Fast) Click on a found cache loaded by live map (Type: ??, Marked found, Unreliable) Popup opens but does not report it as "Found" Close popup The map now displays the correct cache type but the found marker (smiley) is no longer shown The popup from live map on geocaching.com (where we retrieve the info for our popup) is not indicating whether the cache is found by the user. This means c:geo can not get new information on found-status and thus should not overwrite the found-info in case the popup is opened.
Manager.title: Found marker lost on live map after opening popup

Manager.description: Found in current master: Be sure "Hide own/found "is active Open live map and wait till loading is complete Only unfound caches are displayed Close live map Go to settings and deactivate "Hide own/found" Open live map again Still only unfound caches are displayed I think this is an issue of "caching" data, because if I move the map afterwards so that an update is triggered it works as designed. Only the initial data after opening the map is not updated as long as c:geo is running. So this is no major issue but just a glitch, however it is happening to me quite often if I am out caching and just want to quickly check which found caches are nearby.
Manager.title: Map not correctly refreshed after hide found setting has changed

Manager.description: I assume there will be split opinions here but anyway we got the first support mails asking why they can not login using their facebook account. Can someone explain how this is working? Does it mean the user does not necessarily need a gc.com account or is this only a link between geocaching.com account and facebook account meaning the user needs a gc.com account in any case ? If it is only a link-feature I don't see any necessity to support it, but in other cases we should support it if possible.
Manager.title: Login via facebook

Manager.description: The status notification system gives a 503 right now.
Manager.title: status.cgeo.org 503

Manager.description: The web site needs to be updated: a link to the Google+ page should be added, with icons similar to Facebook and Twitter (do we have the templates?) a link to the status page should be added the reference to the "partner app" GCC should be removed, there isn't even a backlink to c:geo
Manager.title: Update web site

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: add start time to calendar entry

Manager.description: Hi, Here in Portugal we are a little limited on 3G traffic, and it dissapear if we download to much cache. It will be great if we could customize the strategy level by checking if we are on Wifi or in 3G. I could append with the images on description maybe. Greats PS: sorry about my poor english, please contact me if you have any doubt.
Manager.title: Change Strategy if in wifi or 3g

Manager.description: Hello is it possible that you are navigating also komoot with einbaust or that with your software Komoot tours and planning can Greetings Giuseppe Groth
Manager.title: Integrate navigation software Komoot

Manager.description: Since a few days the actual version of c:geo (2012.06.28) shows the sizes of freshly downloaded (or updated) caches as "not choosen" / "nicht gewählt".
Manager.title: Cache size not shown correctly

Manager.description: Found in NB2012.07.04 : Save a cache which has WPs with coords for offline Set WP-limit in settings to a number >>0 to enable the feature Open live map and check that the saved cache and its waypoints are shown Close live map Activate filter which does not match your saved cache Open live map Result: The cache is hidden properly but its waypoints are still shown which is not what the user expects Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: Live map shows WPs of caches fitlered out

Manager.description: From support email: It would be nice, if there were a counter somewhere, to show me how many caches I mark as found the offline-log function. When I am on a cache tour with 30 or more cache on one day, I am not able to count them all by myself. I can use the filter for showing all caches with a saved log, but there is still the number off all caches in the list showing. May you have an idea.
Manager.title: Filter and counter problem

Manager.description: With the latest update, c:geo now puts me just off Africa at 0 deg long, 0 deg lat when GPS is off. Previously, it picked up my location from my mobile signal and used that approximate location. If I turn the GPS on and then lose the GPS signal, c:geo will hold the location for about 10 mins or so before defaulting back to 0,0. My partner uses the same version of c:geo on the same model of phone but doesn't have this issue.
Manager.title: User location defaults to 0 long, 0 lat when GPS off

Manager.description: After the last update i can not get to ground 0 it jumps from 7 to 100 ft back and forth tried rebooting several times and different phones no change
Manager.title: GPS Jumps when 100 ft or less

Manager.description: Rather than clicking on thousand of one star caches, it might be a cool idea to filter out the easy ones ahead of time. Or if you're strapped for time, filter out the difficult ones, y'dig?
Manager.title: Filtering based on Difficulty / Terrain

Manager.description: From a list of caches, if you choose Menu and then List, you are given two choices: Create new list Change list Clicking Change list gives a listing of all the lists AND an option to create a new list. I propose that when List is clicked, it gives the same menu as when clicking on the name of the list at the top. The only downside I see is that it is an extra tap (and maybe some scrolling) is required to create a new list. But, it is one less click to change lists (for those that don't know about clicking the name)
Manager.title: Remove one layer of List menu

Manager.description: Is there a chance of updating only the status of a list of caches or making a sub-menu( or options menu) for updating caches in a list (already in archive) ? A funtion that only update the status (active, disabled, archived) for a list or selected caches? For example, having options for update caches, like: FULL (all cache update) This is what we have now [in my android it takes +-1min/cache] MEDIUM (Cache Status, Logs and possible GCvote/Favorite rattings ) LOW (Cache Status)
Manager.title: Cache status update

Manager.description: Hello, When I search for Nearby caches, I get a list of 20 caches. When I select the map icon, it shows me the map. But only three caches are on them. All 20 caches are within a 2km range so should be on there. It happens for google maps, but also OSM. As it happens the 3 caches are the only caches out of the 20 that used to be stored offline. I dropped them, but they still show up. I remember something about map only showing stored caches, but I couldn't find any info on that. Also read the faq, but I still think the expected the behaviour is to have all 20 caches shown? Is this correct, or am I missing something? Thanks and keep up the good work! I have a free GC account, and login is ok. Using newest 28/6 version.
Manager.title: Map (nearby caches) only shows 3 caches

Manager.description: http://bcaching.com is greate website which can receive gpxs directly from GC.com via email. It imports them into your personal list of geocaches. You can download them into the android app "GeoBeagle". However GeoBeagle is much less sophisticated compared to c:geo. So it would be cool to have c:geo connect to bcaching.com also to import those caches into your Offline Caches list. Also an easy way to keep the caches up to date, saving on requests to GC.com. EDIT: Here's info on the bcaching.com API.
Manager.title: Request: Enable import from bcaching.com

Manager.description: Since the introduction of this feature (give/remove favorite point to/from cache) there is no progress indication after the action has been started. On slow network connection the action can last for long time, so a progress spinner or similar should be shown to indicate to the user that the action is ongoing.
Manager.title: Progress indication missing for favorite management

Manager.description: c:geo should store trackable data offline along with the cache(s). When I'm geocaching, I often find TBs or something in the Geocache, and end up leaving it there because I don't know the trackable's goal; And I don't like moving trackables without knowi where they are supposed to be going. I think there should be a feature in c:geo where if you store cache(s) offline, the data for each of the trackables in the inventories of the cache(s) should be stored with it. Then if I ever find a trackable in a cache and forgot to check its info at home, I'll know where it's going so I can pick it up.
Manager.title: Store data for trackables offline

Manager.description: The context menu on the preview map misses an entry, probably the default navigation tool.
Manager.title: Context menu misses entry

Manager.description: I have just read some caches directly from mail.whenever I stored one of them, the status label did not update, only on storing it a second time.
Manager.title: Offline storage status label not updated

Manager.description: One from support. I don't know this app and if it's possible It would be helpful if I could use the maps produced by Cyclestreets.net to tie in with c:geo. This is especially as they have made an offline UK Map Pack available as an Android app. Unfortunately, when I am using c:geo, the map pack doesn't appear under the list of available options. Can you advise how I can integrate the two?
Manager.title: Cyclestreets.net maps

Manager.description: As reported in the devforum by Bonemaro: Starting with NB 2012.07.17-NB-9875e2b the signature text field in settings as well as the log text field is sized down to only one line height only.
Manager.title: Log text field does only show a single line

Manager.description: It seems the api from go4cache is down since a few days and also the website www.go4cache.com is no longer available. Some of the users (including me) really miss this feature. AFAIK the service was offered by a 3rd party (who?). If this is not only a temporary outage we should think about, what to do with the go4cache implementation: Is it possible and allowed to take it over to c:geo servers or else remove it from c:geo.
Manager.title: Remove or Replace Go4Cache support

Manager.description: When correcting the coords at gc.com and then using the send2c:geo everything works fine. But, when the already in c:geo stored cache gets corrected at gc.com and then again using send2c:geo the coords in c:geo are not being updated. You have to push update to do this. Is this a bug? Edit Lineflyer: Topic changed
Manager.title: Updating cache using send2cgeo does not update coords

Manager.description: In the latest build, clearing history is causing a forced close.
Manager.title: clearing history caused force close

Manager.description: If hint contains special characters (for example cache GC3F4A3), app displays wrong hint. Screenshot for GC3F4A3: https://docs.google.com/open?id=0B5Cr-bOUvTFQWVFJcU5scGx0M3M
Manager.title: Special characters in hint

Manager.description: From support mail: Currently the history only lists caches which where a log has been composed (online or offline). It would be a useful feature to also have a history of the most recent cache which have been viewed in c:geo. This could be done in a common list with the current history or (better) as a separate history list. Usecase: I look into some caches which I want to go for soon. Afterwards I want to navigate to those caches but have to look them up again manually and might have forgotten the name which makes it difficult. The user is not refering to the geocaching.com feature but a standalone c:geo feature.

But when I choose "Open in Browser" from details view in c:geo the link reopens with c:geo itself. I should get a question what app to use by default from within c:geo.

Manager.description: From support mail: On some caches the downloading stalls and takes ages or does not end at all. Example: GC1MAX1 I tested this and can confirm that the downloading stucks. What I can see in the decription is, that some embedded images are not displayed (only the placeholder icon) although they are already downloaded, i.e. if I click on the hint pictures the pictures are there but still not displayed within the description. If I open the same cache in a web-browser everything looks normal.
Manager.title: Opening cache gets stuck when image host is not responding

Manager.description: Hello, The reason for this issue comes mainly from issue #1602. If you import/store/refresh a large number of caches, you'll hit the google maps api limit for static maps. Issue #1602 covers a fundamental change to handle this situation better. I am thinking of a quick improvement which could help a lot. If we sort the caches before starting the actual refresh/loaddetails thread, we can make sure that after a while all caches are refreshed (and have static maps). My first thought was to order them by the 'property' "hasStaticMaps". So caches that don't have static maps, will be first in the list and get refreshed first. After that I thought maybe a more general solution would be to just order the caches by "lastUpdated" timestamp. So the ones that have the oldest stored data, get refreshed first. This would cover my use-case, but also kinda makes sense in a general way. Let me know what you think, I think making a patch would not be too difficult. Once I have the dev environment up and running that is.
Manager.title: Use 'better' ordering for refreshing of stored caches

Manager.description: I want to ask you, if it is really needed to have this option for switching compass usage off. If you have a new installation Compass is standard and when a new user starts with cgeo, he has in the menu the option "use GPS", what looks for him like enabling GPS, but the result on map/compass is much worse than with compass. So, mucek told me, the option is for some situations, when compass doesn't work, like in car. But when compass is enabled and it doesn't work it is the same like when it is disabled. So why it is not enabled all the time? So why you not: -) use compass all the time when available on device, without this option anymore, .. or -) rename it in "use compass ON/OFF", .. or -) remove the arrow when using GPS only
Manager.title: Use Compass VS Use GPS

Manager.description: I know this is an open issue somewhere but hubroid will only show me so many and I couldn't find it but I'm see a lot on cgeo facebook about this issue and it not working in market version 06.28.12 but has and is working in nightly builds any idea when this feature will again in a market release Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: store for offline from live map

Manager.description: Hello, I was wondering whether we could use the OSM map files used by navfree. Usecase: I have Navfree app installed on my phone. It offers trun by turn navigation using offline maps. It uses OSM maps. So I have the benelux and france maps downloaded on my device (for my holiday). This is about 1.5G of map data. I also have c:geo installed, for I want to use also offline maps. For this I need OSM map files also, whichs means another 1.5G. Question: Could we re-use the OSM map files from navfree? It seems they use a different format, but possible this format is also supported by the mapsforge? The files/folders used in this format look like this (Benelux map): +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 +---blx +---bel ¦ +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ ¦ belgium@bel.4.poi.4.ydb ¦ ¦ ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ belgium.alb ¦ belgium@bel.4.ydb ¦ Settings.txt ¦ +---lux ¦ +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ ¦ luxembourg@lux.33.poi.35.ydb ¦ ¦ ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ luxembourg.alb ¦ luxembourg@lux.33.ydb ¦ Settings.txt ¦ +---nld +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ nitherlands@nld.35.poi.37.ydb ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 netherlands.alb nitherlands@nld.35.ydb Settings.txt I found a page about OSM formats, but I'm not sure this is the place to look. While writing this issue, I stumbled upon the mapsforge ginary format page, which gives me the feeling mapsforge has developed its own format?
Manager.title: Use OSM map files from navfree ?

Manager.description: Open an unsaved cache (I did this from a publish notify-mail) Click add to watchlist After operation has finished the details still show "Not on watchlist" Update cache Now the watchlist status is correct (which means the operation was successful but just the page in c:geo was not updated)

Manager.description: One from support email: I live in Holland near the Belgium and German border. So I often go looking for geocaches her. But outside my own country I don't have an internet connection on my Android phone. So I use offline maps (open street maps). Every time I want select an other map (country) I have to go in c:geo back to the main menu and to preferences and scroll all the way down. Is it possible to make it quicker to change offline maps? Or is it even possible to show all the downloaded maps at once? So I don't have to choose a map anymore.
Manager.title: Quicker change of OSM offline maps

Manager.description: Would it possible to implement a such feature based on GCBuddy app : http://www.btstsoft.nl/apps/gcbuddy/ ? I already had this idea a few months ago and did something on javascript. It works perfectly for me but it is not usable on a mobile device :( Here are the required steps (from my own point of view) : add 1 field "formula" in waypoint add a page for each cache to enter values (A,B,C) and a "compute" coordinates button. User enter values as soon as he gets a new value during the hike. Click "generates" button calculates new coord values for child waypoints with formula (if all required values are present). Technically, javax.script.ScriptEngineManager (or JEXL) could manage eval job. From my experience, user should input himself the formula because extract formula from text's cache is really hard. Used format is not always the same. (x or * for multiplication, ( or [ for input...)
Manager.title: Formula solver for multi

Manager.description: When I enable "show circles" and LiveMap has loaded a lot of caches, for example with 11/500 in the header, for every 500 caches a circle is generated and moving of LiveMap isn't possible anymore without lags. So, generate only the circles for caches within the visible area+radius.
Manager.title: Show Circles only for shown caches

Manager.description: From support mail: For the send2cgeo – Userscript it is necessary to accept cookies. The Greasemonkey-Project allows you to store some data in the browser (also after restart), so that you don’t need cookies!
Manager.title: Don't use cookies in send2cgeo

Manager.description: At the moment c:geo already recognizes a coordinate in the personal cache note and treats it as a waypoint which is great. It would be nice though to have the map icon re-positioned to this location. (and change to the icon with a red flag overlay for example to indicate a re-positioned icon like it is done already in the listing of nearby caches which have a "final location" waypoint) The reasoning: I often write the final location of mysteries and multies in the personal field note. Then on the map you can easily see the "actual" cache location while planning your route on the road. also, when placing a cache it can help with checking the proximity of the actual cache locations.
Manager.title: Replace map icon to coordinates found in personal cache note

Manager.description: Premium member caches should be marked in livemap by overlay icon when user is basic user. It is annoying to see caches that can not be saved or opened. Manager.description: Hello, I would like to create multicaches with coordinates of the next step stored in NFC tags. On android, only Google Maps respond to NFC tags with geo URI (ie geo:37.786971,-122.399677) See : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geo_URI Does c-geo handle another type of geo coordinates URL/URI ? Or is possible to handle these one ? In this case, c-geo could set is destination to theses coordinates and display the compass or the map screen. Thank you
Manager.title: Handle of geo: URI ?

Manager.description: Hi there, we are the developers of SmartNavi. It is an app which can make you independent from GPS. With the help of internal sensors, SmartNavi recognizes steps and their direction. So you are not just independent from GPS, you can even save a lot of energy for your Smartphone. We would like to customize SmartNavi, so that c:geo users can benefit from it. We wrote an E-Mail to c:geo support, but they recommended to write our issue here. If you are interested, we would like to talk to you about how we should customize SmartNavi. For more information you can visit: http://www.smartnavi.2imba.de/ You can write us an E-Mail via: smartnavi@2imba.de Best Regards, Christian Team SmartNavi
Manager.title: SmartNavi for c:geo - Navigation without GPS

Manager.description: Hi, today I had realised that it will be great when send2cgeo could be able to clean queue, by "magic button". I have two testing phones. And I had sent about hundred of caches via send2cgeo to one of them some time ago (about 4 days). When clicking import from web on the other one phone ... it was downloading the same hundred of caches and after them new added caches. There should be a possibility to clean that queue, because it is really time consument and sometimes uneccessarry to download caches to all users phones. How this should be solved ? And how send2cgeo works ? What is the structure of queue storage ?
Manager.title: Send2cgeo clean queue

Manager.description: Android (4.0 + ?) allows to store maps for offline usage. c:geo should be able to use them instead of always downloading the map data from google. Yes, I know about the osm offline maps, but their handling is a worse (e.g. the one map limit).

Manager.description: the Favpoint percentage is a very helpfull indicator wether the cache is highly rated or not. The absolute number of Fav points is not that meaningful . I suggest to enable live by defaukt if the map is started from main screen. Sent via Hubroid

I offer to take the logistic part (e.g. creating label, and labeling matching issues) if this is generally agreed by a majority.

Manager.description: From support mail: Currently in lists and nearby result you can filter "Status" -> "Only PM". Would it be possible to implement the inverse function "Only Non-PM", which could be quite useful for basic member to hide those from the result. I agree to that, on the other hand I know that the whole filter thing should be reworked. However I think this would be easy to do at the mentioned place as a workaround for now.
Manager.title: Filter "Only non PM caches"

Manager.description: Free from support mail: Currently I can only see my current coordinates when I activate some navigation tool. For a geocaching app it would be nice to see them also somewhere within the main app. On the mainscreen I can currently only see the town/country information. It would be a nice feature if users could tap on that to toggle between this and the coordinates. Example:
Manager.title: Make current coordinates more visible

Manager.description: An option I change quite often is 'Hide own and found caches' in 'further options'. Sometimes I want to show this cache to other cachers, or look for new logs and can't find the cache, because the option is set wrong. Next time I'm looking for unfound caches by e.g. adress and the option is set wrong again and shows me found caches, too. Would it be possible to display and change this option on main-screen (like the cache-type icon) or in the search-dialog? Or somewhere else to change it quicker?
Manager.title: Display Option 'Hide own and found caches' more prominent

Manager.description: With current nightly I had the following problem today: A cache was stored on my device I updated the personal note on the website I updated the cache in c:geo afterwards Result: In "Creating view" c:geo freezes After timeout Android reports "c:geo stopped" and returns to the main menu Its not reproducible. My subjective impression is, that it has something to with the content of the personal note. Without personal note I did 10 consecutive updates without problem, after entering a personal note it appears sometimes. Here is what I found in the log following some lines below static map loading: 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): FATAL EXCEPTION: AsyncTask #4 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:278) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DescriptionViewCreator$LoadDescriptionTask.doInBackground(CacheDetailActivity.java:2019) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DescriptionViewCreator$LoadDescriptionTask.doInBackground(CacheDetailActivity.java:1975) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): ... 4 more 08-29 22:12:45.460 W/ActivityManager( 1998): Force finishing activity r.intent.getComponent().flattenToShortString()

Manager.description: When during changing the text and other stuff of a waypoint the screen get's dark (screen lock) the changes are lost after awaking. Edit (Lineflyer): More precise heading

Manager.description: Would be nice if you add an overlay to map for showing the rating of each cache. Maybe choosing between FP and gcvote. Like http://gcvote.com/screenshot_map.png
Manager.title: Show rating on (live) map

Manager.description: Would be nice if it would be possible to create an empty dummy cache for adding waypoints to it. So when I'm outdoor and collect coordinates for some cache I could generate the waypoints and same them for later. For example: Go to list > Press Menu > Select "Create Cache" > Enter Name > Cache is added to current List..
Manager.title: Create empty dummy cache

Manager.description: The font size for the number of satellites and the measurement error at the very bottom of the compass screen is too small to be read on my Samsung I5800. It would be great if this very useful info could be made more prominent so I don't have to keep switching back to the GPS app to see if I still have satellite lock.
Manager.title: Compass: Increase Font size of satellite and Error text

Manager.description: This feature used to work and it was useful to use "refresh all" on caches that were cached for a longer time and then just abort the process, when you've reached a point that all caches were reasonably fresh. Now, I don't know from which update (i'm using nightly builds) this method wasn't working properly anymore, but sort still works and refresh all still does, but caches stored for a longer time are not picked first. Also using refresh all on a large number of caches stops by it self somewhere in the process, it is not dependant on wifi sleep policy or screen sleep - I tried running it plugged in to usb and wifi and screen do not power off when plugged in.
Manager.title: Stored caches -> sort by date stored on device -> refresh all

Manager.description: Sometimes when typing, the sneaky keyboard hides and you press "send log" accidentially.
Manager.title: Option to delete and/or edit own logs

Manager.description: Currently log templates only include items about the time and user. Since logging is done in the context of a particular cache, can some items be referenced about the cache too? I am particularly interested in the cache-owner (getOwnerDisplayName()), who many name in their log entries. Unfortunately, I'm only just skilled enough in Java to be dangerous....
Manager.title: Template for cache owner

Manager.description: when you do a search ans then display results on map and then press enable live if you rotate your device live map auto disables Sent via Hubroid

Manager.description: I'd like to know your opinion on the best way for the user to get updates in a region. From time to time, I try to get new caches in a specific area but using live map, I have to deal with already found caches, disabled and not-up-to-date caches on the map. Either I should load all caches on the screen and clear after, either I manually check status one by one. Is there already a way to get : new caches in a specific area excluding already found refresh caches not up-to-date (saved a long time ago) Thanks for your feedback.
Manager.title: Discussion - Best way to get caches updates in a specific area

Manager.description: Hi, for me the following occurs: When i start the live map and select a cache from it, it opens the pop-up information for that cache. When long-clicking the Navigation icon to start the navigation, it just jumps back to the live map. I'm using the latest version from the Play Store on a LG 4X HD.
Manager.title: Long-press navigation from the live map leads to live map again

Manager.description: Hi, I'm not sure if this is desired behaviour, but it feels strange to me that everytime I visit the homescreeen of cgeo, the app tries to Login. This is maybe a good feature when a network connection is present, however when out caching my network status doesn't change. Maybe it is just me, but I feel that this is a not needed power consumption. I'd prefer an 'Offline Mode' where no login-checks are performed.
Manager.title: When offline CGEO tries to login everytime homescreen is visited

Manager.description: I went to geocaching.com today and the "Send to c:geo" button was no longer there (it had been there the last time I looked). My browser is registered according to the right side of the send2cgeo howto page. I did delete my browser cookies since I last visited geocaching.com. Is there a way to reregister my browser? Is there something else I should do? I am running Chrome 21.0.1180.89 m . Thanks, Adam
Manager.title: "Send 2 c:geo" button has disappeared

Manager.description: While writing a log the insert function lists all possible templates in alpabetical order (AFAIR). Now that a new owner template has been introduced the "signature" template is even more at the end of the list and even on my SGS2 does not fit on the screen (I need to scroll first). Assuming that inserting a signature is a more common usecase than inserting other templates I suggest to move it to the top of that list or even better to have a third submenu (beside Add and Rating) to quickly insert the predefined signature.
Manager.title: Quick signature insertion

Manager.description: I'm using the Field Note Upload function always with the option "only since last export" / "nur seit letztem Export". In the beginning, this function worked well for me. Now the upload still works, but it always uploads all caches from the "Verlauf" to gc.com. I'm not sure at which time this has changed, maybe with the last update. I'm using version 2012.08.15

The log says: ´´´ I/cgeo (24492): Import GPX file: /mnt/sdcard/Download/export_20120910145541.gpx E/cgeo (24492): Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.0: could not parse XML - org.apache.harmony.xml.ExpatParser$ParseException: At line 11, column 15667: not well-formed (invalid token) I/cgeo (24492): Import GPX file: /mnt/sdcard/Download/export_20120910145541.gpx E/cgeo (24492): Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.1: could not parse XML - android.sax.BadXmlException: Line 1: Root element name does not match. Manager.title: Database downgrade is not imeplemented

Manager.title: Allow to upload photos to a log entry

Manager.description: For caches that I own, I get a star on the map, but the list view shows it as any other cache. I propose to show a yellow stripe (like the green one for found). Also for an owned cache, the log options shouldn't include found and dnf ( and others?)
Manager.title: Improve handling of own caches

Manager.description: The trackable handling could be optimized: Trackables once opened could be stores or cached (like geocache data is already). Currently a new request with loading time is done each time I click on a certain TB. Trackable data of trackables logged into a cache could be saved along while saving the cache for offline use Both options would improve the network requests needed and the offline functionality (#71).
Manager.title: Allow storage or caching of trackable data

Manager.description: Could "Show circles" function not extended so that also stored waypoints are included? So you can see the 0.1 mile radius on the map by multi-caches and mystery-caches.
Manager.title: Show circles also from stored waypoints

Manager.description: i don' know if I'm right about this but i don't seem to be able to get to the settings screen on the HTC One V. The button that I used to use on my old LG doesn't exist on the new phone and I can't see another way to get there. Am I wrong?

What is your opinion?
Manager.title: Nearest caches - use offline ones at first and add online after downloading

Maybe we could link it from above as well (next to the PlayStore link) to avoid such questions.

Manager.description: I've been using the c:geo app for a very long time and have never had any issues with it before today. I went geocaching today and was unable to because every time that I tried to locate a cache the GPS wouldn't activate itself. Regardless if I was looking at the map view or the compass view, the GPS would remain inactive. The GPS is enabled, so it has the ability to be active, but for whatever reason it just wouldn't stay on. As a result, my distance to the cache, or my position relative to the cache wouldn't update. I could only use satellite view to get any sort of bearing. I'm using an HTC Incredible running Cyanogenmod 7.2.

Manager.description: During a chat session we agreed to make our app target level 17. Necessary changes are at least: change target version in manifest select correct build target at each developer Android support library latest version Indicator library latest version Deprecated API must go into the compatibility classes exceptions thrown if using network on the UI thread new permission http://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE optional: use http://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/ConnectivityManager.html#isActiveNetworkMetered()
Manager.title: Use API 17 for building and as target

Manager.description: On the "caches nearby" view there is a menu item "enable updates". When selecting it, the screen quickly blinks and the menu item stays as is. Selecting it a 2nd time, the title bar changes to "live view" and the menu item says "disable updates". I think the menu title (and icon?) should change according to state or even have two tries for the respective modes enable/disable live map update caches on screen Or of the current one button is kept update map enable live map disable live map
Manager.title: Enable updates menu is non intuitive

Manager.description: From support mail: When updating the cache GC3Q5WD the picture for the geochecker does not get updated. Test: Open cache details Remember geochecker graphic Click on geochecker and enter invalid coordinates Go back to cache details Update cache The graphic stays the same even if it changed on the website A manual update and deleting and storing again does not help Can we detect the change and redownload the graphic ?

Manager.description: I'm missing a search function for GPS coordinates. In most Mystery-Caches you only get final coords. But how can we find this position? There is a function to find caches by coordinates but this is not what I meen. It would by nice if you can integrate a feature were we can type the coords and the result is a position on the map. Thanks for this great APP. Mario
Manager.title: Search function for GPS coordinates

Manager.description: We have the log summary (e.g. 20 times found, 4 times not found, ...) only for caches loaded live from GC. Not for GC caches via GPX or for caches from other sources. Should we just calculate the numbers from the available logs in those cases? Or leave them away as of now?
Manager.title: no log summary for GPX imported caches

Manager.description: not sure if its a bug or its Supposed to be this way now but I have my account logged into cgeo and I have my sons account logged into the official groundspeak app and when I log my find I would then open in other browser and choose the official app and it would open but now I'm getting an invalid URL for geocache inside this official app and the official app hasn't changed since march it is because cgeo doesn't use coord.info URLs anymore and if not why does it not use them Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: open in other browser

Manager.description: Since the newest gc.com update, cgeo cannot login. 'Login failed because of Unable to contact Geochaching.com. The website may be down or your Internet connection not working..'
Manager.title: Login no longer possible after update from 17.10.2012

Manager.description: When i try to register my firefox browser it doesn't register it. And the c:geo in my android system when try to get the register doesn't get a positive answer. Is there any problem with the server? Because yesterday i was able to push the caches from my android system.
Manager.title: send2c:geo plugin

Manager.description: Hi, I recommend adding information that cache is in particular bookmark lists ... and possibility to open them. (I know, that this is GC.com only), but very good feature, for example for searching of caches with common topic.
Manager.title: Show that cache is in particular bookmarklist

Manager.description: Hi, I recently installed this app on my phone (Galaxy Blaze 4g) which was running ICS 4.0.4 and it is great, however the compass is really messed up. I can basically make the compass spin by tilting the phone back and forward. If I let it "stabilize" when the phone is on a flat surface (screen facing up or down), it is showing North, where East is. If I keep the phone in my hand in front of my face, North is pointing to about where South is. I updated to 4.1.2 yesterday and the issue remains. As a reference, GPS Status is also going crazy and the author confirmed that he's using a deprecated api because of android 2.2 which has problems with Android 4.0+ Smart Compass (part of Smart Tools) on the other hand, works like a charm when compared to a real compass. Of course, in GPS only mode, things work fine, but need some movement to detect the direction so it makes it more tricky once I get close to a cache :). I'll be happy to provide more data, if you guys let me know what you need. Regards, Georgi
Manager.title: Compass on Blaze 4G and Android 4+ not working

Manager.description: window.open feels pretty outdated. There are several issues: need to manually acknowledge the window experience with single window mode sucks: tab may be loaded in background “never allow popups” either prevents the page from opening or moves away from the current page Using the jQuery which is loaded by gc.com anyway, it’s possible to spice this up a bit. I have modified the user script locally, but only tested in in Greasemonkey/Firefox. Will also try for the other browsers later and then issue a pull request to get some feedback. The modified version loads the page in an iframe and fades it in once the send2cgeo page has loaded. It is currently displayed at the top center. I also modified the link on the map view so that middle clicking (“open in new tab“) is possible while a normal click uses the new fade-in-iframe-method. There isn’t any feedback yet if the cgeo website is down because the iframe is only faded in once loaded. I’ll see if it’s possible to fade it in on click and display a loading message meanwhile.
Manager.title: don’t use window.open in send2cgeo // modernize send2cgeo userscript

Manager.description: In pt translation when go to write log inside a cache, in the type have one option "precisa logbook" (need logbook). This type of log not exist in th GC, and when use, with pt people that not know, in real in GC log put as "need archive". Tks
Manager.title: pt translation critical mistake

Manager.description: Clean issues and make it easier for developers... I think there are many useless feature requests or ancient bugs... can you clear it a little bit?
Manager.title: Clean the issues list

Manager.description: New version of chrome only allows approved scripts from the web store Sent via Hubroid
Manager.title: add send2cgeo to chrome web store

Manager.description: There are quite a lot of tags in the form "jw-XX" in my local repository. Is that just me (because of locally checking out some pull requests) or did those get into the master repository accidentially?
Manager.title: Bad tags in the repository

Manager.description: If you are not registered for c:geo, the website will print out something like "http://send2.cgeo.org Register first!", where "Register first" points to the exact same website again (including the parameter for the cache). This gives an endless loop experience for the user. The parameters need to be removed from the link.
Manager.title: Bad redirect if not being registered for send2cgeo

Manager.description: Greasemonkey scripts can have an icon. We currently use the high resolution image of the send2cgeo website which looks not that well in the addons list. Therefore we should have a 32x32 logo somewhere on the server and afterwards have the script point to that new image.
Manager.title: Upload 32x32 logo on website for use in send2cgeo

Manager.description: Since some weeks I have a strange problem with the nightly builds: On my SGS2 it is supported to replace the default font by a custom user font. I did this a long time ago and installed a quite thin font to save space on the display. All apps including c:geo used to use this font without problems. Since some weeks I do only see the device default font instead of the custom font throughout c:geo. Only on the first start of c:geo after a device restart the custom font is used. Any idea or might this be a system bug (as I also did a upgrade from 4.0.3 to 4.0.4). But in fact c:geo is the only app which has this problem on my device.
Manager.title: Font problem

Manager.description: As written by @Bananeweizen as comment in PR #1741the input dialog style is to be optimized: No headline The text box should be at least 2 lines to show the user, that multiple lines are possible
Manager.title: Unusual style for input dialog when editing personal cache note

Manager.description: After implementation of #409 with PR #1741 it is now possible to create/edit the personal note. However synchronization is not yet supported but this should be implemented on short term if possible as the current behavior is not user-friendly. Currently: Notes from gc.com are shown and can be edited A new note can be created On updating the cache details a personal note created in the app is deleted (if empty on website) or overwritten by the personal note from gc.com Desired behaviour (to be discussed): If the personal note on gc.com is empty and local note is existing this note should be uploaded to gc.com. This could be done instantly when creating or (IMHO better) if the cache is updated If personal notes are existing locally and remote there needs to be an alignment in some way (e.g. take the longer one, ask the user, etc.)
Manager.title: Support personal note sync

Manager.description: Found with NB2012.10.31: Perform search for location (e.g. Cologne) Scroll down to the bottom, the load more button shows "Currently:20" Load more results and scroll down again The bar still shows "Currently:20" whereas the header correctly shows 40 From this time on the count is always 20 behindwhen loading more results
Manager.title: Search result count wrong on load button

Manager.description: I am using c:geo on a Samsung Galaxy Nexus running Jelly Bean (4.1.2). Since early this fall, I have not been able to log in to my account except when using wi-fi, and so I can't search for new caches or post logs in the field.
Manager.title: Login fails if not using wifi

Manager.description: In logbook view users with one cache found are listed with “1 Ein Cache“ (german version).
Manager.title: User with one cache found is shown wrong

Manager.description: Uninstall c:geo and re-install. Both navigation tools are set to compass, but the secondary should be map.
Manager.title: Navigation tools are both compass after reinstallation

Manager.description: I played with the new image gallery tab in the recent nightly builds. While it is working normal and stable on my SGS2 (Android 4.0.4) it is really unstable on my tablet (TF700T with Android 4.1). On the tablet sometimes the app crashes while downloading the images. It is not clearly reproducible, but e.g.: Open cache GC12C15 Swipe to image tab Images are loaded OK on the first try (after starting the app) Go back to main menu Open cache details again Swipe to image tab The app crashes while on the progress of loading the pictures Unfortunately I still have to learn how to take a log on Jelly Bean...so no log available for now. Due to the experiences in the past I would assume it is an out of memory problem again. Can someone elese with a tablet (high res display) test this a little bit and try to take a log (or can someone link me a detailed description of how to take a log on Jelly Bean devices) ?
Manager.title: Crashes on new "image tab"

Manager.description: No description.
Manager.title: Use hardcoded … as button label

Manager.description: It is perhaps related to #1039 but has a different angle IMHO (and I could not find a similar request). Just recently there was a question on geoclub if it is possible to set your 'current' or 'home' coordinates in c:geo. While the latter is discussed in #1039 I think the former would be a useful feature especially when without GPS (either no signal indoors or switched off). I f we allow to enter (or better select on the map) the current location, everything (like cache distances, nearby search, etc.) could be displayed in relation to that. Edit: corrected referenced issue (typo)
Manager.title: Set current position (in absence of GPS)

Manager.description: I just had a NPE in CacheDetailsActivity, line 2083. I'm quite sure I've seen an issue (or stack trace) for that one before, but I can't find anymore. Anyhow, I think I now understand that NPE. The "view" field in the LoadDescriptionTask suddenly is null. To my mind, this happens if "notifyDataSetChanged" is called while some parallel task is running (like the loading of the long description). We do reset the views of all details views in the details view activity when a notifyDataSetChanged occurs, so this might also lead to problems with other parallel access to the views.
Manager.title: NPE in CacheDetailsActivity

Manager.description: What shall I say...that happens if a beginner plays around with "Github for Windows". If you select "Sync" it does not create a PR but publishes you locally created branch to github: https://github.com/cgeo/c-geo-opensource/tree/changelog Could someone please delete it ? It seems I should only create branches in my local repository but not in a cloned repository. Sorry for that, I hope I did not break anything.
Manager.title: Delete branch accidently created

Manager.title: Settings - themes folder: changes in textbox are not saved

Manager.description: Tested with four caches (not my own) and they all don't have a link to spoiler in the cache description. This seems to affect also stored caches with the newest nightly. I am quite sure, that these stored caches had the spoiler link and picture available but now it is gone (cache was not updated). So I guess it is rather not a problem with the recent site-update but a problem within c:geo which came in recently.
Manager.title: Link to spoiler not available

Manager.description: I found a regression with the NB version, apparently to call the menu: 1 - from a list, if I keep pressing on a cache to display the menu, I get FC 2 - from a cache, if I press the menu button, I get FC Calling the menu from the list of caches works (thus I could refresh the caches). I downloaded the spoiler images and get back to NB 11.07
Manager.title: Huge regression with NB 11.09

Manager.description: Hi, writing this just as memo, I will try it on clean master when I will have time for it (writing from phone in tram now). (It is possible that it is caused by cache download service patch). There are some changes in map code which allows to click on cache overlay multiple times, so you end up with more popups over map. Pressing back-back-back.. solves it, but it is weird. It will be better if it will open popup without data, just progress and grey titles and load data in background. And when it will be ready it can show data and become responsive.

Manager.description: As per the discussion on #2128, we could add a new bug-reporting function to c:geo that would let a user send a mail to the reporting address with an attachment made of the last log entries. To avoid needing any permission on any Android version, we could exploit the fact that all our logs go through cgeo.geocaching.utils.Log static methods and add a circular buffer storing the N last logs (such as the 500 last entries).
Manager.title: Add a bug-reporting function to c:geo
