Although it indicates accuracy about five meters it shows coordinates up to fifteen meters far from the right ones and what's worse they moves although I don't move. Before it was absolutely exact. Trying Google maps I can see the point where I stand stays at one place without moving. It's almost impossible to find some cashes. I use Sony Ericsson Experia Mini with Android 4.0.4. It's not rooted. I didn't change anything even no relevant actualization was installed durig the critical time. I've tried to reinstall the application but nothing has changed.

Manager.description: We do have all of our menus in the Java code. The recommended way of creating menus is using resources. Having resources for menus also makes it easier to use an actionbar afterwards (native or Actionbarsherlock) because we can add the attributes needed for action bar items directly into the menu declarations. See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/actionbar.html If we try that in code, we get version dependent stuff in every menu creation. Also Actionbarsherlock recommends inflating from resources, should we decide to use Actionbarsherlock. Therefore I want to refactor all current options and context menus to menu resources. At places where we have dynamic menu items (like the map selection) I assume we may still need the old Java code.
Manager.title: refactor menu code into resources

Manager.description: Currently all of our database methods need to be invoked at cgeoapplication instead, which simply redirects to an instance of cgData with the same method signature. I intend to remove all these methods from cgeoapplication and to directly invoke them at cgData instead. Reasoning: Every single member/field in cgData is static (besides the CacheCache, but we can make that one static, too). That means it is a pure utility class, not an object with some inner state. And that makes perfect sense, as we don't add any state to the underlying database, we only need a lot of methods to more easily access that underlying database. As all fields are static, we can also make all methods of cgData static (which Eclipse even recommends, if we just change 2 method signatures of the current implementation). As we don't have any state in cgData and as all methods can be static, there is absolutely no good reason to have some kind of "entry point" in cgeoapplication to "shield" all the database methods from being accessed from anywhere in the application. Now some of you might object that this destroys the nice design we currently have. It doesn't, really. Currently our database is only accessed from the application class. That's nice. But every method that wants something from the database has a direct dependency to the cgeoapplication class instead. By removing all the indirection methods in cgeoapplication, we change neither the dependency count between all of our classes the dependency kinds the cyclomatic complexity ... Or to re-phrase it a third time, if you are still not convinced: Why is it OK to have hundreds of dependencies from all classes to the cgeoapplication class, but it is not OK to instead have the same number of dependencies directly to the database class? Basically this change will remove some hundred lines of code without any functional impact, just the receivers of database related methods will change all over the place.
Manager.title: Remove application->database redirection

Manager.title: NetworkOnMainThreadException in logs view

Manager.description: From FB: 1.) List the files Alphabetically by file name - This would make it much quicker to sort through. I've got all 50 US states and some other countries in my list and this would be much nicer to sort through Alphabetically. 2.) List the most recently select map at the top of the OSM: Offline list to make it a quick selection. This would enable people like myself who switch between Sat. and Offline to do this quickly w/o scrolling all the way through the list to get to Texas where I do most of my caching. This could even be called 'OSM: Offline - Current' just so it had a permanent name.
Manager.title: Better sorting of OSM-map lists in quick selection

Manager.description: Seems d8c5377 is not working correctly: Set filter to Multi-Cache Open live map Click on filter-bar Result: "cgeo stopped" No log yet, because using a S3 with 4.1.
Manager.title: Click on filter bar crashes c:geo

Manager.description: From support mail (unverified...I don't even know the device). Anyway I want to bring it here to check if this could be possible to be a fault: On my Samsung Galaxy Player the latest nightly build causes a parse error on installation. I askes the user if this is still present with current nighlty and if he has more information.
Manager.title: Parse error on installation

Manager.description: The plain smiley [:)] is missing on a log for me. Did not have time to take a closer look but maybe someone can crosscheck: Open GC40D80 In the logbook there should be an entry of myself on 29.11.2012 The start of the log reads like "..Betatest.." where the . should be smilies
Manager.title: Smiley missing

Manager.description: I have just installed the latest version on my Galaxy Nexus running 4.2.1 and when viewing my stored caches, the closest ones (which are all disabled) did not appear so (no line through them). If I went to read the content, the line does appear through the name in the description but not the title. When I then go back to the list, the line appears... I then tried this with the next three and all I have to do is look at the description and then go back and it then gets the line. It appears not to be picking up the flag that says it is disabled on the first reading. Still a great app. Thanks Steve
Manager.title: Disabled caches not shown with line initially

Manager.description: It is just a small graphical glitch which occurs since we introduced the debug setting. The last line with the checkbox is cut off, it it not possible to scroll down so that box and text are fully visible:
Manager.title: Last line in settings cut off

Manager.description: From support mail: Hello support, Have one notice I would like share with you, to make c:geo better .. Yesterday I have updated the app as the c:geo recommended me in the menu ... But I have noticed that scrolling in list of saved caches is not so smooth as in previous version ... It visibly stutters ... Also in cache details it is stuttering too .. The movement is like you are closing/opening some rough zipper .... It is not freezing in a few places for a while during scrolling but just whole movement is rough ... line seems doubled ... It doesn't influence function of this great and powerful app of course, but this is cutting a small piece of user pleasure .. even if previous version works fine in this ... Anyway ... thanks for this app! Current version of c:geo: 2012.12.03 Phone: Samsung Galaxy Note Android: 4.0.4 Kernel: 3.0.15-1068447 I will ask him about the amount of caches stored and if maybe reinstallation solves the problem. Nevertheless I want to create this issue as there are also some posts on FB speaking about a long loading time when opening saved caches and accessing the list.
Manager.title: List access slow / stuttering

Manager.description: After a first look into the code (thanks to @marco-jacob) c:geo should already handle searching waypoints and opening the cache details for: OC - opencaching.de Germany OZ - opencaching.cz Czech Republic OS - opencaching.no Norway / Sweden OK - opencaching.org.uk UK OP - opencaching.pl Poland OU - opencaching.us United States OB - opencaching.nl Netherlands I did only test some of them before so I gave it a test with current master version: OC = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OZ = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) There seems to be some functionality behind which no longer works OS = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OK = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) I am not sure if this is really implemented OP = Working OU = Working OB = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented Can someone give some more background infos what c:geo should support and what not ?
Manager.title: Search for Opencaching waypoints not working for some sites

Manager.description: Reported on support mail and I can reproduce it with current master and release version. Scenario: Perform nearby search Set Filter to e.g. "With Trackables" Filtering is OK Load more results Result: Filter no longer applied
Manager.title: Filtering fails in nearby search

Manager.description: In the last version (2012.12.03) of c:geo I have a problem with the visibility of caches on the live map. I activated the setting: "Exclude own and found caches", but it only works, if I am in the "live-mode" (live map > menu > "enable live"). If I disable the "live-mode" (live map > menu > "disable live") all caches are visible. On swapping the "live-mode" the view gets instantly updated with the correct/incorrect results. Anyone else experiencing this problems? Any questions I left open?
Manager.title: own and found caches are visible on live map

Manager.description: The 'Settings' page is overly long and complicated. Scrolling down to toggle common options such as 'Exclude own/found caches' is a chore. During scrolling, I also often find that I have unintentionally turned on/off one of the settings I was trying to scroll past. Consider restructuring the flat list into a tree for easier accessibility. I envisage the user would, on opening the 'Settings' page, be given a short-list of the main sections. Clicking a section would take the user to a page containing just the options relevant to that section. Clicking 'back' would take the user back to the main section headings, and clicking 'back' a second time would take the user out of the settings page. I foresee that only a single level of nesting would be required; Deeper levels would be counter-productive. I feel that having a structure rather than a flat list would speed up access to settings when compared against the scrolling up and down that is currently needed. Discuss...
Manager.title: Restructure the Settings Page

Manager.description: Excluding own/found is a feature I use very regularly. However, to toggle this setting requires me to exit the live map, open the settings, scroll, change the setting, exit the settings, load up the live map, and then find my way back to where I was before I closed the map. And then, once I've looked at the position of the own/found cache I was interested in, I have to repeat all of the above to turn the setting back off. Am I missing something? This process gets a bit tedious! It would be great to be able to turn on/off my own caches and my found caches from the 'Map Modes' dialog inside the live map. It would be even greater if I had the ability to differentiate between showing own caches and showing found caches. I often want to see my own caches but not found caches, or to see my found caches but not my own caches.
Manager.title: Exclude own/found directly from Live Map

Manager.description: I experienced a problem a couple of weeks ago which I wanted to share. I'm not certain, but here it is anyway: My login name on the GC.com site has some capital letters. On my device, I had entered my login name all in lowercase. I had 'found' some caches through the device, and these then immediately displayed the smiley icon. I later 'found' a cache through the GC.com site. I wanted to pull down the 'finding' of the cache onto the device, to get the smiley icon on the live map. However, when I used the 'refresh' option on the cache, it still didn't show as found. I tried several times with no success. It seemed as though the login name was case-sensitive as after I changed the name to have the same capitalisation on the device as on GC.com, then on the next refresh it picked up that it was a 'find'. I'm surprised if this is due to case sensitivity. Perhaps it was due to some other setting I had also changed, but it seemed for me that capitalising my login name correctly was what fixed it.
Manager.title: Found marker on cache refresh not working

Manager.description: Some relevance to other discussions of filtering, but this goes further.. In the live map, I have lots (like 5000+) caches displayed from multiple lists - holiday locations, local caches, todo caches, specific cache series, etc etc etc.. The live map just displays them ALL. It would be really handy to be able to select/deselect lists for display in the live map. e.g. "Show me the Brocklesby Hunt series list" "Show me my local caches list" "Show me just my To-Do favourites list" "Show me my lists for missing months for 2001 and 2002 for the Jasmer challenge" From the live map, the user would hit the 'more' option, and an option to 'select lists'. A list of the user's available lists would be presented, with a checkbox against each. A global select all / select none checkbox would be available too. The user can select just those particular lists they are interested in viewing, and hit 'back'. Those caches not in the user's selected lists would be excluded from the map.
Manager.title: Filter specific lists on live map

Manager.description: c:geo is great for finding caches. But.. c:geo is not so great for placing new caches. We can check for proximity - Good, mostly. We can find out our current coordinates - Yes, but not so good. We can record and display our new placement - It's possible, but not good at all. Placing caches is something I find difficult in c:geo, and I revert to other apps and pencil/paper. Is this other side of caching something c:geo is aimed at? Should it be? It would be a lot of work to add features aimed at geocache placers, but it would give users more tie-in into this app by giving them less need to go elsewhere. Checking for proximity is catered for very well. This is something c:geo does nicely with the circles on the live map. Recording / averaging our current coordinate? That's a bit trickier. The best way I can find to get our current coordinate is to open up another cache somewhere else and try to add an extra waypoint to it. From there, I can see my current coordinate and ... jot it down on a piece of paper. OK, so I can add a waypoint onto that other cache to temporarily record my placement on the device, but that's such a faff. I have to remember roughly where it is to find it again, and which cache I stored it under (which might be miles away if I'm placing a cache in a virgin area), and then I have the maintenance fuss of deleting that waypoint and moving it somewhere more permanent - back to my pencil and sheet of paper. What would be a better way? A 'My Placements' area in c:geo dedicated to storing waypoints of potential hides. This area would effectively be a stored list of caches, but these would be a different class. These 'My Placements' caches would have no GC code, would have just a UID generated by the device, would have in their simplest form just an editable title and editable notes, and would appear on the live map, perhaps with a different icon to indicate they are one of your placements rather than a real cache. For placement of multi or puzzle caches, a single 'My Placements' cache could contain multiple waypoints. The live map would show proximity circles, just as with any other type of cache. Access to view the list of 'My Placements' could be through the 'stored' section, or through the main menu, but creation of a new 'My Placement' cache would be through the 'more' section of the live map. The user would select to create a new placement, and would be given their current coordinate and allowed to enter title and notes and perhaps select some attributes. The system would allow for coordinate averaging, storing multiple samples for a point over time.
Manager.title: Record and display new cache placements

Manager.description: I would like to know how a new StaticMaps download service in background can fit into the Draft of CacheDownloadService. StaticMapsDownloadService needs to download 5 maps for each coordinate and has to decide wether coords changed or not. We have an issue to first download all maps of highest level. So we have a list for map download requests stored in db loading asynchronously in background. We also need a status page for this downloads and maybe the status "Google maps download limit reached". So what do you think. Should we separate CacheDownloadService from StaticMapsDownloadService? It is somehow a subtask but also somehow different...
Manager.title: Feedback: StaticMapsDownloadService and CacheDownloadService

Manager.description: After removal of challenges on geocaching.com the found cache count at the bottom of the main screen is 0 (at least for PM).
Manager.title: Find count is 0

Manager.description: After removal of challenges all logbook entries are showing up as "Unknown" with a red marker.
Manager.title: All log entries shown as "Unknown"

Manager.description: After removal of challenges on geocaching.com the trackables logs are not parsed.
Manager.title: Trackables logs not parsed

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC: On the list of geocaches on gc.com the "Need maintenance" attribute was changed to a red wrench instead of a red cross. Maybe we should follow that change. Right now I see, that only the overview lists changed. In cache details on gc.com there is still the red cross.
Manager.title: Needs maintenance icon changed partly on gc.com

Manager.description: When looging at the code of refactoring cache types I found that one is missing: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC3XX5J 25, Retract Listing
Manager.title: Missing log type

Manager.description: Since the gc.com update of 11.12.2012 caches which are owned AND found by a user are no longer shown as found. (e.g. caches you adopted after finding them). This caches have been identified as owned by c:geo and had a green marker in lists before. Now with version 2012.12.03 and the RC 2012.12.12 the green marker is no longer shown. Only identification as own seems to work normal (I am able to log "Disable",etc.). HTML example available on request.
Manager.title: Owned AND found caches no longer shown as found

Manager.description: HTC One X / Android 4.0.x Reading my gmail, I see a published cache notification. I click the link in the email - http://coord.info/GC4xxxx. What do you want to complete this action with - cgeo, chrome, etc - I choose cgeo cgeo spins for a while on 'Loading cache details' Error 'cgeo failed to download the cache. Unknown communication error' Same result if I try to load the cache using the GC code in the 'Search' tool. Live map with 'live' enabled also doesn't display the cache. Hmmm. I'm going to struggle to FTF this one if cgeo won't load it. I add a waypoint manually and hop in the car. I got it ten minutes after publication. Job done ;-) Now I'm trying again back at the office later on to see why I couldn't download it. This is on wi-fi with manual proxy settings. My proxy server logs show no connection attempts being made by my android. It's like cgeo isn't going through the proxy properly. Normal browser pages load fine in chrome or in other browsers on my android. My gmail loads fine over the wifi. But cgeo? Nope. I'm about 85% sure this used to work on the office wifi with the proxy, but I could be wrong. Either way, it ought to work fine through a proxy. I have full access to the company proxy server, so I know what is/isn't being blocked at the proxy level; I can see no evidence of cgeo even connecting to the proxy. Is cgeo using the wifi proxy settings properly?
Manager.title: Support Proxy

Manager.description: Using the menu "Scan QR code" from the main screen doesn't work right now. Seems like the SearchActivity can no longer handle coord.info URLs.
Manager.title: "Scan QR code" doesn't work anymore

Manager.description: (Market version from 12/12/12) I had the global cache type filter set to show only "Event Cache". I opened the live map, with the 'live' mode enabled. Lots of caches appeared with "??" markers, including many I know are traditionals. On opening one of them, the marker changed to the "traditional" marker with the smiley face and the floppy disk icon - it's one of the caches which is already in my "stored" list and already stored as "found". As I understand it, the request to gc.com should have been asking for only event caches? More than just event caches were downloaded.
Manager.title: Global cache type filter not working on live map for me

Manager.description: One more log type was found missing: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC4D 12, Unarchive
Manager.title: Missing log type

Manager.description: Some time ago the "Open in Browser" function was changed to use "http://www.geocaching.com//...". I understood this change but was it intended that also the "Share" function now uses this workaround-URL ? I think it should use the coord.info URL to allow e.g. forwarding via mail and the recipient to open it in c:geo (or another app) again.
Manager.title: Share function should use http://coord.info/ URL

Manager.description: I am not sure how this was before the recent changes on gc.com. Can someone check whether we have been able to detect PM-caches from search results before ? I can see in c:geo that when doing a nearby search premium-member caches are not identified as such. That leads to the problem (reported on facebook) that the "All Member Access" filter is useless in this case. Comparing with the website search results I can see that there is a (new) icon which indicates PM-status. I don't know whether this was in form of text before... Sadly this icon is sometimes displaced by other icons for that cache (e.g. Has TB, Needs Maintenance).
Manager.title: Premium caches not identified in searches

Manager.description: Sorry for the late report...testing time was to short after site update: Perform nearby search (BM-user) Nearby results only show the GC-code in second line, the remaining info is missing Looking at the website it should be possible to parse D/T and size as well and for PM this is working normal.
Manager.title: D/T- and size-information not parsed in nearby search for BM

Manager.description: I did some local changes to remove CacheCache. This leads me to SearchResult that does implicit save to / load from db. I suggest to refactor SearchResult. In my eyes It should only be a simple list. What do you think?
Manager.title: Feedback: Remove CacheCache / refactor SearchResult

Manager.description: Live map does not register caches as found. Logs show up, but the main page doesn't show cache as found. Seems to be an issue since the last update.
Manager.title: Found caches not showing up as found.

Manager.description: GCC is not a partner app more than other applications. The advertising should be removed from the website.
Manager.title: Remove GCC as partner app on the web site

Manager.description: Google+ link and icon should be added onto the web site, along with the Facebook and Twitter ones.
Manager.title: Add Google+ link onto the web site

Manager.description: Maps icons are currently hosted on carnero.cc. We should move them, for example on status.cgeo.org, or any site we control.
Manager.title: Hosting of map icons

Manager.description: GC2MYM0 appears as "unknown type". I know...there are not many. But as c:geo is able to filter them we should either parse them correctly or cut down on the filters.
Manager.title: GPS Cache Exhibit type not parsed

Manager.description: GC26232 is parsed as "unknown type". AFAIK all of these are archived. The filter is supporting them explicitly. So I think we should either leave it as it is or parse them as normal event caches (like it is done now for GS block party caches) and remove the filter item for "Lost and Found".
Manager.title: Lost and Found cache type not parsed

Manager.description: Looking at the many recent comments on website related issues, I feel it would make sense to make it possible for every c:geo team member to edit the website sources. I don't demand that everyone can publish them on the server, but just editing the files (and having them published regularly by mucek4) would be helpful as some issues related to the website are lying around for a long time already. As I don't exactly know what is used to generate the site, I can't really say if it makes sense to host the files directly as yet another repository under the c:geo github account.
Manager.title: Make website editable

Manager.description: Right now, the user can modify final coordinates of non-multi non-mistery caches because c:geo and gc.com backend allow that. However, that is not reflected on gc.com interface and may be confusing for the user. c:geo should refuse those changes as well. Related to #2271.
Manager.title: User should not be able to modify final coordinates for non-multi non-mistery caches

Manager.description: The upload of new coordinates can sometimes be quite long, and should be signalled by a progress indicator. Related to #2271.
Manager.title: Upload of new coordinates progress bar

Manager.description: Incorrect icon size for drawable-hdpi/cgeo.png: expected 72x72, but was 64x64
Manager.title: Icon has the wrong size

Manager.description: Related to #2271. Steps: store a multicache offline modify the coords on gc.com refresh the cache in cgeo. Note that the new Original waypoint has been added and coords have changed go to the Original waypoint and chose to Reset and choose just locally I get a dialog that never ends with title "Cache" and text "Reset cache coordinates" The last thing in log is: Loading GCXXX (1) from DB Edit: After forcing cgeo to quit from Eclipse, when reopening the cache, things look ok (Original waypoint is gone. Cache coords back to original. gc.com not modified) @triakcz
Manager.title: Endless wait when reseting cache coords just locally

Manager.description: When adding a waypoint the Box that saves the waypoint is cut off at the bottom 121912nb http://www.imgur.com/VxXgW.png
Manager.title: Save Box cut off

Manager.description: In df33031, I just fixed a NullPointerException that happened during migration of database from version 62 to version 63 as I loaded an old database and happened to see it because of an opened logcat. As we ignore those exceptions after logging them, the loop to clean up double undescore map files was interrupted prematurely but everything went normally and nobody notices. I therefore propose to make Log.e() a fatal error when the Debug settings is on. What do you think about it? We will catch much more errors this way, and also probably reduce some Log.e() into Log.w() if that does not deserve a crash.
Manager.title: Abort on Log.e() when debug is active

Manager.description: The following two caches will not load in c:geo GC430FM Cache is Unpublished GC431F2 Needle in a Haystack
Manager.title: Some caches not loading because of "Cache is Unpublished" text in description

Manager.description: I've originally saved http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC3X5R8 more than a month ago in c:geo. Now I've just refreshed it. The embedded geochecker image in the description shown in c:geo still contains 0:11 checks, which is clearly from that month ago. To me it looks like we cache that image forever, but we shouldn't.
Manager.title: network based image not updated

Manager.description: When I create a waypoint for an opencaching cache the checkbox for uploading the coordinates to the website are not shown (which is correct) but the text string is still shown:
Manager.title: "Modfiy coords on website" not hidden properly for OC-caches

Manager.description: Currently the functions of changing the cache coords locally and on website are completely independent. I think the scenario of only uploading them to the website but not setting them as cache coords locally does not make sense (i.e. after the next refresh the cache coords will be changed anyway). Vice versa makes sense of course. I therefore suggest that when the user selects 'modify coords on website' the 'set as cache coords' should be selected automatically.
Manager.title: Uploading modified coords to website should always include changing cache coords locally

Manager.description: Currently the log type "Discovered", "Visited", "Grabbed" and "Retrieved" have a green marker. The log type "Placed" and "Write note" have a grey marker. I suggest to keep the green marker for "Discovered" and "Visited" and use another green tone (maybe brighter green) for the types "Placed", "Retrieved" and "Grabbed" as these logs indicate a "real progress". Only "Write note" should stay with the grey marker.
Manager.title: Improve color markers in TB logbook

Manager.description: See TB29GGQ, logbook entry by user "holler2" from 04.11.2012. The log type is currently shown as "unknown error".
Manager.title: TB log type "Marked as missing" not parsed

Manager.description: I often want to see what has been discussed over the day in the IRC channel. But at the same time I don't want to (or even can't) have my machine run all the time and be connected. What do others think about having a bot in the channel to create a log, which one can read afterwards? I'm not sure what is the best software to do that and what could be run easily on our server...
Manager.title: IRC log bot

Manager.description: With the current release version the watchlist status seems not to be parsed from the website: Put a cache on your watchlist via gc.com Download the cache to your device in c:geo Result: It is shown as "not on the watchlist". Adding to watchlist within c:geo seems to work but also in this case the status change is not correctly shown (This is issue #1926).
Manager.title: "On Watchlist" not parsed

I reinstalled c:geo an tried some other stuff but nothing helped so far. Does anybody know this problem? thank you for your help. greetings TheWizard

Stared screenshot Non-stared placed/owned caches After the last major release and all subsequent nighlty builts I have lost the yellow star on all of my owned/placed caches.. ..... Manager.description: Some databases on people devices are corrupted: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: own: , while compiling: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude, longitude, note, own FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = ? ORDER BY _id LIMIT 100 We should detect those cases and propose too reset the database.
Manager.title: Existing corrupted databases

Manager.description: I have a suggestion: When we see the list of caches it shows a vertical bar color for caches done (green) and a orange for caches with log stored. My suggestion it's add a color for caches that we are the owner of it. Regards,
Manager.title: Suggestion: Color for own caches

Manager.description: From support mail: GC.com allows naming a related webpage. Sometimes this is used to refer to important cache information or even necessary for solving a mystery. Example: GC3BCT0 Unfortunately the link to the related webpage is not visible in c:geo. It could be added in the hint section like the spoiler-image link.
Manager.title: Have a link to "related webpage" in cache details

Manager.description: When caches are imported via GPX, they are not marked as being owned by current user. Initial discussion can be found in #2304. Options as presented by Bananeweizen: A) Move the call to setOwn() from GCParser, line 377 into the cgCache.setOwnerUserId method. Then >the flag would automatically be set when the user id of the cache is set, independent of how the cache >was created (GC parsing, GPX...). That's an improvement as the flag and the user id are then always in >sync during parsing. B) Remove the own flag completely. Instead make cgCache.own a calculated property, for which the >cache asks its connector. The flag and the user name are then always in sync, independent of >changing the user name in the app. Option B sounds best to me.
Manager.title: Caches not marked as owned when importing GPX

Manager.description: We had discussions about confirmation dialogs in several issues already. I want to suggest to not have confirmation dialogs at all, but to implement the "Gmail style" undo actions instead as described over here: http://www.vogella.com/articles/AndroidListView/article.html#listview_undoaction I'm aware that an undo will not always be possible (but in those cases we might even just defer the real action until the undo notification has gone). Your thoughts?
Manager.title: Replace confirmation by undo

Manager.description: We had some memory leak due to having reference to whole page strings in the parser, which were fixed here: 061e1e0 To avoid similar issues in the future, we might want to have a wrapper around the Matcher class, which automatically creates a new String instance for every group() result and then replace all matchers in the code base by the wrapper.
Manager.title: Have a wrapper around Matcher to avoid String related memory issues

Manager.description: Hi all, I often use c:geo on bike ... and there are some specific problems related to limited precision of control when you ride ... so I created this issue to gather all recommendations and point of view for using cgeo on bike. My biggest concern: Map .. it is very hard to click on cache icon when you can not be precise - solution can be very easy, we can create some bike mode ... when enabled, there will be menu option "select" which should open popup of cache which is nearest to center. The second problem of map is, that it is sometimes difficult to turn on autocenter (this should be too as option in menu in bike mode) Map ZOOM ... it is very problematic to zoom without picking some cache or not moving map center when you ride ... if it will be possible, we can use volume buttons for zooming too. Please provide me your point of view and some other improvements that we can do.
Manager.title: Bike mode for map

Manager.description: If you have no network connection and try to Add or Remove a cache as a favorite, you get stuck with an endless dialog. I'll submit a PR and then rework as necessary as it affects same code as in #2331.
Manager.title: No error handling for add/remove favorite failure

Manager.description: With 2012.12.18 some user complain the app crashes a few moments after starting the live map (with Google Maps). I was able to retrieve a stacktrace via PlayStore from a certain user. His scenario is, that the live map fails for one account constantly when opening, but if he changes to another account (both BM) it is working normal. java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.loadAttributes(cgData.java:1701) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.loadAttributes(cgeoapplication.java:497) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache$1.loadFromDatabase(cgCache.java:102) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.initializeList(LazyInitializedList.java:16) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.isEmpty(LazyInitializedList.java:51) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache.gatherMissingFrom(cgCache.java:293) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.saveCache(cgData.java:969) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.saveCache(cgeoapplication.java:463) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.addCache(SearchResult.java:216) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseSearch(GCParser.java:235) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.searchByAny(GCParser.java:810) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.searchByCoords(GCParser.java:825) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCMap.searchByViewport(GCMap.java:246) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByViewport(GCConnector.java:115) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.ConnectorFactory.searchByViewport(ConnectorFactory.java:81) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$DownloadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1215) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1080) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:573) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) There are more NPEs exactly like that, with all user comments more or less refer to 'live map'. I did not check whether this might be a duplicate from what @samueltardieu already opened here based on market feedback.
Manager.title: NPE when opening live map

Manager.description: We do not support multi-user mode (tablets running Android 4.2+), because in multi-user mode each user gets their own directories (accessible through Context.getFilesDir() or Context.getExternalFilesDir()) while we build the paths using Environment.getDataDirectory() and Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory(). The path we use corresponds to the primary user (for example /data/data/cgeo.geocaching), which is unaccessible by other users. The right path to use for some other user might look like data/user/10/cgeo.geocaching and will be obtained through the proper API calls. If this issue is a duplicate of an existing issue, please mark the other one as a duplicate and keep this one as a reference on the problem.
Manager.title: Support for secondary users in multi-users mode

Manager.description: When you go in the nearby section, and leave this before the results will be shown, c:geo crashs. here the report: log see also #2335 I use a Desire HD and the latest NB (2013.01.05-NBb418bcc).
Manager.title: Crash when leaving the nearby activity, before results will be shown

Manager.description: Hi all, I have an idea, as it is now obsolete to have dashboard (according to current google's recomendations) and as I use app, I discovered, that I often only skip dashboard to list of caches or active map (I don't use other options very often). I have done small test ... I added intent filter for launcher to several activities ... and it seems to be usable at least for offline list (minor change needed .. default value of type value is null ... changed to OFFLINE)and google maps activity, other map activities crash when started directly, but this could be fixed. What is your opinion on this ? If we are not dependent on going though dashboard ... we can speedup app a lot and make it much more usable. For lists it will be possible to create direct shortcuts to particular lists (the same as you can obviously create shortcuts to particular folder on SD card).
Manager.title: Direct launcher for Map/Stored caches list

Manager.description: I have a problem. I have a Nexus S with the CyanogenMod 4.2.1 rom, and when I go to a cache distance is fickle. For example, I'm 15 meters and he's always saying 15 meters and 1 km, changes alone .. what can it be? thank you
Manager.title: Distances fickle

Manager.description: Waypoint on map is not reloaded after editing. Steps: View map with some cache waypoints showing Click on cache and then go to waypoints tab and edit one of them or just click on waypoint directly and edit it After clicking Save, return back to map Click on any of the waypoints from the same cache The log show NPE and the dialog is empty If you move the map (which triggers reloading caches from database), then problem is fixed. This is what it looks like. Add relevant log: D/cgeo(16425): cgData.loadWaypoint(715) E/cgeo(16425): cgeopopup.init: java.lang.NullPointerException
Manager.title: Map waypoint popup is empty after editing

Manager.description: I have selected in the settings, that I want to use the english language. When I view a log of a cache, the language is ok. But when I rotate the display to landscape, the language will be switched back to german. Can somebody reproduce it? Use NB 2013-01.06
Manager.title: Language switchs by rotate the device

Manager.description: Currently when opening an oc.de cache the cache details show the attributes (e.g. "Parking nearby", Available 24/7",etc) only as english strings. I suggest to align this between the attribute descriptions/icons we already use for gc.com caches. A huge subset of attributes are equal, only a few attributes are OC-specific.
Manager.title: Align attributes between oc.de and gc.com caches

Manager.description: This type is shown as "unknown type" with ??-icon Example: OCCB01
Manager.title: Cache type "Moving cache" from OC.de not recognized

Manager.description: Have only the standard list available Store a cache locally. Select it in the list and then go on "Verwalten" (manage?) and try to move it to a different list. This fails, as the context menu does not show the "move to other list" item. Go to main screen, then stored caches again. Select "new list" from the menu create a new list. Go to the standard list select the stored cache as above and select "manage" in the menu again. The context menu now shows the "move to other list" item. Pressing it, shows the list of lists and an entry to create a new list. c:geo should always show the "move to other list" item, as it contains an option to create a new list.
Manager.title: Can not move items to a new list when only the standard list is present

Manager.description: It seems (after searching the strings) the referer to geocaching.com for OC-listings (on top of the description page) is hardcoded as it is not contained in the translatable strings. Anyhow I would suggest to move this information from the description page to the detail page in the line "GC-code" (which should be renamed to Geocode btw as this can not only be a GC-code).
Manager.title: String "Listed on geocaching.com" missing for translation

Manager.description: ...which can only be shown correctly on geocaching.com" is not the best for OC caches. :)
Manager.title: "This description contains table elements..."

Manager.description: When constructing the Translate menu, the following comparison is done: !Locale.getDefault().equals(Locale.ENGLISH)) This could compare a language_country pair (such as en_US) with just language (en) making the comparison always fail. It should just compare the languages. Yielded this if Use English was set in settings and set locale included a location.
Manager.title: Improper comparison of Locales when building Translate menu

Manager.description: If you search for a geocode that doesn't exist, you will see errors in the log from where we leak a window. The problem is that when loading fails, the activity is finished, but the progress dialog that was up is never dismissed.
Manager.title: Window leaks when failing to load a cache

Manager.description: Today I was thinking about the "This cache description contains table elements and may..." label that we add to caches where we are not sure if we got it right. To work around this we could store the original webpage in the cache directory (where we also store log images) and then offer an additional page in the details activity view pager where the user can look at the original stored web page (offline, not accessing the URL at that time). Do you think that would be of value? I don't have a full list of pros and cons myself yet.
Manager.title: Store original website and show as additional details view

Manager.description: From Google Play console, and reproducible. If you rotate the device while loading the details of a cache, when the progress dialog is dismissed, a crash will occur: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: View not attached to window manager at android.view.WindowManagerImpl.findViewLocked(WindowManagerImpl.java:599) at android.view.WindowManagerImpl.removeView(WindowManagerImpl.java:336) at android.view.WindowManagerImpl$CompatModeWrapper.removeView(WindowManagerImpl.java:151) at android.app.Dialog.dismissDialog(Dialog.java:321) at android.app.Dialog$1.run(Dialog.java:119) at android.app.Dialog.dismiss(Dialog.java:306) at cgeo.geocaching.activity.Progress.dismiss(Progress.java:31) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$4.handleMessage(cgeocaches.java:341) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4511) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:980) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:747) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Whoever fixes this should do it in the release branch.

Manager.description: For event caches, if there is already a "will attend" log by the current user, then the initial selection in the log type field should be "attended" (to save one click of the user).
Manager.title: have "attended" as initial selection, when already logged "will attend"

Manager.description: GC.com changed icon for found caches. c:geo is no longer able to detect a found cache on live map and nearby search.
Manager.title: Found are no longer detected.

Manager.description: A 96x96 launcher icon for xhdpi resolution should be put in folder res/drawable-xhdpi. It should be added to the release branch.
Manager.title: Launcher icon for xhdpi is missing

Manager.description: I am not sure if this is a new bug (since the change of the ownership icon) we never supported it It was already in for a long time Procedure: Be sure to have non of your owned caches saved or cached Perform nearby search where one of the results is a cache owned by yourself Start logging view for your owned cache directly from result by long press on the cache Result: You will see that only the default log types but not the owner specific log type are shown Only if you open the cache details the owner logs are available (Deactivate, Archive,..) This probably means one of the following: The nearby search parsing does not return the ownership status since the change. We did never parse it from search results Its a bug elsewhere in the code that when accessing the log view from list the log types are not shown
Manager.title: Special logging types for owned caches not available from nearby result

Manager.description: Hi, I have C:GEO on my Samsung Galaxy S3. Sometimes the compass lags and show me that I am going on the opposite way. Even if I have good gps signal and nothing metalic or magnetic is near the S3. Other applications with compass are showing good data.
Manager.title: Strange behaviour of compass on SGS3

Manager.description: I first tok notice of this around December 2012 26th. CGEO could no longer load any caches. When a cache loaded, several messages appeared as usual: load cache details, load height, load etc. But then an android-message appeared: CGEO does no longer react. Sorry for this inconvenience. (translated from german, exact message maybe different). Update 2013.01.07 didn't fix this, and since Update 2013.01.10 it's even worse. CGEO now freezes completely, and so does my phone. Was this behaviour already reported? I already installed CGEO completely new, but it's all the same. Kind regards, Werner
Manager.title: CGEO freezes on Samsung GALAXY S GT-I9000

Manager.description: I can currently reproduce a database crash which leads to immediate deletion of the database. I'm not sure if this is specific for my device or a general bug. If you want to try, first create a backup of your database. Then open the VisitCacheActivity for a cache and tap one of your inventory items listed at the bottom. Manager.description: The last few days I am often experiencing that on startup of c:geo an empty notification box is shown for some seconds. I am quite sure, that with older versions the box was never shown when empty but only visible together with a notification. Did something change in the code with respect to the notification ?

Manager.description: When rotating the device while on any of the cache detail pages (Waypoint, Description, Logbook,...) the view jumps back to the details page but the footer still indicates the page which was active before rotating the device. So, two problems here: In the ideal case the view should not be reset when rotating but stay on the active page The footer should be aligned Example: Logbook was active in landscape and I rotated the device. Now the details-page is shown but it is still labeled "Logbook".
Manager.title: View pager jumps back to details on device rotation

Manager.description: I'm trying to refresh some caches from the map. This is something that can be done already, but it is awkward to do. It could be simpler. I'm in the live map, but with live disabled (I rarely use the 'live' part of the live map). I'm about to set off round a 5 mile circular walk, picking up 20+ caches. I know I might not have much connectivity out in the field, and even if there's good 3G signal I'd rather save my pennies and not use it. I stored them on the device weeks or months ago, and I'd like to make sure I have the latest logs and see if any are disabled etc. So I want to refresh the caches that are in the bounding box of the screen. I don't want to refresh everything with a full gpx import - I just want the ones on the screen. Now, I can do this. To do it, I have to turn on the 'live' part of the live map, and then wait for it to download the details of all the caches, which ought to be unnecessary since they're already stored. Since they're already stored, it's hard to know whether it is done with downloading them again in the background or not. A couple of minutes later and it might allow me to choose the 'show as list' option. It occasionally won't, because it's stuck downloading something I don't need. If it does let me 'show as list', then I can ask it to 'store' them, after which it will move them into my 'Stored' list, taking them out of the lists that I had spent much time sorting them into. Alternatively, I can faff about setting up a very narrow pocket query to generate a gpx of just the ones I need to refresh. Similarly awkward. I shouldn't really have to turn on 'live' mode to be able to use the 'show as list' function. It ought to be always available to use, showing a list of what's on the screen. The 'live' mode is I'm sure useful if you've got an unlimited data tariff, but I expect many users prefer the gpx import approach. If 'live' is enabled then great, but if not then that's no reason to not allow me to list the caches on the screen. Show as list should show just what's on the screen, as a list - It shouldn't include 50 other 'found' caches in that list that were filtered out on the screen because of the 'exclude own and found' option. I'd like to be able to 'refresh' the caches in-place, not store them back into the default 'Stored' list, or at least be given the option to choose whether to leave them where I filed them or to drag them back to 'stored'.
Manager.title: Improve 'show as list'

Manager.description: As we now can download oc.de caches directly, an adaption of send2cgeo for opencaching.de would be a good idea (as was mentioned in #1334)

Does it make sense for you?

Manager.description: Is there any reason we generate GPX 1.0 file? The 1.0 format was standardized in 2002, and was superseded in 2004 by GPX 1.1. See http://www.topografix.com/gpx.asp I propose to switch to GPX 1.1. Any remark?

When I add a waypoint (eg. station of a multicache) and enter coordinates in "simple" mode, then the current coords are shown using ',' as the comma, but when I enter a coordinate using ',' the fractional part is set to '000'. Example: When adding a waypoint, the coordinate entry (simple mode) shows: N 48° 12,345 Now I change it to N 48° 11,345 (note, that it only occurs when the ',' is re-entered) When I save, it shows N 48° 11,000

I did not try this but the report from the user sounds reasonable.

Manager.description: This ia my scenario: have all the caches on my country (about 2000) loaded into cgeo in a named list, via gpx import. Next create another list and import into it all the caches in and around my home town, about 300. All the cahes in the second list already existed in the first list, but i wanted to have them separately for managemnt, usabiliy and responsiveness reasons. However, as soon as i imported the 300 in my home town list, the country list shows 300 less caches. This is something unexpected especially since before cgeo i did my geocaching with Pathaway, which has an excellent point database management system. Is this a bug or a feature? In my opinion it is a bug. Following an email discussion with Tomaž from c:geo support, he directed me to report it on the issue tracker. See below. If this is a limitation, that a cache can be stored in a single list only, kind of defeats the purpose of having different lists, that is a way to categorize caches and handle sets of caches differently. Sets which may contain some caches that are the same. Given the current implementation, the user has little control over the caches in the lists, because an import in another list that contains an existing cache will move that cache automatically from one list to the other. I do not think this is what any user would expect. (besides the fact that loading several larger lists will make the user completely lose track of which cache got where.) Considering these, I whish to submit this issue as a feature request to remedy a design flaw.
Manager.title: A geocache can only exist in one list ?

Manager.description: Currently our search by address is invoking a search by keyword on GC.com (as this is basically what the website does itself also). I suggest to change this. We already resolve the address using the Google address resolver to present the user a list of potential matches. During this process we already get all the longitude and latitude information and could directly run a search by coordinate instead. This would also fix the issue that a search by address currently does not return any results from OC. Any comments or shall I just go ahead?
Manager.title: change search by address

Manager.description: With NB2013.01.26 the app did not show any waypoint of the cache GC33HXE after opening/saving it. The release version is showing the waypoints correctly. Did not have time to check other with other caches.
Manager.title: Waypoints not loaded from website

Manager.description: Right now, we use an "id" to identify the waypoint, which is the row id in the database. Not only this will not survive a backup/restore which does not copy the database, but also it duplicates information: the prefix and lookup code are both unique for a given geocode. We should use a couple (geocode, prefix) (or (geocode, lookup)) to identify a waypoint uniquely.
Manager.title: Use waypoint prefix (or lookup code) instead of id

Manager.description: Hi all, I have one idea for making c:geo usage more friendly for users with slow connection(I hope that I'm not alone). Just to imagine how it should work ... we can have options how to save cache for offline (soft,all) where soft saving means downloading/parsing just a bit of data - coordinates, cache type, cache name (it is sufficient for displaying cache on map/in lists). When you open that cache it can automatically download the rest of data (or it can be downloaded by refreshing). This will dramatically speedup live-map and make geocaching easier, and there will be one advantage for gc.com servers ... it will save some bandwidth, because users which are now downloading all caches with all content can switch to this method. I'm not sure if this can work in current design of c:geo and how about UI of this function.
Manager.title: Feedback needed: "Soft save for offline"

Manager.description: Hi, I'm using self compiled version (now it is same as yesterdays master) and I have discovered one inconsistency (I don't know if it is regression or not, never noticed before). When you create field note (just by log offline -> Found) from list, active map popup, cache details ... it works correctly, but when you try to submit that field note ... Log visit offline -> log visit -> (loggging window) -> Send log button it depends where you start this sequence ... when it is started from cache detail activity it is ok ... it deletes associated field note (cache is not visible in list where you put filter status->offline log prepared) if it is started from list (long press) or map (cache popup) it sends log online, but never removes that associated field note additionally - field note is not clearable in that case by clicking on clear in offline logging menu
Manager.title: Not deleting field note (offline log) after submitting online

Manager.description: When loading the standard list I get an OOM. I managed to get around this by lazy loading shortdescription and hint - like desciption already. But this will be just a delay from the next OOM again when I add more caches. Q: is this change of any interest? Or shall we just accept that there is always a limit by memory depending on the particular device and number of caches one uses? I know it's ridiculous to have so many caches stored in ONE list. But this is the case for me just now... I'm in New Zealand and there are many places without cell phone reception so I decided to generate PQs for the whole country. I'll have to tamper with the db directly to move them to different lists automatically. How to make multiple PQs automatically: https://github.com/koem/pqauto
Manager.title: OutOfMemory when 13000 caches in DB

Manager.title: GPX Export traceback

Manager.description: http://blog.opencaching.de/2013/02/opencaching-de-neue-datenlizenz/
Manager.title: Add copyright note to OC connector

Manager.description: "GC-Code" has been replaced by "Geocode in some parts already. However in cache details and on map popup still "GC-Code" is used, which is correct for GC.com caches but not the correct term for caches from other platforms. I suggest to either replace it by "Geocode" generalls or set the correct label depending on platform type.
Manager.title: Replace "GC-Code" by "Geocode"

Manager.description: Currently a popup opens when you scroll to the image page in cache details. But what if you want to scroll to the trackable page? Then you must wait or press "back" first. I'd suggest to either hide the popup or load images only on request (maybe the user wants to use c:geo offline).
Manager.title: Image page: load on click

Manager.description: I don't know who is administrating the bot, so I open an issue as reminder: Since 2013.02.19 the bot stopped loggging and is no longer online in the channel #cgeo at freenode.
Manager.title: IRC logging bot is not running

Manager.description: @mucek4 needs to push a new bugfix release to market for the linked milestone. 3 bugs have been fixed by rsudev, lineflyer and myself this night, detected by our unit tests. Maybe there are additional changes on the site which where not detected by our tests. Therefore some more manual testing with the nightly is needed.
Manager.title: Push new bugfix release to market

Manager.description: Just recognized that login is not possible to geocaching.com account. Didn't try via WiFi, so can't say if it's a network problem. Any suggestions?
Manager.title: No login possible to geocaching.com

Manager.description: I have an idea to reduce refresh of static maps for waypoints: I can add the hashcode of the coords and waypoint type to the filename. Only if the coords or type changes, the map has to be refreshed. This could be an easy change. Maybe cache map can be handled similar. Of course this has to take care of the waypoints shown on cache static maps. What do you think about?
Manager.title: Static Maps: Only load if necessary

Manager.description: Sometimes when using the satellite view the cache marker is in the way and covers essential areas. Especially when zoomed in to the max. It would be great if you could be able to toggle the cache marker so it just becomes a tiny dot/crosshair.
Manager.title: Ability to toggle size of map marker

Manager.description: When loading a TB no Logs are Displayed. NB from 22.02
Manager.title: No Logs on TB Page

Manager.description: I had a discussion with some OKAPI people, and we miss to load cache descriptions of multi-lingual caches in the users language. Example German/Dutch: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5177 Example Dutch/English: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5199
Manager.title: Load OC caches in preferred language (OKAPI)

Manager.description: From support mail: I would like to plan my caching trips with c:geo. Currently the plugin does only allow adding event caches at the date of the event. It could be a cool extension to just allow adding a calendar entry for all caches types (asking the user about the date and time in that case).
Manager.title: Allow calendar entry also for non-event cache types

Manager.description: Today I was doing a multi-cache where I got coordinates in DDMMSS-style, e.g. with 23.4''. When entering them in our dialog, the fractional part as '4' it was interpreted as '004', which surprised me (and took a while to notice). Even if I think this interpretation would be well aligned with my expectations regarding fractional minutes (the three digits are so 'standard' to me that I simply do not see them as fraction). I'd rather not prepend trailing zeros for fractional seconds. What do you think?
Manager.title: Edit coordinates: treatment of fractional seconds

Manager.description: In case approximated coords have been loaded (orange circle) and later a implicit nearby search is performed (strategy Detailed and caches move to map center) the orange circle stays and the cache location is not updated. Once you invoke rhe popup for the cache and close it again, the cache jumps to the correct position and the orange marker is gone. NB 2013.02.22
Manager.title: Cache location not updated

Manager.description: If I open the logging page for a cache my inventory is listed below. Trying to click on the listed TBs I always get the message "c:geo kann den gewünschten Trackable ncht anzeigen. Ist es wirklich einer ?". I am sure this worked approx. two weeks ago. Maybe a problem after gc.com site update or some change in the app. NB2013.02.24
Manager.title: TB can not be opened from log view

Manager.description: If I open the logging page for a cache my inventory is listed below. Trying to click on the listed TBs I always get the message "c:geo kann den gewünschten Trackable ncht anzeigen. Ist es wirklich einer ?". I am sure this worked approx. two weeks ago. Maybe a problem after gc.com site update or some change in the app. NB2013.02.24
Manager.title: TB can not be opened from log view

Manager.description: When using offline maps, if I switch maps, the zoom and center changes on the map. Sometimes it is impossible to recover without backing out and restarting the map. I use C:Geo version 2013.02.21 on a Samsung Galaxy S3. The maps I use are the massachusetts and new hampshire maps from 0.30 on mapsforge. If I am in the map inteface and switch the map from massachusetts to new hampshire, the display zooms in on Concord NH with a fairly high zoom. Likewise going from new hampshire to massachusetts, it zooms in on downtown Boston. From a caches Navigate>>Map menu, this makes it painful to recover. Depending on the distance, it is often easier to backout and re-enter Navigate>>Map. On the stored map view, this also appears to override the center map on current location feature. Thank you. Even with these hiccups, I really enjoy the ability to use offline maps.
Manager.title: mapsforge recenters/zooms when switching maps

Manager.description: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=cgeo.geocaching
Manager.title: Icon has no transparent background in Google Play

Manager.description: Hi, what if we ourselves provide downloads for maps for the users? As I understand, we have a server on our hands and I bet it is idling around most of the time. And mapsforge doesn't provide downloads for some countries yet. For example Thailand is not on their list. a) generate (missing) maps with osmosis on a regular basis and link to available downloads on mapsforge b) add links in settings to open cgeo-download pages (and mapsforge) c) in a later stage we could even integrate the download into c:geo Wouldn't it be cool if cgeo.org is the most complete download server for mapsforge maps in the world?
Manager.title: provide maps to users

Manager.description: is that possible to do a filter caches by a bookmark , i think it will be interesting to implement on c:geo
Manager.title: filter

Manager.description: From facebook and I also see this change of behavior in the nightlies: Create a new WP Tap on coordinate field to open the coordinate input dialog The dialog will appear centered on screen instead of on the top of the screen, thus (depending on the device) overlapping with the keyboard which is now opened Change coord format (e.g. from DDD MM.MMM to DDD MM SS.SSS) Now the input dialog is correctly reinitialized on top of the screen. This was previously also done at first start of this dialog.
Manager.title: WP coord input no longer placed on top of screen

Manager.description: As mentioned in #1317 there is the functionality of send2gps on gc.com which returns reliable coords as well as some other details like cache description,etc. It is available for all members. Example: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/sendtogps.aspx?guid=881f33d9-9df9-4d2f-b229-35b621b044b9 I would like to ask you if there could be any good strategy to use this within c:geo. Especially I am thinking about the approximated coords on live map. As suggested in #1317 it could be used to retrieve precise coords in case the popup is called. Or we could even implement it fully into the live map... What do you think ? My opinion: Integrating it fully into the live map is a touch too far away from a browser behaviour but for the user initiated popup this is a real good option and would solve many user complaints.
Manager.title: Usage of send2gps - Feedback requested

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Hint doesn't refresh

Manager.description: Found in NB 2013.02.27: Go to the list of saved caches Select an unfound cache and start logging Write a log and leave the logging page (not saving manually so autosave is applied) Returning to the cache details it shows "Saved log" Returning to the list the oranger marker line is not shown. It is only shown after leaving/reentering the list In case this procedure is done with explicitly saving the log the orange marker is OK, so this does only happen for the "auto save" procedure.
Manager.title: Offline log marker not shown after log autosave

Manager.description: Yesterday I uploaded a log image. The log entry was added to the logs but the image was not added to the image list.
Manager.title: Log image not added locally

Manager.description: We scale images on download to fit the display. Can we also scale images for upload to reduce mobile data?
Manager.title: Scale log image for upload

Manager.description: When updating a stored OC.de cache, the content of the cache description is doubled.
Manager.title: Updating a OC.de cache doubles the cache description

Manager.description: Following on the discussion #2533 and dependent on the decision about that. Some users will not understand why uploading with photo takes ages for them. So what about a progress indicator if technically possible (in %). Or we could have a warning toast message if the image exceeds a certain size, which states "You attached a highres image. Uploading might take a long time depending on your mobile connection".
Manager.title: Picture upload progress indicator or warning on huge size

Manager.description: Reported from facebook and I am now in contact with the user to get a log: With my username 359° I am not able to login with cgeo. Using another account on the same phone under same conditions is possible.
Manager.title: Special character login problem

Manager.description: This is not a big deal however I can not do this via github GUI easily. It will be no problem for someone with real skills. There have been comments on support mail, that users don't know how to display waypoint on maps. We have a setting "Show waypoints on Live map". In fact that is not only valid for the live map but for any kind of map. This is useful but can not be recognized by the menu name. Could someone who has a free minute please remove the term "Live" from that string in all languages ?
Manager.title: Waypoint limit setting string should be renamed

Manager.description: On my PR #2550 as a fix for #2507 I found that refreshing on StaticMapsActivity causes cgeo to stop due to a network access on main thread. This is not relating to my changes in #2550 but still exists for a longer time now showing up.
Manager.title: StaticMapsActivity - Exception on menu / refresh action
