Manager.description: If I got it right the import functionality of personal notes from GC.com creates waypoints of type "reference point" for each detected coordinate string. Would be a nice feature when the import could identify coordinates tagged with keywords to create other types of waypoints during import from GC.com E.g. personal note: "Parking area at PARKING=N 50° 40.666E 006° 58.222 My calculated final coordinates: FINAL=N 50° 40.777E 006° 58.111 Get some ice cream at N 50° 40.555E 006° 58.000" Import creates one waypoint of type "parking area", one of type "final" and one of the default type "reference point"
Manager.title: Create individual types of waypoints when importing personal note from gc.com

Manager.description: the settings are set wrongly and the file deletion does not work
Manager.title: Unit test for WP hash codes fails

Manager.description: I don't completely understand this bug report from support mail and thus can not test it. Maybe someone else knows, what is meant here: Using the latest version. When user changes their GC username the open profile link fails with 404 error as it's not opening the users updated id. It also stops showing your own caches as it doesn't match the user ids up.
Manager.title: Open profile link and open owned caches fails if user changed his name

Manager.description: I've been using both c:geo and my browser is registered for send 2 c:geo and device has been recognized with pin number. Having clicked the send to device button on my browser and the Import from the Web button on my device, the devices c:geo home screen now shows 6 stored. But when clicking on the stored button on the device, nothing appears. Clicking between 'All caches' and 'Stored' (which shows a [6]) still doesn't resolve the problem. Whats going wrong?
Manager.title: send 2 c:geo caches aren't appearing on device..

Manager.description: Feature Request: Right now it is possible to sort caches by the absolute number of fav-points received. To get an even better ranking of the best geocaches, sorting by a "Wilson score confidence interval" would be very useful. On http://project-gc.com (menu Cache stats) you can see a comparison of various methods.
Manager.title: Sorting caches by "Wilson score confidence interval"

Manager.description: Testing Release 2013.03.13-NB-787597e The stored lists are not working. If the user goes into the lists, then chooses another list from the drop down menu, the name of the list changes, but the list itself does not.
Manager.title: Stored Lists Not Working

Manager.description: Save a cache nearby to you Add a custom waypoint with nearby coordinates to it Verify on live map you see the cache and the created waypoint (live map wp limit setting >0 of course) Delete that cache from your lists Open live map and move and pan around a bit => Cache is gone but the WP suddenly appears again Possibly linked to #2558 ?
Manager.title: Waypoints of deleted caches shown on live map

Manager.description: Today I did some spontaneous caching with live map. Zooming out to 1km and driving loaded several aproximated (orange circled) caches. Zooming to 800m I wanted to get updated coords by opening popup and going back to map. The cache display didn't seem to change on live map. But I got a second cache overlay (without orange circle) below the first almost invisible. I bet, both caches are in the list. NB 2013-03-12
Manager.title: Doubled cache icon after details popup

Manager.description: Reproducable: go to search page enter an invalid trackable code GD1EG8 click on search trackable popup shows failure field content not editable
Manager.title: Trackable field not editable after invalid search

Manager.description: Found with NB 2013.03.14: Perform nearby search 20 results are returned (as usual) The headline shows Nearby[45] for me After loading the next 20 results it shows [65] So it seems it is counting wrong by +25 (at least in my case)
Manager.title: Cache count in nearby search is wrong

Manager.description: Caches on lists should be initially sorted by distance. After opening the lists or changing between lists I can see, that caches are not sorted by distance initially but seem random. Waiting for some seconds the order suddenly changes to the correct distance sorting. The appearance of this problem seems to be depending on the GPS status for me. If I only work on "coarse location"(i.e. no GPS fix, but position by WLAN/Network) the delay is as described. If GPS signal is fixed the list opens in random order as well but immediately gets resorted. The distances shown in the list are correct at any time, so there seems to be another glitch causing this. NB 2013.03.16-NB1
Manager.title: Sorting not OK after opening/changing list

Manager.description: in the nightly build ion my TAB is no configmenu. Jelly Bean on Samsung Note 10.
Manager.title: no Configmenu

Manager.description: Everytime i input coordinates to a waypoint, and then try and navigate to that waypoint using the map, the app crashes. it will navigate to existing waypoints such as parking but won't work on custom ones, i.e. multi caches where i have entered the coords manually. I am running version 2013.02.21 on a HTC One X (Android 4.1.1)
Manager.title: App crashes everytime i try and navigate to a custom waypoint using map

Manager.description: Description There is no directory choser in the offline map directory settings. Steps to reproduce Store a map in /sdcard/Locus/mapsVector Open c:geo Settings --> Offline Maps Press ... Result Only the maps stored in /sdcard/Locus/mapsVector are shown as a list Expected A directory chooser where you can select the directory with map files. Not sure if bug or feature request, so I selected both.
Manager.title: No directory chooser for offline maps

Manager.description: Idea of a user: Currently on the cache-detail screen the coordinate format can be changed by tapping onto the coordinates. On the waypoint tab however this is not working, but you have to edit the waypoint, use the dropdown selection to change the format and read it from the editor window. It would be a useful addon and an alignment of the user interface if this one click conversion would also work on the waypoint tab. Usecase: For car navigation the car does only accept DMS and you have to first edit the parking waypoint before you can use the coordinates in you car navigation each time.
Manager.title: Support one click coordinate conversion also on waypoint tab

Manager.description: This was probably in since a long time but not relevant as logging was fast: While a log is being posted (including a picture it might take some time) I tend to tap on the screen to keep it alive. If I tap outside the upload progress window it disappears but the uploading process is still running (as after a while my log is visible on the website).
Manager.title: Log progress dismissed when tapping on screen

Manager.description: It look like it is trying to arrange the list somewhat by distance but it obviously fails.entry which is far away is followed by an entry which is very close. It almost seems random how things are arranged.
Manager.title: sorting by distance does not work

Manager.description: would be nice, if at least the visible thinks like logs will be updated, if an user isn't premium anymore. afaik accessing logbook is the same for premium/non premium.
Manager.title: Updating stored premium cache when not premium

Manager.description: I described something like this already in #2178 but right now I am quite sure what has happened. Today I had the following experience: Started c:geo, waited for Login OK Opened live map and went for a cache Logged the cache from live map popup and returned to live map Then I decided I need a warm up before going for the next cache, thus I "closed" c:geo with the home button on my device Approx 30-50 minutes later I "restarted" c:geo via the normal launcher icon on my home screen It came up immediately with the live map (where I left it) After I moved a bit a reload was triggered and suddenly all my found caches are showing up without found marker (I hide them by default). So it seems the login has expired but c:geo still loads data from the live map as "anonymous" user. We should be able to catch the fact, that the live map is not longer working in "logged in" mode before loading anything from it. Side effect of this: The caches loaded accidently remain in cachecache and thus bother the user until next "cold start" of c:geo.
Manager.title: Login expired after return to c:geo

Manager.description: I can not reproduce that, but a user of the version 2013.03.24-RC-678280b is reporting this on facebook: Download new version but when I go into settings the display is all black on black with boxes some checked. I use the light skin. Device: Motorola Droid x2 Android 2.3.5 I asked whether other parts of the app are also affected. => All parts are affected..
Manager.title: Light skin not working

Manager.description: There is not enough network input sanitisation. I can look on this, but not now. The problem is, that sometimes you can be connected to wifi network which redirects all http traffic to some page, where you have to insert password. If you are connected to such wifi ... and try to log a cache ... cgeo crashes, instead refusing to log online. (I have suspection that it is something related to trackables, because it works for short period of time (you can type one word or so)).
Manager.title: Crash when openning logging screen if connected to wifi network with captive portal.

Manager.description: It was sorted in the other direction before. btw: Where's the regression label? As you can see the ordering switches directly after taking the screenshot. I can observe the same behavior in other ("real") lists, but they are re-ordered a few ms later.
Manager.title: History sorted from oldest to latest

Manager.description: There are already some "add" entries in the menu: Signature, add, smilies.
Manager.title: Move "add photo" button to menu

Manager.description: I don't know whether it is so simple as said in the topic, but at least some users on support mail and facebook said, that it should be possible by simply uploading it there.
Manager.title: Publish c:geo in Blackberry "app world"

Manager.description: Hi all, today I had some problems with integrity of my SD card. It is not connected to c:geo, but it pointed me to this ... there is .cgeo directory (used as cache, storage of cgeo sqlite backup and ...) ... there were about 3000 directories, but I have only 900 caches stored. How this is maintained ? I feel that it is "write-only", saved when needed, but never deleted.
Manager.title: Cached images handling

Manager.description: This problem seems to be similar to but more severe as #2527 If I select to edit the personal note The window looks like this ("Reise" is the note content): Once I tap into the note window the note content is covered by my keyboard and due to the unusual window design (#2121) I am not able to move it to see what I am writing:
Manager.title: Personal note editing problem

Manager.description: Typos ought to be fixed in string names. However, doing it during the release process is a bad idea since translators may be actively working on localized files, and the changes must happen in all files simultaneously. favorite / favourite: pick one aquire -> acquire There are others that I forgot to note.
Manager.title: Typos in `strings.xml`

Manager.description: Hi, my problem is: I have a list in C:Geo with caches I want to find in the next weeks. These caches have been moved by myself from the "standard" list towards the "todo" list. If I import the weekly pocket query with caches from my area, the caches from the list "todo" are also moved back towards the "standard" list. Is there any chance to keep the "todo" list AND import the current pocket query?
Manager.title: Import Pocket Query - Listed items change

Manager.description: From facebook: User Hi c:geo, [...] something else: The last 3 days I also noted a strange behaviour: refreshing a single off-line cache led to a never ending process (waited for 10 minutes). After cancelling the refresh and reopening the cache it appeared that the cache was already refreshed. first i thought thus was the connection, but it happened at least 3 times today and some more times yesterday. May be it is related to the new version? Thanks. Response by c:geo: Any example GC-code ? Did you select to save log images for offline use in the settings ? (Depending on the amount and size of those log pics this might take a while). What state was shown in the progress (e.g. "Reading logs", "Render view") ? User: i am using save images, like before. With the wifi it is working now, but it seems to take much more time than before. 'weergave genereren' (generating display) takes the time the other part is fast. One example is GC2CN97, another is GC2EBD5 (has only 4 photo's). I am not at home, but the wifi seems pretty fast itself as we watched television on my laptop (not at the same time ;-)). Downloading multiple caches for offline storage is also slow. I can check next week at home to see the difference.. another test: GC1YDMB, more than 5 minutes. I used speedtest and the download avarage is here 2250 kbps. could be my connection? And some more tests: my girlfriend has the same device gti 9070. She still has the old version so i synchronized settings regarding c:geo and refreshed some caches at the same time. The old version was always 2 to 3 times faster. also downloading 3 new caches is at least three times faster in the old version. Please let me know if you need more info. In my opinion the reasons could be one or both of the following: The new version is somehow slower, but this does not match my testing experience It is a slow connection in combination with "Save log images" activated. This is valid at least for GC1YDMB as it has a lot of photos. Any other opinions ?
Manager.title: Performance issue when storing caches

Manager.description: Or is it possible and i might be blind?
Manager.title: Option to show waypoints of saved caches (eg. final cache waypoints!)

Manager.description: Today I was completely confused by our user interface. When I edited coordinates in the wild and afterwards tried to save them, I thought the application was hanging. In reality what happened was that the editing dialog was consuming 2/3 of my screen, with the waypoint activity still visible in the background. But the foreground and background are really hard to distinguish, which is why I tried to scroll down (below the radio buttons of the background waypoint activity) to see the save button of the dialog. (will attach screenshot) That's why I suggest to convert the coordinates dialog into an activity instead.
Manager.title: convert complex dialogs to activities

Manager.description: When I open c:geo, my standard geocaching.com language (german) is set to english, so the app can work. This should be reset when c:geo is closed/logged of. I have to manually reset it now.

Manager.description: After opening GC42MEW and sliding to the image tab, two of the three images are not loaded. Only x placeholder is showing up. Same when opening them directly from log tab. On the website it is ok.

Manager.description: With the current RC-version I hav a strange problem today: Perform nearby search 20 results are returned Open several caches from this result (and also store some of them) After return to the cache result the next 20 results see to be loaded each time So after some browsing in the results I finally wondered that the result has grown to 140 caches without selecting to load more results It is not clearly reproducible for me, but has something to do with leaving and reentering the result list. Is this related to #2607 and therefore possibly alreaddy fixed ?
Manager.title: Nearby search automatically loads more results

Manager.description: Ŵith the new RC from 2013.03.30 it is not posible o load more search results. Tapping the button at the bottom of the list only produced a short flash of the progress indicator but no more results are loaded.
Manager.title: Load more results not working

Manager.description: According to this tutorial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XNF8pXr6whU I've create a thumbnail animation for our main screen. See the video above to get an idea of the visible effect. I'd like to add that to our next version (to the main activity only). The performance of opening another activity seems to be the same as before to me. The visual difference is that the new activity does not popup from the center of the main screen, but from the icon that was touched. And that the icon resizes (and fades out) to the new activity, all of that very fast (and remember, we use black/white backgrounds, so it is much less obvious than in the video with the colored backgrounds). If you don't look closely, you might not even actively notice the difference. It is more a subtle hint from where you opened the new activity, so it might support learning the UI.
Manager.title: thumbnail animation for main screen

Manager.description: The URL for a cache when sharing on Twitter is wrong: http://www.geocaching.com//seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GCxxxx One slash too much directly after www.geocaching.com. A good idea could be using the short URL for the caches: http://coord.info/GCxxxx Cheers, Martin
Manager.title: Twitter URL not correct

So when you rely on GC's function, what does this mean exactly? It would be good for the whole community to have a good documentation. best regards Frank

As the menu is still usable I set this issue to prriotiy "low".

She showed me other screenshots where the east coordinate was wrong the same way. I assume the true coordinate before calculation for display was a very little bit less than N 50 00,000.

The functionality "share using barcode" generates a QR code with a URL that looks like this: http://www.geocaching.com//seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC40 The "scan geocode" functionality says "Didn't find any geocode in the scan result." and displays the URL. Maybe the issue here is the double slash // behind the domain name.

Manager.description: I installed the current nightly build (2013.04.03-NB-05e241c) and noticed that Twitter sharing (when logging a found) does not work anymore. Even re-authorization of the Twitter app does not help.
Manager.title: Twitter UI not shown in master

Manager.description: I tried the photo upload function when logging a found cache with yesterday's nightly build and I am really really excited. But is it possible to upload a resized (smaller) version of the photo? Maybe it is already done, maybe it is done by Geocaching.com (my guess), as the photo there is "only" 2048 pixel width and has a little bit less than a megabyte. Here it is 3264 pixels width and about 3.5 megabytes. It took me very very long (2-3 minutes) to log the cache, and I had perfect UMTS reception. Cannot think how this would be with just GPRS/EDGE. Anyway, I think almost a megabyte size and 2048 pixel width is too much in my eyes and also kills data volume on limited mobile data plans, so an option in c:geo to shrink the photo to a selection of specific image and/or file sizes before uploading it can make sense for many people.
Manager.title: Upload a resized version of photo to log

Manager.description: When taken a photo for the log it is saved on the primary SD card in the Pictures/cgeo directory, at least for my device (Samsung Galaxy Note). An option in c:geo would be nice to choose the directory. Either the default directory where photos go taken with the "normal" Android photo app or an alternate directory.
Manager.title: Save taken photos to different directory

For now I used the new feature to set the state of this waypoints to visited. This is nice, but they are still visible.

Manager.description: If an Android keyboard completes a name and inserts a space at the end of the username to search caches of, this space will be transmitted to gc.com as well and no caches will be found. Search fields should be trimmed.
Manager.title: Search input should be trimmed before being sent

Manager.description: Hi, Just for discussion topic ... I have one idea ... which can make our life easier. What about little redesign to CacheCache. Now when you modify anything in Geocache object, waypoint ... etc, you have to call cache.saveToDatabase(...), otherwise your changes will not persist. I have one idea ... to have CacheCache as singleton in our app and modifying models in that way, that it automatically track changes and set "commit interval" like it is being on filesystems. For example: you query cache by GC code from database => it is not in cache, so it will be loaded from db and sets it's validity to current timestamp and modified flag to false you modify it by calling some setter on it or on its childs (for example you add waypoint) model itself sets modified flag to true changes will be written back to db, by background thread, which will go through cache and write all changed objects and reset their modified/validity state on destruction of CacheCache (or the whole app), the same procedure applies (It's just and idea ... and to make it useful, it is needed to think more about it). But the main advantage will be in separating other code and caching handling. It can be good to look simultaneously on content providers and just think about creating content provider backed by CacheCache, which will provide all data to our (but not necessary only our) app, in future it can lead to creation of third party plugins.
Manager.title: CacheCache improvement

Manager.description: Hi, I had discovered one funny bug caused by localisation of distance unit names. When it is localised, it is not possible to project waypoints (distance). So .. should i remove that localised names ... or modify code, that it will be controlled by selector position, not by strings ?
Manager.title: Not possible to project waypoint, when distance units are localised

Manager.description: User message: Stopped while trying to set gpx folder to external card Version: 2013.04.03 Trace: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.files.SimpleDirChooser$OnTextViewClickListener.onClick(SimpleDirChooser.java:165) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:2500) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:9117) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:130) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:3683) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:867) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:625) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

Manager.description: -> Make an offline log and attach an image. -> Close the log screen, and open the log again. -> The image you attached earlier isn't attached to the log anymore.
Manager.title: Images attached in offline logs not attached when you go back to the log

Manager.description: It would be nice to have a button somewhere that allows you to batch submit all offline logs you made.
Manager.title: Button to batch submit all pending offline logs

Manager.description: Today I talked to a friend who tried 2 times uploading a log (including an image) and got an error message both times. Afterwards, his log entry was there 2 times in the cache log, but without images. So probably we show an error "Log upload failed", although in reality only the image upload of the log failed.
Manager.title: "Log upload failed" error, but log was uploaded

Manager.description: Due to the upcoming release of OKAPI on opencaching.de I would like to replace the current oc11xml-based access to opencaching.de by access via OKAPI extend the okapi client to support all c:geo operations that can be supported by the OKAPI (logging, watchlist handling, ... possibly extend c:geo to support all operations possible from OKAPI (here I have espacially the more flexible filter/search options in mind) Of course this is can only be a staged process, but for the first steps I'd like some feedback When the okapi-client allows searches and live-map, we need enabled/disabled and user-account information for all OKAPI-sites (currently pl, co.uk, us, soon de, es, it). If we put this into the settings that would make a bed thing worse... To be a good solution for oc-only users we need to be able to switch off live/search for gc.com I am unsure if it is a good idea to store the Api-keys for OKAPI in the source, or if we should get some for c:geo specifically (with c:geo eMail) and store them in some private config, like the google-maps api key. I think the first stage after replacing oc11xml should contain the logging possiblity at least and be in the next feature release. What do you think? The background implementation shouldn't be to hard (I am already very far in replacing oc11xml). What I am most unsure about is the settings part.
Manager.title: Extension of OKAPI Client

Manager.description: A facebook user reports he used to deactivate the setting "User Google Navigation" (or similar) in older releases to avoid using Google Navigation but to start another app ("co pilot" in his case). The user does now say that he does not have this possibility anymore with 2013.03.04 and the setting is no longer present. I can also confirm that the option is gone, but I do not remember the reason for it. Using the "Use external map" allows the user to open "co pilot" but does not transfer the destination coords. Does anyone know when and why this option was removed ?
Manager.title: Setting "Use Google Navigation" is gone

Manager.description: In my locale (Czech), accented characters (ěščřž...) should be sorted after their unaccented version. But in list of lists, they aren't. In the screenshot, Šatov should be between Praha and Tatry.
Manager.title: List sorting does not respect locale

Manager.description: When I open the logbook, there is no summary shown on top. c:geo 2013.04.03 Android 4.1.2 Samsung Galaxy S3 (GT-I9300) Kind regards
Manager.title: No log summary

Manager.description: In the Czech localization does not count in Any Destination - Coordinates - from this position. The announcement is: C: geo can not calculate distance. (c:geo nemůže dopočítat vzdálenost). In the English localization that works without problems.
Manager.title: C: geo can not calculate distance

Manager.description: Report from user: Store Cache Add Waypoint Delete Cache Waypoint still shown on map Not shown after 3 days anymore http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=1089493#p1089493
Manager.title: Waypoints of deleted caches shown on map

Manager.description: If the short description is the same as the start of the long description, then it should not be displayed. Example: OC49C6.
Manager.title: Don't show short description, if same as long description

Manager.description: There is an error if I try to export this (and also other) caches to a GPX file: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC4733N I think it should be easily reproduceable. IMO the important Line in the stack is: Illegal character (d83d)
Manager.title: gpx export fails GC4733N

Manager.description: The trail only disappears on next move.
Manager.title: Disable trail on map does not refresh

Manager.description: I just tried the patch from issue #2640 in the current nightly: I would appreciate having a possibility to filter out stored caches e.g. in search results. It works great. However sometimes the search result does not show full details below the cachename. ("GC... -" instead of "GC... - D 1.5 - T 1.5 - Regular - Offline") In this case the filter has no effects. If I manually open and close an offline cache the details appear. Is this an intended behavior? Is there a workaround for this?
Manager.title: Follow up: Filter out stored caches

Manager.description: Seit kurzem kann man "Persönliche Notiz" unter einer Cache-Beschreibung zwar noch antippen und da auch was schreiben, doch es gibt keine Möglichkeit mehr zum speichern, weder über Enter noch über ein "OK"-Button
Manager.title: Personal note doesn't work

Manager.description: There is a new optimization page in the developer console. Besides other things it recommends us to add tablet screenshots. So can someone with a tablet take some nice screenshots? See http://developer.android.com/distribute/googleplay/quality/tablet.html#google-play for more details.
Manager.title: get tablet screenshots

Manager.description: Our Jenkins server needs the built timeout plugin: https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Build-timeout+Plugin I just cancelled a job running for more than 3 days.
Manager.title: Jenkins needs build timeout plugin

Manager.description: We should enable the GPX import also in the virtual lists, as this seems not to be intuitive: cgeo#2595 (comment) We only need to make sure that the target list itself is not one of the virtual list, but is replaced by the standard list (or the list choosen in the dialog, if the option is active).
Manager.title: Enable GPX import in all lists

Manager.description: As mentioned elsewhere we should have as much of our activities declared instead of coded. To begin with that, I've started to introduce view injection using the butter knife library from http://jakewharton.github.io/butterknife/ Everyone using Eclipse should be fine, as the necessary IDE setup is contained in the changes. IDEA users please follow http://jakewharton.github.io/butterknife/ide-idea.html
Manager.title: Use view injection instead of view.findById()

Manager.description: Using todays nightly 2013.04.28 I opened the TB33C8K. The newest log contains two photos. If you now scroll down to some older logs you will see, that an older log seems to contain the same photos (same description) which is not the case. Furthermore if you continue to scroll up and down through the logs the link to the attached photos in the newest log is increased by an additional link each time it comes into view. (sorry, hard to describe). So finally if you continuosly scroll up and down you get more and more of the same photo link on the log entries.
Manager.title: Photos in TB-logs are multiplied in listing

Manager.description: Open details of a cache Select Navigate -> Map Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but the cache you want to view is in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so the cache is no longer in view or Open live map Your current position is shown by the marker Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but you are in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so your position is no longer in view After selection of a new map the view should be initialized at your position (live map) respectively the cache coords (cache map)
Manager.title: OSM:Offline: After selecting new map it is opend at map center but not at the previous location

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: (1. Premium user)? 2. Add personal note in c:geo 3. Do not add personal note on gc.com, leave it empty 4. Refresh cache Personal log is deleted.
Manager.title: Personal note deleted after cache refresh

Manager.description: I suggest to add a photo gallery tab. Displaying all photos from logs could be very useful. From a technical point of view, I can suggest that only thumbnails will be first retrieved. A menu action, in the tab, will download full images, if not already done.
Manager.title: Photo gallery

Manager.description: Hi guys! After the update to Android 4.1.2 of the HTC One SV the menu button is missing. I am not able to change my settings anymore. See Screenshot:
Manager.title: Menu Button is missing on HTC One SV

Manager.description: Edit Lineflyer: Topic changed to reflect issue. When I want to log a 'performed maintenance', the type on geocaching.com will be 'need maintenance'. The options are not switched because 'need maintenance' will become 'need maintenance' also.
Manager.title: Different log types and order before/after log page loading for owned caches

Manager.description: nefunguje mi zadani noveho cile podle azimutu a vzdalenosti, vzdy mi to napise ze „…c:geo nemuze dopocitat vzdalenost", pokud prepnu cgeo do anglictiny, tak to funguje does not work enter a new destination by azimuth and distance, it always write that "... c: geo can not calculate the distance", if cgeo is switched to english language, it works

Manager.description: On support mail and facebook users often claim to have the problem, that the date display in logbook (below the username) is truncated on their device. I do not have this problem, but I think it will depend on device type, font size and date format style (different separators). A user on facebook came up with the idea to just shorten the year to a two digit style in general to avoid this problem. This means to change e.g. 28.12.2012 to 28.12.12. What do you think ? Is that technically possible ?
Manager.title: Change year in logbook to two digits or adjust field

Manager.description: NB2013.05.05 Open live map Click on any cache or waypoint of a cache The popup opens completely empty
Manager.title: Popup is empty on live map

Manager.description: Originally I posted this to #1246, but it's closed issue, so I'm opening new one. My girlfriend has Huawei Ascend G300, ICS 4.0.3, and I'm not able to setup offline map on microsd. The device has internal memory in /sdcard/ and also in /mnt/sdcard/. Microsd can be found in /mnt/sdcard2/. C:geo doesn't even search /mnt/sdcard2/ and if I fill path manually (to directory only or *.map file), it doesn't accept file and the Offline map option is still grayed out. Map file is valid for sure, it works well in Locus. BTW map also worked in c:geo before - I set it up earlier in older version about half a year ago, but last week I moved it from card's root to its own directory to clean up the mess, and it stopped working and can't be set up again.
Manager.title: Offline-map search doesn't scan all storages

Manager.description: The user should not be allowed to select the checkbox of the ".." entry (or OK should be disabled, whatever is easier). This will lead to effectively unreadable pathes, like "/sdcard/..". While those can always be typed manually, we should avoid creating them using our browsing activity.
Manager.title: Don't allow to check ".." in path selection

Manager.description: It would be great to have all the cache statuses in separated checkboxes. So instead of only "exclude own and found caches" and disabled caches, have one for everyone: own, found, disabled, archived. I often want to be able to see my own caches to keep track of them, but not the ones i have found, And the archived ones probably never comes back, so i dont want to see them either.
Manager.title: Separated cachestatus filter

Manager.description: Hello, Here is the pb and the way to reproduce it. Pre-requisite : be an owner for a cache on gc.com: delete a cache waypoint in CGeo: download cache (or remove it then download it again) => the deleted waypoint is here! See cache: http://coord.info/GC3WRQT where there are only 2 waypoints on GC.com and 3 downloaded and displayed in CGEO.
Manager.title: Deleted waypoint on GC.com is not removed in c:geo (when refreshing a cache)

Manager.title: Images tab is blank after cache is updated

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: select "attended" by default, if event cache is expired

Manager.description: As I believe that the integration and rework of GCBabble is a huge effort, I've now implemented our own speaking service. Can be started and stopped from the menu of the compass (and runs as long as the compass activity only). Currently it updates the voice output every 30 seconds and tells you "11 o'clock, 270 meters". The voice output probably makes absolutely no sense in other languages than German and English, as it will use your locale for the voice, but the English text (as there are no other translations yet). Have fun.
Manager.title: Speech output in compass

Manager.description: As users have trouble finding out why there is no "edit" button. When using this on unstored caches, simply ask for storing first.
Manager.title: Enable personal note editing for unstored caches

Manager.description: The strings in the about dialog contain links. Those should be removed, so they are not part of the translation process (and cannot be modified by accident).

Manager.description: Improvement proposal for the speech output function recently integrated by @Bananeweizen : Currently a fixed interval of 30s is implemented. The GCBabble offered a settings for this (which I do not suggest to implement) and also an adaptive speaking (which does not work for me or I do not know how it is supposed to work). After thinking a bit about it my idea would be: Implement an adaptive speaking interval which triggers an output each time the distance to target has decreased or increased by a certain value and only keep the minimum interval at 30 (or 20 ?) seconds in case of no movement (distance does not change or change of distance is below the aforementioned limit). I would propose the following distance steps for that (to be discussed) assuming a walking navigation: 1000m distance: 200m 500-1000m distance: 100m 200-500m distance: 50m 100m-200m distance: 20m 0-100m distance: 10m As the speed output itself takes some time there has to be a lower limit of 5s anyway to avoid triggering the next output while the first is still running.
Manager.title: Variable speech output interval

Manager.description: The speech output is stopped if the device is rotated while on compass view.

Manager.description: May I wish for a new feature? Right now if I chose to display circles on the map, a circle is displayed around each and every feature (finals, waypoints, original coordinates). In a densely populated area the map can get rather crowded and it is hard to see which circle belongs to which object, making it difficult to find a free spot to place a new cache. It would be really cool, if the 161m-circles around caches would only be displayed around physical objects like finals (of traditionals and user-entered final coordinates of multis and mysteries) and stages of multicaches, because only with those physical stages the 161m-rule is important. You might add a new option to display circles around everything or only around physical stages.
Manager.title: Feature-Request: Circles on the map only around physical stages

Manager.description: At my last test (some months ago) GS block party caches have been parsed as event cache which is OK as they are basically events (according to log types, etc.). The current master is parsing it as unknown cache type. Example: GC3X684
Manager.title: Cache type "GS block party" no longer parsed as event cache

Manager.description: I've tried everything! Even removed the app and reinstalled it. App worked great for the first two months, now my live map will only show stored caches. Plenty of ways around this, but it still sucks.
Manager.title: zero caches on live map.

Manager.description: It's pure text now.
Manager.title: Nearby search no longer contains directional images

Manager.description: I suggest we move our location provider code to the compatibility package and only use it on devices where no google play services are available. The fused location provider from those basically does all the stuff automatically that we try hard to implement (merge different sensors, use different sensors based on speed, ...) http://developer.android.com/google/play-services/location.html
Manager.title: use google services for location provider

Manager.description: Especially handy for exporting and sharing GPX files with caching buddies would be the ability to filter the cache list by distance. That way, I'm sending only a few dozen nearby caches in the GPX instead of my entire list of 500+.
Manager.title: Filter cache list by distance

Manager.description: The new version makes c:Geo no longer compatible with the Motorola XOOM. Any word on if this will be sorted?
Manager.title: Compatibility issues

Manager.description: When the nightly is invoked from a mail to open that cache in c:geo, it does only show "Cache" as title below the c:geo icon (instead of "Import into c:geo" or something like that, as before). This is due to my refactoring to let every activity have its title declared in the manifest instead of in the Java code of the activity. To cleanly fix this new problem, I suggest to introduce a new activity for opening a cache from a hyperlink. That new activity would then only handle the intent, and afterwards forward to the cache details activity.
Manager.title: Bad title, when invoking c:geo from mail

Manager.description: Some users made me aware, that on devices without magnetic compass sensor our compass wont point to the direction of the cache while walking but does while driving/biking. My assumption is, that we try to get the direction from that not existing sensor (in case the speed is below the coded limit). Is there a possibility to always use GPS for those devices without having the user to select it ?
Manager.title: Always use GPS for direction in compass if device does not have magnetic compass

Manager.description: The PlayStore suggested to add localized screenshots to improve the customer experience. I will assign myself and will produce these screenshots if time permits. Today I found the time to start the "production" and upload of up to date screenshots. I tried to keep it common for all languages and took similar screenshots of: Main screen Live map (in a major city of that country) Live map popup Cache details Compass Search screen Nearby search Logging screen I added them for the following languages up to now: English German French Czech Swedish Dutch Italian Polish Hungarian Japanese Spanish Portuguese Danish Pleas take a look and give me feedback if something is not OK. (PlayStore might need some hours to update)
Manager.title: Add localized screenshots to PlayStore

Manager.description: I had a discussion with a lot of users today. They had a proposal for the UI: Currently on live map we always show found caches with the small smile overlay at the top left. From live map parsing we will only get the information that a cache is found but not the type as the icon on the map is only a big smile. I suggest to replace the smile overlay on top left with a full smile icon in case the cache type is unkown and its status is found (only this case!) because: It is more visible on map then the small overlay with its grey background. It is hard to distinguish between ?? unfound and ?? found. The ?? always shows that we miss some information. But the user will be able to obtain it anyway when clicking on it. I thought a while about this proposal because this would make the UI kind of inconsistent as we would show a big smile for unknown types and a small smile for known types. But still the fact remains that I don't like this lot of ??-caches on map which are in fact only found caches and thats the only valueable information for the user. What do you think ? I would like your feedback.
Manager.title: Replace live map icon for found ??-caches

Manager.description: Until now I had c:geo 2013.04.05 on my Asus Transformer TF201 tablet.Now c:geo informed me that there is an update (2013.05.16). How ever when I go into the Android Store, it tells me that it is not compatible with my tablet.
Manager.title: Android store: c:geo 2013.05.16 not compatible for my TF201

Manager.description: If you leave a personal note, Cgeo seems to save it at first, but if you press refresh or change its status for example after you have found it and log it. It then disappears and you may lose vital information whilst in the field caching! It only remains in place if you have previously entered it from the Geocaching.com website.
Manager.title: Personal note is lost when cache is refreshed/updated

Manager.description: A user reported this and I can confirm this with my tablet. In the previous versions there used to be an android zoom icon where the user can select whether he wants "Zoom to fit" or "Expand view" (or similar translation). With version 2013.05.18 this option is gone and c:geo is always running "Expand view". Basically this is OK as it is the "better" option, but some users on support mail are missing the "Zoom to fit" option to have bigger letters and thus make some parts more readable.
Manager.title: Zoom options no longer shown on tablets

Manager.description: Currently we have the plurals hardcoded in the string resources, instead of really providing plurals as resources.
Manager.title: TTS distances should use Android plurals

Manager.description: It seems that the buffered writer introduced in aea41c8 breaks the export. The file is created, but without content and in the log you see: 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): closeQuietly: unable to close java.io.OutputStreamWriter@40f622a8 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): java.io.IOException: BufferedOutputStream is closed 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.checkNotClosed(BufferedOutputStream.java:91) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.write(BufferedOutputStream.java:122) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.flushBytes(OutputStreamWriter.java:167) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.close(OutputStreamWriter.java:140) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatHoneycomb.closeQuietly(RequiredFields.java:15) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.export.FieldnoteExport$ExportTask.doInBackgroundInternal(FieldnoteExport.java:169) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.export.FieldnoteExport$ExportTask.doInBackgroundInternal(FieldnoteExport.java:105) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.utils.AsyncTaskWithProgress.doInBackground(AsyncTaskWithProgress.java:135) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:864)
Manager.title: Field-Notes export does no longer work

Manager.description: Using NB 2013.05.20: After scrolling several times up and down through the listing of GC4BRWM suddenly the logbook entries were no longer matching the username next to it. This means e.g. that the username "ApproV" who initially published the cache was suddenly shown as the user who wrote the FTF-log. It seems something gets misaligned after scrolling so that username and their corresponding log entries get out of sequence.
Manager.title: Logbook username not matching to log entry

Manager.description: When selection Menu -> Settings -> Menu -> "Reset login" the GC credentials as well as the GCVote username are deleted but the OC.de username still remains.
Manager.title: Reset login should also delete OC.de username

Manager.description: Bonjour, j'utilise un Garmin A50 sous Android : 2 questions : 1- Quand j'ouvre la carte CGEO mes caches placées et celles que j'ai découvertes apparaissent bien que dans les paramètres je demande qu'elles soient cachées. Je ne suis pas Premium. Est-ce la raison ??? 2- Quand je trouve des caches je l'enregistre dans le carnet off-line. Quand je rentre et passe en Wi-Fi ou en 3G y-a-t-il une possibilité pour les envoyer en un seul bloc, sans devoir les ouvrir une par une ? D'avance merci. Vincent Google translation: Hello, I use a Garmin A50 Android 2 questions: 1 - When I open my map CGEO caches placed and those that I discovered that appear in the settings I ask that they be hidden. I'm not Premium. Is that the reason?? 2 - When I find caches I record in the book offline. When I come home and go into Wi-Fi or 3G is there a possibility to send in one piece without having to open them one by one? In advance thank you. Vincent
Manager.title: Owned and discovered caches not filtered out

Manager.description: I once read some issue about log images not shown, but the search did not return any matching results. With NB 2013.05.20 I have the following problem: GC26C2Q Log of user "Matthikue" from April 13th The attached image is not shown when I open it (only red X placeholder) On the website the image is shown normal:
Manager.title: Log image not shown

Manager.description: I can no longer use c:geo for geocaching, because c.geo tells me it's unable to log in. I cannot understand it. I can search and watch geocaches, and I can save them to my phone, but I can not navigate to them because c:geo can not log in. I can not use offline maps either. I can use Groundspeak's geocahing.com app, but not c:geo. I am frustrated. I really loved c:geo.
Manager.title: c:geo can not log in

Manager.description: A reminder to myself (assigned myself): The FAQ needs update once the next bugfix release is out. Reason: BM can now also sort by distance and the limitations changed a bit.
Manager.title: Update FAQ after release with nearby search fix is published

Manager.description: I intend to replace the standard test runner in the test project by this one: http://zutubi.com/source/projects/android-junit-report/ Main reason: It can create JUnit XML reports, which should make our Jenkins output more readable and hopefully lead to better tracking of the tests. When this has been committed, you may run into an Eclipse error, when launching your unit test launch configuration (something about a test runner not being specified). Use Project -> Run configurations and edit the run configuration to use the com.zutubi.... test runner. Ant users should be fine.
Manager.title: Replace test runner in test project

Manager.description: When you click on a cache or trackable in your browser then c:geo is registed as a potential application to handle the url. In a recent change 74fce89 (AndroidManifest.xml) the name of the different activities were changed. Previously the name was always "c:geo". Now it is "Cache" or "Trackable" depending on the type of url. I think the real application name should be displayed in this dialog. It is currently very annoying that c:geo appear as 1st item (Cache) and 2nd item (Trackable) since the ordering is alphabetical and "Chrome" is the other item in the list.
Manager.title: Appname in Android select dialog

Manager.description: After running tests, I ended up with 2 new caches stored offline in default list (it was last I had open). GC1BKP3 and OC5952 I don't recall this happening in the past.
Manager.title: Running tests stores caches in list

Manager.description: I propose that we rename our c-geo-opensource repository to cgeo. We are now the sole c:geo implementation on the market, and we are as open-source as other applications present on GitHub, and those don't add "-opensource" to their name. Up until one week ago, this would have been a complex operation as all the checked-out repositories, URL and so on would have to be modified. However, GitHub introduced the repository redirects which take care of automatically forwarding HTTP or git requests made to the old address to the new one. It means that it should be a transparent operation for everyone using our repository, and we do not have to rush to edit our webpages with the new repository address since the old ones will work as well.
Manager.title: Rename the repository from c-geo-opensource to cgeo

Manager.description: There are some issues that are best discussed asynchronously between developers. Right now, we have a forum, but several people, me included, almost never access it because it forces us to use different tools than everyday tools and I see it as a burden. I propose we create a replacement cgeo-dev Google Groups (because it also has a web-forum-like interface for those who like it and let you chose the rate of notifications) with the following characteristics: targeted towards cgeo developers, testers, community managers, etc., everyone involved in the development and the life of cgeo (that includes planning for developers meetups, etc.); private, with consensual admission for new members (no huge secrets will be exchanged, so we can be pretty liberal about it). What do you all think about that?
Manager.title: Create a cgeo-dev mailing-list

Manager.description: If i write a personal note on a cache, and then refresh the saved cache, the note disappears. Device: Galaxy S II i9100
Manager.title: Personal Notes dissappears

Manager.description: With NB 2013.05.23 I am not able to start speech output: Once I select "Start speech" while in compass on my SGS3 it will only open a menu "Google Text-in-Sprache-Daten verwenden" which offers to download speech packages. It shows german (my phone language) is already downloaded and it offers to download other languages, however proceeding is not possible. Pressing back leads me back to the compass and speech is still disabled.
Manager.title: TTS not starting

Manager.description: Some days ago a user reported that http://www.cgeo.org/cgeo.apk is outdated. Please close, if this has already been done in the meantime.
Manager.title: Update cgeo.apk on website

Manager.description: Last days https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/blob/master/main/res/values/strings_not_translatable.xml was accidentally merged from release to master causing e.g. the release notes to get mixed up completely. Could someone with the ability to do that revert this merging so that we get back the original file ?
Manager.title: Revert changes to strings_not_translatable on master branch

Manager.description: I have just found this app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.pquery It has a GPLv3 license with the source code at: http://code.google.com/p/pocket-query-creator/ It can download existing PQ-files from gc.com and also create new PQs and download them. Would it be an option to think about implementing such a feature ? For PM it is a very convenient method of managing PQs in combination with later import to c:geo.
Manager.title: Pocket Query Creator

Manager.description: When cache is opened and then dropped from stored on map, that not disappear by navigating around stored map, only when close stored and open again, then cache is disappeared. Would be good if cache after drop would disappear automatically. Maybe this can go as feature request?
Manager.title: Droped caches not disappear on stored map dinamically

Manager.description: Just an idea. See more about it here http://android-developers.blogspot.cz/2013/05/new-ways-to-optimize-your-business-in.html
Manager.title: Use new alpha/beta testing feature on Play Store to distribute RC-versions

Manager.description: Given the placement of the "Drop" option on the cache details screen and in the cache list entry long-press context menu, it might make sense to have an optional confirmation message (probably off by default) for dropping stored cache data. I know a c:geo user who accidentally dropped a few caches by accidentally tapping the wrong option, and it was a very frustrating experience due to the complete lack of a nearby Internet connection.
Manager.title: Optionally confirm dropping stored cache data

Manager.description: I received at least four mails from different users all seriously describing that the apps crashes or hangs after performing a nearby search. For these users the crash is reproducible. The nearby result does not show any distances in this case. All are using the newest market versionm, all are BM , all deinstalled and reinstalled the app, but the problem is persistent. I am waiting for logs, screenshots and maybe a video of the problem. Until then tagging as "Unverified".
Manager.title: ANR or crash after nearby search for BM

Manager.description: I always stumble over SearchResult.addCache. It adds the geocode and stores the cache into db. The name should mention this. I suggest: addAndPutInCache(Geocache cache) Why? Developers often didn't realize that addCache stores the Geocache to save memory and only adds geocode to SearchResult. GCParser.parseFromText added the cache to SearchResult without setting it detailed (until I fixed it). This led to parsedCache.gatherMissingFrom(storedCache) overwriting parsed information with cache data load from db (old).
Manager.title: Rename SearchResult.addCache

Manager.description: From support mail: Each time I rotate from/to landscape the trail recorded up to this location is lost. It would be appreciated if the trail would survive the rotation.
Manager.title: Trail on live map gets lost if phone is rotated

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Reactivate OC Test

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Cleanup newly introduced Lint warnings for new opencaching.de connector

Manager.description: When new caches are published, but not found by anyone yet display a marker on the cache icon to make easier FTF runs
Manager.title: Mark unfound caches on live map (for FTF run)

Manager.description: From time to time single users are reporting that bold font is displayed only blurred and almost unreadable. Logs are affected as well as the cache description. Recently I discussed with a user and found the following facts: Using Samsung Galaxy S3 with Stock-ROM (same as mine) Android 4.1.2 Newest market release Problem is not reproducible but once it occurs only force stop and restart of c:geo solves the problen I have the same phone but can not reproduce this. I am still in chat with the user trying to find out more details. So I open this issue for me as a reminder and for you in case you have any idea for that. Screenshots: Cache: Cache description:
Manager.title: Bold font displayed blurred in log and cache details

Manager.description: There are some problems when checking/adjusting colors in the cache description. There is no handling of white fonts when using light skin. This gives this problem: The checks are for color=. This causes incorrect matches on bgcolor=. This is what causes this cache to get a gray background even though it doesn't have black text. To solve part 2, I first thought to change it to color= with a leading space, but this doesn't have to be true, so I am thinking about maybe stripping all bgcolor from the text before checking for color but I don't want to make a second copy of the entire text in memory again. Any feedback?
Manager.title: Errors in coloring cache description

Manager.description: NB2013.05.30-NB-cc69b7a: I authorized c:geo for OC.de and tried it for a while Then I switched off the "Opencaching use for Live map and search" in the settings If I perform a nearby search and continuously load more results, it also keeps showing OC-results Same on live map "Force stop" and restart does not help
Manager.title: OC.de still enabled although switched off

Manager.description: I suggest to set the default value of "Load long description automatically" to true. This option was mainly used for performance tuning in the past. Meanwhile our code is better and smartphones are better, so from the usability point of view, a user should have this enabled by default in new installations. Any more settings, where you think the default should be different?
Manager.title: Load long description automatically

Manager.description: We retrieved some mails that logging is not OK with the release version. It could be a result of the site update from yesterday. I just tested it myself with version 2013.05.22 and can reproduce that. c:geo says "Log sucesful" but updating the cache details afterwards the log is not shown. Also on the webpage there is no new log. Feel free to test with GC352Y3 Log will follow.
Manager.title: Posting log not possible

Manager.description: I thought I had login trouble, looking at my phone (but it was only that I disabled GC in the settings hours before). We should make this status label more easy to understand, dependening on what connector is active.
Manager.title: main screen status shows "geocaching.com * ", even if GC is disabled

Manager.description: Attributes are not loaded/displayed when viewing cache details. Both in NB and official. I guess it is due to the site update...
Manager.title: Attributes not loaded for caches

Manager.description: I tried logging cache http://coord.info/GC4D3XF today, cgeo said: successfully submitted the log. I refreshed the cache, my log was not there. Tried sending the log 3 more times, my log was not there. Opened cache in browser, submitted log from browser, refreshed the cache and now i have it logged as found. Wtf? Using latest version from market. Screenshots: http://db.tt/Hkw7Dg2B
Manager.title: cgeo did not send log

Manager.description: While testing the new release candidate. It seems TB logging is also broken: 15:16:52.390 Info cgeo 27677 Trying to post log for trackable #mycode - action: DISCOVERED_IT; date: 2013.5.31, log: Heute gesehen beim Lineflyer. 15:16:52.390 Debug cgeo 27677 POST http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?wid=06060e39-51bc-42c2-9a94-d8a801fc46ab 15:16:55.015 Debug cgeo 27677 200 (2641 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?wid=06060e39-51bc-42c2-9a94-d8a801fc46ab 15:16:55.234 Error cgeo 27677 GCParser.postLogTrackable: Failed to post log because of unknown error
Manager.title: Trackable log posting not working

Manager.description: Version 2013.05.22 for Android. I have replicated this on two HTC Desire S phones running Android 2.3.5. I press the submit log button on a "stored" cache. I see "Sending log ..." then "C;Geo Successfully Submitted the Log". It shows up in the stored information for the cache, but doesn't get as far as the website!.
Manager.title: Logs not being submitted.

Manager.description: It's an issue if you have multiple maps starting with the same prefix. How about removing the Offline word, or both OSM: Offline and display stored offline maps like ::Map_name for example
Manager.title: OSM:Offline map name won't fit the box

Manager.description: Today on FB Tobias Andersson Hey and thanks for the awesome work you put in to this. However, I just upgraded to a Galaxy S4 and there is something wrong with the icons on the livemap. The little floppydisc that indicates that the cache is saved on the phone is about four times bigger and blurry as sh*t compared to how it looks on my S3. It is, of course, mostly an esthetical issue but it's kinda hard to see what type of cache it is when the floppyicon blocks out more than half the circle. :) Hopefully it's an easy fix (or maybe it's just something wrong with my phone, anyone else got this?) Tobias Andersson I suspect it got something to do with the higher resolution on the S4 but what do I know. Tobias Andersson Looked into it and it goes for all of the "add-on"-icons. The floppy, the smiley etc.
Manager.title: FB: "add-on"-Icons on Galaxy S4 stretched

Manager.description: Is there a workaround? This happened today on all Finds only.
Manager.title: Save logs not saving to GC from app

Manager.description: The new connector always tries to do OAuth level 3 authentication, even for methods where this is not needed. That leads to the situation that one can no longer search for OC1234 from the quick search or search. We should only use the OAuth authentication, if the method really requires it, otherwise we enforce the user to authentication.
Manager.title: OC search no longer working without authorization

Manager.description: HTC One Developer Edition, Android 4.1.2. A couple of weeks ago I briefly tried c:geo on this new phone. Seemed to work alright. Now, with latest update, it won't display any caches on the map. I've tried Live Map, Nearby and Search. It will bring up a list of caches, but when selecting "Map" it won't show any. Changing the Map View option doesn't help. It is not automatically centering the map on my current location when doing Nearby or Live View. When performing an address search it isn't automatically centering map on the searched location. Regardless, it isn't showing any cache on the map when I manually center map to my location or to the searched location.
Manager.title: No caches displayed on any map or any mode

Manager.description: Hi, i am using the "send via email" feature to "mark" found caches. I don't like to write my foundlogs on the road, so i send found caches via email to myself and post my logs at home on my pc. so it would be nice to have the link to the post-page in the email. there is not mucht to do there, just put the link as following into the email: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?WP={$GCCODE} maybe this could be optional? thanks
Manager.title: Feature Request: loglink to email

Manager.description: As mentioned in #2380 the GPX import is slow even if all extra features (like static maps, gc vote, logs from friends) are disabled. With profiling we managed to figure out this happens if caches are already stored in the database. The main slowdown is when logs of the cache are read before import, which is pointless if they get overwritten. http://pbrd.co/11kuRbZ Trace: https://www.dropbox.com/s/o41h76anf06wa95/ddms7173376374349962084.zip
Manager.title: GPX import slow

Manager.description: TB2T01N has no description, but we show an empty section.
Manager.title: hide empty sections in trackable view

Manager.description: This error always shows up in the log at the end of each live map loading cycle (without ever having touched any OC-option after install): 21:10:01.062 Error cgeo 32766 Calling OkapiClient.getCachesBBox with wrong connector Don't know whether this is a problem, just did a preventive reporting.
Manager.title: Calling OkapiClient.getCachesBBox with wrong connector

Manager.description: This is entered for tracking purposes. If a BM does a Nearby search, then the distance is approximated as we don't have the cache coords. If a BM does a search by location, then the distance shown is in reference to where the search was done, not the user. Example: Go into Search Enter somewhere into the Address box and Search (I entered Hamburg) In the resulting list, the caches show as several hundred feet away instead of several thousand miles I'd suggest this limitation entered into the FAQ.
Manager.title: Distance to cache for BM based on search location not user location

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: User Report: Refresh of OC-Caches not working since NB from 02.06.2013

Manager.description: During my tests due to the log date problem I have seen that I got logged out while the app was still open but idle. Long time I experienced nothing like this. I opened the log page for a cache I got the error message that c:geo can not load the log page In the log I see a 500 error while loading the log page Trying at the PC I can enforce the 500 by logging out from the page and then trying to load the logpage. So it seems my login expired/invalidated for some reason. I assume this is a fault at the website but we should keep an eye on that. Currently this error is not handled. We could e.g. trigger a relogin in case a 500 error is received.
Manager.title: Cookie problems

Manager.description: While testing another thing I have seen this NPE in the logs. The WPs are not parsed any longer. It was working some NBs ago and I did not change my note until then. My personal note is Alte Koordinaten: N 51 21.252 E 007 02.675 Neue Koordinaten: N 51 21.168 E007 02.840 Note: I altered the coords due to security for my mystery ;) , but I assume that makes no difference. This is the log: 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 Geocache.parseWaypointsFromNote 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 java.lang.NullPointerException 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.hasIdenticalWaypoint(Geocache.java:1434) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.parseWaypointsFromNote(Geocache.java:1391) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCacheFromText(GCParser.java:722) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCache(GCParser.java:334) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:141) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.searchByGeocode(Geocache.java:1662) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.storeCache(Geocache.java:1570) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.refresh(Geocache.java:1554) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DetailsViewCreator$RefreshCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:1409)

Previously it worked when I changed the extension to gpx even if it was still zip file. a) First of all all found gpx files are shown twice b) importing gpx does not work: 'Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.1: could no parse XML' On the other hand, imports works when I send email myself with changed extension to GPX (gmail does not like *.zip), click 'Download', next c:geo as a program to use with this action. In a new version it could be nice if at least offline logs will be possible for opencaching.pl OC caches which work currently with c:geo. Thanks for correcting it!

I think they will either set this one as a default or fall back in the next days. However maybe someone can look at the content with respect to parsing changes ?

Manager.description: If I do the following everything is normal: Enter a note on the website: Test N51 13.888 E007 03.444 Update the cache in c:geo WP in c:geo is created correctly Change note on website to: Test N51 13.777 E007 03.444 Update the cache in c:geo WP in c:geo is modified correctly But this case fails: Enter a note on the website: Test N51 13.888 E007 03.444 Test N51 13.233 E007 03.444 Test N51 09.123 E007 03.444 Update the cache in c:geo WPs in c:geo are created correctly Change note on website to (last WP changed): Test N51 13.888 E007 03.444 Test N51 13.233 E007 03.444 Test N51 09.456 E007 03.444 Update the cache in c:geo Result: 5 WPs instead of 3. WP1+2 are doubled, only WP3 is corrected correctly.
Manager.title: WPs from personal note doubled under some circumstances

Manager.description: Using cgeo on new blackberry Q10. As we logged out visits, cgeo displayed a message saying the log was successfully uploaded showed our log at the top of the list of logs When we signed in to geocaching.com's website, none of the logs had been actually uploaded. Back at the Q10, we refreshed one of these caches inside cgeo. Our log disappeared from the list of logs. :( Things we tried: restarting the Q10; did not fix the problem confirming that "Enable offline" was NOT checked; did not fix repeating the process with other caches; did not fix submitting a log on the same account from cgeo on my Google Nexus: this works fine. confirmed Q10 roaming and data were enabled; device is able to send and receive data Happy to help debug this. Let me know what else I can test/tell you. ;-)
Manager.title: Logs not uploaded BB10

Manager.description: This issue introduces the AndroidAnnotation library in our project: https://github.com/excilys/androidannotations Main goal: Reduce code clutter by implementing standard android patterns trough annotations. This is done by generating code from the annotation. There is no runtime penalty and you can debug through the generated code. Eclipse and Ant build have been customized by me, so this should build on everyones machine. Someone using IntelliJ might want to read https://github.com/excilys/androidannotations/wiki/IntelliJIDEA.
Manager.title: Use Android Annotations to implement standard patterns

Manager.description: Hello first, sorry for my bad english and sorry too if my post is not an issue and if it's not in the good section. I don't know if i can write it here. I have a problem with distances with a smartphone zopo with android : all caches have several distances for the same point. I saw this in the FAQ : The distance to a cache is fluctuating heavily For some users the distance to a cache in a list of caches or in the compass is jumping between some meters to some kilometers. You are probably running Cyanogenmod ROM. This is a known bug in Cyanogenmod 10. More information can be found here: http://code.google.com/p/cyanogenmod/issues/detail?id=6883 So you either have to wait for a fix for this ROM or change to another ROM. The link doesn't work. i'm not using a cyanogen ROM. Do you now if there is an issue for this problem ? Thanks for your answer
Manager.title: Multiple distance

Manager.description: Do we want to add an information to our IRC channel to the c:geo website ? This would allow users to contact us for support via chat. Most questions on support mail are easy to solve/answer, but for more complicated issues it would be nice to have a direct chat contact. I don't think that many users would use it however for those with really difficult issues it would be helpful. Can we add a link on http://www.cgeo.org/contact.html ? I could also add a link to our FAQ (e.g. "I have a really difficult problem with c:geo. Where to get help?")
Manager.title: Add IRC contact to webpage

I moved all the solved mysteries to that list. Afterwards I was able to have a quick look where is the next solved mystery the I can search for now. That worked pretty good for me. However after I received the next time my home-zone PQ and imported that to the standard list, all the solved mysteries were moved to the standard list back and did not show up in the "solved" list any more. Do you have an idea how to keep the solved mysteries in the related list also?

Manager.description: This sounds like a strange request because why not add a waypoint? Well the reason is as follows. On multiple locations I have received coordinates in email, text, or even from OCRing a picture. I copy and paste the text into the 'personal note' of the cache. But now it does not become a waypoint. If the text was in the 'personal note' before (on the website) and it would load, it would have become a waypoint. So the easy request. Can we extract coordinates when entering the personal note in C:geo. this allow me to copy and paste a large number of coordinates at once using copy/paste and not have to make a lot of individual waypoints.
Manager.title: Extract coordinates when entering 'personal note' manually in C:geo

After cgeo goes into background, it is now null

Manager.description: I searched for a similar request, but I couldn't find one. I would like to be able to see if a cache would need me to bring some tools (to climb, to dive, to swim, ...) when I look at the live map. Unfortunately the attributes of caches could not be used for this as not all caches are using attributes in the same way. (a climbing cache could miss the "climbing required" attribute although the description tells me to climb) Currently the best way to solve the problem is using several lists for each kind of tag I am using and then showing only this list in the live map. There are several downsides of this. (a cache can only have one tag at a time; caches from the normal live map can't be distinguished) Short term improvements: *A list could have a symbol. Each cache in the list would be displayed along with the symbol. *One could manually add tags to caches. An according symbol would make the tag visible in the live map. Long term improvements: *One could reuse the mechanism for a global filter system (issue #995) to use a filter result as dynamic tag. (a search could be combined like: attribute = "climbing required" OR owner = "climbing only" OR GC-Code = GC1234, GC5678) *Cache appearance (color, shape, symbol) could be determined by filters too. (Source = OC -> shape quadratic; Terrain = T5 -> color red) These are only my ideas of the topic. I would love to hear what you think of it.
Manager.title: add tags like climbing, swimming, diving to caches and show additional small icons in live map

Manager.description: No description provided.

Manager.description: We should not include any further big feature for the next release, but get the current new stuff finished and polished. Please add issues to this list directly, if you see them blocking the next release. @Lineflyer added #2122 Personal Note synchronization. #2826 From my users/testers perspective I think needs to be solved as well (The problem, that on empty tiles for PM we are still showing them if retrieved on lower zoom) What about #2821 which came in probably after the new basic member nearby search implementation? @Bananeweizen added: #2898 #2770 #2443 #2747 @Lineflyer added: #2925 #2926 #2932 #3000 #2996 #2606 #3086 #3104 #3111 #3136 @samueltardieu added: #2915 A release from the release branch with the end-of-line warning must be done first
Manager.title: Next feature release

Manager.description: This issue is for discussing whether to raise the minimum SDK level to run cgeo from 4 to 7 (or higher). Current play store stats show minimal usage among level 4 devices (I believe this just means they have it installed, not necessarily actively using it). Reasons to upgrade: Allows supporting multi-window feature on Samsung devices (see #2443) Allows using [ActionBarSherlock]((http://actionbarsherlock.com/) to implement action bar functionality in cgeo. It supports minimum of level 7. Note: Google is planning to release an action bar support library (ActionBarCompat), but I haven't seen details for what versions it will support or when it will be released. The current sample project in the SDK runs on level 4. Other API functionality we could use? Reasons not to upgrade: Users of devices prior to level 7 will no longer be able to use cgeo. They could run current version until changes to gc.com render it unusable. Please post any thoughts and discussion.
Manager.title: Raise minimum sdk level from 4 to 7 (1.6 to 2.1.x)

Manager.description: A user made me aware of that: If you click on "Bluetooth GPS" in the list of recommended apps you will get an error from Playstore that his app is not existing. I never tried this, thus I do not know to what app this should refer at all.
