Manager.description: There seem to be some caches (virtual) which require a passkey/keyword in order to place found logs. Example: OCB68A In c:geo I can compose a found log (I did not send it because I did not really visit it), on the website I need the passkey to post a found log. I don't know whether the API supports this and I don't know whether I can post a found log via c:geo even without entering the password.
Manager.title: Support keyword for virtual cache logging

Manager.description: I am using nightly build 2013.06.14-NB-76f59b8 There has been a change in the waypoints are handled, and I vote to return it to the previous method. The change: long press on a waypoint takes a user straight to the edit screen. The problem: there is no means to navigate to the waypoint other than by the default means - the small compass icon on the waypoint view. In previous versions, a long press on the waypoint would provide the navigation menu, and options such as navigate(driving) would be availble. I cannot find a means to achieve this any more. Example: I have a puzzle cache with modified co-ordinates. When stored in c:geo, the original co-ordinates are also stored, and these can often be the parking place for access to the cache which I use to access my driving navigation application. It maybe related to this, but when a waypoint is selected on the map view, a menu -> navigate also takes the user directly to the default navigation took (Radar in my case). Previously I was presented with the navigate selection menu. Please can I have it back :)
Manager.title: Navigation - no option to choose navigation menu on waypoints other than default setting

Manager.description: Whats named "Radar" in Cache-Menu is now named "Navigate" in the cache-menu on the live map. So there are two buttons with "navigate". (open live map, select a cache, press menu button then)
Manager.title: Radar named Navigate in Live map cache-menu

Manager.description: When I go geocaching I just save an offline log on the field and then logs online back at home using my computer. The found caches is now listed in the History List så I know in wich order they were found. But as soon as I view the cache page for a cache found for a time ago it is also added to the list. This messes up the current "found but not logged" count and I have missed a planned milestone cache because of this bahavior. I have two possible change suggestions: Only include caches in the list that was found since the History was cleared last time Add a section for each found date in the list. With a counter for each section. ie: Today [2] Cache name no 1 Cache name no 2 2012-01-03 [1] Cache name no 3
Manager.title: When viewing found caches they are added to the history

Manager.description: Add coords to a personal note on gc.com Refresh or load the cache Verify the coordinates were used to create a waypoint Select to edit the waypoint Click save cgeo crashes FATAL EXCEPTION: main java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.EditWaypointActivity$SaveWaypointListener.onClick(EditWaypointActivity.java:361) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:4204) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:17355) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:725) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) The line is final WaypointType type = wpTypes.get(waypointTypeSelector.getSelectedItemPosition()); Since the waypoint type can't be chagned, waypointTypeSelector was never initialized. This was introduced in 4b4294d
Manager.title: NPE when editing waypoint created from personal note

Manager.description: Nach dem erstellen eines Loggeintrages und dem hinzufügen eines Bildes aus dem Bildverzeichnisses des Smartphones wird das Bild mehrfach hochgeladen. bei zwei Loggeinträgen am Samstag trat der Effekt auf. For two log entries on Saturday the effect occurred. In a log entry the image was uploaded 4x and the other 2 x. Used device: Sony Xperia Tipo, Android 4.0.4, C: Geo 2013.06.05

Manager.description: I would like to suggest to clean up the list management menu to a clear structure by using some sub menus and other methods instead. The current situation is partly inconsistent and looks a bit overfreighted. Current situation: Drop all Drop all and delete list Suggestion: Drop all only and have an option for additionally deleting the list in the following confirmation dialog Current situation: Import GPX Import from web Suggestion: Import as main entry (like already for export) with sub items GPX/LOC and Web When one/some caches are selected the management menu still shows the options Import GPX and Import from Web These can be removed at this spot, as they have nothing to do with managing the selection and are probably never used from here.
Manager.title: Clean up list management menu

Manager.description: Activate compass Select "Use GPS only" (which is an important choice in case you carry the phone in your pocket and want to listen to TTS only) Select "Start speech" Nothing happens Thanks @rsudev for the hint to test this

Manager.description: Activate compass "Start speech" As long as the output is running I can change the volume of the output In the pauses between the output the volume change buttons on my device only change the ringtone volume I was not sure, whether this is a technical limitation, therefore I crosschecked with the original GCBabble and there it is possible to change the output volume also during speech pauses. I think this should also be possible within c:geo. Typically when using loudspeaker you may want to reduce the volume before the next output starts (e.g. in case you walk into a crowd of people) but you actually can not do that but just reduce your ringtone volume instead.
Manager.title: TTS volume can only be changed if speech output is active at that moment

I liked that method to just keep track of the changes included in master only. @rsudev told that we can get a list of commits only on master via github. My questions now would be: How to get that list of changes? How and when to transform the commit list into a list of "user readable" list of changes ?

Bug reports from users have shown in the past that (on some strange devices at least) it can be necessary to do so, because either the dirscanner (offline maps) or the dirchooser (export/import) does not scan/show all existing file structures.

Manager.description: I know from the past (but do not find that issue at the moment) that we currently have two different dirchooser methods. On one hand a dirchosser with black background and selection boxes and another one (which probably cam out of another library) with more graphical design. Those two have been somehow mixed in the past, e.g. the initial dir selection was done using one style, the change of an exisiting path was done using the other style. Within the new settings we now constantly use the dirchooser with black background (the old one) but not the graphical dirchosser. Has that been done intentional?
Manager.title: New settings: Only old dirchosser style used

Manager.description: Currently important options like export/import and backup/restore are hidden in the section "more settings" which could probably be seen by the user as optional or advanced settings but currently contains a mixture of miscellaneous settings. I am not a friend of these kind of sections as most probably everything which does not fit into an existing section will be appended there...like a wastebin ;) I suggest to have at least one other section "System" and move GPX Export/Import Backup / Restore Location for database Debugging option to there. The section "More settings" should then indeed only contain something like advanced settings which are optional.
Manager.title: New settings: Have a section called system

Manager.description: I see a margin of maybe 15 pixels left and right in each settings screen (only the titlebar has no margin). That should be removed as it does not add any structure or other value.

Manager.description: I first noticed that while caching on the event in Koblenz together with the c:geo team. Today I did some more fieldtesting with the TTS function: As long as I use "GPS + Compass" mode the TTS output for the direction is always accurate (i.e. same as shown on the compass rose). If I use "GPS only" (which is meaningful for using it in some pocket and listen only) the direction shown and TTS output of it is different from each other most of the time. I did not manage to find any logic in it beside one thing: If I am not moving and switch to "GPS only" (this will not get any meaningful direction shown as movement is necessary to calculate the GPS direction towards the cache) the direction shown and TTS output of it are identical. If I now start moving the displayed direction changes immediately but the spoken direction seems to remain as it was or only catch up after a long time. I set this to "medium" as using "GPS only" mode is pretty helpful in combination with TTS output.
Manager.title: Compass TTS: Wrong direction in "GPS only" mode

Manager.description: If a personal note is merged the string Merged: is shown in the note. AFAICS it is not included in strings.xml but should be to get translated.

I have a new mobile phone (Android Version 4.2.1, Kernel 3.4.5) and had to discover that the distance of a chosen cache in the compass view varies very much (i.e. 100m to >10 km). Also if I search for caches in the live map the scaling bar changes its scale new sometimes and switches back now and then... Changing the used maps does not help... (Thought it would help, but it doesn't and wrote that in a mail to the support)... Still- I do not see any such effects when using googlemaps directly and everything seems to be fine with the implemented GPS (no jumping in google maps or orux maps when tracking)... Help, please! :(

Manager.description: Hi, I am just curious... Is possible to show GeoKrety trackables in Geocaching caches? I think it is not implemented yet because I didnt see Geokret which was in my last cache in cgeo in trackables... but it was shown on GC.com websites with GeoKrety plugin...¨ Thank you
Manager.title: Support GeoKrety

Manager.description: Hello! My problem is, as stated in the title, that c:geo seems to use my phones gps even when it's closed. By default my gps tracking is switched off and I turn it on manually when I go GC hunting. When I've found what I've been looking for (using this great app), I turn off the gps tracking and close c:geo. However I've noticed that even after I've closed the app and turned gps tracking off it still seems to use the gps somehow. When I check the use details of c:geo under battery usage it shows that it still uses gps and drains battery accordingly. The gps usage time (and battery drain) won't stop until I've done a full phone restart, even force closing the app won't help, only restart. Anyone else having this issue (or is it an issue at all or am I doing something wrong)? I tried to search for similar topics, but couldn't find any. I'm new to c:geo, but I've found it to be a great app already, just hate to restart my phone after using c:geo just to conserve my battery. Any help would be greatly appreciated! I'm using c:geo (ver. 2013.06.05) on my galaxy nexus (android 4.2.2). Sorry if I'm in the wrong place with this, so feel free to redirect/delete/whatnot if so ;) Thanks, Runkha
Manager.title: App keeps using gps/draining battery even after closing

Shouldn't we check for both headers instead of returning after finding the first?

Manager.description: Due to comments in PR #3017 there is still some refactoring left to substitute int values with speaking constant names. Look at @Bananeweizen comment in the linked issue.
Manager.title: Introduce constants in CacheDetailsActivity

Manager.description: I discovered this while working on #2234. Scroll to an area where you found many caches on the live map, and the outer ones will load as ?? caches because the details aren't important. If you click one, the pop-up loads some more details about it, but it loses track of the "Found" status on the cache. Now, if you close the pop-up, the smiley face indicating that the cache was found is missing. This also affects my fix for #2234; if you select a ?? cache which was found, and then click "Hide own/found caches", that cache will not disappear with all the other ones. Clicking "More Details" in the pop-up (causing it to load that information again) will fix the problem. The cache status needs to be downloaded when clicking the pop-up, or the "Found" status needs to be kept somewhere. I'll try to fix this.
Manager.title: Clicking on a ?? cache in Live Map destroys previously-downloaded Status data, does not download again

Manager.description: When using MTK 6589 powered phone the distance data gets crazy. At one moment You are located 40 meters from cache, few seconds later You are located 500m from it and after less than a second You came back. This makes it difficult to use the app. This is well known problem for many apps with phones powered by this CPU. RunKeeper is one of the apps working correctly, Endomondo is the example of the one working wrong. There must be some kind of problem with interpreting the data from GPS.
Manager.title: Wrong distance data on MTK6589 phones

Manager.description: "c:geo - calendar plugin" on GooglePlay description(wiki/Plugin-description-for-PlayStore), "c:geo calendar add-on" on c:geo app(/main/res/values/strings.xml). it should be better to use terms consistently.
Manager.title: c:geo - calendar plugin? add-on?

Manager.description: Currently the option "since last export" in the field note upload dialog will only activate the appropriate checkbox on geocaching.com fieldnote page. This has some disadvantages: The checkbox is only existing on the webpage if there are still pending logs (it can be used to add more notes to an already exisiting list of pending notes only). If a user exports field notes from c:geo, logs all the notes on gc.com and later exports again as he has new offline logs, all stored offline logs will be again shown on gc.com (old ones and new ones). We could delete the offline logs in c:geo once the export and upload is OK, but as exporting them does not mean logging them, this might raise other problems. So saving an own timestamp of the last export (not use the gc.com feature) and exporting only logs newer than that sound like a better way.
Manager.title: Field note upload "since last export" should be controlled by c:geo

Manager.description: With NB 2013-07-20 the live logs are not added to the log list anymore.

Manager.description: By now we explicitly support around 12 different navigation apps and tools (e.g. bike navigation, Oruxmaps and that stuff). While that is really nice for the people who want to invoke exactly their app, I find this menu is starting to get huge (at least on my device). As we now have better settings, it would probably make sense to add another category to the navigation screen, where each navigation app can be disabled using a checkbox. Each would be checked by default, and only for installed apps the preference would be enabled.
Manager.title: Settings to enable/disable all navigation apps

Manager.title: Field notes are in strange UTF-16 encoding

Manager.description: Dear developers, I am analyzing cgeo using a static code checker. I found some potential slow operations in cgeo's UI thread. Android documentation says this: http://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-anr.html "Any method that runs in the UI thread should do as little work as possible on that thread. In particular, activities should do as little as possible in key life-cycle methods such as onCreate(). Potentially long running operations such as network or database operations, or computationally expensive calculations such as resizing bitmaps should be done in a worker thread (e.g., via AsyncTask)." I found the following event handlers transitively performing database queries, touching file systems, or compressing bitmaps: cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity.onActivityResult() cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DescriptionViewCreator's onClick() handler at line 1644 (revision 6e4a8d4) cgeo.geocaching.MainActivity's onLongClick() handler at line 362 cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetaiActivity$DescriptionViewCreator's onClick() handler at line 1797 cgeo.geocaching.ui.ImagesList$AsyncImgLoader onClick() listener at line 132 cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity's onClick() handler at line 323 cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity's onClick() handler at line 332 Do you think these slow operations will affect cgeo's performance (e.g., make GUI not smooth enough)? If yes, perhaps moving them to a separate thread can help make cgeo super smooth in user interaction. Looking forward to your reply and hope I can help improve cgeo.
Manager.title: Performance improvement suggestion

Manager.description: After Importing caches with waypoints it is possible to select them to edit it. But after typing in new coordninates etc. and press 'save' the app will force close. My suggestions: Don't allow to edit owner-made waypoints as long it will lead to a crash Repair that bug and make all waypoints editable. ;-) If that is not possible perhaps let the app store a copy of the orginal waypoint when saving an edit
Manager.title: Editing owner-made waypoints lets c:geo crash

Manager.description: When you choose to sort the caches by name, it doesn't work properly. This bug seems to arrive when there are numbers in the geocache name and a number is re-used later in the name. For example, with the following names : GR8 01-01, GR8 01-02, GR8 01-03, GR8 01-04, GR8 01-05, GR8 01-06, GR8 01-07, GR8 01-08, GR8 01-09, the result will be : GR8 01-08, GR8 01-01, GR8 01-02, GR8 01-03, GR8 01-04, GR8 01-05, GR8 01-06, GR8 01-07, GR8 01-09. The example is real. It occure on a French Southwest serial of geocaches. And there are others same cases. It's not an heavy problem but thank you if you coulde resolve it. Sorry for my english. I send you a sunny memory (36 ºC) of France. Chrono81. PS : I'm waiting to be able to read the whole information of date (and not 26.07.20..) beside the logs. In version 2013.07.25, it is not yet corrected.
Manager.title: Caches sorted by name doesn't work properly when numbers are present.

Manager.description: I use the nightly build which I downloaded from the website and I am updating it over the in-app-notification. Although I deinstalled the playstore-version before installing the nightly the nightly seemes to me conneceted to the playstore version. The Problem will appear if the playstore-version gets an update. If that will be installed the app don't work. Always when I try to open the live-map the complete app force close. The only possibillity to change that is to install the newest nightly build over the website again. I tried to set the playstore not to update automatically but on days with much app-update I happen sometimes that I update it manually together with al the other apps. My suggestions: prevent the nightly to connect to the playstore! repair the force-close-bugs then the versions get accidentally installed that way? perhaps upload the nightly to the playstore as a seperate app if that don't make to much work?
Manager.title: Problem with nightly-builds and playstore-version

Manager.description: Today I was checking a cache series for the notes I had taken on each of them. So I sorted by name, opened first cache, closed it again. Sorting was reset to sort by distance. This is quite annoying when you need to switch between list and details multiple times.

Manager.description: 2013.07.26-NB (but probably this is existing quite a long time) Steps: Open live map Click on a cache to open pop-up Click on the compass rose in the popup to invoke default navigation End the default navigation Result: Return to live map (popup no longer shown) Expectation: Return to the live map with the popup opened Remark: If you use the Menu to start navigating instead of the one-click navigation the popup is open after return from the navigation

Manager.description: From Playstore ratings: German (original): Kennwort wird im Klartext abgespeichert Mal ehrlich: Wer speichert denn heute noch Kennwörter unverschlüsselt auf dem Smartphone ab? Klar, es geht hier nicht um riesige Summen. Trotzdem ist das ein No-Go! Bitte fixen English: Password is saved as clear text. Honestly: Who saves passwords without encryption on smartphones? Sure, this is not a big deal here but still a No-Go. Please fix it. I can not judge whether this is true and whether it is worth to change something here as it is the first complain like that I ever heared. Nevertheless I would like your opinions on that.
Manager.title: Password storage in c:geo

Manager.description: Hi, on my HTC Desire X, I cannot access the settings menu. In other words, I cannot use the app at all since I cannot login to my account. Any workarounds? Best, Martin
Manager.title: HTC Desire X: Cannot access settings menu

Manager.description: A feature request from support mail which I fully agree to: Open the live map Move it manually to the desired location (which means "fix to current position" is off) Leave the live map Enter the live map again Result: It starts at the current position ("fixed to current position" is on again) Desired behaviour: In case the map was moved to another position before it was closed it should open again on this very position (right now we only store the last zoom but it seems not the last position)
Manager.title: Live map should start at last position if not fixed to current position

Manager.description: Found during the event in Koblenz with @Bananeweizen : Open live map with active OSM:offline map Center to your position or remember your current position on the map Use Menu -> Maps to change to another offline map Result: The map initial view is set to a strange position (possibly the capital of that country or the map center) but the "fix to position" button is still shown as active. Expectation: The new map should open at the current position or the last centered position (whichever was the case before the map change)
Manager.title: Changing between offline maps the new map is not opened at last position

Manager.description: At least for the "Activate OpenCaching.de" checkbox I just got "true" or "false" being shown in the settings summary when toggling that setting.
Manager.title: Settings summary shows "true" or "false"

Manager.description: On Saturday and Sunday I went for around 25 caches. All of them have been logged offline. Those logs are complete (i.e. exporting field notes or just looking at the logs in cache details is fine). But for 2 of the 25 caches the visitedDate in the cache table is zero. This leads to those 2 caches missing in the history. I've now looked back and forth through the code to find how the visitedDate might become zero. But I don't really have any clue as all the places accessing that variable seem to be fine. Therefore it would be good if someone else could watch for the same to happen. I also don't know anymore what version I used at the weekend, as it has been updated in the meantime.
Manager.title: visitedDate wrongly set to zero

Manager.description: I just accidentally managed to hit the backup button in settings while sliding through the menu. Sadly there is no confirmation dialog but it just overwrites an existing backup.(which in my case has overwritten a backup of 500 caches which I did before reinstalling c:geo with a new installed DB with 0 caches). We should really have a confirmation screen for backup and restore.
Manager.title: Backup/Restore should have a confirmation dialog

Manager.description: The "Navigation Menu" entry in settings should have a short explanation shown below like for almost all other settings. It could be: "Here you can select which of the available navigation methods will be shown in the navigation menu for a cache or waypoint".
Manager.title: Have an explanation for "Navigation Menu" in settings

Manager.description: I copied this into an empty note in c:geo: Station 1: N50°14.759 E6°11.178 A=35 B=25 Final: Station1 + (2*B Meter in A+6 Grad) Final: N50°14.779 E6°11.206 After that I uploaded the note, then I refreshed the cache. That is the result Station 1: N50°14.759 E6°11.178 A=35 B=25 Final: Station1 + (2*B Meter in A+6 Grad) Final: N50°14.779 E6°11.206 -- Station 1: N50�14.759 E6�11.178 A=35 B=25 Final: Station1 + (2*B Meter in A+6 Grad) Final: N50�14.779 E6�11.206
Manager.title: Merging of personal note caused by special chars

Manager.description: With 2013.07.30-NB I am am no longer able to change the active map. Whatever I select I am stuck on "Google Maps". Neither OSM:Online nor OSM:Offline works. The settings show my selection correctly but the map stays with GoogleMaps. I am on the road right now...will provide more details later. Can someone reproduce?
Manager.title: Inconsistency when changing map source

Manager.description: With the new navigation method selection I realized that the method "GCC" is greyed out for me, although I have GCC installed on my device. Maybe the reason could be, that I use the "GCC Pro" version?
Manager.title: GCC not available for navigation

Manager.description: Apache license 2.0 says anybody can distribute the app under several conditions. One of them is: "You must give any other recipients of the Work or Derivative Works a copy of this License" In c:geo itself there is no license or even link to license file. I think we should include our LICENSE and NOTICE files in application istelf (in About under Details section) or we shall at least make links to files in our repository.
Manager.title: Have a LICENSE and NOTICE file in our distribution

Manager.description: I've just seen this on the release version: A non archived cache has been stored locally (and it has an offline log). By now the cache is archived on the website. You can refresh the cache in the app as often as you want, it doesn't get show the archived state anywhere. I cannot reproduce this currently on my own device, because for me the same cache is archived when I download it the first time. Will have to debug into that faking the non archived state first.
Manager.title: merging of boolean attributes is not correct

Manager.description: Hi I have an Gem7008 Android 4.1 It does not have a GPS unit in it. I want to use it as a fast translator for Geo logs etc, away from my main Android that is too slow. When I download a pocket query and import the GPS, it says it has imported 55 caches, but will only display the 12 multicaches on the visible list. I hope you understand. Regards Derek
Manager.title: Lists only showing Multicaches, not singles or mystery. Android without internal GPS

Manager.description: There is more images that is common in http://coord.info/GC2PVN5, but not much. When trying to touch "Images" on the bottom of the listing on OR show all images on separate list (on cache details), c:geo falls back to cache list instead of showing images. This seems like bug. I have current c:geo on my Note II with Android 4.1.2 (JZO54K.N7100XXDME6).
Manager.title: Images in cache details causes c:geo to fall

Manager.description: gc have change the layout of the site, we must check if all is runnig fine or the change also some ids.
Manager.title: Check cgeo with new layout

Manager.description: Hi, is there a reason why there is no Firefox AddOn? The idea I have is to remove the need for Greasemonkey, as I find this to be cumbersome for novice users. It would be fairly simple to do this, 5 lines with the AddOn builder and page-mod. Though, one possible issue I see with this is the update mechanism, as for each change of the script the addon would need to be updated as well, but then Firefox would update the app automatically. Furthermore I have one off-topic question, is the server side code for send2cgeo publicly available as well? Looking forward for feedback.
Manager.title: send2cgeo Firefox add-on

Manager.description: When searching for caches online, it would be nice to have the search term as the default name of a new list created from the search results.
Manager.title: have search term as new list name

Manager.description: Last days we chatted, that the apk on the website should be updated to 2013.07.25. Maybe this can also be included in the jenkins project?!
Manager.title: Update apk on website

Manager.description: Hi, Opencaching works fine, but I like do deactivate it. In the Menu, i can do this, but the past shown caches are still there and the MAP cannot be refreshed or cleaned. The problem is, that the icons won't disappear. For example, if you logged a GC Cache, the OC Icon will Overlay the GC Icon. You cannot see, if you have logged the GC Cache. So you want to be able to deactivate the OC Icon. Reconstruction of this issue: Use a GC Account in gceo add the OC Option without an account be happy to see the OC Caches. Remove the OC Option because the GC Caches are overlayed. View the result. Both Cache Types are Shown regards..
Manager.title: Caches from disabled sources shown on live map

Manager.description: Many times when I talk to friends about caching with android and c:geo they tell me that they don't want to lose the possibility to submit caches from a (garmin)-device to an other. The garmin-gps-devices are using ANT+ for that. Thince a few days I use a cheap (20€) ANT+Stick to recive chirp-signals on my smartphone (using "ant usb service", the app "cache beacon" and a small usb cable). It whould be nice to send or receive also cache-listings between c:geo and garmin. And maybe it whould be also nice to send caches from smartphome to smartphone over NFC or Bluetooth without an internet connection.
Manager.title: Feature request: Sending caches from device to device

Manager.description: For personal notes, waypoint notes and potentially other input fields we should set the cursor to the end of the input field because appending to them has a higher probability than adding text at the very start of the note.
Manager.title: Set cursor in personal notes at the end

Manager.description: Go to logs section. Log a find with an image attached. See the log show up in the logs section, but without a trace that the image was actually attached. Only when refreshing the cache details the image indicator is shown. There should be an indicator (even if not the final) as otherwise users submit entries again.
Manager.title: No IMG indicator after loggong for logs with images

Manager.description: I opened the live map today with 2013.08.03-NB and while loading I noticed the following: In the first phase the map was populated from PNG parsing and caches appeared with orange circle After that a nearby search was triggered and the orange circles disappeared for those 20 caches So far, so good but: I can verify that caches parsed with an incorrect type are not corrected (see screenshot where an Earth cache is shown, but it is an Webcam cache) I am quite sure, that I have seen that none of the icon position moved on the map. This would mean that the precise coords from the nearby search do not replace the approximated coords from the parsing. But I am not sure of this issue right now.
Manager.title: Wrong parsed cache type not corrected by nearby search and/or popup

Manager.description: It only becomes visible after changing the log type.
Manager.title: twitter box in trackable logging not visible

Manager.description: Search for a non existing geo code from the search bar at the top of the main screen. For me that leads to the screen keyboard remaining open on my Galaxy Note.
Manager.title: onscreen keyboard remains after failed search

Manager.description: Hi... Since a few days I have the following problem: Live map = OSM. Choose a cache from map, start navigation (from cache preview or detailed view) --> black screen for 2.. 3.. seconds, then cgeo jumps back to live map. Live map = Google Navigation starts correct. Now I can change the map to OSM, everything works fine. When I go back to the live map, Google is still displayed. Choose another cache, start navigation, cgeo uses OSM. Go back to live map --> still Google. Change live map now to OSM --> same problem like in case 1. Tried: New Installation of cgeo from app store and the current Nightly Builds Version: 2013.08.04-NB-62677dd. Downloaded new OSM maps here: http://download.mapsforge.org/maps/europe/germany/ Using Android V 4.1.2 Help :)
Manager.title: No navigation start form Livemap (OSM)

Manager.description: Just a question/proposal: It seems currently send2cgeo is running on the same server where also the webserver and Jenkins is hosted. This is most probably @mucek4 home. send2cgeo seems to get more popular recently and our user base is growing. On the last outage of the webserver we got several complaints about this. Wouldn't it make sense to host it where status.cgeo.org is hosted?
Manager.title: Run send2cgeo on another server

Manager.description: Please install findbugs (tar or zip) from http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/downloads.html on ci.cgeo.org. I'm not sure about how to do this on linux, but I read it might be installed to /data/findbugs. Afterwards I'll add fingbugs checks to the CI run, as described in https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Building+an+Android+app+and+test+project#BuildinganAndroidappandtestproject-FindBugs
Manager.title: install findbugs on CI server

Manager.description: The talking compass function tells the direction to the cache in relation to the compass direction. You therefore have to point your smartphone to a specific direction such that the compass direction is a meaningful value, right? The direction output "3 o'clock" only makes sense if I hold the smartphone horizontally and with the upper side away from me. I would like to use the talking compass while keeping the smartphone in my pocket. This way I could approximate the cache without being noticed that I am a geocacher. I therefore suggest another direction mode which tells the bearing. Either in cardinal directions (north, north-east, east, ...) or with the pure value in degrees. This assumes that you have a slight notion on where 'north' is.
Manager.title: Another direction mode for the talking compass

Manager.description: When you used the function "see the geocache off-line" ( without wifi or GSM connection). When i opened the cache, i've all information on the first page (hint photo is ok). On the log pages, when an image is attached on a log, sometimes it's ok, i click on the image and i see it. But if i go on the last right page ( images page), all the images are a white block with a red cross. It's strange, on the HINT, i see the image, but on the image page, i'ts not possible... Perhaps it's an android problem and not a C:Geo problem, i dont'know. I'm on android 4.1.1
Manager.title: Image cannot be displayed on the last page

Manager.description: Changes have been merged into the script (and I increased the version number to 0.28 consequently). I will give the new version a test and report back here. Afterwards it needs to be published to the website.
Manager.title: Test and release send2cgeo v0.29 user script

Manager.description: I would like to take the posting from @BudBundi to the issuetracker to start a discussion: TB Page not correct load with vodafone DE Beitragvon BudBundi » 06 Aug 2013, 23:05 I have told that to some of you on the MEGA Eck when load a TB Page over the Vodafone DE Network it isn't showing correct. So I investigate in that a little and found that the vodafone proxy try to optimize the HTML and delete some empty divs and not used styles. You can change that when load http://perfomance.vodafone.de and change the settings to optimize off or in expert settings optimize html off. Perhaps that is something for the FAQ. Adding this to the FAQ is one point, but another point would be to compare the HTML-output with both settings and see whether we can optimize our parsing so that this optimization does not have any impact to it. As far as I know these performance proxy installation they usually only strip "unnecessary" HTML-content (like comments, unsued scripts, etc.) from pages and additionally compress pictures requested in that HTML before transfering it to the user. So it is somehow strange that these break our parsing. I also met a user recently with the same problem on Telekom-D1 network in Germany. So it is not specific to one operator but may spread widely with all operators using that kind of proxy. Here are the infos provided by the german network operators: D1: http://www.t-mobile.de/speedmanager/0,20641,24079-_,00.html VF:http://www.vodafone.de/business/hilfe-support/vodafone-performance-manager.html E+: Proxy introduction was stopped (AFAIK) 02: Proxy program was live but terminated after a few months (AFAIK)
Manager.title: Page parsing impossible due to proxies on mobile network

Manager.description: Ask for list
Manager.title: Have settings active by default

Manager.description: It is not possible to see whether one has logged "will attend" for an event except by looking at the (potentially incomplete) logs.
Manager.title: Show "will attend" state

Manager.description: I use version 2013.08.08-NB-89fd871. I have the setting "hide own and found caches" activated. But the waypoints of this hidden caches are still visible on the live map. I saw it many times in the last days. Moust times at parking coordinates at some of my own caches.
Manager.title: Waypoints of hidden Caches still visible on map

Manager.description: (sorry if this should be a douplicated issue, i dont found an other one with my seach before) Sometimes I have to switch from c:geo to an other app and back. For example for calculating new coordinates or making a photo. When c:geo is not active the gps gets deactivated. (Sometimes I even go to the home screen to disable gps and save energy.) After switching back to cgeo the gps needs one second to get a fix again. When I use the live-map I get a trail from N0°E0° near africa to my current position in that moment. When I switch between apps a few times (for example to calculate the next part of coordinates) there comes more and more of this trail-lines from 0° to different positions around me. At least it gets sometimes almoust impossible to see the southern part of the map. Possible solution could be to filter the 0°position from using for the trail or to filter very large jumps of the trail in little time.
Manager.title: Trail jumps to 0° and back.

Manager.description: From support mail: Using navigation with OSMand would be really good, as it provides offline navigation. Right now I can only use "Show on external map" but this will only open OSMand at that position but not navigate to it.
Manager.title: Support navigation with OSMand

Manager.description: Importing a GPX works normal but importing a *.loc shows a strange behaviour: After the file has been selected the progress immediately jumps to 100%. In the log I can see that the data is being imported but at the same time the static map download is triggered for each cache. After importing is done (acc. to log) the progress for static map download is shown normally and it seems the maps are downloaded once again. So the fault is: Static maps should not be downloaded during the file import but seperately Progress indicator is wrong
Manager.title: Strange sequence when import *.loc

Manager.description: The background is dark grey instead of white.
Manager.title: Personal note edit box not ok with light skin

Manager.description: Feature request: It's sometimes a bit irritating if all caches with offline-logs gets the same red smiley on the map, whether I loged a found or a dnf. Whould be nice to see a difference, for example different colours for the smiley.
Manager.title: Use different coloured smilies for found/dnf/etc

Manager.description: Add send to c:geo script to Google store and Mozilla store. It would be nice to add this script to these stores... it would be update automatically, users could write their reviewes, etc... mainly no problem with installing for example GC little help is in the Google store too
Manager.title: Send to c:geo - Google store

Manager.description: I would like to have a easy way to control which caches are displayed on the (live) map. Now we have to go to the home screen -> settings and loose the current viewed positions on the map. Implementing Issue #3078 "Live map should start at last position if not fixed to current position" would eliminate that effect but it is still a long way to the related settings. SIMPLE SOLUTION Add a "Settings" button to the menu of the map. That way we can reach the settings "Exclude own and found caches" and "Exclude disabled caches" more easier. EXTENDED SOLUTION Add a submenu "View" like "Map View" to The menu. It contains a list of check boxes which enables when marked the display of the related Caches. Some ideas for Options: Own and found Disabled Whit stored Log (Caches I couldn't find) All other (hide all so we can see the map in crowded areas) From which "Stored" lists (submenu, giving the option to select any combinations of lists - I don't want to see caches on my 'Riddels to solve online' list out in the field.) Type (maybe submenu) Difficulty (maybe submenu whit selection of which counts of stars) Alternative this menu could be called "Filter" and removers the selected kinds of cached from the map.
Manager.title: Easier way to select which caches are shown on the (live) map

Manager.description: I wonder what this might be: http://labs.geocaching.com
Manager.title: Lab cache type icon ?

Manager.description: Hi folks, just for your information: like mentioned in #3027 the android app startet an open beta phase these days. Have a look at www.cachelab.net if you want to participate. CacheLab will be published under a closed source commercial licence. There is a JSON webservice (already active) and an open source API library (comming soon, after the beta has been finished), that can be used by other programs which want wo make use of the waypoint database of CacheLab.
Manager.title: Beta phase of waypoint formula tool

Manager.description: This feature would alarm me when a new cache has been hidden in some predefined area via the normal android notification mechanisms. This is like a nearby search with sorting by hiding date, newest first. But executed automatically by the AlarmManager in predefined intervals. cgeo should store the last check time and only alert about caches hidden after this check time.
Manager.title: Alert for new caches

Manager.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: Search for GC-code GCA687 Go to image tab Result: Only red cross placeholders shown.
Manager.title: Pictures on image tab not loading

Manager.description: I've recently switched c:geo to use offline maps, in preparation for a trip to Italy. In the UK, the offline maps are separate for England, Wales, Scotland etc. When I move from one region to another, I have to manually go into the settings and select the right map, it would be nice if this was picked according to location. For bonus point: revert back to "live" map when no offline one is present (especially when browsing the map) - for instance, I'm set to England right now as I'm at home, but I was scrolling around the live map looking for caches in Italy... but no map appears, making it hard.
Manager.title: Auto-select offline map

Manager.description: Feature request: I am using c:geo with different Pocket Querys. From time to time it is necessary to replace the hole PQ. There is no other easy way to keep all data up to date. (updating the caches whould not bring new caches in the area and not delete archived caches. And additionaly needs needs much time, data-plan-usage and gc-server-capacity). Like much users I have a list for each PQ. So I have to delete all caches in the list and import a newer PQ for that area. But all self-created waypoints etc. get lost in that moment. I whould like a possibillity to keep all that kind of data. I know it whould waste much phone-storage-place to keep every waypoint of deleted caches from holidays years before. Thats not the best way. But perhaps its possible to delete the data some time later after thethe cachelisting and only if there is not the same cache stored on the phone again in the meantime?? Or a complete different posibillity to replace a PQ?
Manager.title: Create the possibillity to keep user generated data when replacing a PQ

Manager.description: Links in Logs which have not the url as text are not clickable, e.g. my log in http://coord.info/GC4H0P6.
Manager.title: Links in logs not clickable

Manager.description: Hello there. Since yesterday I have some problem when updating me already found caches that I have stored in c.geo in mobile. After updating my status cache smiley disappear from the map and the status cache is not found. In c.geo I logged correctly even on the home screen shows me the correct status of found caches. Why? : (
Manager.title: update has already found caches

Manager.description: The personal note is not parsed when opening cache details. I have a cache with personal notes but it is not showing up with 2013.08.22-NB4.
Manager.title: Personal note not parsed

Manager.description: Due to my restructuring of settings, the "no login data stored" error message leads to opening the screen listing all services, not the preferences screen specific to GC.com. I think it might be useful to directly go into the GC.com settings instead. Other opinions?
Manager.title: missing login should open GC specific preferences

Manager.description: In new settings shorter texts were introduced later then long texts. And the problem was long text IDs were shortened and moved to other IDs. This made our translations confused. I fixed Slovenian today and got a report for Swedish Screen shot: https://fbcdn-sphotos-f-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn2/1149351_10151613266232304_1561332353_o.jpg We have to check translations and report to translators to fix it.
Manager.title: Settings texts too long

Manager.description: Report from facebook: In the Pick a List menu 'Stored' no longer defaults to the top of the menu...it is alphabetized along with all the other lists.
Manager.title: "stored" is no longer 1st

Manager.description: If you create new list by: Click list name on top Select create new type name press OK you get yourself on that newly created list If you create list by: press menu Select List Choose Create new list type name press OK you stay on old list.
Manager.title: Creating new list inconsistency

Manager.description: There is no Slovenian TTS. So compass does not work at all. When you select Force c:geo in English c:geo itself is in english but it still does not talk.
Manager.title: TTS talking compass does not uses force English

Manager.description: I did a backup just now and there was still the date of the failing backup 2 days ago.
Manager.title: Backup date not correct after backup

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Event caches not marked as found

Manager.description: There is a new URL path for cache details: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC2MFE0_pi. It should be added to c:geo so that Chrome2Phone and others work with c:geo.
Manager.title: c:geo doesn't recognize new URLs from geocaching.com

Manager.description: Everything except links on main screen is in English. RC2
Manager.title: Force English does not force English on main screen

Manager.description: Feature release 2013.08.24 is published. Due to the hurry some issue, which we wanted to solve until that release remained open. Those are: #2770 #3136 Edit: Issues originally assinged to last feature release but not completed: #2645 #2864 #2588 Added: #2976 #3201
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: From FB: I have a wish for the calender add-on. It automatically uses the standard calender app from my device, but I installed Jorte calender. It ist not possible to change the calender app in this add-on. Could you add this function some day?
Manager.title: Support other calendars than the default one

Manager.description: From support mail: I am running c:geo version 2013.08.24 and have Light Skin selected. When I go into Settings, the main screen is displayed correctly. When I select any sub-option, the text is not visible. I have to slide finger up or down (scroll) and then text will appear. Running on HTC Incredible Phone. For me on Android 4.x it is working normal. But HTC Incredible for sure has some Android 2.x version which I am unable to test. Maybe someone can have a look on the emulator. AFAIR we already had some version specific problems with the light skin in the past.
Manager.title: Light skin in settings broken

Manager.description: The ci job to install a status message gives an empty URL to the API instead of no URL (when no URL has been entered). This causes a crash when the user clicks the notification.
Manager.title: ci job should not install URL in status if empty

Manager.description: This commit 5ca18af introduced a feature/class which makes the nighlty build fail to build due to proguard issues.
Manager.title: Nighly Build failing due to Null analysis by Eclipse JDT

Manager.description: Version 2013.08.26 -Enter coords and start navigation -Return to anywhere screen by ending navigation Result: -East coordinate is 0 -North coordinates is way off Expected: -previously entered coords should still be shown
Manager.title: Coords in anywhere menu lost

Manager.description: I'm using last nightly build 2013.08.25 When I'm in cache list, press menu and then export, the progress bar is counting caches, not field notes. So even I'm uploading one "Found" log, there is a number something like 286/286 (the number is exactly number of caches in the list). I think that there should be counter of number of field notes for upload.
Manager.title: Remove Field Note Progress

Manager.description: I have latest NB from 2013.08.25 When uploading field notes, there are two questions: upload to GC only since last export I wish the c:geo remember my previous setting.
Manager.title: Field notes export window does not remember my preference

Manager.description: When trying to log with an empty log message, this is catched and logged as an error by GCParser. This should be done in the Activity instead to avoid such debug logs.
Manager.title: Empty log should be caught in log activity

Manager.description: Just loaded the app onto my Sony Experia S - Android v4.1.2. Everything seems OK except the 'hint' is gobbledegook. Can you help? Jim
Manager.title: HInt is gobbledegook

Manager.description: Found in 2013.08.28-NB: This is not clearly reproducible but happens for me almost consistently with the following procedure: Compose log, Attach an existing image Set scaling to "640 px" Send log Compose another log, Attach an existing image Set scaling to "No scaling" Press "OK" to leave the picture selection Result: c:geo stops reacting (does not return to logging view) After some seconds "c:geo is stopped" is shown The log does show nothing special after Debug cgeo 2293 SELECT IMAGE data = Intent { dat=content://media/external/images/media/32943 (has extras) }, just the normal login procedure when c:geo is restarting
Manager.title: ANR (or crash?) when trying to attach an image

Manager.title: "Index out of bounds" on Mapsforge map

Manager.description: Some users on FB thought, that c:geo recognizes them as basic members. After asking what makes them think so, it turned out that they did not get the meaning of the menu item "Basic member" which was shown to them. The fact that it is greyed out was interpreted as this field is for information only (showing that the user is basic member). This item should be renamed to e.g. "Basic Member options" or have a subtitle "This item is only needed for basic members".
Manager.title: Users confused by term "Basic member" in c:geo settings

Manager.description: An noticeable amount of people on FB and support mail are mentioning that the nearby search gives them additional results which are several 1000km away. First feedback (and my personal assumption) shows that for these users one of the opencaching platforms seems to be activatad, although they claim that they did not do it manually (just upgraded the app). Can someone check if the initial values for that platforms are set to disabled?
Manager.title: An unusual amount of people are reporting nearby results which are far away

Manager.description: In the newest nightly-builds I noticed that the same cache-popup on the livemap sometimes opens a few times. Sometimes it needs a second or two until that popup is open. When I touch on the cache icon again and again in that time (because I don't know if the device had realised my touch) the popup opens again after I touched the dark map to to close it. So in some cases I have to touch the map three or four times to go back to the map.
Manager.title: Cache-Popups open several times

Manager.description: When I use the live-map-feature to search online for caches I often have to load that caches a few times and spend the data-usage a few times. Thats because almoust every time I switch to an other app and back (and every time I leave the livemap to open an other cache in history and reopen livemap again than) that caches are gone from the map. Even when I already opened a cache-detail-page and downloaded (not stored) all cache-details the cache will not not shown on the map after an app-switch. The "unstored" cachedate is kept three days by c:geo. why can't the cache-icon also be displayed all that three days?
Manager.title: Feature request: Keep unstored caches on map until its data gets deleted

Manager.description: Sometimes not all stored caches will be shown on the map. I noticed this much times when I zoom out from a center of an imported PQ with 500 or more caches. The round circle full of caches seem to be cutted at the half and the eastern part is missing. If the shape of imported PQ is round that is easy to recognize but if it is rectangular (for example from gsak) that can be really irritating. If its really not possible to display all caches I whould like to get a short error-message.
Manager.title: PQ - Not all stored-caches are displayed on the map if there are to much

Manager.description: Depuis la derniere mise a jour de cgeo ma batterie se decharge a la vitesse V V' Je ne sais pas si c'est lie a la mise a jour mais je n'avais pas ce problème avant donc...
Manager.title: Decharge de la batterie

Manager.description: We create a static map in the cache details which seems to have very restricted height. On a new tablet it looks like 80 by 600 pixels or the like. We should make the height proportional or even equal to the width, there is enough space for scrolling.
Manager.title: static map in details should be bigger

Manager.description: Users request on suport mail: He told that opencaching.us should support it already and asked if we could include it. As the US are one of the big "markets" where c:geo is used this sounds reasonable.
Manager.title: Support opencaching.us via OKAPI

Manager.description: The Text of Street-, Building-, and Area-Names is displayed very small on high-res-devices. In the moment I help myself with zoom in and try to read the text in that second until the more detailed map picture is shown (with small text again). In that second the text have a nice-to-read-sice. I have no very bad eyes so I think we need a "bigger" map-scale for high-res-displays.
Manager.title: Feature request: Show mapsforge-map "bigger" on high-res-displays

Manager.description: Hope this is not a duplicate, - i found nothing in the old issues. I created a PQ named "Rügen Auswahl" at gc.com and marked the option " Include Pocket Query name in download file name" there. But I was not able to import it to c:geo. I get the Error Message "Bad bite at 10". It worked with two workarounds: open the zip and rename the gpx-files so that the umlauts are gone create a PQ without this name-option. Here the not-working file: http://db.tt/WUkVQ9Hu
Manager.title: PQ-import dont work if "include name" is enabled at gc.com and the name contain a german umlaut

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: GPS exhibit not recognized as event cache

Manager.description: As the discussion in #3212 showed, there may be problems the way we do multiple requests automatically in the Network class. I assume, that spurious reports of multiple logs or images posted (see e.g. #2921) may come from this as well. So the question is, if we remove this altogether or limit it only to specific use cases or only remove it for OAuth calls. Opinions, comments, questions welcome.
Manager.title: Remove automatic retries in network

Manager.description: 2013.09.01-NB: Search for a not existing GC-code (e.g. GC1) The error toast shown "Unknown communication error" Expectation: AFAIR there was another prompt for an unexisting cache which also used to work. "Communication error" sounds like a network problem, wich is not the case
Manager.title: Unkown communication error searching for a non existing GC-code

Manager.description: IRC-discussion with Lineflyer: (22:30:41) Lineflyer: another last question (22:30:53) Lineflyer: live map seems to have lost performance in the last months. (22:31:12) rsudev: You mean gc.com live map? (22:31:13) Lineflyer: I am not sure if this is just gc.com (after their tile server change) (22:31:16) Lineflyer: c:geo (22:31:29) rsudev: gc.com in c:geo? (22:31:33) Lineflyer: yes (22:31:58) Lineflyer: Now something really weired out of my mind (22:32:29) Lineflyer: In the logs is see "Cache XY loaded from DB" or "Cache xy returned no results" for each and every cache parsed from live map (22:32:59) Lineflyer: I am really not sure if this was the procedure ever since or came in new (22:33:09) Lineflyer: COuld this slow done the whole process? (22:33:31) Lineflyer: I see some 0,2-0,5 seconds or sometimes even more between those consecutive requests (22:33:55) Lineflyer: Are these DB requests? (22:34:04) Lineflyer: DB is slow,...isnt it? (22:34:04) rsudev: These are DB requests (22:34:10) rsudev: they are slow (22:34:29) rsudev: We need them to get coords and found state of stored caches (and type and...) (22:34:40) Lineflyer: Was it always like that? Or maybe due to changes in merging data? (22:34:50) rsudev: they could be fater if bundled (22:35:02) Lineflyer: fater :D (22:35:05) Lineflyer: ;) (22:35:07) rsudev: That I am not sure of - I copuld try to research this (22:35:16) rsudev: fater faster :) (22:35:55) Lineflyer: cachecache = DB Right? (22:36:00) rsudev: no (22:36:15) rsudev: cachecache helps avoiding db (22:36:46) Lineflyer: isnt cachecache just for unsaved caches (22:37:40) Lineflyer: saved with listid=0 (22:37:47) Lineflyer: in DB (22:37:48) Lineflyer: ? (22:38:14) rsudev: No. Its for all. Its the only place where we hold livemap caches, but all detailed ones are in the db and in the cachecache if needed (22:38:25) Lineflyer: mmh (22:39:24) Lineflyer: couldnt we load all saved caches to cachecache when starting cgeo or livemap ? (Again: Just brainstorming wiithout any deep knowledge) (22:40:03) Lineflyer: Sadly the c:geo version of just after introduction of cachecache is no longer working (22:40:20) Lineflyer: I remember an impressive performance boost at that time (22:40:34) rsudev: We can't generally, as even the big phones do not have enough memory for that (22:40:40) Lineflyer: ok (22:41:45) Lineflyer: I would really love to have a flow chart of how that live map merging works to analyze and improve...but this will not be easy (22:41:46) rsudev: We can try to bulk load caches in the live-map area (we do that anyway, hmmm) (22:42:13) rsudev: Perhaps these additional requests are just not needed (22:42:58) Lineflyer: As said...It is just my brain telling me that those hundreds of "Cache xy retuned no results" was not present in the past (months ago) (22:44:13) rsudev: those should be relatively fast, I assume (22:44:51) Lineflyer: not really...afair... some weeks ago I posted this somewhere that I see a maximum of 2-3 lines per second in the log
Manager.title: Collection of ideas to analyse and improve live-map performance

Manager.description: Always returning the twenty first results from opencaching seems to be not a good idea, as you may be far off the mainland of a particular site and thus receive a number of meaningless results (several thousand kilometers away). One option can be to manually switch this site off (which would lead to some missed caches as the occasional cache is placed her and there even far off the mainland. I suggest to introduce a maximum range instead of about 100 or 200 km.
Manager.title: Introduce Range limit for opencaching 'nearby' searches

Manager.description: Digging through ImageSelectActivity code I found out that the preview image is always downsampled by 8 instead of calculating the necessary downsampling rate. There is still code in ImageUtils to calculate the downsampling rate. That should be separated to calculateDownsample and scale and ImageSelectActivity should use it only providing the desired preview boundings.
Manager.title: ImageSelectActivity: Alter downsample preview according to source and preview size

Manager.description: As found out by @rsudev it there are retries on post requests in class Network. This will lead to several posted images on timeout of 30 seconds. POST requests should not be retried in Network but maybe by the caller. If we need to retry here, we should split up in two post methods: post and repeatedPost. Another approach is to set Network timeout to a higher value in GCParser.imageUpload. Any feedback?
Manager.title: Network - No retry for POST

Manager.description: This was already mentioned in #417. A lot of request are on support email and facebook to implement talking list in addition to talking compass. Talking list would give you spoken instructions to the next cache. Like for power trails for example. The question just remains what is the next cache. Caches that are "in front of you" (9 o'clock - 3 o'clock) Caches that are not found (and do not have stored log) Only caches that have a strage there (would it make sense to talk for misteries?) Shall it work only on stored lists or also on nearby, etc... I have also selected feedback to get feedback.
Manager.title: Feature request: Talking list

Manager.description: If a trackable is in the hands of a cacher then the TB page says "In the hands of XXX". This text is clickable and should open a menu where "XXX" is used as data. Right now the data is "In the hands of XXX" that will lead to opening invalid links in browser or trying to view invalid data. The problem is that UserActionsClickListener.java is using the full text of the view as data...
Manager.title: Trackable in hands of cacher problems

Manager.description: From support mail (did not have time to verify this yet): I think there is some problem with cache attributes (considering opencaching.pl). Before August update I could see the attributes (not sure if all) in text form just below cache description. Now, in new version only few attributes are displayed as icons (changing into text after touching) below cache main details screen. Most of attributes are skipped. Why?
Manager.title: Attributes on opencaching.pl

Manager.description: From support mail: Go to cache details, navigate, download static maps. Go back into navigate and the option to download static maps is still there. BUT.... go back out to the list view, reselect the same cache and now go into navigate - this time it recognises the maps have been downloaded and ready to use.
Manager.title: Menu item "Download static maps" not updated correctly

Manager.description: I downloaded a zipped .kmz (for Google Earth) file to my phone with my browser. Attempting to open it automatically opens c:geo, and I can't change this by clearing a default app in Android, because it doesn't seem to be registered that way. To attempt to open the file in anything else, I had to uninstall c:geo.
Manager.title: Associates with zipped KMZ files in a nonchangeable fashion

Manager.description: I've got several reports of the hint decoding not being triggered. Probably because the area is to small.
Manager.title: Make hint box clickable

Manager.description: To make it easier to count event attendee numbers we soul simply have the log view below the log form.
Manager.title: Log list view below log form

Manager.description: I just tested the circles feature. To be of any value to owners it should draw circles only around physical stages of a cache. That is a) the coordinates of a traditional cache b) the physical stages of a multi-cache (where a box is hidden to give further clues) c) the final coordinates of a multi-cache (if available) d) the final coordinates of a mystery (if available) I checked the current stable version (2013.08.26) and also the nightly build (2013.09.06-NB-e21a54e) and in both circles are drawn around multi-cache header coordinates and mysteries. That is a bug and should be corrected.
Manager.title: Circles around physical stages of a cache

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Event cache pop-up should show the date of the event

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Touching a TB should present the "touch" action by default

Manager.description: Open a cache with a TB. Post a log for the cache. Now the trackable tab of the cache listing is gone. If the cache listing is refreshed then the TB reappears.
Manager.title: TBs disappears from listing after posting a log

Manager.description: Is there a possibility that the cache icons on the maps could match that of geocaching.com. The current icons are superb, what I mean is the one for traditionals that are for premium users are round and the one's for all members (basic and premium) are square. Currently all cache icons are all shown as circles.
Manager.title: Map Icons

Manager.description: When browsing the Live Map, after panning around, sometimes tapping on a cache will open details for a totally different cache (possibly that was visible in previous area viewed). Going back to the map and tapping the cache again will open the correct info.
Manager.title: Wrong Details Open from Live Map

Manager.description: Just translated description of Prague webcam cache and got HTML mixed in.
Manager.title: Strip HTML before using translate

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: default log type for webcam cache is dnf

Manager.description: Cat log shows this in a stored log: 09-07 22:23:22.765 D/JsonParser(18883): org.gorenc.cgeo: publishState=2
Manager.title: Curious package name

Manager.description: Starting from event date the default should be "attended", before that it should be "will attend"
Manager.title: Default event log type should depend on date

Manager.description: One can refresh all caches in the history list. Doing that will lead to asking for a list to store all these caches. That's unusable. It should be possible to refresh those caches and leave them on their own list each.
Manager.title: Refresh all from history asks for list to store

Manager.description: When selecting a list, we have pseudo entries for "all" and "new list". I think it might be good to also have "history" there to more easily switch to that list.
Manager.title: Put history in list selection

Manager.description: When being in the history list, the title click does not lead to a list selection pop-up. It does nothing. This is surprising for users, therefore this should just work in all lists without any special exception.
Manager.title: Switch from history to other list by title click

Manager.description: From support mail: I'm using the c:geo App already a while whit a custom map theme. Now I tried to change the theme and selected the directory of the new theme. But it still reads the old one. I already tried to rename the old theme and select the renamed theme but then it says that the theme could not be found. As workaround I placed the new theme at the same location as the old one. So the conclusion is, that the selected theme was saved on a different location/key with the old GUI and the renderer reads the theme from this old location/key and not the new one.
Manager.title: Selecting new map theme directory fails

Manager.description: When more than one cache is removed since we opened a non-default list view, we should propose to remove the list as well. We do it the other way around (propose to remove the caches when we remove the list) but some users might just remove all the caches, expecting to be able to remove the list at the same time.
Manager.title: Propose to remove list when all caches are removed

Manager.description: I found issue with opencaching.pl cache images. C:GEO only download spoiler image, but not download other cache images. You can try this bug in cache OP4FE1 (http://opencaching.pl/viewcache.php?cacheid=20454). Other - on opencaching.pl there are some other attributes than in gc.com, so maybe you can add this attributes (http://wiki.opencaching.pl/index.php/Parametry_skrzynki).
Manager.title: Images from opencaching.pl don't download

Manager.description: Open dir chooser (selecting offline map theme) Select a folder but do not press OK. Manager.description: The cache description of GC3F1YK contains some really small fonts which might make them hard to read on a small screen. One possibiity is to allow zooming (another issue) but I wonder if it might be meaningful to set a limit for minimum font size,
Manager.title: Have a possibility to define minimum font size

Manager.description: When I open a cache-detail-page on my devices (latest stable or nightly builds) and than >menu>navigate>map I get the map with this one cache and its waypoints only. (I think that is right and useful) Last week I tried the same on a samsung galaxy S4 (last stable build from playstore) and the result was the normal map with all other caches also displayed. I don't know a setting to change that so I think it must be a bug!?
Manager.title: Map for one Cache behaves different on some devices

Manager.description: Currently short press and long press on the main menu item "Filter" has the same result. It will open the cache type filter list. I suggest to use the long press for resetting it to "All caches"
Manager.title: Use long press on filter button to reset filter

Manager.description: If the time-stamp betwenn device and the OKAPI-site is higher than a certain limit, all requests are denied. We can (and should) detect this situation and report it back to allow the user to adjust the device time and timezone. A sample answer (with http response code 400): {"error":{"developer_message":"Expired timestamp, yours 1378850423, ours 1378878830 (threshold 300).", "reason_stack":["invalid_oauth_request","invalid_timestamp"], "status":400,"yours":"1378850423", "ours":1378878830, "difference":28407, "threshold":300, "more_info":"http:\/\/opencaching.pl\/okapi\/introduction.html#errors"}}
Manager.title: Detect and report time-skew that prevents okapi access

Manager.description: When refresh caches, we could only update the status or/and coordinate or/and log or/and other separated item(s).
Manager.title: Make refresh item selectable

Manager.description: My device and my c:geo are usually in French. I do not have the "Translate to English" menu because it is only offered when c:geo is configured to use English. Given the fact that the most used translator, Google Translate, uses English as a pivot language and may be very bad for other languages, I propose to always offer the "Translate to English" menu in addition to the local language. This has hit me in Prague where the French translation for some cache was awful.
Manager.title: Always propose to translate in English
Remove unary distances from TTS

Manager.description: I'm not sure if that is a convention for the firefox addons, but the NOTICE and LICENSE files are not Javascript files, only text files. I therefore suggest to change their extension. Anyone with more knowledge?
Manager.title: send2cgeo NOTICE and LICENSE are named .js, but are not JavaScript

Manager.description: The icon on our "helper apps" screen is outdated.
Manager.title: GPS Status app has a different icon

Manager.description: I noticed this in 2013-09-14-nb. I opened the live map, got a new cache with orange circle, opened the popup, stored the cache and got a second Icon. The orange-circle-icon stays until the whole map get closed.
Manager.title: Stored live-map-caches are twice on the map until next map-close.
