Manager.description: When long pressing description on trackable details a popup menu to translate a description is not offered as it's on cache details.
Manager.title: Trackable description can't be translated.

Manager.description: I use „Radar“ (GPS Status 4.3.78) when approaching a cache. I notice the coordinates sent to that app are off by .001 in lon or lat direction for many caches. Examples: GC423BT, listed at N50° 47,654 and E 006° 04,212. When switching to Radar, target coordinates are N50° 47.654 (OK), but E 006° 04.211! Same for GC34TXF (N 50° 48,247 E 006° 04,622) targeted in Radar as N 50° 48.246, E 006° 4.622. I only noticed it in lon or lat component, never in both at the same time. Some caches are OK, like GC4DCZH. Build-in "Kompass" is OK, so i guess it has to do with sending the coordinates to GPS Status app, While the difference is small, in urban settings it can be crucial, and i start to reason about why i did not find so many caches during the last weeks. I did not notice that difference…
Manager.title: Coordinates in "Radar" off by .001 in lon or lat direction for many caches

Manager.description: When using GC.com and OC.de in parallel, the icons for caches published on both pages perfectly align. The OC.de-cache icon gets painted on top. When tapping on the map, i can only open the details for the OC cache, not the GC one, because it is covered by the other icon. More often than not, i would like to see the details of the GC.com listing, as they are often more up-to-date (archivings, deactivations), or their logs contains better info (DNFs, better/more hints). I would like to ask for a selection dialog when two icons are too near too each other so that i can choose whether i get to see the details of the GC or OC listing. Or detect there are two listings on different services for the same coordinate, and allow for switching the listing in the detail view.
Manager.title: Icons for same location on maps overlap (Same Cache listed on GC.com and OC.de)

Manager.description: When opening manage menu in lists clear offline logs is close to import and has no confirmation.
Manager.title: Clear offline logs should have confirmation

Manager.description: For those who do not have internet on mobile phone would be interesting to create a way to automatically upload all logs created offline and not one by one. It is possible to create this option?
Manager.title: Offline log automatic upload all

Manager.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to stored caches list Long press on a cache Select "Delete" Result: Cache remains stored Expected: Cache deleted from device
Manager.title: Delete from list not possible

Manager.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to lists Select one or several cache(s) Press Menu and Select "Manage" -> "Move selected" Create a new list in the dialogue shown(!) Result: New list is created but cache(s) not moved to that list Expectation: New list created and caches moved to that list If the list is already existing, moving is working normal.
Manager.title: Move selected caches to a new list not possible

Manager.description: Most probably this is related to #3285 and/or #3286, nevertheless I open a separate issue for that: 2013.09.15-NB Open a user created list with caches in it Select Menu -> Manage -> Delete all and list Result: List is deleted but caches are moved to default list instead of being deleted Expectation: All caches of the list should be deleted and the list should be removed
Manager.title: Remove all and list not working

Manager.description: Filtering for Whereigo or Letterbox (did not try all the other „exotic“ cache types) shows me all OC caches mixed with the correctly filtered GC caches in "nearby" search. As OC does not support these cache types, i propose the OC caches should default to NOT match these filters. Now they seem to default to match the filter "just in case", or erronously.
Manager.title: Filter for whereigo and letterbox shows all OC caches

Manager.description: On my phone with today's RC the checkbox is only partly visible. The other question is shall we drop checking when checkbox is shown or not? It was added by me when orange circle were introduced.
Manager.title: Live map coordinates not precise warning

Manager.description: During the recent presentations I gave and also during events I notice that nearly no one knows about the Pocket Query Creator app, although it is listed in our helpers apps screen. I was wondering if we could increase the visibility by having a new menu item besides the import GPX file and import from web menu items, which would always be visible and would either invoke the pocket query creator or redirect to the market page (if not installed yet). Comments? Other ideas?
Manager.title: have Pocket Query Creator in import menu

Manager.description: Hi! I tried playing around with custom map styles, but failed miserably. Now i cannot get rid of it. Copied a dir structure with 3 map styles to device Set map themes dir to root of that structure went to live map, in settings, map settings, select map theme i selected one of the (correctly displayed) themes c:geo died unexpectedly (perhaps a bug on itself, but well…) restarted c:geo, went to live map, c:geo dies again Cannot undo my theme selection, as i cannot get to the settings of the live map anymore I delete the dir with the 3 map styles I go to live map again, get toast "map theme not found". I go to settings and select "standard" map theme. When going to live map, i continue to get "map theme not found'. Displayed map theme is "standard" as selected. I want to "delete" the selected directory for map themes in general settings, but that is not possible. I can only select a dir, but cannot "empty" the selection I go all the way up in my dir tree on the device. Upmost dir i can select is "/sdcard". I select this one. When again i want to change the selection, in the dir selection dialog there are no sub dirs diplayed, "path" at the top shows "/" Now i am stuck: I cannot change map themes dir, i cannot reset it to "nothing", when starting map i get "map theme not found" although i selected "standard". I propose to give the user an easy way to reset his map theme settings to „factory" when things get borked. Is there any way for me to do this manually? I can edit files on my device if necessard. Using 2013.09.16-RC.
Manager.title: directory for custom map styles not clearable, map theme not found, dir not changeable

Manager.description: On the last two events I have been, both times I have seen a person using c:geo with our upgrade warning on the main screen and that person wondering why something did not work, but not having the idea that an upgrade is available or needed. I have the feeling that our message text or the general presentation of that warning are not explicit enough. We should change the text to "Hey dude. Install the new version, this one is broken" or have the warning shown as confirmation dialog after some time. Any other suggestions how to improve this?
Manager.title: People ignore the upgrade warning

Manager.description: Can you use offline basemaps and add layers? Is a measurement tool available?
Manager.title: Offline Base Map and Layers with Measurement

Manager.description: Similar to #3294 I also have an additional problem: I user to have selected "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" selected for offline maps I created another folder "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/america" and moved maps there I went to c:geo settings and triggered the dir selection The scanner runs and offers maps in both directories "europe" and "america" I selected a map in folder "america" Returning to setting the choice "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/america" is correctly shown Leave the settings Open live map Select Menu -> Map It offers me only the maps contained in "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" but not "america" Reenter the settings. The map folder selection shows "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" again which is NOT what I have chosen before 2013.09.17-RC1
Manager.title: Map folder selection faulty

Manager.description: After negotiating with an user who reported that c:geo keeps showing 0 caches at the status bar in c:geo for him, I adviced :) to find another cache. So now the user has two finds and c:geo shows them normally. Prior to that the user tried resinstalling,etc,etc. with the same result that 0 caches are shown. So I guess there is really a problem recognizing a find count of 1.
Manager.title: Find count not working for "1 cache"

Manager.description: Trying to load the unzipped contents of http://www.android-hilfe.de/attachments/karten-navigation/230515d1376040879-mapsforge-vektorkarten-high-contrast-style-vmap-fuer-orux-locus-vmap_locus.zip as map theme makes c:geo crash. Problems with interpreting the files should lead to an error message, not a crash. Faulty or not c:geo-compatible files should be considered the norm case, not an exotic edge case where crashing might be more acceptable.
Manager.title: Missing Robustness when loading map themes

Manager.description: The map settings are only accessible when the map is displayed. This leads to an vicious circle when due to misconfiguration c:geo crashes when displaying the map: The faulty setting cannot be reset, as the menu cannot be reached before the crash. I propose to include the map settings in general app settings as a separate sub page.
Manager.title: Map settings only accessible from map view

Manager.description: Map-Themes-directory is displayed as "/sdcard' in Map-subpage of app settings. When tapping the entry, directory chooser displays "/" as path, no subdirs are shown for selection, and only "abort" is displayed as button. Device: HTC One (only integrated storage, no memory card)
Manager.title: directory chooser not working properly

Manager.description: I sometimes log event caches some days late. It would be more convenient to use the event date as default instead of the current date, if the cache is an event cache.
Manager.title: Use event date instead of current date for logging

Manager.description: People are not aware of the ability to translate cache descriptions.
Manager.title: add Google translate to useful apps

Manager.description: When events are created in the users calendar using the calendar addon, then the coordinates are added as well. These coords has used to open Google Maps or other apps like OsmAnd to view the position. Now it seem like the intent format has changed since Maps don't find anything and OsmAnd indicates that part of the coords are lost.
Manager.title: Coords in calendar is not usable

Manager.description: I can currently not provide a step-by-step for this but its quite obvious: 2013.09.20-NB Filter for a special cache type (global filter) Open live map Zoom or pan around (I guess zooming out below where gc.com hides them for PM) Some caches of other types (parsed from map, orange circled) appear and stay (also when zooming in again) Solution would be limiting the minimum zoom-level in which tiles are requested (as discussed in another issue) or refiltering after parsing (I guess this is currently only done for BM).
Manager.title: Cache type filtering fails on live map

Manager.description: in chrome version 29.0.1547.76 m you can´t install scripts if they come from websites. the script must be available on playstore. i don´t know how i can install the script now :(
Manager.title: Can´t install send2cgeo script with chrome

Manager.description: Our installation guideline does not give any tips for Chrome. But you cannot install our extension in a pure Chrome browser (due to access restrictions), therefore we should explicitly mention to install Tampermonkey first: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tampermonkey/dhdgffkkebhmkfjojejmpbldmpobfkfo
Manager.title: send2cgeo installation should link to Tampermonkey

Manager.description: After the latest update, 2 days ago, I am unable to access the Android c:geo app at all. It even crashes the Google Play app instantly, when I try to reach and open c:geo that way. I am reluctant to try to uninstall and reinstall, after I read that it will erase every saved cache, and note, and so on. Am I the only one experiencing this problem? What to do, please?
Manager.title: C:geo app crashes when I try to open it

Manager.description: We use two different labels "Authorize" and "Authorize again" for the OAuth settings, depending on whether the user has already authorized the service. But right after authorizing a service the first time, this label is not updated and still shows "Authorize". We miss a refresh of the settings activity there.
Manager.title: Label of OAuth settings not updated after first authorization

Manager.description: I deactivated 2 of my caches but the state in list didn't show it. After refresh it is shown correct but activating one cache it is still shown deactivated. The state should be shown correct after logging deactivated / activated.
Manager.title: Activated / Deactivated Flag

Manager.description: With the latest update, the caches I have already found no long appear with the smiley face unless I select the cache, scroll to the log, then close the cache. Also, the app is now very slow since the last update.
Manager.title: Cache Found Icon

Manager.description: Required: Slow connection Prepare Mapsforge to use online map Open cache list Press "Map". The (empty) map appears and map tiles are loading. Press "back" c:geo is not responding anymore (ANR after some seconds after user interaction) until all tiles are loaded in the background or a timeout occurs.
Manager.title: ANR in Mapsforge

Manager.description: It seems like many translations were lost in 04d3a1c when translations were imported from Crowdin. I noticed many incorrect/missing translations in the Swedish in nightly builds that I knew that I had translated.
Manager.title: Lost translations due to import from Crowdin

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: OC Authorization activity is black on black with light skin and Android 2.x

Manager.description: OC has an additional cache size "nano". Currently c:geo reads it as "micro" size. Example: OC100CB
Manager.title: Support OC cache size "Nano"

Manager.description: Our OAuth signing is wrong for the reserved characters of RFC 3986. OAuth requires everything except unreserved characters to be encoded: http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#encoding_parameters I found this while trying to add support for name search in OKAPI and failed for a long time, due to us not encoding the asterisk wildcard "*". Even if our OAuth signing method is only 20 lines, to me this issue (and the hours I spent looking back and forth) makes me think it should be replaced by a ready-made library.
Manager.title: OAuth signing is wrong

Manager.description: Current market release as well as 2013.09.30-NB: Example GC53 which is located at 00 00.000 E036 00.000 Distance to cache shows --- Coordinates are not shown / Navigation is impossible
Manager.title: No distance calculation and coords if cache is at equator

Manager.description: When viewing a map, one of the options is to show the visible caches as a list, however it is only active when 'enable live' is also activated AND the live feed has finished loading for the map view. As someone who predominantly uses c:geo in an offline mode, is it possible to have this feature active without the live feed? thanks.
Manager.title: Option to 'show as list' only active when viewing live caches

Manager.description: I just made a longer multi cache and used the note taking field below the listing to keep track of the variables i took along the route. It read like A=1 B=2 C=3 Suddenly when looking again at the list later, it read A=1 B=2 C=3 -- A=1 B=2 C=3 The content has been doubled, separated by "--". I could continue editing the (doubled) content without problems, and nothing strange happened any more. I am very, very sure i did not copy the content or type the "--" by myself. Is this a bug or some obscure type of feature i accidently triggered? I cannot reproduce the cause, but perhaps someone can have a look if something inside the note taking field looks fishy or if there is some reference to the string "--" somewhere.
Manager.title: Note-Taking field doubles entered text

Manager.description: From german geoclub forum: If a log image is added to the log, the log page is loaded again and the trackable actions are resetted to the default.
Manager.title: Trackable actions reset after attaching picture

Manager.description: With NB 2013.10.03 I experienced several crashes in different parts of the app which didnot stop until I deactivated oc.de. NB 2013.10.02 was quite stable. So my assumption (which is totally unvalidated due to lack of logging capability) would be that something with the oc.de interface is broken from yesterday to today. A focus area of the crashes are in the search field when searching for cache name or GC-code. Reproducible for me was: Search for "GC4" Progress window is shown but before cache is displayed c:geo crashes Note: OC.de was activated in parallel to gc.com to that time I am outside the OC.de area (>200km rule applies) Edit: changed title according to description from @AlfredSK
Manager.title: c:geo crashes on first fix

Manager.description: 2013.10.04-NB: Search for location (e.g. Köln) Press Menu, Select "Save for Offline" Result: Nothing happens
Manager.title: Save for offline not working

Manager.description: We allow upload for non-PM too. Didn't try what it does and if it works.
Manager.title: Personal note on GC.com is only for premium members

Manager.description: sometimes there are waypoints (puzzle piece icon) visible on the live map even though I didn't open the corrosponding cache. I'd expect only to see theses waypoints when I'm opening a cache with waypoints on tap on "map view".
Manager.title: Waypoints of Multi-Caches are shown on Live Map

Manager.description: In the folder /sdcard./cgeo are all the caches that were ever loaded by the app. At least that's my understanding. It would be great if there would be a differentiation between saved caches (from lists) and all temporary loaded caches. I would appreciate it if there would be a function to delete all caches but the ones saved on my lists.
Manager.title: I would like to delete caches that were loaded tempararily

Manager.description: All caches nearby are loaded and only after I clicked the map icon of the cache to see the details they become grayed out and eventually hidden. The same goes sometimes for found caches, I have to open them completely, then when I go back to the live map, I see the cache with a smiley and only if I change the zoom level the found cache disappears. It would be an improvement to load the status of the cache on the livemap so that deactivated caches aren't shown at first.
Manager.title: Deactivated caches load on the live map even though I set the setting to not show them

Manager.description: From support mail: I use a tablet and selected a larger system font so that I can read all details without problems (I am a little older). Its working quite well throughout the app, however in compass view the direction and distance are truncated although there is enough space.
Manager.title: Allow font to be bigger in compass view

Manager.description: The event time of GC4N2MB is not recognized correctly.
Manager.title: calendar time recognized wrongly

Manager.description: From FB: is it possible to make send2c:geo compatible with polish site opencaching.pl ? it will be very usefull to polish geocachers!
Manager.title: Send2cgeo for opencaching.pl

Manager.description: The new customizable templates for twitter posts allows insertion of placeholders. But these placeholders do not include the name of the found cache / touched trackable and the coord.info URL. I would consider these the most useful information for twitter postings (and it was also included in the default text before).
Manager.title: Template placeholder for twitter should include cache name and URL

Manager.description: When deactivating „hide deactivated caches“ (so showing them), archived OC-caches are displayed, but not OC caches with status „gesperrt“. Example is OCDB3D. It never shows in the live map, whether „hide deactivated caches“ is activated or not. I propose handling „gesperrt“ and „archiviert“ alike. Version: 2013-10-07-NB
Manager.title: OC: Caches with status „gesperrt“ do not show on live map

Manager.description: OC website has some kind of subheading below the cache name, that can possibly hold important information for the cacher (as in the example above). This subheading is not displayed anywhere in c:geo, as far as i can see.
Manager.title: OC: „Subheading information“ missing in cache details

Manager.description: 2013.10.06-NB: Set global filter by cache type Open a (non default list) Select Menu -> Manage -> Delete all and list Result: Filtered cache type caches are deleted List is deleted Non filter matching caches are moved to default list I am not sure how this function should react in such a case... However just pushing all remaining caches to the default list confuses my list management and was not what I expected. I suggest to either ignore the filter in that case and really delete all caches of that list or not offer the "Delete all and list" in this (filtered) case.
Manager.title: Deleting cache+list in combination with filter reacts strange

Manager.description: GC4MEKX The text for WP15 is not displayed in c:geo. I assume it is caused by the special characters used in WP name.
Manager.title: Problem with special characters in waypoint

Manager.description: It may be confusing for users that they can't find 'Import from web' entry in menu, when they don't have registered send2cgeo service. I suggest to have the entry there and show error informing user that send2cgeo is not ready to use and maybe even contain link to registration page.
Manager.title: show 'Import from web' even without proper send2cgeo registration
GPX import dialog has double border

Manager.description: In case when more than one origin of caches is configurend (in my case GC.com und OC.de), there should be a possibility to filter for that property. So just display GC caches or OC caches or both.
Manager.title: Filter for Cache Origin (GC.com or OC.de)

Manager.description: http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_43 seems to reference a menu item that is no more… So possibility to filter out PM-only caches is no more?
Manager.title: FAQ #1_43 outdated

Manager.description: The directional arrows are still there, even the option is deselected. There is another option regarding directional arrows for basic members in the "services" - "geocaching.com" section. I deselected this one, too (Why are there two of them?) Still the arrows are there.
Manager.title: Direction to cache still displayed in lists although deselected

Manager.description: So, yeah. I want to select what caches to display and not only display 1 type. I want to be able to sort by rating/favs. Is it okay for me to implement these?
Manager.title: About Filters

Manager.description: When trying to install all the plugins for c:geo with the .p2f file i get this error: An error occurred while collecting items to be installed session context was:(profile=epp.package.standard, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Collect, operand=, action=). Manager.title: DEV: plugin installation

Manager.description: I propose to make a more sensible default for the type of a waypoint when creating a new one, depending on the type of cache: Traditional: Keep Reference point Mystery: Make „Final“ default Multi: Make „Stage of Multi“ default (or whatever the english translation is in the moment) — yes i know that then at the end you have to change to „Final“. But normally Multis have more than one stage, but only one final. Others: Don't know, perhaps you guys have ideas? Else keep „Reference Point“. I personally never need a „reference point“, and so i have to constantly change the type of waypoint when i need one. Just a small thing, but it would mean less annoyance. Thanks for considering.
Manager.title: More sensible default for waypoint type on creation

Manager.description: Often, i take a nice picture before approaching and finding the cache, that i want to add to the cache log. When selecting a picture now you only can select between taking one right now or going to the gallery where in 99% of cases i select the last picture i took, not one from 3 months ago, that it would allow me to do…In one app i once saw an option „Last picture taken“, that automatically took the newest picture from the gallery with just one click. Perhaps this can be implemented in addition to the other two options? I suspect c:geo has to scan the DCIM-directory itself and cannot rely on delegating the task to the gallery app for that feature. Or is there an matching intent? Bonuspoints when it takes the second-to-last picture when i already uploaded the last one (when i want to upload two pictures to the same log). Thanks for considering.
Manager.title: New option „Last picture taken“ when selecting picture for log upload

Manager.description: Activate open caching, set global filter to wherigo, then search nearest. Result list contains all kinds of caches from open caching.
Manager.title: Wrong caches returned for filtered search

Manager.description: From support mail: c:geo used to remember the position to which I scrolled on each tab of the cache details. Now this is still working except for the log tab. I tested this with the result: Open cache details Change to logbook screen Scroll down some log entries (and keep it in mind) Change to description screen Chane back to logbook screen Result: Position is still the same Now change to e.g. to details screen (more than one slide away from logbook!) Change back to logbook screen Result: The logbook position has been resetted and is opened at the top
Manager.title: Position not saved on logbook screen

Manager.description: Have event cache type as global filter. Search. GC caches have their date shown, OC caches do not.
Manager.title: OC event caches don't show date in search results

Manager.description: for the last two days: http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo-nightly/738/console
Manager.title: NB fails to build

Manager.description: (rsudev told me to open this ticket) When clicking on the Any Destination button, c:geo crashes with the following error:
Manager.title: Any Destination crashes

Manager.description: Most likely related with #3354 When scrolling down in the cache listing, then swiping to WP tabs and creating a new one and saving it, or editing an existing one and saving it or navigating or„radaring“ to it and returning, the scroll position in the cache listing resets to the top. Most annoying when doing Multis where you have to cope with many waypoints but also need the listing to solve the stages. IMHO, scroll position on listing page should be preserved all the time until i leave the cache details.
Manager.title: scroll position not preserved in cache listing when saving a WP

Manager.description: When trying to scroll down in a cache listing and i pull the finger down just a little bit diagonally, the cache listing would not scroll, but the swipe left/right animation starts, but „bounces“ back to the cache listing, as the horizontal swipe is not enough, Sometimes i need 3-5 attempts to scroll down in the cache listing, especially when doing a „kinetic“ scroll, flipping the finger down and lifting it from the display. I do not see that behaviour that sensitive in other app. Is the sensitivity of detecting the horizontal part of the swipe configurable? If so, i suggest making it a little less senitive. I also would not mind when the horizontal part of the movement would start the swipe left/right animation and bounce back as long as the vertical part would still lead to scrolling the cache listing. But the vertical part gets discarded and it would not scroll. Again, i speak of very small deviations from being vertical, not 45 degree angles. Using 2013.10.14-NB-fff9cde
Manager.title: Scrolling down in cache listing slightly diagonally triggers start of swipe left/right instead

Manager.description: When swiping right from Cache Details to Listing, when i quickly start scrolling down in the Listing after the swipe animation ended optically, the scroll does not happen, but the horizontal parts of the scroll gesture trigger anothor swipe left/right animation that bounces back. When waiting a split second an the newly swiped to page before starting scrolling down all works as expected. So: Swipe right to Listing, start scrolling: No scroll, another swipe left/right with horizontal part of the scroll gesture is initiated. This persists as long as i try scrolling. After a short break of scroll-attempts of about 0.5sec scrolling works as expected. When doing Swipe right-short break-scroll it works. I can reproduce it 90% of the time on Cache Listing and Log page when swiping to them from one of the neighbouring pages. When reading the listing from the top one would not notice because you do not start a scroll immediately. But when going from WP page of a Multi to the log page, often you immediately want to scroll down to get to a stage description down the page. Then this behaviour is more obvious, and you are forced to make an artificial break before scrolling down, something that feels very unresponsive and annoys me :-). Is it possible that the swipe left/right animation has some kind of cooldown after it optically ended that prevents an successful immediate scroll gesture? I hope my observation can be reproduced, else i would have to do a video :-)
Manager.title: Scrolling up/down in cache listing or log page does not work when done immediately after swiping to that page

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Export field notes does not remember check boxes

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: send2cgeo on oc.de not working with new (5digit) cache codes

Manager.description: With last NB when try to delete a Cache over the button in pop up in live map nothing happen.
Manager.title: Popup delete button don't work

Manager.description: Today I had the time to browser through a lot of issues, did some cleanup of duplicates and wanted to get an impression about bugs and their perceived severity. Having done this together with the user feedback from support mail, FB and my own experience I want to share my impression on the current release and yet start a new "Next release" discussion. First of all: The current release seems to be clean of high severity and only has some medium and low severity issues (as mentioned further down). In fact, there are almost no complaints on FB or support mail which is a really good thing. You/We did a real good job with the last release!! However some single issues need a correction as soon as possible as they are not affecting all users but are severe at least to the affected users: #2976 Affects only offline map users in combination with some devices. But for those users the feature becomes unusable. There are some side issues (all created by the new settings scheme) which can be implicitly solved by solving this. #3329 We did not take into consideration that personal note is a premium feature. All BM users doing the upload are affected by this issue. #2108 There seeem to be some devices where the compass is either consistently or sporadically not working, which has a high functional impact. A possible way forward was mentioned in this issue. #3267 Users which use OC and have their time not set correctly will not be able to use OC. Secondly in my opinion these regressions or uncatched problems in new features need a correction: #3325 While implementing personal note upload we forgot the limit of 4000 chars. #2168 The OSM maps are getting unusable for more and more users (more high-res displays in the field) due to our memory problem there. #3088 There are still reports (and it somehow matches my experience) that the livemap got slower with one of the last releases. Comments and suggestions and other opinions are welcome. I hope this gives a little overview about issues and where we are right now.
Manager.title: Next feature release

Manager.description: In the twitter message template you can include these placeholders: [DATE] [TIME] [DATETIME] [USER] [NUMBER] [OWNER] Non of them is actually working. When tweeting with these placeholders they just show up as plain text as shown above.
Manager.title: Twitter placeholder not working

Manager.description: Although we now have a customizable text, the default hashtags (#cgeo #geoaching) are still silently appended at the end. Users might instead want to use own hashtags, thus they should be part of the default text instead of being fixed. Additionally this unnecessarily shortens the maximum possible length of the tweet. Remark: Touching TB tweet does not append the default hashtags, but the cache found tweet does.
Manager.title: Hashtags for twitter are not customizable

Manager.description: AFAIK tweets are limited to 140 chars. Currently the text input for the template seems not to be limited at 140 characters.
Manager.title: Twitter template should not exceed 140 chars

Manager.description: For sharing in twitter it is meaningful to be able to share the logtext (at least the first 140 characters) by default. This would be a new placeholder (only for twitter posts) as for the signature, inserting the logtext makes no sense.
Manager.title: New placeholer [LOG] for twitter template

Manager.description: Due to the recent gc.com site update on October, 16th parsing spoiler images seems to have a problem: The unit test fails and @rsudev debugged it back to GC2JVEH failing to parse the spoiler images. Also for me in the NB neither the spoiler hint nor the gallery is shown for this cache. We decided not to push a notification as we assume it should be solvable quite easy and we could release a bugfix.
Manager.title: Spoiler image parsing fails

Manager.description: ... if no one is the new state. I had a cache with NM Attribute after maintenance the attribute is gone and the cache have no attribute, but c:geo not merge it correct the NM is staying and will not go until I change the attributes and minimum one is there.
Manager.title: Attributes not update correct..

Manager.description: Enable "Log offline" in settings Open an opencaching cache Press "Log" You'll see all log types that are available for geocaching.com caches. But opencaching has not all of these types. When you open the log form, only suitable types are shown.
Manager.title: Log-offline-menu doesn't respect cache source

Manager.description: send to c:geo registration of Browser and device has to be renew erevry time of PC Restart. Browser: firefox BR
Manager.title: send to c:geo registration renew erevry time

Manager.description: It seems gcvote had some problems the last days. Many user contacted us, reporting that cache opening got stuck at "Loading GCVote" phase for several minutes. We should avoid waiting such a long time on a non responding server. Recently there was a change in the network retries. Is this issue already solved implicitly with that?
Manager.title: Cache description loading slow if GCVote server unavailable

Manager.description: It seems the CI test building from master is also done if something is committed to the release branch. This does not bring any new results. It should either not build or build based on the release branch.
Manager.title: CI builds master if a commit is pushed to release

Manager.description: Cant start the app. Some time ago, it was installed and was running. Now I installed again and it crashes on start. Manager.description: Load OCDDD2 repeatedly. Each time 2 more waypoints will be shown.
Manager.title: OC waypoints imported multiple times

Manager.description: With current nightly I tested the [LOG] template. For geocaches it is working as designed. However for logging a TB (discovering) I composed the template: Trackable: [URL] [LOG] The [LOG]'was missing in the twitter post. The tweet was: Trackable: http://t.co/pkTNQL5pxI #cgeo #geocaching
Manager.title: Placeholder [LOG] not working for TB tweets

Manager.description: Hi! Using 2013-10-25-NB-115ae01. I live about 540km away from Berlin, and i am a basic member. When doing an adress search for „Alexanderplatz Berlin“, i get the following result list: As you can see, the distance for the two premium caches is very wrong.
Manager.title: Distance to Premium Caches in Search Results wrong

Manager.description: I would prefer to have my cache notes in a separate tab, so that i do not have scroll down so much in caches with very long listings, like long multis.
Manager.title: Personal cache notes on separate tab

Manager.description: If you look at the map and see a couple of unsaved caches, you can choose to save them for offline, but it would be great to have the option to Update shown caches on the map (to se if some of them are archived and so on without to have to update them one by one)
Manager.title: Update shown caches

Manager.description: Instead of a generic info icon we should use a refresh icon in the pop-up during the cache details download
Manager.title: Use refresh icon for download pop-up

Manager.description: Right now, the GCVote settings only contain a password input setting. And in the cache details settings we have another option whether to download votes or not. I'd rather move that checkbox into the GCVote section to globally enable and disable the use of GCVote (for download as well as voting yourself), similarly to the other services. That's more aligned with the other settings and makes it more easy to find, probably.
Manager.title: Move GCVote enablement to GCVote settings

Manager.description: It seems that the number of found caches is one too high for the Twitter placeholder while it works perfect for the log template itself.
Manager.title: Twitter placeholder [NUMBER] adds finds plus 1

Manager.description: From support mail: When looking at a list of saved caches I can not see whether some have stored notes. I suggest to have a filter for this e.g.: Filter -> Status-> With personal note From my side I think also the alignment of icons between map and lists (another issue here) could improve the situation.
Manager.title: Filter for "Personal Note existing"

Manager.description: From support mail: When caching n a high-dense area it is sometimes hard to see the map as it is cluttered with caches. It would be very helpful to have a toggle-switch to hide/unhide caches on the map in the map menu. Could indeed be helpful but if this is implemented it should always fall back to "Show caches" if the map is reopened. Otherwise users might miss to switch it back on and report a problem.
Manager.title: Allow hiding of caches on map

Manager.description: I got this stacktrace from PlayStore. The suspicious thing is, that all user messages on the fault reports deal with logging event caches cgeo Version: 20131019 and 20130919 java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2211) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2261) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1256) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity.setDefaultValues(LogCacheActivity.java:348) at cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity.onCreate(LogCacheActivity.java:261) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5133) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2175) ... 11 more
Manager.title: Crash when trying to log "Will attend"

Manager.description: When listing the PQs in c:geo the number shown behind the name of the PQ seems to be the maximum possible entries of this PQ as listed on http://www.geocaching.com/pocket/ in the tab "Active Pocket Queries". This is no meaningful information as the real amount of caches in that PQ might be different. The real amount of caches contained is only listed on the website tab "Pocket Queries ready for Download" on the same URL. Unfortunately not all active PQs are also available in the other tab. So my suggestion would just be to remove the number in the PQ selection in c:geo.
Manager.title: PQ reader shows useless number of caches

Manager.description: As stated in the corresponding PR: I like the functionality but I am quite sure no user will currently find it. I think it deserves even a new main menu icon (visible for PM only in this case).
Manager.title: PQ reader needs an own (main menu) icon

Manager.description: Steps: Start PQ reader (long press nearby) Select a PQ to show the list of cache Press back Result: Return to main menu Expectation: Return to PQ selection dialogue
Manager.title: Exiting from a PQ list should get back to PQ selection

Manager.description: As far as I am aware of the information needed to get this percentage, we need the total amount of logs for a cache. We do only have this information if a cache is detailed and/or saved. As a result of a search may also contain (typically) not stored cache the sorting will not result in any useful order, thus this option should only be present on offline lists.
Manager.title: Sort by favorite percentage should be disabled in search results

Manager.description: Helo, I have exported a set of caches to the GPX file, transported the file to another device and imported it to the c:geo again on the second device. But the caches does not contain the rating, popularity, inventory (TB) info etc. on the second device.
Manager.title: Cache rating, popularity, TB info not exported to GPX file

Manager.description: When exporting cache GC32996 or GC2N3YV to the GPX, c:geo display message "export failed". Actualy there is second issue with this. When exporting a lot of caches and c:geo display short message "export failed" somewhere in the middle. So it is not easy to find which cache caused the failure. It would be usefull to display also code or name of the cache in the message.
Manager.title: GPX export failed

Manager.description: Currently when refreshing a saved cache we also download and store the personal note from the website. If a local note is also present a correct merging is done. But if only a local note is present but no note on server we won't upload the note. Would it make sense to include this in the refresh procedure or would this essentially slow down the refreshing? Background is, that a user contacted us saying that he has 400 caches in c:geo with local personal notes in it (created before we introduced the upload mechanism). Now he asks about an easy way to sync these local notes with the website.
Manager.title: Upload personal note on refresh?

Manager.description: When deleting a cache from a map pop-up, the pop-up should be closed as the user will probably not interact any further with that cache.
Manager.title: Close pop-up on deletion

Manager.description: If a text contains coordinates, then our context menu should have additional entries to copy each recognized coordinate. Currently one has to copy the complete text into another editor, extract the part with the coordinate and copy it back.
Manager.title: Auto extract coordinates from text

Manager.description: I originally wrote a comment on commit ddaa662 which introduced a strikethrough of the cache title for past events. As no one answered I would like to get your feedback here instead: I am not sure if this might be misinterpreted by users. Up to now strikethrough is only used for disabled caches and I personally think we should not change this. As I like the idea in principle I suggest to find another method of marking a past event. How about a strikethrough of the event date only?
Manager.title: Use different visualisation for past events

Manager.description: I discovered that when I import .loc file I see whole time progress dialog for reading of file (process of importing caches is working, but progress is still showing 100% of reading a file, nothing about downloading caches from websites). http://i.imgur.com/Dbru1Bc.png This problem is present on android 4.0, ASUS FonePad. I don't know if elsewhere. If you can try I would like to know if I'm alone facing this issue or not.
Manager.title: Importing .loc file has wrong progress dialog

Manager.description: Hi Team, there is a czech translation from guy named Regi (if I remember correctly) on crowdin.net, can you please import it from there to have translated missing strings. I don't want to duplicate that. Thank You.
Manager.title: CZ Translation

Manager.description: Just started to use offline maps and found the following bug: if i go in cgeo to stored -> klick on the map icon on the top right -> select any preloaded cache and click -> more details -> now i click on the compas icon on the top right which should open the map instead of compass (thats my setting) -> now it opens the map with all stored caches again, instead of just the one i selected. the same thing is also for waypoints if i first open the map to show all stored caches and after that i open one of this caches go to waypoints and click on one and select map. it will show me the map again with all stored caches instead of just the waypoint.. this bug also happens if i do the same as above but now i am clicking at the map in cache details instead of the compass symbol. it also opens the map with all stored caches instead of just the selected one. but if i go to stored->select any cache->click on compass or the small map in cache details it will work right. its just if i opened the map before with all stored caches. then it wont work... would be nice if you could fix it soon :)
Manager.title: Bug with offline maps

Manager.description: From the german geocaching forum (translation by me): I normally use the TB visited action, but only for found and attended logs, I don't think it makes sense for other logtypes. Could you change that?
Manager.title: Default TB action only for founds/attended logs

Manager.description: Hi i have two problems (sorry for my english). First: On active map instead of type of cache is displayed two question marks (?? - unknown type) until i open cache details. Saved caches are displayed corectly Second: Visited caches are displayed like unvisited even if filter is active. On the begining of using this app everything was OK it started about week ago.
Manager.title: Caches on map

Manager.description: Today I noticed that the userdefined description text which is shown for each waypoint in the WP tab gets mixed up when scrolling through the list of waypoints. I can not exactly give a clue on when this happens, but if a cache has e.g. 12 waypoints where the first one has the description "This is a small parking spot" and you scroll down and up the list a few times suddenly some of the other waypoints also show the description "This is a small parking spot" in the overview. Such a like this happens with all WP texts randomly. If you open those wrong described waypoints the wrong description is not shown, which probably means it is only a problem in the WP overview view. 2013.11.09-NB
Manager.title: Waypoint description gets mixed up

Manager.description: We used to have this problem some time ago, but it seems that happens again: I had 6 pair of coords in the personal note and 6 WPs created from them. I edited the personal note in c:geo and added a 7th pair of coords Saved the note and uploaded it I refreshed the cache to get the new coords parsed to a new waypoint Result: It ended up in having 10 "personal note" WPs, i.e. some are doubled The note looks like this: Station 1: N 51 20.123 E 006 58.123 Station 2: .... ... (I added Station 7)
Manager.title: WP from personal note doubled

Manager.description: Today I noticed that the userdefined description text which is shown for each waypoint in the WP tab gets mixed up when scrolling through the list of waypoints. I can not exactly give a clue on when this happens, but if a cache has e.g. 12 waypoints where the first one has the description "This is a small parking spot" and you scroll down and up the list a few times suddenly some of the other waypoints also show the description "This is a small parking spot" in the overview. Such a like this happens with all WP texts randomly. If you open those wrong described waypoints the wrong description is not shown, which probably means it is only a problem in the WP overview view. 2013.11.09-NB
Manager.title: Waypoint description gets mixed up

Manager.description: Hopefully I am clear enough with this request. There are trackable tags out there that have a QR printed on them. Some examples: http://shop.geocaching.com/default/trackable-items/travel-bugs/new-geocaching-qr-travel-bugr-black.html http://shop.geocaching.com/default/trackable-items/qr-tech-tags/qr-tech-tag.html The QR contains the url of the trackable page including the tracking code. Currently you can already scan these with any barcode scanning app and be taken to the trackable page within c:geo. What I am requesting though is to be able to scan these with the "Geocode" scanner that is already included within c:geo and be taken to the trackable page without ever having to leave the app. Currently the geocode scanner only supports cache pages using the userscript here: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/95134 I will also contact the author of the userscript to see if he can add QR to trackable pages also.
Manager.title: Support Trackables With the QR Scanner Included in c:geo

Manager.description: When approaching a cache you usually use the map at first and then filp over to compass or radar when you are close to GZ. However you might frequently flip between them at GZ to account for the local topology (tracks, water, street sides, etc.). This should be achievable for the c:geo internally provided navigations such as map and compass (e.g. by an explicit separate button at the top or by an implict click area as I proposed it in PR #3427) but for externally provided navigations I have no approach in mind.
Manager.title: Flip between the preferred and the secondary navigation by a single click

Manager.description: When approaching a cache you usually use the map at first and then filp over to compass or radar when you are close to GZ. However you might frequently flip between them at GZ to account for the local topology (tracks, water, street sides, etc.). The implementation should be achievable for the c:geo internally provided navigations such as map and compass (e.g. by an explicit separate button at the top or by an implict click area as I proposed it in PR #3427) but for externally provided navigations I have no approach in mind.
Manager.title: Flip between the preferred and the secondary navigation by a single click

Manager.description: When i want to see a WP or a cache location on a map, and i select "Navigation" from the context menu of the WP or the menu in the cache details, it asks me whether i want it in opened in Locus, although Locus is the only option i configured for the navigation menu in the settings. It is completely unnecessary to ask for the option when only one is enabled. I guess that is just a harmless small code change like "if number of options == 1 then skip select dialog".
Manager.title: Omit single option after selecting „Navigation“ to WP or Cache

Manager.description: I changed my formerly broken map theme path to some "innocent" directory where no single XML file resides (unfortunately there seems to be no way to "delete" the map theme directory path). When i go to the live map and i select the map theme from the menu, it only offers "standard" (perhaps "default" in english)? It is selected and i also tapped it again just to be sure. But still when using the live map i get a short toast saying that the map theme is not found. There seems to be some residual „garbage“ that screws up the map theme thing although i want to go back to the default. Version 2013.11.12-NB
Manager.title: "map theme not found" although "standard" selected

Manager.description: After you have logged a find, it gets saved in the history and gets removed from the live maps. If you want to check a friends log, you enter the history and press refresh but if you do this it resets the time you originally logged to 00.00 everytime. Can this be fixed please. Regard Matt
Manager.title: Date and Time reset

Manager.description: Garmin devices have the option of downloading spoiler images. http://garminoregon6xx.wikispaces.com/Geocaching+With+Photos These images can be batch fetched with tools like GSAK, or manually added/downloaded from coordinate checkers. They are stored as: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\Spoilers\ Example: Images for geocache OXZTXGC would be placed as shown: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\Spoilers\ c:geo should be able to import or display these spoiler images (eg. option to select directory), so that an user can manually add addition spoiler images to the cache page which are not included on the webpage.
Manager.title: [Feature request] Importing garmin-like spoiler images

Manager.description: When I clicked on "nearby" to see nearby caches, there is no way to filter only caches I didn't find. I see that I can filter to have pretty much everything else. I can use the map and I can see the caches with and without smiles, and I can pick from there, but it would be nice to have the the list filtered to "didn't find" only.
Manager.title: CGEO blackberry z30

Manager.description: In slovak translation, there´s an attribute: "dogs allowed". In slovak language it is translated as "psi povolené" and that should be "psy povolené". Also I would like to mark my own caches as found so I can easily sort them on my phone, because I don´t normally find my own caches. It could be as a setting. Thanks, c:geo is a great app!
Manager.title: Translation typo and feature request

Manager.description: I seem to have botched something with my latest changes. When doing a multi on the weekend, the 'visited' flag was no longer saved/visible after saving the waypoint
Manager.title: 'Visited' not saved for own waypoints

Manager.description: Blocking the UI while saving to the DB makes using c:geo tedious in several areas: working with the personal note working with waypoints offline logging it should be possible to synchronously update the cache object/UI state and do the saving to db in the background.
Manager.title: Avoid synchronous saving

Manager.description: Working with waypoints is more awkward than it should be. I propose the following changes to make the experience 'smoother': Remove the save button from edit waypoint, add save and cancel to 'action bar', make 'save' the default action on 'back' Swap short and long press in waypoint list. Short-press - edit, long-press - menu
Manager.title: Waypoint improvements

Manager.description: ob my nexus7 at android4.4 c:geo doesn't Run it Starts and at "Live-Karte" it crashed down :-(
Manager.title: nexus7 at Android 4.4 c:geo doesn't run

Manager.description: The issue is that when I download certain number of caches (say 40 nearby caches) and I minimise the app, say just for a phonecall, and than I bring c:geo back, in many ocations the caches will be gone and I have to download the list again. It does not matter if I just got them in the list or opened them in a map. The only caches which will remain are those which I have allready opened (not downloaded for offline, just opened). It does not happen regularly, but still quite often and it can be especially anoying in places with weak network coverage. It happened to my on my HD2 running 2.3.7 and it happens on my SIII, no matter if on stock 4.0.1 - 4.1.2 or custom 4.2.2 - 4.3.1. Related to this issue, it would be very helpfull to add list saving ability like the one built in GCZII. I really would like to be able to save lists of caches when I need it without a need to download all caches details. Also a return to last list would help a lot, as I many times accidentally pushed back button while on list of nearby caches, bringing me to the home screen and than I had to download all the cache list again - very "pleasant" with poor data signal.
Manager.title: List of caches disappears after minimising app

Manager.description: We received four mails on support telling this: Using Android 4.3.1 Scrolling possible in other parts of the app but not in cache description Trying to scroll it jumps around and always ends up at the top after releasing One user confirmed the behavior for market release as well as nightly build. I am still waiting for more details. I asked in what views scrolling is posible and where it is not possible. Any idea from developers side yet?
Manager.title: Scrolling in cache description not possible on Android 4.3.1

Manager.description: opencaching.us updated their okapi installation to rev 901, so it can be set to current in our implementation.
Manager.title: Opencaching.us: Api update to rev 901

Manager.description: Was reported in the german geocaching forum. If you open the map from a list (with many caches), the waypoints are not shown, even though the number of caches on the screen is smaller than the limit from the settings.
Manager.title: Waypoints no longer shown on map from list

Manager.description: From support mail: I usually have quite some event caches saved and it is hard to remember where I already posted a "Will attend". It could be an improvement to somehow mark this state in the cache list or at least the cache details (Status not "Found" but "Will attend") Remark: The feature request to include your own logs in the Friends-log tab could also be an option, as the user has a quick possibility to check what he already logged for these caches.
Manager.title: Mark saved events which have been logged "Will attend"

Manager.description: Now, this beast doesn't officially support Google Play (and the Google Maps + API), but both can be installed and work fine. c:geo, however, crashes, when using Google maps. OSM is fortunately just fine. Looks like getZoomButtonsController() is some undocumented API, that's why. At least could fail more gracefully :-) Log: E/AndroidRuntime(22576): FATAL EXCEPTION: main E/AndroidRuntime(22576): java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.GoogleMapView.getZoomButtonsController E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.GoogleMapView.displayZoomControls(GoogleMapView.java:74) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap.onCreate(CGeoMap.java:421) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.GoogleMapActivity.onCreate(GoogleMapActivity.jav:36) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5008) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1079) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2030) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2091) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:137) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(Ac tivityThread.java:1202) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.ja va:99) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThrea d.java:4781) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:5 11) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndA rgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:805) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(Zygot eInit.java:568) E/AndroidRuntime(22576): at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: Crash when using Google Maps on a Jolla

Manager.description: As opencaching.nl now directly uses the Polish code-base, the oc.pl script can handle oc.nl as well. It's just necessary to add the url.
Manager.title: send2cgeo for opencaching.nl

Manager.description: There is an option to remove past events but to remove all found caches an user has to sort them to have found on the top, tick all found and remove chosen, so three steps. An option to remove all found would do that in one step. The most important is that this option should remove only found and logged online (green color), not found and logged offline (orange color).
Manager.title: Remove 'found' option

Manager.description: 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): FATAL EXCEPTION: pool-5-thread-1 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): java.util.ConcurrentModificationException 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at java.util.LinkedHashMap$LinkedHashIterator.nextEntry(LinkedHashMap.java:347) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at java.util.LinkedHashMap$KeyIterator.next(LinkedHashMap.java:367) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap.filter(CGeoMap.java:1433) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap.access$40(CGeoMap.java:1428) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$LoadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1115) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1080) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:573) 12-16 13:24:58.977: E/AndroidRuntime(17301): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:841)
Manager.title: ConcurrentModificationException in map

Manager.description: Version: 20131219_NB Cache: OC101D5 The first attribute has the text nur bei opencaching logbar but an icon which is a red ?!. I assume this is not correct.
Manager.title: Wrong attribute icon in OC.de cache

Manager.description: Although the number of found caches for each user is shown on the webpage logbook it is not included in the c:geo logbook view. Example: EC254
Manager.title: Count of found caches not visible in logbook for EC-caches

Manager.description: EC allows terrain ratings up to T7. Our list filter does only allow filtering for terrains up to 5.
Manager.title: Terrain filter not matching for EC cache terrain range

Manager.description: After posting a found log for an EC cache the find count on the main screen is not updated.
Manager.title: Find count not updated after log submission

Manager.description: Instead of disabling the menu item for the barcode scanner, we should bring up a message to install the necessary app from the play store. I just experienced a user without a barcode scanner and he did not know what to do with the menu item.
Manager.title: Bar code scanner should show message

Manager.description: I assume by the recent changes in the connector framework, the currently gc.com-specific 'more'-search was broken. Even though it is a regression, IMO it is not very critical. Instead of re-activating this short-term, we should rather try to generalize it (as it is available for OKAPI as well) mid-term.
Manager.title: 'More'-search doesn't work any more

Manager.description: The checkbox at the hint popup of map (third time it us shown) is not visible with german text on sg3. Found it with NB 2013-12-20 using OSM 0.3. The user will not be aware of it.
Manager.title: map: unsure coords popup checkbox hidden

Manager.description: This is no bug in c:geo but I want to document this here as a reminder: The GPX file returned from ec.com seems not to include the information that the user already found the cache. This leads to the problem that already found caches are not shown as found. I contacted their support to ask whether this is intentional or not. Update: For the map API it is working.
Manager.title: No found status for EC caches in their GPX

Manager.description: This is no c:geo failure but an enhancement request to ec.com. I open this issue here to document the current restriction for us: The map API does not return the cache size information (the GPX however does). For me it makes sense to add this information as the c:geo users probably do not understand why the cache size is only shown for some EC-caches in a list (i.e. if the specific cache has been opened before).
Manager.title: No cache size info in API from EC

Manager.description: Version: 2013.12.24-NB Steps: Deactivate all services except extremcaching.com (I could not see this faulty behavior with geocaching.com) Search location "Schwarzenberg" The search should return 20 caches Open one of the caches Press back to get back to the result list. Result: Only the previously opened cache is still displayed Log shows: 16:11:20.689 Debug cgeo 2831 DataStore.loadCaches([EC335, EC69, EC31, EC32, EC71, EC39, EC58, EC36, EC38, EC83, EC111, EC85, EC62]) returned no results (Remark: These are all caches out of the 20 which I did not open before)
Manager.title: Caches disappear from list after return from cache details

Manager.description: As far as I could see from taking a look into the GPX file transfered (API) when opening an EC-cache, there is attribute information present. However it is not supported/shown in c:geo.
Manager.title: Support EC-cache attributes

Add option for Pebble watch in Navigate menu

Manager.description: Please install the following: findbugs 2.0.3 (see /opt/findbugs-2.0.2) (maybe) an update of the Jenkins findbugs plugin Google API level 19 in android-sdk
Manager.title: Update ci.cgeo.org

Manager.description: Version: 2013.12.26-NB Steps: Deactivate gc.com as cache source Activate another cache source instead (ec.com in my test) Start live map Result: No tiles are requested from gc.com tile server (which is OK) but still at the start of live map a single request to gc.com is done as the log proofs: 16:10:14.875 Debug cgeo 21327 GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx 16:10:15.531 Debug cgeo 21327 200 (644 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx I do not know if this is necessary for some reason, but I think we should not contact gc.com if the user is not using this cache source at all.
Manager.title: Requests to gc.com although deactivated

Manager.description: Just as a reminder for myself: If the username is cleared in the input dialog of the settings, then an error is written to the log (noticed this yesterday). Will update with more details later.
Manager.title: Error in log when clearing user name in settings

Manager.description: The features list for services uses an HtmlView. The content is made from plain text strings, which are not properly converted to HTML.
Manager.title: Bad encoding in features list

Manager.description: If any of the first 4 standard capabilities is missing, it will be replaced by an empty string instead of removing the item completely.
Manager.title: Empty strings added to capability list

Manager.description: 2013.12.30-NB Steps: Search for geocode "ec242" EC returns 404 Search for geocode "EC242" Cache is returned Geocode should be capitalized in cgeo or ec.com should accept those requests as well
Manager.title: Geocode search for ec.com is case sensitive

Manager.description: Steps: load an EC cache e.g. EC35 you should see the attributes tap the refresh button the attributes disappear
Manager.title: EC attributes disappear on refresh

Manager.description: 2013.12.30-NB Using white theme the input field for a new list name has a grey background and black letters.
Manager.title: New list name input field grey in white theme

Manager.description: Hi, sometimes I'm facing problem, that I log via field notes from computer and in that case I have caches not found in c:geo to get it to actual state it is needed to update caches, but it take some time and wastes gc.com servers. What about function which can update just Found/DNF/Attended ... from this url: http://www.geocaching.com/my/logs.aspx?s=1 ? It can download just one page for this purpose, which is much more acceptable than refreshing all caches. The only problem is that on that page we have name of cache and GUID, but not GC code.
Manager.title: Quick update of cache state via list of found caches

Manager.description: In settings > system it's possible to move the database to the sd-card. But that don't work right on my Sony Xperia V. When I use that function the data gets moved from phone-storage to internal-storage instead of external sd-card. It would be very helpful if it would be possible to choose the right storage.
Manager.title: Database get moved to wrong storage

Manager.description: It looks like DataStore.loadWaypoints() sometimes manage to initialize the lazy list with null. This, in turn, should only happen when geocode is blank. I think that in this case an empty collection should be returned instead of an empty list after writing an error message in the log. Another reason to not accept null as a completion value for a lazy list is that null represents a non-yet-completed lazy list, and subsequent calls to getList() will try to complete the list again. java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.size(LazyInitializedList.java:50) at java.util.AbstractList$SimpleListIterator.hasNext(AbstractList.java:51) at cgeo.geocaching.Waypoint.mergeWayPoints(Waypoint.java:118) at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.gatherMissingFrom(Geocache.java:316) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.saveCache(cgData.java:1026) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.addAndPutInCache(SearchResult.java:246) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCacheFromText(GCParser.java:754) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCache(GCParser.java:347) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:156) at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.searchByGeocode(Geocache.java:1678) at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$LoadCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:729)
Manager.title: Crash with `null` completion in lazy lists

Manager.description: Today I wanted to test some more with ec.com. With 2014.01.01-NB I do not see any requests to ec.com on the live map and consequently the map stays empty. Steps: Activate ec.com as cache source (only) Open live map Scroll around Result: Nothing is shown (in area where ec caches are present) The debug log does not show any activity (requests)
Manager.title: No live map functionality for other sources than gc.com

Manager.description: 2014.01.01-NB After loading the cache GC39TA0 no cache description is shown.
Manager.title: Cache description for GC39TA0 not shown

Manager.description: It would be great if we could also have a nightly build for the new contacts plugin. On short term it would be great if someone could post me a download link for a recently compiled apk for testing (if ready to be tested).
Manager.title: Nightly for cgeo-contacts plugin

Manager.description: For users convenience we ignore the flag "Hide found" if the user is searching for his own found caches using gc.com. We should do the same for other cache sources which are supporting the search by finder.
Manager.title: Search by finder should ignore "Hide found" when searching for own username

Manager.description: Just tried to log an OC cache without having it authorized in the settings. This fails only on sending the log, but does not give a meaningful error message. It also does not tell the user in advance to authorize the connector.
Manager.title: Online log on OC without authentication not prohibited

Manager.description: From support mail: Please remember "Sort By" in the lists. I usually sort by "Date stored on device" or sometimes "Favorites" and would like to keep that at least during one session or better permanently. I have to select it all the time again and again.
Manager.title: Make list sorting permanent

Manager.description: For caches where our connector doesn't implement logging support, we might simply open it's web page when using the logging menu.
Manager.title: Open webpage when logging caches without log support

Manager.description: As in several other activities, the GPS is turned on when entering a cache list in onResume() and turned off (if noone else requires it) in onPause(). In parallel, we try to be clever by turning it off while refreshing caches, and turning if back on when the refresh is finished (regularly or through a user cancel). This two cycles do not cope well with each other. It led to #3521 where the GPS will stay turned on after we navigate away from the activity or from cgeo entirely. The fix is only partial, and will lead to the GPS not being turned on spontaneously when a list refresh is cancelled (but will resume regular behaviour when navigating away from the activity by going back in cgeo or by displaying the details of a cache). I think we try to be too clever here. The questions we should ask ourselves are: Do we need the GPS to be turned on while displaying a cache list? Do we need the GPS to be turned off while refreshing the caches? Note that keeping the GPS turned on may be overriden by an explicit user action (the user is always free to disable the GPS and this is easy to do from the status bar on most devices), and preserve an up-to-date distance and direction (if the GPS is used for it) for the caches displayed in the background window. What do you think we should be doing? Should we keep being clever or should we adopt more simple an approach?
Manager.title: Clear up GPS status in cache list activity

Manager.description: On Google+, someone requested an automatic way of sharing the found caches on Google+ as we do on Twitter and (indirectly) Facebook.
Manager.title: Google+ cache find sharing

Manager.description: A discussion on facebook brought up this proposal: Do not open the map on the current position by default, but on the last remembered map position (which is not the last remembered device position!). Because people sometimes switch between map and lists (or settings, or...) and then have difficulties finding the previous (non center) location again. As a lot of people would expect the map to open at the current position normally, this somehow needs to be tied to a "session". Such that if you use c:geo on Monday, it does not reopen at the old position on Tuesday, but on the current position. As Android does not really support this "session" concept well, I suggest to use the time delta as criteria. If the map is opened again in a time span of 1 hour, reopen the map at the last position, otherwise at the current position.
Manager.title: Remember map position per session

Manager.description: We have a shortcut from the position label on the main screen to the GPS settings. The same action is invoked when clicking on the login labels instead. That seems counterintuitive, especially as the number of connectors (and labels) increases. We might want to open the connector settings instead on clicking there.
Manager.title: login display text on main screen leads to position settings of device

Could the problem be fixed, or provide a way for the picture to be rotated in the app? Very happy to provide any extra information.

Manager.title: Trackable name and type not parsed

Manager.description: From the German geocaching forum (translation by me): My current observation is, that after the phone has been in sleep-mode for a longer time, c:geo is not able to re-activate the GPS. Neither the new location symbol from Android nor the GPS symbol is shown. After stopping and re-starting c;geo it works again. (Android 4.4, cyanogenmod 11, HTC one, c:geo NB from 27.01.2014 probably) (Original text from http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=1154170#p1154170): Allerdings, nach meiner bisherigen Beobachtung, wenn das Handy offensichtlich längere Zeit im Sleepmodus war, kriegt c:geo GPS nicht wieder aktiviert. Weder das neue Lokalisationssymbol von Android noch das GPS-Symbols eines GPS-Tools erscheint dann wieder in der Statusleiste. Der Workaround geht folgendermaßen: c:geo abschießen und neu starten, danach funktioniert GPS auch wieder.
Manager.title: Problem re-activiting GPS after longer phone sleep
