Manager.description: On import Crowdin strips tools:ignore="Typos"from strings where this has been added intenionally to avoid false positive typo detection on the CI server. This leads to new lint warnings when building. Example: http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo/1745/androidLintResult/new/type.81291663/
Manager.title: False positive lint warning "typos" after Crowdin import

Manager.description: @YraFyra @triakcz @RomNexus6 @Bazsy @ray4423 @MichielK @mieczyslaw @seromenho @scrool @campbeb As we now have completed the first phase to sync our translations to Crowdin (see #2468 for details) we would like to invite all our translation contributors to Crowdin. Feel free to sign up (free) on Crowdin, find the c:geo project (https://crowdin.net/project/cgeo) and start translating right away. Additionally we would like to assign at least one proofreader (which is a account role on Crowdin) for each language. A proofreader will have the right to set translations to "Approved", which means that they will be imported into the c:geo source at next import. If you are interested in becoming a proofreader, just reply here. If you encounter problems while translating/proofreading cou can either ask here or try the "Raise Issue" function on Crowdin. (We do not know yet, what will be the best way.) Your help is appreciated!
Manager.title: Translators/Proofreaders on Crowdin

Manager.description: Hello it would be nice to have a direct line (from my position to the cache) and distance to the cache shown on the map when a cache is selected.
Manager.title: Distance to cache in map view.

Manager.description: This is a continuation of #3425 which has already been partially implemented. Currently as implemented within the app, the scanner only supports the geocaching.com url for trackables and not the shorter coord.info url. This Userscript http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/95134 now supports trackable pages using the coord.info url.
Manager.title: Support coord.info/tbxxxxx trackable urls with the in-app "Geocode" scanner

Manager.description: This was already reported by Ticketautomat and issue is closed - but not solved. I am annoyed about the language setting of my account in gc.com is so often switched to English. I wrote to GC about it. Their answer was a question: Do I use some other application that uses the gc account? Of course I do - c:geo. Now I made some tests: C:geo is off. Then several log-ins and log-outs on gc homepage. Language stayed always German (fine). One log-in with c:geo, then next log-in on gc homepage shows language setting changed to English (bad). This is reproducable. I don't even have to log-out and re-log-in on the web site to see this language change. It is sufficient to start c:geo and then press F5 (refresh) in my PC web browser to see the language change to English. Either the app does the language switch or the gc api does it implicitly in the backend when it is used by c:geo. Please help.
Manager.title: gc language setting always turns to English on c:geo access

Manager.description: I remember that this issue was solved in the past but come up again on market version 2014.02.04: Save s geocache for offline use Use the search function and search its geocode in "upper case" Result: Cache is opened immediately Use the search function and search its geocode in "lower case" Result: Cache is requested online

Manager.description: Hi, I'm using IntelliJ IDEA (which Android Studio is based on) for Android development. I would like to add a project file (*.iml file) to the repository and ignore workspace specific settings (like which device to use). The main reason is, that I can't commit those changes in my forked project without including them in my pull requests (or can I?). So either I don't commit those changes or I delete this commit before each pull request - both are a little bit annoying. Furthermore, with Google switching from Eclipse to Android Studio it is just a matter of time for other software developers to follow.
Manager.title: IntelliJ IDEA/Android Studio project files

Manager.description: This bug occurs only using OSM and offline maps. Tapping with two fingers on the screen causes the map to zoom out (I assume this is a feature). The problem comes while pinching, which normally zooms in/out the map. But if it's done too quickly, the screen either zooms out or doesn't zoom at all. This depends on how big the pinch movement is. Fast and short pinch = zoom out, fast and long pinch = nothing happens (i.e. the map zooms in while pinching, as any map would, but it returns to the same zoom level after releasing). It seems like the two-finger-tap is triggered, if a pinch movement is too quick. This would explain the behavior: quick short pinch = "nothing" from map + "zoom out" from tap => zoom out quick long pinch = "zoom in" from map + "zoom out" from tap => nothing happens Since Google Maps doesn't have this two-finger-tap feature, it doesn't occur there.
Manager.title: Map zooms out when it shouldn't

Manager.description: A user reported that setting the type filter to "Wherigo" shows many different caches on the live map which shouldn't be there. I tested it and made the following observations: Prerequisites: Enable global cache type filter "Wherigo" Choose live map strategy "fast" Do not have any caches in the database for the testing region (e.g. clear data before) Premium member? Observations: All caches are ?? although I zoomed in to "200 m" These ?? include: traditional, multi, unknown, etc. (all cache types?) But not all caches are shown, only a small subset (but with many types) Leave the live map and return to it (maybe unnecessary) Some Wherigo symbols appear. Open one of them and it will change its type to "Earthcache" (also other types?) If you need an area to test it, try Hanover in Germany.
Manager.title: Type filters on live map unreliable

Manager.title: Long press on a cache in a list does not provide options

Manager.description: It's a proposal for a new feature: support a new type of cache for c:geo users only, in the spirit of Wherigo caches but simpler and focused on audio. I like Wherigos, especially the idea of moving from WP to WP, with automatic unblocking of the next WP once the current one has been reached. But Wherigos are rather rare because it's a pain to build one, and they are more often visual than audio-based. I also like audio-only guidance, because it's a much better experience, especially when biking. So, putting it all together, I propose to work on the following simple type of cache, to start with: create the cache by moving along a path; press a button at each WP and record a voice message, simply from within c:geo at play time, you put earphones, take your bike, launch c:geo and move to the next WP with some audio guidance; when you reach the WP, you hear the pre-recorded message and the next WP unblocks and becomes automatically your next target, so that you don't (eventually) need to stop and look at your phone. Such caches would run only in c:geo; they're more complex than standard, simpler than multis but also more dynamic, and putting this all within c:geo would make the creation of such trails way easier, and I suspect would greatly increase their number. I can work on this, if you think it's interesting...
Manager.title: New type of wherigo-like support

Manager.description: Using 2014.03.19-NB (but probably existing much longer) It happens sporadically when scrolling or zooming the map that waypoints are still shown although the defined limit of caches shown is reached. I have set the "hide waypoint on map" limit to 10. I scrolled to an area on the map with well over 10 caches but still the waypoints are shown. Only after another manual operation (e.g. zoom out and zoom in again or scroll in one direction and back to the orginal position) the waypoints are correctly hidden. I can give no clear instruction of when this error shows up but my feeling is, that it happens after several zoom and scroll operations. To make this more clear, here are some screenshots: Map drawing not correct (limit 10, 15 caches shown) After moving the map just a little bit forth and back it updates and hides the waypoints as it should:
Manager.title: Limit for showing waypoint on map sporadically not working

Manager.description: Over the last months there is a mentionable amount of users (most probably also new to Geocaching itself) that use the app without a valid login and claim problems which results from that. Besides the fact, that we should not load any data from gc.com without login (that would prevent problems like "The coordinates are always wrong",etc.), we should give some advice at the first start that a login for some platform is needed. Currently the app starts at the platform selection in Settings -> Services, but it seems some users are helpless here and just press back, get to the main menu and start using it in a "wrong way". I suggest to implement a screen on the very first start with some explaining words like "On the following page the geocaching platforms supported by c:geo are listed. You need an existing account on at least on of this sites to use c:geo. c:geo will not create an account for you, but you need to enter the user credentials provided to you after registering to the specific geocaching website. Please press OK to get to the list of supported platforms and enter your existing user credentials before starting to use c:geo"
Manager.title: Improve first start behaviour

Manager.description: Please, add ability to move .cgeo folder to SD card, which is represented on some devices as /storage/extsdcard. Android 4.2.2 on Samsung Galaxy SII+ is unable to move cgeo data to external SD card. My phone has only 8 GB of storage, 4 GB are eaten by andoid, aprox. 2 GB are system apps (unable to remove them without root) and some space is required for my apps and also there must be some free space. Please, add ability to set storage dir or at least add some more options to select. Thank you.
Manager.title: Move .cgeo to SD card

Manager.description: Current situation: If the user enables "Use GPS only" in the compass menu, this setting is persistent. It affects not only the compass but also other directional views (e.g. pointer on live map). There are quite a number of users on support mail with "compass problems", where it turns out this settings was active (either accidently or because it was once needed for a special purpose and forgotten afterwards). I suggest to change this settings to be "session based" and defaults back to "Use Compass and GPS" (only if the device has a compass sensor of course). The other option would be to have a clear indication somewhere, that the magnetic sensor is disabled.
Manager.title: Have "Use GPS only" setting session based

Manager.description: On my bike tour today I had problems with logging. Although the mobile data connection shows best quality H+ it sometimes fails to send logs. But not only. cgeo was blocked until I killed it. Users should have a chance to either try sending log in background or make this a cancelable dialog. I know that this will increase the chance of double log entries. Maybe something like "send to background"? But then we would need a feedback interface, don't we?
Manager.title: Hanging log sending blocks cgeo

Manager.description: When exporting to GPX, some fields are missing: FV, Found, NotFound, County, State. Child Waypoints not linked. This is when using this GPX with GSAK.
Manager.title: GPX Export

Manager.description: As I try to find the problem with the db on my phone I can backup the db as cgeo.sqlite and also can load it again. But if I want to try different actions I must save the cgeo.sqlite some where else and transfer back the one I want if I want to restore. Better backup as YYYYMMDD_V_cgeo.sqlite and at restore you can select the one you want.
Manager.title: Version based database backup

Manager.description: In every list there is an option to long-press on a cache and select "Drop" to remove it from the list. But the History list is missing the "Drop" option. Please add the Drop option so I can remove old caches that are added due to the bug mentioned in issue #2906
Manager.title: "Long-press > Drop" missing on History List

Manager.description: Hi c:geo team, when final of a multi/mystery has corrected coordinates provided by geocaching.com (so normally this final point defines the physical location of the cache), the 161m circle does not show around this final on the map. I am forced to define a final waypoint with same coordinates to use the function of issue #3551, but it's not comfortable. Help :)
Manager.title: Circles on map not shown for mystery/multi with corrected coordinates

Manager.description: List of pending sites with running OKAPI installation: opencaching.us (#3219) opencaching.nl opencaching.ro (in the final stages of getting active)
Manager.title: Add support for new opencaching nodes

Manager.description: I would love a feature to add a waypoint from the map view by long pressing on a position on the map and choose "Navigate to" or "Add waypoint" in a context menu. The only way to add a waypoint today is to enter the coordinates manually or read from the Notes. This feature would be particularly useful when trying to navigate to a suitable parking place.
Manager.title: Add ability to add waypoint from map view

Manager.description: I suggest to: Remove "localisation XY" contributors from the contritbutor list and replace is by a reference to all crowdin translators Add a link to crowdin on About c:geo -> Help or the contribution page itself
Manager.title: Replace dedicated translators from contributor list and add reference/link to Crowdin

Manager.description: Today on an event a cacher asked me if we could implement an overview list of cachers trackable inventory. Groundspeak app supports it.
Manager.title: List of Trackable Inventory

Manager.description: From FB: Event caches still go to will attend even on the day of event. I thought it used to change to attended. In #2709 it was introduced that "Attended" is the default for past events. I agree that this could be extended also to cover the day of the event itself, as most people will probably log a "Will Attend" some days before and "Attended" on the very date.
Manager.title: Default log type "Attended" also on the day of the event

Manager.description: Today I was on tour. First I logged a cache. But no smiley appeared on map. I didn't think more about because sometimes it changes on move. Another cache I needed to update. It was archived and the cache icon shows grey but it didn't disappear because it was stored? However, so I removed the cache and the disc image disappeared but the grey archived cache resided. Another cache updated and removed but icon with disc resided. Another cache I removed without update because now I knew the whole series was archived. The icon didn't change a bit. I killed cgeo between but the icons stay on map although they are removed. Strange behaviour. NB 2014-03-27 I know caching last sunday the icon changed to smiley and disappeared from map.
Manager.title: Archived caches still shown on map

Manager.description: A new release 2014.03.30 has just been published and will be available soon on Playstore. Assigning @samueltardieu to update the status page accordingly.
Manager.title: Update status.cgeo.org

Manager.description: A new release 2014.03.30 has just been published. The cgeo-release.apk has to be copied to cgeo.apk on the website. Remark: The current cgeo.apk is already outdated since two versions! Assigning @mucek4
Manager.title: Update apk on website

Manager.description: Already mention on IRC, added here as well to track it: For the upcoming addition of the opencaching nodes opencaching.us, opencaching.nl and oc.opencaching.ro (#3692) it is necessary to aquire official keys from them and add those to the build environment.
Manager.title: Add OAuth keys for oc.us, oc.nl and oc.ro to build environment

Manager.description: From Playstore comment (unverified): Great app but coordinate conversions are incorrect since downloading new version. For example, using DDD.DDDDD°, I typed in N 32.6486 W 109.8197 and it was converted to 32°03.892 109°04.918. The correct conversion is 32°38.916 109°49.182. Note the decimal point error.
Manager.title: Coordinate conversion wrong

Manager.description: The cache GC245X3 has 243 images (which is quite unusual but good for testing purposes). When opening the image tab I can see that a certain amount of pictures but not all are loaded. Depending on the used device the amount of pictures loaded differs, but some keep missing. With the debug log it is hard to distinguish whether all of them are requested and some not returned or we just stop requesting. That would need further analysis. Anyway it ends up with having "spinning circles" as placeholder for some of the pictures but no more network traffic ongoing.
Manager.title: Failure to load all pictures on image tab

Manager.description: Once in a while you accidentally press the Post log button too soon or choose the wrong log type. Today the only way to edit an already posted log is to edit the log in your browser. Please add the ability to edit or delete a posted log directly in c:geo.
Manager.title: Ability to edit already posted log

Manager.description: Currently on a new installation the input format for entering coordinates (the coordinate dialogue in various parts of the app) is set to "Plain". In many discussions with users I have seen that they were not aware of this setting and complained about the difficult input method. I suggest setting the initial default to MinDec ( DD° MM.MMM') instead as this is the most common format used throughout the geocaching world.
Manager.title: Change initial default for coord input to MinDec

Manager.description: When c:geo is started and stored lists are selected from main menu the message "list no longer avaliable" is displayed and it reverts to the default list (Stored).
Manager.title: Current list no longer avaliable

Manager.description: From @YraFyra: The current implementation is first looking at the Alias field. If no match is found then DisplayName is searched. However, this search is done using the '=' thus only matching full names. I suggest to using "LIKE" as operator and "%GcAlias%" as pattern to really find the best candidates. Of course this may return more that one match and therefore I added a simple optionsmenu to select which contact to open. and let me add to this: I use to store most caching contacts in this format: Max TheCacher Mustermann or just Max TheCacher where the geocaching name (TheCacher) is either the middle name or the last name. I think some users might do alike, so I would prefer if these formats are also matched (I dont't know if this is implicit in the proposal above).
Manager.title: Improve contact matching

Manager.description: Hi, since the last update, the compass has a deviation of -90° when holding the device in landscape mode. I'm running Android 4.2.2 with a Kernel 3.4.5 on a ASUS ME173X (Built ME173X_WW_user_4.2.4.72702_20131128) If I have another app using the compass, like GPS Status, it works well when turning the device. Rebooting and locking the screen in landscape mode doesn't have any effect.
Manager.title: Compass deviation -90° in landscape mode

Manager.description: Since 01.04. we received at least 5 independent mails claiming that using "Show on ext. map" is no longer providing coordinates to the destination app, which was working with the previous release. I asked the users what app they are using and wait for feedback now.
Manager.title: Navigation with external apps not working

Manager.description: With market release 2014.04.01: Switch off GPS Start c:geo The main screen shows "Last position" and correct coordinates for the last known location Perform nearby search Results are according to the last known location Open live map Result: No pointer/arrow shown The map starts up where it was last opened position or even defaults to N0/E0 (in case c:geo was not running before) Clicking on the "my location" button has no effect Expected: Last known location should be used as starting point for the map If possible the arrow should mark the last known location I am using a new device, so I am not sure whether this is a new issue or just device depending?!
Manager.title: How to handle the case when no location is available

Manager.description: As for #3729, the cache list activity mini-compasses are wrong when in landscape mode.
Manager.title: Mini-compass deviation in cache list

Manager.description: When clicking on a spoiler image and opening it with the Photos app, another image is displayed (in my case a spoiler from a previously visited cache). Sometimes the other image is displayed during less than 1 second and the actual spoiler is displayed after that but darker than usual.
Manager.title: Wrong image when opening a spoiler with Photos

Manager.description: From #3736: when images are opened into the Photos external application, they appear darker than in the Gallery application. It looks like the application opens them fine, then makes them darker after about one second. cc @jacobtardieu who originally reported this issue
Manager.title: Darker image when opened with Photos application

Manager.description: I find it very annoying that the map zooms out to show all caches in the current list every time I press the Map Icon in the list view. I have to zoom in to a more suitable level to locate a nearby cache, only to get all the caches again after pressing the Map icon later. It would be great if the zoom level should be remembered from time to time when viewing the list map. You could add a "Remember Zoom Level/Show all caches" option in the Map settings menu.
Manager.title: Remember zoom level in List Map view

Manager.description: 2014.04.05-NB (but probably exisiting since the recent changes to the long click events): It happens to me quite often, that when trying a long click on a cache in a list the context menu opens but shortly after that the cache details are opened and the context menu vanishes. It is quite easy to reproduce: When you do a really long click the context menu opens as expected When you do a really short click the details are opened as expected If you do a click which is just at the time limit of a long click the described problem shows up
Manager.title: Long click in list also triggers short click

Manager.description: Maybe a follow up of #3550 : Start "Import from web" Send a cache to c:geo Result: OK Press "Cancel" Start "Import from web" again Send another cache to c:geo Result: Nothing happens. Kill c:geo Restart c:geo and start "Import from web" Now the queued cache from step 6 is downloaded
Manager.title: Import from web does not work if started a second time

Manager.description: Looks like the CI uses echo instead of curl for message updates: 23:10:57 Lineflyer | Started by user Lars Building in workspace /srv/jenkins/jobs/Create notification/workspace │ | [workspace] $ /bin/sh -xe /tmp/hudson5116230000040917557.sh + [ -z ] + echo -X POST │ | http://status.cgeo.org/api/update/message --data @/srv/statusSecret --data message=Geocaching.com │ | maintenance! You might encounter connection issues. --data icon=attribute_firstaid --data │ | message_id= -X POST http://status.cgeo.org/api/update/message --data @/srv
Manager.title: CI wrong message update

Manager.description: If you log found you have to refresh to add a cache to favourites. We should change this attribute on logging found. It is similar to disable / enable.
Manager.title: No add to favourites after logging found

Manager.description: The app crash on Motorola XT1032/1033. Please fix it. Thanks
Manager.title: Crash On Motorola XT1032/1033

Manager.description: If you select "All caches" list, you cannot refresh caches in "Manage" menu. I don't know why this item is removed from the menu in this case; but it would particularly useful to refresh all old caches (independently from its list) using Sort / save date on device Refresh all
Manager.title: Refresh caches not possible in "All caches" list

Manager.description: When starting the map or compass activity, it needs 1-4 seconds to start. There are also warnings about skipped frames. I'll provide logs later today.
Manager.title: Map and compass activities start slow

Manager.description: When scrolling the logs it pauses ca. every second for some ms.
Manager.title: Log list stutter

Manager.description: From support mail and was also told to me by @SammysHP or @marco-dev : The timer for "Import from web" seems not to be resetted if caches are incoming but times out as if no caches have been received.
Manager.title: Send2cgeo times out although caches are imported

Manager.description: With release 2014.04.01: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.enlargeBuffer(AbstractStringBuilder.java:95) at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append0(AbstractStringBuilder.java:140) at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:125) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.whereGeocodeIn(DataStore.java:2865) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.loadCachesFromGeocodes(DataStore.java:1631) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.loadCaches(DataStore.java:1582) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.getCachesFromSearchResult(SearchResult.java:243) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$LoadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1073) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019) We probably have to limit the number of caches loaded in one request.
Manager.title: Out of memory error while loading caches

Manager.description: Hi, I have a Samsung Galaxy xtrem2 (GT-S7710), and c:geo running version 2014.04.01. In the stting tab of c:geo there is no "device name" option. Any help? I have register the browser ok, but can't do it on the phone. Thanks JoniFili
Manager.title: No device name in c:geo settings.

Manager.description: With release 2014.04.01. java.lang.ClassCastException: android.text.SpannableString cannot be cast to java.lang.String at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity.onCreateContextMenu(CacheDetailActivity.java:360) at android.view.View.createContextMenu(View.java:8358) It was triggered by a long-click on the geocode according to the user.
Manager.title: Crash when the long-clicking on a value string

Manager.description: 2014.04.13-NB: It happend to me several times today, that c:geo crashed when trying to start the compass from a waypoint popup on the livemap (via Menu -> Naivigate -> Compass). It is not reproducible, meaning on the next try it usually works. No log yet, Sorry.
Manager.title: Crash when starting compass from popup

Manager.description: With 2014.04.13-NB I can see a new settings menu for opencaching services. However If I e.g. active the opencaching.us service I do not see any menu to authenticate to that site. Returning to the main menu I see "Not autorized" on the main page.
Manager.title: Somehting is strange with oc autorization

Manager.description: I have Android v 4.3 on my tablet and 4.0.4 on my phone, and the start talking feature for the compass stopped working on both devices last week. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app, and doesn't work.
Manager.title: "Start Talking" feature on compass not working

Manager.description: Looking at the many new supported OC-countries it would make sense to put them into a separate sub menu please Settings -> Services in order not to clutter the menu with a lot of almost similar entries. Like this: Settings Services geocaching.com Openaching.* or Opencaching Pages opencaching.de opencaching.nl .... opencaching.com (Garmin) Extremcaching.com
Manager.title: Have another sub menu in settings for opencaching.*

Manager.description: You will for sure remember the problems and discussions about The menu button no longer working starting with a certain API level(?) Some devices not having a HW menu button (but only some workaround like long-press on another button or a menu switch for showing a on-screen three-dot icon) Regarding 2. we always have quite some mails on support although it is mentioned in our FAQ. Currently only some not widespread devices are affected, but I got the following news today: Samsung will replace the menu button with the recent-app/app-switch button on all new handsets starting with the Galaxy S5. The legacy menu button is only available by long-press on this app-switch button on these devices. That makes me think, that we should put more focus on introducing our own menu button (e.g. action bar sherlock).
Manager.title: Use Action Bar

Manager.description: The interface for "Any destination" is not user-friendly. To make anything useful from it, one has to use the menu button. This should be made better.
Manager.title: User-unfriendly interface for "any coordinate"

Manager.description: From support mail: If I log a OP-caches offline and afterwards export the field notes the result file is empty. If I log a OP- and a GC-cache offline and export the fiels notes only the GC-cache is contained in the file. I am not familiar with the field note support on OC-sites but I can confirm the behavior (possibly the same for all non-GC caches).
Manager.title: No field note export for opencaching sites

Manager.description: The compass works fine in GPS Status, Geocaching.com etc, but not in c:geo. Upon opening, it appears to sharply move to 215° and lock.
Manager.title: Compass not working with SGS4 running CyanogenMod 11

Manager.description: Need several attempts to download total list of cache send via sendto option
Manager.title: import from web

Manager.description: 2014.04.20-NB (but most probably not new in this version): For my holiday I stored a list with an imported PQ of 1000 caches. This slows down a c:geo a lot: Scrolling through the lists is stuttering not always but most of the time Opening a single cache from the ist and returning from the cache to the list takes considerable time (1-2 seconds) The situation gets worse in the following scenario: Open cache list with 1000 caches Apply a filter (e.g. Attribut -> Medium hike) Open details of a cache from the filtered list Return to the list In this scenario two things are noticeable: Even the attribut selection list in the filter menu is stuttering when scrolling It takes 7-10 seconds until the list is shown after the last step Setting label "Unverified" as I have no possibility to take a log currently. Mabye someone can try to reproduce with a 1000-PQ. This is one of my usual holiday usecases and I never experienced such problems before (last time used in February). It is not related to the mini-compass (tested by disabling it in settings).
Manager.title: Slow list if many caches stored

Manager.description: Seen with 2014.04.21-NB and also read about it on IRC: Sometimes when using the filters it seems to be possible to apply a combination of filters (i.e. after selecting one filter, select another one and both are applied). While this can make sense for some usecases, there seem to be problems with that: Only the latest selected filter is shown in the headline of the list Sometimes applying a new filter seems to cancel the filter applied before (not sure under which conditions) but not always. Sometimes selecting "Reset filter" does not really cancel them, but still only a subset of the caches on the list is shown but there is no UI indication anymore, that there is still something filtered out Will check if I find a reproducible case for this one.
Manager.title: Combination of filters seem to work unreliable

Manager.description: Example (the only one at the moment).:GC4K089 Currently parsed as "Unknown type".
Manager.title: Support new cache type Giga-Event

Manager.description: Open GC1BABN Click on the first link to the listed other cache in the cache description ("Respeitem...")
Manager.title: Crash when opening cache link from cache description

Manager.description: Form support mail: On the list of saved caches it is possible to filter for "Found" cache but the (maybe more important) filter for "Not found" caches is missing.
Manager.title: Filter for "Not found" caches missing

Manager.description: From support mail: You are showing the apache license. One of the last lines of this text is "copyright [yyyy] [owner of copyright]" maybe there is some text missing?
Manager.title: Apache license is missing text

Manager.description: Currently, our geocache objects have a reference to their log entry list. Therefore a cache that has once loaded its log entries (during import, displaying, export, or filtering) will consume a lot of memory for the strings in the logs for a long time. A refactoring will make log entries own top level objects, which are loaded/stored directly from/to database. Initial measurements show that this cuts down overall memory consumption for a use case of importing 500 caches from GPX to 40% of the current memory usage.
Manager.title: Have logs separated from caches

Manager.description: From Twitter: have problem showing a set waypoint on map. In cache-details, list of wp, compass, show on map - Can't see the wp on map. Open cache with more than one waypoint Press compass button on one waypoint Menu → show on map Only that waypoint will be shown Expected result: All waypoints and the cache itself are shown. Not sure if this is an intended behavior or a bug.
Manager.title: Waypoints not shown after compass

Manager.description: After #3778 has been fixed/improved we should do a bugfix release from release branch. I have just build a RC-version, will test it tomorrow and report back here. Someone needs to update the release notes on release branch. I am unable to do it as I do not have my PC equipment with me.
Manager.title: Prepare new feature release

Manager.description: Import the GPX from GC53HTM. The XML parser freaks out, as that is invalid XML (due to a bad character reference � in the file). I've been trying to remove this using a ReaderFilter as described in http://info.tsachev.org/2009/05/skipping-invalid-xml-character-with.html, but that implementation only works for invalid characters as such, not for invalid character references. Now we could implement our own character reference detection, in a FilterReader, but to me that looks like a very big gun. Does anyone see an easier solution? Just to be crystal clear: I know this is a bug on the GC.com side, but nevertheless I would like to fix it in our app.
Manager.title: GPX parser dies on invalid character references

Manager.description: Today I wanted to copy waypoint coords from c:geo to the clipboard in order to use them for calculation in another app. It seems not to be easily possible to do that; you can actually copy either latitude or longitude (if format "plain" is selected) to the clipboard but not the whole string like it is supported for the cache coordinates itself (long click on coords). For pasting coords from clipboard into a new waypoint there is a similar "problem". If you paste them into the latitude field of course the complete string (with lat and lon) is pasted in one field which is wrong. Here some more intelligence is needed or it would need an option like "Create wapoint with clipboard content"
Manager.title: Copy coords from/to waypoints

Manager.description: Over the last weeks we received around 30 mails with same symptoms: Login fails (acc. to main screen) Same on wifi and mobile network "Identify as Android browser" does not help "Check login" reports Unknown communication error Reenter and check credentials done without success For all(!) of these users the problem was solved by one of the following: Reinstall c:geo Delete all data in Android settings Any idea, what went wrong here? Any idea, how to get more clues on this (besides having a log)?
Manager.title: Login problem on existing installation

Manager.description: There is a typo in the german Playstore listing, in the changelog under the headline '2014.3.30', at one of the last points it says "- Listensortierung nun permanant während der Sitzung". I guess it should be 'permanent'. I don't know if this is the right place for filing this 'bug', but I don't know who has access to the developer console. Keep the awesome work up!
Manager.title: German Playstore listing typo

Manager.description: That import menu item should not be enabled when looking at the history.
Manager.title: "Import from android"enabled in history

Manager.description: In the latest release the option to navigate using "MapsWithMe" has been added. On my device, selecting MapsWithMe from the navigate menu pops-up an option to install MapsWithMe even though it's already installed on my system. Clicking on one of those options takes me to the GooglePlayStore page for MapsWithMe. I suspect the problem is because I didn't purchase MapsWithMe from GooglePlayStore, I bought it from AndroidPit on a special offer. There is a workaround: if I select "Ext. map" from the Navigate menu, one of the options is MapsWithMe and if I select it there it works fine.
Manager.title: MapsWithMe fails to launch

Manager.description: I did a nearby search with only OC.DE being active. All caches are fine, except for OCF1F1. It is shown as unknown, but the description looks like an event. My app version is a self made one which is some weeks old. So if no one can reproduce, I will look at that with current code after my holiday.
Manager.title: Unrecognized cache type

Manager.description: While on the live map and pulling up map settings, toggling "Show own/found caches" will only turn off your finds on the map, not your hides. As evidenced by my GitHub username, I am the OpenCaching.us webmaster, and may be able to answer technical questions about our site. I am only a server admin though, most definitely not a coder. :-)
Manager.title: Cannot hide owned caches on live map; OpenCaching.us

Manager.description: Static maps for giga event caches (and maybe other types?) have no cache icon but only the default marker. I guess the appropriate icon needs to be stored on the webserver.
Manager.title: No cache icon for Giga event on static map server

Manager.description: 2014.05.03-NB: Open a saved webcam cache Post a log of type "Webcam photo taken" Result: Log is correctly shown in logbook Status is NOT changed to "Found" NO green marker in lists After manual refresh the cache is correctly marked as found.
Manager.title: "Webcam photo taken" log does not mark cache as found

Manager.description: Yesterday I saw the GPS totally not working on the mobile of my father. It was basically hanging at zero coordinates although it was switched on. My father was not able to detect this bad state, as the app was not indicating it. However, when inspecting the phone for the reason of all his caches being away some thousand kilometers, I noticed a very awkward display in the left lower corner. The satellite fix was shown as 4/0. If I remember the code right, the second number should always be larger or equal to the first. If so, then we should indicate such a sensor reading as error state and display this to the user maybe.
Manager.title: GPS not working detection

Manager.description: Open a cache list. All menu items are available. Switch directly to the history list. The "list" menu item is now invisible, correctly. Switch directly to a real cache list. The "list" item remains invisible, wrongly. It only works correctly again when exiting the list activity to the main screen and then reopening the lists.
Manager.title: List menu becomes invisible

Manager.description: Normally when we use the "my position" button in our maps then it becomes centered on my position and stays there also in other zoom levels. Yesterday I sometimes was not in the screen center when using this button. Zooming in could then even lead to moving the blue arrow to outside the screen, on pressing the button. This only happened, when I opened a map for a list of about 1000 caches and had very bad network. So bad that the Google map background would not load at all.
Manager.title: Map not centered

Manager.description: It seems to me that the GPX files exported from c:geo are no longer readable by Garmin. I'm using the export function to generate GPX files that I then upload to my Garmin device (Garmin Oregon 450t). This worked like a charm for years already. With the last c:geo update (version 2014.04.30) I happily noticed that the process of exporting GPX files significantly sped up. However, the resulting files are no longer accepted by my Garmin device. I tested this with an older GPX file that I generated with c:geo as well and that file worked just fine again.
Manager.title: Exported GPX files are no longer readable by Garmin device

Manager.description: 2014.05.07-NB Received a GPX file (exported from cgeo) via mail Opened the file in my mail program Selected c:geo as target app c:geo opens and asks for a list to store the caches After selecting the list nothing happens (only the list is shown) Manually importing the file (via Manage -> Import GPX) works without a problem. I am not sure whether this used to work before with my mail client, therefore setting "Unverified". But IMO it should work if c:geo can be selected when opening the file, or not?
Manager.title: GPX import not executed when started from mail in

Manager.description: As written in #3731 users reported that with the release 2014.04.19 the following procedure stopped working: Open cache details Menu -> Navigate -> "Show on ext. map" Select the app: "MapFactor Navigator" The fix applied for #3731 does not seem to help. With the current 2014.05.11-NB I can still see, that this procedure is not working. MapFactor Navigator is started but remains on the startup screen. Hint: If I use this procedure I can start navigation with MapFactor Navigator: Open cache details Menu -> Navigate -> "Google Maps Route" Select the app: "MapFactor Navigator" @Bananeweizen : Disregard my email concerning Sygic navigation. It turned out the user used the wrong method to invoke Sygic.
Manager.title: External navigation with "MapFactor Navigator" not working

Manager.description: In 5133e10 @samueltardieu introduced a call to VACUUM (shrink) the c:geo db during database clean. On my device (HTC Evo 3D, Android 4.0.3) this takes quite some time: 05-11 13:24:12.720: D/cgeo(31003): Database clean: vacuuming the freed space 05-11 13:27:25.828: D/cgeo(31003): Database clean: finished Depending on the point in time when the call starts, the cache count may already have been initialized or not. In the latter case, c:geo was reported to crash on almost every action. The times were measured after stopping c:geo in task manager (otherwise the cleanup routine might not be called) Are these times exceptional?
Manager.title: VACUUM seems to block database

Manager.description: The cache reviewer told me that I am required to set the "Wireless Beacon Required" for my cache ( GC53WJ0 ). Now on geocaching.com this reads simply as "Wireless Beacon Required" - but c:geo displays (at least in German): "Cache mit Funk-Sender (Chirp)". But Chirps are proprietary and therefore not usable without an alternative way to get to the coordinates. I used some other form of wireless beacon which is non-proprietary and does therefore not have to be optional. Solution: remove the "(Chirp)" Hint and rely on the Cache Listing to specify what kind of Beacon is being used.
Manager.title: Wireless Beacon Attribute Comment is misleading

Manager.description: When I start c:geo (2014.05.11-NB) I have to wait 15-20 seconds until the lists are accesible. If I immediately try to open the list after c:geo gas started I get a delayed reaction followed by a black screen for the mentioned time. If I just wait on the main screen I can see, that the amount of saved caches is only shown after the mentioned time. Might be connected to 5133e10 (as written in comments there). Strangely this happens to me on each "cold start" of c:geo although I would expect (as stated by @samueltardieu) that there is nothing to clean up after it has been performed once.
Manager.title: Long waiting time until list accessible

Manager.description: I find the street names on the maps much too small to be readable. Both on Google maps and on OSM. If I compare with the Google Maps App the street names are much bigger. As a result you have to zoom more to show more street names. I have a nexus 5 with a resolution of 1920x1080 and 445 ppi Is there a way to customize the font size depending on the unit's resolution? There should be a map font size setting if possible. The "Scale Map Text" option does not seem to have any effect for online maps. Google Maps in C:geo Google Maps App
Manager.title: Font size too small on map

Manager.description: 2014.05.12-NB: For testing another issue I imported 4000 caches to a list. This slows down the UI significantly: When leaving the cache details back to that list, it takes around 3-5 seconds to open the list. App not responsive during that time. Applying a filter takes up to 10 seconds. App not responsive during that time. Deleting a subset of the caches on the list (e.g. preselected by applying a filter) most often leads to an ANR-error.
Manager.title: Slow reaction when dealing with huge lists

Manager.description: I know, that this is not the main purpose of a geocaching app, but this request is made really often via support mail, so I would like to place it here and not simply deny a function a lot of users want to have: Have an option on the compass screen to turn on/off the camera-LED of my smartphone (e.g. a graphical button on the compass screen) I also link those users to apps supporting this via the notification screen or some key-shortcut, but I have to admit that this is probably some usage steps more than just clicking on the screen in your geocaching app. I assume there is some free code for this, so it would IMHO require just a button triggering that function?!
Manager.title: Support Flashlight function

Manager.description: Interesting idea on support mail: When I click on a cache on the map it shows me more or less the same info as if I click "More Details" afterwards. (D/T, Size, etc.) I prefer to always look at the complete page instead. Can you perhaps add an option to simply ommit the popup and directly open the cache on click.
Manager.title: Optionally skip the map popup

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: gc.com update: testSearchByGeocodeBasis failed

Manager.description: Screen shot tells more or less everything. Also new market release does not parse traditional type (if not logged in). Not logged in a.k.a. no login info stored.
Manager.title: All caches are "own" if not logged in to GC.com

Manager.description: the zoom calculation does not take the orientation into account. reproduce: search for caches of user "hinagicu" with landscape orientation. result: 3 caches on GC. show on map. result: only one is visible. zoom out, all become visible.
Manager.title: show list on map does not zoom correctly

Manager.description: The buttons on the map popup are larger than before (after the merge of the action bar branch?). Well, it works, but it's different and I'm not sure if it's intended.
Manager.title: Map Popup: Large buttons

Manager.description: On the map popup there is a button for compass (btw: the secondary tool is supported here!), but the menu also includes a "compass" entry.
Manager.title: Consistent use of "compass rose" icon throughout the app

Manager.description: Before the icon for "navigate" (a map) was shown together with a string "navigate". Now the icon is shown alone and it's not intuitive what this button does (well, it doesn't show the map).
Manager.title: Action Bar: "Navigate" icon not intuitive

Manager.description: The dialog to edit wayoint coordinates now has a transparent background (in dark skin, Android 4.0.3). That makes it hard to read
Manager.title: Coordinate dialog has transparent background

Manager.description: After entering the list and immedietely opening the menu, the item "Select mode" is missing. it only appears if you wait some seconds after opening the list.
Manager.title: Select mode not available on list menu

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC: Maybe we should consider always to show the three-dot button also if the device has a menu-button. Reason: Consistent usage for all users Less effort in writing FAQ, manual and on support mail (otherwise it requires doubled descriptions depending on the selection) To be discussed
Manager.title: Suggestion: Always use overflow menu

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: List Selection in light theme uses wrong colours

Manager.description: Details to follow
Manager.title: Doubled gcvote in popup

Manager.description: Here is a first quick approach of my suggested order of the menu items and settings of "Always show" / "Show if room" as far as I understood the implementation. Please correct me if I am wrong with the possibilites of the viewing options. My goal was to keep the UI as much as possible like the old one to allow the user to find items they are used to, but additionally improve the handling where e.g. an addtional actionbar item could make the handling easier. I am sure this can only be the base of the discussion and it might be a bit too conservative. Main screen: a. History b. PQ c. Settings d. Scan Geocode e. Useful apps f. About c:geo "Dont show action" for all to keep the main menu alike to the exiting one Lists: a. Map List b. Manage c. Sort d. Filter e. Select mode f. Show on Map (different to a as it invokes a dialog for the target app) "Show action" a+ b "Dont show action" c,d,e,f Cache details: a. Prefered navigation (preferably long press for secondary navigation if possible, see #3843) b. Secondary prefered navigation (if not possible to include in a) c. Log Visit d. Navigate e. Caches around f. Open in browser g. Share "Show action" a +b (if we can ommit b somehow c should also be shown) "Dont show action" (c),d,e,f,g TB-details: a. Log TB b. Open in browser "Show action" for all Cache logging: a. Signature (ideally only if autoinsert is not active, if possible) b. Add c. Smiley d. GCVote "Show action" for all TB-logging: a. Add b. Smiley c. Signature "Show action" for all Any location: to be completed (I think the whole screen needs to be reworked, refer to #3770)
Manager.title: Menu item sorting and display as action

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC it might be useful to have more meaningful icons for some menu items as they are now possibly displayed as "icon only" on the actionbar and probably not every user will know, that he can get the text by long press. What I found not be intuitivein my opinion: "Navigate" icon (e.g. in cache details) It is using the same icon as we already use for "Map a List", which should be avoided The usage of the map icon is now inconsistent: In lists = Show list on map In cache details = Navigate "Open in browser" icon This is just an (i) which IMO suggests to the user that it provides more details in c:geo instead of opening an external browser "Smiley" icon Its somehow OK and recognizable if you tried it once...but what is it? :-) Feel free to comment or add some others you think are misleading.
Manager.title: Better icons for actionbar

Manager.description: Just another proposal: In the sense of migration from old to new UI we should show icons + text in the overflow for two main reasons IMO: Users know the icons from the old UI, so it helps them to find the menu items in the new UI If icons jump from the overflow menu to the action bar (e.g. on different devices or when turning to landscape) the user will recognize them as the icon is "permanent" and find it again much faster.
Manager.title: Always show icons+text in overflow menu

Manager.description: Press the search icon on the top of the main screen Press back to close keyboard Press back again -> Another(?) search field appears instead of the search field beeing closed
Manager.title: Leaving search function on main screen broken

Manager.description: After actionbar implementation the TB-detail view shows "c:geo" instead of the TB name (as it was before).
Manager.title: TB-details should show TB-name in header

Manager.description: For some actions, the up navigation target is defined in the manifest (those, which can only have one parent). For all others, we need to dynamically set the target in code, otherwise they will lead to going to the main screen, which is not expected. http://developer.android.com/training/implementing-navigation/ancestral.html
Manager.title: Up navigation wrong in some actions

Manager.description: In "init_showoverflow_summary" a special char is used for the three dot symbols. Some phones seem to be not able to show it. We should remove it, as this wont change the meaning of it.
Manager.title: Three dot smybol not shown as contained in strings

Manager.description: Bug present in ver 2014.05.20-NB-893982b
Manager.title: Long-press on navigate icon does not start secondary navigation tool.

Manager.description: 2014.05.20-NB: Open list Open cache from list Press Navigate icon and select "static maps" Press refresh icon on the top right Result: Crash. Log can be provided later
Manager.title: Crash when refreshing static maps

Manager.description: We have some menu items which are disabled instead of hidden. The Android design guidelines prohibit that: "If an action is unavailable in the current context, hide it. Do not show it as disabled." Examples are "Strategy" and "Store for offline", when opening a map from a cache list.
Manager.title: Hide disabled menu items

Manager.description: Since the last update, the app has become generally very laggy. I have noticed that when using the live maps, if you try to save one item to an existing or new list the app starts to hang. At first it doesn't seem to want to allow you to move around the lists created, it just pauses after 10 seconds - it either catches up but still laggy or a warning that the app has stopped (would you like to wait or force close). Please can this be fixed in the next release/update.
Manager.title: Live Map / Saving to a list

Manager.description: Switching from any list except for "history" to "history" uses an animation. Switching from any list to any list except for "history", no animation is shown.
Manager.title: Switching lists animation

Manager.description: As the title says: Before the action bar integration it was possible to create a new list directly from the list selection, now there's no item for it in the list.
Manager.title: List-list: Item "New List" gone

Manager.description: When pressing "Navigate" in the menu of a map popup nothing happens.
Manager.title: Map popup: "Navigate" not working

Manager.description: Due to a change on the gc.com servers the ¨trick¨ with calling a URL including a // no longer works as intended (for details see IRC log of May 21st).
Manager.title: ¨Open in browser¨ function needs to be reworked

Manager.description: From the german geoclub.de Some menus now have a smaller font which is more pleasant to read, some still have the former, larger font. Sample is the cache list view Sorting: new, nicer Filter: old, bigger, not so nice Reasons? Opinions? Possible to make uniform?
Manager.title: Different font sizes in similar menus

Manager.description: From the german geoclub.de: The progress spinner looks too large compared to the action icons (that is my feeling as well) Is it possible to change that?
Manager.title: Indeterminate progress feels to large

Manager.description: Version 2014.05.22-NB-19a24f4 Go to saved caches Caches are sorted by distance Select list "Verlauf" (english translation?) edit Lineflyer: History Select any other list Caches in other list are sorted differently (log date?) Go to menu, sorting I see sort order "log date" I select sort order "distance" Order does not change Checking menu, "sorting" again, it still shows "log date" Same happens when jumping to "Verlauf" directly from main screen, and selecting any other list there. It seems as if selecting list "Verlauf" locks sort order to log date. It gets unlocked when going back to main screen and selecting "saved caches" again. Then ordering is by distance, until i select "Verlauf" again. Expected behaviour: Restore previous sort order when going from "Verlauf" to any other list.
Manager.title: Switch to "History" breaks sorting in other lists afterwards

Manager.description: The action bar is full transparent. On my phone the icons are almost invisible due to a background image. I suggest 40% transparency.
Manager.title: Less transparent Action Bar

Manager.description: Currently only the version code is checked to trigger opening of the changelog on app start. Additionally the hash code of the file(s) itself should be checked to only show the changelog if both conditions are met (i.e. there is something changed in the changelog). This will prevent triggering the changelog on each new NB. Thanks for the idea @Bananeweizen Assigning @rsudev as requested
Manager.title: Only show Changelog on startup if hash code changed

Manager.description: Currently there is still an action separated from the actionbar to show a list on map. We should take this as first action into the actionbar instead which will lead to the same result AFAIK. Remark/Problem: We will then have two items with same naming and similar functions in the actionbar.
Manager.title: Take button "show on map" to actionbar

Manager.description: 2014.05.22-NB: Open stored cache Post a log Result: Log is locally added to the logbook page Log is not locally added to the friends/own log page
Manager.title: Own log not added to friend/own log page after logging

Manager.description: This seems to be only on Android 2.3:
Manager.title: Android 2.3: Duplicate title in Actionbar
Units.getSpeed() returns uncommon string

Manager.description: In the compass menu, the "set destination" and logging menu items all use ic_menu_edit (the pencil).
Manager.title: compass uses same icon for different things

Manager.description: Hello I can't get c:geo to log in. When I try to connect Geocaching.com (I have put username and password rights) it raises an error message "Login failed because of Unknown error" My mobile phone: Star X2 Android version: 4.0.3 c:geo version: 2014.05.14 Log in alogcat: [ 07-02 16:25:48.894 32636:0x7f97 D/cgeo ] GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx getaddrinfo: www.geocaching.com return error = 0x8 >> [socket][56] connection www.geocaching.com:443;LocalPort=40487(30000) [CDS]connect[www.geocaching.com/63.251.163.200:443] tm:30 [Posix_connect Debug]Process cgeo.geocaching :443 [ 07-02 16:25:49.861 32636:0x7f97 D/cgeo ] 200 (967 ms) GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx [ 07-02 16:25:49.882 32636:0x7f97 D/cgeo ] POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx getaddrinfo: www.geocaching.com return error = 0x8 >> [socket][57] connection www.geocaching.com:443;LocalPort=40163(30000) [CDS]connect[www.geocaching.com/63.251.163.200:443] tm:30 [Posix_connect Debug]Process cgeo.geocaching :443 [ 07-02 16:25:51.318 32636:0x7f97 D/cgeo ] 200 (1436 ms) POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx [ 07-02 16:25:51.331 32636:0x7f97 I/cgeo ] Failed to log in Geocaching.com as zalmoxis80 for some unknown reason System date is not correct (because of candycrush :-)), but I suposse this is no problem I suppose the error is related to "getaddrinfo: www.geocaching.com return error = 0x8"... I can connect to www.geocaching.com correctly using a firefox or another browser without any problem I remember some months before now i can connect correctly, but not now... :-( Thanks in advance
Manager.title: I can't connect geocaching.com

Manager.description: Today I used "Weiterleiten" (Share) on a cache. It lead to a popup menu directly below the share button, listing 3 or 4 share possibilities. And at the same time another selection menu popped up with more than 10 items.
Manager.title: Share button leads to 2 popups

Manager.description: While in all other activities I can also open the overflow menu by pressing my device menu button, this does not work on the popup Galaxy S3, Android 4.3 2014.05.25-NB
Manager.title: Menu button does not open overflow menu in popup

Manager.description: This is my first post here and firstly I would like to thank you for great free geochacing application:) Everything works fine but I miss a option to disable download a pictures for offline use. Sometimes there is a situation when I arrive first time to town with a lot of cashes around. First thing what I want to do is to fast download a caches around and go caching. Downloading with pictures (especially a lot of caches) takes quite a long time.
Manager.title: Downolad to offline use without pictures.

Manager.description: Today I tested upgrading v0.29 to v0.30. Firefox 29.0.1 Gresemonkey 1.15 Existing v0.29 installation take from here: f3b46da I opened the script manager of Greasemonkey, then right clicked on the existing send2geo installation and selected "Look for Updates" It detected and updated the script to v0.30 (at least it is shown now in the script lists) Looking deeper by using "Edit script" it turns out the script is still v0.29 (and still not working on live map). Can someone retest this please ?
Manager.title: Update send2cgeo via Greasmonkey not OK

Manager.description: With the new UI, the title of a cache list is only updated after loading the complete list. Until then it is basically empty. This makes the spinner "triangle" in the actionbar jump around every time you open a cache list. While we don't know the number of caches in advance, we should at least set the title of the list before we actually load its caches, to avoid that "jumping".
Manager.title: update list title before loading

Manager.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Go to a list of many saved caches Scroll to the very end Activate selection mode by swiping to the right Mark some of the caches Scroll to the beginning of the list (keeping the select mode active) Press Menu - Manage Result: Only the default actions are shown (e.g. Refresh all, Delete all) Expect: Refresh selected, Delete selected, etc. should be shown In the second try it works normal. It also seems to work normal if selected caches are still "in view" on the list.
Manager.title: Actions for selected caches not present in management menu

Manager.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Set global filter to "Event-Caches" Perform nearby search The resulting list is sorted by event date as default Select Sorting - Distance Result: Still sorted by event date Remark: Connectors for oc.de and GC active (if this makes any difference)
Manager.title: Resorting of event lists not working

Manager.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Open list of saved caches Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result: Not that the count in the header still shows `xx Caches`` where xx represents the total and not the filtered amount In nearby search however it works liek before: Perform nearby search Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result (as expected): The heading shows yy caches/xx caches where yy is the filtered amount and xx is the total amount (like it was before implementing the actionbar)
Manager.title: When filtering subset count is not shown on lists

Manager.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Open list of events or containing events where all of them are not in the past Menu - Manage shows the option "Delete past events" although non of the events is in the past Selecting it nothing happens Improvement: Do only show this menu item if the list contains events in the past
Manager.title: Delete past events should only be shown if past events are available

Manager.description: APK and changelog are outdated. It currently shows 2014.04.30 as current version. We could also remove it and refer to an appropriate location (e.g. github) to avoid the need of udpating it. Assigning @mucek4
Manager.title: Link from website to github for APK download and changelog

Manager.description: I have seen that GCC (GeoCache Calculator app) is a navigation option in c:geo. Why is that? AFAICS is it only starting GCC without any interaction with the cache I call it. If there is no interaction, there is no need at this point to call this external app.
Manager.title: What is the sense of GCC as navigation method

Manager.description: To me the progress of refreshing caches looks quite confusing (just testing in the wild). It always jumps from 0 to 2, and it reaches 100% some time before the dialog closes (probably when it starts downloading the last cache). Looks like an off by one error somehow. Is that just my imagination? For reproduction, take GC caches only, as all other sources are to fast.
Manager.title: progress of refreshing caches

Manager.description: Tried to Import a list from GC.com, which I've exported as loc file: Problem is the same as discribed here: #1987 (comment) Except: After hours on 100% only aprox. 53 Caches was imported. this is the list: http://www.geocaching.com/bookmarks/view.aspx?guid=645bd6da-fa8a-498f-bcce-1dd7169d3109
Manager.title: Importing .loc files from GC.com fails

Manager.description: E.g. signature contains [NUMBER] only this string but not the number of finds is inserted. 2014.05.29-NB
Manager.title: Insert signature inserts placeholder instead of values

Manager.description: As discussed yesterday on IRC with @schwabe c:geo is not offered as target app on the destination phone. Reason is probably, that the transmitted URL is malformed.
Manager.title: NFC sharing transmits wrong URL

Manager.description: checkout: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC53NJM_circumvallatielinie-1 Watch the order of the waypoints at the bottom Now load the same cache in c:geo. Look at the waypoints, the order is different from the website. It looks like that reference points are displayed first. But in this case the reference point is a kind of "walked by"/via point, the waypoints should be kept in the website order. Maybe its not a bug but a change request (in case its intended to have a different order than the website), cannot determine that. c:geo:2014.5.14 Android:4.2.2 samsung:S3mini
Manager.title: Sorting of the waypoint list

Manager.description: Open the compass Select ¨Start talking¨ The menu item is still labeled ¨Start talking¨ instead of ¨Stop talking¨
Manager.title: ¨Start talking¨ menu item on compass not changed after selection

Manager.description: 2014.05.31-NB: In the last release it was possible to long press a logbook entry to do one of the following actions: Copy Translate to Share At the moment there seems to be no action associated with a long press anymore.
Manager.title: Long press options in logbook no longer working

Manager.description: 2014.05.31-NB: With the last release short press on a waypoint in the waypoint tab offered a menu for: Edit Duplicate Prefered navigation Navigate Caches around Now short press does not result in any action. Long press for editing however is still working.
Manager.title: Short press actions for WPs no longer working

Manager.description: Activate a filter on a stored list. Switch to another stored list. The filter is still shown as active, but the list content is actually not filtered.
Manager.title: list switching does not respect current filter

Manager.description: When switching a list, we reload all current caches, before actually loading all caches of the new list.
Manager.title: switching list reloads all current caches

Manager.description: Start a search. Activate a filter. Hit "more caches". Afterwards the footer shows the filtered number, while it showed the overall before. We could either fix this or get rid of the numbers (as they are already at the top in the spinner). Anyone with strong opinions about that?
Manager.title: number of caches wrong in footer bar

Manager.description: I have noted that several caches I had done where not uploaded to geocaching.com when exporting field notes. At first I did not realize why, but now I think that if I open a cache through "search nearby caches", then log it as "found", then go back to export field notes, it is not uploaded.
Manager.title: Found caches in "Search nearby caches" are not uploaded as field notes

Manager.description: Open OC10CB8 In the logbook summary on the logbook tab the "WIll attend" logs (and maybe other log types as well??) are not counted
Manager.title: Will attend not counted in log summary on OC-logbooks

Manager.description: I found the faq to make the change. However I can not find a main menu / settings or appearance. Nor has it changed automatically. It was fine on my old Motorola phone, but now I have a Samsung Galaxy S 5. How can I change to imperial units ? c:geo uses metric units by default but should be able to detect if you are using a local setting which defaults to imperial units and will adapt to it automatically. A manual change can be done in c:geo settings (main screen, Press menu, Select settings, Select Appearance) and select "Use Imperial units".
Manager.title: change metric to imperial units

Manager.description: This one is difficult to describe: I am very sure, that in the past it was possible to open an OC-cache and have an inventory page shown with the listed geokrets. It was also possible to click on the inventory and see the details of the geokret. Today with 2014.06.03-NB I have seen that this is obviously no longer working. I continued and tested it with the last market release 2014.05.14, but even there it seems not to work anymore. I am unsure whether it stopped working some time before that, or it is a problem of the API or it is a problem of switching to the new API. @rsudev Possibly you are the right one to answer that. Example: OCB92E which has a virtual geokret always logged into that cache

Any change depending on its setting? Version of the nightly build

Manager.description: Not sure whether a special case or a general bug: I have a cache where I see the friend log (only log on friend logbook page) doubled in the normal logbook page. The cache has only 18 logs, so all its logs are contained in the normal logbook page. 2014.06.06-NB
Manager.title: Doubled friend log in standard logbook

Manager.description: Can we get a progress callback from our network download method? I'm currently sitting at the end of the world where sometimes there is network and sometimes there is not. So when staring at the download progress pop-up of the cache details activity I'm often wondering if my device is getting any data at all. Just displaying the number of received bytes there would really help to understand what is going on. Bonus points for getting the overall number of to be transferred bytes from the HTTP header and showing a percentage.
Manager.title: Network transfer progress?

Manager.description: OCE142
Manager.title: Duplicate short description not recognized

Manager.description: We had several user reports issues with hangs/ANRs after unlocking a phone that has been locked on the map screen for an extended period (10 mins till over 1 hour). Digging into this I was able to see, that the unsubscribe in CGeoMap.onPause does not stop the LoadTimerAction from being called. According to my limited knowledge this is what unsubscribe is for. I was unable to finally deduce if this is an implementation Problem (incorrect Api usage) or a bug in rxJava. If the latter is true, it seems to be present even in the latest 0.19.0 version (I could not fully switch to that, but had to fake/comment out stuff related to the GeoDir handler in order to build it) Any of the more experienced (@samueltardieu @Bananeweizen ) that can shed some light on this or provide pointers for further research?
Manager.title: RxJava periodic timer is not stopped in onPause

Manager.description: According to our FAQ and my experience we support all of the date formats of gc.com except dd/MM/yyyy as we can not differentiate it from MM/dd/yyyy So we support and detect: yyyy-MM-dd yyyy/MM/dd MM/dd/yyyy dd/MMM/yyyy MMM/dd/yyyy dd MMM yy See: http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_6 Right now the amount of people having problems with log dates and contacting us has raised. I checked the website and have seen the following new(?) date formats: dd.MMM.yyyy dd.mm.yyyy Seems gc.com introduced '.' as separator as well. At least four users gave feedback, that they were actually using one of these but did not actively change to that. So might be, that they changed some defaults based on whatever rule. Shall we do anything for that? dd.MMM.yyyy should be detectable and usable, but dd.mm.yyyy is not usable I think (due to the existing mm.dd.yyyy)
Manager.title: New date formats on gc.com

Manager.description: According to this information: http://forums.groundspeak.com/GC/index.php?showtopic=323369 The following was reverted: We've also reverted the change from "Unknown" to "Mystery" in GPX files, meaning that "?" caches will display and filter properly in those applications and devices that could not handle the terminology change. Do we need to fix the import or are we running backward compatability?
Manager.title: GPX change for "Mystery" reverted on gc.com

Manager.description: From support mail: I'm using export from cgeo and import to Locus. I noticed this issue Mystery vs Unknown C:geo exports mystery caches with Geocache| groundspeak:typeMystery Cache/groundspeak:type Locus expects Geocache|Unknown Cache groundspeak:type/groundspeak:type At http://www.geocaching.com/about/guidelines.aspx#mystery I found this information: Note: Cache owners creating a mystery/puzzle cache will select "" from the cache types on the cache submission form http://www.geocaching.com/hide/cachebasics.aspx. I think "Unknown Cache" is the correct cache type.
Manager.title: Usage of Mytery instead of Unknown in GPX exports

I assume we either have a server problem or a sepcific (new) Firefox or Greasemonkey version? Can someone crosscheck...I dont have a PC with me in Italy.
Manager.title: send2cgeo hangs with Firefox/Greasemonkey

Manager.description: When geocaching I often use an external GPS receiver (in my case a BT-359) to improve my tablets battery life and have better positioning results. Using the 'mock locations setting' and a bluetooth GPS provider (like: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=googoo.android.btgps ) this is doable but has a number of drawbacks. I'm not sure if the 'mock locations' setting is available for everyone. some apps do not allow 'location spoofing' which they equate to having set the 'use mock locations' setting to true. the system works when the bluetooth gps provider replaces the internal GPS, which confuses a lot of other apps apparently. i'm not sure what is happening with the other internal location providers (network, gsm) when the internal gps is replaced by the bluetooth provider, but I'd like these things to be undisturbed if possible. Ideal situation: Let the bluetooth gps provider create a new location provider instead of replacing the gps (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.globalsat.android.gps.bluetooth.provider claims to support both these methods ) Have a setting in cgeo where I can select which gps provider to use. (Walhalla: have cgeo use multiple providers) I understand this is far from trivial to implement. Questions: Is there an alternative which gives me roughly the same results? What would need to be done to implement this? For example: would the implementation be able to borrow from existing implementations or would I have to start from scratch? Are other people interested in this?
Manager.title: Adding support for external GPS receivers

Manager.description: I was just trying to fix #4036 by just making the URL part of the regex more tolerant. That worked fine, but afterwards by emulator was hanging for eternity when trying to download the avatar image. I guess this is because of the toBlocking() in HtmlImage.getDrawable(). Generally speaking, right now the image CDN of GC.com is somewhat broken as it seems (it creates direct links instead of using the CDN, and the https links deliver http traffic). Nevertheless we should not have such blocking calls with a time limit.
Manager.title: blocking network in HtmlImage.getDrawable
