Manager.description: As mentioned in #3967 the preview static map is too small on tablets and less in detail due to zoom factor.
Manager.title: Improve Tablet preview

Manager.description: I wonder if we can move the progress spinner to some other place in the action bar. Using the live map in the sun I can hardly see a difference between the spinner and the position button.
Manager.title: Progress spinner and position action button look similar

Manager.description: Today I learned that UI testing has become much easier with espresso (which is from Google itself). If we want to re-introduce UI tests, we should surely use espresso instead of robotium or any other third party lib. https://code.google.com/p/android-test-kit/wiki/Espresso
Manager.title: UI tests with espresso

Manager.description: I can see that we have a mailto link in cgeo/main/src/cgeo/geocaching/AboutActivity.java Line 98 in 9f39b08 setClickListener(support, "mailto:support@cgeo.org"); as well as some strings with a hyperlink e.g. in cgeo/main/res/values/strings.xml Line 1210 in 4500ab6
Manager.title: Set mail subject for support mails sent from the app

Manager.description: Been running the latest nightly builds for som time now and there's one annoying bug with the ones I've used this week. The history doesn't contain all the offline logs resulting in missing found logs when exporting the feild notes. I noticed this the first time July 16th and it's the same today. All caches are saved and updated on the phone prior to caching. The offline logs are saved and I'm able to open the logs from the individual caches, but they simply don't appear in the history. Today 2 of the caches are not shown, last time it was 3 or 4. Currently running 2014-07-18-NB1-0822830 and can confirm that the bug is still there.
Manager.title: Cache not added to history if unsaved and logged from popup

Manager.description: Recently when I try to filter caches in a certain city or place or try to find caches nearby, the number of caches is limited to 40. Although the button at the bottom states "more caches (at this moment 40)". When I click this button, it still shows the same 40 caches and no more. Where I used to be able to get more than 40 caches. I am wondering why this feature is not working anymore. Hope to hear a solution from you Ray
Manager.title: Filter caches limited to 40 caches

Manager.description: There is currently only one posting on FB mentioning that there is something wrong with TB loading for those user previously affected by #4082. I can neither reproduce nor I am sure, that this is an issue. Still I remember #3118, where the manipulated HTML issue came up for the first time. Will try to investigate if this is an issue or not.
Manager.title: TB parsing possibly still broken by performance proxies on mobile network

Manager.description: @R3gi noted on Crowdin this name change. One way (renaming strings as well) or the other we should trigger this for all languages.
Manager.title: MapsWithMe renamed to Maps.me

Manager.description: I use osmand as navigation app. Since a few weeks I can no longer use "Navigate to" in c:geo. Osmand opens but gives a message (translated from dutch): can not process geo intent 'geo:52.103683,4.361817?q=52.103683%2C4.361817(NAMEOFTHECACHE)'
Manager.title: Navigate to doesn't work anymore

Manager.description: From the german geoclub forum. With the following sequence, the drop button on the popup does not work: kill c:geo and start again open live-map tap a stored cache tap on drop on the popup popup closes, cache remains stored
Manager.title: Drop on map popup does not work

Manager.description: A new release 2014.07.27 has been published. Consequently we need to replace cgeo.apk on the website with this new version. Assigning to @mucek4
Manager.title: Update cgeo.apk on website

Manager.description: Too often I see incorrect log types in a cache page and I realized it often is due to c:geo having a default log type - "Found it" on caches not your own. I think the app ought to force the user to select the log type before it can be submitted instead of having a default.
Manager.title: No default log type

Manager.description: I'm just setting up Eclipse for c:geo development and I need some help with obtaining API V1 key. Google claims this API has been deprecated and one cannot obtain the key: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/android/v1/mapkey?csw=1 . What should I do? Are there any public-ish keys? It's not really an issue with the app, but I wasn't sure where to ask this question. I think anyone new to the dev team will have this problem.
Manager.title: Obtaining Google Maps Android V1 API key

Manager.description: Hi! I dont know whats wrong with my phone Xperia SP and c:geo. On normal Google Maps compas works perfectly - when i turn phone, map torns too But on c:geo arrow shows wrong direct at start and when i turn phone arrow turns some time but still in wrong direction. Regards! Kucharskov.
Manager.title: Wrong compas orientation on map

Manager.description: After using send 2c:geo (using Greasemonkey) and importing chaches in to the save list the number of found caches in the start-menu (footerbar) is reseted to zero. The correct number of the founded caches can only be restored by restarting the smartphone.
Manager.title: Number of found caches reset to zero

Manager.description: Current NB Live map seems to crash after opening and closing three different waypoint popups Details when I return home
Manager.title: Crash after opening several popups on map

Manager.description: Extract of todays IRC-chat: [19:12] Lineflyer: OneEyed.. a question or proposal: From what I can see/test in our nightly builds c:geo is rather stable at the moment.... Now I see over the last days that a lot of refactorings are going on which is a good thing but (from testers perspective) possibly endangers the stability or at least need another round of testing. So doesn't it make sense to release from master NOW despite the open issues? Or might there be another possiblity to have a fairly good tested version? [19:12] Lineflyer: Maybe another branch? But this makes things more complicated...wouldn't it? [19:12] OneEyed: Well, yes, it would complicate things, and moreover, nothing would ever be tested anymore [19:14] OneEyed: We should branch release from before todays refactorings [19:15] OneEyed: Those refactorings are here to allow an easier map rewrite, + an easier integration of Google Services location providers [19:38] Lineflyer: oneeyed... branching release as of yesterday would be a good idea (from my perspective). Of course, we would throw away the possibility to do a quick fix in case of website changes.....but I think if such thing happens, it would be good as it forces us to do a step forward Opinions on that?
Manager.title: Feedback needed: Copy master to release?

Manager.description: This might depend on the device screen resolution?! On my Galaxy S4 the smilies loaded with logbook entries from gc.com are displayed too small. They look more or less like colored dots, not possible to see the smiley type. I can attach a screenshot later.
Manager.title: Smilies in logbook too small

Manager.description: BUILD FAILED /opt/android-sdk-linux/tools/ant/build.xml:470: The following error occurred while executing this line: /srv/jenkins/jobs/c-geo-RC/workspace/android-support-v7-appcompat/build.xml:55: sdk.dir is missing. Make sure to generate local.properties using 'android update project' or to inject it through the ANDROID_HOME environment variable.
Manager.title: CI does not build RC

Manager.description: 2014.08.04-NB1: Open a list of saved caches Long press on a cache Select "Delete" Result: Nothing happens, cache is still saved Expected result: Cache deleted from list and no longer stored offline
Manager.title: Deleting cache not possible

Manager.description: Map a cache which has waypoints with coordinates Open the popup for one of the waypoints The waypoint notes are shown with their HTML tags We should either format the text according to the tags or simply strip them. Example: GC2K085 - Stage 2
Manager.title: Dont show HTML tags in waypoint popup

Manager.description: Idea posted in #3860: @Bananeweizen I propose putting the items inside "manage" to the top level. Be aware that the item for starting the selection mode will go away completely, once we use the contextual action bar on this list.
Manager.title: Move Manage submenu items to top level

Manager.description: ic_menu_mylocation_off is present in mdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi but not in hdpi This issue is a reminder to build that image too.
Manager.title: ic_menu_mylocation_off.png missing in hdpi

Manager.description: With the new action bar we have two different meanings for the same icon: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/blob/master/main/res/drawable-hdpi/ic_menu_mapmode.png First usage: On live map for selecting the map source Second usage: In cache details for selecting a navigation method. I think we should find another icon for the second usage (on cache details) because the world map does not reflect that the navigation is triggered here. I suggest another slightly modified compass rose icon or simply the letters "NAV" as an icon.
Manager.title: Map icon is used inconsistent

Manager.description: While showing the new actionbar to some users and giving out the NB to some others, I often got the feedback that finding the way to send a log is not intuitive. This is how it currently looks on standard mobile phones: I think it would be desireable if the send button would always show up with text like mocked here and the remaining items always go to the overflow:
Manager.title: Always show text for "Send log" in logging view

Manager.description: Seeing that the release branch build also failed in GPXImportTest today, backporting yesterdays test fix seems like a good idea. http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo/2488/consoleFull
Manager.title: backport GPX import test fix to release

Manager.description: Observed this today, probably a side-effect from the new JSON parser
Manager.title: Empty personal note on OC leads to 'null' as text

Manager.description: Users wish: Support uploading of a picture with the log like for gc.com. Don't know if OKAPI supports it.
Manager.title: Support log pictures for OC

Manager.description: Device: Xperia SP Android: 4.3 C:geo: 2014.08.06-NB-e50fbb4 Bug description: When i open a live map to search a cache and when caches are loading (spinning spinner in navbar) the spinner dont make full rotation. It make some of animation and make it again from start - thats look strange. Regards!
Manager.title: Bugged spinner at caches map

Manager.description: Device: Xperia SP Android: 4.3 C:geo: 2014.08.06-NB2-f3d487e Bug: In "changes" screen in "about c:geo" text "Next feature release" are doubled.
Manager.title: Doubled "next feature release" text

Manager.description: I wish to have a mode, where c:geo shows every cache one or more members of the current group did not find yet. The Problem ist, you often go caching with a group of people which do not have found the same caches, but only one or two are using there devices, to save battery. Sometimes you walk past a cache some members would like to log, but nobody knows there is a cache they need. Maybe you can "connect" accounts by scanning a QR-Code from another device and c:geo only hides the finds of all members currently connected. It would be an awesome feature of an already great app!
Manager.title: "Partner mode" show caches a member of a group didn't found

Manager.description: It would enable a new way to use the app if it would periodically check the approximate position of the device and check if a saved cache is within a given range (like 100m) and show a notification. Also it would be great if one could set filters (like only show traditional caches) and enable/disable this feature. For better battery life, an additional mode would only check the (GPS) position if it is being activated by another app.
Manager.title: Notify when saved caches are nearby

Manager.description: 2014.08.07-NB: Open OC110EE Swipe to logbook Logbook has a lot of scrollable space below the existing log entries (about one screen length is scrollable but black).
Manager.title: Empty space on logbook

Manager.description: User simple wish: If user is owner of log after long press in action bar he can edit log. Very usefull when user make a mistake eg "wOrd" or user choose "note" for "not found" Regards!
Manager.title: Add option to edit log

Manager.description: Hi there, this is my first bug report, so please be kind. ;) But seriously, I have not been able to find neither a solution but nor someone else with the same problem, so I don't know whether it really is a bug. c:geo does not find the maps that I have moved to the sd-card. They are found when I place them on the internal storage (which is called sdcard0), but not on sdcard1 (actual sd-card), even when I specifiy the exact directory. I'm using a Huawei MediaPad 7 Youth (S7-701u) with Android 4.1.2. Thanks for your answers!
Manager.title: offline maps on sd card not found

Manager.description: I've reverted the use of the Play services geo provider in 1f7d111. On an emulator (where no GPS signals are produced) the call to currentGeo() is blocking endlessly.
Manager.title: Play service geo provider blocking on emulator

Manager.description: Please verify that the changes from e040706 are actually correct.
Manager.title: verify gradle debug with ProGuard enabled

Manager.description: Before the implementation of the actionbar the user activated the feature by selecting "Start Speech" in the menu. This menu option then changed to "Stop Speech" and was implicitly indicating whether speeach is currently active or not. With the actionbar the functionality is basically the same but the user would need to long press the icon each time to find out whether talking is enabled or disabled. I failed today several times in checking and changing the status and got confused by pressing the icon without anything happening. It would be preferable if there is some visual feedback to the user by one of these methods: Show a toast "Speech activated" / "Speeach deactivated" after each press Have a permanent status indicator on the compass screen itself Change the icon in the actionbar reflecting the next action (e.g. Stop talking would be a strikethrough bubble)
Manager.title: New UI for talking compass needed

Manager.description: 2014.08.10-NB: Activate and authenticate to OC.de Search "Found by" or "Hidden by" with a username which should match No cache returned Communication looks normal in the log (no HTML error codes,etc.) Not sure if this ever worked, but according to "Supported functions" it should.
Manager.title: No caches returned from OC.de

Manager.description: Open OC11254 Try to log it with a random log password (which is obviously wrong) A toast is shown: It seems that your log was not posted. Please check on geocaching.com Two problems: We should detect that the reason for not posting was the wrong password (if possible using OKAPI) We should refer to the correct caching platform and not default to geocaching.com
Manager.title: Failed logging on oc reports incorrect and misleading error

Manager.description: 2014.08.10-NB: Compose a personal note for a cache Upload the personal note to g.com c:geo reports "Succesful" but in fact the note is not shown on the website. Release branch is OK according to @rsudev tests.
Manager.title: Upload of personal note not working

Manager.description: If an empty note is sent to the gc.com server, it does not affect the previous note. An empty string should be sent as the json "dto.et" component, not null. Due to code changes in this area, this must likely be fixed separately in both: master release
Manager.title: Cannot erase personal note from server

Manager.description: The gc.com HTML code changed once again, and the avatar image is no longer recognized when verifying one's credentials.
Manager.title: Avatar no longer recognized

Manager.description: As noted by @Kucharskov in #4146, the labels at the top of the log book for OC110EE include "0x will attend" while this is not an event cache (it is a virtual one).
Manager.title: Inconsistent labels for non-event cache

Manager.description: I just logged a trackable using the Sunday master. After logging the log list was not refreshed. Has to reload the trackable to actually see my log.
Manager.title: Trackable log not shown after log

Manager.description: So you're geocaching in a public place and people are staring at you. We geocache in groups from 2 to 3 so we're thinking it might be funny if the compass had a button we would could press to play a sound bite event such as the tricoder sound. Not to the extent of having a LCARS theme but something comical when we're the dead centre of attention. Tricoder sound example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hd_LV_mUd14
Manager.title: Sound effects on compass

Manager.description: My wish: Simple button to hide all caches and waypoints on map. Usable when c:geo load too much caches and map city names are unreadable. Regards! BTW. Where are nightly changelog?
Manager.title: Add option to hide icons on map

Manager.description: The last parameter of TextUtils.getMatch is unused, although it gives the method different semantics. The method is used with last being true and false, so it is really meant to be used.
Manager.title: TextUtils.getMatch ignores `last` parameter

Manager.description: We have both CacheDetailActivity#notifyDatasetChanged and CacheDetailActivity#notifyDataSetChanged. Those methods names differ only by the case of the set. This should be investigated, sorted out and one of them should be renamed.
Manager.title: Methods differing only by case

Manager.description: Open trackable TB159ZN in cgeo, click on the name of the containing cache ("Les 84 marches"): E/AndroidRuntime(16417): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity}: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: geocode must not be empty E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2215) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2264) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread.access$800(ActivityThread.java:144) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1205) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5139) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:796) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:612) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: geocode must not be empty E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.loadCache(DataStore.java:1527) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity.onCreate(CacheDetailActivity.java:267) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5231) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2169) E/AndroidRuntime(16417): ... 11 more
Manager.title: Cannot open cache detail activity from guid

Manager.description: I just had an ANR in CacheListActivity. I opened a pocket query ZIP file from the launcher and selected c:geo. The app opened, but nothing happened afterwards. This is in a location, where I normally only get a GPS fix after quite some time. I run a one or two days old build with enabled Play service location provider. My feeling is this could be a "block until GPS is ready" issue again.
Manager.title: ANR in CacheListActivity

Manager.description: Got a report right now. Lab caches cannot be imported from gpx. Can attach a file when at home.
Manager.title: Cannot import lab cache from gpx

Manager.description: Previously it was possible to have location switched off and use BT-GPS and an external GPS receiver via the mock location provider. This seems not to work any more.
Manager.title: New fused provider breaks BT-GPS

Manager.description: Before introduction of the new location provider it was possible to see the reliability of the location in the lower right corner (GPS or network). Now it is always fused and you don't know if the position is from network with possibly high precision but low correctness or from GPS with the given accuracy.
Manager.title: Info about location provider "fused" not helpful

Manager.description: If no gcvote rating is present, the favorite rectangle on the lists do have a black border (1dp) on the white theme. However if a rating is present (background is green/orange/red) the border is missing. I do not see why this is the case, because the border color is defined. Probably another appearance of the confusing alpha values in the ARGB color definitions. Will try investigate this.
Manager.title: No borders shown around favorite rectangle on white theme

Manager.description: When navigating to one of the additional waypoints of a cache (e.g. stages of a multicache), the cache itself is displayed on the map instead of the selected waypoint. When trying to navigate to that waypoint again, it works. Steps to reproduce: open a cache with multiple waypoints go to the left-most screen (list of waypoints) select a waypoint (e.g. a station of a multi-cache) so that you get the context menu select Navigate select Map Current result: main icon of that cache is displayed (on its correct location) Expected result: selected waypoint should be displayed on the map Workaround: go back to the waypoint list repeat the steps Notes: seems to be timing related on slower devices the problem only happens occasionally
Manager.title: Navigate to additional waypoint shows main cache in map

Manager.description:
For easier debugging it would be helpful to get c:geo compiled with a different applicationId so that the debug instance run be installed / run / debugged without having to de-install the existing installation (with all of its cached data, configurations, ...). Changing the package name in main/AndroidManifest.xml - package="cgeo.geocaching" + package="cgeo.geocaching.test" causes lots of compilation errors: ~/Projects/cgeo> ./gradlew assembleDebug
:main:processDebugResources /home/chkr/projects/cgeo/main/build/intermediates/res/debug/xml/preferences.xml:15: error: No resource identifier found for attribute 'text' in package 'cgeo.geocaching' /home/chkr/projects/cgeo/main/build/intermediates/res/debug/xml/preferences.xml:15: error: No resource identifier found for attribute 'title' in package 'cgeo.geocaching' [...]
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

Manager.title: Running multiple instances of c:geo

Manager.description: Recently we disabled Samsung multi window support as there seems to be a memory leak in some versions of Samsungs multi window feature leading to crashes when continously rotating the device while c:geo live map with mapsforge offline map is active. There was a discussion in Munich whether or not we should reenable this feature. I vote for reanabling because: It would be a feature regression if we release without that function. I know some people regularly using it (e.g. gallery and c:geo in multi window for typing in coords from pictures they took) Only a subset of devices seem to be affected (my S3 (Android 4.3) is affected, my Samsung S4 (Android 4.4.2) and my Galaxy Note 10.1 (Android 4.3) are not affected) The OOM seems only to happen when using mapsforge in combination with continous rotation (in combination with an affected device). It could be a rare case anyway. Opinions? I will meanwhile test if other apps supporting it have similar problems on my S3 (e.g. Locus).
Manager.title: Reenable Samsung multi window support

Manager.description: I experienced, that on the trackable logging page (but might be the same on the cache logging page) the log button might be missing in the actionbar (see screenshot). I assume that the network connection was bad and thus the log page was not yet being loaded from gc.com. Before we implemented the actionbar this was indicated by the send button being replaced with a "Loading Log Page" button. With the current implementation there is no visual indication to the user that he can not yet send his log. I suggest to always show the send button and if the user presses the send button while page loading has not yet been completed, to show a toast with an error message like "c:geo is still loading data from the server. Please try again in some seconds".
Manager.title: Log button not present if page is still loading

Manager.description: Google recently changed the PlayStore appearance (via playstore app): They introduced a short description and are now using the "Advertisement image" as heading image after selecting the app. I already filled the short description with the former first line of our long description (c:geo ~ Let's find some geocaches!) in all available languages. However the "advertisement image" we currently have is somehow outdated and looks not so very advertising IMO. Is someone here able and willing to rework/replace it by something different? It is stored here in our repo: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/blob/master/main/project/rawimages/play_feature_graphic.jpg Current appearance (without the short description I already added):
Manager.title: Replace functional graphic on PlayStore

Manager.description: The membership (basic vs. premium) given in the logs right after a change of account is still the one of the previous user.
Manager.title: GC membership information may be wrong in logs

Manager.description: When changing the username in the application, some information in the database becomes obsolete (found, favorite, friends, etc.) and cannot be easily rebuilt without doing many requests to the various connected sites. The user should have the choice to partially erase the database (connector dependent) when switching from a valid logged in user into another one on any connector.
Manager.title: Database should be cleared when changing username

Manager.description: I have recently noticed multiple instances of following feature: I'm in GMT +02 timezone (Helsinki). I have this timezone setting both in my phone and in geocaching.com (just checked). If I submit a new log (i.e. Cache found) before 10 am Finnish time, using "Today" as submission date, the log will show with the previous date in geocaching.com. I.e. today 21.8. I submitted online two cache visits between 9 and 10 a.m. from my Android phone using c:geo. When reviewing these logs with my computer, I find out that both instances have been saved in geocaching.com with date 20.8. This has happened before, also i.e. with a morning meet log. It seems that somewhere in the chain the time stamps are not handled correctly. I have also reported this problem to geocaching.com, since I've learned that similar problem occurs also with some other online software, at least neongeo.
Manager.title: Wrong date in geocaching.com after logging online

Manager.description: When using the app on Samsung Galaxy Note 2, you open the compass to direct you to the cahe coordinates, it remains static. Distance to coords changes, gps position moves as expected, but compass doesnt move or is jumpy and then freezes. Ive uninstalled and reinstalled to no effect. This was working perfectly up until a day ago.
Manager.title: frozen compass

Manager.description: I can't delete lists or enter select mode or bulk manage or filter caches on the LG G3. There is simply no ... menu button there to enter that mode. Just got the phone today, phone is running Kit Kat. Happy to provide any other info needed to get this fixed.
Manager.title: No menu on LG G3

Manager.description: We use enumerations when invoking activities via intent. E.g. the CacheListActivity gets a CacheListType enum to behave differently as history or offline list. This is all fine, as long as the intents are handled only inside our app. I've started enhancing the shortcut creation abilities of c:geo and this is a problem now. We cannot invoke any activity (from outside) that uses such custom types in its intent, as the launcher application is not able to load the necessary enumeration classes (due to them being in our package). I'm thinking of how to replace the enums in the intents, such that it remains maintainable and readable. I'm currently favoring to use the string representation of the enum values (and not the ordinal values), as that would be more readable for external intent callers. Any other opinions?
Manager.title: avoid enumerations in intents

Manager.description: I'd like to make "show trail" disabled by default, and session scoped. Right now, it is enabled by default, and persistent (fortunately, to be able to get rid of it). I'd like feedback on this before going on.
Manager.title: Make "Show trail" transient and disabled by default

Manager.description: I'm not using live map much, but today I watched a friend, who never used our app before. He was coming from live map (with a big area covered), looked at a cache and zoomed into the map of that cache very closely. When going back to the live map, it was also zoomed in closely. We should use 2 different persistent zoom states to allow more easy switching between these 2 use cases.
Manager.title: store zoom separately for live map and for "map of a single cache"

Manager.description: after update stopped running offline maps. It would be good if you could choose a repository of stored cache. Move to SD does not work on phones that have internal memory mapped as SD0 and SD1 as a memory card
Manager.title: problem offline maps and cache databaze

Manager.description: Set your system locale to something not english. start c:geo set "force english" force close app or reboot phone start c:geo c:geo is in a native language of phone.
Manager.title: Force english does not work on main screen

Manager.description: It would be great to extend infos about Favouritpoints in the Cache-Details. Perhaps you can include the Favoritepoints PM percentage and a info about the user: Do you don't you give a favoritepoint to this cache (like the info about your own GCVote at a cache)?
Manager.title: Favo percentage in Cache-Details

Manager.description: IRC logs containing links are hard to use on mobile devices, as the logs and therefore their links are plain text. Would be nice if that were actual HTML.
Manager.title: Linkify irc logs

Manager.description: When reload is used on a stored cache, the cache is then reloaded twice from the database after getting the static maps.
Manager.title: Refreshed cache is reloaded twice from database

Manager.description: Should be great if we could save log in one click for all caches with saved visites.
Manager.title: Save logs for saved visites in one click

Manager.description: Uploading coordinates to the website shows "cache"as title of the progress dialog. "Upload" would fit much better.
Manager.title: Upload coordinates has bad title

Manager.description: At least on Android 4.x, people sometimes complain that the network is not used to get an approximate location. In their phone settings, they might use "device only" while they should select "high precision" if they want to use the network location provider. This would need a FAQ entry.
Manager.title: Location FAQ entry needed

Manager.title: Attach several images to the log

Manager.description: I wonder if we should reintroduce the "Set destination" menu in the compass. While reworking the menus it was removed for some reason(?) but people on support and on FB keep asking for that. It seems to be more often used than we have thought as people don't want to go back and add waypoints but just continue from one navigation to another by settings a new destination directly in the compass.
Manager.title: Reintroduce "Set destination" in compass

Manager.description: This was orignally discussed in some commit...but in the end it was not changed. I had two users today saying that they can no longer log a cache with c:geo. After some mails back and forth it turned out that they did not manage to get the clue, that the OK button is behind the keyboard in that showcase screen.
Manager.title: Prevent keyboard showing up on logging screen if showcase is shown

Manager.description: It looks like the HTML code has changed. To check, look for keyword "CITO", the CITO events do not have the date in the search results.
Manager.title: Cache placed date parsing is wrong

Manager.description: Trackable location in logs disappears when the activity is restored. To reproduce: open a trackable, go to the logs page, put your phone to sleep, turn the phone back on, the locations will be removed in the left column.
Manager.title: Trackable location disappears in logs

Manager.description: Right now, Settings.migrateSettings() is called if the right version is not found. However, in the absence of settings (for example in a fresh installation), this method is called and for integer settings install settings that might be different than the default found in the corresponding setter. This led to #3723 because the default was present in two places. We should avoid callling migrateSettings if no previous settings are present, for example by checking for the presence of a known key which had always been there, or by checking (if possible) for the presence of those shared preferences.
Manager.title: Do not migrate nonexistent settings

Manager.description: We have one loader (RemoveHistoryLoader), which actually executes a database modifying operation before loading data. At least to me this concept seems rather wrong. That operation should be done independent of the loader, and this loader class be removed completely. Or am I missing something? (stumbled over this looking at #4251 and where we already use confirmation dialogs)
Manager.title: RemoveHistoryLoader seems not necessary

Manager.description: Scenario: I have one cache in the Stored list. click on Stored - I see one cache in the Stored list + info "One cache" Menu / Filter / Attributes / Dogs allowed - list is clear + info "0 caches/One cache" Menu / Filter / Clear filters - list is clear ! + info "One cache" This is a bug. Now if I choose another list and then come back to the Stored list I can see my cache.
Manager.title: Clear filters not working properly

Manager.description: In Menu / Utility / Locus there is is this description Simple, usable application which shows online maps and allows you to download them directly into Offline mode (raster maps only). Also supports track recording, POI handling and many other useful functions. I know Locus and it is quite complex, not simple. In Locus you can work with offline vector maps as well. I suggest to change the description to Usable application which shows online and offline maps and allows you to download them directly into Offline mode (online raster maps only). Also supports track recording, POI handling and many other useful functions.
Manager.title: Locus description inappropriate

Manager.description: Issue #4256 has not been fixed by 2014.09.02 version.
Manager.title: Context menu not updated when selecting caches

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: unpublished caches not recognized

Manager.description: Login as Basic member (be sure no cache is saved/cached) Enable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Enter the correct Captcha Result: The list has coordinates (exact distances) but no D/T/Size info is shown Login as Basic member (be sure no cache is saved/cached) Disable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Result: The list has no coordinates (approx. distanances and arrow picture) but D/T/SIze is shown
Manager.title: No D/T/Size parsed if CAPTCHA is active

Manager.description: Compared to the web version, there are a lot less logs and only 2 photos out of 4 for this geocache: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC2C543_the-sphinx Thank you
Manager.title: Logs and pictures missing

Manager.description: Funny fact or bug? Version: 2014.09.02 If I change the phone language the showcase view is shown again for all three views, where we implemented it. I wonder if this is just a small bug in the showcase code or anything triggered by our code (forgetting settings,etc.). However it is nice for testing purposes.
Manager.title: Showcase retriggered after language change

Manager.description: 2014.09.02 Way to reproduce: open a cache navigate via compass press talking icon and c:geo starts talking (why does it sometimes takes so long?) rotate screen 90° A message is displayed "talking stopped"
Manager.title: Screen rotation stoppes talking compass

Manager.description: On nexus5 Android 4.4.4 stick rom. Disabling HW acceleration does not help.
Manager.title: Our main screen remains transparent

Manager.description: If GeoKrety (as of geolutins, pathtags...) are supported by c:geo, it would be good if they could be easily differentiated in cache inventory. Adding an icon representing "brand" may be an option. What's your opinion?
Manager.title: Add an icon to trackable representing "brand"

Manager.description: It might have seemed "cool" and "fancy" to have a transparent main screen at some point in the past, but now it brings nothing to the application and looks strange compared to what people are used to. Therefore, I propose to use a unified black or white background depending on the color scheme. Opinions?
Manager.title: Remove transparency on main screen

Manager.description: I'm just experimenting with changes in the compass. It would stop the speech service on rotation although we implemented our own configuration change handling for this activity. Google says we need to add one more configuration change "screenSize": http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6968105/orientation-change-in-honeycomb Might be relevant for other activities too.
Manager.title: configChanges=screenSize is missing

Manager.description: Right now we are showing the type icon (e.g. the orange multi cache icon) in the cache details activity only. It should be shown in every activity that is related to exactly one cache, instead of the default c:geo icon. Technically, we should have higher resolution icons for the cache types, when implementing this (or upscale the current icons from their native resolution). Other opinions?
Manager.title: Activities related to one cache should use its icon

Manager.description: Since one of the last updates (I'm using the nightlies), quite possibly since c:geo uses Google Play Services, localization with switched-off GPS places my Live Map in France (centred on Paris, Ile-de-France). Whenever I restart c:geo, it's centred there again. Any ideas why? BTW: no Google account on this phone, does that matter?
Manager.title: Use user-defined default location in absence of system location instead of Paris

Manager.description: The current implementation for viewing a GeoKrety trackable use the API brought by GK team. We use export2.php script to retrieve data. Currently we can get: gkid tracking code (when authenticated request) distance traveled lat/long current waypoint owner_id state type featured image and name missing details, like: current goal pictures gallery rate detailed logs visited countries count watching users count place visited reported missing info and maybe more... On the IRC we told "no more html parsing"... It would be cool if the GK webmasters can provide more info or API to retrieve those informations. I can send them an email, proposing to discuss about that here.
Manager.title: GeoKrety, some details are missing

Manager.description: Since we are using crowdin, we experience more wrong placeholders (%d, %s), missing/bad special characters and similar than when we still got translations as pull requests. The build script should flag the build as unstable in case of translation errors (with non matching placeholders at least), as those could potentially crash the app.
Manager.title: check for translation issues in CI build

Manager.description: On previous versions we were able to insert a customized location and order the compass to navigate there, along with a history list of waypoints used, we're unable to do that in the new version, the "navigate to" option disapeared.
Manager.title: No compass navigation in latest version

Manager.description: In the first screen of c:geo, there's a waypoint list, on previous versions we were able to select one and navigate to it, now, when selected, only the compass opens, and we're unable to do a "navigate to" waypoint using the gps indications.
Manager.title: Waypoint navigation disabled

Manager.description: The dialog is shown every time you press "Save" after editing or creation of a waypoint. It should be shown only if this waypoint is uploaded. Btw: How can you upload waypoints? You can only upload changed coordinates of a cache.
Manager.title: Dialog "Uploading Waypoint…" although not uploading

Manager.description: renew option in pull down menu for selected records is absent
Manager.title: renew option

Manager.description: Input coordinates Press the compass icon Press back, the coordinates are not in the history. Press back (go back to main screen), coordinates are added to the history. Additional issue: With history items there is a overflow menu button (three dots) with "nearby caches" and "clear history". Sometimes the button is shown but when you press it, it changes to the arrow for loading nearby caches.
Manager.title: Everywhere function: No history when navigate via compass

Manager.description: @mucek4 Please install the current findbugs 3.0.0 in opt/ and afterwards modify the job configuration to use that path when calling findbugs instead of the currently used findbugs 2.0.3.
Manager.title: Install findbugs 3.0.0 on Jenkins

Manager.description: 2014.09.08.-NB: Followup of #3914 and #4260 Steps: Clean start c:geo (no sorting set for this session) Open list with non-event caches Check sorting menu, sort by distance is active Change to a list of event caches Default sorting changes to event date (=hidden date) automatically Check sorting menu --> No entry is selected but should be "Hidden date" Also related to #4321
Manager.title: Sorting selector sometimes not prefilled

Manager.description: After 3ff011f has been implemented (very nice feature btw) I recognized an case at this weekend: GC27W1Y It is a multi with a predefined WP for stage 1 named Station 1 (as stage 1 is always at the listing coords but sometimes separately listed by the owner) After solving stage 1 I entered a new WP and it was autonamed Stage of a multi cache 1 but should be Stage of a multi cache 2 This is probably hard to solve automatically as the initial waypoint can have random names. I renamed the new WP Stage of a multi cache 1 manually to Stage of a multi cache 2 and saved it Afterwards I again created a new WP to enter the coords of the third stage. Now the autofill gives me 'Stage of a multi cache 1' again although Stage of a multi cache 2 already exists. Here we should not only look up whether Stage of a multi cache 1 is existing but also if other Stage of a multi cache x are existing and create Stage of a multi cache (x+1) in this case.
Manager.title: Improve index of auto named waypoint

Manager.description: As discussed in d29403c
Manager.title: remove lpdi icons

Manager.description: My wife has a Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (first generation). This tablet does not include a hard button, nor a soft button to call the menu of an application. c:geo, when showing the map, has no title bar and consequently no menu. It is impossible to change the map layer, map settings, etc.
Manager.title: Menu not accessible on map (samsung tablet)

Manager.description: When Number is selected nothing happen. What would be expected ? Display my count of trackables(+1?) discovered Number of caches discovered It has nothing to do here select a cache that has trackables Log any trackable Menu add -> Number
Manager.title: `Number` menu entry in `LogTrackableActivity` has no effect

Manager.description: Login as Basic member Enable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Tap the refresh icon. Would expect a new captcha to be shown...
Manager.title: Refresh captcha boutton doen't refresh...

Manager.description: I checked the code how connectors are working. From an developers point of view it is not too bad. But it is static limited. What about an dynamic system ? Pack each Adapter into an DEX file Dynamic load DEX file's from an location Allow user to add new connectors This would allow to build new connectors more easy. You can provide "binary" plugins for GC-API without disclosure of the source. Less dependencies in the project.
Manager.title: Connector Plugin

Manager.description: Instead of the current hardcoded ftp upload script there should be a version that takes the source and target file name for the upload as parameters. (Already discussed with mucek4 on IRC today)
Manager.title: Create parameterizable script for ftp upload

Manager.description: I have a small feature request. It would be really great if the background image from the cache web page was included under the Pictures tab in c:geo.
Manager.title: Show the cache's Background Image under pictures tab

Manager.description: From support mail: Right now I have to first log the cache and afterwards add it to my favorites on another page of c:geo. It would be better to have the option to add it, right on the logging screen like it is realized on the website (and in c:geo for voting on gcvote). It somehow makes sense, to decide about favoriting the cache while logging it, rather than having to do it manually afterwards.
Manager.title: Allow adding favpoint in logging activity

Manager.description: I am not sure about the thought evolution regarding lists, I have read an older bug in may this year on this topic. Since c:geo changed interface recently, I find it much easier to change my lists, but I strongly miss the "new list" at the end of that drop down.
Manager.title: "new list" in list selector drop down (new UI)

Manager.description: c:geo has a major problem handling lists: it cannot handle a cache existing in 2 lists. Scenario: Have file1.gpx contain caches A, B, C. Import that file in list1. Have file2.gpx contain caches A, B, C, D, E, F. Import that file in list2. Expected result would be each list to contain the corresponding caches from the imported files. Actual result is: list2 contains A, B, C, D, E, F; list1 is empty. The fundaments of having lists, in principle, suggests the ability to manage different sets of caches, which have the potential to partially overlap. In the above example I may also have specific reasons to have A, B, C caches in list1, while at the same time have them in list2 which holds another set for different reasons. Considering the current implementation, implementing independent list handling will require implementing a migration module for the data stored as subfolders for each cache.
Manager.title: Make cache lists independent of each other.

Manager.description: I have encountered a problem with map scale icon, which frequently jumps by itself, or upon scrolling the map (no zooming action), between the actual map scale and a different scale (corresponding to a significant zoom out). See picture, shows the same area, same scale, only slight scroll.
Manager.title: Map scale icon jumpy

Manager.description: This may be related to the map scale issue. My list of caches, sorted by proximity, jumps wildly. I have a cache at 149m, then after a few seconds I see it at 3.26km, then again at 149m... GPS fix is stable, position icon on map is stable. GPS fix on map in other apps is stable. Position in GPS status app is stable. I am connected to internet via wifi, I have GSM off. The same happens with GSM+WiFi all off, or with all on. At first it may seem like jumps between coarse and fine location, but in airplane mode there is no coarse location provider (eg. GSM tower)
Manager.title: Unstable location

Manager.description: Current list management is IMO incomplete. Consider offline mode. There are several lists of stored caches. Considering a reasonably dense population of caches, I want to see on the map only members of my choice of lists. Currently one can see all caches, or only caches of a single list (via list -> show on map). I am requesting the addition of a "visibility" flag to each list, and only visible lists be shown on map, such that I can display more then one list, but less then all lists.
Manager.title: Ability to display contents of lists chosen as visible

Manager.description: I have a list of 324 caches. Some of them also have supplemental data stored in folders under .cgeo. Assume I do a "remove all". Now c:geo no longer has them stored. Problem 1: I am offline yet I still see all the caches I just removed on the map. Caching some of the data is ok, but I really want to get rid of them. See them gone. What do I have to do, other then manually deleting all files under .cgeo? Problem 2: all per cache folders under .cgeo are still there. They occupy storage space. I don't want them anymore. I removed the caches from storage, I want all their data gone. After managing several imports and them removed them, I was left with 3000 folders and several GB of space blocked this way. Problem 3: while online I consulted several caches in the area (via the map). Stored several of interest, left the rest. Now I go offline. I still see all caches that c:geo showed while online on the map. While caching them for some people may be of interest, I am only interested in the ones I stored, the rest are now cluttering the map. I cannot get rid of them unless I manually delete all files under .cgeo. The hard to access deep in the settings "delete orphaned files" command does not help with either of these problems.
Manager.title: c:geo does insufficient cleanup

Manager.description: I have a feature request: When one selects navigate to cache using map, a line be drawn from current location to the cache. Not having the cache on the screen because of map scale can make it hard to guess the direction in which to follow it on the map.
Manager.title: line to destination

Manager.description: Having tested these builds: (posted in #4097) https://www.dropbox.com/sh/f9nj0u9tnhgnm7t/AACKQQLMrQ0uKfSO71XlcRnVa?dl=0 both JIT and non-JIT exhibit the same problem: freshly installed cgeo (old one uninstalled) starts by showing imperial units on the map. In settings, appearance, the corresponding checkbox is unchecked. I can only get metric units by toggling on then off this setting. The current release version in googe play does not have this issue. (tested).
Manager.title: Checkbox not correct if c:geo performs autoswitch to imperial units

Manager.description: The status server now knows about "deployment" releases. Those are releases that are currently being deployed, before we can update the "release" notification. The CI server should be updated to trigger a deployment release announcement when using the "release" target, similarly to what is done in nightly builds or release candidates, only with the "deployment" kind.
Manager.title: Add "deployment" to release builds

Manager.description: Please add "Refresh all" option to "Stored" -> "All caches" menu.
Manager.title: Missing refresh all in all caches

Manager.description: Long tap the time of an event. The contextual action bar has an item to add this to the calendar. It does not do anything.
Manager.title: Contextual action bar item calendar does not work

Manager.description: Share a cache and select the "show all" entry from there share menu. On my system that starts locus immediately.
Manager.title: Share cache invokes different action

Manager.description: I'm seeing caches with additional webpage a lot here in Sardinia. That always looks like an advertisement. We should move it to the end of the cache description, like the link to other platforms.
Manager.title: Put additional webpage at the end

Manager.description: Long tap a log entry to invoke contextual action bar. That already leads to the long text translation warning toast.
Manager.title: Translation warning at wrong time

Manager.description: OX caches have a line like Traditional Cache(2.0/1.0/3.0) There should be a blank before the opening brace. We could even think about removing all information that is already shown elsewhere.
Manager.title: OX caches should have blank before rating

Manager.description: This one is from support email: If a link on picture is done using area tag and not a href links in c:geo does not work. Example caches are GC2B09B (hyperlink on the pic) and GC4ZR3R (maplink on the compass). Shall we do anything or it's too excotic?
Manager.title: HTML links with area tag in description does not work

Manager.description: Hey team, First of all, it's not an issue, but maybe a quick fix for UI. Could be possible to make this button bigger as the other screenshot? Sometimes it's difficult to press this button when you are walking :-) Thanks, Regards Daniel
Manager.title: "Insert" button to small?

Manager.description: Running C:Geo on my Nexus 7 Gen 1 and Nexus 7 Gen 2, OS version 4.4.4 In Liveview the icons load on the Gen 1 but are only displayed as generic icons (double question marks) until I click on them. The Gen 2 however display the correct icons at once. Regards Hans Blom
Manager.title: Missing icons in Liveview

Manager.description: In cache details we hide the size for earth caches. In the map popup we wrongly show it. When fixing this, make sure the same condition is used. I guess we hide it for all virtual caches.
Manager.title: Map popup shows earth cache size

Manager.description: When clicking on external maps using Osmand you will get an error saying "konnte geocontent nicht verarbeiten"
Manager.title: Problem with external maps

Manager.description: Hi, I have the problem that caches won't be shown as "found" on the map which I found for a long time (e.g. GC32NGW). On the geocaching website the cache will be shown as found. But in c:geo it won't be neither on the map nor in the cache details. Maybe I also find the reason for the issue. I have found that not all cache logs will be loaded, also if you scroll down to the end of the list. The first cache log which I can see is from the 17.04.2014, but I found the cache one year earlier (15.04.2013). I hope you can reproduce the issue. greetings Shorty
Manager.title: Cache will not shown as "found"

Manager.description: From support mail: Galaxy S2, Android 4.1.2 version: 2014.09.02 The title bar in text selection mode seems to be white on white:
Manager.title: Copy Paste operations in personal note not visible on white theme

Manager.description: From support mail: I have a cache where I failed due to the invisibility of an addtional info. Cache: GC47DP5 The hint picture "Hinweis wie du zu A kommst" contains a subheading. I can't find it in c:geo. I did not check where this subtitle is coming from but can confirm that we do not seem to support this.
Manager.title: Picture comments not shown

Manager.description: When invoking the translation menu on an encoded hint the result is just garbage. We should make the cache details creator set explicit ids for each line (which must be defined in ids.XML) instead of using id.value everywhere. When we have explicit ids for each line then we can easily take the necessary string from the cache member fields instead of reading it from the text controls.
Manager.title: Translate encoded hint does not work

Manager.description: Use power safe mode in our settings. Restart device. Open the app. The nearby button remains disabled as the GPS does not get activated in the main activity.
Manager.title: No "caches nearby" after restart

Manager.description: When opening a list while someone else is driving, I find it very confusing how far off the shown distances are, if power safe mode is active. This fixes itself when the first cache is opened. I think it would be useful to get one GPS fix from cache list.onresume.
Manager.title: Use GPS in lists when in power safe mode

Manager.description: For $reasons I have set the font size to "small" in the system menu on my phone. Because cgeo has very big letters I do not think that it is using the system set font size. I installed cgeo via the apk download from the website and am using a htc vision with a CM10.1 based custom rom.
Manager.title: respect system font size

Manager.description: When I delete (drop) a cache from a list, the position of the list is reset to the top position. This means that I have to reposition the list again and again when I want to delete several caches. This is a very annoying behavior.
Manager.title: Deleting a cache from a list reset the list position

Manager.description: I just found a bug in the latest version ( unsure if it existed before though ) . It's quite easy to reproduce . I open a cache that has a "Parking" waypoint I then go to the waypoints page and click on the compass icon on the right next to the parking waypoint Everything fine till here , it shows the correct coordinates above the compass :) I then click on the map Icon on top , and here comes the problem ... It will show me the Cache location on the map , not the parking location ( it uses the cache icon too instead of the parking icon ) If you exit the map and re-click on the map icon , it's ok , Parking icon on correct spot As strange as it is , the problem only occurs the first time after opening the cache , it's fine afterwards . To recreate the error , close the cache , reopen it , and it will happen again .. The same thing happens if I hold my finger on the Parking Waypoint, then select "navigate" , "map" The first time after opening the cache , it will show the Cache location with the cache icon on the map an navigate to it ... Exiting the map an redoing exactly the same thing will result in parking being displayed correctly . Cgeo Version 2014.09.18 Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini Android 4.2.2
Manager.title: Waypoint problem

Manager.description: Search a trackable from the action bar search. The keyboard is still visible while the progress dialog is shown. That looks not so nice.
Manager.title: Close keyboard when starting search

Manager.description: We currently allow creating the same shortcut multiple times. We should delete an existing identical one. http://stackoverflow.com/a/20864800
Manager.title: Avoid duplicate shortcuts

Manager.description: Have no data connection. Lookup a trackable code from main screen. A trackable result opens without any details except the geocode. We should show an error instead.
Manager.title: Unknown trackable if network not available

Manager.description: For mystery and multi caches it is possible to change the cache coordinates. E.g. after I've solved a mystery, I set the coordinates of the cache to the coordinates of the final. This allows me to see on the maps the place I need to walk to. For traditional caches this is not possible. This is correct, as the cache location is the place I will visit. For WherIGo caches it is not possible as well. Usually I will start at the given coordinates. But especially in the case of Play-Anywhere-WherIGos, I'm getting the coordinates of a final box during the game. Now I would be happy if I can set the coordinates of the cache. I'll be happy if you implement this change. btw: Thanks a lot for your work and keep on hacking
Manager.title: Cache coordinates of WherIGo should be changeable too

Manager.description: Since version 2014-09-18 the compass points in seemingly arbitrary directions. This affects navigation as well as the stored cache list. I have only been caching (or trying to) twice since then. In one instance it pointed roughly in the opposite direction of the supposed cache location (judging from distance displayed) over the course of several minutes moving around on foot. In the other instance it pointed consistently about 90° westwards of a known cache location while i was moving 1,5 kilometers on a bike.
Manager.title: Compass not working

Manager.description: Hi, I often hunt caches is Prague and here is cache density very big so sometimes it's difficult for c:geo to show all caches on area about 2x3km, even harder it is for geocacher to select particular cache on map like that. I recommend that map overlay should merge icons which are too close in one special icon and if that icon will be clicked it should show menu/list where you can select which one cache/waypoint you need. It should also help the readability of map. What do you think about this ? TriakCZ
Manager.title: Icons on map merging in high density areas

Manager.description: I created child waypoints in GSAK, and then export as a GPX file to Dropbox, and then import into c.geo. However, the child waypoints don't show up as additional waypoints. If I import the GPX file to another program on my PC, or even if I import the file to Locus, the child waypoints are correctly shown. So only c.geo is not importing them correctly. My preferred app is c.geo, so hoping you have a fix. Thx
Manager.title: Child waypoints not loaded correctly

Manager.description: From FB: Android 2.3.6. The menu item for attaching a photo to a log seems missing. I had a mail conversation with another user a week ago and from his description it looks like the same problem. Neither the overflow nor the icons contain the corresponding menu item. Ihad no chance to retest this on a 2.3.x device yet.
Manager.title: No menu item for attaching picture

Manager.description: When I'm logging multiple trackables, then I sometimes want to repeat the log text. But typically I forget to copy it into the clipboard, while I'm logging the first one. I suggest to have a menu item "Last log text" either on the top level or behind the "Insert" menu item, which automatically puts the last used log text into the text field. Anyone with different ideas or related use cases?
Manager.title: Insert last log text

Manager.description: I connect via WiFi and search a cache by geo code. Ex: GC1VR4M I load the details and have a message saying: "Not available offline" and store the cache. After disconnecting, I go to the stored cache and don't have the button to show compass, only to log. If I search through the live map, I'm able to go to the compass. Am I doing something wrong? Thanks in advance
Manager.title: Not available offline

Manager.description: just got an email, would do myself, but don't know if it's ok - I too long did not take part in this project, guys... Hi koemski, You've got a message at Crowdin from Dmitry Livmanis: Please add Latvian language tool! Our community also wants, that our friends, who don't know English can play this game! LeXeR in geocaching.com, fan of the c:geo app! Reply to Dmitry Livmanis Please do not reply to this email directly from mail client, use the link above to answer. Best Regards, The Crowdin Team
Manager.title: add latvian language

Manager.description: Is it possible to check without additional web requests whether a trackable was already discovered or otherwise logged by myself? That would be useful to avoid repeated logs of the same trackable when visiting lots of local events.
Manager.title: Show found state of trackable

Manager.description: After refreshing alle caches the caches are no longer stored in their list but are all now in the "All caches" list.
Manager.title: Refresh problem

Manager.description: Not sure if we can do anything about that. The BB Q10 seems to have a quite rare screen length/width ratio:
Manager.title: Compass cut off on BB device

Manager.description: Today I was out caching with 2014.10.09-NB and had the following problem, which I try to describe: Low power mode activated in c:geo I started at home where I had Wifi active in my home network I drove 35km to the cache location Activated the live map The initial position before GPS fix is accquired is still "at home" making the position jump 35km forth and back on each standby and resume of the map Most probably the location provider had no better information, so it took the last available approximated position until the fix is done. What I don't understand is, that this happens repeatedly altough after the first fix the location provider should rather assume that I am on the last known position. Is this a problem/behaviour of the Google Service or can we do anything about that. I never experienced this "problem" in c:geo versions without Google Location Service.
Manager.title: Wrong initial positioning on live map

Manager.description: I was using send2cgeo since a while, with everything working perfectly. Then I discovered I could have the site in english... and that half-broke send2cgeo: I still have the "send to c:geo" in each cache page, but not anymore on the short description mini-page when I click on a cache on the map. I also checked that going back to english fixes the problem, and going to german makes it reappear, so it's really an i18n issue.
Manager.title: The "send to c:geo" action isn't available in the gc map if the site is not in english

Manager.description: I need to add another implementation of AbstractRadarApp to c:geo for integration with my app (not yet released). Is there anything else I should do other than adding another class (eg. WearApp.java) under main/src/cgeo/geocaching/apps/cache/navi/ and inserting it into the enum in main/src/cgeo/geocaching/apps/cache/navi/NavigationAppFactory.java?
Manager.title: Integration with my app, c:geo Wear

Manager.description: After implementation of #3799 it is most likely (depending on the screensize) that the "Done" button is now hidden behind the keyboard. So for the normal operation of entering coords and closing the window, the user might need an additional keypress to close the keyboard now. I suggest to place the "Done" button at the first position as this is probably the most used operation on this screen.
Manager.title: New sorting of buttons on WP edit screen

Manager.description: Show only one number in live map title
Manager.title: Enable total number of caches in live map only with debug setting

Manager.description: Recently gc.com changed the content of http://www.geocaching.com/account/ManagePreferences.aspx which is used in the login process of c:geo. It is now forwarded to https://www.geocaching.com/myaccount/settings/preferences with a new UI. I tested that the date format seems still to be detected correct, but I did not test all possible formats (so I am not 100% sure). Additionally I don't know what else other information we retrieve from the mentioned URL. Please notice that now also HTTPS is used. Can someone confirm that all is working normal at this point?
Manager.title: Crosscheck new preferences page

Manager.description: Open a cache from a mail. Afterwards hit the up button at the top left. This returns to the mail client instead of navigating up.
Manager.title: Application stack not correct coming from mail

Manager.description: Open a cache from a mail. Afterwards hit the up button at the top left. This returns to the mail client instead of navigating up.
Manager.title: Application stack not correct coming from mail

Manager.description: If I slide right on a list to select one item and switch to select mode, the context menu opens up and I need to press back every time. Context menu should open only by longer touch or select mode should not start by slide rigth an entry anymore.
Manager.title: Select mode by slide right sucks

Manager.description: 2014.10.18-NB Open map Zoom in to e.g. 100m per unit Close live map Open live map again Zoom is reset to a higher value
Manager.title: Last zoom not remembered

Manager.description: 2014.10.18-NB: Today I stumbled over an english string in my german version. I took a quick look and it seems caches_clear_offlinelogs_message is not in the german strings.xml and not listed for translation on crowdin. Why (or did I simply overlook it)?
Manager.title: String missing in crowdin translation

Manager.description: I just imported a cache from mail on my tablet in landscape mode. During the import 2 pencils were visible in the action bar, after the import one of them vanished. Conclusion: In all actions that take more than a tiny amount of time to initialize we should disable optional actions by default (instead of declaring them visible in the XML and then hiding them in the code).
Manager.title: Disable optional action bar actions by default

Manager.description: Issue #4012 seems to be reappearing (some mails on support mail in the last weeks). Market version Premium-Member Here is a german step-by-step which I can't reproduce but believe in (will translate later if necessary): Bei EinstellungenAppsc:geoCache gelöscht Bei EinstellungenAppsc:geoDaten gelöscht c:geo deinstalliert Handy neu gestartet Aus dem Play Store c:geo neu installiert Ohne Wiederherstellen meiner Datenbanksicherung und ohne etwas an den Einstellungen in c:geo zu ändern (nur Accountdaten von geocaching.com) die „in der Nähe suchen“-Funktion angeklickt C:geo findet mehr als 40 Cache „Eigene und gefundene Cache ausblenden“ ausgewählt und Suche noch einmal gestartet C:geo findet nur 40 Cache Datenbanksicherung wieder hergestellt und noch einmal getestet C:geo findet nur 40 Cache Funktion „Eigene und gefundene Cache ausblenden“ deaktiviert C:geo findet wieder mehr als 40 Cache
Manager.title: Search result limited to 40 caches again

Manager.description: Current NB: The menu item Log visit (and others?) Are missing in the overflow menu of the cache popup on map.
Manager.title: Menu items missing in popup

Manager.description: Hi, I have a crash that can be reproduced (at least on my phone). Running 18/9/2014 (latest from playstore) on Galaxy S3 Cyanogenmod 11 M11. I tried https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/wiki/Send-log-to-developers but it doesn't generate any log output. Just some few lines about an activity starting: --------- beginning of /dev/log/main I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41c450a8 time:375560 W/InputEventReceiver( 5904): Attempted to finish an input event but the input event receiver has already been disposed. I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:405629 I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:416735 I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:739101 If I go to /dev/log to see what's in the logs, there are only empty files there. The google crash report does show the stacktrace nicely, but it seems impossible to store this report somewhere? To reproduce I do the following: Open a pocket query in c:geo with more than 20 caches in result. First 20 are showing. Apply filter: Status=Not Stored. Observe less than 20 result remaining, for example 19. Select Store Offline from menu. Select create new list. Observe crash after a few seconds. There's an IndexOutOfBoundsException in CacheListActivity.java:286. Please note that when I rerun the scenario above, there are less than 19 caches not stored. For example 16. Next run: 14 not stored, etc. So it does store some caches before crashing. It does not show any progress in the bar before crashing. So maybe it tries to update the progress bar and crashes? If I try the exact same pocket query with no filter, I can store it fine. I tried with different pocket queries, so it looks like it doesn't matter which pocket query I use. Anything else I can provide?
Manager.title: Storing filtered list results in crash (IndexOutOfBoundsException)

Manager.description: We should suppress all images from the image tab, which have only the size of a typical smiley. Example cache http://coord.info/GC5DHMW
Manager.title: Filter Smiley's from image tab

Manager.description: I have just seen with 2014.10.27-NB that the image title for the second latest log entry for this TB seems to be malformed. http://www.geocaching.com//track/details.aspx?tracker=TB121TG To be verified.
Manager.title: Wrong image title in TB-log

Manager.description: I have one saved solved mystery (in a list) where i set the calculated final WP coordinate as new cache coordinate, locally and on the web site. When doing a search for nearby caches, i see the cache listed with (and sorted by) the distance to the publish coordinates, not the new saved coordinates. When i go to the cache details, i see the correct (bigger) distance to the final. When returning to the list of nearby caches, now that cache is listed with and sorted by the correct (bigger) distance. This can be reproduced by closing the list of nearby caches and opening it again. I expect to see the distance to the cache to be correct upfront. Version: 2014.10.28-NB-935444e
Manager.title: Wrong distance for „nearby“ caches when setting WP as cache coordinates

Manager.description: While reading #4441 I remembered a similar issue on the live map which I experienced with 2014.10.25-NB: Have some caches with modified coords saved in c:geo Open the live map of this location (it might be important for this issue, that the listing coords and the modified coords are both within the map view) While the live map is loading the solved mytery are already shown at their modified coords (including the flagpost overlay icon) as it should be After loading it might happen (but not always) that the solved mystery jumps to the listing coords (but still showing the flagpost overlay) This situation can be corrected by moving or zooming the map which makes the caches jump back to their modified coords @samueltardieu As you are assigned to #4441 maybe you can take a look at this one as well. I assume the wrong positioning comes from a similar source = The nearby search performed during live map loading
Manager.title: Jumping "solved mystery" on live map

Manager.description: According to the latest gc.com release note some URLs have changed. Currently they are forwarded to the old URL but we might need to update: Update your bookmarks! The following URLs will be changing: www.geocaching.com/myaccount will now be www.geocaching.com/account This acffects the URL for the preference page we are requesting. Update your bookmarks! The following URLs will be changing: www.geocaching.com/adventures will now be www.geocaching.com/play This is probably not used by c:geo ?!
Manager.title: URL change on gc.com
