Manager.description: When Jenkins is restarted the next time, we will have a new plugin for automatically analysing build errors (by searching for regular expression patterns). The patterns still need to be added then.
Manager.title: configure build failure analysis plugin on Jenkins

Manager.description: Tomorrow I plan to go to a MEGA event in Sweden. :-) The descriptions of the waypoints are mixed up compared to how it is displayed on the webpage. GC4XBA9 NB-141031 (as well as official from Play 140918)
Manager.title: Descriptions for waypoints are mixed up

Manager.description: Today I attended an event, where a user showed me the following crash scenario on his Samsung Galaxy Note 2 (running Android 4.4.2) with c:geo version 2014.09.18: Open live map using OSM:Offline map Rotate 3 times On fourth rotation c:geo crashes The specific play report shows only this: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at android.graphics.Bitmap.nativeCreate(Native Method) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:928) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:901) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:868) at org.mapsforge.android.maps.overlay.Overlay.changeSize(Overlay.java:411) at org.mapsforge.android.maps.overlay.Overlay.run(Overlay.java:246) This can not be the multiwindow bug as it should be disabled in that version. I can contact the user. What else would we need to find the reason? Possibly a memory dump...but AFAIR this is not automatically created in the release version isn't it?
Manager.title: Still OOM crashes on rotation of offline map

Manager.description: When showing cache details and swiping to the logbook page, some recent logs are shown. The name of the logger, the logtype (e.g. found it, didn't find it) and the number of found caches are shown with the logtext, but I am also interested in the log dates. Was the cache found recently, was the cache found every day or only once a month. When showing the dates this gives you more information about that.
Manager.title: Show "found dates" in logbook page

Manager.description: Hi! There are some caches, that have really long names and are part of the trail (eg.: A really, really long cache name that is part of this beautifull trail No. 11). In a list of all saved caches c:geo only shows first XY characters (I have a small phone screen). Since the cache number is usually on the end, I can not find a specific cache easily. If I sort by name I have to count where the desired one will be, that is quite hard. The proximity sort is also of no use in some cases, when the trail is circular and the returning path is nearing the curent one, so the closest caches are not always the next ones. I wish there was an option to have multi-line title names, to switch them on and off. Is that possible to implement? Regards; Luka
Manager.title: List of caches - multiline title

Manager.description: Hello! I have searched but could not find an option to show on a list of saved caches only those that I have not found yet. During caching I usually save only offline status (found it, DNF, ...) and send log only when I came home. But there is no filter to show only the saved caches without saved log. There is an option to show caches that have saved log, but I wan't right the oposite. Is this possible to implement? Regards; Luka
Manager.title: Filter: exclude caches with saved log

Manager.description: Since this Version, my phone (Samsung Galaxy GT-S7562 Android 4.0.4 Kernel 3.0.8-1102401) performes a shut down (complete power off) while loading detailed cache information from live map. The last version before this c:geo update was working perfekt without any error. This bug causes the phone to shut off (power) complete. In order to restart the phone, you have to remove the battery and wait for some time before you put it back in. I try to provide a crash dump, but since the device is going down complete, it is not easy to do.
Manager.title: Power off crash with version 2014.09.18

Manager.description:
Some days ago I complied a RC version via Jenkins. I have used that version during the last weekend on three devices and it performed good. IMHO we can release this version to have some bugs fixed in the field (including the important fix to support all possible date formats): · Fix: Map icons looked blurred on some devices
 · Fix: Some menus had a wrong font size
 · Fix: Adding an event to calendar was not always working
 · Fix: Do not show cache size info for earth caches as it has none
 · Fix: Support all possible date formats of geocaching.com
 · Fix: Avoid crash when saving a filtered list of caches
 · Fix: Picture title in TB logs not shown
 Are we good to go or do you think there is something missing (open issues, or changes currently only on master)? Maybe some new translations pending?
Manager.title: Bugfix release

Manager.description: As soon as the current release branch is published, the FAQ entry for date formats is no longer valid and should be removed (or limited to be only valid for legacy version). Assigning myself.
Manager.title: Remove FAQ entry regarding supported date formats

Manager.description: Three reports on Google Play saying that the new verison does not open caches and get stuck while loading in "Loading Details" (or similar). Unverified.
Manager.title: Caches not loading with 2014.03.11

Manager.description: As the login error message on gc.com changed we currenlty always report "Unknown error". Seems they now alway report Either your username or password is incorrect. Please try again. If you've forgotten your information, click here. So we might now be unable to distinguish between username or password failure and should always probably give the same message as above.
Manager.title: Login failure always reports "Unkown error"

Manager.description: Today we recognized on IRC that the CI server is reacting slow on user inputs and status updates on the web GUI starting with the new version being active.
Manager.title: CI server unresponsive

Manager.description: From support mail: I user is missing the button for adding a cache to his favorites. He send along a screenshot which seems to confirm, that the whole favorite line is missing. Login is checked OK, all other functions normal. Any idea? I asked him to crosscheck another device and another user on his device. Waiting for answer. To only "unusual" thing I noticed up to now is, that the user has a 5-digit find count. Might this influence the parsing at that point?
Manager.title: Favorite status and button missing for Charter Members

Manager.description: 2014.11.04-NB Open a TB Log a discover on a past date (not today) After sending the log it is shown as Today in the TB log After refresh it is correct, so we send the right data but show it initially wrong
Manager.title: TB log has wrong date

Manager.description: Hi, If I am not mistaken, currently the Google Maps integration in c:geo does not cache map tiles? I know I can use OSM maps to have offline maps, but these have some points that could be considered sub-optimal: You have to either store complete countries in your phone, or create your own maps for the areas you need. For example the map for Germany is 1.3GB. In some countries Google Maps is just a lot better compared to OSM. Would you consider implementing support for the caching of Google Maps tiles? By caching I mean caching them for a couple of day or so. I think the Google Maps API v2 (#2222) supports storing tiles offline and allows to keep tiles stored for up to 30 days? In a perfect world, we would be using the offline storage of the official Android Google Maps app. This app can store maps offline in a convenient way: all zoom levels are stored. So when preparing for a trip, or for areas you frequently visit, you keep the maps stored offline in Google Maps. If c:geo could use this, it would be very helpful. I've tried to google whether this is possible, but couldn't really find any info on it. I would be willing to help on the implementation, but first we need to agree on whether it's a desired feature, etc. Opper
Manager.title: Caching / Offline map tiles for Google Maps

Manager.description: Older versions of cgeo had the option to save visible caches from the live map for offline-caching. Is there a reason why this option was dropped? Can you reenable it?
Manager.title: live map - missing the option for saving for offline caching

Manager.description: to be completed after the weekend. not at home currently I can see the wp for thr original coords of my saved caches with corrected coords even on a map with an amount of caches which is above the limit.
Manager.title: Waypoint limit not working

Manager.description: Opening this cache Geocache GC49CQC - Das Nest der Hedwigeule - zum 5000. - http://coord.info/GC49CQC is obviously problematic. On my Galaxy S4 the whole app gets quite unresponsive and sometimes runs into an ANR.
Manager.title: Cache rendering has massive delay or leads to ANR

Manager.description: From support mail: Currently there seems to be no offline tool which supports the Dutch RD coordinate system. In the netherlands quite some caches use this. It would be good if c:geo would also support entering coords in Dutch RD. Maybe someone come along willing to implement it. IMHO its a rare case....but I had the same problem while staying in dutch and can confirm that I did not find any tool supporting it offline on Android.
Manager.title: Support Dutch RD coordinate system

Manager.description: Three users reported this via support mail: Version: 2014.11.04 All users are PM Have a list of offline saved caches Refresh the list of caches After refresh some caches are missing the size info in the list view as well as in the details (line is missing) Doing another refresh either solves the problem or other random caches loose the size info One user reported, that after a fresh reboot of the device (probably a fresh start of c:geo would be enough) the problem disappears for some time to happen again after some hours. With current master I can not reproduce this. I will test the market version later and report back.
Manager.title: Cache size info lost on refresh

Manager.description: In detail view, date when cache was found is displayed after the status "found". This must be rather new feature, i guess, i never noticed that before. Anyway, when logging a cache from c:geo one day later, setting the date to „yesterday“, the date shown after the cache status is today, not „yesterday“. So caches found 8th of november but logged on 9th of november with log date „yesterday“ are displayed as found on 9th of november. Interestingly enough, gc.com has a similar bug: I logged my first cache from Saarland one day late and manually set the date to one day before. Cache found date is correct, but the date i aquired the Saarland souvenir is wrong, it's the date i entered the log. But that is unrelated. I forgot: Nightly 2014-11-10-NB1-e0afb7
Manager.title: Wrong date shown for cache/TB log if logged with past date

Manager.description: I have downloaded OSM mapping to a file on my phone and selected the correct path. Help informatin states the following - In order for c:geo to use the selected map you have to activate OSM:Offline in the dropdown menu "Select Map Source" located above the directory settings. You can change this setting also directly from live map.- The dropdown menu referred to does not contain "OSM:Offline" as an option. I am using version 2014.11.04
Manager.title: OSM offline -

Manager.description: When you have selected the light theme (Android 4.4.4), the button 'Choose directory' in the map selection in the preferences is black on black...
Manager.title: Choose map directory in preferences not readable with light theme

Manager.description: With todays NB Details later
Manager.title: Various crashes during usage

Manager.description: 2014.11.09-NB (newer version not tested yet) When logging a cache sometimes the gcvote selector is not shown below the text window. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. Need to puzzle it out later.
Manager.title: Gcvote not always shown in logging window

Manager.description: If onlySave is true, the image will never be refreshed even if it is not fresh enough. It is only refreshed if we intend to display it immediately.
Manager.title: Mass-refreshing caches won't refresh stale images

Manager.description: In http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo/3007/androidLintResult/new/ Lint warnings appear as if they were new, while in fact they have been fixed.
Manager.title: Lint warnings are shown as new instead of fixed

Manager.description: Github allows creating a project defined side bar which can give more structure than the simple list of pages. I got the idea from the sidebar of the openhab project wiki: https://github.com/openhab/openhab/wiki/Release-Notes-1.6
Manager.title: have dedicated sidebar in wiki

Manager.description: Hey all. I was thinking of adding a "pre cache caches" for situations where netwrok is unavailable., I stumble on this personally quite a lot, where I am looking for caches where there is not signal. I want to prepare at home to being some caches. Any thoughts? T.
Manager.title: Caching Chaches for no-network situations

Manager.description: As the website removed the button which is our anchor point, the send2cgeo button is no longer shown (cross-check other oc-nodes as well!)

Manager.description: Feature request from support mail: I would like to sort my list of found caches by found date. That seems to be not yet possible.
Manager.title: Sort by found date

Manager.description: I have no meaning yet about that, thus I want to share it with you to get feedback. From support mail: I'd like to share an idea for an update. When caches are in a list view ( near caches, saved caches) actually you can see :name, code, dimensions, D, T and distance. I think, it could be useful another row, where is listed last log info (date, log type, log user). This could be useful:in this way you can check at first sight situation of many caches at once. Instead to open each one. Hope that explain it clearly. Thanks for your work.
Manager.title: Idea for list view

Manager.description: As reported originally in a followup to #4481, rendering of GC5GMTZ leads to corrupted on-disk copies because the same image is fetched and tentatively cached multiple times simultanously.
Manager.title: Cache with many repeated images may corrupt the on-disk copy

Manager.description: Way to generate the bug: select a cache on the map cklick on more details --> move to the waypointlist click on the compass icon on the right sight of a waypoint in the waypointlist of a cache click on the mapicon --> map opens map is centered on the waypoint location but the red icon is invisible; the main icon is the only one which is visable on the map go back to the compass view click on the mapicon --> map opens map is centered on the waypoint location and the red icon is visible :) C:geo shall move form 4. to 8. directly :)
Manager.title: red waypoint on map is invisible

Manager.description: From support mail (not yet verified): OU077B Saved cache description ok. I am using offline logs. Saved a basic "found" OK, but when adding to the log offline, it gives unable to retrieve needed info, or similar. Hit send log arrow. It gives a popup, "loading log page OK" Expected behavior: Work like GC.com.
Manager.title: Unnecessary error message when starting logging activity for OC caches

Manager.description: Even if a cache comes from an opencaching site, an error to post the log invites the user to check if the log has been posted on geocaching.com.
Manager.title: Reference to geocaching.com when any cache log fails to be sent

Manager.description: From support mail: Sygic is not enabled as navigation method although Sygic is installed. Further investigation shows, that the users uses another Sygic app called "Sygic voucher edition". The only difference should be an included activation code from some promotion. However I can reproduce that Sygic stays disabled in our navigation menu after the voucher edition has been installed like the user reports. I only don't know whether it is related to a difference within the different Sygic apps or just us by having a too strict check method?
Manager.title: Sygic voucher edition not recognized

Manager.description: AFAICS the new latvian translation introduced with ce112c1 also included changes for the plugins. Thus we should release a new version for them if time permits. I dont consider that urgent, so this is basically a reminder (for myself or whoever wants to do that). Contacts plugin Calendar plugin
Manager.title: Release new versions for plugins

Manager.description: When Google geocoder (used to transform addresses into coordinates) fails or is not installed in the phone, we resort to geocaching.com simple geocoder which returns one set of coordinates and return the caches from geocaching.com located near those coordinates. As a consequence, caches from other connectors are not fetched. When the geocaching.com connector is active, we should use its geocoder as a fallback for Google geocoder instead of a special case for loading geocaching.com caches. Also, some other geocaching sites may provide their own geocoders.
Manager.title: Do not restrict geocaching.com geocoder to this connector

Manager.description: From Facebook for version 2014.12.09: Viewing caches of a PQ is working, but batch saving them fails since the update. You can only save one by one but not the whole list. The program crashes then. Original: Das anzeigen der caches von PQs funktioniert, aber das speichern leider nicht mehr seit dem neuesten update. Es geht nur noch ein einzelnen speichern der caches, aber nicht mehr der gesamten liste. Da hängt sich das programm auf.
Manager.title: Save PQ-list of caches fails

Manager.description: Found with market version 2014.12.12. while on vacation: Cache GC35RQ4 is saved offline Open the cache Swipe to get the cache description Result: My S3 shows a delay of around 12 seconds until the description page is shown My Galaxy Note still needs about 8 seconds The description contains quite some images, but not hundreds of them. As the cache is saved and I was offline, I guess it cant be that loading from network causes this delay
Manager.title: Massive delay until cache description is shown

Manager.description: This is not reproducible but botheres me the whole day today: Version 2014.12.12 Slow network connection Caches are saved offline I entered a search term in the search function on the main screen which matches an offline saved cache I selected one of the results shown At this point sometimes a windows "Loading cache details" comes up and stays for 10-20 sedonds. As the caches are all offline I dont understand what kind of activity is going on here. Not reproducible, either it depends on the specific cache or the speed or availability of the network connection?!
Manager.title: "Loading cache details" window shown when trying to open a saved cache

Manager.description: This has been reported by a user using a Wiko Cink Peax2 running Android 4.1.2 with cgeo 2014.12.12. The arrow does not appear when the user rotates the device.
Manager.title: Blue arrow does not appear on map

Manager.description: Hey, I have a problem with the c:geo app. Every time I use the map the scale is fuzzy. Sometimes, in the caches description there are fuzzy letters or numbers, too. See http://www.directupload.net/file/d/3837/6d6svt4k_png.htm Is it a bug? Thanks for helping, melawe (I use samsung galaxy duos gt s7582, android 4.2.2)
Manager.title: Fuzzy scale

Manager.description: Set my Android in Latvian to see translations and test them, it seems to me, that it should be possible to select language set as English by default, if I want. I use Options - Appearances - Use English language (restart needed), but still app lang stays Latvian, for example.
Manager.title: Can't set English language for c:geo if using Android in home language

Manager.description: 2014.12.16-NB Have a saved found cache Open caches details and select "Add to favorites" The online operation is succesful but the shown amount of favorite points is not increased After refresh the correct number is shown This used to work fine in some past version, but is reproducibly not working in the current NB
Manager.title: Favorite points not updated in cache details after adding it to your favorites

Manager.description: Hello all, I have been surprised today to see that the last update of c:geo doesn't work any more with Bluetooth GPS (app to connect my Globalsat BT-338 Bluetooth GPS Receiver) Bluetooth GPS get a fix but C:geo show a wrong position far from the correct one. Moreover the blue aim and the map are stuck even if you move. I double checked with GPS Status and GPS Test, they work correctly so the the issue defunately comes from C:geo
Manager.title: After last update C:geo doesn't work any more with app Bluetooth GPS

Manager.description: After the last update (2014.12.12) c:geo doesn´t display the current Position with the blue marker. C:geo show a wrong position far from the correct one. Moreover the blue aim and the map are stuck even if you move. Samsung Galaxy Tab7
Manager.title: No current position since the last update.

Manager.description: cgeo 2014.12.12, Illusion (SCH-I110), Android 2.3.x: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:54) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:130) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:60) Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException at android.hardware.SensorManager$ListenerDelegate.setDelay(SensorManager.java:596) at android.hardware.SensorManager.registerListener(SensorManager.java:1173) at android.hardware.SensorManager.registerListener(SensorManager.java:1034) at cgeo.geocaching.sensors.RotationProvider.onStart(RotationProvider.java:65) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.RxUtils$LooperCallbacks$1.call(RxUtils.java:94) at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:47) ... 4 more

Manager.description: Starting with 2014.12.17-NB the line showing the amount of favorite points is empty in cache details of owned caches. In list view the amount of favpoints is shown normally.
Manager.title: Amount of favpoints no longer shown for own caches

Manager.description: It looks like some users aren't clear on where to configure their login / password for geocaching.com and other services. Adding a summary in the settings under "Services" might help with that.
Manager.title: Add summaries in Settings - Services menus

Manager.description: Since yesterday, after installing the android update on my Device: Samsung S4 Mini Android: 4.4.2 Kernel: 3.4.0-3173303 c:geo: 2014.12.12 it is not possible to enter coordinates at the waypoint dialog anymore. When touching the coordinate field, the app crashes. When touching one of the other fields, I can edit them. On a different device, same model, different kernel the app works fine Device: Samsung S4 Mini Android: 4.4.2 Kernel: 3.4.0-3011164 c:geo: 2014.12.12
Manager.title: c:geo crashes when entering waypoint coordinates

Manager.description: This issue was raised by SammysHP. It is not fully deterministic, but I was able to produce at least one affected cache with every try with the following recipe: Start c:geo, open live-map, switch off 'live' move to a region where no caches are stored, select a zoom level so that you expect >~20 caches in the view switch on 'live', wait for the caches to be displayed select 'store offline' to a new list when the download is finished, the caches are still displayed as unreliable (I would have expected an update here) directly start opening caches and checking the log page for missing statistics I assume some sort of timing, but couldn't find any clues to that in the log
Manager.title: Log statistics sometimes missing when downloading from live-map

Manager.description: App still worked on Saturday after last update, but on Monday the blue arrow of the own Position is missing and neither the map nor the compass adjusts to the current position. I am not sure but I suppose it was the display rotation I activated on Monday. Since then I have this issue. I think These issues are already reported: #4533 and #4540
Manager.title: Own position not shown on devices without compass

Manager.description: After logging a trackable taken 3 days ago the log is shown on top with "today". Going back to search and again enter trackable log list the entry is correct. So just a problem how we add it to the list.
Manager.title: Log entry of trackable shown as "today"

Manager.description: I know that recent changes are the cause of it, so this is to discuss if any improvement is necessary/possible. From support mail: in older versions one came back to the last position at the maps when opening 'live maps', in the new version c:geo forgets the last position and always starts at the center of the actual city. This means scrolling every time when opening 'live maps'. Is this to be a feature? To me it behaves more like a bug - is it posible to re-configure c:geo to old behaviour? Before, with GPS on, it always showed the present position. With GPS off, it memorized the place that was last shown/chosen. In this state, there was an issue. After I turned off GPS, I needed to remove app from memory and restart it, otherwise, it still showed the map from last GPS known point. Now, even with GPS off, it always show the map from my home position, even if I'm not at home. I have turned off WiFi also, but it still shows the map at my home location. For example, I select a directory "Faro" where there are caches from a certain area and choose the map icon to show them on the map. Then I go back to the main page and select the Live Map. It shows at my home location, instead of "Faro" location, as it was before. Also, following your instructions to select the "active Live Map" in the "Faro" area, all found caches also appear, despite the option is set to hide them. In my opinion, I think the previous behavior is much better, because in any map location there's always the option to go to the present location, by clicking in the "target" icon at the top, right? The opposite is not possible.
Manager.title: Live map does not remember last position

Manager.description: We have some users on support mail which have problems using the compass starting with 2014.12.09: The distance is correct but the direction is randomly changing. "Use GPS and Compass" is active. If the users select "Use GPS only" the direction gets stable and correct (while moving) Disabling GooglePlayServices makes no difference Compass in other apps (Groundspeak, GPS Status, etc.) works without a problem Devices: Sony Xperia SP (C5303), FW.205, Android 4.3 other model informations requested (will be added later)
Manager.title: Compass shows random direction

Manager.description: The RC version 2012.12.20-RC2 was tested by myself with respect to the known fixed problems (as far as possible) and for general usage. No regressions found so far, so we decided to publish it to fix the most urgent issues reportes after the last feature release. Publish will take place soon. Update follows.
Manager.title: Bugfix release

Manager.description: From support mail and I can reproduce it: The main menu of c:geo is missing the option "Scan Geocode" although the barcode scanner app is installed.
Manager.title: "Scan Barcode" menu is gone

Manager.description: In the OKAPI you can set your preferred langauge for retrieval of various strings, because e.g. cache descriptions can be availabel in many languages. We currently use locale.getCountry() for that, instead of locale.getLanguage()...
Manager.title: opencaching: use language instead of country to retrieve descriptions

Manager.description: Android 4.4.4 c:geo 2014.12.22 Geocache: http://coord.info/GC3A2GV On android device: When visualising a cache details, if you slide screens right when you get to images screen: only 2 images visible. In browser you can see: View the Image Gallery of 17 images.
Manager.title: Not all images from gallery apear on device

Manager.description: I'm a frequent Waze user and would like to see the option to use the Waze app to navigate to a Geocache instead. Using waze we could easily avoid traffic jams etc when driving to a location.
Manager.title: Navigate to Geocache using Waze

Manager.description: When "found" log is posted cache does not get updated on map and needs refresh to make it disappear (if proper setting is checked in map settings).
Manager.title: Geocache needs a refresh to update it's found status

Manager.description: There should be a way to vote from the cache details screen, without the need to use the logging activity. It should encourage users to vote more often. E.g. we could always display the row with the own rating (instead of only when he/she already voted), and ask the user for his vote on tapping that row.
Manager.title: Simple way to vote with GCVote

Manager.description: I sometimes do cache series, where you get a clue (like a character to number mapping) in each of the caches, and using all together you can find a bonus mystery of that series. I typically store that clue as personal note in the cache where I found it, but sometimes I forget to write it down after logging. I envision that the app could ask me with an input dialog after logging automatically, given the following conditions: A setting for this feature has been activated. A certain text is found in the cache description, in German a typical word would be "Bonuszahl". The personal note is empty. What do others think of this? A drawback is the dependency to pattern matching, without knowing the language of the cache description. We would basically need to search for all language patterns at once (e.g. English, French, German,...), without making this a translatable string.
Manager.title: Ask for bonus mystery clues on logging

Manager.description: I have HTC Wildfire S, HTC Sense 2.1, Android 2.3.5 with c:geo 2014.12.22 installed and 1196 caches in offline storage. The update section says (in German) "No updates available for this phone. This phone is at the most recent status". The SQLite c:geo database seems to be OK (no errors reported with PRAGMA integrity_check) but I have used c:geo for quite a while so it may be that some entries do not comply with the current version's requirements... I use a prepaid card so c:geo is used exclusively offline (except when having a WiFi around and loading new caches). However, using c:geo I get crashes ("Tut uns leid! Die Anwendung c:geo...") almost everywhere: opening the offline map (using OSM maps) logging in when first starting c:geo (rare and difficult to reproduce) when starting c:geo and Wireless has recently been disabled but c:geo still thinks it's logged in (shown in the bottom line "login OK") when moving the map around or starting map view for a cache waypoint that had been opened from the map view already most importantly: when downloading one or several caches for offline use The last issue is very reproducible: Downloading more than three caches at once is a gamble with less than 5% chance of luck. More than four hasn't happened more often than once or twice in the last two years. It seems to increase when the GPS is on but this may only be a subjective impression. Downloading a single cache from the map view also leads to a definite crash in few cases, the most recent one being GC4Z71P (Jura-Höhenweg Teil 1). Map movement crashes are also easy to cause: Zoom out until more than ~200 caches are shown at once and simply move the map around a few times. Crash guaranteed. After a crash, sometimes c:geo reopens the map view automatically (rare case) or reopens itself automatically (frequent) or doesn't reopen at all (also frequent). Nothing else (except for sometimes BatteryBot Battery Indicator and sometimes Llama) is running in the background. I have debug logging enabled so there should be a few memory dumps. Is anyone interested in solving this issue so that I can send them in? I reject Google Play Services so reporting doesn't work (unfortunately). Best regards, Eingehirner
Manager.title: c:geo crashes constantly on HTC Wildfire S with Android 2.3.5

Manager.title: Crash while refreshing list

Manager.description: I was happening to me recently and two users on support mail reported that: Opening a saved cache and looking at the image tab sometimes shows pictures of a different saved cache. On next access (or on next refresh) it is solved (not sure about the conditions).
Manager.title: Inconsistency of pictures in image tab

Manager.description: Found during the voting dialog implementation: When logging a cache with voting, then the voting is not stored locally for the cache.
Manager.title: GCVote not stored locally

Manager.description: No GPS arrow showing on phnoe when geocaching. Phone centres on area, but won't follow or show arrow. Was working in previous releases - just not latest one. No magnetic compass on phone (android)
Manager.title: GPS arrow not visible on map

Manager.description: In the past, downloaded maps and themes from openandromaps with no problems. Now, the maps are OK but selecting any theme other than the default theme causes no map to be visible. Just caches and current location are visible.
Manager.title: Map Themes

Manager.description: LogTrackableActivityTest fails on my Lollipop emulator because the "add" action is not in the overflow menu, but is present directly in the action bar which is large enough to hold two items. Tentatively assigning to @Bananeweizen as he is the one who used Espresso in the first place.
Manager.title: Test fails because item is not in overflow menu

Manager.description: Google Play Services disabled Powersave mode disabled High precision is only used in some views like map, list, cache details but not in cache description, logs, etc. That is bad e.g. when you are deep in the woods and waiting for a GPS fix.
Manager.title: No GPS in some views

Manager.description: If a cache do not have any attributes except the Need Maintenence flag, that attribute is not removed on refresh after the attribute is cleared on the geocaching site. #3370 is closed but the bug is still there.
Manager.title: Bug:NM attribute not cleared

Manager.description: From support mail: Galaxy GT-I9000 with Android 2.3. White theme in c:geo 2014.12.22 Search menu - GC code search (and others?) Enter some digits Suggestions are shown but not readable (white on white).
Manager.title: White theme: Suggestions in search field not visible

Manager.description: As I missed @rsudev on IRC this night, I kindly ask for a fresh upload of strings from master to crowdin to cover recent changes.
Manager.title: Upload strings to crowdin.net

Manager.description: When viewing my list of stored caches, if I select to sort by "Date stored on device" this works, and shows the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. If I then choose the menu option again to sort by "Date stored on device" the list is reversed, so that the most recently stored cache as as the top of the list (which I find more useful). However, if I then drop a cache from this list, the sort order is lost - specifically, the caches are sorted again with the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. Please allow my preference of having the most recently stored cache at the top of the list to be remembered.
Manager.title: Sort order lost if negative sorting is active

Manager.description: The bar goes from blue (where I'm at) to a shade of grey to another shade of grey. This hasn't existed in any previous release
Manager.title: Import loading bar changes colour

Manager.description: I love c:geo - have been using it ever since I got a smartphone, but I've recently encountered a rather annoying issue. The compass no longer works. The distance to the cache updates fine, but the compass does not function properly. It seems to only want to bounce between 2 different headings (between 0-30 degrees and between 180-210 degrees). This only became an issue within the past few weeks; I'm not sure if it was after an update or not. I check the compass in other apps, and it works fine elsewhere. I've also tried it both using GPS and compass and GPS only, and neither one works. Is there something I can do to fix this issue? I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app with the same issue still present. I use a Samsung Galaxy S3 (SPH-L710) running Android version 4.4.2
Manager.title: Compass not working

Manager.description: Hi, I acquired a Samsung Galaxy S5 mini today and I have downloaded cgeo but it is not recognising my login details. It told me they were fine but is unable to log me in. Any ideas?
Manager.title: New phone unable to log in

Manager.description: Since Google Play Services 6.5, the monolithic library has been split into multiple libraries. We should use that new version, as it will reduce the size of our app, avoid DEX problems when building and generally introduces new features. There is an issue however: The new version is only available in AAR format, which is not recognized by Eclipse. I'll try to convert the AAR libraries into Eclipse projects, as otherwise Eclipse cannot be used anymore.
Manager.title: Use split google play services

Manager.description: Recently a limiter for static maps loading was introduced by @samueltardieu (If a 304 error is received the download is suspended for 30 seconds). While this is good to speed up the refresh process of caches it might be considered not useful for GPX imports while static maps loading is active. More precise: When importing a GPX the last import step is the download of static maps for the previously imported caches. This means in contrary to the refresh of caches the static maps download requests are bundled at one point, which means, that on the first occurence of a 304 the static map loading for all imported caches is skipped. While this is the current intended behavior I do see it as a problem for users who would like to use the static maps (e.g. offline after importing a GPX). How to find a useable solution for this....maybe only by implemting #3406?!
Manager.title: Static map loading might be nearly completely skipped on GPX import

Manager.description: I believe I have found a minor issue with c:geo. When logging in, cgeo gives you the number of your found caches, in my case 424. Now, using c:geo, I submit a DNF log for a cache. When I return to the initial screen, the number of found caches is now 425 -- cgeo mistakenly has counted the DNF as a find. Only when cgeo has to go to the GS server (e.g. when I ask for nearby caches) does the number drop back to the correct value of 424. I have seen this issue when reporting DNFs (as usual) on caches hidden by others, but I have also tested it by reporting a DNF on one of my caches -- same problem.
Manager.title: DNF log counts as found cache

Manager.description: When cgeo is used to beam a cache to another device, we do not explicitly request that cgeo is open if present. One one of my devices, this leads to a browser being opened instead of cgeo, because I once opted out for Firefox instead of cgeo on this tablet. However, here the intention is clear: beaming from cgeo should favor opening cgeo on the remote device. We need to add an AAR (Android Application Record) to the Ndef message. I propose to include one commit (57c41e9) as soon as possible in the release, as it will not change the behavior but will ensure that explicit requests to use cgeo will be handled properly. The second commit (525d94c) will then be added to the master branch only. While this way of doing is not strictly necessary, that would allow people with version N-1 of cgeo to receive explicit beams sent by version N as well. Thoughts?
Manager.title: Favor cgeo over other ways to handle cache URIs transmitted via NFC

Manager.description: 2015.01.06-RC1 Open a list of saved caches (50 caches in my case) Select Menu - Refresh all Progress will get stuck at some point, no more messages in the debug log Abort the refresh Trying to open a saved cache afterwards => Stuck on loading cache-details and ANR short after Trying to start another refresh of the list => No progress and ANR short after As discussed on IRC this might be caused by a possible race condition introduced in cdf5c65
Manager.title: Refreshing without progress and ANR afterwards

Manager.description: While working on another issue yesterday, I noticed that one cache read from geocaching.com ended only after a 90 seconds timeout. This is too long, the read timeout should be similar to the connect timeout (30 seconds).
Manager.title: Socket timeout is too long (90 seconds)

Manager.description: I have written a URL for a trackable to an NFC tag but when I scan it I only get the option to open it in one of my two browsers. If I click the same link in for example an email I get the option to also open it in c:geo. As I understand this is because Android doesn't detect c:geo as capable of opening NFC url:s. I also tried writing the URL for a geocache to a NFC tag with the same result, I only get to chose one of my two browser for opening it when scanned. (I would be really neat to have this feature since the NFC tag in question is implanted in my hand and I want people to be able to log it easily with c:geo when scanning it) I found something related to this issue here: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/84173/how-to-set-default-browser-used-by-nfc
Manager.title: cgeo should be able to read trackable URI from NFC

Manager.description: With version 2015.01.07-RC I can see a new behavior: When selecting Menu - "Refresh all" I experience a short delay before the refresh starts and the progress window is shown. Subjectively (I have to test) it rises with the amount of caches on the list to be refreshed. For a list of 100 caches it is a noticeable delay of approx. 1 second.
Manager.title: Delay just after selecting "Refresh all"

Manager.description: Hi : Android 4.1.1 c:gep 2014.12.22 I did a refresh of 200 caches two days ago and when out in the field, found the wrong images at several caches. I came home, cleared all caches and files from sdcard/.cgeo. Then reloaded ti 200 caches, and still wrong pictures. I deleted as much as possible and cleared as much caching as I could and loaded one cache and it loaded the images from another nearby cache. Then I deleted all again and this time it loaded one correct image. So, it could be local caching troubles, but if anyone else see it, please report it.
Manager.title: Downloading caches gets the wrong images associated with a cache.

Manager.description: Split up from #4552 Following the above mentioned issue and the reports we get on support mail and Facebook we can break down current compass problem to this specific one: Device: HTC One (M7) Android: 4.4.3 Description: When rotating the phone the compass does not turn steady but will jump by 180° as soon as this angle is reached Same bevavior with the arrow on map Independently of Google Play Service settings Not yet tested if Low-power mode On/Off makes any difference At the same time other compass apps are working normal (i.e. the sensors itself seem to work fine) Current RC-version 2015.01.07-RC does not solve the problem I sent a video from a user showing that issue to the cgeo-dev mailing list on 07.01.2015. @arteos Can you kindly test if enabling "Low power" in c:geo Menu - Settings - System makes any difference for this issue? Can you please fall back to version 2014.11.04 (Download from here: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/releases/tag/market_20141104) and check if the compass is normal in this version? There are also reports with HTC One Mini, Android 4.4.2 but sadly without a clear description whether it is the same problem (jumping by 180°). I will ask those users via support mail to describe in more detail.
Manager.title: HTC One (M7): Compass rotates in 180° steps

Manager.description: Split up from #4552 Device: Sony XPeria SP (C5303), FW.205 Android: Android 4.3 Description: If the phone is rotated normally the arrow is only reacting very sluggish and never reaches the correct direction. If the phone is rotated fast the arrow aso moves really fast but also ends up in a totally wrong direction. Independently of using "Google Play Services" It is currently unclear whether this happens with and/or without "low power mode". I asked via support mail but got no feedback up to now.
Manager.title: Sony Xperia SP (C5303): Compass rotatation sluggish

Manager.description: In #4552 and also on support mail an unusual amount of people are describing that a pure deinstallation + new installation of version 2014.12.22 solved their compass problem. All of them had the problem, that the compass was randomly moving or fixed to a random position and it was working normal in other compass apps at the same time. I was wondering if there is any "default value", "compass state" or alike we store somewhere which is incorrect / out of range and might only get cleared on a new installation. This is the only reason I could imagine where a reinstallation could make any difference.
Manager.title: Compass problems solved by pure reinstallation

Manager.description: We should add more specific system information that would help us debug problems tied to specific models.
Manager.title: Add system information in "about" and mails

Manager.description: We should not test the presence of the TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD sensor to check whether we can use either the TYPE_ORIENTATION or the TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR sensors.
Manager.title: Do not query the magnetic field sensor

Manager.description: For me, a class is not found as soon as the application is launched, due to commit d3dc2be: rx.android.view.OnSubscribeViewDetachedFromWindowFirst$SubscriptionAdapter This can be tested with the existing NB.
Manager.title: Test current master branch on 2.3.x

Manager.description: While on my Samsung S4 I can copy the system information to the clipboard using 2015.01.08-RC I am unable to do so with an HTC One Mini using 2015.01.08-NB3. Not sure whether it is caused by the different c:geo versions or just a bug of the HTC?
Manager.title: System information can not be copied

Manager.description: 2015.01.08-RC1 Be sure your gcvote password is wrong in settings Open a saved found cache Select Menu - Vote Select a score (in case it already has an own vote, select a scrore different to the existing) and send it An error toast is shown about the wrong password but still the new own rating is saved to the cache
Manager.title: Own rating is also saved if placing the vote was not succesful

Manager.description: I have just seen that there is a booklet offered in Google Play called "c:geo review" using our logo. Is that something agreed with us: https://play.google.com/store/books/details/c_geo_Booklet_c_geo_Review?id=L3vwBQAAQBAJ Is is sold by "Google Ireland Ltd".
Manager.title: "c:geo review" in GooglePlayBooks

Manager.description: Version 2015.01.12: Open live map Set live map strategy to fast Scroll to an area without any saved caches Select Menu - Show as List Select Menu - Export - GPX The resulting GPX is empty (besides the header). It seems meaningful, that nothing is exported because we have nothing but the name, the type and the geocode of those caches. On the other hand: If I perform a nearby search and export it to the GPX, the caches are actually exported with what we have (in this case D/T, favpoints, coords but still no description). I don't know what conditions apply for the cache to be exportable. Mabye we should gnereally disable exporting if the caches are not stored?
Manager.title: Status of a cache to be exportable?

Manager.description: Last version saw a new "really useful" feature : a menu to fast mark as found without enter into the log. But now, feature has gone. What is the status of this feature ? I really loved this one.
Manager.title: Shortcut menu to fast log offline disappeared ?

Manager.description: Seems tests on CI are failing as the cache http://coord.info/GC3XX5J has been archived recently.
Manager.title: Test failing due to GC3XX5J beeing archived

Manager.description: As I did not reach @mucek4 via IRC I post this here: Currently a lot of mails are returned with "Relay access denied". See inbox for details.
Manager.title: Mails returning to support address

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC we want to have a new release rather soon due to #4616 and other regressions in the currently release version. Tests of RC version by users is positive and so far no bad feedback also via FB (but it was only today posted there). ToDo: Build release Smoke test release Publish to 10-20% Tag release on Github Update milestones Complete release information on Github release page Publish to 100% (if no problems show up) Update status.cgeo.org Post on social networks
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: On android i can't download nightly release from https url (link directly from app). I must first edit link and delete "s" from it. It's not a big problem but maybe you can change link in app from https to http ;)
Manager.title: Problem with nightly download

Manager.description: A lot of mysteries use a checker with a spoiler in the solution, and I copy/paste the URL of the picture in my Personal Note to retrieve it quickly when I am on the spot. But it's very annoying to copy the URL (very difficult with my fingers and the screen, and i'm not alone in my case), and then, open the browser and paste it. Can you make it clickable? Thanks!
Manager.title: Parsing of URLs in Personal Note

Manager.description: Hello, when I use OSM maps (online or offline) then very often skips the map to the North (typically from Prag to Svalbard; from America to north Canada). The skip happens when I move by map. Sometime the skip happens, when I put off my finger from display. Google maps in c:geo are OK without this problem. I have smartphone ZTE Z5mini, Androiid 4.2.2, c:geo 2015.01.20 and some older version. For more information contact me, please. Best Regards Vohary PS: edit 24.1.2015
Manager.title: During browsing OSM map skips thousands kilometres

Manager.description: Yesterday I was in a town nearby and wanted to store all traditional caches in viewport for offline. Steps: Start c:geo Open live map (which is OSM 0.3) Show as a list Filter type only showing traditional Store for offline After storing c:geo was stopped. SG3 2014-12-29-NB-c3d85fc My SG3 seemed slow to me, so maybe there was less memory. However, maybe after storing we don't return to the previous map instance? Will try it at another location with newest NB.
Manager.title: OSM - storing filtered viewport caches causes stop

Manager.description: The stored caches can be updated one-by-one or list-by-list, but not globally. It would be nice to add this action.
Manager.title: Update all caches from the list of all stored caches

Manager.description: 2015.01.25-NB (also present in 2015.01.20 as reported on support mail). Happens also in other scenarios where the cache is opened directly from map. Not sure whether it is a regression, but I think so as I never noticed it before. Search for GC5K2A1 Open the cache details Note that the cache has a spoiler pic which is correctly indicated on the description tab Open the spoiler picture, is is shown normally. It is also visible on the image tab Select Navigate - Map Click on the cache to open popup Select more details Result: The link to the spoiler pic is missing on the description tab and the picture is not shown on the image tab. Selecting "refresh" will show it again until the next test cycle (unless the cache is saved).
Manager.title: Spoiler picture link missing

Cache count missing in new restore dialog

Manager.description: I`m running the latest version 2015.01.20 but I had this problem since getting my Nexus 6 the compass is always reversed when using cgeo a temp fix I have found is open Google maps then cgeo and it seems to correct it until next time i use it
Manager.title: Compass reversed on Nexus 6

Manager.description: The SD card is not shown in the file selection of C:geo. So I can not, for example, select the location for the Off-line map. I can only access the internal SD memory. I using a Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini. Thanks for your help.
Manager.title: SD Card Problem on my Samsung Galaxy 4 Mini

Manager.description: Hello, In french, the list of caches in the filter is wrong. It's not a natural order and the type "Event Cache" (Événements in French) is at the bottom of the list. Here a screenshot:
Manager.title: Bad sort in caches filter

Manager.description: In Slovak translation of the app, there is a mistake in "Dogs allowed" attribute: "Psi povolené" should be "Psy povolené".
Manager.title: Slovak translation mistake

Manager.description: I found there was a this feature, but it disappeared from cgeo. I suggest marking them with a yellow strip.
Manager.title: Distinguish own caches from other

Manager.description: Hi, I'm using c:geo, and I'm happy with it. Thanks for your work! However, I found some bugs. Here is the first. The offline map is not rendered properly. Depending on the zoom level, some portions are not displayed. I'm using offline map downloaded from mapsforge website, suggested in c:geo's FAQ. I don't know if the problem is with the c:geo or with the map. It's up to you to check it :} This bug is also present in one of my friends phone. You can find attached a screenshot how it looks. Best regards, kukukk
Manager.title: Offline map not rendered properly

Manager.description: Sorry, It seems that it was already reported and it's fixed: #4633 Hi, When I store the caches for offline use, images from hint are not downloaded. Even if I refresh all stored caches, the images is still missing. If I refresh the cache itself, the image appears. But it is stored only temporarily. If I leave cache details, go back to the map and select the cache again and lick on "More details" the image is missing. I hope you can fix it as soon as possible, because I had some bad lucks with it, being in a zone where there was no mobile internet and the only hint was that photo. Best regards, kukukk
Manager.title: Spoiler photo from hint not downloaded for offline use

Manager.description: From support mail: Compass starts spinning around until c:geo is killed and restarted. I would interprete: It starts malfunctioning at some point during usage and is working again for some time after a restart. --- System information --- Device: XT1068 (titan_retgb, motorola) Android version: 4.4.4 Android build: KXB21.85-23 Cgeo version: 2015.01.20 Play services: present Use Play services: yes Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present --- End of system information --- @samueltardieu This is the case from support where you asked for more information.
Manager.title: Compass on MotoG (XT1068) not working

Manager.description: We should add more information to the system information which could be relevant for debugging/support and do not contain personal information. Here is my wish list: PM/BM status List of active connectors Last login result of each connector Installation status of plugins (calendar/contacts) Setting of "Hide Owned/Found" Used map strategy Language used on device Status of HW-acceleration Lineflyer: Removed one item
Manager.title: Add more system information

Manager.description: From support mail: A *.loc file of US benchmarks as selected and downloaded from Geocaching.com, with no modifications, will import fine. But then try to export, c:Geo crashes and an empty export file is created. Version 2015.01.20
Manager.title: Crash on export GPX from imported benchmark *.loc

Manager.description: From support mail: If I modify the loc file at all and save it as a gpx, adding description info using Basecamp for example, it will not import into c:geo - I see that as a separate issue that may simply not be supported by c:Geo. (But Locus does support it, and so I am asking if c:Geo would also.) Example file requested...
Manager.title: Modified GPX not imported

Manager.description: Looking at OC10CB8 only 10 logs are showing up in c:geo. The cache however has quite some more logs available.
Manager.title: Amount of logs for OC caches

Manager.description: If a search returns more than one contact with the searched alias (name of gc-user), a dialog shows all results. In this dialog only the alias is shown, so no distinction is possible. It would be nice if more information here would be shown, for example additional first name and last name or something like displayname
Manager.title: Show more information if multiple contacts found

Manager.title: Nightly build for calender plugin failing

Manager.description: Just noticed that on my new phone the primary and secondary navigation are both the compass. I'm not completely sure, but very much that I did not touch that setting yet.
Manager.title: Both navigation options are compass

Manager.description: Click one of the cache details to activate the contextual action mode. Now when swiping to the left or right the action mode remains, which can be confusing. E.g. you still can copy the selected cache detail field to the clipboard, while you are actually on the logs page.
Manager.title: Cancel action mode on page switch

Manager.description: from facebook: avoid accidentially logging December 2015, when creating December 2014 logs in January 2015.
Manager.title: Disallow future logs

Manager.description: From support mail: Currently we disallow setting WP-coords as listing coords in general if it is not supported on the gc.com webpage for that cache type. We could instead allow at least a local modification of the listing coords in that case (as we e.g. do for OC mystery caches).
Manager.title: Allow local change of listing coords for other cache types as well

Manager.description: Since empty tags have been cleaned in fa6741e, the Eclipse settings should be changed to warn about empty tags.
Manager.title: more strict javadoc checks

Manager.description: We can already create shortcuts on request from the standard widget creation of android. If our app had an additional permission then we could create home screen shortcuts to caches directly from the menu of a cache. What do you think about that?
Manager.title: Add shortcuts to caches

Manager.description: An offline log can only be deleted when in selection mode, but not directly from the context menu. Edit: This bug only happens, if there is an offline log, but the cache has already been deleted.
Manager.title: deletion of offline log not in context menu

Manager.description: As of 2015-02-10, the MapQuest geocoder started to return 403 errors. It looks like this may be a larger issue as shown in: http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open/forums/-/message_boards/message/1327001 As of 2015-02-11, the GeocoderTest.testMapQuestGeocoder test has been annotated with @Suppress. This annotation should be removed when the problem is solved, or when the MapQuest geocoder is removed from cgeo. Note that the unavailability of MapQuest does not impair the behaviour of cgeo in any way when other geocoders (Android, GC) are available.
Manager.title: MapQuest geocoder returns a 403 error

Manager.description: @Bananeweizen Looking at the code I would assume that if the cache has no hint the toast should be shown with the string="cache_hint_not_available". However if i select the hint menu on compass nothing is shown if the cache has no hint.
Manager.title: No reaction if hint is requested but cache has no hint

Manager.description: opencaching.{de,fr} is supported, but opencaching.us is not for example. They should be added to the AndroidManifest.xml and handled properly.
Manager.title: URLs for most opencaching.* sites are not recognized by cgeo

Manager.description: Hi. The 'Filter by' menu in list view is using the older large (huge) style, and so does its sub menues. Would it be possible to change that so it uses the same style as the list menu and the sort menu?
Manager.title: Filter by menu uses different style then other menues

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Hide the show as list menu in map for single cache

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Have compass menu in map of single cache

Manager.description: There is some attribute that makes texts scroll in android if they don't fit. I wonder if we should use that. Just had a cache I opened from mail and could not read the full title afterwards. This would also be possible in cache lists.
Manager.title: Scrolling title in cache details?

Manager.description: If an offline log exists, then it should be shown as the topmost log entry (independent of the date), to make the user more easily aware of that existing log. Clicking that log should lead straight to the log editor.
Manager.title: Show offline log as topmost log in logbook

Manager.description: @Bananeweizen Small addition to #4679: The shown offline log should have an orange marker in the logbook instead of the default marker for the log type posted. This would make it consistent to the list view and would draw users attention to this log.
Manager.title: "Your saved log" should have orange marker

Manager.description: This is unreproducible right now, but while caching today I realized two times, that caches I was currently dealing with suddenly got marked as "stored log" while I did not actively do this. The offline logs contained my autoinserted signature. Trying it lateron I could not reproduce it. 2015.02.15-NB Option "Log offline" activated. Did anything change which could cause that?
Manager.title: Caches marked as offline logged by theirselves

Manager.description: If I go for e.g. a multi cache I add waypoints on the waypoint tab of the cache and then use the map icon in the actionbar to open the map and get an overview of all waypoints. Now this will also show the heading line and distance overlay to the cache coords. While this is meaningful when starting the map from cache details it is not meaningful for mapping a bunch of waypoints of a cache. Couldn't we either disable it for this view or automatically set it to the latest waypoint which has coords?
Manager.title: Heading line also shown in "waypoint view"

Manager.description: While with yesterdays version (2015.02.14-NB) the actionbar on the waypoint tab of a cache contained a map icon, it now (2015.02.15-NB1) has the same structure as on the cache detail tab. I would strongly suggest to have the map icon located at first position as implemented before.
Manager.title: Actionbar content changed

Manager.description: Sometimes (unfortunately i cannot reproduce it), the text of the second waypoint is duplicated into the first for saved caches. Screenshot for GC4E28K: „Der Yogi bewacht C und D“ belongs to the second WP, Stage 1. Text for first WP (Start) is gone. This is different from #3420. The error is permanent and persists across refreshes of the saved cache. Also WP detail view shows the wrong text. Unfortunately, the error appears infrequently, and the circumstances are unclear to me. I noticed it 4-5 times during the last months, but never was annoyed enough to open an issue. Version 2015.02.16-NB, but i suspect the error occurs during saving of the cache, which was quite a long time ago now, and thus happened with an older version.
Manager.title: First Waypoint shows text of second waypoint

Manager.description: The [NUMBER] placeholder is off by one in Twitter. I suppose that results from the way the value is formed in the tag engine, which I suspect to be $count+1 because the soon to be published log is one number higher than the current found count. The Twitter backend is called after logging, when $count was already incremented, resulting in the off-by-one bug.
Manager.title: [NUMBER] off by one in Twitter backend

Manager.description: Spoiler images seem to be delivered via img.gc.com as well as imgcdn.gc.com. Our parser does not handle both.
Manager.title: spoiler images parsed wrongly

Manager.description: I'm currently working on a project to create maps from an amalgamation of data (OSM, OS, shapefiles). These are processed to generate a single OSM file which I am then processing with Osmosis and mapsforge mapfile-writer to generate .map file to be viewed on various Android apps. These maps almost always work on all the maps and apps I've tested (Atlas application on Windows and Locus/Orux/cgeo on Android). I have one map which causes a crash when I try to load it in cgeo on both my tablet and my phone. Other than looking at the log file and asking here is there any easy way to find what might be causing the problem? I've tested maybe 5 other maps (almost all covering larger areas and one much larger one which includes the area causing the fault) and they all work fine. I've uploaded 2 maps to Dropbox (https://www.dropbox.com/sh/chaxjx4oxtjs9ih/AACf9g0wNcRgCOB5n4IaMWDOa?dl=0) OS_NU_android crashes and OS_TEST_android (which is a subset of it) doesn't. I'm not used to checking log files on Android but I've managed to recover: build.board: baylake build.bootloader: unknown build.brand: asus build.cpu_abi: x86 build.cpu_abi2: armeabi-v7a build.device:
