Manager.title: Crash on a self generated map

Manager.description: Hi c:geo team, sometimes, spoilers or log photos of geocaches are not displayed in c:geo, when storing cache for offline use (or even online). Example : spoiler of http://coord.info/GC3CJ0K cgeo version 2015.01.20, android version 4.4.2 or android version 4.1.2 Other example with missing some log images : GC1PCV7 If you could something... thanks :)
Manager.title: Spoiler of GC3CJ0K cache is not displayed

Manager.description: When opening a map with a real action bar then we should move the cache numbers into a second line similar to the cache list.
Manager.title: Use second line in map title

Manager.description: Due to #4693 and #4691 we should create a new release from the release branch, rather quickly. (And afterwards we should schedule a release from master for beginning of March).
Manager.title: Create release from release branch

Manager.description: 2015.02.21-NB Not sure if this is a duplicate of a still open issue or a returning error. Today I managed to log a cache offline (I think via live map popup) and it was not showing up in the history afterwards. Looking at the cache list it had a orange maker, looking at its details it had the status "Saved log" BUT it did not have the date written behind that. I performed again Menu - Log offline - Found and afterwards the date was shown in details and it showed up in the history. Reproducing this problem failed up to now, so mainly a reminder for myself or anyone interested in trying to reproduce that. If its indeed a duplicate, feel free to close it.
Manager.title: Cache not added to history if offline logged from popup

Manager.description: 2015.02.21-NB Log a cache offline Verify it is added to the history Open the cache again and delete the offline log by Menu - Log offline - Delete (or whatever the menu is called in english) The cache keeps showing up in the history permanently (also after app restart)
Manager.title: Cache not removed from history after offline log deleted

Manager.description: I know that one can save caches for offline use and that there's a list of what I logged, but there should be a list of recently opened caches, just like it is on geocache.com profile main page. It would be very helpful for a typical usage scenario where I visit several caches but don't want to fiddle around with the smartphone for writing the log text, but log at home in peace and comfortably. And for that I'd need a view of the visited caches in the order of opening. I assume it should be quite easy to implement, there would be no need to synchronize with the geocache.com list, but only store locally in c:geo the last x caches which were opened in detail.
Manager.title: [Feature request] Add view of recently opened caches

Manager.description: Installed the new version yesterday and it won't work at all
Manager.title: new version (2015.02.23) won't open on Samsung Galaxy SII

Manager.description: 2015.02.22-NB If I am not completely wrong the TB logbook normally contains the geocache name alongside with dropped, retrieve and visit logs. However for me the TB TB4TXR0 does not show them in the logbook. Did not check if only this one or all TBs are affected. Maybe a website change or I just remember incorrect.
Manager.title: Caches not visible in TB log entries

Manager.description: 2015.02.24-NB I tried to add several found caches to my favorite using the button in the cache details. For all of them it does not work, I get the error toast. I checked and have 10 favorite points available on the site. I can not provide a log at the moment, but I fear this could be a change on the website.
Manager.title: Adding to favorites fails

Manager.description: Open a map for a stored list of caches. Enable "live" from the menu. Switch to another map provider. Live is disabled again (which can lead to no caches visible at all, if you scrolled out of the area of stored caches).
Manager.title: live state not remembered on switching map provider

Manager.description: We are already have a mechanism which will sort lists containing only events by date automatically instead of by distance. I was wondering if we could similarly detect that all caches have a common prefix (i.e. belong to a series) and in that case sort by name by default. Does anyone see a problem with that? If not, I may try implementing this.
Manager.title: Sort by name automatically

Manager.description: Seems we have new strings which need translation. It would be good if someone can upload strings from master to Crowdin.
Manager.title: Upload new strings to Crowdin

Manager.description: Hold your finger on any button in action bar and the tooltip appears with wrong size. On other screens, the tooltip seems ok.
Manager.title: ActionBar tooltip bubbles on main screen have wrong size

Manager.description: As there is currently no way to undo the ignore action from within c:geo I think it would be wise to show a confirmation dialog explaining the meaning of that function, how it can be undone and let the user confirm the action.
Manager.title: Ignore cache should have a confirmation

Manager.description: As far as I could see there i no UI indication after ignore cache has been selected whether the action was succesful or not. Nothing can be seen in the UI after selecting that menu item.
Manager.title: Ignore cache should provide result

Manager.description: 2015.02.23: Open GC5NBMH Swipe to the waypoints Waypoint "Cafe Times" shows a block instead of the smilie.
Manager.title: Smilies in waypoint description shown incorrect

Manager.description: We still have two mapsforge libraries in our code. I'd like to remove the 0.24 version. We introduced that to enable people to use their 0.24 maps instead of just showing an error, because our 0.3 library cannot load them. That was 2.8 years ago, and people should have new maps by now. Any good reason not to remove the 0.24 support?
Manager.title: Remove mapsforge 0.24

Manager.description: Hello Team, i have a question about a Mystery and the Personal Cache Note. If i have saved the final Coordinates in the mystery cache (online Gecaching) and i save the cache offline i must ever open before i can see the final waypoint on the map. Why i have to open it again, because if i have now internet the waypoint isn't avaiable in my case. What is the reason? You can answer in germany ;-) DramyFB
Manager.title: Mystery Personal Cache Note

Manager.description: When running the map with a single cache we can use the subtitle for additional information like d and t.
Manager.title: For single map cache show T/D in subtitle

Manager.description: I'm more and more stumbling over an issue: I want to use Android libraries in cgeo, which can only be consumed as source or via gradle. Using Eclipse I therefore must go with the source option for now (this is also nice because often we need tiny fixes in the library). Instead of copying the library verbatim, can git submodules be used to actually just refer to their github repo? From the description of it in the git documentation, it sounds fitting very well Example: The showview library currently exists as verbatim copy in our repo, so we will probably not update it. If it were a submodule, this would be easy to do. @samueltardieu You probably have the most experience there. I'm rather sure we discussed this or a related submodule question already, but I can't find this anymore.
Manager.title: Consuming libraries as submodules?

Manager.description: 2015.03.02-NB-b6ed572 Set global filter to "Event cache" Search for Adress "Prag" On the result page click on "Load more caches" Result: 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 [main] UncaughtException 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 java.lang.NullPointerException 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at cgeo.geocaching.CacheListActivity.onCreateLoader(CacheListActivity.java:1620) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.support.v4.app.LoaderManagerImpl.createLoader(LoaderManager.java:490) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.support.v4.app.LoaderManagerImpl.createAndInstallLoader(LoaderManager.java:499) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.support.v4.app.LoaderManagerImpl.restartLoader(LoaderManager.java:646) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at cgeo.geocaching.CacheListActivity$MoreCachesListener.onClick(CacheListActivity.java:1295) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:4633) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:19330) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:733) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:157) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5356) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1265) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1081) 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: NPE on nearby search

Manager.description: If I am not wrong, the legacy version still has the problem described in #4691. We should either fix it and release it or decide to drop legacy. Opinions?
Manager.title: Apply latest fix also to cgeo-legacy or abandon it

Manager.description: I wonder If you experience the same 2015.03.06.-NB using OSM:Offline map Open list of saved caches Open a saved cache Select Navigate -> Map Press back to return to cache details Select Navigate -> Map Result: c:geo freezes I am not using two instances of the map in this case, am I?
Manager.title: Reproducible ANR with OSM:Offline map

Manager.description: When opening a map, it gets an initial title which does not change afterwards. But several options menus make the map behave totally different. Therefore on activating the "live" option, the map should call itself "life map" on disabling the "live" option, the map should call itself "map". This is most confusing when the map was started from a list, where it (correctly) takes the list title initiallly.
Manager.title: Map title should more accurately reflect what is visible

Manager.description: Open a contact from a logbook, which is multiple times in your contacts list. Cancel the selection of the right contact. The phone now behaves like not reacting anymore. Actually, an acitivty is open, without any displayed contents.
Manager.title: Phone seems halted after canceling multiple contacts selection

Manager.description: When selecting a cache from the search bar of the main activity, the the search field should be deactivated and the keyboard should go away. Otherwise users may be very confused when returning from the cache and finding the keyboard opening suddenly.
Manager.title: Search bar should close on selection

Manager.description: 2015.03.07-NB On maps other than the live map (map for a list, single cache map with activated live) I had problems to day to hide found/owned caches if I toggle that setting directly from the map. Need to look deeper into this to provide more details. On the live map it seemed to be OK.
Manager.title: Hiding out found/own cache no longer reliably working

Manager.description: @samueltardieu added the ability to view and open embedded images under the "Images" tab after my posted issue #3661 Really great and useful! But far from all caches shows the image under the "Images" tab. These does include the image: http://coord.info/GC5NHA1 http://coord.info/GC4TZMH These does not include the image: http://coord.info/GC1EH4K http://coord.info/GC5NV7Q I suspect it has something to do with the file size of the image. That it does not show images below a certain file size to filter out language flags, smileys and other "unwanted" images. If I'm right that filter should be removed so that all images are shown. Or the file size threshold should at least be lowered.
Manager.title: Embedded images in short description not shown in image tab

Manager.description: In #4290 we discussed that the current name is quite irritating. I suggest to rename that main menu to "Coordinates" for the time we have it, as this is exactly what is behind that menu...you can enter coordinates. Opinions? Remark: If that is OK, some could do the favor to replace it by the already existing string search_coordinates as it would not require new translations then.
Manager.title: Rename "Any destination" to "Coordinates"

Manager.description: The new advanced search just went live. some functions seem broken by this.
Manager.title: Search function broken

Manager.description: @rsudev suggested to also apply the fix for #4730 to legacy and release a new version.
Manager.title: Fix #4730 on legacy branch

Manager.description: Suddenly any destination does not take input coords when DONE pressed. This happens on my phone and tablet. Was OK last week. The coords input get changed when press done
Manager.title: Any destination wont take correct input

Manager.description: I can't use filter to searched results it always return me to saved cache instead of search results. Steps to reproduce: Open c:geo Click search Type ex. Warszawa in address Display results Use filter Result: Filtered stored cache not searched cache --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.16-NB-bab02fe Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (Disabled by default: no) geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Basic Member System language: pl_PL Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---
Manager.title: Search result filter

Manager.description: On support mail we have two users reporting issues: Logbook is completely missing Dates in logbook are wrong I am on the way to collect system information and the date format those people are using on the website. Do we know, if e.g. during the site change they might have changed or added new date formats?
Manager.title: Missing lobook or wrong dates in logbook

Manager.description: I have made missing final qualifiers in parameters, fields and local variables a fatal error in IntelliJ IDEA. Some Eclipse user should do the same there. Best done in the release branch, then merged into master.
Manager.title: Eclipse: make missing `final` a fatal error for cgeo sources

Manager.description: Please include the shortlink icon of the map into the preview window of a cache.
Manager.title: mapshortlinkicon in cachepreview

Manager.description: 2015.03.17-RC: A user on FB reported that loading his owned caches using the "Show owned caches" function in the search menu does return nothing. I can not reproduce this but asked for more details about what is showing up and the step-by-step.
Manager.title: Search owned caches does not work

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC on 2015.02.11: Proposal: http://thenounproject.com/term/new-idea/104277/
Manager.title: Add menu icon for showing hint in compass/cache map

Manager.description: Sitting in HMC in Vietnam. Home coordinates in Germany. Searching for keyword Metzger. In the result list some views are missing. Switching to other apps and back adds some of the missing views. Rebooted phone and still the same. Source of March 9.
Manager.title: Views not displayed

Manager.description: Looks I got some problems to get the data dir (.geo) to my external sd card on a Xperia Z2 (Android 4.4.4). Wen choosing this option the dir is set to /storage/emulated/0, which is the internal storage. The external is located on /storage/sdcard1. This is almost the problem described in faqs (http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_67) Possible this dialog/feature would be working on more phones if the user could choose the directory like for external maps.
Manager.title: Data on external SD

Manager.description: 2015.03.25-NB: After the recent changes we once again miss the coordinates on the nearby search results. So most likeley something changed in the LOC download.
Manager.title: No coords in Nearby search for PM

Manager.description: From support: Since website change the menu "Pocket Queries" is no longer available. I suspect this is caused by #4763, still I open a dedicated issue to track if this problem is also solved after solving #4763.
Manager.title: Pocket Query menu no longer available

Manager.description: The Personal notes upload button has disappeared. Could be linked with the geocaching.com website update of 25th March 2015 --- System information --- Device: SM-G900F (kltexx, samsung) Android version: 5.0 Android build: LRX21T.G900FXXU1BOC7 Cgeo version: 2015.03.12 Play services: present Use Play services: yes Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present --- End of system information ---
Manager.title: Personal note upload has disappeared

Manager.description: On my Xperia M2 - KitKat the compass is fixed, it don't move at all, only the distance is updated
Manager.title: Compass problem on Xperia M2

Manager.description: According to my history view on Crowdin the strings for the new showcase have been present but have been deleted this morning by an additional upload to Crowdin. Can someone crosscheck what happend here? If this has been clarified I would send out another mail to the translators asking for help.
Manager.title: Strings missing on Crowdin

Manager.description: ...to get the tests green again.
Manager.title: Mocked test data needs ro be refreshed

Manager.description: Future request: Please add support for select part of text in cache desc and strip html tags while copying.
Manager.title: Copy selected text
Showcase in compass is missing the circle

Manager.description: Shall we apply the adaptions for the gc.com change to legacy or depublish it? I can't estimate the effort....so others have to judge this.
Manager.title: Adapt legacy or abandon it

Manager.description: I am at my parent's place. "nearby caches" lists 19 caches. One of them is a solved mystery that is saved in a list and has a changed "final" waypoint. When i press the "map" icon in the "nearby" list, the subtitle changes to "1 cache" instead of "19 caches" and the map view only shows 2 waypoints, the original and the newly set of that stored solved mystery. Then i saved another cache from the nearby-list, and now map view shows this 2 caches. Happened with NB 2015-03-19, still present in 2015-03-28.
Manager.title: Map view of "nearby caches" only shows only saved caches

Manager.description: From support: Ever since this new update 3/28/15, when I push navigate, there is a thick irritating stright red line from my present position aiming at and all the way to the geocache where I want to go. I do not want it there! It is distracting and gets in the way of reading Street names and other things. How can I make it go away? I looked at settings and do not know how to disengage it. Maybe it is a Google map thing and has nothing to do with c:geo. Any helpful advice is welcomed.
Manager.title: Make heading line optional

Manager.description: Currently the user enters his login and password and additionally has to select "Retrieve API key". This could be redesigned to make it look likt e.g. the authorization to Opencaching sites. Just enter a username and password and select "Authorize" to complete it. Not yet sure however about how this thing works.
Manager.title: Geokrety login UI should be easier

Manager.description: With 2015.03.28-NB1 (incl. Geokrety PR) I see the following problem: Each cache does only list one TB in the inventory list independently if GK connector is active or not. For example: GC3TCGP contains 2 TBs (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB shown in inventory Another example (with mixed TB/GK): GC3FJ5F contains 2 TB and 1 GK (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB and one GK shown in inventory It seems that now only 1 TB is shown
Manager.title: Wrong GC TB inventory

Manager.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Open OC10E19 Save it for offline use In the list of caches 7 TBs are shown Open the cache Look at the inventory --> 6 GKs are listed for this cache.
Manager.title: TB count in list wrong for OC with GK

Manager.description: From support: User long tapped on the geocache name. This should result in a headline being shown with "Name" and the Copy,Done and share buttons. However for him it looks like this: Note that "Name" is not shown and "Translate to %s" is shown. If the user tries to copy the clipboard content is empty. System information: --- System information --- Device: Nexus 7 (nakasi, google) Android version: 5.1 Android build: LMY47D Cgeo version: 2015.03.28 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (default state) geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Premium System language: en_US (cgeo forced to English) Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---
Manager.title: Copy functions not working on Nexus 7

Manager.description: 2015.03.29-NB: Open the logging page for a geokret The time selector defaults to 12hour format (AM/PM) although my local setting should be 24hour format
Manager.title: Time selector for GK logs does not respect locale settings

Manager.description: 2015.04.29-NB: Open GKC240 Start logging Enter a wrong tracking code Send the log A toast is shown [No such Geokret!] which is not contained in strings.xml
Manager.title: String not localized

Manager.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Enter GKC240 in the search field on main screen Start logging the GK Select "Visit" Click on the coordinate field Click on "My coordinates" in the coordinate window Error toast: "c:geo could not retrieve the current location" although GPS is active and fixed.
Manager.title: Own coordinates not retrievable for Gk visit log

Manager.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Open GKC240 Start logging All fields have a preset indicating their meaning (e.g. "Geocode", "Log-Text") however the coordinate field is empty, so it's meaning is unclear unless you click on it.
Manager.title: Coordinate field in GK logging has no preset

Manager.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Open GKC240 Start logging Select log type "Visit" Enter valid coordinates, tracking code and log text Try to send the log Error toast: Geocode missing... Comparing to the geokrety.org website it should be possible to post a visit log just with coordinates without the need for a geocode.
Manager.title: GK visit should be possible without geocode

Manager.description: Reported on Support with 2015.03.29-NB: Trying to discover a TB When sending the log there is an error message "Logging from c:geo cannot be anonymous...". I guess the user did not even touch the GK-settings and his action does not involve GKs. Will try to reproduce later.
Manager.title: Problems logging TB with newest NBs

Manager.description: In the context of ̀LogTrackableActivity, the text "Loading Log Page…" doesn't fit well. I've got the message displayed when trying to log a TB while not connected to the GC service. Something like "Logging is not possible…" would fit better in the context. This string is also used in LogCacheActivity. I propose to: Create a new string for the LogCacheActivity, saying "Loading Log Page…" Change the text to "Logging is not possible…" for the LogTrackableActivity (which fit better to the string name)
Manager.title: String for "log_post_not_possible" is weird

Manager.description: I like the new design of the edit waypoint activity. But I think some users may be confused if waypoints change, when using back (or up navigation). We should show a toast about the change, if the activity is not left using the explicit okay or cancel buttons.
Manager.title: Toast when saving on back

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC, should we activate GK lookup feature by default ? "Question: Would it be better to switch "Geokrety" off by default to avoid a state where requests are done but no login is stored avoid additional network requests which the user might not want to have? [...]" "Looking at the fact that a huge percentage of users are in US (Where geokrets might be not so well known/used)..." "speaking of the traffic: Typical weekend case is 15k up to 20k of users online." "lookup of geokreties will work without that [feature] being active"
Manager.title: Should GK lookup be active by default?

Manager.description: When not actually viewing a geocache but simply selecting coordinates from the history list in the goto destination (bottom middle icon on cgeo home screen) you still have the new hint option at the top of the screen (even though there obviously isn't a hint) selecting this crashes cgeo - unfortauntely c:geo has stopped
Manager.title: Crash using new Hint Option on go to coordinates

Manager.description: I cannot open any cache containing a Travelbug or Geocoin except if it is stored offline. I just get a error message saying "c:geo can't find that geocache" If I open an offline Geocache that has TBs, I cannot view the Trackables Tab or Update the cache. Examples of caches that are affected: http://coord.info/GC500Q5 http://coord.info/GC25QD6 http://coord.info/GC422Q5 Using version 2015.03.30-NB-052sc9a on a Nexus 5
Manager.title: Geocache with Trackables can not be loaded or updated

Manager.description: 2015.03.30-NB: Enable Geokrety and cached loading from geokretymap.org Open GKC240 The trackable description is shown as Bitte ignorieren. which is truncated. The xml result of geokretymap.org contains the complete description:
Manager.title: GK description truncated (geokretymap.org)

Manager.description: Looking at the debug logs I saved yesterday (2015.03.29-NB) I have now seen requests like this http://www.geocaching.com/track/details.aspx?tracker=GKA301 in the c:geo log in parallel to the correct request to geokrety.org. Today 2015.03.30-NB1 I cannot reproduce this anymore. @kumy Was that solved by recent changes or an unreproducible behaviour?
Manager.title: GK requests to GC

Manager.description: Login failed on main screen but all feature working fine. In settings login shows up as OK Strange behavior, but all is working so bug is not important 😉 --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.31-NB-d137393 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (default state) geocaching.com: not logged in (Login failed) System language: pl_PL (cgeo forced to English) Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---
Manager.title: Login failed on main screen

Manager.description: I suggest that we create a very small test suite of existing or new tests, which are only related to the parsing of the website. This test suite can then be scheduled to run every 30 minutes in a new job on Jenkins. That way we would get a much better overview of the times where the website is down or has changed the output again. So we can eventually react even more timely than now.
Manager.title: Parser only tests in cron job

Manager.description: When looking at the website www.geokrety.org I do see, that the names are used like: GeoKret for one of the trackables GeoKretyfor the service itself The current strings do not always follow that: We are mostly missing the capital letter K I am not sure if we refer to a GeoKret when speaking of a GK trackable. AFAIR I did see something like Geokrety not found or similar. This is not really important but still a thing which should be made consistent before the feature is release and before too much translations have been returned (which need to be translated again). @kumy: Can you provide a PR making this consistent? You probably know GK best and for what purpose the separate strings are used.
Manager.title: Consistent naming of GeoKret/GeoKrety

Manager.description: Using cgeo on both the Lenovo A8-50 and Yoga 10 tablets is not possible. Get a line of cache icons and a messed up map. Seems to be a continuation of a previously flagged problem. Any idea how to fix it (either at user end or software update)? Thanks
Manager.title: Lenovo map problem

Manager.description: GK provide the information with the /export.php API (the script is announced as "slow and large volume of data") GKM /export-details.php provide the missing status in standard. We may render the status as: strikethrough the trackable name in the cache inventory list activity. Name could also be strikethrough on the Trackable detail activity
Manager.title: `Missing` status for GK should be represented

Manager.description: Analysis by IntelliJ IDEA shows that the excludeMine parameter in SearchResult#filterSearchResults is always false. This is likely a bug. If this is not, the parameter can be removed and the code can be simplified.
Manager.title: excludeMine parameter is always false

Manager.description: It appears that Twitter.postTweet gets always called with a coords parameter as null (no coordinates posted with the tweet). This is likely to be consistent with our privacy policy and our recently obtained ratings on Google Play Store. If there are no objections, I propose to keep the situation as-is and remove the useless coords parameter rather than implement the location-aware Twitter posting.
Manager.title: Tweet does not contain coordinates

Manager.description: From Google Play with version 2015.03.28 (not sure if maybe 6165ec4 fixed that already) User comment: the new hint feature shuts down the app before I can go from the compass the the map Stack trace: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.CompassActivity.onOptionsItemSelected(CompassActivity.java:217) at android.app.Activity.onMenuItemSelected(Activity.java:2250) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity.onMenuItemSelected(FragmentActivity.java:372) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity.superOnMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivity.java:244) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.java:352) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivity.java:130) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.java:357) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.dispatchMenuItemSelected(MenuBuilder.java:777) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuItemImpl.invoke(MenuItemImpl.java:158) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.performItemAction(MenuBuilder.java:922) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuView.invokeItem(ActionMenuView.java:544) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuItemView.onClick(ActionMenuItemView.java:105) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:2532) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:9277) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:143) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4196) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:839) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:597) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

Manager.description: Reminder for myself to create a FAQ entry describing the problem, refering to issue #4097 and the download-link for a nonjit nightly. I will do this on old and new FAQ.
Manager.title: Create FAQ entry for #4097 (MediaTek - NONJIT)

Manager.description: GeoKrety.org provides SSL support, but they're certificate is self signed.. :/ Should I try to 'auto-accept' the "bad" certificate, or continue to not use SSL? GeKretyMap.org provides SSL, but our current Network library doesn't support SNI (#4991). Note: Already discussed on #4778 To sum up. @rsudev: I would definitely vote for trying to use SSL, because even with a self-signed certificate we get encryption. @samueltardieu: only if it doesn't make us accept any certificate, because we check the certificate for a number of sites already (extremcaching.com, geocaching.com, open.mapquestapi.com) and I would not want to allow MITM for those. GeoKrety.org GeoKretyMap.org
Manager.title: Support SSL for GK connection when possible.

Manager.description: The absence of any active connector shows in the system information by not showing anything. It should be more explicit and says that no connector has been enabled.
Manager.title: Be more explicit in system information when no connectors are active

Manager.description: Since the website changes, the app crashes each time I try to load an event cache. This happens through pocket queries and also via email notification links.
Manager.title: c:geo crashes when loading an event following update

Manager.description: From support mail and confirmed by a test with 2015.03.30-NB: Open a cache Select Navigate -> Sygic Sygic will open but no navigation action is started According to users info it was working before and stopped with the recent feature release 2015.03.28.
Manager.title: Navigation with Sygic no longer working

Manager.description: When sending a log there should be a confirmation if another log with the same text exists for the cache. I just posted a duplicate log, where my other log existed locally.
Manager.title: Warn when sending log and same log text exists

Manager.description: Just installed a new emulator. In the cache list menu I see "Export: %1$s" as last item.
Manager.title: Bad menu item label

Manager.description: 2015.04.03-NB Open any GC trackable (for me it was a TB listed in a cache and I opened it from the inventory) Select log type NOTE Enter log text Try to send the log Result: Toast is displayed, that the tracking code is missing. It seems the tracking code is needed for GKs but it is not needed for GC TB (and was working without before implmentation of GK support)
Manager.title: Write note for GC trackable no longer possible without tracking code

Manager.description: Hi, Steps to reproduce: open stored caches list apply a filter (in my case Status > With trackable) open a cache to display the cache details when going back from cache details to the list of caches ... the filter is gone (ie all caches are displayed). It seems to be a regression link to the introduction of the new "categorized filters". best regards,
Manager.title: Filter lost after opening cache details

Manager.description: It is possible to paste coords to wayponts. See #3799 But there is no way afaik to copy cords FROM waypoints. I find a need for this very often when I want to share coordinates with friends on the fly. One possible implementation of this might be to add a "Copy coords" option to the long-press menu of a waypoint. Another would be a "Share coords" option that presents a list of possible Share providers like on the Share Cache option.
Manager.title: Copy coords from waypoints

Manager.description: It would be cool to have a button to refresh a displayed trackable in the TrackableActivity.
Manager.title: TrackableActivity has not refresh button

Manager.description: Delete a cache from the details screen. Afterwards go back to the list. It is still there. Did someone modify the notifychanged code?
Manager.title: List not updated after deletion

Manager.description: From facebook: I like c:geo a lot, but why does it (usually temporarily) count a NM log or a note as a find? Hi. It's strange, it's only a short term thing, but it increases the number of finds on the front page by one. It usually rectifies after logging out and in a couple of times. It obviously doesn't register on the gc.com site, as the count remains correct on there. Thanks for a great app though, and thanks for looking at a very minor niggle! Actually, we increase the find count on logging, independent of the type of the actual log. See GCParser 1176.
Manager.title: wrong find count when logging something else than found

Manager.description: 2015.04.04-NB Live map active Put phone on standby Switch phone on again After a few seconds the GPS is fixed and my position and the uncertainty circle shows up again, but it is sometimes up to approx. 50-100 meter wrong...far outside the shown uncertainty. After about 7-10 seconds it suddenly jumps to the correct position. Google services active Energy saving off I described this already some months ago...have to look also for the old issue to get a clue. Not clearly reproducible.
Manager.title: Position jump on live map

Manager.description: Figured out the user error, ugh, simple one
Manager.title: Ignore post - Can I delete this?

Manager.description: @mucek4 Can you please remove the APK from the server and instead set the target for this hyperlink to https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/releases/latest ? We get quite some mails argueing about the outdated version on our homepage.
Manager.title: Remove APK download from (old/current) website

Manager.description: 2015.04.07-NB: Have TBs and GKs in your inventory Activate "AutoVisit" in Settings - Logging Open a saved cache Select "Log visit" On the logging view sometimes the GKs are set to No Action instead of Visit This seems to depend on the time needed to load the inventory from GK. I have seen that sometimes the AutoVisit also works for GKs, it seems to fail only if the answer from GK is coming in quite late.
Manager.title: "Auto visit" not always working for GKs

Manager.description: I attended an opencaching event today and presented the upcoming GK feature. While the feature is considered as really great from the audience some of them suggested to have a better logging view. Due to the fact, that there is a new field for the time in the first row, the log type field became rather small, so that only a few letters are visisble. The proposal was to somehow rearrange the view to give more room for the log type. I currently do not have any great idea how this could look like. Maybe we can move the date and time to a separate row below the log type?
Manager.title: Log type field to small when logging a GK

Manager.description: I attended an opencaching event today and presented the upcoming GK feature. Users have been wondering why we show the "Unknown" in the owner field of a GK. AFAIK we don't get the information via the API, but "Unknown" was misunderstood by users. Can't we just ommit the field completely as long as this function is not implemented?
Manager.title: Do not show GK owner as "Unknown" when no information is present

Manager.description: I attended an opencaching event today and presented the upcoming GK feature. A big challenge for many users was, that they did not know what to do when they tried to log a GK for the first time and ended up in the info window telling that anonymous logging is not possible. Instead of having just OK as an option we should have a second button to open the geokrety settings directly in that info window. Furthermore we should slightly adapt the text not only to say "Please register" but "Please register or login with your existing account from geokrety.org".
Manager.title: Direct users to settings if they try to log a GK without login

Manager.description: The "visual compass state" added in 4723c5a should help the user distinguish between "compass mode" and "GPS only mode". At this stage, the design is very basic, and the strings that have been reused (@string/attribute_compass_yes and @string/attribute_compass_no) are not appropriate and are ambiguous in some languages. The design should be improved if needed, and new strings should be defined and used.
Manager.title: Improve design of compass button

Manager.description: After activating opencaching.com in Menu - Settings - Services - opencaching.com(GARMIN) it is still not listed in the system information under About c:geo - System.
Manager.title: Opencaching.com not listed in system information

Manager.description: The icon for TB in the CacheDetailsActivity inventory is the default one. It should be identical to the one shown when logging a cache.
Manager.title: TravelBug doesn't have good icon in CacheDetailsActivity inventory

Manager.description: I've downgraded again after using support lib v21 for a short test. We are hit by this directly on start of the app: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=81215 I have no idea what that is related to, so I didn't see any way to fix this. If someone is more friends with the theme stuff, maybe you can find a workaround.
Manager.title: error when using support library v21

Manager.description: I open a new issue instead of commenting on the closed issue #4725. Is this the right way to do it? I think that the fix by @Bananeweizen did only solve half of the problem though. The behavior is still illogical when trying to deselect the search bar by pressing the back key. When you first press the search bar, the last shown caches are shown in the dropdown and the keyboard is shown, allowing you to enter a search query. When you select a cache from the list the search bar gets deselected in the correct way. Showing the default controls in the action bar next time you come back to the home page. Perfect! But when you press the back button instead, the first state is like the below screenshot, This step is unnecessary since you cannot enter anything in the search field anyway when the keyboard is hidden When you press the back button a second time this action bar is shown: ...instead of the default action bar setup below that should be shown instead: So my suggestion is that you should only have to press the back button once to deselect the search field.
Manager.title: Search bar should close properly on back key (Android 5.0+)

Manager.description: Looking at 4723c5a wrong strings seem to be used for the new button. We misuse the stings attribute_compass_yes and attribute_compass_nowhich are intended for the text form of cache attributes. I just changed them to match the new function not recognizing, that they are used also in other places. I will revert that commit in a minute. We should either use the original strings use_gps and use_compass or create new strings for this button.
Manager.title: Wrong strings used in new magnetic compass button

Manager.description: Of course this feature request was mentioned by OC-users looking at the new Geokret functionality: The logbook of GK trackables should be loaded as well (like for GC trackables). I don't know whether the API supports that currently, so I just want to file that as a Feature Request here.
Manager.title: Show logbook of GK trackable

Manager.description: as it has been done recently in 944f4e5 for the CacheDetailActivity. See #4575
Manager.title: GPS off mode should be tied to "Use Low power" in TB activity

Manager.description: This seems to be supported with the OKAPI and should be implemented identically to the gc.com feature: http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/caches/save_personal_notes.html
Manager.title: Allow upload of personal note to OC server

Manager.description: Recently the disabling of GPS in some views was modified to be applied only in "Low power mode" to allow users to keep a GPS fix as long as c:geo is running (as it might take some time depending on the device to re-fix GPS). Still quite some users ask for keeping the GPS also if: Screen is locked c:geo is active in the background So this is feature request (I checked but did not find a matching issue) to "keep the GPS-lights on while c:geo is started" as an additional option in the System settings.
Manager.title: Optionally keep GPS always on

Manager.description: It would be great to attach data e.g. images to a cachelistings in c:geo. Locus owns this feature already and I think c:geo needs it too.
Manager.title: attachments (e.g. images) for caches

Manager.description: contrary to the change from #4243 the map trail is still on by default. This is because our default values come from the XML file, not from the default values we pass into the getters.
Manager.title: trail is on by default

Manager.description: I've submitted 'Disable listing' log of my cache and counter has been increased (geocaching.com) After closing the app (completely) and reopening and logging in - the counter has been updated to original value. I presume not only 'Disable' is affected.
Manager.title: Counter of found caches increased after 'Disable listing' log

Manager.description: I found some more external tools for code coverage and dependency analysis when reading the checkstyle readme: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle This is just a reminder to check them.
Manager.title: Check coveralls and versioneye

Manager.description: Somehow linked to #4684 but another scenario which I consider a bug: 2015.03.31: Open cache details of a saved cache with waypoint Open waypoint tab Start compass for a waypoint Use title bar map icon to switch to the map Result: Heading line is targeting to the cache coordinates but not to the waypoint previously selected for Navigation
Manager.title: Heading line has wrong target when started from compass

Manager.description: I downloaded an OSM map using rmaps with sqlitedb format but cgeo can't see it when I follow below guidance. Menu - Settings - Map and select the section "Directory with offline maps". I can find the folder no problem but it appears empty when it's not. Thanks Pete
Manager.title: Can't see my offline map on sdcard

Manager.description: I suggest that we remove the trail feature due to severe limitations: It doesn't work correctly, if the screen is off. It has a restricted buffer size (so it cannot track multiple hours). It looses the trail when reopening the map. There are many more explicit tracking apps. E.g. I have Endomondo tracking my geocaching walkings through the forest. 👍 1 👎 7
Manager.title: Remove trail feature

Manager.description: I have keepassdroid and c:geo installed in my android phone. When I try to open .kdbx (keepass password file), it is taken to c:geo and tried to be imported as waypoint-file (import GPX to list). There are no defaults set for c:geo so I don't find any way around this.
Manager.title: c:geo tries to import .kdbx-file

Manager.description: While "playing" and testing RX stuff for #4802, I got a feeling that Trackables Connectors may/should be converted to RX. Is this a good idea? Am I still understanding the RX stuff wrong way? As an exercise, I started to do that... Not yet finished...
Manager.title: Convert loading Generic Trackables to RX style?

Manager.description: 2015.04.16-NB We had such an issue on support mail (or even here as an issue) but I was not able to reproduce or find a hint in our code: This morning at approx. 06:30am CEST I logged two TB (retrieve log) I am quite sure that the log date shown in c:geo was 17.04. (which would be correct) but I did not explicitly verify it , at least I did not change it manually Looking this evening at the website I see that those logs have the date 16.04. (e.g. http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?LUID=58d79e3f-56d5-4595-bbbe-326b8add5390) The time zone settings of my device (Galaxy S4, Android 5.0.1) is set to factory value, i.e. derive from mobile network. Checking the world clock app it confirms the timezone used as GMT+2 (which is correct). Can someone check if we send the log with just the absolute date or do we try to transmit a time and time zone info as well?
Manager.title: TB log has wrong date on website

Manager.description: Does c:geo support receiving outside intents with coordinates as extras, to start a new waypoint / open the compass with those coordinates? I'm very new to the android programming scene and due to lack of experience cant yet grasp your source code just by looking at it. I'm working on an application that has an option to share coordinates and i would love to give the users an option to open them on c:geo. If this is possible, i hope you can point me to the right intent + class name.
Manager.title: Starting c:geo from another application

Manager.description: I use c:geo for offline caching, but lately I've been having an issue where any field notes it exports are blank. At first I thought it was an error in uploading to geocaching.com, but I checked the field notes folder on my HTC's drive, and all the recent ones are blank. At the moment I am just logging my caches offline, then going into history and exporting them. This has been working perfectly for several months, but on my last holiday it stopped and I have had to log everything manually, which has been a huge hassle. Is this a bug, or do I need to be doing something different?
Manager.title: C:geo always exporting blank field notes

Manager.title: huge empty space on devices without compass

Manager.description: 2015.04.18-NB ...if gc code is in small letters e.g. http://coord.info/gc77
Manager.title: cgeo not offered for opening coord.info links

Manager.description: People should be able to export a single cache to gpx from the cache activity.
Manager.title: Have export menu in cache activity

Manager.description: If I make offline logs during a geocacheing session, I can't see them in c:geo. Only on the map, when i scroll to the position of the cache, the cache with the red smiley is shown. I think it would be usefull, if a cache is logged offline, that the cache will automatically saved on the default list or on a list like 'offline logs'.
Manager.title: Can't see offline logs / offline logs only on the map visible

Manager.description: open few caches in Livemap goto "store offline" and select/create a container --> now the caches are starting to get downloaded Here it becomes highly unstable, many actions one does with the process stops: turn phone, move to a different app etc . few of the situations should be handled but not all
Manager.title: Store from live map - highly unstable

Manager.description: GeoKretyMap has been moved to a new server. Api has been reworked a bit, and a dedicated subdomain has been set. c:geo should now use the the url. from: geokretymap.org to: api.geokretymap.org BTW, all scripts and configurations are now published. However, still lot of work and documentation to do... https://github.com/GeoKretyMap
Manager.title: Use the new api url for GKM

Manager.description: The actual implementation of the NextPageGeocacheListLoader doesn't use parallelCombineActive. In case of multiple connectors supporting loading next page calls will be parallelized. (However, as of today we only have GC connetor supporting this). This will be necessary for #4802. The "load more cache" function should call parallelCombineActive, as retrieving Generic Trackable will be hooked there.
Manager.title: NextPageGeocacheListLoader doesn't use parallelCombineActive

Manager.description: With the coming of generic trackables, having the inventory stored as a simple list in the cache object start to be limited... Problems: Grouping trackables from different sources Merge GK from OC connectors and GK connector (duplicates) Using a HashMap may be an idea...
Manager.title: Cache inventory should be smarter ;)

Manager.description: In the current version of c:geo it is only possible to move a cache from one list to another. It would be nice to have a feature to copy them too. Often you want to hold one cache on more than one list. An example case, where it is useful to keep one cache on multiple lists could be: Caches in my Hometown Caches, that I want to find today Caches that I have not found and plan to retry in the future Caches that I have found Another annoying thing is, that when I import a GPX file into one list it removes caches with the same IDs from other lists.
Manager.title: keep one cache on multiple list

Manager.description: I would be glad if CGEO support the Message Center on geocaching.com. The app could check for new messages when you get anything downloaded from geocaching.com. Since the number of new messages is a part of every page. 👍 1
Manager.title: Geocaching.com Messagecenter Support (Feature Request)

Manager.description: The GPS coordinates in the details pages is note good. In the description is the right one but when you try to navigate or look on google map, with the GPS coordinates you had locked, it's wrong. This problem happened in the geocaching place made by Braconne Charente in the web site https://www.geocaching.com/ Can you fixe it? Thank you
Manager.title: Problem GPS Coordinates

Manager.description: At least some tests about Trackables in caches should be added. Take care of: cgeo/main/src/cgeo/geocaching/connector/oc/OkapiClient.java Line 438 in f7e3196 cache.mergeInventory(parseTrackables((ArrayNode) response.path(CACHE_TRACKABLES)));
Manager.title: Some unit test on OkapiClient are missing

Manager.description: @mucek4 Could you please install API 22 on the CI? We need this to restore the nightly builds.
Manager.title: API 22 on the CI

Manager.description: For some months, c:geo sometimes crashes when displaying the geocache details page. Unfortunately, this bug is not reproducible (can't trigger it directly) but still happens quite often during normal use. I'm running Android 4.4.4 (Samsung S3 LTE, not rooted) with recent releases of c:geo (from Google Play store). I've send a couple of those automated bug reports (usually like "crash while viewing cache details"), but today's crash (5.5.2015) starts with the (hopefully unique) label "AMK4711A", just in case you want to debug this specific crash. There are two ways the crash happens. (1) When I'm on the map screen (OpenAndroMaps locally stored) and touch a geocache icon (traditional, geocaching.com), a small overlay window opens. There I can touch "More details" to launch the geocache details page. And this is when the crashes happen. (2) When I'm editing the "Personal note" of a geocache and touch "OK" to return to the geocache details page, then c:geo also is likely to crash. It doesn't matter if GPS, WLAN or Mobile networks (or any combination of it) is switched on or off. There's plenty of memory and disk space available (usually, c:geo is the only app actively running). Rebooting the phone doesn't change anything. The only common thing of all the crashes is that they always happen when the geocache details page(s) is going to be displayed. There's no crash by just switching back and forth between the sub-pages of the geocache details (like waypoints, overview, description, logs etc.) If you need additional information, please let me know. If it helps I can assign the same "unique" label (see above) to future crash reports so they can be referenced easily.
Manager.title: Geocache details page crashes occasionally

Manager.description: Hi, I'm reviewing the french translation and I have noticed a button in cache details (see screen capture) which can not exceed 6 caracters ... it's very very short (I would like to translate this button to "Recharger" a word only 9 caracters long) Note: I think there is enough place here to put a bigger button and I'm sure I'm not the only user/translator who found this "6 caracters limit" too short for a button label. Thanks for your attention,
Manager.title: In cache details: button are too small for labels

Manager.description: When importing a gpx the selected offline data (e.g. maps, pictures, ...) should be downloaded as well. Currently a refresh is needed after the import
Manager.title: Download offline data during gpx import

Manager.description: https://corner.squareup.com/2015/05/leak-canary.html
Manager.title: Checkout leak canary

Manager.description: The app does not recognize the gpx links on this page: http://www.gutenberg-2015.de/index.php/en/labs
Manager.title: c:geo not registered for Mainz lab cache links

Manager.description: Required modules for undobar are not declared in idea configurations.
Manager.title: Project fail to build on Idea since inclusion of undobar

Manager.description: Hi, would it be possible to provide a simple F-Droid repository for the cgeo apk? There is a Howto here: https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Setup_an_FDroid_App_Repo. This would allow all F-Droid users to get updates automatically, even if cgeo is sadly not part of F-Droid. Thanks!
Manager.title: Provide a F-Droid repo for the apk

Manager.description: Hi, I left the following message to the geocaching.com site: "How can I store my user interface language more permanently. Apparently, this option uses cookies to store language? I don't want to store cookies permanently, because I also use public computers. If I close browser and logged in again, the user interface language setting is returned back to original." ..and geocaching.com answer: "Hello, Thank you for contacting Geocaching HQ. Do you use the Android app c:geo? There is a bug currently in the app that is reverting your language settings back to English on our website. Since this is third party website, we have no control over fixing it. You will have to reach out to c:geo for additional support. Please let us know if you have further questions. Kindly, Janelle Geocaching Community Manager"
Manager.title: c:geo revert geocaching.com website language settings back to English

Manager.description: I just tried restoring a backup of my personal device on an emulator. While no error message is shown, the database is empty afterwards. Have to inspect this when there is some more time...
Manager.title: restoring backup doesn't work

Manager.description: When I go to history and open any cache from there I don't have refresh option in menu (3 dot menu).
Manager.title: Refresh option not avaible from menu in history

Manager.description: This should not be possible
Manager.title: Moving caches by selection mode

Manager.description: I have seen that on a users device at the giga in Mainz, need to reproduce myself. Steps probably necessary to reproduce: have an unfound cache on your device (detailed yes, stored?) have setting filter found caches active log the cache as found on the website go to the live map showing the cache in question the cache is still visible (which is as expected) switch the filter found caches setting off the cache gets the found smilie attached when refresh finished switch the filter found caches setting on again the smilie vanishes, the cache is still shown!
Manager.title: Merge issue in live map: found flag not updated

Manager.description: 2015.05.18-NB Open GKC240 The "spotted" field shows "in GC1HKWQ" but in fact the GK was only visited there and is still with a user (with myself). For a GC trackable the user name of the curent holder is shown in such a case. Not sure whether this is a bug or a different function at GK.
Manager.title: Spotted field is wrong for GKs

Manager.description: This follows #4787 "GK visit should be possible without geocode". Now, it is possible to log a GK without specifying a cache Geocode, but (IMHO) this may not be a "good practice" as GC coordinates are not automatically imported in GeoKrety service database, this make logging on the GK website difficult for newbies. GC/coordinates are 1st stored when user log GK ; next GK log in same GC cache will prefill coordinates from last input. In #4787, I proposed to show a message to users when no Geocode was filled. Text could be: "You're about to send a log without a cache Geocode. It's encouraged to set one. Do you really want to proceed?" We could also add a "remain choice" checkbox to not annoy users...
Manager.title: Display an alert when submitting log without cache Geocode?

Manager.description: Assuming that c:geo would be able to get API access from Groundspeak: Which points of the existing API license agreement would need to be discussed and/or modified to match our requirements? Can we keep all existing functions if we change to the API or what technical modifications would be needed for the API to achieve this? I found this help page via Google, but don't know if this reflects the current API.
Manager.title: Introduce Groundspeak API

Manager.description: This follows PR #4859. Actual icon for TB doesn’t seem to suit for everyone... Current icons for Trackables are: Unknown: TravelBug: GeoKrety: Swaggie: New proposed icon for TB: Extracted exchanges from old PR. @SammysHP said: I'd prefer the first one. Why? Because it shows "Travelbug and Geocoin" – you can't distinguish between them. What we need is this first icon and an icon for Geokretys. @kumy said: I've hacked the existing icon a bit to build the TravelBug icon. @SammysHP said: I'd use a question mark for unknown, in your draft unknown and travelbug are rather similar. @Lineflyer said: I would currently not like to use a question mark for an unknown brand, because in our current way of loading all GC-trackables are unknown as long as you only look at the inventory of a cache. If the standard GC-only user opens a GC cache it would be OK and correct if he would see this icon IMO:
Manager.title: Change Trackables icons?

Manager.description: Summary: Refreshing all caches in a list caused repeated caches to be displayed on screen with different information. I had 14 caches stored in my "Found List" and I was logging them on my computer. When I completed my logging (on the computer) I did a "Refresh All" in c:geo and the caches refreshed. (I wanted to verify that I hadn't missed logging any.) What was displayed after that was a combination of "unfound" caches and "found" caches of the same name. It appeared to have not cleared the previous state properly before reloading the cache. To clarify: Some caches were displayed twice, once with the "Cache Found" green bar, and once without. See attached screen shot. Exiting the list and re-entering refreshed the display correctly.
Manager.title: Refreshing stored list resulted in incorrect display

Manager.title: Crash of c:geo when invoking wear navigation

Manager.description: Currently this item is named "Import from web" (german: "Aus dem Internet importieren"). Why not be more precise like "Send2cgeo".
Manager.title: Have a better string for send2cgeo import

Manager.description: Hi, It looks like c:geo adds ".." to 2 translated strings (see screen capture attached) because these 2 points are not in my translations. Details: translation keys are: caches_refresh_selected / caches_move_selected to reproduce => this menu is displayed when: in cache list, activate "selection mode" then select some caches and finally open the "contextual" menu. Regards,
Manager.title: Strange double final Points (in a menu)

Manager.description: We need to change some hyperlinks within c:geo as soon as we release the new webpage. IMO it would be good if someone can prepare a PR for this, so that we can merge it at a point of time when the website is ready. AFAIR we have quite some links to the FAQ in some message windows, in "About c:geo" and in statusupdate.java (closeout warning for 2.2) which need to be changed accordingly.
Manager.title: Prepare homepage link changes in c:geo sources

Manager.description: Request from support mail.
Manager.title: Add the ability to have several pictures attached to the log

Manager.description: Name: c:geo wear Icon: https://lh5.ggpht.com/t9pmtcp4Icy0vmcb2fFYHDTRs9YiBZqpb5QhQ5rWKoJf1Xo4bAO8Eo4cdsNWcBQ6F5E=w300 Link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.javadog.cgeowear Description: c:geo Wear is a plugin for c:geo that lets you navigate to geocaches using your Android Wear smartwatch.
Manager.title: Add c:geo wear to list of useful apps

Manager.description: I can't save my offline log to field notes when waypoint of my cache is "OPxxxxxx". Need fix it for opencaching.
Manager.title: Field notes work only with GC
