Manager.title: NoClassDefFoundError 'Move to different list' cache from list from long press action

Manager.description: Hi, The same string is displayed in 2 different contexts in the app and it's make them hard to translate because: the meaning are slightly different and the available space is also quite different. See screen captures attached: Context 1 in parameters: results displayed when checking login/password Context 2 on the home: connection status with gc.com.
Manager.title: Translation Request - need 2 different strings

Manager.description: Starting with 2015.05.22-NB1 I seem to have extreme inconsistencies on my lists of saved caches. Example: I open a list named GdH with 15 caches I open one of them and close it again Returning to the list I do see that all caches shown belong to the history list but not my list The header still shows GdH as name but a count of 81 caches (which is the amount of caches in the history list) Leaving and reentering the lists solves it Trying to explitcitly reproduce it was not succesfull, but it keeps happening in various ways.
Manager.title: Inconsistencies between lists

Manager.description: Some people do not know how to drop a TB because they do not see the list under the log text input field. Some sort of visual hint (aka loading circle) might help in this situation.
Manager.title: Visual feedback for logging activity

Manager.description: Good evening As geocaching.com let us know, it's the c:geo app, that seems to have an error/bug as it sets back the language settings on geocaching.com to english all the time. Sorry, but only part on this planet speeks english. Would be great if you could fix this. Thanks in advance Best Regards Grizzly70
Manager.title: language settings are getting changed by c:geo

Manager.description: Open a cache, go to the description page. For demonstration immediately decrypt the hint. One or two seconds later the detail page is recreated and the hint is encrypted again (and the long description is hidden). Maybe setDataSetChanged() is called a few seconds after the first creation of the page.
Manager.title: Description page in detail activity is created more than once

Manager.description: On Jolla (Sailfish 1.1.4.29), i can't authorize c:geo to use opencaching. When I press the "Starte Authorisierung"/"Neustarten"(=restart) button the web browser opens and asks me, if i want to authorize c:geo. I click yes, and openCaching remembers that c:geo should be authorized. The app itself still tells me it was not authorized to use opencaching.de
Manager.title: OpenCaching authorisation fails on Jolla

Manager.description: From support mail and I can reproduce it: Could still be a device problem as I use the very same device on same version. Can someone please crosscheck with another device? --- System information --- Device: GT-I9505 (jfltexx, samsung) Android version: 5.0.1 Android build: LRX22C.I9505XXUHOD5 Cgeo version: 2015.03.31 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: fastest HW-acceleration: enabled (default state) geocaching.com: not logged in (Anmeldung…) System language: de_DE Installed cgeo plugins: calendar --- End of system information ---
Manager.title: Date selector shows wrong week

Manager.description: Version 2015.03.31. I was not able to reproduce it with 2015.05.26-NB although I am not aware that anything changed in that area. Here is a video showing the problem (provided by a user and published with his approval): https://www.dropbox.com/s/1v2i0xtq5z9ti8a/Offline.mp4?dl=0 Could be related to #4086
Manager.title: Cache not added to history when logged in a particular scenario

Manager.description: I know we discussed this briefly somewhere. Now I crosschecked with current release and new relase candiate (with modified waypoint layout): On the current release 2015.03.31 pressing back while editing the waypoint discarded the changes. With 2015.05.29-RC pressing back will save changes made I think we should either adopt the old working mode (don't save on back) or preferably show a dialog with "Save" or "Discard" options.
Manager.title: Back from waypoint editor should not save automatically

Manager.description: Strangely with 2015.05.29-RC the user avatar is no longer loaded when using the function "Check Login" in Menu - Settings - Services - geocaching.com. With production release 2015.03.31 it is working normal (also tested today...so not website change related) Edit: Test with production release was done on another device (see comment from 03.06.2015). Log does not show any error.
Manager.title: Avatar no longer shown on "Check Login" on some devices

Manager.description: I installed 2015.05.29-RC and restored a backup of 2015.05.28-NB. After that I do see some caches on my list which have inventory icons (one or several TB numbered) but If I open the cache the inventory tab is not shown. The GC website confirms, that there are no TBs listed in this cache, still it keeps showing in the list even after refresh of the cache. Note: Tested for me with GC50HFV
Manager.title: Cache list shows inventory but no TB/GK in cache

Manager.description: Hi, I'm wondering if it's possible for a user to check is personal TB/GK inventory within the apps? As far as I know yet, you could only simulate to log a cache and there you see inventory. Thanks,
Manager.title: Question / Improvement: is there a way to check its personal TB/GK inventory within cgeo?

Manager.description: Hi, I want to be emailed each time tag "Translation" is added to an issue. Is it possible in GitHub ? regards,
Manager.title: GitHub issue usage: is there a way to subscribe to a tag?

Manager.description: The current Apache httpclient library doesn't support SNI connexions.
Manager.title: No SNI support for network requests

Manager.description: As it's available with the quick search on the main activity, direct logging a GK should provide autocomplete on 'geocode' field. search for a GeoKret open logging page choose 'discovered' logtype start typing in the 'geocode' field -> autocomplete should start.
Manager.title: LogTrackableActivity should provide autocomplete on 'geocode' field

Manager.description: Since #4834 I've enabled "don't keep activities" settings in System -> developer options Last time I opened "Locus", I got this warning. Should we implement something similar in c:geo?
Manager.title: Warn about "don't keep activities" settings

Manager.description: extremcaching.com uses a 7 star terrain rating. AFAIR c:geo also shows seven star icons in the cache details on EC caches. With 2015.05.29-RC open EC1043, it shows T5/7 but only five red stars, no grey stars.
Manager.title: EC terrain rating misses stars in cache details

Manager.description: 2015.05.29-RC but also in 2015.03.31: Open saved cache Go to WP tab Add a new WP and add a note to it Save it Add another WP without adding any note Save it Result: On the WP tab you will see that both WPs have the same note (which was only entered for the first WP)
Manager.title: WP note field note field gets text from previous note

Manager.description: What about a showcase for this new feature? It should be intuitive, but still some users might fail to find it.
Manager.title: Showcase for new WP save button

Manager.description: While all nightlies are already available on download.cgeo.org we have to adapt the upload script also for cgeo-RC.apk and cgeo-release.apk to have it still available once the new website is live. @mucek4 or @rsudev Can you do that configuration on the CI?
Manager.title: Relocate cgeo-RC.apk and cgeo-release.apk to download.cgeo.org

Manager.description: I have Sony smartwatch 3. Android version 5.1.1 and wear 1.1.1.1929530. my phone is Motorola Moto G (2nd gen.). Android 5.0.2. Newest c:geo. I downloaded c:geo wear. Phone c:geo crashed everytime when I clicked wear button in c:geo.
Manager.title: C:geo crashed after clicked wear button

Manager.description: @downloadURL and @updateURL need to be updated to target the github repo directly. We also applied this strategy to the new website. This would mean that release is directly controlled via commit to master.
Manager.title: Update URLS in send2cgeo script

Manager.description: Similarly to a bug we discussed long ago I again experience funny stuff when using the share menu. When I select the "show all" from the android share menu provider then locus opens with the cache. This is surely a faulty way through the switch case of the onOptionsItemSelected of the cache details activity.
Manager.title: Sharing has unexpected results

Manager.description: On some devices cache icons are shown rather large, taking up much of the mapspace, especially when you have many caches in your lists (device tested on is Samsung Galaxy Note 3). Wish is to be able to switch between (eg) two different icon sizes - "large" (= todays icon size) and "small" (about half the size). This would be very helpful for better orientation on packed maps.
Manager.title: Customizable icon sizes

Manager.description: People sometimes log spoilers that are not encoded. Encoding all non-encoded logs as they're fetched would allow users to check the recent logs to see if it has recent finds without accidentally having the cache spoiled.
Manager.title: Add option to encode non-encoded logs.

Manager.description: Im using C:GEO from weeks on my mobile (Huawei Ascend G510), and few days ago I installed C:GEO on my wife's mobile (Motorola Moto-E). She reported high battery usage of something, but I did'nt check that then. Last evening I fully charged up bettery of my Huawei and after night i realised that battery is almost empty again, and 40% of that consumption is caused by C:GEO (Using GPS). Durring night I had localisation switched to inacurate (GPS off), and C:GEO was not closed (was not on screen - is there any "exit" button?) I tried to set diferent options in C:GEO (use or not Google Play Services, save or not battery when sleep mode etc.) and C:GEO is showing on screen`s bottom that GPS is off but it didnt helped ... battery usage menu in android is still schowing huge consumption of C:GEO app and its consumed by GPS C:GEO that im using is version: 2015.03.31 On Huawei im using Cyanogen Mod 11 - Android 4.4.4 On Moto-E my wife is using Branded by Motorola Android - I guess its 4.4 or something. Regards Albert
Manager.title: High battery usage even on GPS turned Off, and when not using C:GEO

Manager.description: 2015.06.03-RC1: I had several GPX imports on my device for lab caches and custom made caches (not refering to a known geocode). I would not expect, that these caches are checked towards GK or GKM for inventory as these geocodes are not supported for carrying GKs. 15:51:39.327 Debug cgeo 11463 [ModernAsyncTask #5] GeokretyConnector.searchTrackables: wpt=LABYRINTH-FESTUM 15:51:39.327 Debug cgeo 11463 [ModernAsyncTask #5] GET http://api.geokretymap.org/export2.php?wpt=LABYRINTH-FESTUM 15:51:39.437 Debug cgeo 11463 [main] Loading LABYRINTH-FESTUM Labyrinth-Festum (41) from DB 15:51:39.657 Debug cgeo 11463 [ModernAsyncTask #5] 200 (352 ms) GET http://api.geokretymap.org/export2.php?wpt=LABYRINTH-FESTUM 15:51:39.767 Debug cgeo 11463 [main] Loading LABYRINTH-FESTUM Labyrinth-Festum (41) from DB
Manager.title: Requests to GK(M) for unsupported geocodes

Manager.description: Unverified, taken from FB: wherigo option is available when the cartridge is not yet completed. Else this option is not there.
Manager.title: Navigate -> WhereYouGo option missing if cache is found

Manager.description: From support mail: Currently I can map a list of caches in an external app (like Locus or maps.me). Great feature! (Map - Menu - Show on map - ) The same thing should be possible from the waypoint tab of a cache to get all its waypoints shown on the external app.
Manager.title: View all waypoints of a cache in an external app

Manager.description: I just recognized that we did not yet officially publish the send2cgeo script for OC. While thinking about how to do that, I had the idea that there might be no need to have to seperate scripts but just one which triggers for both websites. Is that technically possible? Having a combined script would minimize the effort (one version handling, one send2cgeo.html page on the website, etc.).
Manager.title: Combine send2cgeo scripts into one script

Manager.description: It is good that we can use corrected coordinates made on the GC Cache page in PQ's or updated when refreshed (The little red indicator makes these very visible on the map. It would be nice if all corrected coordinates from PQs had this indicator without the need to refresh in c:geo. I also make a lot of notes on the GC cache page. In GSAK, these notes are available through the 'GcNote' database field. It would be a great feature to be able to see this data when viewing the cache in c:geo. Is this possible?
Manager.title: Read cache notes from GSAK

Manager.description:
The job keps failing constantly since yesterday but the websites seem up and running from my users perspective: Websites which failed testing
OpenCachingDE OpenCachingNL OpenCachingPL OpenCachingRO OpenCachingUK OpenCachingUS
Manager.title: Watchdog fails for OC-sites

Manager.description: In the settings we disable the not installed navigation apps. As shown by the recent facebook post many people are wondering why their settings don't allow certain apps (e.g. the WhereYouGo in that case). We should therefore add a settings summary next to the setting to describe that.
Manager.title: Show not available navigation apps disabled

Manager.description: The new menu item for opening recognized checkers can lead to the app crashing, as reported on facebook. Reason is a to broad recognition of URLs.
Manager.title: crash when invoking checker from c:geo

Manager.description: While using the Play Console I noticed a new offer to use a cloud test service. From what I have read it offers free testing on 20 physical devices and provides a report back to the developer account. It is combined with the alpha/beta channels on GooglePlay (so tests will probably run as soon as an APK is placed there). That could be a useful additional test (although I am not sure how deep this service can test by using random clicks in the app). There is a possibility to "early sign up" for this upcoming service. Shall we do that? https://developers.google.com/cloud-test-lab/ http://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2015/05/google-announces-the-cloud-test-lab-a-free-automated-testing-service/
Manager.title: Use Google Cloud Test Lab

Manager.description: There seem to be many users (judged by the amount of support mails and bad GooglePlay ratings) having stability problems with c:geo after upgrading their devices to Android 5.0.x. This seems to be an issue which is maybe independend of #4921 For some of them the problem seems solved after a factory reset, but a lot others keep having problems. I have the chance to get a Sony Xperia Z3 tomorrow and will try to see if I can reproduce the general instability. @rsudev What was that device you are using? Did you see any regular crashes of c:geo on it?
Manager.title: Regular crashes on Sony Xperia devices on Android 5+

Manager.description: First crash report for new version (2015.06.15). Not sure how relevant that is, but it is shown as 'new' (so kind-of regression). Manager.description: As discussed on IRC: I would like to test if requesting a larger heapSize in our manifest could help minimizing the OOM problems (caused by large bitmaps and mapsforge library) for the time being. I am aware it is no solution but still maybe helpful until we get more memory optimizations (like e.g. a new mapsforge library). Reference: http://developer.android.com/reference/androi/R.styleable.html#AndroidManifestApplication_largeHeap I suggest to change it on master and do some comparisons on some devices.
Manager.title: Try to minimize OOM problems by requesting larger heapsize

Manager.description: I would like to have send2cgeo to work on project-gc.com 👍 1
Manager.title: have send2cgeo work on project-gc.com

Manager.description: Follow up of #4733. Will complete details next days.
Manager.title: Additional waypoints in GSAK GPX not recognized on import

Manager.description: Previously Inventory was in alphabetical name order when you were logging a cache. Since the last update, a new little icon is next to them, but it is no longer in alphabetical order. This makes it very time consuming to scroll thru and find the ones you want.
Manager.title: Inventory Order when logging a cache

Manager.description: Update mapsforge for better performance and new futures The current stable release is 0.5.1.
Manager.title: mapsforge lib update

Manager.description: Similar to how phone numbers are formatted in edit texts we should add leading or trailing zeros automatically in the coordinate fields. I have been quite confused again by our non mathematical minute fraction part.
Manager.title: Use text watcher to format coordinate input

Manager.description: We can parse longitude OR latitude from double. But we cannot parse two doubles as coordinate. Found because the copy from clipboard button was disabled after copying such a coordinate from the browser.
Manager.title: Floating point coordinates not accepted

Manager.description: Taken from #5007: Reason: With the new webpage we link directly to mater on cgeo/cgeo repository. Having a separate repository for send2cgeo would allow Separate bugtracking Having branches for release/master separate to c:geo app => Allowing a separate release management for the script without need for any other hosting,etc. So, here would be my proposal: (Merge #5045 - if ready to merge) Create a dedicated repository for send2cgeo in organization cgeo Change @updateURL and @downloadURL in script Change URLs on web page Raise version number of script Place the new version of the script to the old URL https://send2.cgeo.org/send2cgeo.user.js for a last time Will this work? Who could support this by creating the new repo (this won't work easy with UI only).
Manager.title: Split send2cgeo into a separate repository

Manager.description: From support mail for 2015.06.19: Open TB3CNBH Swipe to "pictures" tab to verify that pictures are shown Press the "Refresh" button Result: Picture tab is empty
Manager.title: TB pictures lost on refresh

Manager.description: Hi. It is a kind of usability improvement. When I click a cache on map that is already stored on some list I wish to have "MOVE" button. I do not need to click "More details" then, in order to move cache from one list to another.
Manager.title: New button "Move" in already stored cache pop-up window

Manager.description: Quite similar with what we do ourselves. https://github.com/mcharmas/Android-ReactiveLocation
Manager.title: Explore possible use of Android-ReactiveLocation

Manager.description: Hi, For personnal reasons I use 2 differents gc.com accounts. My request is to: store these 2 differents accounts in c:geo simultaneously provide an easy way to swicth between them. Notes: the best I think is to ask/select the account to use at c:geo startup this need of several "c:geo profils" on the same device may be usefull for other c:geo settings (for instance background color ...) don't forget to manage other "linked" accounts like (geokrety, GV vote ...): some accounts could be shared between these new "c:geo profils". What do you think?
Manager.title: Suggestion: need a way to manage/switch between several gc.com accounts easily

Manager.description: I got several independent users on FB and support who report, that they export a GPX from c:geo for caches with waypoints and some (or all) of these waypoints are missing when reimporting it on another c:geo installation. Both versions 2015.06.19 Did not have time to retest this yet.
Manager.title: Child waypoints of exported GPX missing on reimport

Manager.description: the description of a multicache contains a list of waypoints (e.g. http://coord.info/GCY803) I can't find a way to copy coords of a station to waypoint - longpressing text select the whole text for copying to clipboard or for translating. finally I solved my problem using an external file to select described coords and copy to waypoint - this last part then worked great for me. Samsung Note3 Android 5.0, c:geo version 2015.06.19
Manager.title: Copy parts of cache description e.g. coords to waypoint

Manager.description: We already sort lists by date if they contain only event caches. We could sort by name automatically if we recognise a common prefix in all caches of a list.
Manager.title: Automatically sort by name

Manager.description: I do see some untranslated strings on master which would need to go to Crowdin to get translations.
Manager.title: Upload strings from master to Crowdin

Manager.description: I have found on several occasions that I cannot post a Owner Maintenance log on my own caches. The log types Archived and Disabled are also missing in the log type dropdown list. But sometimes the log options are available. I have not figured out yet when they are available and when they are not.
Manager.title: Owner related log types not always available on own caches

Manager.description: From support mail: Some applications (like GSAK and Garmin tools) support a compressed GPX format named GGZ. While this officially is a propriertary solution for Garmin devices, it seems to be just a zipped GPX with a small folder structure inside (containing a XML file specific to Garmin(?) and a normal GPX). As it seems to be a valid ZIP archive, might it be possible to enable c:geo to import that on the same way as GPX (and zipped GPX). Advantage for the user: Have only one small file valid for his Garmin and c:geo (which is in fact the same device=Monterra). Example file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xbl6ma64f6dcpg2/test.ggz If you just remane that to *.zip you will be able to open it.
Manager.title: Support import of GGZ files

Manager.description: HI I received a mail anouncing a new GC. Normally importing from mail or by gc-code search works perfectly but for these 2 new GC: GC5YR5P and GC5YR9B Thanks for fixing. My System: Samsung S4 GT-I9505 BE AUT, Android 4.4.2 stock rom, rooted. C:GEO 2015.06.19
Manager.title: Can't import 2 new geocaches, while other work

Manager.description: Tag the release on Github Upload APK to Github Remove problem notification and set release notification as soon as release is available As I will be unavailable soon until tomorrow afternoon it would be good if someone can take care of that please.
Manager.title: Version 2015.07.08 has been released - Tasks left

Manager.description: Issue #5069 would have to be fixed on legacy as well, if they are not going to revert that change on server side we still want to do maintain the legacy version Just as a reminder to decide upon in some days.
Manager.title: Fix legacy version?

Manager.description: Please update the FAQ: The .cgeo directory fills up my internal sdcard of my android phone. How to delete not needed data? Thank you very much.
Manager.title: Please update FAQ: .cgeo directory fills up my internal sdcard: How to delete not needed data?

Manager.description: There was an update from 3.3.1 to 3.3.2. For me, the new version does not work in the main project. So please don't attempt an upgrade on your side.

Manager.title: Export GPX - pass through gpsbabel - import GPX - fail

Manager.description: It would be cool if c:geo could import comments from GCComment. Since I am not a Premium Member at Groundspeak anymore, it has become indispensable for me. But I always missed the the sync of them to c:geo. GCComment GCComment is browser extension for managing your personal cache notes for basic and premium members (option to sync them with GS's personal notes). It also advantages compared to GS's personal notes: no char limit, additional coords, ... I'm not initiator of the script, but I try to fix bugs and keep the development going. In my branch I've created a version with the possibility to share comments as links (gist based). This version is not ready for release yet (some little thing are missing), but it's working. The gist export could be basis for an import in c:geo. Links There are 3 types of links: single cache: http://gcc.lukeiam.de#gcc77f77058034820de51e1 (id starts with gcc and is 23 chars long) If you cut of the gcc from the id you get the gist id where the data is stored: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/77f77058034820de51e1 multiple caches: http://gcc.lukeIam.de#gccce2836e0154de67363c1f (id starts with gccc and is 24 chars long) Cut of the gccc from the id you get the gist id again: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e2836e0154de67363c1f static link to multiple caches: All other links change with each export, but the static links can be resolved to the last multiple caches export of the user. (If the user agreed with uploading his ids - It uses a little web service hosted on azure) http://gccs.lukeIam.de#23788787-7b74-459b-96b3-3773eca8f5a6 (other subdomain and id contains - and is 36 chars long) Use this id and call https://idresolver.azurewebsites.net/23788787-7b74-459b-96b3-3773eca8f5a6 and you will get a multiple caches id: "gccce2836e0154de67363c1f" Data The data is encoded in xml and can be parsed easily. See the links above for examples. Gist API Gist has an easy to use REST-API to download the data: https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/ c:geo integration It would be cool to support two methods: Import with qr code by url (using intent-filter?) Save the static url in the options and import frequently or on request I could write some java code to help, but I'm quite new to android. If you need more information or if I could help somewhere, let me know...
Manager.title: Support import of personal notes from GCComment

Manager.description: Hi, I discovered, that when I go offline, nearby search feature is unusable at all. I would recommend showing 20 nearest caches from local storage with warning that it's only from local storage, because internet connection was not sucessfull. What do you think about this ? Sometimes it will help users with many lists of caches, to just see what's around (using offline list with 3000 caches from pocketquery is difficult on many devices). Thanks for your opinion. TriakCZ
Manager.title: Nearby search when offline

Manager.description: This is somehow similar to #4074: 2015.07.18-NB Open GC2G9AJ or OCF19C "Render view" takes 30 seconds to complete because of: 11:44:55.261 Warning cgeo 22067 [network-5] Failure (30162 ms) GET http://team-jerichow.de/uploads/kurzlog4.JPG (ch.boye.httpclientandroidlib.conn.ConnectTimeoutException: Connect to team-jerichow.de:80 timed out) Couldn't we do this in the background not blocking the UI? Looking back at #4074 I tend to remember that the unavailable pictures was not blocking the UI in the past but did "only" prevent all other pictures from beeing shown. So I would assume (although I did not explicitly test this before) that the blocking behaviour is new.

Manager.description: I did not see this filter in an offline list : considering and filtering caches with zero found log (as possible FTF to do). Of course, this is the cache state according to the last refresh, but it's user responsibility to update it. I know this has been already asked with a marker on a map, but the cache details are not downloaded in this case, so it has no sense. But in an offline list, we have these logs. The filter would just check if there is at least one "found" log. What do you think about it ?

Manager.description: This might be more a question than an issue: Sine some weeks (cant tell the time where this behavior started) I do see a different behavior with c:geo in interaction with cache links. What I was used to: Start c:geo and do something Exit c:geo by pressing home button Open some webpage or an email which contains coord.info links and click on it to open it in c:geo Press back to return to the webpage/mail client What is different now: At step 4 I do not always get back to the appwhere I clicked the link but instead return to the session I started in 1.. Only if I repeatedly press the back button until I return to c:geo main menu and press once more on back to leave c:geo I get back to the originating app. Any thoughts whether I am wrong or what might cause the difference? To myself the old behavior was more user friendly: I click the link and see the result and can press back to return to where I came from. In parallel I would expect the ¨original session¨ to be kept in the background until I start c:geo itself again.
Manager.title: c:geo only a single process now?

Manager.description: It seems that c:geo does not update what it thinks it my current location after it has been started. Two things that happened yesterday: Start c:geo wth location still turned off Turn on location Wait until OsmAnd sees me in my current location Select "Nearby", "Current location" in c:geo c:geo selects caches on the wrong continent, it seems to use the previous location I have been searching... Later, I restarted c:geo. Then at least it had me in the right city, but Select a cache Click the circle with the four bars at the top, so that there's a circle filling it Walk around c:geo does not update my current location The "location service" icon does not even appear in Android's status bar. When I switch to OsmAnd, it does appear, and the blue spot follows my walking. This is using c:geo 2015.08.03 on a device without play services, but with open-source replacements for some of them. (Not that I think that matters, but who knows^^).

Sorry, happend already some days ago, and I wasn't able to reproduce as it needs quite a slow network connection. After refreshing the cache I have seen, that both operations have been sucesfull (coords set and fav point added). Not a big deal as the occurence will be quite rare.

Additionally there seem to be problems with users on some timezones (maybe erratically set on their phone) leading to fail to add it due to the missing menu.

Manager.description: 2015.08.30-NB1 Perform nearby search Result contains unsaved and saved caches Press home button to ¨exit¨ c.geo Open c:geop again The shown search result is now only containing the saved caches. Unsaved caches are no longer shown. I am not sure how it was in the past, but the fact that only saved caches are left is new to me. I assume, that either the list was still there or a the search equest was repeated.

Manager.description: Groundspeak has asked us to remove gc-based address search, as they will get charged for that in the future (see mail in g+ developer group). Already since some time we primarily use Android or Mapquest for geocoding, but gc is still there as a fall-back.
Manager.title: Remove gc-based address search

Manager.description: Follow up of #5175 I wonder a little about this high amount of requests to mapquest mentioned in that issue depsite the fact that it is only the fallback option in a user initiated procedure. My assumption would rather be that this is not caused by geocoding for adress search but by the geocoding done for showing the current location on the start screen. This is more likely to happen than a user initiated search by adress IMO. In this case I suggest to remove the mapquest fallback at this place but keep it for adress search to maybe extend the 15000 limit.
Manager.title: Remove mapquest geocoding for current location

Manager.description: Long time ago I've contacted David, the GeoLutins owner, asking him if he agree with an integration of GL in c:geo. He replied yesterday, and was enthusiast. He proposed a simple API to lookup GL. He also added a GL[0-9AZ]{5,} pattern to lookup GL. The c:geo icon was added on his website just near this "new GL numbers" http://www.geolutins.com/profil_geolutin.php?ID_Geolutin_Selectionne=1976. Is there a problem with that? Main API url, is as of today: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/api.php?G=GLXXXXX There is also a converter from Tracking Numbers to GL numbers: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/decode.php?G=00000000-000 ( [0-9]{8}-[0-9]{3} ) I've done a proof of concept, I still need to clean a bit the code.
Manager.title: Support GeoLutins trackables

Manager.description: As we do have some need to release some version soon (due to #5175 and #5177 and maybe due to #4921) let me just give some opinion from my side: The release branch contains only minimal changes with respect to the shutdown of opencaching.com and the geocoding things, whereas the master branch has a lot of new stuff. While I think that master is rather stable, I did not have any sufficient time and will not have until beginning of October to test it in deep (e.g. compass related). So although the gap between master and release is quite big and will get bigger until beginning of October I would still prefer a release from release as far as I am concerned for testing it. There could be one alternative if needed: If we could strip the compass related changed from master, the remaining changes on master could be made ready for release without too much effort IMO. What I want to say is, that the compass changes need to be carefully checked, as it is a core function but I would still like to see the bundle of other changes on masterto be out there rather soon. Happy to get your opinion on that...
Manager.title: Next bugfix/feature release

Manager.description: As noticed by one of our translators, the filter for offline logs is actually implemented twice. https://crowdin.com/translate/cgeo/80/en-hu#14917:drl:531:kia71
Manager.title: Duplicate filter for offline logs

Manager.description: @samueltardieu Just a reminder: This is now almost outdated and needs an udpate: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/wiki/Low-power-mode I would appreciate if you could add the new methods for direction and its priorities as well to that or another Wiki entry.
Manager.title: Update Wiki about "Low power mode"

Manager.description: Right now our main build is still Ant based, as that is supported in Eclipse, IDEA/AS and on Jenkins. I propose that after our current release we switch to a Gradle based main build and remove the Ant one. Reasons: More and more Android libraries are not packaged as JAR anymore, but as AAR only. For Ant or Eclipse based builds those have to manually be repackaged. I've done this since quite some time for the Google play services and similar libs in our repository, but this task is getting harder every time due to no easy identification of the right source artifacts, transitive dependencies, classes occuring multiple times in repackaged libs and so on. The (currently still experimental) Java to Dalvik bytecode compiler for Android requires Gradle. We can expect that tool chain to replace the Java to class to DEX to... toolchain of today in the near future. The current state slows down our adoption of other new technologies, e.g. lots of small libraries on github, which could easily be consumed with gradle, the most recent compat libs with Material design back port and so on. Of course this has consequences. I actually expect us not to be able to have a working compilation inside of Eclipse anymore due to it not understanding the gradle dependencies, thereby potentially requiring every Eclipse user of our developers to switch to Android Studio. I'd be happy about feedback of whether you feel we should take that step, especially if you are using Eclipse (like myself). I guess that we can replace additional functionality of our Jenkins build (coverage measurement and such) with gradle based functionality, but I'm a noob in Gradle. So this surely would require some team effort (and maybe lead to some days of Jenkins not building anything).
Manager.title: switch to gradle as main build system

Manager.description: While testing the RC version I noticed a big visual difference for basic members: While the nearby results looked like the saved lists in the past now every (unsaved or previously unloaded) cache will have orange circles. While this is technically correct it looks strange and users might be confused by that. What do you think? Here is how it looks:

Manager.description: With the redesign of cache overlay icons the textual note "Offline" has been removed. While this is OK in the search results (as the disk icon is shown) now the saved caches list does not have any indication, that those caches are stored for offline. While this is implicit and should not lead to any uncertainty, still some users of the RC version are confused by the missing "Offline" in the lists. I suggest to either introduce it again or also show the disk icon in the saved lists (while I prefer the first in order not to clutter the saved list by always the same overlay). Opinions?

Manager.description: The title says it all. Refer to discussion in #5190 Pro: Consistency of icons throughout the app (map and lists) Contra: As "lists" are offline per definition (besides history and search results where the disc icon is used) the icon does not provide any information. Your votes please? :)
Manager.title: Replace "Offline" by disc icon in lists to be consistent throughout c:geo?

It would be much more convenient to also have an "Ready" button on the top of the window. See explanation: I like this suggestion!

Manager.description: Hi, I use filters and it would be convinient to change "filtre icon color" when a filter is applied (let the user know if a filter is on or not). Best regards,
Manager.title: UI improvment when filtering cache list

Manager.description: Icons without overlays are smaller than icons with overlays in lists. cc @rsudev @kumy
Manager.title: Icons in lists have inconsistent sizes

Manager.description: On GC.com it is possible to add a description to each of the spoiler images at the end of the cache description. This description is not shown, but might be helpful/crucial for solving the cache. Sample: http://coord.info/GC4JBWA at picture "Spoiler" description: "So sah es mal aus..." (it once looked like that)
Manager.title: Spoiler images: Description not displayed

Manager.description: When ignoring a cache on oc.de and searching e.g. at the coordinates, the cache is shown nevertheless. While this could be a bug in the OKAPI, we should ensure that we properly authenticate (level 3) in this case, to enable filtering of ignored caches.
Manager.title: oc.de: Ignored caches displayed in c:geo

Manager.description: From support mail (related to cgeo 2015.09.23): I received the latest update to c:geo last night and immediately noticed one problem: when I use the "Live Map" to view caches, even though I have all cache types selected, multi caches that I haven't found are not displayed . There are several night cache (which display as multis) that I have not saved for off-line use. None of these caches are displayed. I normally do not save night caches for off-line unless I intend to attempt them in the near future. Let me know if others have had this problem. I am using an Android phone (Samsung Galaxy S5). I cannot reproduce this (launch cgeo without any filter, live map, I can see multicaches, including in areas where I have no caches stored). Can other developers check if they can reproduce this problem?
Manager.title: Multicaches are not displayed on map

Model: Classic OS: 10.3.2.2474 Location: on Google Play Services: n/a I was in touch with Carnero and he suggested it might be problem with missing Google Play Services. If that's the case, it would be nice if the app could work in some fallback/compatibility mode.

Manager.description: open search menu, large controls open live map switch orientation by turning the device go back to search menu, small controls c:geo: 2015.09.28 Device: Samsung SM-G800F (Galaxy S5 Mini) OS: 4.4.2 (B800FXXU1AOC8)

Manager.description: https://fdroid.cgeo.org response with 403 Forbidden. F-Droid reports Error getting index file. Has it been shutdown, moved or is there maintenance being done?

Manager.description: With the recent version we are now using the rotation sensor by default and added an option for the user to fall back to the orientation sensor instead. For support cases it would be helpful to include the current setting of "Use Orientation sensor" into the system information section.
Manager.title: Include status of orientation sensor usage in system information

Manager.description: From support mail (but not yet verified): With Version 2015.09.28 you fixed "Spoiler image descripritions". This is working now for each Cache of other Cachers. But descriptions of OWNED caches are still missing. I think the reason is that the HTML-code of owned caches is slightly different the following code is additional for owned caches:
Manager.title: Spoiler images of owned caches are missing the description

Manager.description: 2015.10-04-NB (and also 2015.09.28): Store a multi or mystery cache to a list Open cache and go to waypoint tab Add a waypoint of type "Final" with valid coordinates Save the waypoint Return to the list Expectation: Cache icon should be shown with overlay icon on lower right for "defined final" instead of no overlay. The overlay does only seem to work if the function "replace listing coords by final waypoint" has been used while creating the waypoint. This should not be necessary for the overlay to appear in the list. I assume the bug was introduced with recent changes to the overlay design in lists as it used to work with older c:geo versions.
Manager.title: Icon overlay for "final defined" not shown in lists
Broken string in progress bar for moving caches

Manager.description: 2015.09.28: Activate one-click offline log in Settings - Logging Open a list of saved caches Long click a cache and select "One click offline log" - Found it Result: When returning to the list the cache is not marked as offline logged (orange bar, orange smiley) Only after scrolling the list or close/open the list the new status is shown Expectation: The status change should be visible when returning to the list without further action required. Note: In case "One click offline log" is not active, it works as desired.
Manager.title: Found status not refreshed in list after one-click offline log

Manager.description: From support mail: I'm missing the image DESCRIPTION of log photos. Sometimes they contain important or interesting additional explanation of a log photo. For example: Cache: http://coord.info/GC1Z9J1 Log: http://coord.info/GLFD2GY6 Logimage-Name: 20140831_123209 The missing description of this image is: "Holzschuhe" Even if the image description isn't displayed on the Caches' Website (just if you click on the image), it's already there within the HTML-code of the Caches' Website: "Images":[{"ImageID":24259208,"ImageGuid":"5be12ac4-7c29-4543-9176-4e88bbc7b558","Name":"20140831_123209","Descr":"Holzschuhe","FileName":"5be12ac4-7c29-4543-9176-4e88bbc7b558.jpg","Created":"2014-08-31","LogID":441107781,"CacheID":1415339,"ImageUrl":null}]}
Manager.title: Include image description in c:geo gallery of a cache

Manager.description: My normal mode of operation for using c:geo is as follows: Use the map to find my area of interest. Scale the map to select an appropriate number of caches and store offline. Peruse the list for caches to target. Open the cache details Go to the logs and look at the recent ones to see when it was last found This is because where I live it isn't uncommon for a cache to go unfound for months and often the last years worth of logs are DNFs and/or needs maintenance. I usually will just skip these. It would be nice to have some sort of indication on the list page and/or the first details page of the last time cache was found and/or what the type of the last few logs are. My initial spit-ball of an implementation would be to have a colored/dashed line duplicating the colors from the last few log entries on the list page, one log per dash. Then that could be duplicated along with a last found date on the details page.
Manager.title: Indicate the last time a cache was found / type of recent logs

Manager.description: 2015.10.08-NB: Open Settings/Services Open GCVote settings Click on username and replace the existing user by an empty field Select OK Select "Verify login" This will return "Check OK" and I do see in the log that the previously stored username is still in use Close c:geo / Force close Start c:geo again Go to Settings/Services/GCVote You will see, that the previous username has been restored. As the username of GCVote and geocaching.com need to be identical we most probably derive it from the settings for geocaching.com. However couldn't we just disallow editing of the username in the GCVote settings and just show it for informational purposes.
Manager.title: User name for GCVote can not be deleted

Manager.description: I have just published a cache. When I view the waypoints in CGEO they are jumbled up and are not being displayed correctly. The same waypoints are displayed correctly in the geocaching.com app, on the geocaching.com website and on my Garmin GPS unit. Just not correctly on CGEO. This is the cache: Le Chemin Secret GC64J9E To see the problem, first look at the cache on geocaching.com on a PC. Look at the second waypoint puzzle: Les Fenêtres . In the French part of the waypoint description, the coded waypoint is displayed correctly on the PC as : N 44° 05.2E1 E 005° 59.CDE. CGEO displays the same waypoint jumbled and incorrect as : N44°E005°05.2DD59.CD5 There is a similar problem with the remaining waypoints. Interestingly, the English waypoint description displays the waypoints correctly. This seems to be a big problem. Please advise! Thanks, Chris
Manager.title: Waypoints are not being updated correctly

Manager.description: Tried the new GGZ format and it takes forever to load into c:geo. It cycled through 0-100% numerous times. It loads into my Oregon super quick, so is there an issue? Currently, I will revert to a GPX format for c:geo as I can only see a disadvantage.
Manager.title: GGZ import fails or is slow

Manager.description: I have recently upgraded my phone to an Xperia Z3 Compact (D5803) running Android 5.1.1 and the dates on the log pages are reversed, i have checked my settings on Geocaching.com and can confirm i have selected dd/MMM/yy. Is this a bug in the system.
Manager.title: Day and Month switched

Manager.description: 2015.10.11-NB: Have oc.nl connector active Have gcvote active Search for caches by address "Stadtkyll" The result should include OB148D (and others from same owner) Open cache details of OB148D Result: Rating is shown in cache details (i.e. 3 of 5 stars with 3 votes). This can not be true, as: I cannote see any request to gcvote for that GCVote is not supporting OB* caches I am a little puzzled here..can someone confirm?
Manager.title: Can see GCVote for OB caches?!

Manager.description: If I use https://www.geocaching.com/geocache instead of http://www.geocaching.com/geocache The Userscript is not triggered and I don't see the send2cgeo Button in Cache-Details. Easy Fix: Add // @include https://www.geocaching.com/geocache/* in line 10 :)
Manager.title: send2cgeo button not showing up with https URLS

Manager.description: I suggest a "Toggle" (by pressing on the the text itself), between the approximate date and the actual date of "stored in device". This way the current functionality is also preserved. Detail: I use my "Stored in Device" date as a way of knowing when I actually "found" the cache. (which I then log from the geocaching.com website) I do this together with putting the cache into a "Found" List. So displaying the date, instead of the approximation, would be invaluable for me, so I don't have to figure out which day I was at the cache location.
Manager.title: Toggle "Stored in Device" between "X Days" and "the actual Date"

Manager.description: Following #5200 ; It seems that it doesn't work for owned caches as the html contains additional informations. owned cache:
Manager.title: Spoiler images: Description not displayed for owned caches

Manager.description: From support mail: I use to import large GPX files (and sometimes several of them). Sadly while the import is running it does not show which file I am currently importing. This would be helpful in order not to accidently the same file again after a long importing time. So the name could be shown in the import window header or at least the "import done" window should state the file name which has just been imported.
Manager.title: Have file name in GPX import window

Manager.description: From support mail. A user performed an upgrade to Android 5.2 which was offered by Motorola for his device. Afterwards the compass of c:geo stopped working. I first advised to try the setting of using the orientation sensor...He reported back that it is not selectable. Other compass apps are working all the time before and after the upgrade. The sys info is as follows: --- System information --- Device: XT1032 (falcon_retde, motorola) Android version: 5.1 Android build: LPB23.13-56 Cgeo version: 2015.09.28 Google Play services: disabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: de_DE Geocaching sites enabled: - geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Premium Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information --- @samueltardieu Is it really possible that the device does not provide rotation sensor but only orientation?
Manager.title: Moto G compass fails completely

Manager.description: Right now we the master branch looks stable to me. So we could use the opportunity to release from master. However there are some issues which seem to be a regression out in the field still unsolved: #5240 #5225 #5264 #5262 #5296 #5312 #5390 So ideally these should be solved before release. Opinions?
Manager.title: Next feature release

Manager.description: From FB after users tried our nightly which included the fix for #5196 Also the personal note input window should have the Done/Cancel selection on top sue to ease of use and design consistency. @Rahu In case you are interested and it is technically possible...
Manager.title: Have OK/Cancel also on top for personal note editing

Manager.description: We got replies from several users (all gmail) that our replies to them are always sent to their spam folders on gmail. I suspect it has something to do with the identification of the host (like the one we had with IPV6). @mucek4 Can we do something about that?
Manager.title: All suport mail end up in spam on gmail.com

Manager.description: I can send a "found"-log, but this log doesn't appear on geoacaching.com same problem for a friend on another device. Maybe groundspeak made a change on the API? (PS: on www.geocaching.com it works...)
Manager.title: Log can be sent but doesn't appear on geocaching.com

Manager.description: 2015.10.31-NB on my tablet Samsung SM-P600 as well as on my Samsung Galaxy S4: In landscape mode the new input dialog is missing the OK/Cancel and the buttons "Cache Coordinates" and "My Coordinates". Switching to portrait mode it looks ok.
Manager.title: Coordinate dialog broken in landscape mode

Manager.description: 2015.10.31-NB: Open a cache Select "Log Visit" Post your log and select (the new) checkbox for "Add to your favorites" When returning to the cache details afterwards the state is not updated: The amount of favorite points for the cache is not incremented The button still shows "Add to your favorites" Expectation: If posting the log was OK, the information of the (stored) cache should be updated in cache details accordingly to avoid user confusion. @madankb
Manager.title: Amount of favorite points not updated when awarding a favorite point in logging view

Manager.description: When you select ignore cache from the cgeo menu on the selected cache, it states that if you need to see this cache again you need to restore it from Geocaching.com. However, this doesnt work - i have chose two different caches to ignore, but they still appear on my map and nearby list.
Manager.title: Ignored cache may persist in DB

Manager.description: Now when I'm trying to select and copy some text from cache description, I have only upper bar with "Copy" and "Share" buttons. So, the first problem is - I cannot select custom text from description. Then, when I click "Copy" button it copies all the raw content with HTML tags and so on, so it's really useless in such form. Suggestion to copy only meaningful text.
Manager.title: Add possibility to copy raw text from cache description

Manager.description: A lot of people contacted support mail because of this. The problem started after update to a newer version of this mapy.cz app, however I sill want to share this here as I don't know whether mapy.cz has a bug or we do use a special implementation for this app which is no longer valid for some reason now. Here is a good problem description from support. I have set as secondary navigation external source - application mapy.cz. The connection between c:geo and mapy.cz worked well until last big update of mapy.cz. Now, when I want to show cache in mapy.cz, it doesn't work. Through c:geo is opened application mapy.cz, but coordines are no shown (this worked before). It only works when I copy coordinates in format DD.DDDDD from c:geo to mapy.cz and I have to change "," for "." because it is copied from c:geo with ",", but it doesn't work in mapy.cz with ",".
Manager.title: Coord handover to mapy.cz no longer working

Manager.description: Current market version 2015.10.30 and current master (NB): Open a saved cache without waypoints Add a new waypoint of type "Stage with question" (others might produce the problem as well, however "Reference point" is working) Enter the note (NoteA) for this waypoint in the note field Save the waypoint Verify that the waypoint is stored and the note is shown correctly Add another waypoint of type "Stage with questions" Enter the Note (NoteB) for this waypoint in the note field Save the waypoint Result: Both waypoints shown with correct coords but both waypoints show "NoteA", the string "NoteB" is lost.
Manager.title: Inconsistency of notes in user defined waypoints

Manager.description: Thanks for the app! Recently, I was thinking about a new feature. Usually, I save the geocaches for one city before I go for hunting. After a while, many caches are in a list and many of them I saved weeks ago. It would be nice have a button to reload all saved geocaches and make the description up-to-date. At the moment, you have to click on each individually to update them.
Manager.title: Reload all saved caches and update all descriptions at once

Manager.description: From support mail: Basic user Perform search Load more results Load more results Repeat until you notice that some caches are no longer properly sorted as selected (by distance as default) Video: https://www.dropbox.com/s/yfb28mm3xqdri7f/SCR_20151108_101144.mp4?dl=0
Manager.title: Wrong sorting after continously loading more caches in search results

Manager.description: Since we use properties
Manager.title: Versioneye not working anymore

Manager.description: From FB: Some people seem to get mails from Groundspeak where the URL has the portnumber appended. Those links fail to open with c:geo. Example: http://coord.info:80/TB6Y8N6
Manager.title: Coord info link with port number not working

Manager.description: Folllowing info from support mail (and I have also seen this happening once in a while). It seems that the process is triggered which should merge the notes between local and server although there is no server communication involved. Here is the info from support mail: Problem's scenario: save a cache offline, add a personal note, save it and leave the cache return to the cache with the previously saved personal note re-edit the note (change some stuff, perhaps use copy 'n paste) and save it --> the personal note is duplicated, with a "--" line between the copies Most sadly this is not deterministic. And although I tested and checked a lot, I cannot say which steps lead to this behavior, nor which conditions "must" be fulfilled to let it happen. Moreover it does not happen with every cache, but if it happened once, it happens every time I change the note of this cache. What I can say: It does not matter if I have previously uploaded the personal note or not; it does not matter where the cursor stands in the text; it seems to not matter if I use copy 'n paste or not.
Manager.title: Personal note doubled

Manager.description: As listed in #5251 the master branch is not yet ready to release. However I just noticed that we still have the Moto G compass problem pending in the field and resolved on release. Therefore I just produced a RC version to give it a basic test with the goal of releasing it tomorrow. Any objections to a release (not sure what is going on on master at the moment which might be important for release).
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: So nice to get another of my feature requests (#4058) fulfilled! Thanks a lot @ThibaultR for the coding! But I just discovered that the feature is missing on caches that you own.
Manager.title: Watchlist total not visible on own caches

Manager.description: There are instructions how to contribute, but there is no info how to configure all the stuff to build c:geo (IntelliJ Idea, SDK, Gradle, etc.), . It can be helpful for beginner developers...
Manager.title: Add instruction for beginners how to configure build environment

Manager.description: Does anyone have experience with c:geo on an Android 6.0 device? From support mail: My "guess" is that "something" within my recent update to Android v6.0 Marshmallow has changed how the state of Google Play Services "appears" to the C:Geo app. (appears to be disabled). [...] MAPS and CALENDAR seem to work fine...........but C:Geo still displays "GPS disabled" when I have your System/Use Google Play Services enabled (checked). So I'm "guessing" that Play services may well be active, but it appears to C:geo to be disabled. Alternatively, there may be something unique about my Android v6.0 and Nexus 7 (2013) which is disabling c:Geo's access to that service. Who knows?
Manager.title: PlayServices Android 6.0 compatability?

Manager.description: Found this strange issue during Russian localization testing. Here is the test case: Store a cache for offline use. Open Cache details Slide to page with Waypoints or Images Press button with 3 dots Press 'Personal notes" Enter some text Press "OK" Application will crash. Some notes: The case is not reproducible from Description or Details or Logbook pages, only from Images and WP I found that I cannot add a personal note to a cache if it wasn't stored. Button "Personal notes" just does nothing. I assume this as a separated FR to allow to write personal notes for non-stored caches (or add error message for such case) My phone is Xperia Z3 Compact, Android 5.1.1 C:geo 2015.11.29-NB1-a4faa8b
Manager.title: Crash when adding personal note from WP or Images tab

Manager.description: Market version 2015.11.29: After selecting delete on cache detail page some users see a toast message "cgeo could not find the cache" (or similar) when returning to the list.
Manager.title: Wrong error toast after deleting cache from list

Manager.description: From FB: Within the status filters it would be good to have an option to show only caches which have any found logs within the last 30 days.
Manager.title: Have "status" filter for "Found within the last 30 days"

Manager.description: It would be useful to be able to click on a FAQ title (in the full version of the FAQ) and get a link to the anchor of the entry, so that we can easily send it when answering a support question without looking for the right link again in the summary.
Manager.title: Add self-links to FAQ

Manager.description: Now distance units are not being localized
Manager.title: Add localized versions for distance units

Manager.description: Small glitch in the implementation for #5226: If I have a filtered list (e.g. 'Status -found') and I remove the caches that are in the result (e.g. moving those to another list or deleting them), I get the suggestion to delete this allegedly empty list in spite of the number of filtered out caches still present on it.
Manager.title: Bug: Suggestion to delete filtered list with empty result

Manager.description: A very funny feature would be in "Live MAP" on klick a button -> see all in the direction of travel
Manager.title: On Live MAP in the direction of travel

Manager.description: Also a very funny feature would be select/unselect Mysterys in the Live Map
Manager.title: On Live MAP select/unselect Mysterys

Manager.description: Sorry for my bad english :-( I want to select Tradi AND Multi AND EarthCaches Now only one thing is possible or ALL Cacheforms I mean: I want see ALL Caches but NO Mysterys. That is not possible with the filters. Manager.description: Yesterday it was cold (~0°C and windy). Since I don't have gloves for touchscreen use I got cold fingers while using cgeo - I don't like cold fingers. So thinking about how it could be possible to use cgeo with gloves the motion sensor came into my mind: For CacheDetailView: tend to the left / right ^= wipe to the left / right tend to the top / bottom ^= scroll up / down For Map: maybe we can add crosshairs which can be moved by tending the phone. to select fast move forward and back. But this can also be added later. For Lists / mainmenu: highlight the current selected item. move selection by tending the phone. select in the same way like map-select. Back: fast move left / right.
Manager.title: alternative control concept for cgeo

Manager.description:
..or improve it to make it more reliable. Several users contact us regularly having problems with strange waypoints automatically created by parsing of the personal note. There seem to be cases, where we parse nonsense. One example I received today: Personal note content: A=6 B=0 C=5 D=4 E=13
N 48° 53.(A*C*E)+194 E 009° 11.((D*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(6*5*13)+194 E 009° 11.((4*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(390)+194 E 009° 11.((284)-0)-1 N 48° 53.584 E 009° 11.283 c:geo creates the following waypoint as parsing result: N 48° 53,000 E 006° 00,000 This means users might see a lot of incorrect waypoints on their map without a possibility to permanentely remove them. So I suggest to either improve the parsing or add an option to disable it in general so that affected users have a solution.
Manager.title: Improve coord parsing from personal note

Manager.description: For me when opening a cache in maps.me it shows the right area, but no marker. And it seems to be in a search mode somehow. Not sure if we changed something or maps.me did...
Manager.title: Maps.me no marker

I made two screenshots: 2012.12.06-NB-d90449f I don't know what causes the issue and I can not reproduce this @ home. :(

Manager.description: When tapping on the owner name in the cache listing view, you can already call by context menu the Groundspeak web site to send a private message to the cache owner. While running with bad internet connection throw the forest and not liking to load a web page first, it would be nice to be able to type in the message content directly in the c:geo app and the app will automatically send it via Groundspeak to the owner. Also nice then, if the app will show a prefilled edit box with {cache owner name}, {cache name}, {GC code} and {my nick name} in the following format: Hello {cache owner name}, “{cache name}” ({GC code}). Regards, {my nick name} So you can directly post your concerns, without coping or typing boring standard content.
Manager.title: In-app "Send message" (mail to owner)

Manager.description: In order to untangle the current mess with changed waypoint descriptions and such, I would suggest to separate the waypoint description as loaded from the source (website, OKAPI, gpx) from the user additions. Than we can clearly detect website changes and update the local waypoint accordingly without endangering user-entered data. As a migration path I would suggest to treat the current description as user supplied and remove if it is identical to the website description on next update. Comments?
Manager.title: Idea: Change waypoint storage

Manager.description: I suggest we exclude the dedicated website tests (where each connector is tested one time) from normal unit testing. Benefit: Continuous integration testing on code changes is not affected by websites being down (e.g. OC.es right now). Drawback: We might take longer to notice parser issues after website changes, depending on how often we look at failing website tests.
Manager.title: exclude watchdog test from normal testing

It will get the description of the first waypoint as well. Create another waypoint with a description. It will keep its description. Master from today morning.

Manager.description: ...but make it depending on the sum of caches on that list. Quite often user complain that they are unable to refresh all saved caches. Reason is always, that this menu item is hidden on the all caches list indepently of the number of caches on that list. This "feature" was initially introduced to avoid unnecessary refresh of a large amount of caches. However I have seen many cases where users have something like e.g. 6 lists with 5 caches each and would like to refresh all 30 on the all caches list which wont work but require to seperately refresh each list. I instead suggest to use a hardcoded limit for the amount of caches on the "All caches" list where the "refresh all" option is hidden. My suggestion would be >500 caches and not to simply hide the option but display a info toast when it is selected. On other lists there should stay no restriction. Another option would be to allow it on all lists but only present a warning if the amount of caches is >500. Opinions?
Manager.title: Do not simply hide the "Refresh all" option on the "All caches" list

Manager.description: With 2016.01.19: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:62) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:150) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4385) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:849) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:607) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.PocketQueryListAdapter.addAll at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.PocketQueryListActivity$1.call(PocketQueryListActivity.java:41) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.PocketQueryListActivity$1.call(PocketQueryListActivity.java:33) at rx.Observable$27.onNext(Observable.java:7928) at rx.observers.SafeSubscriber.onNext(SafeSubscriber.java:139) at rx.android.app.OperatorConditionalBinding$1.onNext(OperatorConditionalBinding.java:79) at rx.internal.operators.OperatorObserveOn$ObserveOnSubscriber.pollQueue(OperatorObserveOn.java:202) at rx.internal.operators.OperatorObserveOn$ObserveOnSubscriber$2.call(OperatorObserveOn.java:162) at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:55) ... 9 more addAll() has only been added in API 11, so the crash happens on Android 2.3.x. This seems to have been introduced at 7ff76b2.
Manager.title: Crash in PocketQueryListActivity

Manager.description: From release 2016.01.19: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:62) at rx.schedulers.ExecutorScheduler$ExecutorSchedulerWorker.run(ExecutorScheduler.java:98) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1112) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:587) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818) Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: credentials are not valid at cgeo.geocaching.settings.Credentials.guard(Credentials.java:92) at cgeo.geocaching.settings.Credentials.getUsername(Credentials.java:53) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.ec.ECLogin.login(ECLogin.java:48) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.AbstractLogin.login(AbstractLogin.java:78) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.ec.ECConnector.login(ECConnector.java:139) at cgeo.geocaching.MainActivity$4.call(MainActivity.java:271) at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:55) ... 4 more

I don't know why Ihave this feeling, maybe because the icon does not really look clickable. I would honestly prefer the old implementation. Opinions on that?
Manager.title: The improved dialog for PQ import is less intuitive

Manager.description: from facebook: Does cgeo automatically decode encrypted logs? I have permanently encrypted a log entry on one of my caches as it gave clues to the cache location. On the web page the entry appears encrypted but cgeo shows it in plain text. GC59E5Z, log entry for 27 Aug 15 This is because we use the "Decrypt" button functionality when fetching logs. It should be possible rather easily to instead fetch the non decrypted JSON. I'm just wondering if we would need a new database column for log entries. To my mind it should in principle not matter for our app whether the stored log text is actually encrypted or not. Clicking it in the UI will just toggle, independent of whether we known its state. Am I right with that concept? If so, we could probably just pimp the JSON parser.
Manager.title: support encrypted logs

Comments?

Manager.description: Right now it is impossible to tell if a trackable opened from search is either travel bug or geokrety or geolutin. As far as I can see the "type" line might distinguish coins (if travel bug connector), books (if geokrety) and similar, but it does not tell which company/website manages this trackable. As there are users which don't want to register at all sites, we should make it possible to recognize very easily to which site/brand this trackable belongs. @kumy maybe this is of interest for you, since you changed a lot around trackables?
Manager.title: Add trackable brand to activity

Manager.description: While the signatures are correct, the authorization process fails right at the beginning, at least on Android 6.0. It might be due to the use of HTTP/2 (h2).
