Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a saved cache Go to description tab Long press on the listing text Actual behaviour after performing these steps: Norhing happens Expected behaviour after performing these steps: Selection mode is started and I am able to select part of / the whole text Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.23-RC Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Device: HTC Wildfire S (htc_marvel, htc_europe) Android version: 2.3.5 ... Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: Can not select cache description with Android 2.3

Manager.description: The current RC is at least missing one string (i.e. string name="cache_found_last_30_days") and I cant find it on crowdin either. Outdated upload or problem with the branching? @rsudev
Manager.title: Translation missing in current RC version

Manager.description: According to the latest Groundspeak release notes they are conducting a test where 50% od users do receive the search view as landing page (when logged in) instead of the default page. I am wondering if this has any consequences for c:geo. Can all of you check what page you receive when opening http://www.geocaching.com and if you have the new behaviour do some smoke tests with your account in c:geo? Not sure however if this test is bound to 50% of users or 50% of calls to the URL...
Manager.title: New default page on geocaching.com test phase

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a saved cache Create a waypoint, select to change coords locally to listing coords Refresh the cache Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The local change is lost and replaced again by the listing coords retrieved during refresh Expected behaviour after performing these steps: As the user defined change was done, it is not correct that this data is lost by refreshing. Not all users will understand this in beforehand and loss of data will appear. Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.23-RC Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Not relevant Other comments and remarks: Follow up of #5439 Comment by @blochi79: Now we have a follow problem. ;-( The local header coordinates are overwritten if the cache is refreshed. The method for refreshing a cache needs also to be adapted for the case that the local header coordinates have been corrected. Then the original coordinates in waypoints must be updated with the Listing coordinates instead of the header coordinates. [...] I often perform bulk refresh of mixed lists that contains also traditional caches. In this case I don't want to lose the corrected coordinates of letterbox or Wherigo caches. I did not know that it is the default behavior of c:geo to overwrite the local corrected coordinates with the listing coordinates. I think the current issue can be closed and the behavior of overwriting corrected coordinates while refreshing a cache may be discussed as subject of another issue. Sorry for the confusion.
Manager.title: Locally changed coords replaced by listing coords on refresh

Manager.description: For mystery-caches, which include final coords already in the listing, which is sometimes the case for challenge-caches, the additional red flag over the cache symbol is displayed in the list view, but not on the map view. Example: http://coord.info/GC5AZ68 Version: latest nightly, but noticed this already few months ago.
Manager.title: red flag missing on map for mystery caches, where the listing itself includes final coords

Manager.description: Garmin devices have a nice feature for images that provide GPS coordinates via Exif: They place a picture icon on the map that shows a thumbnail of the image when activated. I found this feature very helpful and would therefore propose to add a similar feature to c:geo.
Manager.title: Show geotagged log or listing images on the map

Manager.description: 2016.02.25-NB (but maybe also in current market release) Login as BM Perform nearby search Open a premium caches from the result list Unknown error is shown instead of the the correct message, that the cache is only for PM
Manager.title: Wrong error toast if BM tries to open a PMO-cache

Manager.description: As written in some commit comment: CI fails building nightly since some recent library update.
Manager.title: CI not building nightly from master

Manager.description: Select some text of the description. Close selection mode. Try to scroll the view up and down. It jumps around.
Manager.title: Scrolling broken after selection

Manager.description: 2016.02.27-RC: Open a cache Compose log which contains some line feeds and empty lines between each test block Send the log Go to the logbook tab The log is shown but missing all line feeds. Only after refreshing the cache (thus getting the log from the server) it is shown in a normal way.
Manager.title: Line feeds missing for own logs in logbook view after posting it

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Users reported on support and FB report that the NB is installable but crashed immediately after starting. Could be related to #5489 Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you: To be checked Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Will attach log this evening (or someone can help out please)
Manager.title: Nightly build 2016.02.29 not starting

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: downloaded the nightly build apks for at least 5 days now tried to install these builds installation did not work, I get "App wurde nicht installiert", that's it, no further information visible Version of c:geo used: The current nightly builds, tried for at least 5 days Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Other comments and remarks: all other apps, doesn't matter if from Play Store, F-Droid or manual install with the apk work on my device
Manager.title: Nightly Build: unable to install for days

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: PM-user User has no favorite point left to assign Open cache details of a cache which is not yet a favorited cache of the user Click the "Add" button in the favorite point section Actual behaviour after performing these steps: "This is one of your favorites" is shown in cache details and no error message is shown. After refreshing the cache again "This is not one of your favorites" is shown as assigning the favpoint did not work (because the user is out of available favorite points) Expected behaviour after performing these steps: A correct error message should be shown and the status should not be changed Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.03 Is the problem reproducible for you: Reported via FB but not tested myself (due to 21 favorite points available :( ) Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: No error message when adding favorite point from cache details fails

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Search for and open GC5XBKZ, GC5NVYK or GC68R58 and many more with the partial name Bild af Piteå. Actual behaviour after performing these steps: After a second the app crashes and sends you back to the start page. It just happens with some caches, not all. One common thing with the ones that causes the crash seems to be that they all have linked images from dropbox in the description using the short url format https://db.tt/U7YqJqwN.Don't know if it is a coincident or not. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.05 NB The bug has been present in the NB:s for maybe a week by now. Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes
Manager.title: Crashes when opening cache description with image from dropbox

Manager.description: This works: https://opencaching.de/OC10DA9 This does not work: https://www.opencaching.de/viewcache.php?wp=OC10DA9 https://www.opencaching.de/viewcache.php?cacheid=172122
Manager.title: Support all OpenCaching URLs

Manager.description: OpenCaching supports cache descriptions in multiple languages. c:geo should request one in the user's language. It looks like this is already supported (#4559 + #2512), but not when you forced English in c:geo's preferences.
Manager.title: Request cache description in other language

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: For some reason (maybe as I used c:geo on several devices and authorized them) Twitter denies posting a tweet via the API This seems to be indicated by a 403 error (see attached log Actual behaviour after performing these steps: No special UI indication. Twitter still shown as authorized in settings Expected behaviour after performing these steps: This should be detected (if possible), the user notified and the stored authorization should be revoked Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.03 Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes (under the mentioned conditions) Other comments and remarks: Log: 22:09:15.248 Warning cgeo 7216 [AsyncTask #5] 403 [Forbidden] (403 ms) POST https://api.twitter.com/1.1/statuses/update.json 22:09:15.248 Error cgeo 7216 [AsyncTask #5] Tweet could not be posted. Reason: HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden [cache-control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, pre-check=0, post-check=0, content-disposition: attachment; filename=json.json, content-type: application/json;charset=utf-8, date: Sun, 06 Mar 2016 21:09:15 GMT, expires: Tue, 31 Mar 1981 05:00:00 GMT, last-modified: Sun, 06 Mar 2016 21:09:15 GMT, pragma: no-cache, server: tsa_o, status: 403 Forbidden, strict-transport-security: max-age=631138519, x-access-level: read-write, x-connection-hash: b19230bade95cc6affd2b3181485e2af, x-content-type-options: nosniff, x-frame-options: SAMEORIGIN, x-response-time: 136, x-transaction: baed1ecc1b734226, x-tsa-request-body-time: 0, x-twitter-response-tags: BouncerCompliant, x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block]
Manager.title: Twitter: Needed revalidation not detected

Manager.description: Something with OKAPI? File upload size limits on the individual servers?
Manager.title: Attach images to logs not supported for The Opencaching network. Why?

Expected behaviour after performing these steps: The button "Own coordinates" should update the fields with the actual coordinates. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.10-NB (but probably since we introduced the new input dialog) Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Other comments and remarks:

Manager.description: Just a reminder for me to test this and maybe clean install before retesting. I noticed today with 2016.03.14-NB that cgeo is laggy in responding to clicks. Especially after pressing the three dot button in cache details or popup may take a few seconds to open the menu.
Manager.title: Performance issue

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open cache details activity, scroll down Add to list Actual behaviour after performing these steps: Details activity refreshes, we jump to the top of the screen Expected behaviour after performing these steps: No reload/refresh of the activity, but just refreshing the view containing the list names
Manager.title: don't reload after adding to list

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: IOpen a gallery tab of a cache containing georeference pictures (Having our new overlay) Long press on the picture Actual behaviour after performing these steps: Only some "Open with..." options are shown in the menu Expected behaviour after performing these steps: As a click on the overlay can "only" trigger the prefered navigation I would suggest to include the full navigation menu offering all methods in the context menu after long press Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.15-NB Other comments and remarks: This will also make the feature more usable as the user might fail to recognize that clicking the overlay on the picture triggers an navigation action
Manager.title: Add exif target navigation to picture context menu

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: PM-user Open a unsaved cache in c:geo Edit the personal note Actual behaviour after performing these steps: There is no upload button shown as long as the cache is not saved in c:geo Expected behaviour after performing these steps: I don't see a reason why we can't upload the note for unsaved caches?! (Not sure if it worked before) Else the upload button should be shown and the user should be asked to save the cache before uploading the note (like in other places if data is added). Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.15-NB Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes
Manager.title: Upload of personal note only if cache is saved

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a cache that is not currently stored in the device Go to the Description tab Press "Edit" under Personal note The message "The cache has been stored locally" is shown. Enter something in the Personal note field and save the changes by pressing the checkmark Go back to the Details tab Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The cache does not seem to be stored in any List since the Lists panel is empty. You have to refresh the cache details for it to appear in the List view in the List "Stored" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.19 NB Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Other comments and remarks: Bug related to the newly implemented feature #87

Manager.description: In order to optimize the usability of the possibility to have a cache on more than on list: Instead of the new multiple buttons for ¨Remove from list¨ couldn`t we just make the list selection dialog checkbox based and keep the remaining UI elements on cache details as they have been before? IMHO this would have some advantages: Moving a cache from one list to another currently got more complicated than before No cluttering of buttons on cache detals page Simultanous storing to multiple lists possible in one dialog Doing it like this would also bring it more into the direction of the discussed ¨tag¨ strategy
Manager.title: Finalize multi list UI (first step for release)

Expected behavior after performing these steps: Both images should be shown. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.20-null-20cccf9 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

Manager.title: Heads up: Website update

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Install and start c:geo setup asks for geocaching.com login Actual behavior after performing these steps: default service is geocaching.com Expected behavior after performing these steps: user should be able to choose service, e.g. geocaching.de, geocaching.pl etc Version of c:geo used: all Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Since there are many other services suppoted besides geocaching.com, the user should be able to choose a service when setting up their geocaching account. Currently the setup only allows geocaching.com, other services have to be set up manually and there is no option to choose them after installation.
Manager.title: choose service other than the default geocaching.com on first run after installation

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to the about screen then swipe to system tab Actual behavior after performing these steps: Only a button to copy system informations to clipboard is available Expected behavior after performing these steps: There should be a way to send the informations via mail Version of c:geo used: master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: In my personal case, each time I need to provide system informations, a use the copy to clipboard button, then paste it in a mail.
Manager.title: Add a send button to the About - System screen

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: There are numerous users on support mail, who have graphical problems and stability problems. All of them have in common: They either have a new device with Android 6.0 or recently upgraded to Android 6.0 In all system informations I do see that HW-acceleration is switched off (HW acceleration: disabled (manually changed)) After enabling it, the problems are gone Expected behavior after performing these steps: The users do say that they did not manually change this setting before. Is there any problem in the code, which may lead to the effect, that it is disabled on Android 6.0? Is this setting contained in any (google) backup and might be wrongly restored on a users new device? Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.06.
Manager.title: HW acceleration switched off on Android 6.0

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to Menu -> Settings - Services - geocaching.com Try to authorize with correct username but wrong password Actual behavior after performing these steps: The following prompt is shown: Expected behavior after performing these steps: The cause string "Wrong username and/or password should be shown" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: not relevant Other comments and remarks: Happens since the implementation of the new authentication menus
Manager.title: Cause string missing on login failure

Manager.description: Actual behavior after performing these steps: With the new authentication menu the password field is empty when accessing the reauthentication screen. The user has to reenter his password in order to check it. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The old 'Check Login' function is a procedure well used in my support mail activity and also AFAIR in our FAQ. I would like to see that the old password is kept here, so that we can instruct the user to check the login without the need to enter the password again. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes 👍 1
Manager.title: Allow check authentication without need to reenter password

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open Menu - Settings - Services - geocaching.com You will see an "Create account" menu entry in the section "Information" Open the authentication screen You will see another "Create account" menu item Go to Menu - Settings - Services - opencaching.* You will see an "Create account" menu entry in the section "Information" Open the authentication screen You will not see "Create account" menu item Expected behavior after performing these steps: We should clean this up to have it only at one place. For me having it in the authentication screen rather than in the "information" section looks more straight forward. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Create account menu is doubled for some connectors

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open Menu - About c:geo - System Actual behavior after performing these steps: "Send" button is clatched right next to "Copy to Clipboard". This looks strange and in some languages we might run out of the screen. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Have a separate button in the line below "Copy to Clipboard" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Have Send button in system information in a new line

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Be logged in as user A for geocaching.com with c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com and authenticate sucesfully as user B Go back to the main screen Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com again Note that the authentication status is correct (correct user and avatar) Open the authentication screen Actual behavior after performing these steps: The username of user A is still shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: The username of user B should be shown as he is currently authorized Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: During my tests I also had the connectors for opencaching.de, extremcaching.com also active with user A. MIght be relevant if there is some mix up between the connectors here.
Manager.title: Wrong username kept in authentication screen

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Launch a build on android studio with the current master Actual behavior after performing these steps: Build failed (for missing files): /.idea/modules/cgeo.iml /.idea/modules/cgeo-calendar/cgeo-calendar.iml /.idea/modules/cgeo-contacts/cgeo-contacts.iml /.idea/modules/main/main.iml /.idea/modules/mapswithme-api/mapswithme-api.iml /.idea/modules/showcaseview/showcaseview.iml Expected behavior after performing these steps: cgeo build succeeds Version of c:geo used: Any pull after the commit f2ef045 (03-20-2016) master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Android studio, Open SuSE KDE Other comments and remarks: Build was working before the move of the missing files and is still working if I jump back before the commit f2ef045 (03-20-2016) Many thanks in advance
Manager.title: cgeo doesn't build on android Studio

Manager.description: https://github.com/blog/2141-squash-your-commits I'm in favor of only allowing squash merging. That way our history no longer contains "sprinkled" commits, if someone worked over multiple times and commits on a feature that was later merged via pull request (and where some other commits where done over the same time span on master). (The problem isn't that big in our repository, since most of the time there isn't much overlap. At work we are pushing up to 200 times per day on my current project in multiple parallel feature branches, and developers basically got insane trying to read the history before we activated cherry-pick-merging in our gerrit review system) What's your opinion?
Manager.title: Squash on merge?

Manager.description: We currently derive the registration URL for OC nodes directly from the host name. The canonical way is to use the OKAPI itself. http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/apisrv/installation
Manager.title: use OKAPI for construction registration URL

Manager.description: Right now we include the resource strings for all languages from the library projects that we use. We should only include the languages that we actually maintian in the app, to make the libraries and the app use the same language (and not have translated library things, where there is no translation in the app). Note to everyone maintaining the translations: This change requires that newly added languages are explicitly added to build.gradle.
Manager.title: remove unused library languages

Manager.description: Do you know about tools for Java like Hound? Or Coverity. Could we get benefit by activating such hooks for our PR?
Manager.title: Pull Requests automatic code analysis

Manager.description: Feature Requst/Suggestion: A configuration option could be added to define, if a cache should be move to a specific list right after logging it (offline/online). The target list could either be a configurable one, or a fixed/predefinged one that is supposed to contain finds (when logging online) or caches to log online when doing offline logging. After moving the cache to the target list, it would be removed from all other lists.
Manager.title: When logging a cache, move cache to a specific list

Manager.description: As originally posted in #5603 👍 Wouldn't it be meaningful to reuse the (already translated) string for "Create account" as it was used in the upper menu before instead of creating a new one which will again need translation? 👍 1
Manager.title: Reuse string for "Create account" in new authentication screens

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Enable extremcaching.com Search nearby caches From the result list open a EC cache Go back to the search results Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache which was just opened and closed is shown as saved (icon overlay) in the search result list. Entering the details again it is shown to be saved to the default list, but it can not be found there and it should not be saved at all. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Don't show it as saved. Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.03-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Does not happen for GC or OC as far as I could test but I am not sure.
Manager.title: Caches from EC shown as saved once opened

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to Menu - Settings - Services - geocaching.com Enter wrong password Send for authentication Actual behavior after performing these steps: The string of the error message ends with doubled point Expected behavior after performing these steps: Not doubled point or no point at all (my preference) Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.05-NB Other comments and remarks: Will fix this myself in strings. Assigning myself
Manager.title: Doubled point at string end

Manager.description: With the fix for #2281 it was introduced that c:geo is aborted on log.e when debug mode is active. It might happen that users claim such events on support. Having that cause in mind it would be good if the current setting could be included in the system information in About c:geo -> System like: Debug mode active: Yes/No 👍 1
Manager.title: Include info about debug mode into system information

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Disable Settings - Offline Data - "Ask for list" Open unsaved cache Select "Store" Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache details do not reflect that the cache has been stored, the cache is not stored to the default list Expected behavior after performing these steps: Cache is stored to the default list Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.07-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: We might also decide to remove the "Ask for list" setting as it is contrary to the desired tag/multi-list feature

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Finish language Use "Register" in send2cgeo service to obtain a PIN from our server Actual behavior after performing these steps: Instead of the PIN ### is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: PIN is shown. Version of c:geo used: 206.03.06 System information: Finish language Other comments and remarks: I suspect the problem might be that the translation is wrong. The english original contains #### as a placeholder while finish misses on # Can someone confirm this reason, then I will correct it on Crowdin.
Manager.title: Send2cgeo PIN not showing up (finish locale)

Manager.description: This is no c:geo issue, but an information to all c:geo developers. If there is another way to do this (e.g. a mailing list), please let me know. A changelog has been added to OKAPI, to keep the application developers informed: http://opencaching.de/okapi/changelog.html You may also subscribe to the RSS feed on that page.
Manager.title: Introducing the OKAPI changelog

Manager.description: Hi, we started use Coverity for analyse code at work. This tool is also available for open-source projects. For more information: https://scan.coverity.com/github I was wondering how much bugs it will found for cgeo application. I tried it on assembleDebug target and it found only 49 defects in code. So thanks, you are doing great job ;) If you agree cgeo can use coverity time to time (it can be executed in periods). And we can fix these issues ;) This tool use famous project like python, perl, ruby and another ...
Manager.title: Coverity - static analyse tool

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC69K36 Select Menu -> Open Geochecker Geocheck.org is opened for GC5YH05 Actual behavior after performing these steps: It opens a geocheck link for another cache (this cache should not have any checker as it is a traditional type and does not contain such a reference/link in its description AFAICS) Expected behavior after performing these steps: No geocheck menu Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.11-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Wrong geochecker link in cache details menu

Manager.description: I just built 2016.04.12 from release branch as there are several rather important fixes. Will do smoke testing and publish to 20% (after short OK on IRC today). This is a reminder for the remaining tasks: Rename release branch milestone and create new milestone "Next release branch" Tag the release on Github Publish release on Github Review Google Play reports and set to 100% Update Notification if release is pubslihed to 100% Publish to Fdroid

Manager.description: This is a feature request. It would be great if the running c:geo could appear above the android lock screen. In this way, you could reach the already running c:geo without unlocking the device. I saw similar feature in Locus and Cachebox. This feature can be switched on/off in these apps. Thanks.
Manager.title: Android lock screen

Manager.description:
Two users had problems lately to contact the support mail address. Reason: This message was created automatically by mail delivery software.
A message that you sent could not be delivered to one or more of its recipients. This is a permanent error. The following address(es) failed:
support@cgeo.org: SMTP error from remote server for RCPT TO command, host: mail.cgeo.org (193.95.241.239) reason: 550-X-Warning: 212.227.15.14 is listed at dnsbl.sorbs.net (127.0.0.15: 550 Virus Transmitting Server See: http://www.sorbs.net/lookup.shtml?212.2 27.15.14) Anything we can do about that? They reached us now, so the problem might have been temporary...but still I don't know.
Manager.title: Support mail problems

Manager.description: To whomever administrates the c:geo Google+ account: Could you make myself an editor (or whatever role is appropriate there) in order to share posts we do to other social networks also on G+? The information and pictures there are well outdated (2014) and I can offer to align it at least with the facebook postings.
Manager.title: More editors for c:geo G+ account

Manager.description: From time to time users complain, that texts and symboles on OSM-Online maps are too small to read on a high res device. Locus does support a selectable scaling option for that problem. c:geo could have the same. AFAIR the setting for "Increase text size" does also only work for offline maps...am I right? Find attached an example screenshot from LG G4 with resolution 2560x1440:
Manager.title: OSM: Support zoom of map text

Manager.description: We have 3 build jobs, which already differ slightly in the (script) code they use. I want to avoid that. At work we have solved this by having just one real build job, which is parameterized and all other jobs then trigger this one with a set of matching parameters. However, that has the drawback that this single job is run in different contexts, leading to jumps in every graph you create from the build. Therefore I'm thinking that we should only extract the main shell script part from all the 3 jobs. If we create another job just for this script, and then execute it in the workspace of the calling job then we should be able to have all other things remain as before, but still avoid the code duplication. Other ideas?
Manager.title: Remove code duplication in jenkins jobs

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Store a cache on the map Tap on the icon to open the popup Actual behavior after performing these steps: There are two buttons: Refresh and Store, both with only the first few characters visible and ending with "…" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The Store button should be something like "Manage lists". It is not possible to delete the cache (the Store button changed to Drop previously). Version of c:geo used: master (915fd8c)
Manager.title: Map popup multi-list issues

Manager.description: This is a feature request for the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes. Use case example: Go on a multi cache hunt Store the cache locally Write down A, B, C, etc. in the personal notes section of the multi cache Calculate the final coord by switching between personal notes and a calculator app back and forth. When done, you have the final coord written down in your personal notes. Now you have to swipe left twice and hit the "Add waypoint" button to add the final coords. The little window opens and you have to put in the numbers. My personal problem here is that I can't kepp more than 5 numbers in mind, so I enter the North coordinate, hit the tick symbol, go back to personal notes, read the East coord, go back to waypoints and enter the East coordinate. (You see, this workflow works and the app does what it should, but it could be easier for the user I think.) Expected behavior: I personally see two possible improvements: Expect the app to parse my personal notes after saving for something like "Final: N 47.123 E 8 33.123" and create the waypoint accordingly. Highlight the coord in the personal notes and allow the user by clicking on it to choose "Add to waypoints" or "Update existing waypoint"... something like that Version of c:geo used: Not relevant System information: Not relevant Other comments and remarks: I love caching and your app since 2011 - big thanks to you guys!
Manager.title: Add the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes

Manager.description: Developers of c:geo, I have found that AsyncTask.execute has been widely used in the project. However, this API is relatively slower on devices with system version higher than 3.0 because " AsyncTasks were executed serially on a single background thread" for systems newer than 3.0. (This is found in the API guide) While using c:geo, users can easily trigger multiple AsyncTasks and influence the performance, so I think it will help to improve the performance by changing execute to executeOnExecutor to enable real multi-thread execution. Thanks a lot.
Manager.title: Performance issue caused by AsyncTask.execute

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: I can select maps source folder in section offline map sources But i cannot select folder _themes. Only options for creating a new folder is available. Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.12 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Huawei Mate 8, Android 6.0. , allowing apps to access SD card (installed as external storage)
Manager.title: Cannot select folder for _themes in setting section.

Manager.description: Hello developers of c:geo, I have found that AlarmManager.set() is used in CgeoApplication to set a PendingIntent to restart the MainActivity in 0.5 seconds. But this API may not send the intent in time on devices newer than KitKat. As I found in API guide, alarm set by this API may be deferred sometime so that the activity will not be restarted in that small time interval as expected. Using API setExact will make sure to send the alarm at that exact time. Hope this information is useful for you. :) Thanks a lot.
Manager.title: Delayed restart Application

Manager.description: This is to collect feedback how to deal with the recent changes in the Android tool chain. Please refer to the 2.1 release notes described in http://developer.android.com/tools/revisions/studio.html If I got it right, this means for us: We cannot use Java 8 due to the target level restriction. We can upgrade to Studio 2.1, this is still the same underlying IDEA version. We can upgrade the android gradle plugin to 2.1, since that will also work for other IDEs. We should try to enable the new experimental compiler (via PR), since I expect it to be more performant than the tools used before. Or do you consider this to be to unstable? Or do you currently use the Instant Run feature (which doesn't work with the new compiler yet)? We should switch to in-process-dexing for better performance (http://developer.android.com/tools/revisions/gradle-plugin.html , section for release notes 2.1). However, that seems to require more memory than our current docker slaves are configured for. Shall we just try it nevertheless? Shall we go with 8 GB minimum RAM per slave? @samueltardieu and @kumy , would that still fit for you? Anything I missed or where I might be completely wrong?
Manager.title: Android Studio 2.1, Jack compiler

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have new map active as default Apply global type filter (e.g. Traditional only) Open live map Actual behavior after performing these steps: No filter info shown below the action bar Expected behavior after performing these steps: The notfication about an active filter should be shown directly below the action bar (compare to old map) Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: New map: Filter info missing

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Disable the setting -> Offline-Data - Ask for list Open saved list Open cache details of a cache Click on "Manage" Actual behavior after performing these steps: If the cache is not on the standard list it will be moved to standard list. No list selection dialog is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The "Ask for list" setting should not have any influence on the "Manage" function but should always open the list selection dialog Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Manage lists button not working

Manager.description: Enable debug mode Start c:geo and wait for login completion Disable all network connections Open live map Open a saved cache from map Result: App freezes 2016.04.29-NB Edit: Updated steps
Manager.title: Freeze in cache details without network

Manager.description: I just saw that the Pocket Query Creator app was updated yesterday with the comment "Login fix". Did we have any recent increase in reported login problems? I'll try to get some info about what was the problem there.
Manager.title: Login issues?

Manager.description: Disable all cache connectors (I had this by accident after a previous debug session). Search by address, search nearest etc. will return zero results. I suggest that we show an error message for each search, that does not directly lookup a geocode. Cause to my knowledge we only support geocode lookup with disabled connectors. We could also add a warning on the main activity where the login state is shown, but this would potentially be wrong forusers that want to cache completely offline (e.g. by means of importing GPX or whatever, but never using online search).
Manager.title: several searches have zero results if no connector active

Manager.description: Long press cache in the list The menu shows move and cooy as actions To make it consistent with the multi list feature this should be replaced by "Manage" opening the checkbox based selection.
Manager.title: Replace Move/Copy by Manage on lists

Manager.description: Seems like they are now delivered by https. 👍 1
Manager.title: Spoilers not recognized

Manager.description: Fork-off from the last 3 comments here: #5562 (comment) I suggest to render the log images below the log text as following: If it is one image, then stay as of now: (icon) (image title) For more than one image (e.g. 3): (icon) 3 images That takes away the necessity to have humans really read (and split) the concatenated titles. Since we open all images of the given log anyway, I also don't feel is any value in reading all the titles directly below the log text (instead of only in the image list). Opinions?
Manager.title: Rendering of log images

Manager.description: Open map (new mapsforge implementation) Click on a cache to open the popup Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Heading line is shown and title is the correct geocache previously selected Click on the waypoint of a another cache (but not on the cache itself) Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Result: The heading line is updated correctly but the title still shows the cache which was selected in the first step (Problem does only occur for waypoint icons but not for cache icons)
Manager.title: New map: Title for heading line not updated

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open a cache with spoiler images slide to images tab Actual behavior after performing these steps: only images from the description (maybe logs too) Expected behavior after performing these steps: spoiler images should also been displayed Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.03-5cac039 developer build Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: (not at home for some days, can someone cross check please) found that yeterday, and someone else reported to me the same bug.
Manager.title: Spoiler images not displayed

Manager.description: Due to #5718 I suggest (as also @banaweizen suggested within the issue) to have a shortterm bugfix release. Looking at the release branch I do only see this single change, which I consider not risky in terms of testing need. I have just build a RC version to crosscheck it (but I will have only very limited time). If nothing shows up in my smoke test I suggest releasing it this night or tomorrow morning. Second opinion please! ToDo: Set version code in changelog_release.xml Generate release version Tag release on Github Upload release to Github Rename "Release branch" milestone to release version Create a new "Release branch" milestone Publish release to Google Play (suggest 100% directly) Push notification as soon as available on Google Play
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: I was told to ask in here and I have to admit I am out of my league in here, but I have a request/idea. I have the C:GEO app on a couple of devices. Is there any way to build pocket queries in GGZ format and either use them in the app or export them so they can be used in a Garmin gps? A lot of places I go geocaching does not have cell phone coverage and even though I could use the phone offline I find the gps to work better. I am also asking for bigger pocket queries than GS allows like whole states if needed. A lot of people are traveling and the size of pocket queries are very limiting and they don't want to be adding new ones all the time. Step 1 Step 2 ... Actual behavior after performing these steps: Expected behavior after performing these steps: Version of c:geo used: Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: New request : pocket queries in GGZ

Manager.title: Many exceptions in log in offline case

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: select a target cache the target cache name is displayed in the upper left turn the phone, lock and unlock it, open cache details from pop-up and return to map, ... Actual behavior after performing these steps: the target display vanishes (but the cache is still selected as target) Expected behavior after performing these steps: target cache name still displayed Version of c:geo used: developer version 20160509
Manager.title: Target display lost when turning the phone

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1 Step 2 ... Actual behavior after performing these steps: Expected behavior after performing these steps: additional feature: add proximity signal to c:geo nearing / closing in a geocache (distance might be variable / settable Version of c:geo used: Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: 👍 2
Manager.title: Including proximity warning signal

Manager.description: especially it is not a GC. Thx a lot, meg
Manager.title: How c:geo determine if a waypoint belongs to an cache?

Manager.description: @mucek4 We so again have sme bouncing mails at least from gmail.com SMTP error from remote mail server after end of data: host aspmx.l.google.com [74.125.133.26]: 550-5.7.1 [193.95.241.239 12] Our system has detected that this message is 550-5.7.1 likely unsolicited mail. To reduce the amount of spam sent to Gmail, 550-5.7.1 this message has been blocked. Please visit 550 5.7.1 https://support.google.com/mail/answer/188131 for more information. r11si2166wmb.87 - gsmtp
Manager.title: Bouncing support mails

Manager.description: This is a feature request. Detailed steps causing the problem: import a GPX file there was too little or no feedback when user clicked on GPX file, before import started. User does not know for certain if he/she clicked on the correct file or not. the import progress dialog is shown. This dialog shows a predefined message only. The user does not know which GPX file is currently importing. Expected behavior after performing these steps: the import progress dialog to show the filename of the GPX file being currently imported. Version of c:geo used: 2016-05-09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: GPX file name in Import progress dialog

Manager.description: It would be very handy if one could select the shown cache type directly from inside the map view. This could be similar to how one currently can select the map source. As is now, one always has to exit the map, select the new cache type and enter the map again.
Manager.title: Select cache type directly from within map view

Manager.description: It would be handy if one could select more than one cache type at once. I.e. I would be interested to only see traditional, earth and event caches on the map.
Manager.title: Select multiple cache types at once

Manager.description: I recently adopted a cache and when I open the listing in cgeo I still see the original creator of the cache as owner. It would be nice if you could change this to something like this: Created by (or Creator): name of original owner Owner (only necessary if different from above): name of current owner Thanks! Christian
Manager.title: Feature Request: Add name of adopter to cache description

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map (new map) Click on unsaved cache Select Save Actual behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay not shown for the cache Expected behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay shown. Working with old mapsforge implementation. Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.17-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Same may apply for deleting a cache or updating icon after posting found log
Manager.title: New map: Overlays not updated

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: creat an empty list import GPX file (with any number of caches, I tested with 100+) after import successful dialog, press ok press BACK from GPX files panel to return to list panel Actual behavior after performing these steps: list is shown empty click on lists dropdown shows an update for the "all caches" counter switching lists to all caches shows proper contents switching lists and then back to list into which I imported shows proper content Expected behavior after performing these steps: list to be properly populated after GPX import without the need of further user interraction. Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, always System information: Android 4.4.2 (Huawei Ascend P7) Android 4.2.1 (Allview P5 Quad; MTK cpu with JIT issues) (tested on 2 different devices, same behaviour) Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: List not refreshed properly after import GPX

Manager.description:
Detailed steps causing the problem: appears to be identical to issue #4029 closed in 2014 Firefox 46.0.1 Greasemonkey 3.8 2-MAY-2016 Send2cgeo 0.34 16-MAY-2016 browser and device registered browse to geocaching.com, "Play", "View Geocache Map" right-mouse click on cache to download, click on "Send to c:geo" "Please Wait" is displayed at top and never goes away, never processes the request Actual behavior after performing these steps: nothing happens once the "Please Wait" is displayed Expected behavior after performing these steps: cache should be downloaded with "Success!" displayed Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, but it works fine with Chrome and Tampermonkey System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) The issue is not with c:geo, but with the send2cgeo/Firefox script
##### Other comments and remarks: Browsing to send2.cgeo.org with https produces a Firefox error: "The owner ... has configured their website improperly"
Manager.title: send2cgeo Firefox stalls with endless "Please Wait" - https not configured properly

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: No problem => SUGGESTION Version of c:geo used:2016.05.09 System information: GT-I9305 Android 4.4.4 Other comments and remarks: Hint: it might be practical in c:geo to have a warning beep (or a ringtone of your choice) when passing near a geocache (with distance / adjustable radius). It would be warned when you are cycling for example. MyTrails (FrogSparks) does. I happened to export caches to MyTrails for that, but it's even more applications to run on the smartphone and it is not best for the battery (although I have a Powerbank ).
Manager.title: [Feature Request] Beep alert proximity

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Enable new map Open live map wait till all visible caches are loaded Open menu Actual behavior after performing these steps: No "Store Offline" menu entry is shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: Menu "Store Offline" is shown Version of c:geo used: Reported via `2016.05.29-NB-fb50e95 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Reported by a user via c:geo Fanpage on Facebook. I can reproduce it.
Manager.title: New map: "Store Offline" not shown

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start downloading an online search result list Cancel at some point in between Actual behavior after performing these steps: The online search result list is refreshed and all caches have the offline marker. But in fact, not all have been stored. When randomly clicking caches from the list now, some open immediately, and some will be downloaded first (the ones we cancelled).
Manager.title: cancelling storing leads to wrong markers

Manager.description: From support mail: All worked well until I upgraded to Maps.me 6.0.7 Looking at a list of 40 caches and selecting "Show on a map", then Maps.me There are 40 green dots around where I am standing, GOOD. I tap a dot. It comes up with box and words c:geo and the co-ordinates. I tap the arrow labelled "Back", it then quickly shows a message that it cannot download cache details, and return to the list. The one nearest is top of the list. But I want to research other around and have no idea which is which Previously (before the Maps upgrade) it came up with the cache name, and if I did a back arrow, it then opened that cache's description. So it seems that the interchange parameters to Maps.me has changed with this new version. Please can you look into it? Android 4.1.1 C:geo 2016 05 09
Manager.title: Interworking problem with Maps.me 6.0.7

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC6HP1Y Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache is shown as found altghough it is not found by the user Expected behavior after performing these steps: Correct found state should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 as well as current master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Reported via support mail and reproducible for me
Manager.title: Caches shown as found although not found

Manager.description: Hi c:geo team, Detailed steps causing the problem: Go into an offline list with tens of caches Go to the end (for example), select a cache, move the cache in another list by using the "move" button (or long press the cache, select "move in another list" choice in the menu) Actual behavior after performing these steps: After moving the cache, we are back to the beginning of the list Expected behavior after performing these steps: Stay to the last known position in the list before moving the cache Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Thanks, Tof
Manager.title: In offline list, stay at the last position after moving a cache in another list

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: No multi-filter possibility Actual behavior after performing these steps: Current workaround : apply a first filter, move all results in a temporary list, applu the second filter Expected behavior after performing these steps: A multi-filter fonction (that imagine complicated to implement) Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: It's a feature request, of course. Geo-regards, Tof
Manager.title: Multi-filter in offline list would be great

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Select Search Enter tracking code which is numeric only and has five digits Actual behavior after performing these steps: Immediate response toast "c:geo konnte diesen Trackable nicht finden" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Open trackable page Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: From support mail and verified Secret code available on request
Manager.title: Numeric trackable secret code or five digit code not working

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open cache details of found event or webcam cache Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache details view shows Status Found Expected behavior after performing these steps: Cache details view shows Status Found ([DATE]) Version of c:geo used: 6813f0f Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Other comments and remarks: Tested with GC462DC -> shows date GC5E50Y -> no date GCMMNE -> no date
Manager.title: Missing found date for event and webcam caches

Manager.description: Import the 3 lab cache GPX files from GC55555. Cache number 10 will always overwrite the existing cache number 10. This is because our GPX parser wrongly thinks that the "10 - some name" indicates the geocode 10, therefore overwriting the previously existing cache.
Manager.title: Wrongly detect 2 digit numbers as geocode in lab cache gpx

Manager.description: We already use today and tomorrow for showing logs. We might also use it for the event date in cache details of event caches. 👍 1
Manager.title: Show event date a today and tomorrow

Manager.description: I just noticed today that an event I attend regularly ("Feuerbacher Cachermittagstisch XYZ") only shows "Feuerbacher" in the cache list, and has roughly the same width of empty space. We should use ellipsis=end to display more information there. The same might be useful in activity titles that display the cache name.
Manager.title: use ellipsis=end at some places

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open GC61EE3 the listing contains embedded pictures (at the end) Actual behavior after performing these steps: For me only a placeholder is shown (small rectangle with OBJ in it) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Pictures should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.10-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Not clear but happening on several caches for me System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:

Yes System information: ##### Other comments and remarks:

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map Activate to center own position Leave live map Open list of caches which are at another location Map the list Actual behavior after performing these steps: Map opens at own position (no cache shown as out of view) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Map should cover the coords of the listed caches Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.10-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Not tested explicitly if this also happens with old map but I never before experienced the problem on old map
Manager.title: New map: Map from list opens at current position

Manager.description: I logged a trackable this morning at 6:10 German time. When I refreshed the trackable afterwards, it was shown logged yesterday. I had not changed the date selector, so I'm somewhat sure it was not set to yesterday. Might this be a problem with the time offset of -7 hours that we use somewhere? I can't verify this behaviour at the moment, since I have no private tracking code available. Will re-test one of the next days with my own trackables.
Manager.title: Wrong date when logging trackables very early?

Manager.description: Hi c:geo team, Detailed steps causing the problem: Go in Parameters -> Maps For french translation, the same text appear on 2 lines "Dossier contenant les cartes ho" (not adapted to mobile width) cause translation too long. The rest of text is not written on the following line. Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cannot distinguish which line is for offline maps folder (yes, I know now that it's the first one by rotating the screen, but you don't know at the first time...) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Reduce french translations in cgeo/main/res/values-fr/strings.xml (not sure I have the right...) 1/ Offline maps folder : "Dossier cartes hors-ligne" 2/ Offline map themes : "Dossier thèmes cartes hors-ligne" Version of c:geo used: last Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Thanks, geo-regards, Tof
Manager.title: French translations too long with same beginning cannot be distinguished

Manager.description: IMHO the quite regular fails of this CI check for that site make the tests meaningless as probably no one will pay attention on those fail reports if they come in to often... Is that a real availability problem for that website...in that case I suggest to disable the tests for this site in order to be able to only get fails for real problems. 🎉 1
Manager.title: Disable website check for opencaching.co.uk?

Manager.description: sam-1 is failing tests consitently since two days, sam-2 since one day. sam-2 reports low disk space. I temporarily disabled them to give test execution a chance on another executor. @samueltardieu Coul dyou check them?
Manager.title: Jenkins: sam-* executors failing

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have a list of 100+ caches Select to refresh all Actual behavior after performing these steps: At some unreproducible point of time no more network traffic can be seen and there is no more progress indicated. Happend to me since some weeks in nightly on mobile network as well as on wifi. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Normal progress Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.15-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: We had this in the past and it was solved...something with DB access or static maps (cant remember exactly...have to search the issue). The symptoms now look the same.
Manager.title: Stuck in batch refresh

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open history Menu → Clear history Actual behavior after performing these steps: The caches in the history list are still shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The list should be empty. If you go back to the start screen and then again to the history, it will be empty. Version of c:geo used: 52db0cc
Manager.title: History list not refreshed after clearing

Manager.description: The explanatory string given to the user right next to the setting of "Debug mode" active should include the note, that c:geo may run more instable when activating it (regarding abort on log.e). I will change the english string which should afterwards also trigger a string reset on Crowdin and force new translations.
Manager.title: Change strings in settings to reflect danger of debug logging mode

Manager.description: We should replace the name "New map" by something more understandable like "Mapsforge Beta". Additionally the setting to enable it by default is way to long to fit on screen (at least the german translation). Here I would suggest "Activate Mapsforge Beta Map". Any other suggestions?
Manager.title: Better strings for "New map"

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1 - when working on a geocache county challenge it is sometimes hard to tell via the map what county the cache is in - especially if the cache is near a county line. Other comments and remarks: An added line of information stating rh county the cache is in would help those completing county challenges a lot.
Manager.title: Feature Request - Show County Cache is in

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services Note: No "Active" subtitle for geocaching.su Enter menu for geocaching.su Note: Subtitle of Activate item shows "Load caches from geocaching.su" Activate the item Actual behavior after performing these steps: Subtitle now shows "true"/"false" depending on the active state of the checkbox Additionally on leaving the menu the service list does not show "Active" for geocaching.su Only on leaving and reentering the settings menu the behaviour is correct again. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The subtitle within the geocaching.su setup should remain unchanged "Active" should be shown in the services overview menu Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: @Bananeweizen
Manager.title: Confused strings in connector setup

Manager.description: Maps.me is supported by c:geo, but it's not present in the Main menu → Menu → "Utility programs" category. I think it should be added, Locus is there too.
Manager.title: Maps.me is not in "Utility programs"

Manager.description: we need to make new certificate for Fdroid. I can sign it but I need CSR. You can send it to my email. use the openssl command: openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout yourname.key -out yourname.csr
Manager.title: Fdroid SSL expiresd in 1 week

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Add possibitity to download caches in backgound. For now if I download ~100 caches or more, it takes several minutes to complete and c:geo is unusable for these minutes.
Manager.title: Add possibitity to download caches in backgound

Manager.description:
Here are my settings in IntelliJ IDEA for the order of imports. It can be changed easily. In any case, Eclipse and IDEA users should use the same order to prevent imports from going back and forth every time a file is changed: import static all other imports
import butterknife.*
import cgeo.*
import all other imports
import android.*
import java.*
import javax.* with blank lines between every group if there is at least one element.
Manager.title: Unify import order

Manager.description: Just found out that despite c:geo has offline maps support, it doesn't work with native maps.me maps which are in .mwm format. Steps: Install maps.me download some areas for offline use make sure they were downloaded in .mwm run c:geo, point to the folder with downloaded map files make sure no new maps were added to c:geo It really makes sense, because it's the default use case - download some maps from the mobile maps app and then use it in c:geo.
Manager.title: Add .mwm maps support (Maps.Me)

Manager.description: I know you are not the mapsforge support team, but you have the "Offline Maps" feature, which I use very often (especially abroad), so I think I'll ask here. I figured out a long time ago where to get the maps, but I still struggle on how to apply Themes to those maps. There are pages that provide mapsforge themes, but I got them never to work in c:geo. Is there a source for these themes or could you at least include a few more themes? Mapsforge (v0.6.1) does not include any other built-in themes than the default. I don't know how many users actually use this feature, but I think it would be more users if the feature was more "accessible". Some of the pages that give themes for free: http://www.openandromaps.org/en/legend/elevate-mountain-hike-theme http://openmaps.eu/mapsforgetheme Sidenote: I also found the thread (mentioned in the help here: http://www.cgeo.org/faq.html#osm-use-themes) where user @Lineflyer asks if he could use a theme, but most of the links seem to be dead: http://forum.locusmap.eu/index.php?topic=1753.0
Manager.title: How to use mapsforge Themes and where to get them?
Checker menu missing

Manager.description: Master needs to include the SDK "extra-google-m2repository" to be able to get the latest Google Play Services. Nightly/RC/release builds will likely fail in the meantime.
Manager.title: Update master configuration

Manager.description: In LiveMap-Popup is the posibility to "One Click offline log" - "Found it".... if I do so, this offline log is not in the History an not in Fieldnotes export. It only appers, when u open the Listing.... Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: Map popup - offline logging is not in fieldnotes export

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: have cyanogenmod 13 (Android 6.0.1, see below) have current version of c:geo from google playstore try to start c:geo - and it immediately crashes Actual behavior after performing these steps: c:geo briefly shows main screen for half a second and then crashes Expected behavior after performing these steps: c:geo should start and either display main screen or setup screen for first install Version of c:geo used: current version from playstore (2016.06.09) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Unavailable since I even cannot enter the main screen. Device: Samsung Galaxy S5 (klte), Cyanogenmod 13.0-20160717-NIGHTLY-klte Other comments and remarks: I used c;geo on this phone with cyanogenod 12.1 and it was all fine. Updated to 13 this week (clear install with wipe) and re-installed all apps from playstore. They all work fine but not c:geo. Reinstalled both the OS and c:geo but it still crashes while other apps (e.g. Locus) work fine.
Manager.title: c:geo crashes right on start on CM13 / Android 6.0.1

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Having GKM proxy enabled Open a GK which has been placed in a cache (like GKB988) Swipe to the Logbook tab Tap one of the geocode just behind the date Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast say "c:geo failed to download cache details" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The corresponding cache should be opened (like done for TB) Version of c:geo used: master w/ #5847 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: The LogEntry only store cache name and GUID. In the case of GeoKrety, we don't know the GUID, only the geocode (or coordinates). This will also be necessary if cache is from opencaching (no guid info there?)
Manager.title: Cannot open cache from GK LogEntry waypoint

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have Wheryougo installed open GC21X0F Select Navigation - Whereyougo Actual behavior after performing these steps: Whereyougo opens, logs in and offers to download a cartridge The downloaded cartridge is not matching to the cache but belongs to another cache (of the same owner?) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Should trigger download of correct cartridge Version of c:geo used: Current nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes for this cache System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Might also be a problem within WhereYouGo??
Manager.title: wheryougo downloads wrong cartridge

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Do not store last log for reuse if it is empty

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GKB3F8 Swipe to Logbook Actual behavior after performing these steps: Log from 2016/01/30 is authored by "kumy" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Real author is "nocybe1810" Version of c:geo used: master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: This log has comments attached to it.
Manager.title: GK wrong log author for logs with attached comment

Manager.description: The app is lovely and far more functional than alternatives, but good God, the visual design looks like it's from 2005. Would it be a major project to update to look more modern?
Manager.title: when are we going to get a design overhaul?

Manager.description: History is sorted by the time when the offline log was created, not the date that was set for the log.

Manager.description: Locus Maps Pro (with Geocaching add-on) adds a preview of what the 5 latest log types were when logs are available. This allows the geocacher to quickly determine if a cache might be worth it or if there is a good chance that the cache is not there anymore. We should do the same thing in cgeo.
Manager.title: Add latest log information in cache preview

Manager.description: Only attributes listed in res/values/cache_attributes.xml are shown, but there are more attributes defined in src/cgeo/geocaching/enumerations/CacheAttribute.java (e.g. OC only).
Manager.title: Attribute filter does not list all attributes

Manager.description: I propose to use the mobile version of Google translate in c:geo. Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1 Open log of a cache Step 2 Long press a log in a forreign language. Step 3 Select to translate into your native tongue Step 4 Observe that you are taken to the desktop version of Google translate. Step 5 Append /m/translate to the URI path, prior to the GET varisbles, to go directly to the mobile version of Google translate. Example URI https://translate.google.com/m/translate?vi=c#auto/en/Der%20heutigen%20Tag%20begann%20wieder%20mit%20Sonne.%20Dies%20freute%20uns%20nat%C3%BCrlich%20besonders%2C%20da%20ein%20sonniger%20Cachetag%20wesentlich%20mehr%20Spa%C3%9F%20macht.%20Gem%C3%BCtlich%20starteten%20wir%20nach%20dem%20Fr%C3%BChst%C3%BCck%20und%20konnten%20auch%20heute%20wieder%20recht%20erfolgreich%20sein.%20Im%20Team%20mit%20Q3%20auf%20Tour%20gewesen.%20TFTC%20Gr%C3%BC%C3%9Fe%20aus%20Deutschland%20Orientexpress Actual behavior after performing these steps: Expected behavior after performing these steps: Version of c:geo used: Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: Better url for Google Translatebgiving mobile version

Manager.description: Feedback from beta user: Icons instead of text buttons are nice as they are bigger and clearer, however IMHO the delete button is at the wrong place (also compared to where the textual buttons have been). I suggest to have only regresh in upper row and lower row should be edit left and delete right. This also helps in accidently not tapping delete instead of refresh.
Manager.title: Different arrangement of new icons in cache details

Manager.description: Right now, the status manager displays warning that a new release or release candidate is available and links to the Google Play Store regardless of how the user installed the application. We can retrieve the name of the application that installed the current application from the package manager. This should be sent along with the version code and the version name to the status manager at status.cgeo.org so that appropriate update URIs can be returned eventually.
Manager.title: Send installer package name to status manager

Manager.description: From support mail: I would like to describe you a small problem with sending coordinates to external applications (in this case mapy.cz). The problem is that when you send those coordinates, mapy.cz will only show a label (picture) without a pin with exact position (picture). And I would like to point out that it has to work offline as well. It would really make user experience better not only for me, but for many Czech geocachers. Keep up the good work! Thanks. 2016.06.09
Manager.title: Coords not sendable to mapy.cz

Manager.description: The most recent beta releases of the android tooling require to accept licenses for the SDK components even on build servers. I've implemented this by our build script automatically writing the necessary file, see http://stackoverflow.com/a/38381577/44089 That works. However, I was wondering if other developers would prefer this to be part of our gradle script directly, to make it work everywhere, not only on CI? Might be more smooth, on the other hand I'm a bit hesistant to accept licenses on behalf of every user of our gradle script.
Manager.title: auto accept android licenses

Manager.description: Feature request: add an option to bring back the old behaviour for the lists: each cache can only be part of 1 list. (an option, because I do understand the new way of handling lists and its advantages for lots of users.) Use case: create a pocket query (or run an existing one) and add the caches to a new list. A couple of days later you run the same PQ and also add those to a new list. So you get 2 lists with caches. Best after new caches became part of the new list, or other ones removed, etc. old behaviour: The new list has the number of caches included in the PQ, the old one only lists those caches that aren't included anymore (disabled, found, new caches made them disappear etc.) It is easy to look at those and decide which ones to keep or remove. new behaviour: You get 2 lists with no easy way of telling the difference. If you want to make sure you don't have caches on the device which are not useful anymore, you can only clear the old list. It is possible you clear caches that can still be useful for future trips. In my case I create one using pocket query creator every couple of days, or before I go geocaching, with only the 1000 closest enabled caches that are active and haven't been found be me. With the old behaviour I ended up with up to 3-4 lists with caches, I only had to remove those I found or were disabled. I do not log with c:geo on the device I have with me on trips, so found caches are not marked as found on that device and it also doesn't have an internet connection during trips.
Manager.title: feature request: option to allow caches in only 1 list

Manager.description: Beta feedback: Mapsforge BETA glitch? Sunday entered corrected cords for a puzzle cache but didn't move the cache marker just kept it as the red reference point mark. When flipped back to original maps and cache location had moved to new corrected coords but going back the icons had swapped again. PS love the new Mapsforge much clearer detail.
Manager.title: Modified coords not shown

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Use Samsung device support multi windows (e.g. all Galaxy S since S3) Try to start multi window mode while c:geo is running Actual behavior after performing these steps: "c:geo does not support multi window" (or similar) is displayed Expected behavior after performing these steps: Multi window mode should be started Version of c:geo used: 2016.09.08-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galaxy S7 Other comments and remarks: With the current RC version 2016.09.06-RC the multi window is working normally. @Bananeweizen I suspect the recent changes to the manifest could be the cause (remove mandatory touchscreen)?
Manager.title: Samsung multi window no longer working

Manager.description: Sine this morning we get complaints about freezing/crashing live map. I can reproduce this after short usage of the live map. As it wasnt the case last days I assume we have a server issue one again (or still) where cgeo crashes instead of catching the error and giving a proper error message. Maybe someone can reproduce and provide a log. IMHO we should urgently fix this because people blame cgeo for this.
Manager.title: Live map crashing

This is somehow related to the requested long-press in #5839 as it removes the additional work for selecting a list.
