Manager.description: Starting October 15th, application with no explicit android.hardware.location.gps use in the manifest and requiring high precision location will be able to get installed on devices without a GPS. It means that cgeo will be installable on devices where only network-derived location is available. Do we want this, or do we want to restrict (as I believe it is right now) cgeo to platforms with a GPS to ensure a good user experience?
Manager.title: cgeo on devices without GPS

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log some caches from different lists Delete some of them from all lists, let some remain on the different lists Open the history Select "Refresh all" Actual behavior after performing these steps: All refreshed caches are now stored on the default list (whereas caches still stored on a random list will additionally appear on the default list and no longer stored caches will also appear on the default list) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Refreshing the history should neither store no longer stored caches, nor add them to the default list Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? From support mail (only partly retested by myself)
Manager.title: Refresh caches on history will store them to default list

Manager.description: Just a cosmetical thing: According to the Crowdin project settings here we can use our own domain/subdomain to redirect/point to crowdin. So we could use e.g. translate.cgeo.org to refer users to our Crowdin page if I understand this correctly. Would IMHO be a nice shortcut which can easily be recognized as I always struggle to remember the correct URL refering to our Crowdin project. 👍 1
Manager.title: Create CNAME for Crowdin page

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC4C67W It has a final waypoint without valid coords (as the owner probably decided to make it visible but hide its coords) Store the cache Open the (live) map of that region Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache is shown with the final marker on the map Expected behavior after performing these steps: The final marker should not be shown, as the final waypoint has no valid coords Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Up to approx. March 2016 this was implemented as suggested but changed thereafter. Users are complaining as they are no longer able to differentiate between real modified mystery final coords and those "dummy" caches. I have in mind, that I already have seen such an issue but can't find it.
Manager.title: Dont show final marker (on map) for final waypoints without coords

Manager.description: I was just approached with the following request: In the logging activity menu the menu items for saving the log and for deleting the log are directly besides each other, therefore leading to frustrating when hitting the deletion menu item unintendedly. I'll add undo to the log deletion operation, to take the pressure out of this. I still suggest to actually remove the "store log offline" item, since we store the log anyway when exiting the activity. Thoughts on that?
Manager.title: Remove store offline menu

Manager.description: I just noticed that the menu of the cache details includes the "invite friends" feature. Is that intended? The menu has already many entries and IMHO the entry in the main menu is enough. 👍 1
Manager.title: "Invite friends" in cache menu

Manager.description: Have GC6T86J in a cache list. You will notice that its name is rendered in 2 lines (the second clock of that name is visible partly). Probably that happens for all caches, we just did not notice yet.
Manager.title: Cache name rendered multiple lines in cache list

Manager.description: When using a longer route then it is not displayed in high zoom levels. I guess the path is simply to huge in it's full pixel bounding box. Therefore we need to clip the path. Haven't found a suitable clipping method yet, will probably remove all out of bounding box segments manually instead.
Manager.title: Route not displayed in high zoom

Manager.description: github has finally introduced a rebase strategy for pull requests. Last time when we discussed whether squasing would be an option, most developers voted for not destroying the history of the atomic commits. Rebasing would completely fit to that requirement and still give a more clear history view. Unfortunately there is no option to select a default, when enabling multiple strategies. I therefore suggest to disable all other merge strategies in the repository settings to basically enforce rebase on merge. For reference, this is how to the admin section looks like: Comments? 👍 1
Manager.title: adopt rebase strategy for pull requests

Manager.description: Short version as I am on mobile only: Current nightly Searched for an address Mapped the result Selected "Save for offline" from map menu Result: Toast is shown with something like "Nothing to save" although unsaved caches are on the map Might be related to new map (did not test old map/google map)
Manager.title: Save for offline from map not working

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open Cache Details long Press Coordinates to copy them into clipboard go to some other app and paste the text result: coordinates are pasted WITHOUT middle dot (OK) Open Cache with extra waypoints long press on waypoint to open context menu choose Copy coordinates go to some other app and paste the text result: coordinates are pasted WITH middle dot (NOT OK) Version of c:geo used: 2016.09.26-7b5872f developer build Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Got this issue from german facebook group. The middle dot in coordinates cause some problems in other apps. So c:geo should copy coordinates without middle dot onto clipboard like on the cache details page.
Manager.title: Copy coordinates from waypoint has superfluous middle dot

Manager.description: Have a cache with a parking lot waypoint. Open the map for the cache and look at the final and the parking lot icons. Everything fine. Now open the map from the parking lot waypoint instead. The icon is no longer a parking icon, but a reference point icon.
Manager.title: wrong icon when navigating to parking lot

Manager.description: With high travel speed, the routing is updated multiple times per second. We need to have a delay of some seconds before updating again.
Manager.title: time delay for routing

Manager.description: Don't know whether it should or not. So either a feature request or a bug. As long as Mapsforge beta is activated in settings it will only show a straight line.
Manager.title: Brouter does not work on new map

Manager.description: Map route to a cache Change map source e.g. from Google to OSM Result: Line changes from route to straight line
Manager.title: Broute lost on changing map source

Manager.description: Use the cache icon instead of the normal icon for the logging activity. Requested during an event. There might be more activities where this would be useful.
Manager.title: use cache icon in logging activity

Manager.description: We store the log even if it is just identical to the signature. This leads to offline log markers in lists and on the map and may confuse people. Requested on event.
Manager.title: don't store log if it is identical to signature

Manager.description: Currently the field notes feature is tested on opencaching.de and will be released soon. c:geo does not export logs of OC caches.
Manager.title: Export OC caches in field notes

Manager.description: Open GC6B4TH Although it contains a link to the cartridge the WhereYouGo option is missing in the navigation menu.
Manager.title: WhereYouGo not listed in Navigtion for a specific cache

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log a cache find and attach picture with the log (GC.com) Send the log Actual behavior after performing these steps: An error message is shown, that sending seems failed and user shall check on website (retry/cancel/offline). Expected behavior after performing these steps: This occured to me on the last 14 days for each picture I attched, so something seems wrong while checking the result. In all cases log and picture had been uploaded correctly. Version of c:geo used: Master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes (at least it seems like that to me...can't do extensive tests right now) Other comments and remarks: Feel free to test with my owned caches to check whether reproducible
Manager.title: Log picture upload ends with error message although OK

Manager.description: Hello Cgeo team !! Detailed steps causing the problem: Launch the app Click on "Nearest cache list" Click on menu (top right) Click on "Make list unique" Actual behavior after performing these steps: CGeo crashes Expected behavior after performing these steps: CGeo doesn't crash Version of c:geo used: Master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, systematic System information: Device: SDK build for x86 Android version 6.0 Android build: sdk_google_phone_x86-userdebug 6.0 MASTER 3287151 test-keys Cgeo version: 2016.10.08-14bbb90 developer build ... Other comments and remarks: No Many thanks in advance ! Morice
Manager.title: "Make list unique" menu makes cgeo crash in nearest cache list

Manager.description: A RC 2016.10.11-RC has been uploaded to the beta channel. Changes: Fix for TB type containing HTML Fix for picture upload
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: As discussed on IRC it would be good to have a contact address where Groundspeak can contact us in case of need. @mucek4 Could you create e.g. groundspeak@... and make it forward all to cgeo-dev@.... and my gc@... mail address? @SammysHP Can you allow this mail address to post to cgeo-dev@...
Manager.title: Create groundspeak contact mail-in

Manager.description: Heroku now lets us use a SSL certificate for our custom domain (status.cgeo.org). We got one from StartSSL and installed it for API calls. In order to be able to migrate away from Heroku to a hosted server, we now need to replace API calls from https://cgeo-status.herokuapp.com to https://status.cgeo.org. After this, we can freely move status.cgeo.org to another host. Note that older installations using the Heroku address will be able to be redirected using the Free plan since they will not use our custom domain when talking to Heroku.
Manager.title: Use status.cgeo.org instead of the Heroku address

Manager.description: Feature request Hi guys, thanks for your great job! It is possible to display the background-image of a cache-listing in c:geo? If the picture is in the gallery than its shown in cgeo. But often the background is not in the gallery and in this case it will not be shown. I hope that will be possible. Thanks and best regards king-ton
Manager.title: Listing background not shown in gallery if hosted externally

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Some Cacheowners, especially in the US, are writing URLs in the hints of their listings. Here is an example: https://coord.info/GC4W4BP cgeo recocnise this links and shows a blue "visit link" instead. But its not clickable. if you click on the link the whole hint is only getting en/decrypted Actual behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" in hint not clickable Expected behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" should open the link, not en/decrypt it like normal hint-text alternativ: dont convert it to "visit link" so that it can be read or copied Version of c:geo used: 2016.10.13 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: URL in hint gets convertet to "visit link" but it is not clickable

Manager.description: FB reports tell, that people are located in Iran by default when GPS is not available. I can reproduce by switching off GPS and starting c:geo twice (because home coords are only used after second login AFAIR). It seems either the home coords are not working on the website or we fail when parsing them.
Manager.title: Home coords parsing broken?

Manager.description: According to the latest release notes gc.com now supports this function for all cache types, thus c:geo should do.
Manager.title: Support user modified coords from/to server for all cache types

Manager.description: Feature request Since GC has changed to let all Cache types modify their coordinates, I would like to use it in c:geo
Manager.title: Modify coordinates for all Cache types

Manager.description: Due to fixes for recent website changes we should rdo another bugfix release. To Do: Smoke test release before uploading Publish release on Google Play Rename milestones on Github / Create new bugfix milestone Tag release on Github Publish release on Github Publish on F-Droid Push notification update via status.cgeo.org as soon as Play version is available Post to social networks Please answer here if you object to release or if there are other known issues where we should include a fix before releasing. I will meanwhile do some testing and then continue with uploading to Google Play.
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Set date format on gc.com to 23.Oct.2016 Load a cache with c:geo Actual behavior after performing these steps: Logbook is empty Expected behavior after performing these steps: Logbook should show the logs Version of c:geo used: 2016.10.22-RC (build at around 23pm last night) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Log date format: 23/10/2016 Other comments and remarks: We seem to fail recognizing the selected format. Did not test all formats by now...Update follows
Manager.title: Some date formats still not recognized

Manager.description: Just as a reminder. From todays IRC discussion: [20:53] OneEyed: What do you think? Merge release to a new old-release and master to release now? This would enable us to publish a RC as beta version on Play. Background for me is still to enforce shorter release cycles. [20:59] Lineflyer: Sure [21:00] What about doing that tomorrow or the day after, once we ensure that this release is in ok shape? [21:19] And we might want to think about promoting Mapsforge beta to default [21:19] Did it get online tiles? [21:20] Not yet [21:20] I started to collect the necessary infos, but was not yet bale to implement it [21:20] mmh...that would be the requirement of course [21:21] Just think about if it would be doable or wait until next cycle
Manager.title: Master to Beta?

Manager.description: The play store what's new listing calls for beta testers. That should be removed.
Manager.title: Remove call for beta testers from what's new

Manager.description: I would love to have (on a per cache option) the Personal Note on a own tab (site?). Especially on long multicaches (example: GC1K0FM) it is unpractical to always scroll down to note the value of the next stage and go back and search for the description of the next stage. Great would be to just swipe left and right to switch between the two views like switching to the logs works. There could be a "edit in separate tab" button below the current edit button.
Manager.title: Personal Note on own tab

Manager.description: Moved to new issue from #6032 When rendering, some tiles are missing. And they stay missing even after scrolling/zooming in/out. The missing tiles never load (during current session).
Manager.title: Mapsforge beta - missing tiles

Manager.description: New map active (mapsforge beta) Open live map Enable live Select a cache to show its popup Press the "route button" (circle with angled arrow) A direct line is shown from current position to cache. Top shows distance, I presume it is direct distance. No route seems to be calculated. BRouter is installed and configured for car-test and started in server mode. BRouter has appropriate data already downloaded. Tested and confirmed working using it within OSMAND. in c:geo there is no indication that BRouter is detected, or even if there is such depedency. User has no way of determining if c:geo and BRouter work together or not. Line visual theme (simple red with slight alpha) shown from position to cache (or presumably would be route) is visually not well represented. Assume it is shown as route properly, in sample screen, it would almost be indistinguishable over the red primary roads there. Could be related to #6017 Parts of this issue were conceptually defined here #6033 before being discovered.
Manager.title: Mapsforge beta and route as straight line

Manager.description: I observe that storing caches (actually, both SU and COM) takes really long time and also time prediction is horribly wrong - it says "3 minutes left" and downloads for 15 minutes actually. I suggest to take a look to optimization of the downloading. Maybe use multi-threading, maybe use bulk download API (if possible), or just check for bottlenecks Version of c:geo used: 2016.10.30-NB-057d341 Is the problem reproducible for you? Y
Manager.title: Slow caches download

Manager.description: When logging "webcam photo taken" thenlog page does not show the tickbox for adding the cache to your favorites. Current nightly
Manager.title: Add to Favorite box nit shown for webcam cache

Manager.description: FYI: A RC was generated (2016.11.01-RC1) and uploaded to beta channel after testing the date format fix (#6065) to get feedback. I will meanwhile continue to test the date format compatability in current nightlies (as the implementation is different) so that we can decide later if we want to go with another release from release branch or go as suggested in #6061. My opinion: Since we pubslihed the info about the workaround (via status.cgeo.org) support mail and social network are back to normal by now....so might be no urgent need for a fix. On one hand I would like to see the date issue completely fixed as soon as possible, but on the other hand I would like to avoid to short release cycles on Play (bugfix and feature release right afterwards). So undecided somehow... any other opinions?
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Disable routing for very short distance

Manager.description: If you hold long press a cache to delete it from the stored list - the action selected is "Drop" If you go to the menu and want to delete all the caches from the stored list - the action selected is "Remove all" Shouldn't these have the same verb (so either "Remove" or "Drop all") as to not confuse users and for consistency?
Manager.title: Consistancy in the stored list "actions"

Manager.title: Remove first routing segment

Yes

Yes, crashes occur every time I try to refresh one of the both caches listed above System information: Android 4.4.2 tried on N7100 (Galaxy Note II) and Galaxy Tab 10.1 2014 edition Other comments and remarks: Refreshing both caches works well using release 2016.11.05

Manager.description: With the theme I use the routing is sometimes hard to see. We need a different kind of painting.
Manager.title: Routing hard to see

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a cache Move to East xx° yy'.998 from West Swipe to waypoints "Add Waypoint", select DD MM.MMM format Now move further to East Actual behavior after performing these steps: Display will eventually show xx yy.000 (and a WP taken will be >1 km off) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Expected: yy gets incremented (and WP reflects current position) Version of c:geo used: 2016.07.09-NB.34c95b1 Is the problem reproducible for you? It's a bit tricky because is apparently only happens at xx yy.999[5-9] and with very good GPS reception System information: OnePlus (A0001, bacon) 6.0.1 MHC19Q Other comments and remarks: This looks quite similar to Issue #2624 - but this time, for minutes

Manager.description: I suggest to remove the selectable live map strategy for the following reasons: Users I spoke with are not even aware of this option Users I spoke with always prefer to see the cache type and get most information out of the map Networks have become faster There are often users on support and in ratings claiming that they only see ?? caches as they accidentally selected "Fastest" thinking it would be the same but just faster Make things simpler, less options The speed dependent solution (Current default) should be the fixed strategy. 👍 3
Manager.title: Remove fastest strategy on live map

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: cannot login to GC anymore using old nightly upgrade to latest (2016.11.11) nightly Actual behavior after performing these steps: still login to GC fails, main screen reports maintenance web interface has no hint on maintenance Version of c:geo used: 2016.11.11 nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: A0001 Other comments and remarks: Since GeoToad also fails, there seems to be a change in cookie handling(?)
Manager.title: Login fails, c:geo reports maintenance

Manager.description: enter cache details Select Navigate - Save static maps Maps are loaded but display a yellow error marker and something seems incorrect (did not look in detail) According to https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/error-messages#warnings this means an error in the request.
Manager.title: Static maps error

Manager.description: Noticed in master. This should be modernized to use RxJava to benefit from fine scheduler control, parallelism, and ability to cancel requests properly, instead of using a thread. The StaticMapsProvider is already reactive. Also, some operations (such as the refresh operation from the menu) appear to block on the UI thread. This should be adressed as well. 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): [Thread-2] StaticMapsActivity.LoadMapsThread.run 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): android.view.ViewRootImpl$CalledFromWrongThreadException: Only the original thread that created a view hierarchy can touch its views. 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.ViewRootImpl.checkThread(ViewRootImpl.java:6855) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.ViewRootImpl.requestLayout(ViewRootImpl.java:1040) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AbsListView.requestLayout(AbsListView.java:1988) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AdapterView$AdapterDataSetObserver.onChanged(AdapterView.java:840) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AbsListView$AdapterDataSetObserver.onChanged(AbsListView.java:6351) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.database.DataSetObservable.notifyChanged(DataSetObservable.java:37) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.BaseAdapter.notifyDataSetChanged(BaseAdapter.java:50) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.ArrayAdapter.notifyDataSetChanged(ArrayAdapter.java:310) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.ArrayAdapter.add(ArrayAdapter.java:200) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at cgeo.geocaching.staticmaps.StaticMapsActivity$LoadMapsThread.run(StaticMapsActivity.java:100)
Manager.title: StaticMapsActivity modifies reads and writes adapter outside the main thread

Manager.description: Asked by a user on FB: Currently we have the nojit-version only for our nightlies. As the underlying bug is still not fixed on those devices (e.g. Lenovo) and if we want to offer a stable version also for users affected, it might be meaningful also to have a nojit version based on release (which each release cycle). If this is feasible by "just" creating a new CI job I would support this request. Note: FAQ needs to be adapted accordingly once it is available. If we would have a nojit-version based on release we could stop having it for the nightly instead
Manager.title: Have NOJIT release version

I will try to gather more information from users and try to test some things myself. 👍 1

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Remember the amount of saved caches on your lists as shown on the mainscreen as X Open live map Click on a non-detailed cache (with orange circle) From the popup select Log Visist Enter log text and press back to save the log Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache icon has now markers for offline logged and saved(?) Saved caches amount on main screen is now x+1 Cache is not visible in lists Cache is visible in history Opening this cache in history will show the non-detailed status: Empty description, Empty logbook Cache details screen shows "Saved on device 11746 days ago" Expected behavior after performing these steps: I don't know enough about the DB structure to judge the best way of fixing this. However from a user perspective: It should show up in the history (as it does) It should not count to the amount of total caches stored in lists as it is not part of any list contained there It should not show up with saved icon on map Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.10-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: This seems to be not caused by the change of @pstorch (ded3fb7) as the behaviour is the same with this fix (fresh RC) and without this fix (current nightly).
Manager.title: Non-detailed caches incorrectly counted for amount of stored caches

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start with empty database Save some caches to your lists Enter list, open a cache and write an offline log for one of the saved caches Offline log status is visible in lists Cache is shown in history Open history and select "Clear history" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Nothing happens Expected behavior after performing these steps: Hsistory is emptied Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.11-RC (including ded3fb7) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Comment: Related to #6181
Manager.title: History cannot be emptied

Manager.description: I frequently want to store all the caches in an area but also check them all to see which caches are particularly interesting. Caches can be particularly interesting for various reasons such as helping to satisfy a challenge cache, filling in holes in the Jasmer grid or the DT grid, or just being at a location that would interest me. So I add the caches that are particularly interesting to one of various lists. However when I look at the map or the list of stored caches for the area there's no indication of what other lists the cache is on. And if I look just at the list of "interesting" caches I'm likely to miss other caches that are nearby. What I propose to solve it is when displaying a list of caches to display small icons after the "Small Offline" for each list the cache is on. That way I can see the list of "Nearby" caches or I can look at a stored list for the area and quickly notice if I'm near a cache that I don't want to miss. This would be similar to the way mail user agents universally have a feature allowing you to "star" important emails. I have a few ideas of how to indicate what icon to use. One option is to provide a dropdown in the "Rename List" dialog which allows you to set an icon. This has the advantage that users would see the option when creating the list and also that not every list would have to have an icon so users could choose which lists were actually important. Another would be to simply use the first character of the list name. So caches would have a series of letters next to them. Users who want icons can put unicode emoji signs as the first character of the list name. This has the advantage that users would get the benefit even if they aren't aware of the feature and they don't have to take any explicit action to enable it. Incidentally, I think when displaying a specific stored list it should exclude that list's icon from the listing. I am a developer but have never poked at any Android app development so I may be able to do this and submit a pull request but may need some guidance, especially on Android environment quirks.
Manager.title: Proposal: Display labels on caches for other lists

Manager.description: The various challenges people set themselves or take up from challenge caches often drive people to seek out caches that would help satisfy the challenge If you look on project-gc.com you can see various grids and cache attributes and it's quite common for particularly nerdy cachers to want to collect all the boxes of those grids. Two of the most common are a) Filling all of the DT grid -- i.e. all 81 combinations of difficulty and terrain. Oncepl filled people look to repeat the cycle, i.e. fill it with numbers >= 2 and so on. b) filling the "Caches by hidden month" grid. The challenge caches for this are named after the person who first invented them "Jasmer". So you frequently see people talking about finding "Jasmers". I maintain a list called "Jasmer" which has any caches in areas I'm interested in that were hidden in a month that I'm currently missing on my Jasmer grid. However this has several problems. a) I can't store all the caches around the world this way so when I go to a new area I need to add more even if I'm not planning to do much caching and expecting to have data b) it's really hard to remove caches when I fill a spot. Removing dozens of caches from a lit based on an attribute that doesn't show in the listing is laborious and error prone and some of them may still be worth storing for other reasons but some may have had no other reason to be on the phone. What I would suggest instead is to keep an internal representation of the Jasmer grid and DT grid -- they're very small and easy to fetch from geocaching.com and/or project-gc but also fairly easy to just construct and update from stored information too. Then display an icon or word on the listing and on the cache detail page if the cache fits the property. It would be neat to provide a virtual list for these properties too which would display all stored caches that have the property. Then my workflow for most areas would be "store all caches in the area" then "display virtual list jasmer" choose my destinations based on that and then look at all stored caches in those areas.
Manager.title: Proposal: Virtual lists for common challenge properties (Jasmer and DT grid)

Manager.description: Currently the new icon decoder (#6201) decodes virtual and webcam caches (same color) as webcam caches on the map. I suggest to change this to decode both as virtual. Reason: From my experience in US and remote locations all over the world Virtuals are more often than Webcams From my experience in Europe both types are same rare Logical: All webcams can be considered as virtual, but not all virtuals are webcams. So showing Virtuals is less wrong. @mucek4 wants to take a look on this tomorrow, so I assign him.
Manager.title: Icon Decoder: Replace Webcam by Virtual

Manager.description: Use Case: Base Members cannot add PMO caches to lists. On the other hand, BMs are allowed to log and sometimes have access to PMO listings, e.g. through a Premium Member colleague. Phase 1 could be to create a cache entry by entering GCCode, Name and Coords manually. Later some details could be retrieved automatically, e.g. owner, D/T rating. One way to get this information is nearby search. Currently the only way to enter PMO coordinates is to add a reference point to an already existing different cache.
Manager.title: Feature: Add cache entry manually or semi-automated for offline-caching

Manager.description: Follow up from #6186 (comment). It turned out that due to the lack of foreign keys in the DB it happens that geocaches got deleted from cg_caches without their related records in dependent tables like cg_logs, cg_waypoints, ... The DataStore.cleanIfNeeded() is the housekeeping method which regulary (on startup) cleans up the database. This should be extended to also clean up these orphaned records as well.
Manager.title: Database cleanup of orphaned records

Manager.description: Service Temporarily Unavailable The server is temporarily unable to service your request due to maintenance downtime or capacity problems. Please try again later. Seems to be an aftermath of @mucek4 rebooting the CI yesterday.
Manager.title: ci.cgeo.org is out of service

Manager.description: Problem: The Log Date Format actually displays the current date formatted with the date format in use. On some dates, it will not be possible to infer the date format in use. On, say, February 2, the Log Date Format could be displayed as 02/02/2017, but it is not possible to infer which of the formats DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY was actually used. This feature was implemented in commit 8ad942f Solution: Display the actual format string, like DD/MM/YYYY, or, if that is not feasible, use a fixed example date which makes it possible to infer the date format, like December 14 2013.
Manager.title: The Log Date Format in System Information does not always provide the intended information

Manager.description: GC6YYR8 contains "... ab 18:00Uhr (das..." and is not recognized.
Manager.title: calendar time recognition requires space

Manager.description: Maybe no bug, just a question: Do we get (or assume) any time zone information when parsing an event cache? I am asking because I had some scenario like this: Have phone set to GMT+1 Save an event cache Event cache date is the correct date as shown on website Set phone to GMT-6 The saved events date is now one day earlier Greetings from Panama (what explains why I just discovered the problem).
Manager.title: Timezone question

Manager.description: Feature request: Allow c:geo to install on devices which can not install c:geo now (probably because the lack of gps) using the play store, so it can be used to plan trips or post logs with minimal data usage. Use case: When traveling I try to import caches at home using a PQ or create a small PQ where we are, so I have all interesting caches imported in c:geo. Using the map feature I can easily plan a (hiking/bike) trip or select a cache to log (with live off). When logging I do not need data usage anymore to select the cache I want to log, only for the logging itself within the app I use data. For searching I even don't need extra data usage. I could do just that with our old tablet (transformer tf101), but after replacing it with a chromebook with play store I can not install c:geo. (Pocket Query Creator can be installed and works as expected using google location services). Since the tf101 never managed to get a gps position there shouldn't be a problem using c:geo on the chromebook, unless I'm not allowed to install in via the play store for another reason.
Manager.title: Allow c:geo to be installed on more devices using play store

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open c:geo-FAQ (http://www.cgeo.org/faq.html#legacy) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: According to several sources (e. g. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CyanogenMod) the development of Cyanogenmod is carried on under the new project name LineageOs (http://lineageos.org). The old websites are not reachable any more and no download can be performed. Therefore a new source for customROMs should be linked. I would suggest to link to LineageOs as it's the same project under a new name. Greetings. Nmxcgeo SORRY, I JUST SAW, THAT I'M IN THE WRONG REPOSITORY FOR THIS ISSUE
Manager.title: Recommendation of Cyanogenmod in FAQ

Manager.description: A user informed us by mail, that there is no new f-droid nightly since approx. 15.01. Indeed I can see that somethink is hanging here: http://ci.cgeo.org/job/Publish%20FDroid%20-%20NIGHTLY/
Manager.title: f-droid nightly job is hanging

Manager.description: For your information: A new beta version 2017.02.05-RC has been published today. It contains the fixes made on release since last official release.
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open an unsaved caches Select Menu (three dot) Actual behavior after performing these steps: No menu item "Extract waypoints" visible unless the cache is saved Expected behavior after performing these steps: We should avoid such dependencies as it also makes the feature less acessible. Instead I suggest autosaving the cache (same as when a user edits a waypoint of an unsaved cache) as soon as the function is selected Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.04-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Extract waypoints menu only visible for saved caches

Manager.description: After executing the function "Extract waypoints" it might or might not be succesful in extracting waypoints. It also happend to me, that it took some time until the extracted waypoints finally showed up in the waypoint tab (I suspect the process was still running while swiping to the waypoint tab). We should provide a feedback to the user about the result of the extraction. This could be done with a small toast like "Extracted x waypoints from cache description" / "No wapoints found in cache description"
Manager.title: Extract waypoint function should provide result

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a saved caches which contains extractable coords in the cache description Swipe to the waypoint tab Select Menu -> Extract waypoints Actual behavior after performing these steps: Waypoint tab does not show the extracted waypoints. The user needs to swipe two screens to the right and back again to get it updated. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Screen should be refreshed to show the new waypoints after extraction process has finished. Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.04-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Waypoint tab not refreshed after extracting waypoints

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open list of caches Sort by geocode Actual behavior after performing these steps: Caches are sorted lexicographically/alphabetically. GC1ABCD GC2345 GC56EFG GC77 Expected behavior after performing these steps: Natural sorting, for example: GC77 GC2345 GC1ABCD GC56EFG 👍 1
Manager.title: Natural sort by geocode

Manager.description: If you are adding a lot of waypoints for a (multi)cache newly created waypoints are at the bottom of the list with the add button below the list. To add a new waypoint you always have to scroll down (swipe up) first to access the "Add waypoinr"-button. Same goes to access (or use) a newly created waypoint. Suggestion is to create a setting to show waypoints in reverse chronological order (newest on top), with the "Add waypoint"-button right above the list, or not (as it currently is).
Manager.title: Have "Add Waypoint" on top

Manager.description: Would it be possible to sound a beep when approaching a waypoint, preferably at a chosen distance (e.g. 10, 20 or 50 meters).
Manager.title: Sound a beep when approaching a waypoint

Manager.description: It's more a topic to think about than an detailed feature request. Or maybe someone could give me a hint how to manage this situation. Case: I'm arriving to a new city (i.e. San Francisco) where there are dozens and dozens of existing caches. I have limited time and I don't want to visit crappy caches like "It's my favorite garbage bin and I decided to create a cache here". When I open the map, I see hundreds of caches around, often more than one in each city block Problem statement: I want to visit as much as possible "good" caches in some district and as less as possible "bad" caches. Criteria for "good" and "bad" very depends on a lot of things (read as "some personal filters") Right now I used following approach: scan caches manually and save offline log "need maintenance" for caches I wanna visit. So they became visible on the map and I can distinguish my selected caches from all caches in the area. Important notice: I still want to see all the caches in the area, because even if it's "garbage bin cache" but it's in 5-meters radius from my location, I will visit it. I just don't want to spend extra time, but if it's near - I'll grab it. One of possible solutions which could be enough for my purposes: Use filter "More than N favorite points" and highlight those caches While scanning caches around manually, have ability to "highlight" some caches manually. So there will be some list of "highlighted" caches. I would like to see them actually highlited on the map, i.e. having "star" symbol over the cache icon of something like this so I can easily see several caches I want to visit across all hundreds of existing caches. As usual, sorry if duplicate or if there is already working solution, but I didn't find it by my own.
Manager.title: Highlighting\selecting caches worth visit

Manager.description: Problem statement: I'm a .SU and .COM geocaching player I prefer .SU caches everywhere, but in many countries there are a few .SU caches (which I definetely want to visit.) and thousands of COM caches (I will visit some of them). I want to have ability to see only SU caches on the map. Solution I'm using now: Go to Settings -> Services and disable .COM, relaunch application, see\check\remember\save all SU caches, than enable .COM again and relaunch app. It works somehow, but pretty obvious that is't absolutely not convenient (plus, I had an issue with deleting all stored caches from service I disable, but it's another issue, so nevermind). Suggestion: Add option to select desired services to show just from the map activity. Something like selecting a list to store a cache - available services with checkboxes plus button "show all".
Manager.title: Filtering caches from different services on the map

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open Cache https://coord.info/GC59KT4 Actual behavior after performing these steps: Error message: c:geo can't load description. On description tab only a loading spinner is shown instead of the description. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Show description with missing image Version of c:geo used: master, 6b4cdbc Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: The cache description contains one errornous image tag:
Manager.title: Cache description can't be shown if one image has an error

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC6Y8T8 Swipe tp waypoint tab Click "Add waypoint" Click on coordinates field Actual behavior after performing these steps: Crash Picture of Stacktrace: Expected behavior after performing these steps: Coordinates can be edited without crash Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.12-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes (on the mentioned cache) Other comments and remarks: @pstorch I guess this is a side effect of your latest waypoint handling changes?
Manager.title: Crash when adding a waypoint

Manager.description: Received by a user: [...]would it be possible to list the trackable inventory by tracking code? Right now, it is listed in alphabetical order with the code below it. The only issue, especially when you move many trackables like myself, most of the time the user doesn't know the name of the trackable, only knows the code. So putting the codes alphabetically would be amazing and much faster. I never thought about that, but I fully agree. If I put trackables into the cache I always look for its tracking number and sorting by that would indeed make this more easy. Maybe we could also put it into the first row (bigger font) and the name into the second row (smaller font) or make both lines with same font size. ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Sort trackables on log page by code rather than by name

Manager.description: It would be nice to have an option that would inhibit loading, at the least, log images, when not on wifi. Alternatively, a toggle that could be set manually would do. Cheers
Manager.title: Feature Request: Allow option for 'low data' mode option when not on wifi

Manager.description: Hello Google Play Developer, Our records show that your app, c:geo - contacts plugin, with package name cgeo.contacts, currently violates our User Data policy regarding Personal and Sensitive Information. Policy issue: Google Play requires developers to provide a valid privacy policy when the app requests or handles sensitive user or device information. Your app requests sensitive permissions (e.g. camera, microphone, accounts, contacts, or phone) or user data, but does not include a valid privacy policy. Action required: Include a link to a valid privacy policy on your app's Store Listing page and within your app. You can find more information in our help center. Alternatively, you may opt-out of this requirement by removing any requests for sensitive permissions or user data. If you have additional apps in your catalog, please make sure they are compliant with our Prominent Disclosure requirements. Please resolve this issue by March 15, 2017, or administrative action will be taken to limit the visibility of your app, up to and including removal from the Play Store. Thanks for helping us provide a clear and transparent experience for Google Play users. Regards, The Google Play Team
Manager.title: c:geo - contacts plugin's User Data policy

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: (using Geocaching.com) open a Cache in the live map opening the menu in this flying window export -> field notes Actual behavior after performing these steps: no message or output in the program no field note sent to geocaching.com even the flying window asking where to upload didn't show up Expected behavior after performing these steps: Log is send to GC Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.07 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1 Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: Exporting single field note don't work

Manager.description: When in debug mode, editor doesn't show most variables content from functions, this is not easy to track bugs... Watched variables also don't display. It is described here https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=93730 Is this just me or everyone? I remember to already have seen this last time I've used Idea. As a workaround, building without defining testCoverageEnabled in main/build.gradle solved my problem. See commit PR. #6341
Manager.title: [dev] local variable hidden in Android Studio

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: I tried to retest #6110 and had another issue: Disable "Static maps loading" in Settings - Offline-Data Load unsaved cache (e.g. GC77) Select Navigate -> Save Static Maps Actual behavior after performing these steps: The menu option "Save Static Maps" is not shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: "Save Static Maps" should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.21-NB1-72baaed Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Static Map loading option not visible

Manager.description: Hi, I am using Lint to check for warnings in cgeo and found some warnings that can cause problems: Multi-catch with these reflection exceptions requires API level 19 (current min is 14) because they get compiled to the common but new super type ReflectiveOperationException. As a workaround either create individual catch statements, or catch Exception I found warnings of this category on line 127 in FilterActivity.java line 31 in CustomProgressDiag.java and line 150 in SortActionProvider.java This warning may lead to crash as suggested in an issue report of Android (See comment 2) Format string auth_register is not a valid format string so it should not be passed to String.format This warning can be found in many places in the project like line 274 in TokenAuthorizationActivity.java. I have checked strings.xml. The string is really not a valid string format and the second parameter passed to the method would be ignored. This Handler class should be static or leaks might occur (anonymous cgeo.geocaching.utils.DisposableHandler) This is a possible memory leak issue found on line 399 in CacheListActivity.java and line 165 in GPXImporter I have found some related discussions from StackOverflow Hope this information can help. :)
Manager.title: Lint Warnings may cause crash, display problem and memory leak

Manager.description: Problem: Hitting "back" only takes you one step back. A lot of times you want to go back right to the overview / start page . Solution: A simple Home Button top left would solve the problem immediately.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Home Button

Manager.description: Problem: uploading a picture while logging not possible right now. - Have to edit the log at home and upload there. Solution: Option to upload at least 1 photo would be great.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Uploading a photo when logging

Manager.description: Running gradle's checkstyle target as part of the continuous integration would help to automatically discover some issue. See #6352 and #6350 (review comments) for examples.
Manager.title: Add checkstyle to CI

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open the details of a server defined waypoint Click on the coordinates Select "Duplicate waypoint" Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast is shown that the waypoint has been duplicated but the screen still shows the server waypoint While this is logical for itself, the user expectation might be different. Expected behavior after performing these steps: As the user clicked on the coords he most likely wants to enter new coords (we recently blocked this for server defined WPs for a good reason), so we should directly take him to the copied waypoint as he selected to duplicate it. Right now he has to leave the WP detail view, scroll and search for the duplicated WP, enter the WP details and then finally edit the coords. Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.23-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: I would like to get your opinion on how this should work. 👍 1
Manager.title: Duplicate waypoint from within a waypoint should open the duplicated one

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open detail page of a cache Click on owner name Actual behavior after performing these steps: A menu with many options is shown, however simply copy the user name is missing Expected behavior after performing these steps: Add an menu entry to copy the owner name Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.23-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> Swipe right to System) Keep the apostrophe at beginning and end to have it properly formatted Other comments and remarks: Same for all other menus, where the user can click on a users name (e.g. logbook)
Manager.title: Add option to copy user name

Manager.description: Due to #6326 we created a privacy policy for the contacts and calendar plugin. Note: It is required by Google currently only for the contacts plugin due to the permission android.permission.READ_CONTACTS. For the calendar plugin we do in fact only write to the calendar but also request android.permission.READ_CALENDAR. So we created a policy for the calendar plugin as well. Part of the Google requirement is also, to show/link the privacy policy from within the app: Action required: Include a link to a valid privacy policy on your app's Store Listing page and within your app. You can find more information in our help center. As we do not have any UI for the plugins this is not so easy to solve. I made the following proposal in the original issue: I do only see the option to (if technically possible) trigger a popup on first usage linking to the privacy policy.
Manager.title: In-App link to privacy policy

Manager.description: I would like to have a second GC.com account in c:geo that is used for loading cache data. For example, I have both a separate account and a team account with my father, with the latter having premium features for us both. I would like to use one account only for loading cache listing (PMO caches) and the other for status, logging and everything else. GS once stated that they are ok with families sharing premium features, which is why they don't check access on the log page, for example.
Manager.title: FR: Second r/o GC.com account

Manager.description: PMO caches can be logged even without being PM as the log page does not check access rights (intentionally, according to GS). However, with c:geo, there is no way to log a PMO cache that is not stored offline. Please add a button to the PMO toast to open the log window nonetheless.
Manager.title: Add log button to PMO toast

Manager.description: As briefly mentioned in #6362 the calendar plugin might be obsolete with the possibility to send intents to a calendar to add entries which is possible starting API level 14.
Manager.title: Replace calendar plugin by intent method

Manager.description: I've enabled Mention-Bot for our main repository. For each new pull request, it will mention the 3 committers, that had the most changes previously on the affected lines of the pull request. Maybe this improves PR reviews a bit. Here is a live example from yesterday: #6372 This issue is mostly for collecting feedback. If you have any complaints, or feel this should be disabled again, please feel free to comment. Otherwise I will close the issue in some days. And of course, this is NOT meant to stop everyone else from reviewing the PR. :) 👍 2
Manager.title: Mention-bot on pull requests

Manager.description: ++++ Good Very good
Manager.title: Spam

Manager.description: Are you aware that there seems to be a fairly major change to the 'Log geocache' page on the website on the way? Sometimes (not always) when I try to log a cache on the website, I get a blue bar at the top of the page asking me to try the 'new logging experience'. It looks very simplistic, I didn't actually get it to work. I'm afraid I can't get it to re-appear now to get a screen shot. Just thought you might like a heads-up.
Manager.title: New "Log geocache" page on website

Manager.title: Nightly builds fail

Manager.description: I propose to install xymon-client on our newly refreshed server so -at least- I can monitor it on my home instance. Is this ok for everyone?
Manager.title: Install Xymon on new server

Manager.description: Is it possible to use parts of cgeo as an unofficial command line interface/api? I tried to search for relevant classes or functions but I couldn't find any. For searching, retrieving, filtering caches in a pc terminal instead of in an android app?
Manager.title: Using c:geo itself as an unofficial api

Manager.description: I tried to build a release with CI using http://ci.cgeo.org/job/cgeo%20release/ . This is the ouput which looks fine: http://ci.cgeo.org/job/cgeo%20release/26/ Still the resulting APK cannot be used for upgrading from existing release 2017.02.07: 12:50:33.641 Warning PackageManager 895 Can't install update of cgeo.geocaching update version 0 is older than installed version 20170207 Cleanly installing the APK I can see that no version code has been set: 13:08:28.805 Info cgeo 11694 [main] Starting cgeo.geocaching 0 a.k.a null Assigning @mucek4 and @kumy. Can one of you take a look at this?
Manager.title: Release job on CI produces APK without version code

Manager.description: Legacy release 2017.02.30-legacy (API 9-13): Smoke test Upload to Play Tag release on Github at 511b1e4 (this has to be done for legacy first before doing it for the standard release) Upload APK to Github and publish release Trigger release notification for legacy Release 2017.03.19 (API>=14): Smoke test Upload to Play Tag release on Github at afcdc99 (this has to be done after the same has been completed for the legacy version to have it displayed as newest release) Upload APK to Github and publish release Adapt milestones on Github Trigger release notification via status.cgeo.org once release is available Publish release to Fdroid Post on social media
Manager.title: Post release tasks 2017.03.19/2017.02.30-legacy

Manager.description: While investigatin #6413 we found that we use CloseQuietly() although it is only supported starting with API level 16 (our minsdk is 14 now). There are only rare crash reports on Google Play however we have like 30 occurences in the code. So either we remove it or raise minsdk again to 16 which would close out all Android versions below 4.1.
Manager.title: CloseQuitely not supported below API 16

Manager.description: Due to fix of #6415 and (partly fixed) #6344 I will soon create another RC/Beta version in preparation of a next quick bugfix release. Checklist for upcoming bugfix release: Check/Insert correct version name as headline in changelog-release.xml Build release on CI server (normal + legacy) Perform smoke test with resulting cgeo-release.apk (and legacy) before continuing Upload and publish cgeo-release.apk (and legacy) to Google Play Tag the releases on Github Publish the release on Github including upload of cgeo-release.apk (and legacy) to Github Publish release on F-Droid Rename/Create milestones on Github Trigger notification to status.cgeo.org via CI server once the release is available on Google Play Post release info to Facebook Post release info to G+ Post release info to Twitter
Manager.title: Next bugfix release (normal + legacy)

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open details page of cache Click on cache owner name Click on "Send Message" OR Open logbook page of cache Click on username Click on "Send Message" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Webpage opens on google chrome, link = "Send Email to (Username)" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Webpage opens on google chrome, link = "New Message to (Username)" on Message Center Version of c:geo used: 2017-03-19 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> Swipe right to System) Keep the apostrophe at beginning and end to have it properly formatted Other comments and remarks: e.g. Reference to other issues, projects, sources, etc.
Manager.title: Message Center link

Manager.description: The setting section in Settings - System for "GeocacheData" is not likely to be identified as "clickable". I suggest to add a field below the description text showing the currently used dir and clicking on that offers the dir selection dialog.
Manager.title: Improve setting design

Manager.description: As the operation of moving GeocacheData from internal to external might take long, we should show a clear progress. Test still outstanding how long it actually take with 1k or 5k cache dirs.
Manager.title: Show percentage of completion while moving GeocacheData

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have a full SD-card Open nearby list Try to store search results Actual behavior after performing these steps: c:geo is stuck in download progress 0/20 Expected behavior after performing these steps: Some (to be discussed) handling of that problem Version of c:geo used: http://ci.cgeo.org/job/cgeo%20pull%20request/816/artifact/main/build/outputs/apk/cgeo-debug.apk Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: tbc Other comments and remarks: Just a quick test performed. Better test later. Manager.description: From Google Play. Occurence started with November 2016 release. Manager.description: From Google Play starting with November 2016 release: Users are all on Xiaomi devices (running Andoird 4.4 - 6.0). So I assume this is a fault in Xiamo again, but I would like you to confirm and evaluate the possibility of a workaround. Seems to be related to trackable activities. Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have GeocacheData moved to external SD card Close and kill c:geo Remove SD card from device Start c:geo Log shows Warning (see first sdb log attached) Try to enter Menu -> Settings (e.g. if you plan to set the storage to internal again) Actual behavior after performing these steps: Crash Expected behavior after performing these steps: Detect absence of GeocacheData dir and e.g. fallback (to be discussed) to internal dir in that case. Also without a fallback c:geo should not crash when entering settings menu allowing the user to manually adjust the dir setting. Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start moving geocache data to/from SD Actual behavior after performing these steps: Progress window appears on top of the screen Expected behavior after performing these steps: Just cosmetic: The progress window should be centered on the screen Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.25-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Android 5.1.1 Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 Edition 2014 (SD removeable without power down) Other comments and remarks: Screenshot
Manager.title: Progress indication should be centered on screen

Manager.description: Follow up from #6426 #6426 (comment): Handling of SD-card full while moving needs either to be properly reported back to the user or we should check source size and target capacity before moving. Maybe an additional warning before the process would be good: "This process can take a long time, do you want to continue". #6426 (comment) I'm thinking of calculating the used space in the GeocacheData directory and also showing the available free disk space in the selection dialog (per mount point). Then we could prevent choosing a directory, if there is not enough space.
Manager.title: Handling of SD-card full "before" moving geocache data

Manager.description: Wäre es möglich einzublenden, in welchem Landkreis (in der Schweiz = Gemeinde) ein Cache gelistet ist? Mir wäre das sehr dienlich. So wie beispielsweise in project-gc.com ... Jeder Cache ist in einer Region (wird bereits angezeigt), einem Bundesland (je nach Land = Provinz oder Kanton...) und einem Landkreis (in der Schweiz = Gemeinde) zugeordnet. Es geht darum diese niederere Ordnung zu erfassen und einzublenden. Lg Phil (QQI)
Manager.title: Landkreise (resp. Gemeinden) anzeigen

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Move geocache data from external to internal In the dialog before moving it shows "xMB used" (x=282,2 in my case) Move geocache data again from internal to external In the dialog before moving it shows "yMB used" (y=192,4 in my case) Move geocache date again from external to internal Actual behavior after performing these steps: In the dialog before moving it now shows "0B used" Actually also the progress is getting much faster now (almost instantly). Expected behavior after performing these steps: First we need to find out what actually happens here. Is the data still moved or do we count less data and also move less data? Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.29-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galacy S7 with Android 7.0 and external SD 64GB
Manager.title: Consecutive move of geocache data has problems

Manager.description: According to http://gsak.net/board/index.php?showtopic=32259 there will be two changes to the available log types for the API as well as the website: A user can log a cache only once as found. c:geo should handle this in two ways: Handle the message returned by the website in case of an error; show a warning and disallow another found log if the cache is known as already found. The owner of a cache cannot log found and maintenance logs. This should be reflected in the available log types in c:geo.
Manager.title: Adapt new logging rules at GC

Manager.description: Today I had the first opportunity to use cgeo field notes with OC.de After uploading a file containing OC and GC notes, the Oc.de website declared the file as invalid. Need to test later whether the mixed content is the problem, or something else.
Manager.title: Field note file not accepted by OC.de

Manager.description: From Google Play recommendations: https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2017/03/update-your-app-to-take-advantage-of.html
Manager.title: Google suggests to support new aspect rations

Manager.description: Recently there were some new strings to be translated. One example is init_dbonsdcard with english string : "On public file system" IMO the use of the word "public" is not the best choice here. While from the developer perspective, the private internal storage space available for apps is one thing, and the user visible filesystems, be it internal emulated, internal partitioned, external as in SD card or external as in USB OTG mount, the latter might be considered "public" as opposed to private, no user access, from user point of view the semantics of the word "public" is different. user knows less about internal storage and more about what he/she sees via file manager, meaning internal emulated / partitioned and SD card (where available), as filesystems in the same sense as on a desktop computer. user might understand by "public" something like publicly available - that is available to anyone (not restricted to his device), including cloud like storage. Also this may raise undesirable flags in the user's mind. user knows about internal storage = internal emulated/partitioned storage as seen by file manager user knows about external storage aka SD card where available (device has slot and slot contains sdcard) IMO what c:geo should make clear is the following: c:geo storing it's database internally (same as app data and app cache; not available to user) c:geo storing it's database on internal/emulated storage (but user available) c:geo storing it's database on external/sdcard storage (user available) P.S. Don't forget about newer Android versions that drastically restrict access to sdcard directories (unless rooted)
Manager.title: Translation strings - sdcard, external storage, "public filesystem"

Manager.description: With recent changes we disallowed editing the waypoint text of server waypoints. At least we should allow copying the text to clipboard (via long click on it), so that the user can reuse e.g. contained formulas, etc.
Manager.title: Allow copying waypoint description text

Manager.description: Thats how it looks on my Samsung S4. You are not able to see the free space on the target dirs:
Manager.title: Dialog for dir selection truncated

Manager.description: we are already filtering the dependency resolution process to avoid beta versions of dependencies. Gradle 3.5 will have a new syntax for that, so we should refactor that block: https://docs.gradle.org/3.5-rc-3/release-notes.html#plugin-resolution-rules
Manager.title: use plugin resolution rules in gradle 3.5

Manager.description: Hi, Cgeo remove the first log created by GSAK when user refresh caches. This first log contains personnal notes, it is alway the first log of the cache in the GSP created by GSAK. The user is always GSAK. Would it be possible to keep this log even after a refresh ? Detailed steps causing the problem: GSAK : Create some caches with personnal notes GSAK : Export GPX with options - include user notes in export - Extra informations to show in first log = %UserNote CGEO : Import the GPX (i put a gpx as attachement) CGEO : You can see the notes in first log of caches CGEO : Refresh all caches CGEO : The log created by GSAK as been removed Gpx.zip Many thanks for your software Best regards Pierre
Manager.title: GSAK First log

Manager.description: I would like to suggest a small improvement. It would be great to tag the waypoint as "visited" directly from the waypoint screen either by tapping on the icon here or via context menu braugt up by long pressing in here. It would save time a lot, cause now people have to edit and save the waypoint.
Manager.title: "Visited" tag in the Waypoint screen

Manager.description: Just found in another project a .editorconfig file. http://editorconfig.org/ EditorConfig helps developers define and maintain consistent coding styles between different editors and IDEs. The EditorConfig project consists of a file format for defining coding styles and a collection of text editor plugins that enable editors to read the file format and adhere to defined styles. EditorConfig files are easily readable and they work nicely with version control systems. Some editors are able read it without plugin, like Idea, some need a plugin, like eclipse. What about adding such support for our project? 👍 1
Manager.title: Use EditorConfig?

Manager.description: Since the removal of the showcase library we are getting lots of warnings about unused strings. How do we deal with such removals with crowdin? In earlier years I simply deleted them in the source repository in all language XML files, but I'm not sure if that is still the right way. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_cachelist_title' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_compass_hint_text' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_compass_hint_title' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_logcache_text' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_logcache_title' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_main_text' has no default translation. 01:28.337 warning: string 'showcase_main_title' has no default translation.
Manager.title: Translation strings of previous showcase

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have additional geocache data stored on internal storage (15 MB used) Fill up external SD with dummy data until less than 15MB are available (in my case 6MB available) Select Menu - Settings - System and open storage selection Actual behavior after performing these steps: Both dir options are shown (internal and external) Free space and used space is shown correctly Dialog looks normal but I cannot select the external SD (6 MB free) Expected behavior after performing these steps: I guess this is intentional as the free space on SD (6MB) is not sufficient (15MB used). This however is not intuitive in this dialog. The target which has not sufficient space should be e.g. "greyed out" Version of c:geo used: 2017.04.23-RC Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galaxy S4

Manager.description: Right now you have the option to save caches shown on the live map to a list and have them available offline. That feature is good, but like a second step / option is missing imho. If you have the live map open and you have caches in the area already saved but maybe a longer time ago you want to update just these caches you see. Right now this means go into every cache and update it as the whole list they are stored on is maybe too much. Wouldn't it be possible to have an menu option to update the caches seen in the live map like you are able to save them? Like offline update or so.
Manager.title: Option to update caches - already saved - based on map selection
