Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Activate a cache type filter in the main menu function (lower right icon) Open list of saved caches Click on the active filter notification icon on too Actual behavior after performing these steps: The filter menu for list filtering is opened, where the user cannot find a way to reset the active filter Expected behavior after performing these steps: The main menu filter option should open Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.29 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: The underlying problem here is once again the filter structure which needs to be reworked. Other issues exist for that. Still the user should be able to drop or change the filter when clicking on it.
Manager.title: Click on active filter opens wrong menu

Manager.description: When c:geo is freshly installed on a device and first run, it presents several suggestions about it's functions. One such suggestion is suggesting by default to configure your geocaching.com account. And here comes the marketing and and P.R. problem. Assume one tries to introduce a new user to c:geo as an app for an opencaching service. Instead of having to enter (for the first time) the settings -> services menu and choosing the appropriate service, c:geo by default pushes the geocaching.com service in front. Now I have a BIG marketing and P.R. setback because I have to give additional explanations (some confuse the new user) about other services. I don't mean to exclude or prevent the user from ever accessing other services, but still. Just try to imagine: you are tasked with marketing Pepsi to others. When you talk to them, you pull a can out of your bag. And it's a Coca Cola. Ok... they are both "cola" soft drinks. But you have made a fool of yourself and in the best case have a lot of explaining to do to catch up. Well, yes, most of c:geo users indeed are geocaching.com users. Still, for an open-source app, that has no affiliation and obligations (does it?) toward Groundpspeak, that offers geocaching features from many different services, doesn't seem fair, nor independent. 👍 1 ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Introducing c:geo to new users - a fair playground

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open a list in c:geo after a long day of geocaching one wants to know what the average difficulty or average terrain value of the found caches is. Actual behavior after performing these steps: there is no easy way to calculate those statistical data right in the app. Expected behavior after performing these steps: one-click, and there is a statistic dialog with the desired data Version of c:geo used: 2017.04.27-RC Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes. No really a problem but time-consuming. Other comments and remarks: Just a feature for those of us who's interested in statistics. 😕 1
Manager.title: Please, provide a possibility to get some statistics of the current list

Manager.description: Recent log images created with the original GC app have a standard caption "Created with ... bla bla". I intend to remove that during parsing, since it has completely no value for the user. Example log: https://coord.info/GLQVK1TX
Manager.title: remove useless log image captions

Manager.description: Detailed description of the problem: Adding new functions to the cache list causes a growing of the menu. Issue #6528 asks for a new functionality which adds an additional menu item. In that issue I suggested a restructuring of the main cache list menu. Actual behaviour: A lot of menu items... Suggestion: Restructuring of the menu like this: Show on map Filter Sort Switch select mode Invert select mode Manage cashes ** Refresh all / selected ** Move all / selected ** Copy all / selected ** Remove all / selected ** Delete offline-logs ** Delete past events Manage lists ** Create new list ** Remove current list ** Rename current list ** Make list unique Import ** Import GPX ** Import from send2cgeo ** Import from Android Export ** Export GPX ** Field notes ** Personal notes Remove from history
Manager.title: Proposed restructuring of the cache list menu

Manager.description: c:geo only uses GPS while running in foreground and with screen on. c:geo's purpose, by nature, is to provide location (GPS) based functionalities. For such a GPS focused application, to release the GPS in several, requiring restarting the GPS (even if it is a hot restart) and waiting for a fix, is not the best way towards users. Also as I have pointed out in other issues I have reported, please do not design c:geo in ways like expecting/requiring users to have the latest, most expensive, top of the line devices. Such behaviour is detrimental to c:geo and geocaching penetration to potential users in (at least) some countries that are not among the most highly developed (economically). And this means more then a few with low end devices. Now to the technical points. I strongly disagree with the strategy described here: http://www.cgeo.org/faq.html#gps-powersafe or the resolution here #4879 . Let me explain: requiring users to manage an external app to keep the GPS module on is by far not the best attitude to adopt towards users, for an app whose core functionality is based on GPS. It also adds complications and frustration to new or less IT experienced users. many apps adopt a UI switch to turn on/off the GPS while using that app. Just look at apps like Locus, OruxMaps, Androzic, Pathaway, etc. Keep GPS on until explicitely turned off by user, or application explicitely exited (see below). IMO c:geo should really consider this concept. time, position change and signal level since last turned on DO affect the hot start of any GPS. Time to fix may be significantly longer due to poor signal conditions (eg tall buildings, forest cover, valleys), as compared to maintaning an existing fix while signal level is decreasing. don't assume user has very high performance device, even if most of the developer have. In fact I would suggest to the developers to routinely test both on high performance and mid-range (lower mid-range) devices to gauge the performance of c:geo in a more realistic way. IMO, as a GPS oriented app, I would expect c:geo to perform at least the following way: c:geo is open, has focus. GPS on. c:geo is open, has focus, screen is off. GPS on. (by turning off the screen either manually or by timeout is by no means equal to the intention of turning off the GPS) c:geo running in background in the following scenarios: c:geo has focus and the user changes app that has focus (window manager) c:geo has focus and user goes to home screen These may be considered GPS on optional, or based on setting. But still, GPS on if GPS turn on button in c:geo was used c:geo is closed by explicit user action: c:geo has focus, from main screen, user presses "BACK". Exit the app. Optionally display exit confirmation. c:geo has focus. User chooses "Exit" menu option (to be implemented). See many other dedicated GPS apps. Note: turning off GPS on some screens in the app is nonsense. I seriously doubt going through the settings menus for half a minute incurs such a significant energy saving. And going through the settings menu is by design a seldom used feature to begin with. And me leaving c:geo open in the settings menu draining battery because GPS is on, now that is my fault and my responsability. Even as an experienced IT person, I still find it frustrating and hassling to having to rely on an external app and the associated management, just to maintain GPS fix while I go geocaching with c:geo. 👍 1
Manager.title: Keep GPS on while in c:geo and screen is off

Manager.description: We still have some occurence of crashes reported on Google Play, which canbe tracked back to the fact that users have debug logging activated (in which case we might explicitly abort the app in some failure cases). After thinking a bit about it (and also discussion in some issues here) I came to the conclusion, that the end user experience is the important point here. We can not blame users for accidentally activating the setting, but should take measures to avoid them running into this problem. So mainly two ways I can imagine: Make the setting somehow transient It is not wise to disable debug logging on each start, because the startup and login process itself is likely to need debug logging during testing. But might be it is technically possible, to disable it after 24 hours?! Hide the setting from normal settings menu and move it to somewhere else. For example clicking x times on a certain icon to activate it.
Manager.title: Make debug log setting transient or hide it somehow

Manager.description: I just swithed from WM10 where I was using maaloo geocaching. While I'm really impressed with all the features has, there is one I'm already missing very much. Like stated in the subiect, it woild be great to be able to create a waypoint by just taping and holding on the map. Use case: I view the cache I want to drive to and it doesn't have a parking waypoint. In the map view I can see an OSM marked parking near by (or any other object that could serve as a parking spot). I tap and hold on that spot and a "pin" or createn wew WPT menu appears From that menu I can either save it or select "Navigate" option (which I can use to pass the location e.g. to Google maps. I consider this feature useful because sometimes suitable parking places aren't always on the road closest to the target (therefore the navigation might not lead you to them if you navigate to the cache coordinates). Also, in an unfamiliar country it is best to be navigated straight to the parking as different signs and markings already add to the confusion. Regards WW
Manager.title: Create waypoints directly from the map view

Manager.description: There are some users on social media and support mail asking us, why suddenly they do see a large amount of geocaching related pictures in their gallery apps. It seems, that some gallery apps also scan below /Android/data for media files and thus show them in the overview. I am not sure, if there is any standard or guideline if these folders should be scanned for media (e.g. on my S7 the default gallery app is not showing them). We could think about placing a .nomedia file into the base dir of GeocacheData. What do you think?
Manager.title: Add .nomedia to GeocacheData dir

Manager.description: Probably I should have asked somewhere in IRC, but it's more convenient from smartphone here and also it will be documented. The question is stupid simple - how do you select which features to implement next (except bugfixing and some maintenance stuff)? Just decide witchin the evening chat in IRC? Or do you have some kinda voting for new features? Except implementing it by my own, is there some possibility to increase chance of being implemented for features I'm (and other users) interested in? Maybe it would be useful to have issues list with "votes" so you could see what users would like to see ("users" in this context == "github users")
Manager.title: New features process

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: -Download or write a personal Note ( with morge the 500x charactars edit it, make it longer, what do you want. reupload it too the server Actual behavior after performing these steps: When the note is longer then 500x characters c:geo open a popup window and tell you that the personal note will cut off by the geocaching.com server after 500x characters . Expected behavior after performing these steps: the popup window should only open when he note is longer then 2500x characters and then to tell you that the note will be cut off by the geocaching.com server after 2500x characters. Version of c:geo used: 2017.04.27-RC and 2017.05.22 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Groundspeak has made an update to the personal note system and raised the max charakters from 500x to 2500x charakter. Is it possible to show the counted charaters of the personalnote field in the top of the edit field ( beside the close/save icon) like (1478 / 2500) ? greetings from germany Marco / Wulfman_Do
Manager.title: Raise note length limit to 2500 characters

First step would be merge of master to release and publish of a beta version. This would also allow to get some feedback on the new cache list menu structure. Please kindly give your "Thumbs up/down" and someone to merge once we have positive feedback.

Manager.description: Follow-up of #6601: A cache with one 5-star rating will be ranked higher than a cache with 20 4.5-star ratings. While this commit solves a specific problem, it is not the solution for a correct rating. We get average rating and number of votes, this should be enough to sort caches in a better way. http://www.evanmiller.org/how-not-to-sort-by-average-rating.html https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1411199/what-is-a-better-way-to-sort-by-a-5-star-rating
Manager.title: Improve sort by rating

Manager.description: GeoKrety service will reach five digits numbering soon. [about 1700 numbers left]. I think we have something to do on our side to handle 4 to 5 numbering. I can think of: int to hexa conversion function (maybe) intents
Manager.title: GeoKrety reaching 5 digits (GKFFFF - 65535)

Manager.description: The Send2c:geo script updated yesterday and it no longer appears on firefox, is that something dealt with here? Send 2 c:geo is now version 0:38
Manager.title: Send2cgeo no longer working.

Manager.description: As owner I need to be able to add a "Needs Maintenance" (NM) log to my own Geocaches. This is necessary because some Geocachers report that something is wrong with a cache without adding a NM log. This helps to keep track of all my own caches which need some care. It seems, that NM was removed from the log menu. Please restore it to the state as it was before. Thank you! Christian
Manager.title: Owner cannot add "Needs Maintenance" log to his own Geocache

Manager.description: As I just learned it is not possible anymore for a owner to log "Needs Maintenance" (NM) for his own geocaches. Therefore I registered a second account on geocaching.com which I want to use only to log NM. Also, my girlfriend has her own account, and sometimes, when she forgot to take her mobile phone with her, she wants to use my phone to log a geocache. But of course she doesn't remember her password. Would it be possible to add a multi user feature and make it possible to switch users fast and simple by selecting a user from a list of saved users within cgeo? Thanks, Christian 👎 2
Manager.title: Feature Request: multi user / switch user

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: I upgraded Firefox last week to 52.2.1 version. After this I cannot see "send to c:geo" button/link on any geocaching page (ie, listing w/o button, detail on map w/o link, etc). Open, eg: https://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC77V28_princezna-v-kocare Actual behavior after performing these steps: no button Send to c:geo next to "Send to My GPS" Expected behavior after performing these steps: button Send to c:geo next to "Send to My GPS" Version of c:geo used: Send to c:geo FF plugin version 0.38 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Windows 7 SP1, Firefox 52.2.1 (32-bit) Other comments and remarks: On Toolbar, on www.geocaching page, there is "monkey button". After clicking arrow next to it, I can see "Sent to cgeo" and "Geocaching map enhancement" both marked as active. But, as I said, no button.
Manager.title: Send to c:geo disappeared in Firefox browser

Manager.description: I received the following announcement from crowdin: Hello, This is Andriy from Crowdin team, hope you are fine! Our developers have notified me that according to our database records, some API calls sent for the project(s) listed below lead to http://api.crowdin.net endpoint instead of https://api.crowdin.com : c:geo In a week, we're planning to perform a redirect to https://api.crowdin.com when the request is sent to http://api.crowdin.net or https://api.crowdin.net . It should not cause any issues with API communication, but still that would be great if you could verify your current configuration On July 25th, http://api.crowdin.net and https://api.crowdin.net are planned to be competely disabled and thus it's strongly recommended to switch to https://api.crowdin.com beforehand to prevent any pauses with your Crowdin integration. Kindly check this inquiry with your development team Should you have any questions or need further assistance, you are welcome to reach me directly. Thanks! -- Sincerely, Andriy Poznakhovskyy, Head of Customer Success, Crowdin beacon
Manager.title: Switch crowdin access to https://api.crowdin.com

Manager.description: When starting c.geo when it has no location fix (yet), then the map is always centered on my home location as defined in my geocaching.com account (see http://www.cgeo.org/faq#default-location). However, it is far more likely that I am interested in the area around the last known or shown position than that I am interested in the area around my home location (if these are different). Please adjust c.geo so that if it has no location fix then it shows the map centered on the last known (GPS) or shown (map) position, or even on the location of the last reviewed geocache (in c.geo's History list). All three of these are more likely to be of interest to me than the area around my home location. Some scenarios in which this matters: I am on vacation in a far-away location where I have to limit roaming charges and conserve battery power. Every time I go outside to go geocaching, I turn on c.geo and GPS. While it has no location fix yet, c.geo shows the area around my home location, which is far from my current location. I have to wait until it acquires a location fix before I can easily start looking at nearby geocaches -- or I have to laboriously navigate on the map from my home location to my current location again. When I'm inside, I have location services turned off to conserve battery power. When I turn on c.geo to review recent caches or to plan caches for the remainder of the day, c.geo again shows the area around my home location instead. Navigating on the map all the way from my home location to my current location is tedious, because I need to zoom out a lot to be able to get to my current location quickly, but then the geography is obscured by all of the geocache icons covering the entire area, so it is hard to tell to where to zoom in again. And if I want to go via the most recent cache in the "History" folder of the "Stored" caches list as a shortcut, then I have to wait until the "Stored" caches list displays, which takes a long time if it has 10,000 caches in it, as it did during my last vacation. If the location fix is lost while c.geo is on, then c.geo seems to assume that it is still at its last known position -- at least, the map then doesn't suddenly jump to my home location. It would be good if c.geo acted the same way if it lost its location fix because c.geo was turned off temporarily. Version of c:geo used: 2017.05.22 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, very much so. It isn't a recent problem, either. c.geo has acted like this for as long as I've used it. Regards, Louis Strous
Manager.title: Initial position when offline should be last known position

Manager.description: I see a web cam cache first when sorting by favorite percent with only 70 favorite s but 1800 photos taken. Looks like we take only found counts, which are near zero for the webcam cache, instead of aggregating all logs which represent finds, e.g. photo, attended etc.
Manager.title: Sort by favorite percent is wrong

Manager.description: A friend just demonstrated on his phone that he can open a cache from a mail in k9 and then start cgeo normally, and afterwards there are 2 instances running (as you can verify by editing some data without storing to database in one instance). Can we prevent this by adding some flags to our activities?
Manager.title: Two instances when started from k9

Manager.description: Dear developers, We are applying our performance diagnosis tool PerfProbe to debug the response time for searching for nearby cache given a same address. Through repeated testing in an identical setup, we observe intermittent slowdown for the search result to be displayed (response time on average around 3.6 seconds and can increase to over 7 seconds). Through its system-wide profiling and tracing, PerfProbe discovers that the source of extra delay results from longer waiting time for server-side response. In particular, cgeo app is waiting for the response of two sequential HTTP GET request - one by GCLogin.getRequestLogged inside the method GCParser.searchByAny and another by GCVote.loadRatings inside the method SearchResult.filterSearchResults (with the detailed call chain CoordsGeocacheListLoader.apply -> GCConnector.searchByCenter -> GCParser.searchByCoords -> GCParser.searchByAny -> SearchResult.filterSearchResults). We hope the findings from our tool can be helpful for your debugging. We are also interested in helping improving the performance of this interaction. One suggestion to improve the latency that we can come up with is to batch the two HTTP requests in one network round trip - parallel HTTP request if they have no dependency or otherwise combine the response information of two requests together such that one new HTTP request is sufficient. Thank you very much for your attention and clarification! Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1: click "Search" Step 2: enter address information under "Address" Step 3: click "Search by address" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Intermittently longer waiting time for the list of nearby geo caches to be loaded Expected behavior after performing these steps: A list of nearby geo caches are loaded Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.29 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Android version: Android 4.4.4 Device: Nexus 4
Manager.title: Intermittent slowdown for loading nearby cache

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have an offline "found" log stored for a saved cache (maybe optional) Open the offline log and send it online While the log is being sent provoke an action to get the activity into background (e.g. change to another app, go to home screen, (maybe) rotate device) Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast appears "Logtype has been changed" Looking into the caches logbook you will see your "found" log online and an additional "did not find" log stored offline Expected behavior after performing these steps: Online log is posted Offline log is removed from device Version of c:geo used: 2017.05.22 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes (beside unclear about "maybe" steps)
Manager.title: Offline log created while posting online log

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Save an already found or own Cache in a List (probably also for deactived caches) Go to Live Map select the option "Hide own/found caches" Actual behavior after performing these steps: The Cache icons disapear. But the additional waypoints, e.g. Stages, Parking Lots ... stay visible Expected behavior after performing these steps: If you don't want to see your already found caches, the stages should not be visible too. Version of c:geo used: 2017.05.22 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: --- System information --- Device: SM-G900F Android version 6.0.1 Other comments and remarks:
Manager.title: Don't show stages or other waypoints of hidden but saved caches

Manager.description: Does “Remove all” remove a cache from the current list from all lists it’s on? While this is useful for the history, for other lists I may wish to delete only the current list, keeping caches that are also in other lists on the device.
Manager.title: Remove all except crosslisted?

Manager.description: Submitting "needs maintenance" log for GC cache gets a warning about submitting an "unusual" log type. Wouldn't "special" be a more meaningful word? It may also help if the text clearly stated that such "special" log type incurrs additional actions on the cache (like setting a flag, notifying owner, etc) Thank you.
Manager.title: "unusual" or "special" log type?

Manager.description: Using c:geo I have encountered (for unknown reasons) errors while submitting logs (with all my trackables set to "visited"). The message was smth like "error posting log, please try again". Today I looked into my GC account from a PC and found that for caches where I encountered such errors I discovered that I actually posted several logs to that cache, instead of just one. In fact, there was a log posted for each attempt I made. Clearly posting a cache log and then posting a log for each trackable is done in the same thread (as regard to error handling) and the error message I got was erroneous, by that I mean: actual cache log was successfully posted the error happened for one of the trackables log ("visited") I was left in the situation to retry to post the cache log, even though it was successfully posted the first time. I worked around by not visiting my trackables. Also note that it happened for many caches, but never for "found logs". I encountered the problem with DNF and Needs maintenance.
Manager.title: Error although log posted successfully

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: send2cgeo only accepts single cache IDs. This leads to possibly a lot of browser windows/tabs remaining open after a list of caches has been sent (e.g. from the respective GSAK macro or similar). Closing these windows via JS on the client side seems not possible, because the time required until the request is handled is undefined and getting the result seems impossible due to CORS issues. Expected behavior after performing these steps: additional parameter for send2cgeo to handle a ; etc. delimited list of cache IDs
Manager.title: Multiple cache IDs for send2cgeo

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Select a cache Start navigating, display on map Look about and search Lock screen for some reason Want to use both hands Actual behavior after performing these steps: Expected behavior after performing these steps: Version of c:geo used: Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> Swipe right to System) Keep the apostrophe at beginning and end to have it properly formatted Other comments and remarks: e.g. Reference to other issues, projects, sources, etc.
Manager.title: Keeping geolocatin active while navigating

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Create a new List with some found and some unfound caches Open the List View the List on the map by clicking the Map icon Select "Hide own/found caches" in Map settings Actual behavior after performing these steps: The own/found caches are still visible Expected behavior after performing these steps: They should be hidden Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.26-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Map view of List shows own/found caches when it shouldn't.

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Zoom into an area on the live map where you have both stored and unstored caches Choose Store Offline in menu Create a new list or select an existing list Actual behavior after performing these steps: Only the caches that are not already stored in any other lists are added to the new list. The cache with the offline log is also added to the new list, even if it has a "stored" icon Expected behavior after performing these steps: All caches in the map view should be added to the new list. Since several lists can co-exist nowadays the already stored caches should be added to the new list as well. Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.26-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
Manager.title: Only unstored caches on live map view are stored in selected list

Manager.description: Just built a new nightly to take a first look at the waypoint calculator. I had no time to test in details, so just a short try where I either found a bug or still have a misunderstanding of the working mode. Detailed steps causing the problem: Start with a new calculation Assign A to F to the last lat and lon digits Enter formulas for A to F where A=a , B=b, C=c-b Actual behavior after performing these steps: When entering B=b the variable input field for b is shown, when entering C=c-b a new variable field for c is shown but the field for b is gone Expected behavior after performing these steps: Variable input b should stay Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.29-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 Android 7.0 Other comments and remarks: I added a new label "WP Calc" to get a better overview for issues regarding the new WP calculator.
Manager.title: Variable field vanishing on certain input

Manager.description: The import menu should contain an option to open a list with all downloadable PQ. The selected PQ should be imported to the active list (or open the dialog with the active list pre-selected). 👍 1
Manager.title: Add PQ list to import menu

Manager.description: On my LineageOS 14 device, using the lighttheme, the coordinate calculator is illegible. The variable names are white on a very light background.
Manager.title: Coordinate calculator is illegible

Manager.description: The coordinate calculator assumes that the result of every calculation is a single digit for a single place in the coordinates. In fact, today, when I first tried it in the field, I had only one calculation for the whole decimal part of the minutes, and it proved to be useless… I think the feature is great, but it needs to be more flexible to not cause agony.
Manager.title: Coordinate calculator wrongly assumes all variables are digits

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Put an offline map on a "real" ext sd card Try to find it in c:geo or choose directory Actual behavior after performing these steps: Map not found Directory on ext sd card not choosable Expected behavior after performing these steps: Scan "real" ext sd card, too or let the user choose a directory manually on it Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.24 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Huawai P10 Plus with Android 7 Other comments and remarks: Got this issue reported from a friend. After moving the map to the internal storage c:geo found it. In the last refactoring with the new storage concept we haven't touched the Maps directories. There is some special logic (device dependent?) to find the mounted devices. Maybe this needs some rework.
Manager.title: Offline Map on "real" ext sd card not choosable (Android 7)

Manager.description: I would like to see the hide own and found caches separated. It makes total sense..
Manager.title: Separate "hide own/found caches"

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open list of caches open "sort" popup menu (which is a submemu of the three dot menu) Actual behavior after performing these steps: The popup menu's heading ("Sortierung" for me) is dark grey on medium grey and thus nearly illegible. Menu entries are in white and thus fine. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Menu heading should be another color with good contrast. Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.24 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Default dark theme in c:geo, Android 7 on Samsung phone same behaviour is observed for the other submemus of the three dot menu in cache list
Manager.title: Heading of submenus of cache list's three dot menu is illegible

Manager.description: Cant any more delete or refresh all my stored caches at once. It was very, very, very useful option!
Manager.title: Bulk delete and refresh lost?

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a list of caches Select Manage Caches -> Remove all Actual behavior after performing these steps: Caches are removed Undo bar is shown but not selectable (greyed out) as a dialog ("Do you also want to delete the list") is additionally shown Undo cannot be used until the other dialog is completed, but vanishes most probably before the user manages to close the other window Expected behavior after performing these steps: Undo should be possible Version of c:geo used: 2017.07,24 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Shall we generally make the Undo bar longer lasting (if technically possible), so that it will only vanish after approx. 10 seconds?
Manager.title: Undo option not useable when removing all caches on a list

Manager.description: As this questions keeps coming in on support mail now regularly, I wanted to open this issue to get feedback and maybe also learn what would be needed to support Android Auto. I have no experience myself with Android Auto. Does this need a dedicated app or plugin or is it some other interface?
Manager.title: Support Android Auto

Manager.description: c:geo 2017.07.24 / Samsung Galaxy S6 / Android 7 I've been to an even recently and marked all my finds with "open click offline log". Now I am at home and reopening each cache with a smiley on the map. I go to logs page, I click on the saved offline log, the online log page loads. I write my log and post it. Note: I have around 30 trackables and 9 geokrety with auto-visit. Sometimes, I can't say why, I see my posted online log and the existing offline log, although most of the times the offline log is deleted automatically.
Manager.title: Posting saved log not always removes it

Manager.description: Logging caches especially if one has many trackables (10+) in the inventory set to visit is a time consuming operation, even with excellent internet connection. During this time c:geo is not usable. I request a feature to submit all online logs into a sending queue to run in the background, similar to how email programs take your letter and send it to the mailserver in the background. There should also be a page (similar to outbox) where one can see and manage logs posted for submission but not yet sent due to internet availability or other types of errors. In the list I should be able to do the following: force trying to resend all in queue remove from queue re-edit log and submit online without queue (to see errors, change things if necessary) empty queue (all not sent logs should remain as offline logs in c:geo until they are sent successfully) c:geo should warn upon exit (back from main screen) about unsent logs. c:geo should attempt resending logs not sent due to internet connection problems. (timeouts and such)
Manager.title: Feature request: put logs in a queue for background posting

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Add a new waypoint Use the new calculator and enter some formulas Use the checkmark to close the dialog See a message with "...saved..." Don't realize there is another message Close the waypoint edit dialog with back button Actual behavior after performing these steps: Waypoint is not saved, a toast tells me that the changes were discarded Expected behavior after performing these steps: A warning popping up which warns the user before discarding the changes Version of c:geo used: nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Yes, I know we warn the user with the second toast after closing the calculator. But two toasts in sequence can easily be overlooked. I think we should ask the user for confirmation before discarding any changes. It's frustrating if it is suddenly gone.
Manager.title: Warn before discarding unsaved waypoint changes

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Add a waypoint with calculated coordinates Enter some formulas/values which result in errors The preview below the variables show, that there is something wrong, either with an '*' or with a negative value Save the current state and go back to the waypoint Actual behavior after performing these steps: Valid coordinates are shown (some digits are 0 but valid) There is no indication in the waypoint or in the waypoint list that there is something wrong with the coordinate Expected behavior after performing these steps: Flag the waypoint as errornous Version of c:geo used: nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Errors in the calculator can be missed easily. When changing a variable value the keyboard is overlayed and the coordinate result is not visible. If the user just clicks the checkmark to close the dialog without first closing the keyboard to check the result, an error is missed. It's not visible in the other dialogs, that this waypoint has a problem.
Manager.title: Flag invalid calculated coordinates

Manager.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start c:geo Wait for completion of login on geocaching.com Actual behavior after performing these steps: At the bottom of the main screen it shows: GC * (finds) * Login OK Expected behavior after performing these steps: GC * Username (finds) * Login OK Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.24 as well as nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Most likely related to a website change I could imagine, this might affect also other functions like (owned caches selection, own logs selection) but I did not yet test this.
Manager.title: Username no longer shown on main screen

Manager.description: Due to #6682 and #6702 which have been fixed by @kumy on release branch meanwhile, we should publish a new release. A RC-version 2018.08.22-RC has been published yesterday evening and seems to roll out normal (no support mails, positive beta user feedback, no critical errors on Play Console). Due to the non working logging we should release this version rather soon. I will start preparations for that. In case we should wait and/or include other fixes, please let me know here.
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: @pstorch It was reported by a user (and I can reproduce) that on selecting "Clear history" not only the history is emptied, but also all existing offline logs from cache in history list are deleted. I have something in my mind, that we discussed this case. Did we do this intentionally?
Manager.title: Emptying history implicitly deletes offline logs

Manager.description: Issues #6682 , #6705 and #6702 should still exist on our legacy version (API 9-13) as the needed changes have not been done on that branch. Shall we fix it there as well? In this case @kumy or someone else needs to apply the needed changes to branch legacy as well and we have to publish a new release based on that.
Manager.title: Fix legacy version

Manager.description: Normally I do only have one (owned) Geokret in my inventory (for testing purposes). Whenever posting a geocache log I set the Geokret to "visit". The progress bar while logging clearly shows, that posting the Geokrety log takes several seconds. I assumed, that the server is really slow (as also mentioned before by @kumy) This weekend I used to have 3 Geokrets in my inventory. I set all of them to "visit" and noticed that only the first Geokret log (Progress shows: Posting Geokrety 1/3 (or similar text)) takes several seconds whereas the other two logs follow within split of a second. Is that really a server issue or does c:geo have some problem here? Unfortunately I did not have the possibility to take a debug log and now I only have one Geokret left in my inventory.
Manager.title: Geokrety logging starts slow

Manager.description: From #6704 Interesting. I thought temporarily about linking the 'Calculator notes' with the 'waypoint notes' (or 'user notes') but didn't end up giving it much thought and just implemented a 3rd 'notes' field exclusively for the calculator. Would you find it more useful to have these notes merged in some way? If so I'll look at it as another ticket. Yes, I see no benefit having two separate notes. I feel it as an disadvantage to not see the calculator notes in the waypoint overview. If the calculator is used this usually contains information (e.g. variables and formulas) which might be interesting for other waypoints, too.
Manager.title: Merging the existing waypoint note with the new note in the calculator

Manager.description: I've noticed a styling problem in the cache list. Caches that have a color marker on the left (found, etc) have the following differences from caches without this marker: cache icon is larger. (AFAIK cache icon is composed from multiple images, that of the cache type, that of the found, that of having waypoints) text is offset to right with the width of the border-left and a padding-left (without marker, there is no spacing for the marker width and padding-left=0) This creates a visually disturbing zig-zag effect. IMO cache type icons (with or without composition) should be the same size and the contents of the first column should be aligned at a constant position, leaving space for that marker where it is missing.
Manager.title: Cache list styling

Manager.description: Would it be possible to display a QR-code of a cache in c:geo, so sharing a cache with friends is easier?
Manager.title: Display QR-code of cache

Manager.description: Some weeks ago I stored GC15GV4 on my device using an older nightly of beginning of August. I noticed no problem reading the description. Meanwhile I use a newer nightly 2017.09.03 and noticed the still stored cache had now black text on black background. As the caches was not refresehed since original storing it, it might be the visualization might have a bug in newer version. I might be wrong though. Can someone check this cache with the current market release?

Manager.description: As just yesterday #6712 (for cgeo-legacy) has been fixed, I thought about releasing new version for both cgeo-legacy and release (bugfix). Release checklist: Check/Insert correct version name as headline in changelog-release.xml Build releases on CI server Perform smoke test with resulting cgeo-legacy.apk before continuing Perform smoke test with resulting cgeo-release.apk before continuing Upload and publish cgeo-legacy.apk to Google Play Upload and publish cgeo-release.apk to Google Play Tag the legacy-release on Github first Tag the bugfix-release on Github Publish the release on Github including upload of cgeo-legacy.apk to Github Publish the release on Github including upload of cgeo-release.apk to Github Publish release on F-Droid Rename/Create milestones on Github Trigger notification to status.cgeo.org via CI server once the release is available on Google Play Post release info to Facebook Post release info to G+ Post release info to Twitter (via @SammysHP)
Manager.title: Next bugfix release

Manager.description: We use linking in the personal notes to detect hyperlinks that may be in there. However, given that personal notes often contain values for mystery caches, the phone number linking kicks in for every 2+ digit number in the personal notes as an unwanted side effect. It would be nice if we could still have hyperlinks detected, but suppress phone number detection at the same time.
Manager.title: Disable phone number linking in personal notes

Manager.description: As mentioned by @following5 all OC sites return the image url (return value image_url) directly from services/images/add. So we can simplify our code and omit the second HTTP call. https://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/logs/images/add.html
Manager.title: All OC sites return the image url directly now

Manager.description: The caption field for log images is documented as optional in https://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/logs/images/add.html. But as discussed here: opencaching/okapi#395 and here opencaching/okapi#392 (comment) most OC sites require it. Currently c:geo doesn't require a caption. How should we handle it? Make it a mandatory inputfield per Connector or set a default value?
Manager.title: OC sites might require a caption for log images

Manager.description: Just making this ticket as a way to track the suggestion that @pstorch made in #6704 that: I'm thinking about if we should change the button modes. With a short press it toggles between variable and original value. Maybe it should also toggle through the "space" case. So that this feature is more accessible. If that comment doesn't quite make sense out of context what @pstorch is suggesting is: Perhaps rather than simply having the calculator buttons toggle between 'Input-value" and "Auto-char" (with the blank option being available by entering SPACE through a long press) that the calculator buttons have three states, being "Input-value", "Auto-char" and "Blank". Note that the "Custom-char" functionality will still be available through a long press, it just won't be the way you "blank-out" buttons.
Manager.title: Implement Tri-State Calculator Buttons

Manager.description: This is just being created in order to track the discussion in #6773 about allowing non-standard letters to be used in equations. @rsudev commented: A-Z (if that really is the definition) is less ambiguous than LETTER (which in some places might end up being äöü or even åđžć ... and @UniQP said: I would prefer to allow all characters accepted by Character.isLetterOrDigit(...) and simply use letter and digit in the message. Is that feasible? And later on @pstorch commented: Regarding the letter and digit discussion: at the moment it is ambiguous. Just tried ö, which is a letter, and got the above error message. I personally think we should restrict the variable letters to A-Z. If we allow all unicode letters from all languages, then we might run into sorting issues again. So, to avoid that and make things simple, I would suggest A-Z letters only. What do you think?
Manager.title: Allow non-standard letters to be use in equations

Manager.description: This was probably introduced with #6759 and seems to be caused by a change to the 'Plain Format' text field. The change gets triggered sometime between when the 'textListener' is added in onCreateView(...) and when the calculator's state is loaded in onResume(). The actual crash is caused by accessing the currentFormat variable before it is initialised but I can't for the life of me workout what is causing the text to be changed prior to the onResume() call. In any event simply protecting the reference to currentFormat with "if null" checks alleviates the problem but I would have preferred to isolate the cause of the text changed event in the first place but can't seem to find it.
Manager.title: Calculator Crashed on Screen Rotation

Manager.description: #6715, #6816 and #6821 are all addressing the calculator notes issue and all were closed before I was able to be involved with the changes, so I thought it would be best to open an issue of my own to provide input. As it stands the 'calculator notes' have been removed from the 'calculators state' but seem to be tagged onto the state externally with an 'ImmutablePair' object. In my mind if the notes field is essentially intended to be independent of the calculator itself it would be better to simply access the Waypoint's note data directly than tag it onto the calculator's state and kind of 'carry' them around together. I have an implementation of this and are mainly creating this issue so as to have a branch in which to commit this implementation.
Manager.title: Calculator Notes Cleanup

Manager.title: Allow use of Brackets for the calculator while in 'Plain' format

Manager.description: Feature Request As a geocacher I want to include the D/T rating of the current Cache in my log signature as template variable. Like this I am aware of D/T rating changes between the date I found the cache (created an offline log) and the date I log the cache. This might be important when logging several caches for a challenge cache (having stored offline logs and the rating changed afterwards). I want to be aware of D/T rating changes between the date I found the cache (created a offline log) and the date I log the cache. This might be important when logging several caches for a challenge cache (having stored offline logs and the rating changed afterwards). Acceptance Criteria when I click on "settings/logging/signature/insert template" I can choose "Difficulty" from the drop down. when I click on "settings/logging/signature/insert template" I can choose "Terrain" from the drop down. having selected "Difficulty" "[DIFFICULTY]" has been added to my signature. having selected "Terrain" "[TERRAIN]" has been added to my signature. selecting "Log visit" on a Cache inserts my signature having e.g. "[DIFFICULTY]/[TERRAIN] replaced with the according rating (e.g. "D3/T4") for a D3/T4 cache.
Manager.title: add D/T rating to log signature

Manager.description: As mentioned in #6716 (Managing ambiguous results in WP Calc where trailing/leading zeros are involved) it can be necessary to insert additional zeros into the result of a formulation, and in some instances there is contention as to whether these should be 'leading-zeros' or 'trailing-zeros'. It has been suggested that a method of identifying how a result has been manipulated would be desirable and a suggestion made is to colour the 'manipulated' digits differently to provide this indication: Developer notes: Implementing this is not as trivial as one might at first think for a few reasons: The main concern is that the text to display for a valid location is actually obtained from the waypoint itself rather than from the input strings used to create it. This is done specifically so that users can be aware of exactly what the resulting waypoint will actually represent rather than their entered value (which may result in something they did not expect). Although we have access to both the input string and the resulting GeoPoint's string displaying a 'diff' of these two strings is not as trivial as you may think. However, once it is known what colours should be used for each letter actually displaying the desired results shouldn't be too hard given TextView's support the use of HTML strings. Further notes: Once implemented this "Syntax Highlighting" would be most useful in conveying information to users of what leads to "Parsing Failures" (as related to #6802: Coordinate Parser Needs Work).
Manager.title: Implement "Result Highlighting" in the Calculator.

Manager.description: Add or edit waypoint, open calculator dd mm.mmm format, add some variables type some numbers press home or switch to another app go back to c:geo calculator still visible, but all variable buttons are numbers again when you tap the buttons, they will turn into variables again and still have their assigned content that you typed previously. Nightly from today.

Manager.description: Create a waypoint with calculation. When you long-press on it and select "duplicate waypoint" then it duplicates the waypoint with the calculated coordinates, but not the calculation itself. So when you edit the copy and open the calculator, it will start without variables.

Manager.description: While using the waypoint calculator I wondered how I can share the variables gathered from stage to stage among the waypoints for easy transfer in the calculator formulas. My idea was to create a virtual waypoint called "Variables" to collect all stage variables in its user notes. From there I wanted to copy them into the stages' user notes. The user notes are also visible in the calculator so they can be copied in the variable values of the waypoint calculator. In the following screenshot you can see virtual waypoint "Variables" from where the variables were copied into the waypoints "Stage 2" and "Stage 4". Unfortunately there is no way to copy the user notes from a waypoint. 😮 I did a rough implementation that creates a new waypoint action "Copy Notes". This action strips HTML from the waypoint note, merges with user note and copies both into clipboard. Before I continue on the code I just wanted to ask in advance if there is interest and a chance to get this feature included.
Manager.title: Add support to copy waypoint (user) notes

Manager.description: This was already discussed at the end of #6697. There are various ways you can get unwanted coordinates in a waypoint: you just want to add a note there you prepare waypoint calculator formulas in advance In all these cases arbitrary coordinates (usually your current position) are stored into the waypoint and there is no way to get them removed again. This has different disadvantages: you cannot distinguish between a waypoint with correct or incorrect coordinates it pollutes the waypoint map with wrongly placed waypoints This is of course more problematic for caches with lots of stages: you get a wild mixture of valid and arbitrary coordinates. Therefore it would be nice to have an action to remove waypoint coordinates from a waypoint. The implementation for this is trivial. It acts in the same way as the "Delete" action in the waypoint context menu. This means, there is no confirm dialog and there is no different behavior for user created waypoints or listing waypoints. The latter can be restored by a cache refresh again. I will share my changes tonight. 👍 2
Manager.title: Provide a way to delete coordinates from waypoints

Manager.description: Same as #5498 but for other actions like "Caches around". This somehow slipped through because I thought that "Nearby" action is the same as "Caches around". Only the way how the start coordinates are determined is different. But in fact, there are two different loader types: CacheListType.NEAREST (fixed in #5498) CacheListType.COORDINATE (still truncates list to 40) Fix should be trivial. I will handle it.
Manager.title: "Load more caches" does not always destroy the initial loader

Manager.description: For your attention: In the Geocaching Forum I found the release note regarding the latest site changes as of December, 6th 2017. It is mostly dealing with the cache edit page (which does not affect c:geo) but also contains a section about other updates, which I list below with my assumptions: Change In c:geo D1 is enforced for all Event Caches. Event Caches must have a 1-star difficulty rating because it is easy for geocachers to “find” events. Should not affect c:geo as they will be shown as D1 Event Caches no longer include a container size. This means probably, that the container information might be ommited on the website. We should check new events. [...] In addition, the links “Watch” and “Add to List” are available only after publication, because we found that they were not used by COs prior to publication. This is a rare case, but an owner of an unpublished cahe can load it in c:geo and possibly the watch option will be shown to him but not usable Previously, there were two text fields to describe your cache. During the Cache Submission Process, those were the cache summary and long description. On the Edit Cache Listing page, they were the short description and long description. Going forward, there’s just one field. However, the short description field still exists for any caches that currently have a short description. If a cache owner removes an existing short description from their cache, the field will disappear. We should doublecheck a new listing which only has one description field to check if there are problems The Related Web Page field now only exists on caches that currently use that field. If a cache owner removes an existing Related Web Page, then the field will disappear. I don't know how this was handled in the past. If a cache does not use the related web page, was this field ommited on the page in the past?
Manager.title: Possible problem areas after website change

Manager.description: See formuia in GC7ENZJ. North 48° ((B * D) +((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H) * C)) *A East 011° (E+D) * A * B Result of both formulas is something like 23456. There is no possibility to "float-divide" by 1000 to get 23.456. The only way to achieve the desired result is to repeat both formulas once with "/ 1000" and once with "% 1000", e.g. in plain mode: N 48° (((B*D) + ((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H)*C)) * A / 1000).(((B*D) + ((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H)*C)) * A % 1000) E 011° ((E+D) * A * B / 1000).((E+D) * A * B % 1000) Needless to say that this is cumbersome.
Manager.title: Waypoint Calculator: Support for float results
